Not sure what else we needed to do to make sure our requests could be honored, the most disappointing part was that we were charged for things we didn't not even enjoy and lost our luggage without a follow up call. This was not our first horrific experience but it sure is our last. Not sorry to say I will be taking my family to a better hotel in the future.

Love this pace. I enjoy the history and the older architecture. Only complaint is a lot of the staff isn't the friendliest we've found compared to other casinos. They don't seem to enjoy their job. Had a great meal at Rao's. Caesars is a great location. Checking out the pool today I'll have a separate review.

I called this establishment for a staycation which I do pretty often. I enjoyed the service at Searsuckers one evening for happy hour and decided I would stay with Caesars. Called reservations, gentlemen was polite and I informed him of what room I wanted. Basically I was looking for a room Oct 3 and he put it for the wrong month so it quoted a different price. It was 150 more than the room I thought I was purchasing.

He apologized for the error and I declined the room at the cost. He stated unfortunately there will be a hold however I did cancel the transaction. Cesar Palace now has 313.00 for a room that I have not stayed in. I have spoken to 3 supervisors because they told me a week......Its been a week. Rhonda the manger on yet again, my 3rd time calling , told me oh well you have to call tomorrow to the billing department. 

Now shouldn't a manager after your employee did the error, I have waited the time you told me to wait, and then you tell me Rhonda to call back for a forth time instead of your taking my information and escalating issue and assist in a resolution for Cesar's taking my money and have not returned it. What GREAT SERVICE!!!!

I gave this 5 stars because it is class, casino, cool. Room is perfect. Casino is meticulous with babes everywhere even if you cannot touch. its a very classy place Roam around and you get it, and its on the strip.

What can one say. Go stay at a lesser hotel. Then come back and stay here, now you see the value. Security is over the top, everyone is nice, its like you are guests and they treat you right. Now you know what you're paying for. Class A place.

This is the worst place to stay on the strip, our room was in a disgusting condition upon arrival, they charge you for every single thing, instant coffee $16 in your room, bottle water was $7, daily inter

CP is easily the most popular casino on the strip.  What really makes CP stand out is its mall- The Forum. This has to be the nicest mall I have ever been too. Sure, most of the shops are high-end and it would take a few 10 shot Mai-Tais to get me to actually buy anything, but its fun to just walk through the mall and enjoy the sights.

Unless you play a lot here, or find specials, the cheapest room rates always get you the Roman tower rooms, which are on the disappointing side for Vegas rooms.  They're older, and don't have all the luxuries that you'd expect from a hotel fit for the Gods.  The new towers are nice and have those things, but will cost you more.

As for the rest of the hotel, I do like the grounds.  Like the Venetian, it's very large and extends through the multiple towers but is quite easy to maneuver.  The pool is one of my favorite in Vegas.  Full of marble (faux?) columns and fountains, it is one of the prettier sights to just relax at, and the people there usually aren't too bad eye candy either.  

The restaurant offerings are broad, with all types of cuisine, and there is a line to PURE and Pussycat Dolls every night.  It's fairly centrally located on the strip and allows for quick access to all the other hotels.  

Suggestion is to look for package deals - and as with all Vegas properties, sign up for players cards\/email lists - you'll get special offers that make it much more appealing.

Rooms are decent, pool is nice, but customer service is horrible! Before we arrived, we received an email stating we had been upgraded to the Laural side and should check in there. We waited in line and when it was finally our turn (we waited for 30 minutes, even though only one person was ahead of us) the person at the desk stated we hadn't been upgraded and didn't know who sent us the email. Well, since it came from Caesars, I would say your hotel did! She refused to check us in, and refused to look into it to determine what happened. So then we waited another half hour at 'the regular' check in desk. Those people were much more friendly, but seriously?!?!?! And nobody ever checked into the email for us to determine what happened. There was never an apology or any remnants of good customer service. Will NEVER stay here again!

Gorgeous hotel and forum shops: 5 Stars

Hair in the food at the Buffet: negative 5 Billion Stars

Because I'm an extraordinarily nice person and the bitchy manager who should not be in the hospitality\/service industry comped both my and my friend's meals: 5 Billion and 3 Stars

Basically this place has too much of a reputation to put it down so much, but avoid Pure (boring) and the buffet (toxic) and you're good to go: 3 Stars total

I think the only thing this hotel has going for it is it's location. That would be the only perk to forking out the serious $$$ to stay at this mediocre hotel. 

Don't get me wrong, the place looks beautiful and the rooms were actually quite spacious and clean, but the reason for the bad reviews are mainly from the HORRRRRRIBLE customer service. Here's what happened to us on our 4-night stay:

1) We booked 2 rooms, one with just 1 bed and another with 2 beds. We show up at 11am to at least reserve our rooms and check in early. When we actually show up and get to our rooms, we get both rooms with just 1 bed. After going back dwon to the desk to get the CORRECT room, they tell us they are sold out and cannot fill our request...NO...NOT A REQUEST...OUR ORIGINAL RESERVATION!!!! Then they tell us we can call in the morning so that they can switch us into a room that has two beds...AND EVEN THEN THEY COULDN'T FULFILL OUR FRICKIN RESERVATION!! They had to bring us a roll-away bed for the remaining nights. ALREADY -1 STAR!!

2) Now, every hotel has valet...BUT I HAVE NEVER...I MEAN NEVER....been denied access to valet when I was a guest at the hotel. That, in my opinion...is UNHEARD OF. They told us that we could use the Colloseum valet, but that would mean we would have to walk all the way around the hotel to get to our room in the Augustus Tower...not worth it. MINUS 1 1\/2 STARS!!

3) Now I know I shouldn't be too much of a big deal, but when I went to the Players Card services area to reprint my card, the lady went all POWER TRIP on me and actually told me, in a VERY HORRIBLE ATTITUDE, that I should not be so careless and not have it near any other credit cards or a cell phone. I mean really, how are you supposed to carry around those cards and not have them near items you carry everyday. Minus 1\/2 star!

4) THEY DIDN'T CLEAN OUR ROOM ONE DAY!! I mean ok, we did leave our room at 2pm, but when we left, the carts were still out there and there was definitely no "do not disturb" sign left on the door. -1 another star. 

So there you have it. I would be very reluctant to return here, especially since they charge INSANE prices in comparison to everyone else. You are definitely not getting what you pay for. I'll stick to my usual Venetian\/Palazzo. Or almost ANYWHERE ELSE for that matter.

I've upgraded to 3, for a couple reasons. Check in was smooth except for foreign tourists which you need a plunger to unclog the front desk. Had this Indian couple(red dot not feather type) on their phone comparing online prices with what they reserved that was like $10 difference ? Really ? Also too many Asians, clueless and just walking in front of you with no real concern if they just walk right in front of you. Went gaming spun through $200 before I could get a drink. Walked up to the sports bar, put $100 in the machine with intentions of hunkering down playing video poker and having a couple drinks,  asked the bartender for a drink and he replied , I couldn't order until I played a certain amount in the machine. Really tacky, I mean come on.

I do not recommend this hotel at all. I frequent Las Vegas a lot and have never had such a horrible experience. 

The staff is ridiculously rude especially the Valet. They told me the lot was full and then took the car behind me. Turns out he is a diamond card member just as I am. When I confronted the man he backtracked.

Our room had to be switched once and the room we stayed in was like a Motel 6. The TV didn't work and that was after we discovered we had no remote. 

Do not stay here! Any other Caesars location is better.

What Caesar's has going for it is name and reputation. I mean, who doesn't want to go Vegas and stay at Caesar's. Palace.?! Well, normally not me, because I have Chez Mimi (read: my grandmother) for a place to crash, but when BFF wanted to do her birthday and actually stay on the Strip, I was all in 

Unfortunately, if you get the room that has no heat and non-working mini-bar, you probably will want to go elsewhere. Caesar's staff handled our issues ok, but not great. I had to call repeatedly to say "hey, I want to pay exorbitant prices for bottle water and beer, but the fridge is warm. Please send someone up!" The following day, we had to change rooms because of the temp. I understand people are busy, but it took nearly 2 hours for the bell hop to bring us our keys. Hangry, annoyed, cold.... doesn't even begin to describe how we felt. And the icing on the cake? I had to pretty much beg to get some sort of recompense for the trouble, especially considering that I had paid an additional fee to get the room with a sweet bathroom. They ended up taking off the bonus charge on the freezing night, but I had to use my persuasion skills to get that done. 

Aside from the room snafu, Caesar's can be a fun place to stay. Their forum shoppes always have been my favorite place to spend money on the Strip, so staying in proximity was most fun. And check out my review of Qua, the salon and spa at Caesar's. Getting pampered at such a nice spa was definitely the best part of our stay! 

We ended up checking out The Cosmopolitan for dinner, and I think next time I stay on the Strip, I'd like to stay there. But if it's anything like Caesar's room issues, Chez Mimi it is.

The check in line was kinda slow. Funny how it seems that everyone else takes forever and when you get up to the counter, you're done in 3 min. The hotel itself was beautiful. The bellhops and front desk staff were friendly. I did note that other staff, if walking throughout the hotel didn't offer smiles or hellos. That seemed very odd to me. I stayed in the Palace Tower which was nice but I had to pass those middle eastern women hawking their face cream everytime. That was annoying.
Did appreciate that I could get a slice of pizza at the food court at 2 am. Paid $23 for a breakfast sandwich that made me feel that I ate 5 Breakfast Jacks.
The last thing I did experience before leaving was the valets lost my car. I had parked in the colosseum valet lot (I advise anyone to chose it over the front valet) and I enjoyed the fact that it never took more than 3 minutes to get my car. This was also a blessing because when they lost my car, there were only about 15 cars in the lot and only 2 white Corollas. If I had parked in the front valet, it would have probably taken them an hour and a half and I would have missed my flight. BTW: they lost my car because when I came back in to valet the last night, guy didn't put my car back into the queue.

TIP: When you catch a cab from the airport and they ask you whether you want to take the freeway or the side streets to Caesar's, take note that you're being scoped out for a scam and tell them to take Paradise.  If you say don't know or just say "the fastest route", the driver is most likely going to take you on the freeway, which will run you about $33 compared to about $16 the other way.  This happened to me, but I didn't know I was being hosed until the Concierge at Caesar's gave me instructions for the ride back to the airport.  Pretty shady, but so glad the hotel gave me a heads up for the return.

It's hard for me to give a thorough review because I'm not a gambler and hate casinos, but was here for a conference.  Last time I was in Vegas, I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental, which is not a fair comparison (although Caesar's charges as much for some of the rooms).

I was upgraded to the Octavius tower, which is the newest tower and I guess the nicest rooms unless you're in a suite.  The room was very nice and comfortable. Loved the color scheme.  But they got cheap in weird places, so it falls short of being luxurious (although some wouldn't know; I'm just old & sober enough to know & care).  For example, there's a TV in the bathroom, but it's tiny, not HD, has only 11 channels (compared to the large HD TV in the bedroom with 30+ channels), and there's no remote so you can't control it from the jacuzzi tub...why bother to have the TV?  It's almost worthless.  Also, no in-room coffee unless you pay for the pods, which most hotels give you for free (there was comp coffee in the Augustus tower lobby area in the mornings, though).  No bath salts available for the tub (even checked the gift shop)--do not use the shower gel because once those jets get going, you'll be overrun by suds (LOL).  And the maid didn't leave a new supply of toiletries on my 2nd day (which would've been ok except that I had 2 shower gels & no shampoo on day 1, so was hoping to have that corrected on day 2).

On the plus side, the bed was very comfortable and the casino offers good restaurants.  The food during the conference was very good, too (breakfast, lunch, appetizers).  Staff is very friendly, courteous, and helpful--great service.

I just wish the ventilation system was more advanced.  The newest casinos like Cosmopolitan and Aria have such great ventilation that the cigarette smoke really isn't a problem, but at Caesar's it hits you the second you walk in.

Summary:  I'd stay again if for business travel or I got a discounted room or something.  Even if staying elsewhere, I'd come here for some of the restaurants or shows (or shopping, of course--can't beat having the Forum Shops there).  If paying full price and didn't have business bringing me here, I'd opt for Vdara or Cosmopolitan or Mandarin Oriental personally (MO & Vdara are non-gaming).

But again, remember that I don't like casinos and going to Vegas is not my idea of  a great time...this was all about business for me.

All in all our Caesars experience was great.  The rooms in the forum tower were probably one of the nicest we've stayed in; comparable to palazzo, of course much smaller, but comparable nonetheless.  The beds were comfy, decor chic, bathroom spectacular with a built-in flat screen in the bathroom mirror.  The property is beautiful and the service was good.  Valet was also extraordinarily fast.  We saw Celine and it was one of our favorite Vegas shows; truly amazing and worth every cent.  The gambling was good: lots of $25 tables and some $15 during the weekdays.  The downsides: we arrived at 8:30 and asked what time we could get a room and they told us to check back at 11. When we went back the lady told us check-in can be as late as 6 p.m.  We ended up getting a room closer to 2 p.m. which is earlier than the usual 3 p.m. check-in so we weren't too upset but we wished we could have gotten a room earlier and have at the palazzo, encore and ph.   The other thing, we left the do not disturb sign on but the housekeepers still entered and cleaned the room while we were out on 2 occasions; it was a bit weird.  Despite the minor pitfalls, we will be back.

I've waited a super long time to stay at this hotel. You'll pay a little more to stay here, but the location is a great place to be, IN THE CENTER OF THE STRIP! Paid about $300 for my room and we were in the Palace Towers. Gorgeous room with a long hallway, two queen beds, great view of the pool and huge jet tub with a large shower. PROBLEM: We got home late around 3:00 AM and were looking forward to HOT showers. My two friends took LUKEWARM SHOWERS. They felt bad telling me since I paid for the room. I feel that this is unacceptable since a good amount of money was spent on the room. A guy did come up and service the shower, but it added another 15 to 20 minutes of getting the water hot enough to have another person take a shower. We couldn't shower until like 4:00 AM. Less time to sleep and on the last night of Vegas before a long drive home. Not happy about that. I feel like they should take off my resort fee or something. I did complain, but will see if they honor and value customers. 

The pool was PHENOMENAL! I would recommend any person in Vegas to go check out the pools! 32 oz cocktail is $27. Drinks are expensive, but I was on a vacation so I paid the price for the drink. I would recommend a margarita, mojito or some of their other blended drinks. The pina colada was a bit too sweet. Ice tea is about $9.00. You cannot bring food or drinks from outside. 

There is a poolside area that allows guests to play in the pool. Looked super cool! I hope that I can stay there in the future with no shower or hot water issues.

We heard about Caesars 50th Anniversary party a while back so we book a room at the Nobu (review pending)

We arrived at Caesars around 11ish and the main valet is full (only for hotel guests). We waited only about 3 mins until a nice Valet guy comes and takes our car. For Nobu guests you can use the main Valet entrance at Caesars palace. Since we've stayed at Caesars many times we knew exactly where to go to find the Nobu hotel.

Caesars really did a great job decorating the hotel for their 50th anniversary. We took a ton of photos and the best part was the party with Gordon Ramsey!

So we get ready for the party and ask around and guests will need a white wrist band to enter the pool party. There was a little confusion on where to get the wrist bands at first but we got ours near the buffet.

We enter the party around 8:30 and the place is already hopping! Free Champagne everywhere and more photo ops. The live music was awesome and so was the venue!
They had models in the pool and free cake and various drinks as well. All guests was given a free drink ticket as well. Since we were drinking all night, we went high end with bottled water-lol

We ended up squeezing in near the stage in the pool. We got near front seats to see the man Gordon Ramsey and he was awesome! The fireworks were simply amazing. Looks like nothing was spared at this event!

The next day we ended up eating at Gordon Ramsay's (6th time) and they did not disappoint.
We also ate at the buffet - awesome as usual - no wait.

We will back to, this is our favorite hotel in Las Vegas! Keep up the good work!!!

I just wana  say they are lier, the pictures on the internet of this hotel is all fake. The stuffs work in this hotel is amazingly rude to the costumers, especially to the Chinese. 这里的工作人员很针对中国人，请不要来这家酒店。
I don't know...I just don't like this place. It's wayyyyy too big, so it takes forever to get from point A to point B

Great service.  I left my phone in a cab and didn't know the name or number of the cab. They reviewed the security footage and tracked down the cab I was in.  Didn't get the phone back but they surely did all they could!

PS - Amazing pools but drinks are expensive.

First let me say the only reason I have given Caesar's Palace 1 star because the manager was very apologetic for the cocktail waitresses bold disrespectful behavior. (A copy of our receipt is available) last week while in Vegas my friend and I chose to go to Cleo's Barge which had a fun atmosphere to dance and have a couple of drinks. Well as soon as we arrived and asked for the bar for a cocktail we were directed to the other side of the lounge to an older woman who was the cocktail for the bartender. Initially was friendly and asked us for our drink order. She returned with the total and when we informed her we were paying separately as we didn't request 1 check nor were we asked... She told us she couldn't split the check, she took my friends card and after a short debate of requesting separate checks she proceeded to throw the card down on the table in between my friend and I. Unhappily she split the check in moments and we paid and left to find the manager... Apologetically the manager resolved the matter... Don't recommend going to her for any assistance if she is still working there which it is my belief she may be too old and unhappy for the environment. Most likely will not be returning to Caesars.

One of the greats of Las Vegas.  We stopped by for a drink and ended up playing blackjack for 6-7 hours.  This was solely because our dealers were awesome and couldn't stop talking smack about Steve Wynn - lol, apparently he robs his employees or something.  Nevertheless, around 1am, we ate at Nero's (which is open late-night...AWESOME) then picked up a room.  The room was on the 26th (?) floor in the Augustus tower and I must admit the room was stunning - great bathroom...as good as Encore.  The view was the pits however :(

Still, I would stay here again if we got a better view.  Can't wait to try Mesa Grill next time ;)

Sent son  for 21 birthday charged our card and his?? Holding up his food money and then saId no Comp buffet "he's a grown man when he came to Las Vegas asked for manager said sorry we r too busy even though we were paying guest acted like we were asking to use the bathroom very disappointed that management would
Not try to fix a bad situation. Work a simple food Comp to get through the weekend!!!! Them went as far as to say I can Comp you but I choose who gets it really it's just a buffet and u chArged  card twice holding up our weekend funds

Caesars palace was very cool. The Roman decor was nothing short of breathtaking.  Staff was alright, bartender steve didn't seem to enjoy his job, but he was still very quick and by the book.  Went to sushi roku, it was fantastic! If you are in Caesars Palace and are hungry you have to try it the sushi is out of . The table games were fun, we tried playing some new games, dealers were very helpful.

I would give a ZERO if there is. I left two items in the room, one of them during the room switching. I talked with their front desk, security, and lost&found many times, and their answers were always "NO". For a hotel like Caesars advertise, it is not acceptable. Also, the room is noisy which was the reason I switched the room, and their maintenance person had to come to turn off the fan completely. Want to stay there? Your call, but I won't!

My husband and I arrived at Caesars (our 1st time at this property) for our anniversary. I had chosen multiple e upgrades that might be available and upon arrival was told they were giving me the Augustus strip view ($66 per night). Was not disappointed for sure! It was a beautiful room (3058) but that is why the morning of our departure was marred. At 5am on 6\/2 we were woken up by SCREAMING children. We left our room after more than an hour. Is there not floors for families or an adult tower\/floors? We enjoy our Platinum status and all the properties we have stayed at and our cruise recently, that is why this was a disappointing end to our anniversary trip. The hotel\/rooms and all are wonderful.

Located on The Las Vegas Strip, Caesars Palace is a true classic. This is one of those properties that remains fresh and gives a nod to The glorious Las Vegas of yesterday. They just reopened the buffet and it is supposed to be incredible (A review is forthcoming). I recommend staying,  but even if you don't stop in, look around and enjoy yourself. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

Caesars Palace has a lot to offer.  They have a lot of entertainment and amenities under one roof.  To walk around and Gamble or sight see, Love it.  Pay to sleep here...HATE IT.

From the outside, the place looks incredible and made me feel like I just had to stay here.  I'm not impressed.  Maybe if I got to check in at their VIP side entrance on the other side of the Hotel, and was whisked away to my room in style then I might sing a different tune.  But I'm not that lucky.  I'm a standard room kind of guy.  Some of the rooms are HUGE for a standard.  Some are not.  Some are nice, and some are just skankie.  Oh sorry... sqankee.  Our small room had a whore house red velvet sofa.  I didn't want my kids sitting on it, nor did I want to walk around the room without shoes.

One night I walked out of the Elevator and around the corner,  there were 3 guy who looked like gang members hanging out against the wall.  1 was standing, the other 2 were squatting and they stopped whispering and just watched me walk to the room.  They weren't doing anything wrong, but I didn't like the feeling.  Another time, I heard commotion in the Hall.  Security and Hotel staff were kicking somebody out of their room.  Nice.  Then at 2:30am I heard Janella and Toeshawnda fighting in the hall with all her girlz about their man and how one was going to jack the other girls grill up if she didn't stop flappin her jaw in her face. I couldn't tell which one of the 4 was the most pissed because they were all pissed.  Girlz night out gone bad.  I wanted to go out and tell them to SHUT UP, but I knew I'd get my ass beat if I opened the door.

The pool was another disappointment.  It LOOKS great.  But they don't really monitor who goes in, so its filled with people who are not staying at the Hotel.  

The place is a labyrinth.  I hate that.  It's like being in LA.  Everything takes 20 minutes.  From your car to your room, 20 minutes.  From your room to the pool, 20 minutes.  Walking around the pool to find a place to sit, 10 minutes.  Pool to room, 15 minutes.  Room to Buffet, 20 minutes.  Wait for table, 45 minutes.  Dining, 2 hours. Buffet to Bellagio (next door), 20 minutes.  Casino to your car in parking structure and trying to get out on any surface street, 15 minutes.

The place has an old reputation, the Forum Shops, and Celene;  in all, its like the adult version of Circus Circus.  Its really not that great.

I'm writing this as a diamond member for Caesars players card. I was essentially get free rooms at any hotel part of that group. I normally pick out ballys because they have some huge suites that have been upgraded and look great. I chose Caesars because I wanted to check out what this hotel had to offer. Also, mind you, I got this room for free. 

I booked some suite in the palace tower. I am not a fan of Caesars mostly because I get lost in this damn hotel all the time. Finding my tower was a huge way to get to it. Room is standard at best, was told I got a nice "pool view" room but who cares. No one is at the pool in October anyways. 

Whatever, not my gripe about this hotel. My problem is the lack of amenities this hotel offers. It's supposed to be the flagship hotel for this Caesars entertainment group and its honestly the worst. I have stayed at the Linq the old "imperial palace" and was more impressed with that. If you want to have coffee in your room
Be prepared to pay $13 for a cup of keurig brewed garbage. 

I highly advise to stay at another property, Ballys is legit and the Linq is fun. Happy gambling and good luck.

I reserved a room at Caesars Palace with two queen beds two months in advanced before my trip date. The day I was to arrive in Vegas I received an email from Caesars saying I could check in early and confirm my reservation through the email. Upon arrival the express check out didn't work (which the email instructed me to use) I still had to wait in a very slow line. I was then told they could not accommodate me because the hotel was over booked. They told me they would give me a king bed with a pull out sofa instead of two beds. Still wanted to charge me the same price of 350.00 a night. Since they wouldn't give me any other options I took the room. They put me in the Roman Tower which was EXTREMELY old, dirty (furniture stains), out dated tv, most of the lights were burnt out and the pull out bed was so old that my sister fell through it when she sat on it! I couldn't believe it. I went back down to the lobby to demand a different room. After 35 minutes and a very unapologetic manager they finally put me in a newer room but still not one with two beds. The manager assured me the next day I could switch to a room with two beds. I called three times the next day to see when I could switch and was told all three time that my room was still not available. I gave up after 5 pm. Caesars Palace lacks professionalism, courteousness and good business values. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone!!!

If you are handicapped do not stay here. You will not receive any help whatsoever, even when they pull your car up with a flat tire, and then if you don't tip for not helping change your tire they add another $20.00 on your bill. Then the next night they made me go to the Colosseum to park because they said they were full, and they did not give a shit that it is very hard for me to walk. They did not clean the room for the two days and on the third day they(housekeeping) kept knocking at 8am to tell me that I was checking out and they needed to clean the room. The whole experience staying there was a nightmare. I could keep going but will stop now.

A pleasant stay. Our double bed room was spacious, clean and bright. I also like that the closet and bathroom were by the hallway so you're not just staring at the bed when you first enter. We had a great view of the pools. Gym was nice with high quality equipments. The only sucky part was that they only offer free WiFi the first night and you'll have to pay for additional nights. We can all agree that's a rip off. Anyhow,  wouldn't mind staying here again.

Overall, my husband and I had a really great stay at this property for our weekend trip to Vegas to see Celine Dion. The location is obviously convenient for the show since it's in the building but it is very central on the strip as well which is great. We also love how big the property is meaning a huge casino and lots of dining\/shopping options.

We were staying in the Laurel Collection and I'd gotten an email to check in before we arrived which we decided to do. When we arrived at 10:30 AM on Friday we checked in at the self check in kiosk and paid an extra $30 to get an email when our room is ready instead of coming back at 4 PM. The $30 kind of irked me but we got an email at 1 PM saying it was ready so it was worth having the notification. However when we arrived the kiosk said the room wasn't ready. We waited 15 minutes in the desk check in line and were then told someone had gotten our room before us. I was about to put on my "let me speak to the manager" hat when the woman at check in said she would give us a better room higher up in the building. Now that's service!

The room was very large for what I've stayed in while visiting Vegas and the view was spectacular. We could see the fountain show at the Bellagio and down the strip since we were in the Augustus tower. This tower is also right next to the lobby so you won't have to walk very far. I had some little issues with the room like the fact there were no bath robes, one of the sconces in the bathroom didn't have its shade so it was just a light bulb, the internet connection was super slow on my data plan and wifi, and the shower doors didn't keep water in the shower when fully closed which made the bathroom extremely slippery. Despite all this I think the location of the property and all its amenities make up for any of these negatives.

Expensive room (Octavius Tower),  Filthy Bathroom, Broken wireless, Overpriced and medicore restaurants
==================================
I go to vegas 4 times a year and stay at Venetian, Palazzo, Wynn or MGM. This was the first time i was at Caeser's Palace. 

The in-room wireless for which you pay $15\/day doesn't work. You are left without the internet. 

The jacuzzi, that they claimed was best thing, was FILTHY! I could see ugly green\/brown stains all over with hair and what looked like fecal matter. YUCK! 

When I complained, the staff insisted that I should give them notice. How much notice do you need for a clean room for one of your most expensive towers? 

I am sure this was a great hotel 20 years ago when it was first built. Now it is showing its age and attitude of staff says that they are not getting paid enough to be there.

What a bad experience. I'm here for a wedding and the party went back to the suit. The key wasn't working so we called down to security and Ryan was a complete asshole. He made sure we knew we weren't a priority. That our situation was the least of his concerns. Honestly it was the worst customer service I could've dealt with considering the money we're spending here for our friends wedding. I'm shocked at the lack of customer care and can assure you I won't stay here of my own choice. This was such a disappointment. Just make sure we had a good wedding, that was it but they couldn't do that. I'm so disappointed in Caesars.

Even from the outside, we felt impressed. Inside, it's classy and unique. The layout is a bit of a labyrinth, but I enjoyed it. The casino floor is clean and doesn't smell. They have bathrooms near Gordon Ramsay's restaurant that's underneath. Quite possibly the fanciest restroom I've ever been to.

A classic spot in Vegas, and for me one of the more impressive casinos there.

Caesars Palace's buffet totally sucks - I've eaten at nearly every buffet in Las Vegas and have got to say that it's probably one of the worst 2. It was a great deal at $34.99 for the bracelet to eat infinite buffets (deadly by the way), but the selection of the food was just poor. The omelette was decent, which is why I'm rating it 2 stars; however, most buffets there have an omelette-maker anyways. I wouldn't go back to Caesars unless it was out of convenience and with the bracelet.

Joined the husband for the weekend he was at Caesar all week for conference. Staff is extremely helpful. Definitely expensive but everything is on the strip. Stayed in Octavia's tower,nice room, 2 beds plenty of room for the 4 of us. Very quiet.
I heard people in one of the towers asked to be moved because their room was vibrating from construction. So ask if there's construction in your tower before walking away with key card.
Don't drink\/eat snacks water in room crazy expensive and there is fee to use fridge. 
Our key cards became inactive on Saturday, were staying till Sunday. It's quite a hike to front desk so used phone by elevator and security came up in 10 minutes. Happen separately to my husbands key as well after his am meeting. Same scenario.
Rao's restaurant is good Italian food. Went at 5 pm, about 10 minute wait to be seated with no reservation. Didn't eat anywhere else within Ceasars.
Casino doesn't appear to be as smokey as MGM or Paris (for the non smokers).
From walking through MGM and Paris, caesars is lacking convenience store, for that item you forgot,or soda or chips you want at nigh.

Extremely disappointed that we cant use the fridge in the room. When you pay 30$ a day in resort fees plus the hotel costs, I'd expect being able to use the fridge in the room. I just called down to ask what's up and asked if they could come clear the mini bar from our room so we can use it and they said no. They can bring another fridge up for ANOTHER 20$ a day. Now we have all these booze we bought on the way and are using a garbage can full of ice to cool them really classy right? So far I'm just really disappointed. We won't be staying here again. Our 6 day stay starts now. The staff is friendly and the room is alright (paid 20$ a day for an upgrade) so far but the fridge thing is really rubbing me the wrong way. You pay so much money to stay at a nice hotel. Then charge 30$ a day for resort fees for essentially just wifi a fridge we could use should be included in that fee. I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Day 2: Front desk pool man screamed at us when we weren't aware we couldn't take in outside drinks.  He really didn't have to scream at us. There are more professional ways to speak to people.

Day 4: my bfs birthday. Apparently BCID isn't valued here and he can no longer have any drinks even tho weve been using this ID the whole time weve been here. The whole stress of the stay here has pushed him into pre warning for a sezuire and is having tremors in both arms as he suffers from epilepsy. 

THANKS CAESERS PALACE FOR COMPLETELY RUINING OUR TRIP. Now that he's unwell we will have to spend the rest of our trip in our room so nothing else causes stress so he doesn't have a sezuire.

We're here for another 3 days. We feel trapped and just want to go home

WORST PLACE EVER!!! RUDEST STAFF I EVER MET!!!!
now i didn't stay at their hotel but i was in the casino and their staff at the gaming tables were BEYOND rude.

i'm just standing there, watching my boyfriend play roulette and the roulette ball tossing woman decides to card me even though i'm not playing. Okay, no big deal. 
I hand her my US Passcard and it's obvious she has absolutely NO idea what she's looking at, she hands it over to the guy next to her who's stacking the chips and he too has no idea what he's looking at, at which point they hand it to the female pit boss who (guess what?) has NO IDEA what she's looking at and they start giving me a hard time about it. 
It was the day before my 30th birthday. Yes, THIRTY! 3-0. 
Thanks for ruining my birthday Caesar's Palace with your incompetent staff who were practically on the verge of tossing me out of the casino if i didn't conveniently have my passport on hand. 

it's absolutely ridiculous having two female chinese immigrants harassing me about my United States passcard whilst IN THE UNITED STATES. 
what kind of absurdity is THAT?!
And then they have the nerve to tell me that it would've been better had i shown them my driver's license. 
so you're telling me that you know what all 50 driver's licenses look like and what all 200 country passports look like BUT you have no clue what a United States passcard looks like when you work and live in the United States?!

You need to better train your employees on their manners and what government issued IDs look like. You are lucky yelp requires a 1 star minimum because honestly, you deserve ZERO STARS!

So this is a review for the Roman Tower rooms which is not far off from being a room at the Excalibur.  Being my first time staying at this hotel I was expecting sooooo much more.  

Checking in: Was pretty easy, the hostess was making small talk on what our plans were and if we were going to see and shows.  I said that we were looking for good places to eat and she suggested places that weren't at the hotel.  She suggested we try Wicked Spoon at the Cosmopolitan which was weird because Bacchanal is a better buffet.

So they gave us a room in the Roman Tower on the 13th floor.  We get up to our room and open the door and BAM...disappointment.  The room looked old.  The carpet looked like it had been there since day one.  There were even a few parts where it looked like the carpet was coming apart.  In the bathroom it looked like the sink and mirror had been updated but that's about it.  The shower was just a tub with white tile which was pretty much the same as a Motel 6 shower along with the crusty old shower curtain, which looked like it had a blood stain\/makeup stain on it.  Around the room there were tables which were covered by a cloth.  Looking under the cloth they weren't really tables, it  was a few pieces of wood with a circular board on top to make it look like a table.  The TV was also weird, whenever you would turn on the TV the volume would always be at 30 or something which was Club Scene loud and I'd have to turn it down every single time.  

Overall:  What the hell Caesars....I could get the same room for 2\/3's the price at Excalibur.  I thought I'd save $100-150 on hotel and stay at Caesars instead of the Aria or Vdara but I really regret my decision.  Oh well, you win some you lose some.

Review for the pool:
My friends and I wanted to simply get some sun and sit on pina colada. And we did JUST that. We initially went into the day-club area quickly turned around and left because there was no place to sit or layout. 

The venus pool is a nice kidfriendly pool. There are statues and fountains all around and chairs everywhere. We went on a saturday so it was pretty crowded but had a great time hanging out...
The WORST!!! Buyer beware! Paid $130 to stay 19 hours 4pm check in, 11am check out. Trashy! dirty! RUDE GUST SERVICES! Mold in bathrooms.

Caesars Palace is one of the best Casino Hotels in Las Vegas. I've stayed twice before and would return again. Last visit, I stayed 4 nights and attended a convention for work. The room was clean, elegant, and comfortable. Staff at the front desk and throughout the hotel are friendly and hard working. You get what you pay for, and in this case, pony up: Caesars Palace is the place you want to be while in Las Vegas.

The shopping is phenomenal....! 
The structures are so Caesar...! 
Reminds me of when I was in Greece on vacation...!

This casino has so much to offer over such a large space, one could very easily go inside, and never leave until their trip was over. The rooms are great (I was lucky enough to stay in a room with a lovely view overlooking the Bellagio water show), there's plenty of shopping and dining options (including the fantastic Mesa), the pool complex is absolutely beautiful and relaxing, great shows at the Colosseum, and then there are the forum shops. Throw in a great casino floor with high ceilings  to help keep it from getting to smokey and you've got everything you need.

Very average LV hotel. Everything is paid and expensive. Even in room coffee is a purchase!  No robes or slippers for use while at hotel. You're charged a resort fee but not told so I didn't connect to wifi in my room because it was going to charge me. I was there for a conference and the banquet food was horrible. The pasta was so over cooked it was gummy!  My room was never made up the second day, although someone charged me for water I never bought!  Actually so suboptimal that affected what I thought of the conference too. 

Pool looked nice although I didn't use.

Holy beautiful! I suppose this review isn't quite fair, because I didn't stay there, nor did I spend any real time here...we simply tried to find Pete Rose to get an autograph. Pete Rose doesn't sign here anymore, but the scenery is absolutely breathtaking. The sculptures, the carvings, the art - all spectacular! The ceiling is phenomenal!...puts the  Paris' to shame!

After our night at the LVH (read my review), we moved over here because the Boyfriend has a near-unhealthy fascination with the movie "The Hangover."

Since we had the renal car, we needed to drive from one hotel to the other. This is normally a very simple task but Las Vegas Blvd. was closed! After drying around in circles a couple of times, we called the front desk for help We got transferred to Security who told us exactly where we needed to go. We got to the parking garage in no time after that.

When it was time to check in, the front desk staff was very friendly. I am not sure if they upgraded us by mistake but our $99 room was HUGE; it might have been bigger than our apartment. WE always asked for non-smoking rooms & even though the front desk assumed me the whole tower is non-smoking, I still smelled smoke periodically...wonder why.

I had visited Caesars a few times these past few years for the forum shops (and Fat Tuesdays hehe).  This past weekend was my first time actually staying here as a guest, and I was really impressed.  The room was booked for the Roman tower through expedia, but after reading some yelp reviews about how old and tiny the rooms there are, an upgrade was pretty much going to be necessary.  We finally arrived in Vegas around 6 pm on a Friday, and I was a bit worried they wouldn't have open upgrades available.  Slipped a 20 sandy over and the nice gentleman at the front desk gave us a great complementary upgrade.  Our whole stay there was very pleasant, and all the workers were more than accommodating: spacious bathroom with a jacuzzi and his\/her sinks, a vanity table with good lighting, lots of closet space. Caesars has a great location for clubbing, and it's really cheap to taxi to all the good clubs.  (I don't care of XS is practically across the street; that's still unnecessary pain to trek over in heels.)  Anyways, for the daytime, there's a lot of good food and shopping options inside: the buffet, Mesa Grill, Spago, Fat Tuesdays, and most designer stores.

While it still isn't my ultimate favorite place to stay on the Strip, I will definitely return if the price was right.

ooh i don't know if they upgraded me without telling me but omg the room they gave me was wonderful!!!!!!!! a plasma tv...living area...plasma in the bathroom...huge oversized tub...the room was so nice i wanted to live there!!!! great service...fabulous pool area...

I LOVE IT!!!

this is typically our hotel of choice since we get our rooms comped and it is the best hotel form the harrah's owned - hotels (which takes up a huge chunk of the strip).,, 

for the most part, we enjoy our stay. certain towers have better rooms - so the augustus tower is the best one - altho they have nice upgraded rooms at the other towers as well. they are also scheduled to open a new tower soon and upgrade the rest. 

the pools have been revamped - so there are more pool areas to lounge around. i have only seen this a couple of times, but they do have 'goddesses' passing out frozen grapes. 

for gaming, they are more on the $$$ side, so if you are not looking to play big in terms of table games, you may want to visit a different casino. otherwise, the dealers are nice enough. it can definitely get crowded on weekend evenings. 

for food - they don't have the best assortment. the high end restaurants usually have great reviews but the buffet, cafe and other offerings are a bit sad. i do like payards (see my review) for quick sandwiches to go and pastries. the food court is so-so but a better option than some of the restaurants. serendipity is not bad. 

you also have the forum shops - which is nice to walk around. it has a mixture of your regular mall stores as well as high-end stores. also has a better assortment of retaurants.

we enjoy our stays here. partly because it's free...

4.5 Stars.  Casino is always busy and crowded, but the dealers are very friendly.  Room was okay, not much better than other casinos on the strip.  What you really pay for is the great service.  Friendly and prompt.  I docked half a star because beverage service needed some severe revamping.  Waited almost 15 minutes for a waitress to come and waited another 15 for my drink.

Horrible customer service! Took 35 minutes just to change my chips for cash!!! This place is extra smokey. I gag on smoke going to the rooms. The buffet customer service was horrible too. I was trying to get lunch and they tried to charge me for dinner!!! The movie Hangover made them famous so they are now able to get away with horrible service and a horrible experience all around. The black jack is set up to rob you as well. Don't play their single deck black jack style. Most gambeling tables have $25 or $50 minimums and their drinks are watered down and take forever to get while your gambling. 

If your not a smoker don't go here. Extra smoky!

Horrible customer service all around!!!

Here's what you need to know:  Give the valet ONLY your car key.

Valet is actually quite prompt and they are super friendly.  
But I have to minus almost all their points for losing a key ring attacked to my car keys with all (two) of my other keys.  Maybe it's my own rookie mistake, but 10 other casinos on the strip didn't seem to have a similar problem.

As for the rooms, pretty decent size.  I was in the roman tower, 12th floor, decent view of the pool.  Too bad it's winter.

They get a star back for their craps tables, only cause I won some small change here.

I'll have to write up the restaurant reviews separately... but (Bobby Flay's) Mesa Grill - Big thumbs up.   

Hyakumi (Japanese restaurant) - skip it.

The service is still impeccable. From the valet to the pool service attendants, everyone was amazing. Not one complaint. They left a nice letter welcoming us back. My suite was new, clean, and well designed.  I really enjoy being in the hotel again.

Loved our last stay here! Our room was in the Augustus tower with a view of the Bellagio fountains and it was excellent. The staff was very nice and helpful our whole stay, plus casino, shops, restaurants and pool area are among the best we've tried on the strip. The central location is a plus for walking and taxi fare friendly when we got tired of walking. Very classy hotel without being overly pretentious.

Technically, two and a half stars.  It really is a beautiful casino - the problem is that that doesn't necessarily translate in execution.
CONS:
1.  Very bad time with the front desk getting our room.  First they gave us a smoking room when we specifically told them non-smoking (it was also listed in the reservation).  Took them over three hours - from 10pm at night to 1:30 am before they got us in the right room - this was after numerous calls and going back and forth to the front desk about this.
2.  They are not sympathetic at all - their attitude is pretty bad - each time we went back to the front desk they kept saying it would only be 15 mins, then 20 mins, then 30 mins - and each time they kept repeating that they don't guarantee room types only a room reservation.  When you are exhausted from a full work day and have just flown in - all you want is to just settle in your room - not have to wait 3 and 1\/2 hours til after midnight to check into your room.   When I escalated my concerns to the manager - even he was very unsympathetic and kept putting it back on us saying they don't guarantee anything.  Jeez.  Horrible customer service. You make the consumer feel bad, thanks a lot.
3.  They neglect to mention on their site that only some of the pools are available and that there is ongoing construction.  So instead of getting the peace and quite you would think in the serene Garden of the Gods pools - you get a lot of raucous construction and beeping noises for ambience.  Lovely.  And to think that I specifically chose this hotel just for the pools.  
4.  Ceasar's is the only casino that doesn't have clear marked paths for children to stay on when going through the casino - they seem to purposely make you go out of your way to wander every which way until you get to your destination.   If I were an auditor with the gaming commission, I would certainly look into this and ding them for it - it doesn't help with keeping the under 21 off the gambling areas.

PROS:
1.  To be fair - I think because they could see I wouldn't stop complaining until someone did something, they did credit me a $50 food and beverage credit - although, we realized the very next morning that was barely a blip - two crepes later and one coffee and that was that for the food credit! Not even enough for a $2.50 banana or a $3.50 small water.
2.  Beautiful casino and forum shops - especially with the recent renovation, it certainly impresses.
3.  Room was very nice if on the small side - even for the Palace Tower - which is one of the nicer towers.  I don't know why - but when we mistakenly got placed into a smoking room - the room was much much bigger than the non-smoking.   

NEUTRAL:
EVERYTHING is way way overpriced - like I said $3.50 for a small water.  But then again that's what every other hotel would charge anyway.

Would I come back?  Nah.  Overriding everything is the horrid customer service leaving a bad taste in your mouth.   There are other hotels you can spend your hard earned money on with the exact same amenities or even better.

Zero complaints! Upon arrival, we found a back entrance to the valet parking structure to bypass all of the congestion in the front entrance. Best hidden area ever, we pulled right up with no waiting. Check in was a breeze, there was a $200 safety deposit that we will receive back in five business days. We stayed in the palace tower suite on the 28th floor. Such a gorgeous room!! And it nice because it's a private floor, you need a special key to have access to the floor. The bed  was heavenly! Black out drapes were could of had me sleeping for days, large jacuzzi tub, two restrooms, two showers, and a cute little vanity area to get ready. Also, The staff was beyond friendly & helpful. Overall it was a great experience. We will be back!

Stayed in the Augustus Tower over Labor Weekend and had a blast.  Caesar's may not have the best bars\/lounges on the strip, but the seating is comfortable and they are fairly private.  While I prefer the people watching at Cosmopolitan or Aria, the laid back feel of Caesar's is very much welcomed before or after a night on the town.

Stay away from the MunchBar, the food isn't good and it isn't priced well either.  Pure is a decent spot.  The patio is huge but there isn't anywhere to sit if you're not popping bottles.  The buffet was still under construction during my stay, but it's supposedly going to be the biggest in LV once it does open.

My room in the Augustus Tower was great (4284).  Perfect view of the strip and I could watch the water show at the Bellagio unimpeded.  There's even a separate entrance and registration desk for the Augustus Tower that can be accessed on Flamingo.

The bathroom came equipped with a water closet, television, dual vanities, separate shower, and whirlpool tub.  However, the television in the room was a bit small, 32 in. if I had to guess.  WiFi was not free and cost $14.99\/day.  I thought that was kind of lame considering all of the amenities included.

Having to pay for internet access wouldn't be a big enough deterrent to prevent me from staying here again.  And all those shops in the Forum don't hurt either.

I came, I saw, I conquered...

Yeah I love this Casino, we love the sportsbook and their large big screen tv's to watch sports.  We tend to be winners here for the most part. Plus they got the Mesa Grill restaurant. We ate at their buffet which was okay, the deserts were super good yum yum.  Anyways we went here when David Copperfield was in town and the show was great.  Anyways we like going to see Pete Rose and got our picture taken with him.  We like their forum shops and the architecture was nice. We never stayed there, but if we did definitely go to the pool and looked nice.  Anyways really cool and fun.
Everything is a long wait! From checking in, vallet parking (2hrs wait ), room service and a rip off room!

Caesars palace is one of our favorite casinos. 
We love the fact that it's connected to the Forum shoppes with we love to go window shopping.
The casino is beautiful and clean and has a good selection of slot machines.
One of our favorite places to have breakfast is located in the Caesars palace and that is Payard's bistro. The best croissant eggs Benedict you will ever have.
The valet is convenient and are always courteous.
The casino is very smokey, dated, with limited new slot machines. The rooms are pretty nice, so this review is about the casino. Restaurants and shops are great.

3rd time staying at this hotel.. it's huge!!! It offers a lot to do and although it's nice that it's big It gets exhausting and overwhelming... room service is expensive!! Lol 2 milkshakes over $40.!!!! I have to admit the food is delicious though!!! The rooms are nice and clean.. we typically stay in the Augustus tower closer to the casino\/lobby... we were put in the Octavius tower once and will never again make that mistake!!!!! The longest walk! Overall nice hotel, I'm sure we'll be back.
Old school nice. Only 4 stars because the competition is stiff now with mega hotels like Wynn, Encore and Aria. You cant go wrong staying here!

We stayed at Caesars a few weeks ago & I loved it.  They upgraded our room for free & it was awesome.  A beautiful suite with three baths & seperate bedroom.  They treated us like royalty & I definitely will be back.  Just wish I had won at the slots!

We thought that staying at Caesars would be an upgrade but we were wrong. I called as soon as I booked and informed front desk that I need two beds as I have no desire to sleep too close to the person I was to share the room with. Upon checking in I was told that the hotel had a convention and were full so I only get to have one king bed and they will bring in another temporary bed to my room. I wasn't happy with that arrangement but arguing wasn't going to do any good. In addition the guy who checked me in (I believe his name was Orion or Orien) said that he will compensate with a nice view. As I entered my room in the Roman Tower I realized that he was a major liar as we were put in the 3rd floor and all I saw was the air conditioner on the roof. I also realized that he put us in a room without a bathroom door which is marvelous when you are traveling with a colleague. Then the extra bed arrived and it looked like a military cot. Since I pulled the shorter straw, the cot was all mine.  The entire night our super old toilet made noises as if a bird was trapped inside and the pipes reminded me of a 747 landing on your roof. I could hear our next door neighbor zipping and unzipping his luggage so that tells you how thick the walls are. My cot was hard as a board and i couldnt wait for the sun to come up.  When I spoke to Savannah in guest service she refuse to do anything about any of my problems and told me to call back the next day and talk to Charles. The next morning no one knew who Charles was but after an hour of discussion with the front desk we were moved to another even older room without a view but with two beds and a bathroom door. 
I am not sure where the lack of customer service comes from as I have never experienced such disregard for patrons from another Vegas hotel. This place is old and overpriced and one coffee and oatmeal cost me 20 dollars. The only nice people at this hotel were the valet and bellhop. Save your money and stay at the Pallazo or Venitian for a little more as Caesars is overhyped, underwhelming, and does not care about its customers.

I love going to the forum shops at this place.  They have some nice restaurants too, including a Spago, and I think a Serendipity 3 right outside. The Nike store doesn't have a basketball court on the second floor anymore though.. bummer, i really wanted to dunk on somebody....

I was a little apprehensive at first but my experience at Caesars was not too bad. I stayed on the 40th floor of the Augustus tower and the rooms were great - clean, large, 2 plasma tv's, brilliant views of the Bellagio fountain. The pool was decent, actually it was pretty good. Better than the Venetian and Bellagio, but it did not compare to the one at Mandalay. The location is of course very central with easy access to the Forum Shops. If circumstance made me stay here again - I wouldn't have a problem.

Considering that the whole reason my friends and I stayed here was that hotels.com spat it out as providing the best deal on short notice, I thought Caesar's was great.  Let's be real, it isn't the Palazzo, and you can definitely tell it's an older hotel, but it's still nice.  Our room was basic, with comfy beds, plenty of space, and a view of the awesome pool.  It's a nice place to stay when the hotel isn't the centerpiece of your Vegas experience.  There's plenty to do in and around the hotel.  Shopping is sweet, and there's plenty of it.  The pool is fantastic and there are lots of good restaurants.  I'm also partial to the casino, but this isn't really useful, as I've never met a casino I wasn't partial to.  Overall, highly recommended if you're not looking for a total VIP experience.

Room service is god-awful. It takes over an hour to receive, and the food is delivered cold.  I called room service back after the awful experience of delivering my grilled cheese--cold. I was told room service would come and pick it up if it wasn't consumed. How does that resolve the fact I'm hungry, and didn't want to leave my room for food. 
Get it together Caesars. I stayed 5 nights and no love. Gross.

The entire experience is very disappointing.  Started with the booking for a conference. Booked for 2 nights and found they actually charged my card 3 months before the stay for one of the nights. I couldn't expense it so far in advance of the event, so I had to pay for it out of pocket until I could file expenses after the trip.

I reserved a King room. Received an email at 3:30am (which I didn't see until I was at the airport) and couldn't use their "process" for checkin on my phone. Got to the hotel at 8:30 in the morning, waited in line for 20 minutes in a lobby choking with smoke (I have asthma). I handed the person at the "check-in desk" my Amex and she said "And what do you want me to do with this?" No Hello, no welcome to Caesars.  I said, "Well, I'm checking in" and they then informed me that checkin was at 3pm (which the email did clearly state) and they would notify me via call when the room was ready. I asked if wifi was available and she said its $25 in the lobby area or $14 in the room for 1 device only.

 Went back to the lobby at 3 and waited in line again for 25 minutes (lobby reeks of smoke) and they said they had no rooms ready and might not until 6:00 pm. I said, "Your email said checkin is at 3 and I have a conference call at 4." No apology, no offer of help. Finally got a call the room was ready at 4pm, had to stand in the key line again for 25 minutes. Got keys, went to get luggage at Bell stand, they said I had to go outside to the Valet to get my luggage. Gave the valet the ticket and had to wait 20 minutes in the heat for my luggage.

Got to the room and despite the fact that  I paid for a king and booked months in advance, got a queen\/double and handicapped with no tub. Called the front desk and they told me they would give me the king I paid for, but I"d have to go back to the front desk (from the Palace tower) with my luggage and get the keys myself (and wait in the key line... ) for another 20 minutes. Wasn't worth the asthma attack.

Decided to write this YELP and found out the wifi is only 1.5Mbps and "included in the resort fee" which is NOT what the front desk told me. 

It seems all of the staff I spoke to were angry and put-out that you are even bothering them. There clearly aren't enough staff as everwhere you go, you stand in line.

I notified the conference organizers of this horrible and rude service and they documented it all. Also called my large tech company travel center and they told me that they removed Caesar's from their approved travel list due to all of the complaints and the non-standard billing process.

I would HIGHLY recommend not having an event at this hotel or staying here. The place needs a lot of work to bring it up to 2015 standards for a $300 a night hotel.
Went to 2 places to get a drink and a bite to eat. Each place had no customer service- I didn't get served or given a menu even after I waited.

Note: editing my review and adding stars. I found Keurig cups for the coffee maker, cream and stevia across the street at the CVS in front of Bally's. I can use the coffee maker and keep my cream in the ice bucket. The pool is salt water which feels smoother and more buoyant. Everything here is a long walk, but the staff have been pleasant even cheerful when dealing with my complaints. It turns out that the phone works, but is complicated. Also, the maid accidentally kept my keycard when she and the other man checked my phones. I had to have the first set deactivated. The staff issued new room cards and delivered them to the room. Caesar's staff handling of my issues moves it from 2 stars to 4 !

I just checked out of the Luxor and moved to Caesars. I paid to upgrade my room. The bed appears to be nice, and the upgrade added a jacuzzi tub. 

However, there are some flaws. None of the phones in the suite work, and I had to get housekeeping to give me the number to dial down to the desk for repairs. There are snacks on one of those weighted trays that charge $25 if you even bump anything. There is a kuerig in my room, $13 for one coffee setup. The only refrigerator is fully stocked with drinks and liquor at stupid prices with a warning that you will be charges if you move anything. So any comfort in the room is offset with stress, "DON'T BUMP THE SNACKS OR THE HOTEL WILL SCAM YOU!" If we want a refrigerator that we can actually use, we have to request and pay for one. 

Now folks, I don't gamble. I come with my husband to his conventions and I pay for my upgrades. This is the only real vacation that I get that does not include work or housework. I get some quiet time and read some books. I really do not want to go 60 floors down and walk a mile to pay $7 for a cup of coffee when I was told that my "UPGRADE" included a refrigerator (not) and a coffee pot (not). 
I don't trash the room. I tip the staff. I pay good prices for meals and buy at the shops. I am straightforward and don't appreciate these rip off spots in my room. For this crap, they get only two stars for the bed and jacuzzi. Don't play games with me even if we are in Vegas. The west wing king suite upgrade at the Luxor included three rooms, a coffee pot with Wolfgang Puck reserve coffee, a real wet bar with a real refrigerator, and no rip off snack\/drink charges. I gave the Luxor 5 stars.

We will be here four days. I will rate it again when I leave in an attempt to be fair. Right I am ticked off because I moved to a room costing twice as much with less than half the amenities. I loathe rip off spots in a room.

Nous avions réservé dans cet hotel pour sa réputation... et nous avons été très déçu, outre le fait que l'alarme incendie sonne tout les matins à 10h (pour la tester) le reste de l'hotel n'étais pas a la hauteur. Impossible de trouver quelque part ou manger tard, et notre chambre était sale (tache énorme sur la moquette etc...) 

Bref la prochaine fois je ne retournerais certainement pas dans cet hotel !

This hotel is HUGE!!! The room was beautiful, the bed was comfortable and the service was ver good!!! The shops here are awesome. And you are in the very center of the strip so you are pretty much central to everything! Have fun!!

We stayed in Octavius or Augustus (I forget) in May 2012. The room was very nice and comfortable; I slept like a baby and I showered like a Queen. Concierge bent over backwards for us; their humility and kindness was above excellent. I loved the pool and the service waitress who came by to check if we wanted anything during reasonable intervals. The gambling floor was huge and I often got lost. It seems this was done on purpose, haha. Tip: Bring a hotel map.

We went out there April of 2009. Booked our room on one of those travel websites and got a room for about $90\/night. We were only staying 1 night so we weren't too worried about staying somewhere super posh, but wanted to make sure we were in a decent room. 

We arrived in Vegas and were uber tired from our flight. Got the the hotel to check in and were advised that they gave us a free room upgrade. Sweet! 

There was construction and our room was almost close to impossible to find, but with the help of a friendly housekeeper, we were pointed in the right direction. We got into our room and wa wa we wa, it was so nice. There was a large king bed, a lounge sofa, flat screen TV in the room and a TV in the bathroom mirror. 

The whole room and bathroom were really spacious and clean. I have had bad experiences staying at other casinos that you would expect to be somewhat decent and end up getting a S*!% hole for a room. 

The fact that the casino itself is clean and not a smoky as other casinos was a plus. The Forum shops are also nice to walk around for an hour or two. 

I highly recommend Cesar's, but make sure you stay in the newer towers to get more bang for your buck.

Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.

Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employeesI stayed in the Palace Tower Strip View Room on comp for four nights. The room was huge with a big entry and hallway. Lots of the closet space and a separate makeup area. The bathroom was also huge with separate shower and toilet area, dual sinks and whirlpool tub with big mirror. The bed was big big and comfy and everything was in good shape. New TV with HD channels and a fully stocked mini fridge.

While I absolutely loved the room and has been the best at I stayed in Vegas the maid service was very poor. Not in that they didn't clean the room, they cleaned it everyday and did a good job making sure everything was refilled and cleaned. But when I was changing in the room the maid knocked on the door and before I could do anything and popped her head in and asked if any one was in. When I said yes and was busy she let her self in walked right into the room. Now I was on the bed half dressed and told her I was busy so I don't know why she walked in and stood right in front of the bed while Im half naked. All she did was asked if I wanted and any towels and said she would be back later to clean.

Now I wouldn't say I was mad just very awkward and embarrassing. So while I did love Caesars Palace that was a pretty humiliation moment for me.

This review is a long time coming.  Been coming here to play craps for a few years now and I have to say, hands down, they have some of the most professional and polite craps dealers in town.  Most are extremely nice and they are very helpful to players.  Never had an issue and had some of my best runs at this casino.  Besides craps, Caesars has an array of shops, restaurants, cigar lounges, bars, entertainment and shows.

The rooms are great too, I stayed at one of the newer towers a couple of years back and they definitely kept up the class and high end part of their image with the newly remodeled rooms.

Definitely caesars and venetian all the way!

Caesars Palace is one of my favorite Resorts and Casino's on the Las Vegas Strip. It's probably one of the most massive in size, has a wide range of rooms available in many different towers (all designed uniquely), lots of dining and bar options, and the pool area is amazing. Caesars is right in the middle of all of the action on the Las Vegas Strip so walking anywhere for a change in scenery is easy. 

My husband and I love it so much here that we decided to return to Vegas and get married here. We stayed in the Augustus Tower on our first stay together in December 2011, the Roman Tower on our wedding recon trip in October 2013, and in the Palace Tower (Petit Suite with King Bed) in April 2014 for our wedding. My parents were in the Octavius Tower for the wedding and I'd have to say, the Octavius is my favorite tower so far. Close second is the Palace Tower. Our cousins stayed in the Nobu Tower for the wedding but we haven't had a chance to get their notes on it yet. Will update my review when I do. 

The Forum Shops offer endless shopping and dining options. You could honestly stay at Caesars for 4 days and never have to (or want to) leave! We didn't when we were just there for our wedding April 26, 2014. 

Notes from this past trip:
-Trevi at the Forum Shops for an affordable, classy Italian dinner
-Joe's Seafood, Steak and Stone crab for the highest quality, delicious seafood and steak. GET THE STONE CRAB CLAWS! We had our reception here. (See also: Joe's Seafood, Steak and Stone Crab review).
-Seahorse Lounge: We love this bar as a good middle point meeting place. It's very spacious and the bartenders are on point. 
-Gordon Ramsay Pub: We had our "Rehearsal" dinner here Friday night and the food was good. There weren't any complaints except that we didn't realize some of the entrée items would be served a la carte (menu should say so if that's the case). Not sure if that was our oversight or what. 

Notes on the wedding: (See also: Caesars Palace Wedding Chapel review)

My husband and I decided to get married in Las Vegas and we started our search with where we stayed for our first trip to Las Vegas together; Caesars Palace. 

We got our information from Caesars Wedding Services (JoAnn) and did a little further research at other venues (Mandalay Bay, Wynn, Bellagio). We decided to use Caesars Palace as our ceremony venue and we are SO thrilled with our decision. 

Caesars Wedding Services have a wide variety of wedding packages available for all types of groups coming to Vegas for nuptials, and we chose the Cleopatra package and the Juno Garden to accommodate 85 guests. 

Rebecca Profitt was our coordinator and she was very attentive and friendly, and very timely with email and phone response. She was so on top of everything the day of and we did not have to worry about a single thing. We did opted out of having a rehearsal but because Rebecca was so on top of everything and communicating the details to all parties involved in the ceremony, I did not worry for a second. Our day was so beautiful and perfect and I wouldn't have changed a thing about it. 

Honorable mention for Rev. Brian Ross. We got SO many compliments on how great he was at the ceremony and how much everyone enjoyed him. I also really appreciated his playful manner and humor while I was in the midst of taking huge cleansing breaths in the bridal holding room waiting for the ceremony to start. 

Thanks for making our wedding day so amazing, Caesars Wedding team!

Woah. This place impresses the not-easily-impressed, i.e. me. 

It's just beautiful. Over the top? Sure. Gaudy? A little. But the white marble, the HUGE ceilings, the roman statuaries...it's just pretty damn cool. 

The sports book is not a room...it's a cavern. A large, huskily-lit cavern which makes you feel small, like a wonder-filled tot. 

The many small bars which dot the landscape are bulwarks of cool, little islands of fashionable nonchalance in a sea of decandent frivolity. 

I want to come back to Vegas, and I want to stay here.

We spent our New Year's Eve at #CaesarsPalace  Colosseum and witnessed Elton John's Millionaire Piano #NYE Concert.  It was magnificent and magical! Almost everyone was dressed up to the nines, including yours truly! Woohoo!  The ushers, security and staff were so accommodating and friendly. The seats were comfortable. The ladies rooms were spacious and clean. The view, well that's a different story. We had FIRST row, dead-center seating up in the balcony which was perfect for me since I'm short.  

Will I go back?! Absolutely! Elton Johnny said Mariah performs here so why not?‼

The journey to Vegas can never be fast enough. Crossing the barren desert, everyone rejoices when they see the lights and know they are on the strip. This was our first time in Caesar's Palace- we paid online on Caesar's website where the room was advertised as "pleasing to the senses." The first contact we made was with Elsa, a loud mouth, rude, snappy front desk attendant. I paid for the room with my B of A debit card and expected no issues as I have been to many, many hotels in Vegas and beyond with no issues. Elsa made a point to berate me for not having provided a credit card- I made it clear that there was more in my account than most people have lines of credit for and eventually had to get a manager as she was making such an issue of it. Meet Tyler Moeller. Tyler is the night hotel manager, he comes across as well spoken and appears to be attentive- he simply does not do anything for you other than nod in mock understanding and say mmmhmmm.  I realized that the pool of people that the recruiting department had to pull from "was what it was," - I made my way to my room. Now keep in mind, it is a Monday( I am writing this as I am sitting in my room now) and we paid top dollar due to Easter being so close. The room was utterly plain and devoid of anything- Hard Rock, Palms, Venetian, Wynn...even Treasure Island, hell, the Tropicana have better rooms. The TV is a barely working 32 inch from 1995( I just had to check) you know, the large 100 plus pound, can't get your arms around TVs of yesteryear. Shocking.  Cheap. Crude. I called and Annisha, the customer service rep answered the phone with a breathy, nasal voice. After a few seconds speaking with her and her limited sentence construction, I realized I was getting nowhere- her last interest was in making sure that I had a good first time.
I decided to order room service- the "hard charge" they put on my card did not work for room service and I was told that I would have to provide my card # again or pay cash??!!!? Seriously???? I would give no stars if I could- never again...

This place has gone way down hill. At check-in, the man smirked and laughed because our rooms weren't ready and they were the wrong rooms. He didn't believe a word I was saying. I said I had a confirmation letter. He said, "But you don't understand". When I reached for the letter, he said, "I'm going to get a manager." The manger read me the hotel riot act from the insider's point of view, how these things happen, etc. I showed her the letter more than once. Nothing but boilerplate. Worse, the bar service at video poker is rude, if anything. Sat at one for ten minutes after ordering a drink. Only three people at bar. Pass! $42 dollars this AM for three O.J., two coffee, and three banana nut muffins. Stay where you get the best deal.
One of the best hotels in Vegas! If you wanna luxury weekend you must stay in Caesars Palace!

VERY beautiful hotel. Inside-Outside. BUT! The workers are mean. I stayed there once for a bachelor party. They fully shut down the water at 3am, right at that time we came back to our rooms, NO WATER??? R U SERIOUS??? We called them and they told us to take a drinking water from the refrigerator. Really? I need to take a shower! I want to take a shower whenever I need. I'm paying for the room and they just offered couple bottles of drinking water as an compensation. Very funny

thanks to my dad who's a diamond level we got to stay here. (otherwise room rates are pricey for us) I've stayed many times for over 20yrs and still one of my faves hotels. (though stay away from the oldest tower rooms - I think Roman?) Pool is great, bacchanal buffet along with great restaurants, forum shops, gambling and center of strip!!! they also gave us free passes to the linq ferris wheel.

Oh Ceasars!  You have been good to me while I stayed here for 3 days!  With using my total rewards I was able to get 3 days here Sunday - Wednesday with only paying the resort fee, which is $20 a night! (Not bad).

You can still notice that this hotel is going through some remodeling in the front. But overall it's a very nice hotel! I got lost on my first night just because the hotel is so big!! I can only talk about the Palace tower (newly remodeled) as that is the tower that I stayed in, rooms 1541 with the view of the side of the strip such as a mirage, Venetian, Linq, Trump and the Aria.
