He said the nightclub wasn't possible, since it isn't operated by the hotel. Really? He said that WiFi was $15 per night and that could not be waive. REALLY? He did offer a $200 voucher for the buffet. Really? We ask if it's possible for the vouchers and WiFi but he said he couldn't do it and that we have to choose. First of all, that's insulting to present it as "$200 buffet voucher or free WiFi". You're a freaking manager, what's $15 for WiFi to you? Come on, WE WOULD PAY $1,800 FOR THE SUITE BUT THEY COULDN'T COMP US $15 FOR WIFI!? And a $200 voucher is nothing! We had at least 5 guys staying. 

This whole ordeal took over an hour of our time, and HE NEVER APOLOGIZED FOR MAKING US WAIT. Heck, while we were in line, another guest was complaining that Caesars Palace screwed him over because they gave his room out to someone else. Being diabetic, he originally had a room with a fridge to hold his insulin, but Caesars Palace screwed up. THE GUY HAD TO GO GET HIS INSULIN SHOT AT THE URGENT CARE BECAUSE CAESARS PALACE DID NOT PROVIDE HIM WITH THE PROMISED REFRIGERATOR!

We were so pissed we asked to cancel our reservation. We were going to find somewhere else to stay. The manager then had the nerve to say "You know it's Memorial Day weekend right?" Implying that we wouldn't be able to find living arrangements elsewhere. You know what Caesars Palace? WE'RE NEVER GOING TO STAY AT CAESARS PALACE EVER AND TELLING EVERYONE HOW YOU MISTREATED US!

I like Cesar's Palace i just feel they have built so many new casinos now that this one feels so old fashion now. The furniture and interior needs some uplifting and the colors look very dull to me every time i walk in they just look to dark to me. Maybe there suppose to look that way because they want to keep it in the ancient times, but i wasn't that impressed with the room we stayed in either and the room service was not the greatest they didn't show up until 3:00 pm in the afternoon which we had wanted our room cleaned earlier. I am only giving the 3-stars because it is one of the original casinos that was built in Las Vegas and it has some history to be seen there.
Mother of god, this is a massive casino.....the scope and scale just sort of boggles the mind.

Disabled Vet unfriendly.  OK, if you are going to be a "resort" then act like one.  For those of us who are older and with disabilities, there's a number of significant issues.  First is parking.  Self park is difficult to get to and when in the structure, there are no directions on the walls on where to park, what direction check-in is, etc.  Next you have to walk the entire length of the casino to get to the check in area.  Nothing like dragging your luggage over carpeting.  A number of stairs have no adjacent ramp.

Check in was mechanical and cold.  They did set us up in the Forum tower so we didn't have to walk as far to get out to the truck.

Probably like all the larger properties, there is a high ambient noise level which means most patrons have to shout at each other in the dining spots.  Speaking of dining, overpriced and mediocre quality.  They really gouge you if you try to be economical at the food court. The other thing is bad lighting transitions and no illuminated buttons in the elevators so you have to use your phone light to pick and choose.

The casino staff was friendly.  That got quashed when I got to my room and the key didn't work.  So at O'dark Thirty I got to wait 45 minutes with other frustrated guests trying to get their rooms and some sleep.  Woefully understaffed.

BTW wi-fi stinks.  It doesn't work in the Forum Shops because I found out that area isn't part of the resort.  So if it isn't part of the resort, don't act like it.  The Cigar Bar at the far end of the shop area is OK but doesn't have any draft taps.  Even there the ambient noise roar means you have to shout to be heard.

Stayed in the suite in the old power. 
Old equipment, old torn carpets. rooms were spacious but would not stay in CP again.

This casino is so big, I always get lost! Foodwise, they range from a food court (where you can pay $4 for a soda and get free refill for your whole weekend in Vegas, seriously, the cashier even tells you that) to fine dining. Their new addition, Bacchanal Buffet is a must try. 

The casino is filled with slots. The tables are not my cup of tea as the minimums are more than I'm willing to play. If you're coming from the escalator from The Quad, you cannot get out the same way. It is ONLY an entrance. I always have a hard time finding my way and square footage wise, this is one of the biggest hotel.
Very beutiful casino filled with ornate decorations and statues. They won more from me than I did from them, but other than that my gambling experience here was mediocre.

I've always liked Caesars but in the past year  we've had 2 bad experiences. The last time I wrote and explained our issues with our room and the response was great and the service the next time, as well as the room were great. This time we have a room where the shower is extremely small, set up with a folded seat for handicap accessibility and entire bathroom way below par!  The room is nice for a Quality Inn maybe, not for Caesars. The television is so small and old we can't read the guide from bed or seating. The room is underwhelming in decor and amenities. Very disappointed in the entire experience. I've heard others in our tower have very nice rooms.

11.24.07 - Took KU -2 over Mizzou; OU -13 over OSU; and UCLA +2 over a Dixon-less Ducks.  Won on 2 of 3.  It's always good when you place a 3 digit bet and walk away with 4.  The only thing that was stopping this review from being the coveted "Rage's 5 Star Yelp Review," was the Jaywalks blowing it vs Mizzou - hate the Big XII.  

GO BLUE!

Before my last trip to Vegas I was cruising Fat Wallet for hotel deals and came across rooms at Caesars for $160 a night.  It turns out that our room was actually a deluxe suite in the Augustus Tower.  The room was beautiful with a huge bathroom, dreamy beds, and nice amenities.

In general, I highly recommend Caesars as a place to stay.  It has a great location on the strip, the casino is nice, the pool is beautiful, PURE is right downstairs (though it's not my favorite club), and the mall attached is convenient for picking up forgotten items. 

Also, if you check in at the airport there is no line at all.

Las Vegas was one of those places growing up I never thought I'd visit.  Having a best friend that grew up there changed that.  This casino has become a nostalgic place for me and was quickly one of my favorites in the city. Not the newest or sleekest, I love the Roman theme with all the statues, marble, and art.

I like the casino floor with its lofty ceilings.  The Forum Shops is my favorite part; lots of fountains and many stores.  There are also great restaurants inside.

Pros: Room (in the Augustus Tower) is fantastic.  Huge, well-appointed, jetted tub, comfortable.  I'm really happy with it and would give five stars.

Cons: Self checkin doesn't work.  It said my room wasn't ready yet (at 7:30PM?!?!) and that I'd get an email when it was.  Meanwhile, people are checking in at the desk.  I ate dinner, no email, went to the desk, and they apologized and said this is a known issue.  Huh?  Fix it, or turn them off.

Next, this place doesn't nickel-and-dime you... it $5-and $10s you!  There's a bunch of ridiculously overpriced crap in the room, and the fridge is full of it (if you move something, you get charged)  There was a note saying you could ask housekeeping for a fridge.  Great!  I asked, and was told it'd be $30 a day!  FOR A FRIDGE!  I declined.

This isn't a cheap hotel, but the endless dollar-pinching is kind of a lot to take.  I really don't know if I'll come back.

horrible   stayed fourth of july weekend  hotel lets outside people into their pool facilities and then tells their guests looking for pool chairs that its first come first serve     pool manager even worse and extremely rude   been to Vegas over thirty times     Cesar's the worst

Always love going to Caesars, real style and atmosphere. 
Best mall in Las Vegas too.

We stayed here to celebrate my birthday as well as one of our friends.

Upon check in, the lady was very nice and quickly noticed we had two birthday girls in the party when she looked at our IDs. She was able to find us two rooms on the same floor like we had asked and was very kind.

Our room was very clean, modern and a good size. The cleaning staff was very nice. One morning we had left, eaten breakfast, return back to the room because my boyfriend forgot something and housekeeping had already finished with our room. Everything looked great. She was even kind enough to ask us how our day was and if everything was good in the room. 

Everyone we ran into here just seemed so nice it was a very enjoyable stay.

I hate this hotel more than I can say.  I'd give them a negative star and beg people to tear it down, but the Forum shops are okay, and their concert venue is really nice, so I'll add a star for that.  Other than that, this place is overpriced and over-rated crap.

Their casino is awful.  Their machines have some of the lowest payouts in Vegas.  Their table games have some of the highest minimum bets on the strip, and their staff is snobbish and rude.  If you aren't laying down $100 per hand, then you are simply not worth their time. 

The last time I was there was about a year ago. I actually had one of their pit bosses SNEER at me when I asked if there were any $10 Blackjack tables available, and he told me me it might be best if I found a lower class hotel to play in.  EXCUSE ME?!?!  I was wearing dress pants and a polo at the time, so it's not like I was looking trashy...I was just waiting for my concert to start and wanting to blow $100 or $150 while I waited.

The hotel itself was probably considered really nice when it was built in 1962, but it is completely dated and tacky compared to anything else on the strip.  It looks like some 60 year old Persian guy went nuts with marble statues and gold spray paint. (Not trying to be racist, but that stereotype is the only way I can think to describe the absurd level of tacky)

Do yourself a favor.  Play somewhere else.  Oh, and for less money, you can upgrade to a pretty nice suite at any of the folowing for a MUCH better experience: Mirage, TI, the Monte Carlo, and the Venetian.

I attended a show last night at the Colosseum. Went to the main entrance at first and they told me the valet is full and they only serve their 7 star customers. And they told me to use the valet parking at the colosseum entrance. Ok, I went to the colosseum entrance. They told me the valet parking is full so I have to do self parking. It was a Thanksgiving weekend, so it took me 2 hours to get my car parked. But guess what I saw at the valet parking later on. There was the staff telling another customer that their valet parking is full. And this customer gave this staff a $10 tip, then this staff gave him a 7 star customer card. So this is all about how much tip you can give. You can be a 7 star customer with just $10 tip. Such a nice hotel!

There's a reason they can not climb the ladder to be a 5 star hotel.  The staff are  unknowledgeable. The front desk lines were unbearable with only 3 clerks available to help. There are at least 12 clerk stations but they're empty...it was a busy cinco de mayo and fight wkend. The little worker bees were snobbish until we flash them our "gold\/executive card" then they become super fake nice while trying to kiss our posteriors.  We shouldn't have to fan them with dollar bills to receive mediocre service. After all they are just bottom dwellers!

We hired their catering service for a party, but the food was horrible! The cake was wrong! The catering manager we had was as smart as a goldfish. Then our coordinator thought like a snail.

Did not stay here, unfortunately...but walked through and WOW. Amazing place, amazing architecture...can't say enough good things about it. Even if you don't book at this Hotel, make it a priority to walk around!

Visited 1\/10\/16.

Though it's a pretty large casino with our recent stay there, my opinion is that the slots machine requires updating with new machines.  Nice small poker room though.  Drink servers were very slow.

Worst experience ever!!!
It's my 5th weekend in Vegas and we came for my husband birthday. Shower works bad, cold and hot water changes every time, sink clogged, $10 for parking per day. They have coffee machine but you need pay for k cups.
Attention!!! If you want to check what they have in mini bar they will charge you when you grab the item. It's very nice really? Don't use fridge for your items, they will change for full mini bar!!!
Unknown fees, taxes, charges and pretty new service $10\/per day It's all about Ceasers Palace!
Never again! This place sucks! Thank you for AMAZING Experience

NEVER STAY AT ROMAN TOWER. It's the oldest and crappiest tower\/room out of the entire hotel. I was put in this tower and they wouldn't put me in a different tower unless I paid a $40\/n upgrade fee. Granted, my company booked\/comped for my room but still, I got way downgraded from last year's trip. I have nothing good to say about my recent experience. 

Unlike other tower rooms (ie. Palace Tower), here are things you should expect:
- Room is much smaller than other towers
- I got put in a room with no view of anything - oh, just a beautiful view of buildings and walls
- There are no plugs on night stand lamps. So ghetto. I couldn't even find any plugs behind the beds. The only closest plug is on the wall far away from the bed. 
- No bathrobes
- No jet tubs
- The so-called clock with iPhone plug and charger doesn't even charge my iPhone when plugged in
- Shower and bathtub water is sometimes cold even when you have it on "Hot". It turned cold while I was showering so imagine how I felt!
- Air controller is one of those old-school slider thingies rather than the modern controller with buttons to push to increase or decrease temperature
- There is NO desk for you to work on. How are you supposed to work on your laptop if you're here for work??

- Best of all, front desk informed me wrong information for shipping stuff. I had to order an urgent item online with a 2-day shipping. I called front desk to get shipping address information and they told me the address and said shipments would come to the Business Center and all I'd have to do is go there, show my ID and pick up the package. So I did that, and Business Center reps said that front desk always mixes up that info. In actuality, shipments come to their Parcel Center. They can call and have the package delivered to me anywhere in the hotel. Sounds great! OK let's do that! So the rep called the parcel center and let me speak with the guy on the phone. Turned out, my package was STILL at the USPS!! Apparently they don't deliver to the hotel!! WTF? I would have to actually go to USPS on Las Vegas Blvd to pick it up on MONDAY. I'm like "Uhhm that's impossible. It's Saturday, I have to check out at 11am, and my flight home is 4pm. There is no way I can do that. So finally I was told to call the USPS back on Monday and arrange for the package to be forwarded to my address back home with a shipping fee! Geezussss!!! So much for Amazon prime 2-day shipping. Now I have to pay forwarding shipping fees!? What a nightmare!

This must've been one of my worst trips and stays in Vegas ever. That's why I'm giving 1 star. The only thing good about this hotel is the Payard because that's where I go every morning for my coffee and pastry. And maybe a couple of restaurants. That's it.

So I'm a Vegas regular for sure and I would say this is in the top three hotels to stay at in Vegas! Very classy and elegant. The forum shops are amazing and the forum itself is beautiful. The rooms are good sized and always clean. I would defiantly recommend this hotel!

I've now stayed at Caesars for multiple conferences. The accomodations are not bad, just never look to closely or you'll see the molding frame of the bathroom door or the worn seat covers. 

Like all of the places on the strip, they have a wide range of restaurants and gambling options. They have some of the nicer pools, I think. 

But it's Vegas and while they've tried to keep up with their neighbors, I personally think Wynn or Aria are doing a better job of it.

My second and most recent stay was at the Caesar's Palace. I was not disappointed the first time when I visited with my girlfriends, but this time around it was a romantic second stay here with my love. 

We absolutely loved our weekend stay. We were here on a weekend that our favorite singer (Morrissey) was supposed to perform, at the Cosmo. Unfortunately, he cancelled...but our romantic weekend getaway was INCREDIBLE! We loved our lavish room; especially the shower! 

On one of our nights at the palace, we traveled downstairs and stopped at FAT TUESDAY'S! A must if you're in Vegas. I got hammered, because the drinking continued while gambling at the fabulous casino. There's obviously a variety of reviews...if you want to enjoy your stay lavishly, without any barely turned 21 people; stay here! Otherwise, stay at the trendy and over priced hotel and casinos. 

Caesar's Palace is going to be the hotel and casino where we stay at when Morrissey reschedules.  This time I'm bringing our puppy! They offer pet friendly rooms.

My first time staying here. My husband got a three nights standard complimentary room at the Roman tower, a $125 credit for food or drinks plus $125 for gaming (blackjack or slot machines) I know it's free, but I was disappointed with their rooms I was expecting a lot nicer looking room than this for Caesar. The music from the street woke me up around 3am and didn't finish until 4:37am. We stayed at Bellagio (standard room) and it was way nicer.

We had a stopover and saw a show here while on a road trip.  My husband booked a room on Priceline because they take dogs.  He later found that the dog fee is an additional $75 per dog, per day.  He tried to cancel and had trouble so we kept the reservation.  The room was only $69 per night and the dog fee was more than that.  It was somewhat frustrating.  I am so happy that he was not able to cancel.  The room was luxurious and very spacious.  There were 2 comfy beds with nice bedding.  A floor to ceiling view of the strip and nice seating area were other perks of the room.  They delivered two dog dishes, treats, baggies, a mat and door tag(Dog Inside) shortly after our arrival.  They had a very small turf area for the dogs to relieve themselves.  It had an umbrella and a large water dish, it is hot in Vegas this time of year!  It was so nice and weird to be walking through a hotel\/casino with two Boxers.  The hotel staff was very friendly and happy to see the dogs.  We had a great night and are refreshed and ready to get on the road.  I will definitely stay here again and I can bring my dogs!

I don't know what it is, but this is one of my favorite casinos! This place is huge, but it is nice inside. The points of interest are clearly marked with which direction they are located and it's hard to get lost. The food court is really nice with plenty of options. I enjoy the restaurants at Caesars also, Gordon Ramsay Pub as well as the buffet. I don't know if this is still the case but the buffet was voted the best in Las Vegas within the last year or so. I don't know if it still is, but it is definitely my favorite. The casino games are fun and seem to have some good options available. I personally love playing the video roulette. 

Even though this is one of the older casinos on the strip, it seems like they still put money into it and make frequent upgrades. I would like to see some electric vehicle charging stations instead of just "green vehicle" parking, but hopefully that will happen in the near future.

Came in to Vegas for the first time and I had to stay here because it's been a childhood dream of mine. First impression is that the hotel is HUGE!!! I got lost the first couple of days finding my way around here, this place has definitely made Vegas very very memorable and I cannot wait to return.

Just such a crappy hotel.  No other way to describe it.  The room felt like a comfort Inn and at least they give you amenities. Basic, a view of an alley and another building. Only in Vegas does a hotel feel like they need to do nothing for you, like they're doing me a favor just being here.  The wifi here is inappropriate, literally so slow my tablet and phone gave up.  Everything is a charge.  A fridge in your room $20 per night, etc, again with the zero amenities.  My key, i had to go to the front desk SIX TIMES to wait in CRAZY long lines to get it re magnetized, it was so frustrating. Half the times i went to my room, the key didn't work. And i'd have to trek down to the front desk, it was always a 30 mine process.  The 6 th time i told the front desk person, she was so rude.  She days what do you expect you can't let your key next to your cell phone or credit cards!  Where ate you supposed to keep your key if not your purse, wallet or pocket? She couldn't answer.  She said i don't know what to to tell you, the demagnetize.  Again, no other hotel had the problem.  I was here for 5 days, and was very ready to go home.  This hotel simply does not care about your quality of stay

This was our first visit to Caesars after staying mostly downtown and other places on the strip. I can say we were very disappointed. Don't believe the hype about this place. Though the room was reasonably priced, housekeeping made a horrible effort to clean the room. They didn't replace glasses, coffee, or pick up trash. The room service cart stayed outside our door in the hall for two days even though we asked for it to be removed. The Buffett was overpriced and it was extremely difficult to even find a waitress in the casinos. This place is very understaffed, with  very long lines at check in. We won't be returning.

I paid $215 to be mangled by my massage therapist!  I asked for a deep tissue massage and instead, I got bent, contorted in weird positions and a sore neck.  Basically,  I paid for my own torture!    I complained and was told to file a report with security.  I felt that it was taking it too far as I didn't want to get the therapist fired, I just thought they should have offered me another massage therapist who would give me a proper massage.  That did not happen.

The hotel overall is nice.  A bit confusing with it's layout, but ok.   The different towers are a hot mess, but it's clean and the air quality is good.      The machines are tight and I never saw anyone win.    But that seems to be prevalent in all of Las Vegas.    I've experienced better spa service for sure.  You should think for such a higher class establishment they would be more open to make the customer happy.  Not here.

Very nice atmosphere if you like walking around looking at casino and shops.

However, this place is way overpriced, with $10 cocktails.
IMO Caesars still holds up very well with all the ultra-posh, fancypants newer hotels and casinos.  A Vegas Classic!

Very disappointing stay. Paid $40 to upgrade the room to a better tower. Tried to get a cot. It seems that they have incompetent people working here because the guy couldn't get me a manager or successfully add the cot request in the computer AFTER waiting on hold for 30 mins. Took 3 hours and 4 phone calls to get the cot and almost 24 hours to get a manager to call me. It should never take 24 hours and 6 phone calls to get some customer service. Ultimately we got the cot for free, but the amount of time it took us to get it or the time waiting on hold we should of got the upgrade for free too. The manager said he couldn't do that...really. Ceasers learn some customer service.
One of the best places for Sports Book.  Plenty of cashiers and they are knowledgeable on every line.

This was perhaps my 10th stay at Caesars, and I'm never disappointed.  

I booked a regular room online, but upgraded to a suite at the desk.  I'm really pleased with spending the extra money, as I felt a little more like I was at home, and not in a hotel.  

Didn't need to use concierge or bell, but the associate at the desk was extremely accommodating.  A timely follow up voicemail was left, with contact info, in case I needed further assistance.

It was Super Bowl weekend, and I went to Pure on Saturday night.

What happened in Vegas........well, it ended up on Facebook!  :)

Came here for a CES 2017 business trip with my company and we hosted all our meetings in the Caesars Palace conference halls which are absolutely beautiful and easy to access in the Palace hall. 
Caesars offers many types of hotel towers and I recommend the Nobu hotel! The Nobu hotel is modern, luxurious and so exclusive! 
I stayed in the Julius tower as well, I highly recommend to avoid this tower. 
I stayed in the Nobu Hotel which is the hotel version of the Nobu Restaurant. 
If you stay at Nobu, you get access to their exclusive lounge and gym which is on their 62th floor. You also get access to certain pools which is pretty cool.
The service at the front desk is absolutely amazing and I highly recommend to stay at this hotel for your Vegas stay because it's in the smack middle of the strip.

Besides the hotel talk, I recommend trying the Bacchanal buffet which is one of the best on the strip and to visit the Omnia night club.
I am so lucky to have stayed here for my business trip and I cannot wait to come back! This hotel is a great place to host corporate meetings.

Great size and many things to do. The pools are exquisite, large, comfortable, and just provides a great atmosphere. Now checking in early they allowed us to go to our room. We get there and it was not cleaned yet so we went back down to the front desk and a man named Salvador was kind of unfriendly stating we shouldn't have gotten checked in anyway, which is not even our problem but he stated and said you can wait and we can text you when the room is ready and they will do an express clean so we can check in sooner than 4pm. So we dropped our luggage to the bell desk and did stuff on the strip. Never received a text, so we got back at 5:30 and the room was ready of course and as my friend was in line for checking to see if the room is ready, I wanted to get the luggage and the bell desk lady said I couldn't receive my bags unless I knew the room number or I can go outside to the valet and pick them up, even though their my luggage and I had the red tag. So once we got into the room we made them bring it up and luckily the bell boy Cam, he was beyond nice and friendly and saved Caesars customer service for me. The room itself is nice with a pool view and a nice Jack and Jill sink and two people bathtub and a very large comfortable bed.

Always Amazing 

I do enjoy this hotel every time more and more

Free Upgrade? Yes, please

Excellent service

Fast check in\/out

We stayed at The Octavious tower

Very clean

Comfy beds 

Music everywhere 

Chocolates 

Spacious room

Really good restaurants ( more than 15)

Security  everywhere 

Close to everything 

So much to see and enjoy here 

Will definitely recommend it :)

When my friend told us we had a free room at Caesars Palace, we were excited to finally stay here. 

We arrived at 3am, checked in and told us they were out of double beds. Single beds were the only thing available, they told us they will give us another room the next day with the double bed..... but for our trouble they will upgrade us to a deluxe room and will send us a roller-bed. 

Room was tiny and you just cannot compare with Venetian or Palazzo. BUT its understandable knowing the fact that Ceasars is an older hotel than the two. But i guess we were just spoiled by Palazzo with their awesome room.... 

It was 5am, roller-bed still haven't arrive. Called the front desk and they told us our ticket request is still in progress. ARE YOU KIDDING ME!!!! We all fell asleep and woke up.......and guess what, roller-bed still not here!!! 

We went to the Palace Station and ate at the Oyster Bar..... Highly recommended to go and try it there, everything is so flavorful and yummy. Its our tradition to eat there everytime we are at vegas..... 

When we try to valet our car back at Ceasars, they told us since the lot is full and we r not a diamond or seven member, we had to go to the Colosseum valet to park our car.....whateva..... 

Went back to the room and called the front desk about our doublebed. Long story short, no doublebed room, no notes on our account about changing room.......if i want to talk to a manager, I had to come downstair and ask for them.... ARE YOU F*@&ing kidding me!!! What kind of service are they providing????? After I hung up on them, 2 minutes later......knock knock........rollerbed is here!!! After 15 f***ing hrs later. So bull@%*& 

We were ready to head home the next day, so we packed our bags and headed to the valet. When we walked out......our car was parked on the curb and it said valet was closed. We saw an employee and told them that was our car......they told us we parked at the wrong valet and there is a $20 fee for leaving the car overnite.... ARE YOU F*@&ing kidding me!!! 

Ceasars, we r not ever ever stayin at your place again, even if the room was free....It was a horrible experience. Your service to us was outrageous. So disappointing, I have no comment for you!!

This hotel is beautiful no doubt. It's filled with shopping centers, Starbucks, casinos, buffets, Omnia Night club, lounges--everything you name it!

Check in is made really easy, you can also use their self-serve machine to make things go faster. Check out was also easy, but we had to wait in line for about an hour as others were having various issues with charges and such. 

The room we had was on the 22 floor, facing the pool, and it was gorgeous! The bathroom consisted of a shower, a hot tube, and was the size of a room itself! Super elegant, and newly remodeled. 

The only issue I had with this hotel is when we first arrived to our room it wasn't clean. The trash cans were full, and there was random wrappers and napkins around the floor. The beds and bathrooms were cleaned and made, but the remaining trash was a little frustrating. We called the front desk and they apologized. They gave us the option of getting a new room or having the cleaning services come clean our room within 5 minutes. We opted for the later, since we truly enjoyed our view. Downside, it took until the next morning to have someone come clean it which was really annoying.

Also, there is a fridge in the room that is stocked with a bunch of beverages and snacks. It's all sensor detected, so if you remove an item and put it back, it'll still charge you upon checkout. You can appeal the charge, but it's just a hassle. I wish they made bigger signs that mentioned that, rather than super fine print.

Overall, it was a great experience. I'd definitely come back and stay here.

Caesars Palace is a great place to escape, stay, eat, shop, drink, dance, and hang with family & friends! Their suites are very nice & roomy, plenty to eat & shop @ the Forum shops, dance & party @ Pure! It's a great palace trust me!!!!

Caesars Palace is a dump that needs to be demolished. The entire compound is dated, stale, and is in serious need of a remodel. The rooms were dirty and the showers were moldy. The bed was not comfortable and the linens seemed past their prime. The towels in the bathroom were like sandpaper, and white towels should not have stains on them. The sinks didn't drain and I needed to call the front desk to have them unclogged. This place might have been the place to be 10 years ago but no more.

You can't go to Vegas without strolling through (and leaving your money at) Caesar's. It's pretty much the ultimate Vegas hotel. Great, spread out casino floor, mediocre food court, but the Forum shops are awesome! Cheap stores, expensive stores, they have it all. And make sure you stop at Fat Tuesdays when you've lost too much money, their High Octane yard long drink will make you forget just about everything. Can be kind of embarrassing, but oh well. Make sure you don't make the same mistake that I did. Limit yourself to 1 yard long drink a day, for your health. Seriously. 

The regular rooms are decent. I've never seen a suite but one of these days I hope I'll get comped one!

Stayed at the ghetto Imperial Palace across the street since we're all cheap college students. We made this our second home as we tried our best to spend the least amount of time possible at Imperial Palace. 

The hotel staff was very accommodating. We were there so much, they often mistakened us for their guests. The man in charge of the casino floor gave my friends a tour and offered suggestions on where we can gamble on a budget. They have an awesome sports betting section with a billion tv screens and lounge chairs. I enjoyed gambling at the Wheel of Fortune table. The dealer was hilarious. Cocktails provided were better than drinks I've had in all the bars and clubs I've been to. 

No complaints. I'd want to stay here in the future.

Great place to shop and walk around. Lots of things to do.

Remember to catch the Mythology Fire Show.

So some friends and I stayed at Caesars Palace in February, of course the reviews had me hesitant. I'll start by saying I'm so happy we stayed here. We stayed in the Octavius tower which is one of the newer towers. 

To start from the moment I checked in the level service was great! The lady who checked me in was extremely nice and personable she asked what clubs I wanted to go to I told her. As she handed me the keys to the room she also gave me passes to a few clubs for friends and I. 

Once checked in I must say it was a pretty long walk to the room, but well worth it. The room was spacious and the beds were so comfortable! I mean I didn't want to get out of the bed. My friends arrived later as I flew and they drove. My friends soon arrived with a bell hop in tow. The bell hop offered to get ice for our room and anything else needed. 

Overall the hotel was large, room was great and the level of service was exceptional. If you're looking for a great hotel with plenty of entertainment and great customer service Caesers Palace is it.

Just came here for Spago by Wolfgang Puck and for Shania. Both were wonderful. Staff was very helpful and the casino was rather spacious and huge. I saw a lot of bros and douchebags... not sure what else to say about that.

After all the years of coming to Vegas and for one reason or another ending up at Caesars, we finally just decided to stay here.  Caesars is kind of the center of the Vegas universe.  They get big names at the Colosseum (ok, Celine Dion and Shania Twain, doesn't thrill me, but they seem to pack them in), they have the forum shops (high end mall), a high end spa (Qua), top notch restaurants  and I suppose you can gamble here too :)  Caesars is the kind of place you can walk in one day and not leave until 3 days later.  That is good and bad.  It has it all, but it is also incredibly large, with a complex floor plan and it takes a lot of hoofing it to get from one end to the other.  

Now, one of the reasons we picked Caesars this time is they didn't have resort fees.  I, like everyone else, detest the useless resort fees that Vegas has begun shoving down our throats.  Caesars didn't used to charge them, however I heard as of 3\/1\/13 they will be charging away - so be forewarned!  

We had planned to do the spa and had heard the Augustus Tower was the the newer of the buildings and the spa is in the same tower so we thought we were being smart by booking a deluxe room there. Plus it has it's own check in desk so you don't have to wait in those long lines at the main reception area.  At any rate, they decided to upgrade us (yay!), however we got put in the Palace Tower.  Now we had the single nicest room I have ever stayed at in Vegas, but the PT is SO far from everything I wished I had brought more comfy shoes.  

The Palace Tower suite (2802) we got was on one of the Penthouse floors. The bank of elevators were way out of the way so they weren't busy and you had added security of needing a key to get to the floor.  The suite itself had 3 full bathrooms w\/tvs (which was totally excessive), wet bar, desk, sitting area with TV, dining room, a bed room with a King size bed, a couple of arm chairs, another TV and then of course the double closets, jacuzzi spa and 2 person shower.  It was insane!  I mean, incredibly nice! The only complaint (other than the walk) was that there was zero view.  We basically could see other Caesars Towers (this isn't that big of a deal though).  

I would definitely stay at Caesars again. It has it all!

If I could give 0 star I would've give but 1 is the lowest I can. They've the worst customer service and their management is sooo worst must be the far worst in Las Vegas strip. I had the worst experience at their hotel service last month. I checked in late midnight and the front desk clerk name Courtney gave room keys that didn't work. I had to call the security to open my room and for that I've had waited more than 2 hours to get inside the room. I was exhausted and extremely tired. Then the wifi in the room didn't worked, so I called the desk. They wasted another 2 hours and still I wasn't able to log in. Then 5 in the morning I went back to the desk to get new room keys and report about wifi. I spoke to the hotel manager about Courtney how rude she was and gave me a room key that didn't worked. Hotel manager doesn't seem like to help much except apology. Really you made me wait 2 plus hours just to get into the room and another 2-3 Hours to fix that issue and still my wifi didn't work? Oh my gosh! They're racist, disrespectful, discriminative and 0 customer level experience. I would not recommend anyone wasting their money & valuable time staying at their hotel service at all. The strips has more best rated customer care hotels where you can spend. Soon will report them to Vegas consumer\/ business bureau.

Holy crap this hotel is HUGE?! How many towers of rooms do they have?!

I've been to Vegas soo many times and I have never once stay here. I FINALLY had the opportunity to stay here and it was pretty nice, however, I feel that it's not worth the price. You could stay at just as nice or nicer hotel for a cheaper or the same rate, respectively.

FYI, They charge for every little thing. For example, it cost $1.50 for them to transfer a call from our room to Serendipity!

Because Caesars has been around forever, some of their rooms need some remodeling and need to fix their showers, specifically have hot water.

With so many choices in hotels on the strip, I would have thought Caesars Palace would have been one of the better ones but I was pretty disappointed. 

The hallway to our room on the 69th floor had some water dripping from the ceiling, the hotel jimmy rigged it with a plastic tube that drained the leak into a plastic bucket and they had a fan blowing air towards our room probably to dry the carpet. The hallway smelled like an old moldy cabin. 

When we get into our room a couple doors down away from the whole mess outside, we start noticing the smell creep into our room as well. So we decide to call front desk and asked for a room change. 
I was pretty disappointed at how they handled it after that. They put me on hold for about 15 minutes. Then they asked me to leave the room immediately and told me the other room would be available after an hour or so. I asked if we could just wait in the current room while they prep the other cause we were really tired but they said no and told us we can bring our stuff to the bell desk and wait there until we get a text saying the room was ready. 
 We take what seemed like the longest trek ever down to the bell desk, checked our bags in and after 30 minutes waiting around I got fed up and got in line to ask the front desk if the room was ready and found out it was. I'm so glad I took initiative to ask because who knows if they would have ever texted me. After all this, we find that our room has been downgraded from being on the highest floor (69th) to the bottom floor (51st) of the forum tower. our view went from a corner view of the strip to a view of side walls of the building. Now a floor change might not seem like a big deal to most but man, I just felt like send up a stein of beer for all my troubles or something at the very least but nope. Nothing. I hope I never have to stay here again.
The pools are beautiful and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is huge with giant statues everywhere.

This is a very generous 3. 

We stayed at the Augustus Tower a few years ago and it was great. Magnificent room and view of the pool. 

This time we decided to give the Octavious Tower a try. We had 4 rooms four out group. Street view and not quite as nice of rooms. We arrived at about 1.30pm and the rooms were ready. Like all hotels, on the day of check in if your room is ready before the stated time of the reservation, in this case, 4pm, they give you your keys a couple of hours early. But here's the twist. Cesar's had found a new way to squeeze every possible cent out of its customers. They now charge $30 if you want to check in an hour or two before 4pm. 

The rooms have very few amenities that 5 star hotels usually offer. No bathrobes, just basic shampoo and lotion. Definitely no mouthwash, etc. 

There is also no soundproofing. You can hear every word the strangers in the room next door are saying in normal conversation.And of course, you hear their TV. 

The Buffet is good but the most expensive on the Strip at $60 per person.  And if you want coffee from the Starbucks downstairs expect to pay about $6 for a tall and 50c for a cup of ice water (tall) that is free and whatever size you want at any other Starbucks not in Cesar's.

So hubby had never been to Vegas, and I was there once, back in the 90s. We went, and wow, what a place! Caesar's  was overwhelming at first, HUGE, busy, thought I would hate it.  Checked in, found the room, which was large, immaculately clean, and nice. TV embedded in bathroom mirror and phone in bagno. LOL! Lots of great restaurant options (food court, Mesa Grill, Hell's Kitchen, Beijing Noodle, Cafe Americano, buffet, etc.), car rental for our day trips, and shopping options (Forum Shops with lots of upscale offerings, Appian Way, etc.) without leaving the facility. Great shows (Celine Dion) and casinos. Once the shock wore off, we both liked it, and I would stay at Caesar's again.

Terrible check in experience. Suzanne at the front area was playing favorites on who she led where. Took 45 min standing in line just to get up there and have them spend most of the time trying to sell up grades.  I called the hotel and asked for a front desk manager. I was promptly told the managers do not take calls but would call or email me. It's been 3 days. No call. No email. 

Gave a star only because valet saved the day and were very pleasant.
I've stayed here twice and I don't have much to complain about. I liked my rooms, I ate lots of good food, great shopping, and I loved all the tubs in the spa.

This is a true 3.5 considering it is in Vegas. If it was not a Vegas hotel it would be a solid 5 stars but given the newer hotels that have gone up in Vegas, the competition is stiff. Caesars is an older spot that lacks some of the decor and nightlife that the other spots have to offer. Caesars caters to an older crowd nowadays, which I can understand because for those who were frequenting vegas 15 years ago, CP was the place to stay. But don't worry, for the young folk there is plenty to do. 

Caesars is a great place to stay if you get an upgraded room. The standard rooms are just any standard hotel room but the upgraded rooms are nice and comfy with a spacious bathroom, vanity, and jacuzzi. Comfy, clean, and spacious. Wi-Fi is not included. 

The lago buffet has been replaced by bachannal, which is supposedly one of the best buffets in vegas right now. Although my favorite places to stay in vegas are the palazzo and the wynn\/encore, Caesars is a great place to stay if you dont mind being away from the hot night life spots. There are the forum shops (which I LOVE), many lounges, great restaurant options, and of course the best spa in vegas QUA (45$ day pass). They also have a nice pool which is heated to 86 degrees in the winter. The casino is not my favorite but it has every slot\/table you would expect. They have a Pussycat lounge blackjack table area with live girls dancing. It is an awkward setting but definitely entertaining. The nightlife here is definitely not trendy or the hot place to be right now. They have many lounges and their big club is Pure, which has definitely fallen off.

Ok yes, I was suckered in by The Hangover! It looked so cool in the movie! Also the idea of lounging poolside at various pools lured me. My boyfriend and two other friends planned a couples trip for boyfriend's birthday July 5th-7th. Since we'd be staying there during the week as opposed to a weekend, I thought we'd be able to get a good room for a decent rate. We booked the Pure Package and I think we paid about $350 for two nights. The package came with 2 VIP passes to Pure, and entrance to the Fitness Center and Qua Bath Spa (which I highly recommend). I know the VIP doesn't really mean shit but I couldn't prove it because we went to Pure on a Tuesday night, so there was no line anyway. 

We booked a room in the Augustus tower which is one of the nicer towers. It was great! My favorite part was the bathroom. First of all, it's huge. You can re-enact scenes from Step It Up in there, take a bath and a shower at once since there is a separate bathtub, and the best part...watch tv! We had a nice view of the strip and Bellagio fountain show. The bed was comfortable. I recommend staying in this tower because it's closest to the check-in and entrance however, it's a bit of a walk to the pool.

The main pool was nice. I'm a little bummed that I didn't get to explore the other pools but the heat was tiring and once I found a spot to lay on, I didn't want to move. There's a cocktail waitress to serve you or you can go to the bar and order there which also has food. Nothing like drinking a margarita and eating fried food under a 103 degree sun in your bikini.

I didn't get to eat in any of the restaurants but I did see Shaq eating at Munchbar! It is nice having the shops downstairs and the location on the strip is somewhere in the middle. Minus a star because check-in took way too damn long.

Everything was going ok until checked in. The Tv's in all the guest rooms were not working. For what we paid this should not be happening. When we called to complain multiple times the customer service was rude and suggested we go down to the bar. That is something Motel 6 would pull. Lots of other upset customers this weekend.

Caesars palace is a cool spot with a fantastic location right in the center of the Las Vegas strip. This place is freaking historic and reigned as one of the top hotels in Vegas for quite sometime... Unfortunately, Caesars has hit a bit of a dry spell, especially as newer more modern casinos have hit the strip. The rooms here are nice, but not always spectacular, the amenities leave a bit to be desired and the casino is still a bit difficult to navigate and there isn't enough table game (craps, etc...) Regardless, I have had a great time over the last several years at Caesars and I believe with Omnia now open and some of the new restaurants coming in that this place will gain back its relevance. 

Pros-
Historical context
Omnia
Restaurants 
Augustus tower
Nobu restaurant and hotel 
Sports book
Poker room

Cons-
Rooms 
Service
Table games 
Cocktail servers

This review is for the Pussycat dolls pit by Pure.  It was $15 min bet for blackjack.  You can only double down on 10 and 11 and blackjacks only pay 6:5, not 3:2.  There is no surrender either.  However the dealers are fun and make it worth your while.

This review is strictly for the casino, not the hotel. On the surface, I think the casino and hotel look nice, in a gaudy way. It's almost too over the top, and that's saying much for a casino on the Strip.

Pros:
- I think they have the best buffet on the Strip: Bacchanal Buffet. On top of that, their other restaurants are quite good. 

Cons:
- The parking is a pain. The parking lot structure seems pretty far from the actual casino entrance, so it can be difficult to navigate. I can't imagine doing it when it's actually 100°+. Also, much like other casinos nowadays, they charge for parking. It's so annoying.

- Since the place is enormous, it was rather easy to get lost. Their signs, as well as some of their employees aren't helpful at all. I had to circle back and forth to find the restaurant I was looking for. 

- I'm not much of a fan of the tables here, I find the dealers to be quite snobby. 

In closing, I only recommend stopping here for the food only, otherwise you will regret it.

Terrible service all over, starting from valet parking. As soon as you're getting into the building the staff gives you only their attitude, seems like you owe them some money that you have no idea about. We paid for the suite type of room and they gave us a standard one just because our room was not ready at 3:30 pm stating that the check in time is 6pm. And we never even got at least apologies for their non professional service. Staff of the concierge service can't even answer the question in English so you can understand them. Will never ever go back to that hotel!

centrally located on the strip, this is the original of the "super nice" hotels, IMO.  i used to come here all the time with my uncle who would only stay here...many times before i even turned 21.  man...that lobby area hasn't changed a bit.  

alright, here's what i got out of my two-night stay:
- palace tower = it costs more, but the amenities are the same, except with a more modern decor and the flat screen.  (although they may have put the flat screens in the older rooms too...who knows.)  my favorite thing about this tower is the hotel pool is in this tower right by the elevator.
- poolside = nice area with two large pools.  but closes at 6pm.  hello?  what is the point of that?  the sun hadn't even set yet!  and vegas is full of drunkards and people w\/out poolside etiquette.  this means towels and trash left all over the place.  open chairs were hard to find.  they had 1 waitress for each side of the pool.  there were at least 60 people on each side.  needless to say, the food\/beverage service sucked.  
- valets = very courteous.
- beds = really comfy.  a standard room with two queen beds fit 4 girls pretty well.

we had the goverment discount rate, so i have no idea what the regular price is.  i don't stay on the strip often enough to have a "favorite hotel", so that's about it.  i'd give the poolside a 2, so averaging with my 4 overall is the main reason for the 3 star review.  

review for the spa and the bradley ogden restaurant to come later.

Stayed here for 50$ thanks to comps!! Would have been 300!

Super nice hotel for 50 for me and my boyfriend!! Super big for us both too!! I think we stayed in the Augustus tower

I was able to stay at Caesars Palace for three complimentary nights.

Caesars Palace is humongous and absolutely gorgeous.  I have passed through Caesars Palace and have eaten at multiple restaurants that are located inside of this hotel & casino, but to actually have a room there was really nice!  It was easy access to the Forum shop, multiple great restaurants (Guy Savoy, Nobu, Mesa Grill), and the pools that they have is pretty awesome!

My bf and I had great service from start to finish while staying at Caesars Palace.  We arrived early and attempted to check in and was told that our room was not ready yet.  The guy at the front desk was so helpful and really nice.  He said that he'll rush a room for us and took down my number so that I'll be texted when the room was ready.  He then offered my bf and I bottled waters.  When I asked him about the swimming pools, he gave me a key just so I could go and check the pools out.  He also gave me a map of the pools and told me the ones that he recommended.  He told me that there are 7 pools even though on the site, it says 8 pools.  Literally within 15 minutes, I received a text stating that the room was ready.  We were placed in the Forum tower and our luggage were brought up to us within minutes.

The room itself was spacious with a lot of mirrors everywhere, a shower that had a bench and a rain shower head, and controls on the wall that open and close the drapes.  They didn't have any of those signs that you hang on your doorknob for privacy.  Instead, there were controls and buttons near the door for you to push on to request cleaning service or privacy.  I thought that was pretty cool!  The only downside to the room is that they did not have any plug-ins to charge your phone right at the bedside.  I had to unplug the lamp in order to plug my charger in right behind the bedside table.  The bed was also fairly comfortable and the pillows were very fluffy. 

As for the swimming pools, honestly, it was kind of breathtaking, and crazy to know that they had 7 pools there.  The pools are 3-4 feet deep and there is one that has blackjack card dealers in the middle so that you can continue to gamble while hanging out in the pool.  There is a topless pool that is located elsewhere.  There are also deck chairs that are sometimes hard to come by depending on how busy it is.  There are daybeds and cabanas with TVs inside, but with those, you would have to pay to reserve.

Overall, Caesars Palace was a great place to stay on the strip!  For our trip, we didn't really have to leave the hotel\/casino too often because everything that we needed was all right there.  I'm not sure how much it would cost to stay there, but if you can afford it, it is definitely one of the most beautiful hotels to stay at in Vegas besides the Venetian.
Terrible experience in trying to cash my chips before leaving.  Only one cashier for regular folks.  Had to wait 40 minutes on line!!  Never going back.

I have stayed in better properties in LV.  The game selection is lacking, room service prices are expensive even by Vegas standards. The worst part was at checkout when they hit us with sneaky internet charges, at no time was it stated that you may only connect 2 devices on their WIFI unless you want to pay more, not at check-in when I made sure the internet charges were covered by the resort fee, or when I called down after arriving at the room when I had a brief connectivity issue, they also try to sell you different speed with extra charges, who do they think they are? an ISP? 

I tried to get an explanation about these charges from the front desk manager, he just said I should have read the terms of service and walked away!  Great client relations there!   

They wound up backing out the $4.99 charge but 3 $13.99 charges remain with no explanation as to what they are for. I thought this was covered under the daily resort fee $32.50    When I called the customer service number they were useless as well. 

In all my times to Vegas, I have never experienced such terrible service and shady charges.  I will never stay here again.  I will go back to where they treat me right, anywhere that isnt here.

Security broke into my room at 2:30am because they double booked my room! Didn't knock or think to call the room?! When they were tampering with my door I thought it was the room next to me. Than they ask for my ID as if I'm some sort of criminal, I even have to ask the security guards to excuse me so I can get dressed!! Absolutely unacceptable!

Did I mention that when I got to my room the cleaning lady was still cleaning it. Of course I called the front desk to speak with a Supervisor and they bounced me back and forth between Caesars and the Flamingo, it took 10 minutes to get someone on the phone! This leads me to believe that they don't hear about most of their guest concerns. This hotel is obviously mismanaged and disorganized.

Needless to say, I will never come back & I suggest that you don't run the risk of having your vacation or getaway destroyed by this place.

In my opinion this is still the Best Hotel in Las Vegas. I just spent three wonderful nights and had a blast! Dining at Rao's was Fantastic! My room was sparkling clean and the housekeeping staff did everything with a smile. The entire hotel is very well kept. Even that it is now pet friendly, which is something I still don't understand why taking an animal on vacation is a good thing, that just my opinion. There is so much to do there you really don't need to go any where else! I loved it. I had planned on going to the pool for just a few hours before hitting the strip and before I knew it I had spent just about most of the day there. It was just beautiful! It  was extremely hot and the waitress staff were happy just to get you a large cup of ice water and they had life guards walking around giving offering everyone ice pops. I'm going back to Las Vegas in a couple of years and Caesars Palace is the only hotel I'm staying at. PS: lock up your belongings if you stay anywhere else, I was on the plane home with a passenger that has his Rolex watch stolen out of his hotel room. I won't say the exact name of the hotel but its one of the new ones and it starts with a "W". See you soon!! Viva Las Vegas!! Love YOU!!

The waitresses who walk the casino floor are so rude! They take FOREVER to get to you so pretty much your entire gambling experience has to be while you're sober unless you grab a drink from somewhere else. I had to flag them down, and each one kept saying (all in rude ways): "I'm not your waitress. I guess I'll send yours over." and then they would forget all about it. Just gamble somewhere else if you actually want service while you do.

Horrible horrible horrible!!! Stayed here for a few days and they ended up putting me in a room during construction. When I arrived everything seemed great however a day after my stay the construction started.  Now if your all about customer satisfaction and wanting to bring the customer back to your establishment why would you put your customers through obnoxious construction noises to the point that they are going crazy!!! I have been to Vegas many times however my first time at Caesar's Palace and let me tell you it will be my last time.  Absolutely ridiculous Caesar Palace management you and your staff need to do a better job when putting your clients in a room.  Especially when your going to have major construction going on!!!

Pools are ok.  Rooms are ok too.  The early checkin fee is ridiculous.  I had never been charged an early checkin fee anywhere in Vegas.  Also parking is
Not free. The location of the hotel is really good.

Quick run down...

Octavius (newest)
Augustus (DIRECT VIEW of BELLAGIO fountain - very nice)
Palace\/Forum (ehhh)
Roman (AVOID)

Caesar's Palace is almost 5 different hotels because depending on which tower you stay in, it'll totally make or break your experience.  With that being said, I have also ranked them from best to worst. Be wary if you book on travel sites such as Expedia because the "LOW" price...what you will get is the "ancient" aka OUTDATED Roman tower rooms.

For the true experience, try getting the Octavius or Augustus tower rooms. The rooms are right by the lobby and only a short elevator ride to the pool. Our Augustus deluxe king room was SUPER spacious and had a nice bathroom with his\/her sinks, separate soaking tub and a huge shower. We also got a nice view of the Bellagio fountains.

It's one of the TRUE resort hotels in Las Vegas. One of the best pools, had tons of dining options, Omnia Nightclub, Bacchanal Buffet, and the Forum Shops...the property sprawls the Strip. Even from the boulevard, walking on the Strip...it can take up to 15 minutes to clear it. 

As one of the mainstays in Las Vegas, the pricing here isn't cheap. It may not be as expensive as the Cosmo or Wynn\/Encore but it's definitely up there. For any discounts, be sure to sign up for their Total Rewards cards...even as a gold member, they will send you discounts and offers.

Speaking of their Player's Cards...they definitely cater toward their Diamond and 7 Star level players here at Caesar's. Priority check-in, line cuts, premium this..premium that...yadada...even the main valet is only open for diamond\/7 star players when it's busy. Caesar's Palace is one of the high end properties within the Total Rewards program, so it'll take care of it's players. I also like how the Diamond Lounge is right by the Octavius\/Augustus Towers and not hidden in the casino like other ones.

For some classic Vegas history with modern day luxury...I would definitely recommend it. 4 stars because you can definitely find a better deal, but hey it's Vegas and it's okay to splurge!
Just tried to check in to @Caesars in @LasVegas. They now charge $35 to check in early (before 4-6pm).  One more reason #CaesarsPalaceSucks.

Stayed here in Aug 2014 and loved it. 

1- the pool is awesome
2- parking is huge, plentiful, and free
3- rooms are nice, not super fancy but nice
4- location is excellent 
5- check in and check out is easy as can be
6- service is excellent 

I'll stay here again and again

Staying at Caesars for the first time, after always wanting to stay here but always finding better deals elsewhere. For reference, I have stayed at a lot of the other casinos on the strip: Mandalay Bay, MGM Grand, Planet Hollywood, Paris, Palazzo, etc. Hubby and I are here for 20th wedding anniversary and hubby's birthday. We come to Vegas 2-4 times per year so we are regulars and pretty much know what to expect. 

Our room at Caesar' is a "Palace Tower" deluxe king. The issues:

*Upon arrival at front of hotel, there is no offer to take our bags up for us, we cannot find anyone to help us. We take our bags up ourselves.

*The Palace Tower is located deep into the property with unclear signage and when we find someone to show us the pathway, the pathway has numerous stairs with no ramps available. We have to struggle pulling\/pushing our luggage down the stairs. Apparently there is another path with ramps but it is the "long" way according to the employee. Is this legal with ADA requirements? 

*Our mattress hands down is one of the most uncomfortable hotel mattresses I've ever experienced. I have had way better mattresses at far smaller and modest casinos. The mattress "plush top" is smashed flat with no comfort provided at all. I call the front desk to see if there is a comparably priced room that we can be moved to due to the location of the Palace tower and the condition of the mattress and I am told that there are no rooms available. I ask if we can pay to upgrade and the attendant says no, they are completely booked (on a Thursday night in the middle of February? whatever). I then ask if we are on the hook for the remaining two nights if I would like to relocate to another casino and the front desk attendant says she doesn't know I have to call the reservations department. No offer to assist or find out. 

* We are trying to sleep in a bit after a late night and at about 9:00 am there is constant loud drilling\/construction noise audible from our hotel room. I guess no sleeping in. 

Needless to say completely disappointed and will not likely stay here again.

Soooo disapointing! Sooooo overpriced for what you get... And as already mentioned by many other yelpers, the resort fee is a nonsense... The front desk is a long wait, the frontdesk lady is not accomodating, nobody proposed to take care of our luggage, the room in the forum tower was just renovated but small and way way overpriced compared to other hotels like the wynn, venetian, aria! We had a problem of trace of blood on the toilet door, and the 2 managers we talked to were unpleasant and inefficient.
We don't recommend this hotel. Better options are available for the same price range. The only positive point is of course the location... That is the reason for the 2 stars rating...

I can't believe I would give a one star to a such famous 5 star (or is it 4.5 stars?) hotel. Here are many things that went wrong or being unpleasant.

-  Check in process.  The clerk at check in desk kept trying to sell for upgrade or an early check-in for a fee.  
- Check-in time.  Not sure if this was standard for other hotels on the strip, but Caesars has a check-in time at 4pm.  I expected it to be 1pm or 2 at the latest, but 4pm is way too long of waiting.
- The room is small and old.  Nothing fancy.  It feels like one of those 3 stars hotels elsewhere. 
- Shower is half working and operate at a weird way. 
- No body wash.
- The electric outlet at the bathroom is not working.  Have to use the dryer at the working desk for the mirror.
- No refrigerator in room.  Nor any coffee machine or bottle of water.  Really, almost nothing.
- Trying to cash one of the tickets at the cashier, and found a long line, but only one window is for all guest whereas other windows are for some types of premium members, and even that window has no one attending.  Really? 
- Relatively expensive comparing to other hotels in general.
- $32 resort fee daily. 

The only thing that's good with caesar is its buffet.  I guess if you are some type of honored guests or top premium members, you might be treated nicely with much better room, or whatever, but if you are just an average gambler coming, forget it.

Las Vegas is always a great place to go on vacation. Having Caesars Palace as one of it's prime hotels gives it so much value. You'll see why in a few.

It is definitely easy to get lost in this hotel and casino. From the parking garage, to the food court, Forum Shops, Serendipity, Bacchanal buffet, Colosseum theater, conference rooms, pools, and the new nightclub Omnia, Caesars offers everything a guest could need.

For a quick run down if this is your first time:
The parking garage could use a little work. It is always so crowded and makes it hard to find parking. The food court offers the typical Italian, sandwiches, burgers, Asian, and Mexican foods with plenty of dining room. The Forum Shops is like an indoor mall that can be accessed through the casino from where the parking garage elevators are. It has many top brand and unique shops... even a fish tank on one end. Serendipity is a restaurant located just outside of Caesars on the strip. Definitely check it out if you're starving and don't worry about the time of day; they have any kind of food, breakfast lunch and\/or di..ESSERT! Bacchanal is an upscale buffet (I'll have a review on it's own later). The Colosseum is where you can catch shows at night of performers like Celine Dion (now Mariah Carey). The conference rooms are huge and good for any event. The pools are definitely worth a visit for all the Roman architectures. Lastly, the day\/nightclub Omnia as I heard is a huge party. I can't say much for because I haven't visited yet.

The hotel rooms are all nice, no matter which tier you're in. Of course the bigger the better, right? Enjoy your stay!

It's amazing how much Vegas has changed in just a few years. In relative terms, Las Vegas used to be a "decent buy"...if you didn't go crazy gambling, you could find decent hotel, restaurant and show prices. They used to want to encourage you to come so that you would spend your money at the gaming tables. Now they take every opportunity to gouge you.

We were 1 1\/2 hrs early for check-in...we arrived at 3 pm...not eggregiously early. We were told that it would be $30 extra to check in early. Also, and I am having trouble remembering the long list of extras...$30 per night for an extra person in our room (our four year old daughter), $30 per night for a rollaway bed, $25 per night for a refrigerator. When we checked out, we also discovered that the resort fee of $30 a night was not included in our rate...therefore, we were charged $15 a night for internet!

We were offered a "bargain upgrade" to a suite for an additional $200 a night. If we took this, the other fees would magically go away. Well, we had just flown in and had gotten up at 2am, so we were basically zombies at this point. We agreed to be "upgraded". Unfortunately, this meant giving up our room in the nice Augustus tower for the suite in the Forum tower. This turned out to be pretty old and decrepit...the renovations amounted to little more than slapping lipstick on a pig. Our suite was huge, but pretty sparsely furnished. Wallpaper was peeling from the walls, the AC unit in the ceiling was dripping condensation onto our table, and it really felt kind of depressing. For half of our stay, we couldn't even get robes and slippers...I had called down to customer service and they CLAIMED that they did not provide such amenities. Bullshit. On my fourth try, I finally got someone who cheerfully sent them up. WTF????

Caesars seems to be one of the "in" places of the moment, and there is a lot to like. But these things really piss me off. Next year, we have another conference here...I will be sure not to make the same rookie mistakes in the future.

Got comp for 3 days staying at the Augustus King suite, their rooms is more modern and updated. Only thing that bugs me is that their slot machines is way too tight and stingy they wouldn't pay out. Also had their buffet tonight the food & service went downhill. 

Beef Sliders 2\/5 it use to be Wagyu, now it's flavorless and dry. 

Sausage 2\/5 it was dry 

Sushi 2\/5 it use to be good when they first opened and now they're following Wynn's foot step being poor quality

Fried rice 2\/5 it use to be good with soft rice and right now it's more like hard sticky rice

Beef and broccoli stir fry 2\/5 a little bit salty and the cube beef is very hard to chew. 

Service 2\/5 each time this week going to the buffet, I had to flag down the servers to refilled my drink. 

Slots 1\/5 put $300 in playing 50 dragons deluxe penny machine and not even one bonus spin.

Augustus King Suite 3\/5 Nice updated room & awesome big HD tv with HD channels, comfortable bed. There was an unknown stain on the bath room door and there were a few pieces of long hairs on the bath room floor and I don't have any guest with me. Also watch out getting in the tub there was a lot of small little hairs from unknow parts yuck! If I was going to Las Vegas again I'd would rather spend my money over to the Wynn where they got nicer rooms without the questionable hairs also happier car attendants.

best buffet !
nice room luxury room
snow crab
steak
stone pizza

I have a love hate relationship with Caesars, but it's size and what it offers is magnificent. My first stay they upgraded me to a view room from a recently renovated Forum Tower room. Cool, right? Yea! Except when I got to the room there was no view. It was also extremely dated and smelled horribly of cigarette smoke. I asked for my old room back and it wasn't available anymore. The turn around time for all this was only 20-30min. So needless to say it didn't set a positive tone for my experience. Nonetheless, I've still had other positive experiences at Caesars so it remains a Gemini in my life. I love the restaurant "Trevi" though. Reminds me of when I was in Italy.

Don't remember playing too much here, as we came by Caesar's Palace around 4 in the morning one night however I do remember how beautful everything was! and DANG this place is huge. I wish we would of spent some more time here, but with only a week and so much to do, we had to run around as much as possible. 

I will definitely return and may even consider staying at Caesar's as it's location on the Vegas strip is smack dap in the middle!


All I have to say is, who let the dogs out!

Least accommodating hotel I've ever stayed at. Came here for a conference and got a group discount rate on two nights stay. Extended the trip a third night at same rate, okay no problem. When I found out my organization would cover the first two nights, I called to cancel the first two but keep the third, they doubled the price of the third night! You guys already gave me the third night for the group rate, why charge me regular rate when you clearly have me group rate just a few days prior??? 

Pool closes at 6pm, very inconvenient.

Cleaning lady came in at 9:30am to kick us out. What if we were very tired or had to sleep in from the night before? Totally disrespectful. 

Check in is at 4pm. I'm sorry, but if you have cleaning ladies barging in at 9:30am I'm sure you can get the rooms cleaned well before that. Was very inconvenient for us.

Never staying here again.

So almost a year ago I contacted Caesars Entertainment, after giving up on their customer service responding to the issues I had, I told then to remove me from all systems, marketing lists etc. 

A couple weeks ago, after booking a trip at non-caesar properties I get a call offering me free night at a caesars property. Explained to the guy that I requested to NEVER be contact by them again. He apologized and continued to offer me 3 free nights. Told him I had no interest and that they would need to make me a crazy offer to continue setting foot on their property again. I also explained free nights meant nothing as I can stay anywhere I want for free whenever I want. He said he would talk to his boss.

The next day I check my email and low and behold I have 7 days booked at Plant Hollywood. WTF.....

I've now made multiple attempts to contact the corporate office to get to the bottom of this and have had no replies.

Stay away from the strip.. It's all about the shareholders now days, not you.

What poor service! Received e-mail inviting pre- checkin. Did the precheckin then arrived at hotel and they could not find the reservation. They were completely puzzled by the printed copy of the precheckin. Was sent to a kiosk that did not work. Finally, a not so helpful staff person managed to get it to work. Then told room not ready, come back in two hours. This after the precheckin! Wasted half an hour trying to check in with no success. Terrible place. Loud, unresponsive staff, and generally unfriendly place. Take your business elsewhere.

So on tge caesar buffet  websitethey say they have KING  crab legs. They don't they only have snow crab legs like every other buffet in Las Vegas. I was very disappointed to find this out. My wife and I only paid more money and went to caesar for the king crab legs but they don't have any . This buffet is the same as any other buffet but it cost almost twice as much.

I am beyond disappointed in this place. Husband and I just got married so we wanted to get a nice place. We get here and wait a bit for check in, but understand there are lots of people. We are paying $300+ a night for a room. Way more then a lot of other places in Vegas we have stayed. We get into the elevator and it's old and very worn down, but it works at least. Get got into our hallway and it REEKS like marijuana! We're on a non smoking floor. We get to our room and it is horrible. Super small no fridge or microwave. View of a huge wall and vents. The quality looks like a best western kinda. So I call to ask what can be done and the desk lady sassy like tells me I can try to call back tomorrow and try to switch rooms, but they are pretty full so probably won't be able to. I'm beyond disappointed and we will never stay here again. Not worth the price or the hype for this place when you can get MUCH better for way cheaper!!

I have stayed at several hotels on the strip over the last year or so, but this week was my first time at Caesar's. I really enjoyed it. The place is so huge that you really don't even have to leave (except it's Vegas, so you have to). There are a ton of shops, plenty of restaurants and the rooms are really nice.

Pro's:
My room had a single king sized bed, a large walk-in shower with bench, small couch and over-sized chair. All of the furniture was very comfortable. The pool area, forums, and casino floor is all very nicely done and modern.

Con's:
Access to the gym is an extra $25\/day. Wi-Fi is $14.99 per day. The mini-fridge has weight sensors, so if you move an item (without using it), you can get billed. Parking feels like it is a mile walk.

Nevertheless, I think Caesar's is a great spot. It's affordable, has nice rooms, and is right in the middle of the strip.

My Caesars experience was horrible! We reserved a two queen bedroom and were given a one bedroom room. We understood that these things can happen so we went to the front desk to simply rectify the situation. My friend and I were treated horribly by the john the manager! We are convinced that had we been males john would not have dismissed us so easily, insisting we shack up together in one bed. The way we were treated was absolutely deplorable. We immediately chose to check out and check in to another hotel on the strip. DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY HERE.

Worst customer service I have seen at a hotel.  Stayed here because of a conference at the hotel.  Checked in and my room smelled of smoke, but I had to go staff a table at the conference.  Tried to reach front desk and supervisor via house phone.  Front desk number is never answered (just rings).  Operator sent me to guest relationship.  They said I'd have to change rooms by 6PM - which was impossible (I'm working a conference).  Tried to escalate to supervisor, they put me on hold for 11 minutes before I gave up.  Called back - was told front desk supervisors do not answer the phone - only in person.  After conference went to front desk at 9PM.  They would not change rooms - said the housekeeping staff goes home at 6:30 and they are oversold.  Completely horrible experience.  I'm staying in a room that STINKS of smoke.  The service was atrocious.  They hide and won't help you over the house phone.  This place is way too big and they don't care about the customer.  i will never spend another dime at Caesars - not at the casino, not the hotel, not food.  Completely garbage hotel.  There are SO many better places in Vegas.  Do yourself a big favor and MISS THIS HOTEL.

Very bad experience! Don't book this hotel!!! Expect to pay a $10\/day fee for parking as well as a "resort fee" that apparently is mandatory for everyone but you will only be informed when you check out. The check-in is very late (4pm) and if you want to get your room earlier (as well as access to the pool) you will have to pay $35 on top! 
Overall very expensive but not better than the other hotels on the strip including cheaper ones as the Flamingo or the Excalibur!

We stayed in the Augustus Tower in July for a joint Bachelor\/Bachelorette party. We had a nice sized room, pretty comfortable bed, and nice tub. The room was clean. We checked in in the diamond lounge so we didn't have to wait in line and got to use the side entrance to grab the car. Also, we got a cabana by the pool and the service was amazing and the drinks were great. Overall, a good vacation. Nice pool, nice rooms, and Omnia was pretty cool. I would suggest this for a fun Vegas trip due to the central location and the iconic hotel. We didn't eat anywhere other than the pool so I can't say much about the dining experience.
