As far as gaming, the slots weren't the greatest so we did all gaming at the Encore because they have our favorite slots. It was cool having the forum shops and the Bellagio right next door instead of having to walk a half mile from the Encore to get there.

Endless stores in the Ceasar's. The ceilings were painted to resemble the sky and you just see alot of geek gods and goddess statues. Nice place to take pictures. But I hated their casino. It was too smokey for me. It place was nice, but it was old as well and I don't care for replicas of Greek mythology.

I LOVED my stay at Caesars Palace!  My boyfriend and I stayed here 5 days and 4 nights- we had such an incredible time. It was my very first time in Las Vegas and I'm so glad my first experience was able to be at such a wonderful casino. I loved that it was located in the heart of Vegas, perfect walking distance to anywhere we wanted to go. I LOVED the ridiculously large mall that was INSIDE the Hotel\/Casino. I mean how cool is that?! Every employee that we came in contact with was very friendly, and they truly seemed to love their job! i loved being able to sit at a bar, play a slot machine, and just have drinks brought to me. It was a wonderful experience, and when I return to Vegas next year, I will definitely stay at Caesars Palace.

One of the better, cleaner hotels in Vegas.

Stayed in a room (in the Augustus Tower) that overlooked the Bellagio and Strip, great view to see the Bellagio water show, but note that every time the water show happens, it sounds like thunder.  

Room was clean, spacious.  Walking anywhere in Casear's is a haul though, .5 miles to conference center .75 miles to Forum Shoppes. With a number of great restaurants and bars\/clubs it's easy to stay here for days on end.

** Walk Through Review **

I don't know why, but I always kind of associate Las Vegas and Caesars Palace. Maybe it is pop culture or whatever, but the two are linked in my head. Although I didn't stay at Caesars, one thing I had planned to do was to walk through the Casino. 

I love the Roman theme and the hotel fully embraces it. There are fountains, columns, and statues everywhere. Walking into the shops area is really cool because the ceiling is painted like the sky and it feels like you are walking down a Roman street. The shopping area was huge and contained just about every high-end retailer you could imagine. 

The Casino area was huge and had all the games you would expect to see. There were bars and restaurants everywhere.

I can't give a rating on the hotel rooms or anything like that, but just as an attraction to see while in Las Vegas, Caesars is one not to miss!

I stayed at Caesars Palace in the Julius wing.  We had left our room for the night and the next morning I went to look in my wallet (which was hidden in a bag under my clothes in my suitcase) to find all my cash missing. My other friends had all their cash missing as well that they had in safe places (we should have used the safe though - even though it was the size of a jewelry box and won't fit shit).  About $700 missing in total.  Security came and I was prompted to fill out an incident report.  First thing he asked me was if the door was secured close.  Umm yes...if I close my door and hear a click I assume it is closed!  Apparently they have insecure doors because they don't fully close.  So either a random person was pushing on doors because they knew how insecure they were or it was a staff employee who had a key.  I asked the security guy if I\/he could look at the cameras after I gave him the time frame the incident could have occurred and he kept telling me that he couldn't tell me if there were cameras, if the cameras showed our room, and proceeded to LAUGH at me.  Are you serious? No remorse, no concern.  He said I would get contacted via email in 2-3 days.  USELESS.  We filled a police report which was useless as well.  The front desk credited me our resort fees - a mere $120.  They really should have given us the night they we were robbed for free....but no Caesar's is too cheap to do that.  They charge for early check-in (about $34) and Wi-Fi $15 a day.  Those should both be free! I understand if we were broken into and it not be the hotel's fault, but the way that they all handled it was TERRIBLE.  DO NOT STAY AT THIS PROPERTY.  Anyone can go up to your room...even people off the street.  There are no security check points to flash your room key or anything.  Anyone can get on your designed wing's elevator.  I'm extremely disappointed with the service we received.

Stayed at Forum Tower for 1 night. The bed was great and the bathroom was great. I like the shower place and how it was designed. The service was great. They bring our request stuffs as soon as possible. But, just that the check in time was late, so we have to wait in the lobby where there's no chairs to seat on...and I wish they have free wifi in the room

I really love, love, love, Ceasar's Palace! We had comp tickets for a deluxe suite, and although they were free the Hotel did not skimp on the luxury!!! The spa OUA, Fab Fab Fab, the pampering although pricey was undeniably the top of the line. Location is everything in Vegas, in my opinion even though I don't gamble. I did go there for a vacation, which to me meant sleep rest and sleep some more. The bed was super plush, the shower great. I just cant say enough. Staff super polite, This will be my place of choice next time.

I visited Caesars right before the holidays.  Even for a Monday it was pretty slow--the sour economy had definitely taken a toll on Las Vegas.  On the upside, if you were in town and had some money to gamble with, there were lots of open seats at the blackjack tables and plenty of elbow room at craps.

HOTEL: I stayed in the Augustus Tower.  The room isn't super-extravagant by any means but it's spacious and includes a desk, a small table, a couch, and a flat-panel TV.  It also had a great view of the Bellagio fountains.  The bathroom is very nice--spacious with marble floors, a jacuzzi tub, a glass-doored shower, and a little room for the toilet.  Nothing remarkable about the other room amenities.  I've never been to the gym or spa, but I hear they are incredible--much better than Wynn and even better than the Bellagio.  On the downside, my bed mattress felt a little cheap and uneven, which was a disappointment as I've stayed in the Augustus Tower several times in the past and this was the first time I've had that problem.

CASINO: This is why you come to Vegas, right?  Caesars has just about every game you could want.  (I don't think they have Casino War, but you shouldn't be playing that anyway.)  The gaming floor is pretty spacious and clean.  The Sports Book is huge and is a good place to watch a game even if you can't get a one of the nice seats.  One disappointment was that it looks like all the relatively more favorable payouts are gone: 9-6 Jacks or Better video poker is replaced with 8-5 or worse!  Also, I couldn't find a blackjack table with the dealer staying on soft 17 (though I didn't check the few tables in the baccarat room).  The Poker Room looks pretty good, and they even have a rather large set-off area for tournaments.  In terms of cash games, though, there never seems to be enough of a crowd.  For baccarat, the tables are well-spaced though almost all of the tables are lacking the new computer screens (which, of course, prevents those great "Push the button!" moments).  I thought that the dealers were quite friendly.  The little lounge for baccarat players is decent.  A couple of years ago, they had these addictive little gummy candies, but, alas, they are no more.  You'll have to head to your local Chinese grocer.

RESTAURANTS, ETC.: A lot of the restaurants deserve their own review, but here's the overview.  Generally, I think Caesars offers a very nice selection of places to eat, and that's not even including what you find in the Forum Shops.  I wouldn't characterize any restaurant as mind-blowing, though.  True, the buffet (Cafe Lago) is less impressive than many other casinos on the strip, but the food is alright.  Augustus Cafe is pretty standard.  Beijing Noodle No. 9 was just opening when I visited, but, at least architecturally, it looks like an exciting place.  Hyakumi is pretty standard sushi fare.  I was a little disappointed with Mesa Grill given Bobby Flay's celebrity, and I suppose the same goes with Guy Savoy.  (Note, however, Guy Savoy has the most amazing bacon bread I've ever tasted.  This, indeed, was mind-blowing.)  Neros is pretty standard.  Rao's is pretty decent Italian fare, though I was shocked how empty the place was in December.  I've never been to Sea Harbour, but when that same space was Empress Court, I thought it was very good.  PURE deserves a special mention.  I haven't been there since October 2006, but the place is great, albeit expensive (in the range of $2,500 for a table for five, a bottle of Dom, a couple bottles of Grey Goose, and generous tips to our smoking hot server and a very helpful bouncer.)  If you're willing to spend a decent amount of money to get a table, I think it's worth it, if only not to stand in those ridiculously long lines.

COMPARABLES: Overall, Caesars is not quite as good as Wynn, but just better than Aladdin (which has been replaced with Planet Hollywood).

There are many better casinos!!!
I stayed at Caesars for 1 week (Sun to Sun) - paying for a sleeping room, daily coffees; snacks, Nobu and one of the best but most expensive buffets ever.  During this trip I also dined at other fine establishments and for the remaining (3) days of my visit I gambled in other casinos.  So I dropped plenty of money at Caesars between the room, food\/beverages and gambling!  I am unique gambler in the sense that I am comfortable giving my money to the casino as long as I get to play!!  So I made a donation every night to Caesars for the first 4 nights - on the fifth night, I played and broke even.  Ecstatic not to have a lost, I went to cashier to cash my chips!   That is when I discovered that Caesars treats the ordinary gambler as a second class citizens!  I waited over 20 minutes to cash in - 20 MINUTES!!!  Why.....because I was eighth in a growing line of people in a non-platinum corral.  Initially there were 3 of 9 windows open NONE OF WHICH was the window marked "all".  This meant that every time a cashier was available the platinum people were selected and the non-platinum people remained stagnate.  I get the purpose of platinum status and the privileges associated with being an elite member of a casino, airline carrier, etc. etc.  But when the fourth window was opened and it was still marked platinum and service was continued to the platinum members over the growing line of regular folks, well I along with those around me became infuriated!!!  Let me point out that out of all windows, most were marked platinum, a couple gold and only one "all".  This is understandable, but NOT to have a single "ALL" window open is completely unacceptable!!!  I complained to the teller who was not interested, I spoke to a pit boss who suggested I speak to a manager, a manager was summoned and he suggested I fill out a comment card as he has no control over the cashier station!  
I begrudgingly completed  my stay but for the remaining (3) nights I refused to gamble at Caesars, refused to eat at Caesars and would only purchase my first morning coffee at the Starbucks at Caesars!!  This "common" or aka "all" gambler will NEVER stay - NEVER gamble at another Caesars own property in Vegas or Jersey ever again!!!

I recently attended a conference at Caesars Palace, and our company held a cocktail reception in one of their Presidential Suites, and found the suite more than lacking!   Not only did we have to wait until 4pm to check in, but when we finally got into the suite, the real issues began.

It was dirty (carpet had really filthy areas, the door jam outside looked like someone had spilled beer on it, and several yellow upholstered chairs were so dirty I had to move them out and hide them in a closet); the furniture was chipped, tablecloths had holes in them   When I requested housekeeping to help clean up some of the filth on the door and in the service area, they showed up 2 hours later.  By that time I had already cleaned the grime away.  (Note that all of the staff that came by to help were very nice and really tried to fix the issues -- such as get the air conditioner to work, and get the front double door to closes!) 

It also came with no standard-stocked items.  When I requested a coffee pot to replace the K-cup maker, they told me I had to "rent" one for $40; to get a corkscrew required calling room service and paying for them to deliver one, etc, etc. etc.  

The final ding was that for over $800\/night, our not-so-lovely view was of the back of the Caesar's sign.  

If you are looking for a high-quality suite, don't come to Caesars!

Had a chance to stay in the Octavius Tower in their Laurel rooms over the weekend.  The rooms were great, the bed was super comfy and the bathrooms were nice with large spa tubs.  I would definitely come back.

Roman Tower is a old and overpriced. Thankfully, we stayed at a "summer discount" which was a pre-payed $245 for two nights for a Saturday and Sunday night. 

The room had an old television that had interference at times. The carpet had stains, but not necessarily unsanitary. Every room that I saw in the Roman Tower was completely different. I had a room with a separate shower and bath tub where a friend only had a smaller bathroom with a shower and another friend's room was so big that they could have a dance party in there.
 My view was of the roof and the tower next to us, nothing special.  Our other friends had a view of the pool which was nice.
I understand the Roman Tower is the lowest tier room, but I know you can get better quality for a better price at many other premier strip hotels.

The POOL was the best part and is why I'm giving this review three stars and not two.  I loved every part of the pool situation.  You could relax or walk 20 feet and play blackjack or walk another 50 feet and be in a dance party.  Kids weren't really an issue and our part of 15 were able to throughout the day get lounge chairs and eventually all sit together.  We were going to purchase a cabana but boy am I glad we didnt! $1500 minimum ($500 rental and $1000 f&B credit) the cabanas are NOT what I expected when we got there so I'm so happy we didn't do that! 
The frozen drinks at the pool that were $22 had 4 shots of alcohol in them - not bad when you think of how much one drink would have been.  The fish tacos and french fries at the pool were delish!

During checkout, the line was HUGE at 11 am (checkout deadline). Thank goodness I checked out via text and then stored my bag with the bellman.

As for the casino, I think it's nice.  Table minimums were a bit high for me and I did walk across the street Saturday night as I wanted to play $5-10 hands not $25 hands.

Food after 2am is the worst to find! Food during the day was easy and convenient 

The Forum shops were great to be close to and we (8 girls) had a MAC girls night out which was great to walk to.

The Octavius tower has beautiful rooms. Love the comfortable beds. Very happy here.
I have stayed in the MGM, Bellagio, Venetian, and the Palazzo and recently Ceasar's Palace. We had an awesome stay. I highly recommend Caesar's- but request a room in the newer Octavius Tower- we had a pool view. These rooms have the most comfortable beds which makes it hard to even get out of in the mornings. The room was clean, decent size with a sitting area and the bathrooms are large and spacious with deep soaking tubs. 
The pools at Caesar's are the best and the $17 mojito was perfect. Ok so they do nickel and dime you on the fees but that's not uncommon at these sprawling Vegas resorts. And yes we added the resort package onto our room for $28 for internet and for use of the fitness room which I used everyday during our stay. DO NOT TOUCH THE MINI BAR - EXPENSIVE!! There is a nice little sundries shop right by the lobby- buy your bottled water and snacks there to save money. 
The amenities - the pool, the fitness room, the Qua Spa, the location on the strip, and being close to the forum shops is why I loved staying at Caesars! I am a huge fan of getting the day pass to Qua Spa- it's normally $45 however they charged me $25 probably because I had the resort package added in my room cost. It was one of the highlights of my Vegas trip. 
I love the suite sized rooms at the Palazzo but I would definitely come back to Caesars and stay in the Octavius Tower again. We were very happy with the staff and the room.

I had the pleasure of experiencing one of their Palace Tower deluxe junior suites. The jacuzzi had fabulous massaging jets. The layout and space in the room was comfortable for two people. Everything was clean and well maintained. They had plenty of options for food downstairs and lots of fun architecture to explore. I had an enjoyable stay and look forward to returning.

Caesars Palace. HUGE HUGE hotel. On the Las Vegas Strip. So we tried it.

We got there a before check in time which is at 4 pm. Most places I have stayed we were always lucky to have early check in. This time we weren't that lucky.

We got to the hotel lobby to check in and there was 2 people checking people in. Mind you the line grew longer and longer by the second (IT WAS CHECK IN TIME!!! Just a thought: Maybe there should be more workers at that time.) And to top it off...when we reached the front of the line, the lady said..."someone will be right with you..I can't take you because it would be overtime." 

We finally got in to our room at the Octavius Tower which is far but I never really thought of it as a problem as it was close to the pool, the buffet, and close to the food court hahahah. I am currently preggo so food access is essential.

Room was nice and spacious...There is a section for the beds (yes i like to get two Queen as one is to sleep and one is for my toodler to play and jump on and rub his play-doh all over the place), a couch area, and the bathroom had a walk in shower and a jacuzzi. I liked that the toilet was also in there with a door (hahaha). The bathroom was spacious as well which made it a perfect time to do some aerobic exercises as my son enjoyed his time in the tub. I loved the door bell action when someone came to your door. Refrigerator is completely stocked with shots, beer, alcohol, and they have a snack bar along with an intimacy kit lol. What sucks about the refrigerator is you are not able to put in your own stuff in there...So we had a mini cooler to put our drinks that we got from target that was way cheaper than the drinks in the refrigerator. And again...a refrigerator is very important to me ...especially having a toddler and storing his yogurt or milk.

Wifi sucks in that tower...it's free but that is how they get you. To get the good Wifi you HAVE to pay. Valet sucks in general and it is a shame that this is a popular hotel...you have to wait 10-15 minutes to get your car...give or take. 

What I also liked about staying here is the easy access to the Forum shops... and there is just absolutely alot to do in there. 

Would I stay here again... maybe...not the "I want to go back to Caesar's" feel. I would go there to walk around and visit yes... But I think I would want to try other places on the strip first.

Oh yea.... housekeeping is nice they came quick to change the bedding after I checked and saw red stains on it

This was the worst experience of my life! I was assaulted at the pool by a group of men who were drunk and having x rated sex in the public pool where family's were swimming with small children. I complained to the life guard who observed their lewd acts. She proceeded to tell them this is a public pool and that there was a complaint. The 2 guys started flipping everyone off yelling F..... U it only escalated from there the waiter pointed us out as the ones who complained the group came running from the other side of the pool and began attacking me! I was screaming for security and we received no help by the Caesars staff. A guest sitting by us stood up and kept them from punching me. The situation was terrifying I have it all on video Caesars security showed up 10 minutes later and treated us deplorable I was humiliated in front of all the guest and friends.  He was Unprofessional and did not know how to Handel a crisis situation. We have been coming here every year for the trauma and critical care conference that Dr. Maddox has put on for the last 48 years. I am not satisfied with managements nonchalant response and will pursue further action. I do not feel safe in this hotel and would not recommend staying here! Their management actually told me I could not call the police for the assault what!!!!!!!!!

I like this place!  I stayed here for a convention and was upgraded to a suite.  Sweet I said.

The place has it's own Forum shoppes which also has an ABC (for those of you who have been to Hawaii, know what I'm talking about).

It is a big place with great amenities.  The spa was awesome as well.  i didn't do a whole lot of gambling so can't comment on the casino.  However, overall experience has been great for me.

I did the math....

$28 resort fee X's 3910= MORE THAN 40 MILLION A YEAR!!!!

Commie fee alert, Commie fee alert!!!

I also Googled resort fee for my fellow yelpers....

covers...

fitness center
local calls
internet
newspaper

I NEED NONE OF THOSE!!!!

When is it time for us to speak up about this kind of BS...its an outrage....the above should be services and amenities that are part of the fact that I would choose to stay in such a resort.

Do not even get me started on room service Commie fees....

This is false advertising, we are being taken advantage of, start standing up for your rights people!!!!

i've always loved this casino. i made my first amount of cash gambling here back in the day. I only came here to play some poker and their poker room is beautiful and spacious.  The managers in the room weren't the brightest, but they were friendly and were sort of on top of things.  You can tell right away that they get a lot of regulars in the room, so it made it exciting for some time.
I would just hope that my room and blankets would be cleaned BEFORE I check into our room. So disappointed to take the purple blanket off the bed to find "leftovers" from the last couple stay!
Always a great stop!

This place deserve a big fat zero star. My first time there staying at Ceasars other times i go i stay at other places. 

 So i was just there for a pack expo after a long day of walking it i went to check in. Lines were ok not long so i was waiting for my turn, so i was taking a selfie with the fountain in the back ground. After 5-10 mins of waiting this guy calls me to the counter thinking cool time to check in but no he was accusing me of taking pictures of the employee bihid the counter. i told i was not taking pictures of anyone so he kept stating i did. I told him that how embrarrssing it was to pull me out of line to accuse me. i told him here is my phone and check my photo and then he just walked away. I went back in line then i got called up to check in i ask the lady that help who was that guy she said he was the manager. So that was very rude that i got called out of line for him to asscuse me i didnt a sorry. So that will be mine first and last time i go there i have plenty of friends and clients that go to Vegas i promise i will not recoomend this place.

Why do the rooms have motion detectors?  And why are there no security personnel standing between the street outside and your room door?

I stayed at Caesar's with a large business group earlier this summer.  Turns out every room has a motion detector in it that lights up when you move around.  Who's watching me in my room?  And why?

Also, unlike so many other casinos, there was no one from Caesar's checking room key cards in the guest elevator wells.  Anyone could walk right in from the street and go straight to any guest door in the tower.

The ladies in our group were creeped out by both of these issues.  We won't be back.

So the wife and I found a great deal for Caesers Palace. A friend of ours had enough rewards to get a room there for only $40 or so. Mind you, at this time we weren't in the most stable financial conditions but who can resist Caesars Palace? 

Well, I can. But  I won't. 

Anyway, booked online for $40 and was expecting some trashy room right next to the janitors assistants intern's bathroom and drove 3 hours to Vegas. Pulled up to the Valet parking only to be told to take my pretentious ass to the other entrance since this is for 7 diamond or whatever. I turned around and drove to the other area and made my way to the reception where we were greeted by this extra ordinarily nice gentleman who was very happy to finish his shift after dealing with us. 

He was courteous and very polite especially when he told me that they will be charging $200 deposit to my card. There goes the slot machine money. I understand that they actually do charge this money but CP may charge more than others or maybe its because I was just out of my damn league there. I did think about Best Western suites a couple of miles down the Poor People Avenue. Anyway, not to seem phased by this revelation, I gave my card hoping it won't get declined. However, this guy gave us a free upgrade. He gave us a room on the top floor!! Now thats the bang for your buck. 

The hotel itself was obviously exquisite. I have been to many 5 star hotels in my good times and this is certainly in the top 20. One thing you can't escape even in CP is the Las Vegas stench found in every room of every damn hotel over there. 

Our stay was only for a night and most of it was spent taking selfies by my wife. We walked around, played a few slots, lost all our money and then just got into the hot tub. 

Overall, it was a good experience and now that the financial condition is better, I plan to go back knowing what to expect.

I'm a fan of this place simply for the self parking. When I'm going to hang in the middle of the strip, I always park here. It's cool to walk through the casino and people watch. They've got the forum shops which is also cool. I'm still waiting to see the guys from the hangover though. I don't eat here as IMO, it's just too expensive on the strip and I usually leave disappointed. But I have hit up some of the bars for happy hour and I enjoyed myself!

Big fan of all the sculptures outside of Caesars Palace!

All the water and statues provide an eloquence of to the casino that has remained the same over the years, at least on the outside. 

The shopping here continues to be a huge draw more many even thought the cost to shop here is VERY high.

The garden area in the front of the Palace is very nice. The flowing water is just very calming. I think it is even a better attraction at night. 

Get to the entrance can be a bit like a maze because there are so many twists and turns you have to take to get there. 

Once you are inside you feel like you are walking into a historic casino. Take a left or a right because either way will lead you to the land of "Lights and Sounds". 

If you take a right or left you wind up doing a lap around the machines and the a few tables while on the outside there are the big gaming tables and a few hallways to other gaming areas and shopping areas. 

I had hoped to get to one of the restaurants here for a meal but around noon time the wait for food seemed a bit longer than usual. There are a few places to go to grab a quick bite but I was looking for a sit down meal. 

Very spacious casino. By far, one of the more open casinos throughout in all facets. The gaming rooms are spread out to give room to walk comfortably and the shops are fairly widened to move around without bumping into other people.

#justkeepwalking

Still here but checking out today. Im a frequent visitor of Vegas, but this stay was disappointing. Check in was easy. Stayed at Caesars for the first time ever. Got a room in the Octavius tower. Our room was nice but dirty. The housekeeper did a horrible job. Called front desk and they gave a new room same tower. Got to the new room and furniture was missing. Called guests services and they never came with chairs that were missing. Wifi connect is really bad. You have to reconnect every time if you become idle for more than 30 mins. And if you finally get online, it's slow. Irritating. I could use my own data, the reception in our hotel was really poor.  Ordered breakfast in yesterday, they left the dirty dishes in our room all day. The housekeeper didn't tell in room dining to pick up dirty dishes so our room stank of old food. Called in room dining again and it took them three hours to get the dirty dishes out. It's was frustrating because they said it was our job to tell them to pick up the dishes. What???   No that's not our job, but we did tell housekeeper to get dishes before we left in the morning. I'll never stay here again. There we too many other nice hotels.

I have stayed at many different strip hotels and this is by far my worst ever experience. I paid and requested early check in, not only with the email I was sent but also at the kiosk at the reservation desk area at 9am when we arrived. Machine stated an email would be sent when keys ready for pickup. At 2pm still no email checked at main desk was told no rooms ready they would text me. I never received a text or email at 3:45 went to desk was told oh you never came your room is ready. I complained about $30 early charge and was rudely told did I want my room now or wait until 6pm?  Wow attitude. !!! I requested a non smoking room. And the floor was non smoking however my room had been used as a smoking room more than once in fact housekeeping had cleaned the ashtray and put it on the table with a brand new book of Caesar matches. I called and told them and was told housekeeping could come clean the air but didn't know when they were busy. We were going to a show at 6:30 and wanted to eat first so reluctantly I said no. Than I went to the bathroom. The floor around the toilet was standing water and it was dripping from ceiling above. I called. Same story we can send someone to fix it but don't know when. I said I want a new room. An hour later and two more phone calls the bell man came with new keys. Room was a down grade we could tell, but of course wasn't told or credited any $ but at least you could breath and use the bathroom. Now for check out. Tried to use kiosk but not open I guess it was 4:30am we had an early flight. Got early checkout email when I got home at 9am lol lot of good that does me. For the money not worth the I don't care attitude and the hassles. Lots of better choices.

I went here to go to the buffet and play some machines. The layout has been the same since I was a kid and they've kept up the place pretty well.

The only negative was the wierd forum valet which had 1 attendant.

I made it to Caesars Palace!

I say this because while being a broke college student, we always stayed at the other palace on the strip... The Imperial Palace... 

It was New Years Day, 2013 I got a great deal and booked under $100 for the night!

It was the BF and I and we wanted something central for Taxi purposes, this is important! We were going to be clubbing at LAVO for the evening so taking a cab, or walking in my heels, you have to think about being centrally located.

Got upgraded to the Forum Tower (I don't know what we had before) on the top floor.. (Hello # 69!) Walked in and found the room to be pretty spacious for the 2 of us. Nice King bed, couch, and cool bathroom (No tub, just a pretty cool shower) TV in the mirror (Great for getting ready for clubbing).

I liked how close the tower was to the casino (You walk right into it!) and it was pretty close to the parking garage, and to the Forum shops! 

LAVO was playing all that EDM Music. So after the open bar, we left and ended up a PURE.  This was the quickest walk back to the room ever! Stop by PURE and get on the Hotel guestlist. Room Key may be requested.


I have heard great things about THIS palace. I'm glad I got to check this one off my list! I'll be back, if I can get a cheap deal like this again!
Had an awesome stay,upgraded to a honeymoon suite for only $30...oh yeah and Mariah Carey was there.
We had another great experience at this Casino?  We got the VIP treatment at a separate reservation desk.  A + customer service.

I've got nothing bad to say about Caesars Palace- 
I had a blast !!!
I came this weekend with my girls ...we got upgraded to double queen beds only bad thing was it ended up be a smoking room....
Still the hotel was beautiful even if our room was three blocks from the lobby lol
-the pool was great and warm and fun....
So many people here but great vibes !!
I loved that the forum shops were inside too - 
We went to dinner at Trevi and it was good ...
I kinda wish we had more time here but I will be back with my hubby for a romantic weekend ...
This hotel has everything !!
Come see for yourself !!

This place is 70s-esque, and I had flashbacks or visions of my parents boogying around in drunkenness. So it earns an extra star, because Caesar's Palace apparently has nostalgic value for my family members. The landscaping greenery featured a few Roman-esque statues, fountains, and it was kitschy. And I admit fun. Still, I feel bad for the cocktail waitresses who have to wear these horrendous leotard get ups, and the casino was too smokey and dingey for my taste.

Tuesday in vegas in the summer.  Hotel nowhere near capacity. At 4pm they have 3 lines open to check in and hundred people in line. No clue on customer service.. Hotel should know they have x amount of people coming in and staff it. Who wants to drive or fly all day and then wait in line and be upset instead of gambling at your casino or eating at a restaurant. Instead everyone is just waiting in line upset.
Don't check your bags with the Bell desk.  It will take over 40 minutes to get them.  And you have to wait in your room.

One of the O.G. Vegas hotels and STILL a legend:

PROS
-Check-in self-service computerized kiosks are a big plus. If you're still using the actual check-in desk, please don't complain about their lines. You chose to stand in line when self-service kiosks that spit out your keys are steps away.
-Got a free upgrade from a Palace tower standard room to an Augustus tower mini-suite. Yes, the kiosk automatically upgraded me.
-Housekeeping was professional and reliable.
-TV is flat screen and all channels are HD.
-Bathroom is marble and elegant throughout.
-Express elevators that skip all the unnecessary floors.
-Cheesecake Factory is next door in the Forum Shops.
-Free "Atlantis" show in the Forum Shops.
-CP is in the middle of the strip so you can easily walk to many attractions.
-Spacious conference rooms.
-Check-out is simple via TV and a closed out bill appears in your inbox minutes later.

CONS
-The restaurants in CP are a bit pricey. This includes the Starbucks.
-The pool area needs more shade.
great hotel! loved our room! awesome time =)

I will only stay at Caesars when in Vegas! Caesars is truly a picture of  the classic, self indulging ,Vegas experience.

My girlfriends and I stayed in a deluxe room in the Palace Tower. Our room was very nice, with a great view. It was also quite spacious. I loved the jacuzzi tub and the comfy bed (even though I only slept about 2 hours the entire weekend).

The hotel is in the perfect location on the strip...in the middle of everything! The only time we ever got a cab was at 5am on our way to the palms. The staff is extremely hospitable and will help you get in anywhere, or give you good recommendations.

Caesar's has my favorite pool  (its actually a pool complex),and they even keep the Venus pool open year round.

You could honestly stay in Caesars all day and be completely satisfied. They have lots of dinning options (the buffet, although not as good as the Bellagio's, is delicious), the spa is expensive, but worthy of the emperor of Rome,  the shopping is intense, Pure is tons of fun, and so are the other countless bars. What else do you need!?

Caesar's casino was my favorite, because I won lots of money and I found the crystal chandeliers a soothing surrounding to my black jack game. Cha-ching!

Plus, this is the Hangover hotel, how can you go wrong staying here!? Just don't leave your friend on the roof and forget about him.

I'm a bit of a hotel whore and having just crashed at Caesar's this past weekend upon driving out to see Mizz Mariah (.......cue whistle note), I won't by any means knock the place off of the list. It was good for, well, what it was good for.

While on the higher end of the spectrum in terms of price range and the accommodations themselves, I can still by far, view there being vast amounts of room for improvement.

Upon viewing our forms of identification the gal' at the front desk quickly took notice of us celebrating 2 birthdays and while we'd initially booked a relatively large room already, she upgraded us to a Penthouse suite within the Auugustus Tower.

- - - - - SUITEEEEE! (pun very much intended)

As mentioned within another review, this particular area of the hotel encompasses its own Starbucks. It was nice to bypass this several times as we entered and exited the elevators. 

For those new to Caesars, the place bears a bit of a regal feel. Not quite as plush as "The Palace" in San Francisco but still....

From the massive statues to the soaring high cathedral ceilings, you can't help but think that you've made it by stepping foot into this place; at least on a Vegas scale!!! To further it, it's located within the epicenter of EVERYTHING!!! Stepping out onto "The Strip", you really don't have to cab or Uber anything as everything's within walking distance!!!

- - - - - - What I can further attest to is this place being massive! Any time a hotel provides a map at check in, I've learned to anticipate a surplus of tourist(s) let alone the need for an Excedrin.

Boasting an array of restaurants (enough to satisfy any palette), let alone venues of entertainment, and Lord the shopping!!! (at the Forum), the hotel also possesses a plethora of garages for parking alongside optional valet (free of charge). Valet affront the "actual" front entrance was at capacity upon our pulling up and we were asked to circle around and take use of the Coliseum's valet parking option...... we weren't however, made aware of just how far this joint actually was!

Upon rerouting, we bypassed 2 other valet parking options and finally made our way where we were intended to be. This parking option, while COMPLETELY EMPTY is far as hell from Hotel Registration (we were dayum near back in California!!!) and we were forced to trek the entire way back to the front of the place just to do so.

- - - - - - Nothing like walking a mile through a casino with luggage after a 4-5 hour drive out.

I'm deducting 1\/2 a star as I\/we were informed upon being issued keys, that our bags should've been taken to the front when we pulled up and were greeted by the first valet guy upon his informing us that they were full.

o__O

In any event, our room was spacious. Hands down, HUGGGGGGE! We're talking gi'normous and possessed a partial "Strip" view as well as one of the pool. We were on the 30th floor and it was quite tranquil........that is, until after the concert. We elected to go back to the room and change and noise from outside could be heard from within our suite.

Come on Caesar's!

- - - - - - For $325\/night + the resort fee + taxes and the host of other add-on's ---need I even say that bleeding noise from outsiders should be rendered COMPLETELY obsolete?!!!

Thereon, for the size of the room, the flat screen, mounted appropriately on the wall between the bed and living quarters was absurdly undersized. I'd hypothesize it to have been all of 32'. 

For a suite? GTFOH!!!!______________________

It was actually quite confusing how the television within the bathroom was almost the same size as the one designated for the living area; another 1\/2 point star deduction guys ^ ^ ^ .

Room service however and as anticipated, was efficient BUT pricey!!!! I ordered a burger of some sort and he, a pasta dish. Adding on 2 Patron margaritas (a good $30\/a piece), our order summed a good $120.00. It filled us but was nothing you'll see me writing home about.

- - - - - - What concerns me at places like this is exactly whom to tip. 

It appears that EVERYONE wants AND GETS your money! From the front desk, to the valet guys partitioning tips, to the bell guys, to room service....the list goes on and on. 

The strategy of Las Vegas seems to be to take all of your money and send you on your way impoverished and homesick!

#succubus

Without hesitation do I extend the highest accolades to Mariah's marketing team while I'm at it. Lord have mercy. This chick was EVERYWHERE!!!! From the billboards seen from the freeway and upon the hotel's exterior, down to her having her own gift shop within the casino!!! 

Who's "obsessed" now Mariah? Jeeez! 

It's even crazier when you phone the front desk and hear "Honey" and "Butterfly" streaming as you hold....................... sadly though, that's what I feel as if I\/we paid for --- Mariah's marketing. 

Having stayed at nicer places and crashed on higher threadcounts, this place seriously left a bit to be desired.

If you are looking for a place to stay, I would suggest this place! Have to admit, I am giving this place a decent rating because one, My girl pals and I got to stay here for free. Got to love how all her times at the tables has its perks! So we checked in here and it was actually a pretty quick process and after 9 hours in the car, I was quite relieved. 
    Our room was clean, smelled decent, and we had an excellent view! We had 2 bathrooms that connected which , with 4 girls, is a PLUS. Our room was amazing and I was quite pleased of how well kept it was. Trust me, just because its a nicer hotel, doesn't mean its going to look its best all the time. Any ways, for the night life, this place is pretty packed. Only distaste is the constant smell of cigarette smoke and of course the creepy pervy old men. Strange but I guess normal in Vegas, we had people stop us and offer us free drinks at the bars\/night life in the hotel since we were "good looking." Who can say no to free drinks? Well I would when a creepy old guy followed me for a good twenty minutes. Thought I would have to beat him with my heels if he got close enough. LOL. 
   Lines for the club at the hotel are lonnnnnggg, however if you are a set of women, you will probably get in quick. (Sorry guys!!!) and there is constantly a flow of people wherever you go. Also people with crazy looking drinks just walking around. I def. liked the fact that there were plenty of places to walk to for food or just to check out and the taxi service was also excellent. Fun times!

Since Caesars Palace covers a very large portion of it's land property this review is particularly solely in regards to Caesars Palace Conference Center area. I have experienced and walked around Caesars Palace as a whole many times in the past but this review is for people whom are looking into reserving their conference rooms for events, meetings..etc. 

Firstly, Caesars Palace Conference Center's are located upstairs in two locations levels which are the Promenade Level and Emperors Level. Just FYI (For Your Information) the locations of their conference centers are not quite a ways away from the Ground\/Casino Level and even further away from the parking lot, short distance if you Valet Park or ride a taxi in from the front entrance of Caesars Palace.

Once you get to the Caesars Palace Conference Center's they are laid out and setup very elaborately with such historical Roman style detail it could be breathe taking to some that admire this type scene. The location is also very nice because from certain areas of the conference levels you'll have an excellent view of the Caesar's Garden of the Gods Oasis pool area looking out the side windows, it's awesome. The conference rooms themselves have all sorts of different sizes from small to very large areas, it all depends on what kind of event or meeting you will be holding and how many people will be attending. Caesars have a large variety of choices for rooms to choose from, they are very accommodating to what your needs are and will make your needs will be met with no issues.

Caesars Palace Conference Center's rooms can be set up to how you would like it to be set up. The rooms we had reserved had chairs, tables, projectors, water cooler, and coffee station with complimentary breakfast goodies (muffins, cookies..etc), stage and flat panel viewing screens. They also have a Receptionist Desk located in the area to take care of badges and other information you will need in order to provide access to your conferences\/meetings, they had nice amenities located all over through the largely spaced areas. Caesars was very good at refilling our coffee stations whenever we requested it and with quick service at hand. We had little\/minor issues but nothing too crazy and nothing that Caesars could not handle, they were very professional and courteous about meeting our needs and requests. I would definitely recommend the Caesars Palace Conference Center for people whom are looking to hold large events or meetings, but make sure your budget will be able to handle it.
I love staying here the buffet in this hotel is delicious variety of food cultures . Super clean and elegant huge plus compare to other hotels in Vegas

Reviewing for their Buffet:

Ambiance:  roomy and airy.  I like the ambiance.
Selection of buffet:  very limited (an embarrassment for the name of the hotel \/ casino:  "..Palace"???)  
Taste of main dishes:  at par with any cheaper restaurant offering buffet (like Golden Coral)
Dessert selection:  plentiful BUT taste???  Now don't get me started.  The creme inside the fruit cups had a very bland taste that I only took the fruit cups so that I could scrape the minute berries atop the cup.  The consistence of the creme varied from cup to cup so that tells me that not all dessert offered were freshly made.  The chocolate \/ mocha variety pudding like in small plastic cups was just blah.  I'm very much disappointed with this place, so I won't be coming back.

Ive played poker in practically every room in this town.... But never Ceasars Palace. 
I Went and to find out they have a great bunch of dealers \/ floor pepole. They all made you feel as you were a regular... That's how All poker rooms should be treating  there Customers! ( but they don't)
I'll be going back!,  just because they make you feel Welcome & at home!

I thought the point of the casino was the make a profit, but this place is too incompetent to even get that right. My wife wanted to play black jack for the first time but the lady who was dealing was the rudest individual I have ever dealt with professionally. I understand a lot of the dealers in casinos are not the nicest people but this one took the cake. She sighed, rolled her eyes, raised her voice, etc.. More important, she was highly inappropriate. She became frustrated on the FIRST hand and flipped over my wife's cards right after dealing. I am not a black jack expert but even I know that you are not suppose to be looking at the players' face down cards during the middle of the game. I am glad I was only here for two nights. Will never be coming back.

Can't tell you about the hotel or food here.
Shops are great at the Forums.
Casino here leaves something to be desired. : \/

Caesar's Palace is one of my favorite places on the Strip. From the extremely ornate decor to the upscale shopping at the Forum next door, you can't go wrong at Caesar's. It's certainly an experience through and through. The casino is is great and the bartenders are dressed up in Roman outfits. The lobby is beautiful, though quite full of people at all hours. The pools are insanely neat, and the cabanas are nice for some relief from the sun. There are two or three pools and hundreds of lounge chairs, so even when the pool area is busy, there are still tons of places to lounge and chill. Caesar's is one of the best.

I guess the days of free drinks are over in the Sports Book.  That said, Caesar's is one of my favorite books, with about 8 huge screens for various events plus another pair for the ponies.  The chairs are very comfortable if you can get a seat, otherwise it could definitely stand to be expanded, which I am sure will not happen.

A great place to watch a game.

JR at the players club was very nice. He helped us with all of our questions and recommended places for us to go while we were in town. 

This hotel is absolutely incredible. One its huge, two its gorgeous any employee we encountered was very kind. Some day we will stay here. We are working our way up to this place.

They did however send us a birthday drink  for being a part of Total Rewards, you don't have to use it here but make sure you stop by one of the players club booths and get a list of the places that accept the credit because some of them don't.

Surprisingly ordinary.

I stayed in the Roman Tower, since the conference I was attending was at Caesars. I was actually pretty excited about staying here, since it's still the original megaresort and has a great 5-star reputation.

I was disappointed with the room overall. My room (585) was pretty large, but oddly triangular. There was no desk to do work. WiFi was an extra charge, so the lack of a desk really mattered. There was a wired connection behind the TV, but I would have had to sit on the floor to do work...

There was a separate tub and shower in the bathroom, which was long and narrow like a train car. Oddly, there was no shelf\/ledge in the shower and the shampoo\/conditioner kept falling off the soap dish. The towels themselves seemed worn and over bleached.  And does Caesars not have robes for the guests?? Maybe my room just didn't have them; In a 5-star hotel, a robe would be nice. 

I am absolutely NOT a stickler about luxury details.  Normally, as long as the room is clean and the shower works, I'm happy. 

But in this case, a 3-day midweek stay will run my bosses about $600. In the middle of December, most hotels on the strip are half that...

Stay in the newly renovated Julius tower it is amazing! New beds, and an awesome bathroom with double sinks and a huge shower with both a fixed ceiling shower head and a hand held shower head. We had a great stay!

I love Caesars Palace, but it sure has changed.

*I talk about back in the day like I'm in my 50's, if you couldn't already tell.*

One thing I really miss is the original facade. Caesars has always been one of the tackier places, but now it's just TOO tacky. I miss the original gold plated alcove over the main entrance and I LOVED the glowing blue towers. And the area outside is just a mess. The nice gardens and driveway were replaced with that Roman Plaza thing which makes getting in and out the place kind of a mindfuck. 
There also used to be a HUGE arcade and motion-simulator theater in the basement of the Forum Shops. I had many fun days at those places as a kid. Good times.
I'm happy Cleopatra's Barge is still around though, what kid didn't want to rub the bosom of Cleopatra's figurine?
Another thing I remember is the Race For Atlantis. It was a motion-simulator thing right next to the Atlantis show(fittingly enough), now it's just a giant, gloomy open space. 

As for things that are there NOW, the Colosseum is a very nice theater. Not a single seat is very far from the stage. The food court next to it though definitely doesn't seem to be worth trying. And I LOVE the Forum Shops(even though I can never afford anything).

Oh Caesar, I love how you're nice enough to let peons like me roam freely through your palace.
LOVE THIS PLACE! The pools were amazinngg! Such comfy beds.... Great services.. LOVE LOVE the casinooo!

There is nothing about Caesars Palace that does not scream Las Vegas. The rooms are all good, clean, and way above average...though Augusta Tower is much better than Palace Tower.

There are great dining options, including big name chefs. The shopping is spectacular...I can get lost inside of the Forum Shops for days at a time!!!

I am a Diamond member at all Harrah's owned properties, so parking is a cinch. However, if you are not then don't expect any valet parking on the weekends. Self parking is convenient enough...but hey, it's Vegas so I valet every time. 

The table games are always busy and the Poker Room is secluded, which makes it unique. The table limits seem to be a bit more than other casinos, but I guess that's the price of admission. Don't expect to find any $2 Blackjack tables or even a $1\/2 game in the Poker Room. 

Caesars Palace is a must...and worth visiting every time you are in Vegas. It's classic, iconic, and a must-see\/stay!!!

I spent Saturday to yesterday at Caesars Palace.   It is a AAA, Four Diamond luxury hotel and casino located on the Las Vegas Strip, between the Bellagio and the Mirage. The hotel has 3,960 rooms in six towers: Augustus, Nobu, Roman, Palace, Octavius and Forum (I was in the Forum tower).  It's a HUGE space and I initially found myself overwhelmed when I arrived.  But once I got my bearings and figured out where everything was I was okay.

I liked my room.  The view from my room was fabulous!  My bed was so comfy!  There were buttons next to the bed opened and closed the blinds and sheers!  When the blinds were closed, I had no idea what time it was it was that dark.  Rather than hanging a "Do not disturb" sign on the doorknob, you indicate on a panel which is just inside the room if you want your room made up or not.  Just on the other side of the door outside in the corridor, the light is either red (do no disturb) or green (make up the room) or nothing.  I've never seen this before.

The toilet was in its own room within the bathroom.  There was a phone in the toilet room.  It took me a day to figure out that on the bathroom wall was a remote control for the TV in the bathroom mirror!  There was no tub but a huge shower.

A few times I took a stroll through the Forum Shops, which is a shopping mall connected to Caesars Palace. It has been consistently ranked as one of the most successful shopping malls in the world and is the highest grossing mall in America, with higher sales per square foot than Rodeo Drive in Beverly Hills, California.  It includes more than 270 mid-range and luxury retailers, gourmet restaurants and bars.  The ceilings are painted like the sky

I'm not a gambler and there were machines and tables EVERYWHERE!  Surprisingly people are allowed to smoke in the casinos so it was gross walking through them to get to my room.

The weather was sunny and hot (27C) and I spent an hour one day by the pool.  You rent the loungers ... I'd just grabbed an old ratty non-cushioned one.  I heard cabanas go for about $450 a day

There was a mandatory $28US\/day resort fee and that includes WIFI for two devices, local phone calls and two passes to the fitness centre.  My room was $260US\/day including taxes and resort fee.

It was fun to stay here and experience it!
Great Place to Hang Out in Vegas!!!  Her shops are the most amazing!  Great shopping always!  A must when you're in Vegas!

My husband reserved a non-smoking room here months in advance and informed the staff we would be arriving late. The self check kiosk informed us our room was not yet ready. At midnight?!?! Then we had to wait in line to check in. We were told all the non-smoking rooms were booked up?! I was irate when they responded they wouldn't move us after we told them I am pregnant (AND CLEARLY SHOWING) and was concerned for the health of our unborn child. We arrived to the room and it reeked of cigarette smoke. We called and expressed our dissatisfaction and requested to switch rooms. They didn't honor our request. 

The next morning they moved us to a non-smoking room. Residual hair in the shower drain, residue on the mirror, and small room with a terrible view of the wall. But it's non-smoking--I'll take it!

Bottom line: Take your Vegas winnings elsewhere. There are more places on The Strip that value hospitality.

I lived that I got a good room rate, I understood that there were resort fees. I liked that there was online check-in. Here's the WARNING - don't accept the $25 early check-in. It's says they will notify you when the room is ready before you get there. I did not receive a notification. When I arrived at 2p I went to the desk and was told they had a room available. I asked if I was going to be charged for the early check-in from online and the guy said no. On checkout, it is on my bill. I called, explained and Javier said that's the way it is because I got the room before 4pm. No discussion, that's the rules. For $25 I won't be back here. Venetian is way better with guest services and a much fresher hotel.

This was my second time at Caesars. We had a great stay, loved the pool, courteous service, nice spacious room, etc. I received an email the day after my return from Edward in guest services stating the tv in our room was not operational, so I would be charged $1000.00 plus tax for the repair. We NEVER turned the tv on during our stay. So beware.....test the tv before you spend your cash. (I am disputing this.)

Needs to improve in check in times. , staff take to long.  Also needs better maintance. Our bathrooms sliding door lock was broken.  Also this party vibe not so good.  The Omnia club is hidden.  Should have been built closer to front lobby.  Also Valet parking is too far from my tower.  The hotel is built with towers way to far from eachothet.  Be ready to walk alot.

Seriously I have never imagined myself joining yelp to write a review.

DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL EVER!!!!!
I am a frequent Las Vegas traveller. I have been to several hotels on the strip. I try to use different hotel ever time I go to experience differently.

This time, I chose Cesar's Palace because of their package deal with Celine Dion show and the room. When I made the reservation over the phone, they forced me to get an expensive room with an excuse of a package deal. When I asked them about the daily rate and the concert ticket price, they told me that they do not know the break down of the package. Yet, they told me to get a more expensive room... Duh

Since the package deal was cheaper than getting their cheapest room and the concert tickets seperately, I agreed  to purchase the deal.

So I arrived at 8am, found out the room was not ready. They told me they are highly occupied that I have to wait. GUESS WHAT??!! I WAITED FOR 8 HOURS!!!!! 8 F* HOURS! After a long tired trip, my family had no other place  to go but to stay in our car!!!! I took an alternative room with a single bed when I reserved for two queen beds because my family were too tired!!!! I asked for a free roller bed which they agreed. They said they would deliver immediately. HOWEVER "IMMEDIATELY" MEANT 3 HOURS AND 1 COMPLAINT CALL FOR CESARS PALACE!!!!!

The best is yet to come; CELINE DION SHOW GOT CANCELLED WITOUT ANY NOTICE. They told me all tickets will be refunded. Since I purchased one of my 3 tickets with the front desk, the box office told me that I need to back to them. So on the following day, which was my check-out day, I told the front desk about the ticket refund as I was checking out. The front desk told me that I need to talk to box office, which I did. Then the box office told me to talk to the front desk again. None of them knew how to process the refund for 2 tickets purchased through package and 1 ticket purchased at the front desk.

Back at the front desk, I asked to this one representative for the break down of my package deal. Then he gave me another copy of the room use summary which I received as I checked out. I asked him to give me the breakdown of the package again however he doesn't understand again. Instead he ORDERS me to listen to him that he is going to explain all. Then he starts to explain the room usage break down doing simple mathematics as he is a teacher. How arrogant and  stupid.

That's when I got just furious!!! Not only he is not understanding, he was too arrogant!!!! Every time I tried to ask for what I wanted, he would just order me to listen. When my volume raised up little bit, he orders me to quite down that if not, he would call the security. I COULD NOT BELIEVE THAT A CUSTOMER SERVICE REPRESENTATIVE AT A HIGH-END HOTEL THREATENING THEIR CUSTOMER!!!!!

Here is my recommendation to all of you looking to purchase a package deal from Caesars. JUST WISH THAT YOUR RESERVED SHOW WILL BE ON AIR OTHERWISE YOU JUST HAVE LOST YOUR HUNDREDS OF DOLLARS!!!!!

We have been here for four days, and we are leaving tomorrow. There are some children here, but it's not as friendly as insane as other casino resorts.  I wish that they had a play area like the New Orleans.  I would also like to see more smoke-free areas.  The restaurants are wonderful wonderful here. The buffet is the best but they get to Caesars hotel chain.  Not only does the food look great, including the desert, but it tastes wonderful too!  We booked an upgraded room in the Augustus Tower.  The jacuzzi bath wonderful. I'm going to miss it when I return home.  The jets are very powerful.  The street noise is a little heavy on Flamingo, from level 28; however, the view of the strip is pretty good.  The last time we were here two years ago, and this is a much improved trip.

Caesars has been by far one of my favorite hotels in Las Vegas.  

Here are my pros and cons about my views on Caesars...

Pros

- centralized location of the strip
- easy access to north & south end of the strip via monorail from Bally's
- clean and intricately decorated
- unique architecture
- very friendly staff
- clean and large sized rooms equipped w\/modern tech
- nice selection of eateries

Cons

- not impressed w\/the casino--could be a little bigger
- self-parking too far from the parking garage
- room rates are slightly higher than what I wish but no complaint
- elevators are far from the casino floor and long walk to the front   
   entrance


Overall

I would stay here anytime whenever I get a chance to come out to Vegas even for a few days.

Great location, but overpriced given what you receive for your money and what's available nearby. I spent a lot of money for a room, and the room was large, but nothing especially impressive. Plus, my room was dark and not well lit. The hotel itself is crowded, noisy, and difficult to navigate. You tend to get lost walking long distances through noisy casino floors to get to your room. At luxury prices, it doesn't provide a luxury experience. 

The staff is helpful and friendly, but they are overworked-- when I asked if the bell desk could bring down my luggage from my room,
I was told it would take 20 minutes for them to get to my room. That's not the kind of service I expected. 

The buffet is worth experiencing, but other than Nobu, the other restaurants are nothing special.

The ambiance at some other well-known hotels on the Strip is much nicer and when you realize that their rooms can be had for half the price, you wonder why anyone bothers with the tacky chaos of Caesars Palace.

Thanks God we didn't stay here Worn  Dated and Slimy that's all I can say looks like original carpet in the casino also the smoke is more prevalent here for some reason Maybe because of all the hillbillies with there vapor cigs and pipes Thought I was at a tattoo convention but no it's the regular guests

I don't know about the rooms as I have never stayed in one but as a local I know that Caesars Palace is a safe bet to go if you need to venture down to the strip.

Eats:
Mesa Grill (Think Bobby Flay)
Max Brenner (Chocolate wasted)
Payard (French desserts)
Guy Savoy (Fine fine fine dining)
[Update] Bacchanal Buffet (Buffet)

Entertainment:
Absinthe
Musical artists such as Celine Dion, Elton John, Shania Twait.
Fountains of Caesar's Palace.
The pool(s) is really nice, one of the top hidden pools we have in Vegas.
Pure Nightclub (Still going hot)

Shopping:
Forums Shop (Window shopping has never been so sweet).

Here's a pro tip for my friends with Yelp benefits, this Hotel accomodates pets (dogs to be precise).  Call the front desk and ask.  A pet friendly hotel!  And another tip, finding Caesar's and parking is so much easier if you know about Industrial Road.

In conclusion, Caesar's Palace is the first choice of hotels on the Strip I like to take family or friends from out of town and the occasional dates here or there.  Photos opportunities are a plenty but this stepping stone review should allow you to discover more to Caesar's than what I may have mentioned, enjoy.
Not a bad hotel to stay in at all. Lovely rooms.  But make sure you ask for a tower that's connected\/close to the front desk or else you'll be walking forever to your room.

RUDE AND INCOMPETENT SECURITY + OUTDATED ROOM + POOR MANAGEMENT

This is a one-star coming from a person who couldn't care less when it comes to hotel rooms. I've stayed at the Motel 6 and was even fine with it, so to say that my experience at Motel 6 TRUMPS my experience at the Caesars Palace really means something.

1. Outdated rooms. Step up your game, Caesars. Even Circus Circus has all their rooms fully renovated.

2. All our room keys suddenly stopped working the second night even though we had the room checked out for three nights. What? We were extremely tired and all we wanted to do was come back for some rest, but were locked out and had to inconveniently go downstairs to be issued new keys.

3. After working in customer service for more than seven years, I have a lot of empathy for the people who work behind the counter. I understand there are some bad days and some customers just ask for it, but what I got from the incompetent security guard was unacceptable and uncalled for. All I wanted to do was to pick up a binder that was left behind by my friend who had the room checked out to her. My friend spoke to the hotel manager about the situation prior to my arrival and he told her to let me know the procedure: Go to security - get housekeeping involved - get the binder.

This security guard made my life so much harder by playing games, asking who specifically stayed in the room even when I gave him the name of who the room was checked out to, saying the room wasn't checked out to her even though it WAS, playing with the pronunciation of names, making me walk all the way to the front desk even though he knew the power was in his hands to just call housekeeping up for the item, making up "issues" even though the hotel manager clearly said THOSE WEREN'T ISSUES to begin with.

Basically, this guy just wanted to come off as if he knew everything and made up his own procedures to kill his boredom. I ultimately got the item after more than an hour of dealing with his incompetence and his need to go on a power trip.

4. No apology from the hotel manager even though he knew exactly what the dbag security guard was doing. 

To top it all off, this whole security fiasco made it a sour start to my birthday. I recommend this place to no one.
The Roman Tower is very dated and run down. Our room wasn't even cleaned today. Very disappointed.
Charming architecture and decor, great for photography and admiration. If you are planning to dine here, you are looking at around $50 per person, give or take.

I visit Vegas about 3 times a year because it's the only weekend get away I have time to take due to my busy work schedule. I love the rooms in Augustus Tower with views of the Bellagio Fountain, amazing spa amenities and Bacchanal Buffet. The Forum Shops are very convenient for all the times I forget to pack make up, sunscreen, shorts or a bathing suit. I like the selection of slots and have won quite a bit this past year. Caesars is one of the few hotels that does not charge for parking which is an added value. The excellent staff, service and overall experience at Caesars keep me coming back for more each year.

Beyond amazing customer service from Jack Poma and the rest of the family at Caesar's Palace! My dad needed some assistance from the paramedics and the staff was so quick to respond and get him a wheelchair as they were already helping someone else out! Jack Poma pushed my dad (a big guy) from the casino to our car!!! What a guy! Thank you so much!
Terribly slow service. Took us 45 minutes to check in. Only 2 people who were helping ppl out in the middle of the night.

I can not believe I'm in a Vegas hotel! 
The room is so run down and the service is horrible! We asked for someone to fix the room safe yesterday and we are still waiting the next day
There is no hot water and a huge water (probably mold) stain in our shower. 
I think the worst problem is that no one cares here they seem to have the philosophy that the guest is just not important. We also called them prior to our stay for a car service to pick us up at the airport and they never showed after waiting almost an hour we left. 
Vegas can be a magical experience I just wouldn't look for it at this hotel.

Staff here is amazing.  My sister passed out in front of the hotel and two different staff members ran over to us with Gatorade and water.  We weren't even staying there.  It was very much appreciated.  will definitely look into staying here next time.

The rooms are very comtemporary. The bathrooms have a tub and shower. The tub has jets so it could be a jacuzzi. But who needs that with the 4 different pools they have and they are gorgeous.  Be sure to get down there early as all the good seats in the sun get swiped quickly. The housekeepers are really nice and honest. Valet has 3 separate spots plus the valet in the forum.

This is not my first choice when in Vegas, but the conference I was attending was there, so no choice. First impression was pretty bad. Walked in to the lobby and immediately noticed the odor of cigarette smoke. Walked up to the registration area where there were clusters of people here and there, but no discernable line to get into. i asked a group of people if they were in line and they didn't know either, so I just got behind some people near one of the open stations. 

Check-in was friendly and went quickly, so no complaints. Long walk through the smoky, noisy, crowded casino to the Forum Tower where I was staying. Short wait for elevators. 

The room was nice and clean, except for the faint smell of smoke. It was a non-smoking room. Bed and pillows were comfortable, nice shower, good water pressure, spacious bathroom. There was a coffee maker but the coffee powder cups aren't free. The sign next to the coffee maker didn't say saying anything about cost, but tells you where the K-cups are located. Once you find it, there's small print on the box that says you will be billed if you opened the box. I thought that was sneaky. Wi-Fi was not free. 

Everything in the room worked fine except the air conditioning. It would emit this loud buzzing sound until I shut it down and re-start. This was very annoying. The first time I heard it, I opened my door to look in the hallways because I thought it was a fire alarm, then finally realized that it was coming from the air conditioning unit above my room door. I didn't bother calling house keeping, because it was late, I was tired and since I was checking out in the morning I tolerated it. 

I used the video check-out, but noticed a discrepancy with the bill, so had to go to the registration desk. Again, a bunch of people scattered here and there, but couldn't make out a 'line'. Once I got to an open station it went quickly and the service was friendly. The customer service rep cleaned up my bill without a fuss. My bill had multiple room service charges, even though I hadn't ordered any room service, nor had anything from the mini bar. 

It wasn't a great value for $200+ a night, I doubt I'd stay there again unless it was conference related.

NO FREE WIFI FOR MORE THAN ONE DEVICE! What did i pay that ridiculous resort fee for?

Location is great and the pool is awesome. Rooms, not so much. They are nice but a little worn, unless you are staying in the newest tower which is quite nice.
I love this casino. We went there to gamble and it was so much fun. I don't know when you walk in it just feels different. Next time I will stay there.

Very impressed with their self check-in kiosks. No need to wait in line at the front desk. I was in town for business. Got a very nice room on the 26th floor In Palace Tower. Caesars is not as generous as before but still has a lot of class. Would stay here again since I know my way around so well. Lol.

I've been to Caesars Palace many times over the years with my many trips to Vegas; however, I finally stayed there a few months ago for a couple of nights during a work trip.  Check-in was pretty bad.  The lines were super long and I had to wait until after 3pm before being able to get a key to my room.  Speaking of the room, once I finally received a key, I entered my room and was extremely happy.  I stayed in the Octavius Tower, which was divine.  The bathroom was clean and spacious, the bed linens were soft, and the bed itself was plush (for a hotel).  There was a sofa and chair in the room, which I didn't get to use, but they definitely added to the feel of the room making it comforting and "homey".

The room service was stellar.  The pizza I ordered came within 30 minutes and the server laid everything out for me. 

Overall, the hotel itself is really nice.  The place is huge, so you can easily get lost in there.  But, most hotels in Vegas are big.  

The hotel being called Caesars Palace holds true...its definitely a palace.  I'd recommend it to anyone wanting an energetic environment with lots of restaurant choices and easy access for shopping.  It's right in the middle of the strip, so getting around isn't hard at all.  I'm a fan!

One of the top hotels in Las Vegas. In recent years, the hotel continued to increased in size to accommodate demands. Personally, I think it lost some of the charm that made Caesars such a spectacular hotel from years ago. There are numerous entrances to various parts of the monstrous hotel. You can get lost quite easily.

The Forum shopping area is beautiful. While there, you need to watch to live water\/light shows at the end of the walk. The show is spectacular. My other favorite thing about this hotel is the buffet. After eating so many buffet over the years, they become boring and bland. Caesar Buffet concentrates on quality, not quantity like most other hotels. It is a little more expensive but worth it.

My last visit to Caesars was about 12 years ago and it really has grown. They've added a whole new building just for shopping and restaurants. The hotel has also added a new building as well as a food court for outside dining. There's tons of shops, mini stores and restaurants to see and taste. 
The whole strip was given a face lift.

I really enjoy staying at Caesars but I was really disappointed when we arrived this time for a surprise getaway for my moms birthday and our rooms were in separate towers. Then I ended up having to sleep on a rollaway bed because the 2 queen bed rooms that we were told we were getting were actually sold out. 

I've never experienced this type of problem before. They offered to move us to an upgraded suite for the remainder of the stay and even transferred our luggage for us. The rest of the stay was wonderful. We enjoyed a concert and a full day in their amazing spa. We will definitely return sooner than later.

We came to try our hand at this famous casino.  They had plenty of cheap casino games, which I liked, but according to one player, the odds of winning here were pretty low compared to places, like Bellagio and Mandalay Bay.  At those places, he actually won.  But at this casino, he lost everything he won and then some - and he played the exact same game everywhere for comparison's sake.

When I first came to Vegas this is where I stayed. Not much has changed since that time. 

It's not the most amazing hotel anymore as there are truly other hotels that make this place look outdated, but it still has a very special place in my heart. I love Roman history, so you can imagine my love of all things Roman this place has. 

The standard rooms aren't very big and you would expect more from them, but it's fine. There are really awesome statues here as well that make me feel like I'm in ancient room if they had slot machines! Oh yeah. 

This isn't a bad place, but with more impressive hotels being built day by day, it's slowly become a bit more outdated.
This place never dissapoints...the restaurants are good and the rooms have a luxurious feel...the forum shops are a must do ... imo one of the best places to stay in vegas

Another awesome "Boys" trip to Las Vegas to watch some basketball, throw some cards and empty some slots.  

Our host took absolute great care of us again this year despite being super busy with NAS Car,  3 NCAA Conference Basketball Tournaments and a huge CONEXPO CON.  

At check-in our attendant did all she could to accommodate all our requests and did it with a smile and a great sense of humor.  Caesars should be proud of how well trained their staff is in the art of "Customer Service" as they're all first-class.  

Harrah's has done a remarkable job with upgrading and rebranding their other properties like the LINQ, Harrah's and the Flamingo.  Their new looks and restaurants make it easy to keep our play (or otherwise known as donations) within the Harrah's family.

Thank you Caesars for accommodating us the past 6 years and we look forward for many more to come!!!

When I was younger, it seemed like Caesars was the class of the Vegas strip.  Now it just seems like some gigantic corporate place designed to jam as many people in as humanly possible.  The amount of foot traffic at all times is annoying, and the clientele has seriously declined in my opinion.  The hotel itself is nice, staff is nice, and the place is well maintained but it's just too busy and crowded for my taste.  Think I'll try somewhere else next time.

Just got here. Checking in is a NIGHTMARE. The lines are so long and the agents are taking their sweet time. This has been the worst check in process of my life. They really need to train their agents to be more efficient.

It looks really nice hotel and grandiose. You have to pay more money for that. Acutally you have to be careful about the charges. I just got this experience last week. They have mini bar. We just looked at it and put it back . They charged me $25 dollars for moving items. They should have put sign for it like " if you don't use , don't touch anything and will charge $25 ". We saw coffee machine but no coffee packages. When i called, said they couldn't supply complementary coffee. So i was amazed that big hotel like this couldn't supply for it. Anyway , that was my new experience about this hotel. 
Hope this can help to other people who want to stay in this hotel.
