FYI-I thought we would get a huge bill from the rose petal stains on the white comforter, thankfully didn't.  So go for the romance and don't fret!
4 hour plus wait for table of 6 at buffet - what a mistake - don't bother - so many other options!  Would give 0 stars but can't !

Nice hotel and casino. Rod Stewart plays here. Watch out for that guy that asks "where are you from" he wants to sell you timeshares...  There is attached shopping stores and it is pretty cool to see.

Forum Shops a blast.
Makes me wish I was filthy.
Filthy-rich, dumbass.

Caesars is def a must see if in vegas! the property itself is beautiful. There are tons of stores if you feel like exercising your credi card. 

When i went this time the fountains were not working which was a disappointment, I was traveling with someone who has never been to vegas and one of the things i wanted to show them was the moving statues in the forum. Sadly they were down for maintenance. 

The casino is huge so be prepared to walk, there were some new games i did not recognize. All in all it is worth the stop into Caesars

I have nothing but GREAT things to say about Caesars. Yes, it is a huge, expansive property. But it has everything!!! 

I have been to Vegas many times, typically I don't spend much on the room because it Vegas!!! Go out and do something!!! We were at Caesars for a convention and I wanted a room with a view. My original room was in the Palace Tower, did the $20 trick and was upgraded to Augustus Tower with an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains, Paris area. Best view I've had anywhere. Room was king bed, tons of space, jacuzzi tub for one, separate shower, flat panel tv you could see from the jacuzzi........totally sweet room, clean, classy, spacious. HIGHLY recommend the Augustus tower with a view. 

Although I donated my share of monies in the casino, there was a great selection of games, tables (although mins were higher than your average place) and bars. Drink service was outstanding wherever we were at in the casino or in a lounge. I'm not a nightclub person, although we did go to Pure one evening. Seemed nice, not my scene.....I'm more of a lounge person. 

Checkout first thing n the morning was a bit long, but it moved pretty fast, as did check in. I would stay again in a heartbeat!
Top of the line resort with top of line employees and restaurants. The hotel is kept very clean and organized and the casino has a great atmosphere.

We arrived at caesars palace at about 2:30pm and checked in but the room was not ready the front desk said it would be ready at 4pm so we walked around the hotel casino and ate then we went to check in again like 10mins after 4pm and the room was still not ready and this other front desk employee said the room get ready between the hours of 4pm and 6pm Caesars palace hotel and casino is very disorganized and are very inconvenient to there guest it was my first time to Las Vegas and if I ever go back I will never stay at Caesars palace hotel and casino ever again

Of all the casinos I've been to on the Strip, it's unfortunate that Caesar's ended up being my least favorite. Everything seems so disorganized except the game tables, which are located in the "middle" of the floor; the video poker tables are in another area. You have $1\/$2 machines mixed with the 25-cent and 1-cent games, while the roulette games are thrown in with the pop culture themed slots in another area like they're an after thought. 

The hotel itself is beautiful, hence why it's constantly cited in movies and the like. The Romanesque sculptures and architecture is definitely appealing--the exterior and interior; the lobby alone is gorgeous. The Forum Shops at Caesar's Palace resembles an upscale mall, with both upscale boutiques and common stores. Aside from the Bacchanal, Caesar's has great restaurants including Nobu and Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill. Moreover, Caesar's is also one of the conveniently located hotels on the Strip; it's close to other major hotels, shows, restaurants, and other attractions. There's the main entrance with the roundabout, but if you're walking, you could take the bridge connected to Bally's and the Bellagio, then take a right towards the door that will lead you to the Palace's grounds.

Because Caesar's is one of the older hotels on the strip, your experience is really going to vary based on which tower you are put in. 

The first time I stayed here, I stayed in the Augustus Tower - amazing view, huge soaking tub, flat screen TV in the bathroom, and generally a lovely room that was pristine. However, my last visit to Vegas this past weekend has changed my opinion of Caesar's. What I thought was an upscale luxury casino and hotel quickly became a disappointing, lackluster hotel, with rooms that were comparable to a Motel6. 

I had 3 nights booked and once I checked in, I was thoroughly disappointed with the accommodations. The first night, I stayed in the Roman Tower. Clearly one of the oldest towers, if not THE oldest tower at the resort. I requested a high floor and a room close to the elevator. I was put in the room farthest from the elevator and on the fifth floor. I had the not-so-awesome view of the top of the vents of the casino. The ice machine on the fifth floor didn't work either.

I called the front desk to explain that I wasn't exactly thrilled with the room. The first time I called, it seemed like I was disconnected randomly. I called again and was able to speak to someone after holding a couple of minutes. The front desk attendant said he heard that the lower floors were having issues with the ice machines and that he would send a bucket of ice to my room from room service free of charge. This didn't fix the problems of the moldy smelling hallways, torn curtains, and overall disgusting room. Because the hotel was booked for the night, they weren't able to move me to a different tower, but then I was told that I should try again the next day because there were going to be some openings.

I ended up calling the front desk 5 different times - each time, the attendant told me something different. "I wasn't aware the ice machines weren't working." "There isn't any availability in other towers." "The only higher floors are smoking floors." "The whole tower is a non-smoking tower." "I can move you to a higher floor." "There's no availability on a higher floor." I even went to the Total Rewards counter to see if they would have more success because I was there as a VIP. The Total Rewards assistant really tried her best, but it seemed as if she was dealing with the same incompetent group of people on the phone - considering, she was placed on hold for a good 10 minutes. 

I eventually made my way to the front desk and spoke to someone - which was the best way to go. The attendant (I think her name was Tiffany) spoke to her manager and she was given the go-ahead to move me to another tower if there was availability. Amazingly, she was able to find a room in the Palace Tower and she efficiently made the changes to my reservation. The Palace Tower is MUCH nicer than the Roman Tower - not as shiny and new as the Augustus Tower, but still nice enough. The windows were on the dirty side and the furnishings were older - a couple of knobs were missing from the TV stand, etc. 

I probably wouldn't pick Caesars for an upcoming trip to Vegas again. If I do, I'll be sure to specifically request the Augustus tower because I'd rather never step foot into the Roman Tower again in its current state.

This place is a little chaotic I must say.  I had to go to the far end of the building to find the guest suites.  Its huge.. got my workout in though.  The suites are very nice, I must say.  The only thing that I can really complain about is the long time that valet took bringing my car around.  It took forever and Im not sure why because there are tons of valet parkers.  Nice hotel, great staff.

Always enjoy our stays at Caesars. We were in the palace tower which had nice rooms---huge jet tub and delegate shower. We had our 2 year old with us this time and we were able to put a pack and play in the bathroom so she could sleep uninterrupted. This resort is so enormous, I feel like by the time I get my bearings, it is time to go home!

Great place to stay on The Strip!

PARKING: Self-parking is sooo far away from the check-in! You're gonna get a good workout walking there. Should've done valet.

ROOM: Stayed in the older tower, which smells like old vomit. Disgusting. The shops leading to the tower also smells, and across from the tower is the entrance to the pool, which also smells. Ughhhh every time I had to walk in that area, I tried to hold my breath because it was so bad! The room had a nice view of the pools, and it was very spacious! The bathroom had a shower stall, toilet, two sinks, and a jacuzzi! There was a nice vanity area in the room too. 

POOL: Suuuper nice pools! They have four pools and a bunch of seats to lay out in!

OVERALL: Would come back, but would request to stay in the other tower!

We stayed in a suite here for three nights thanks again to my gf's wonderful parents.
To describe this hotel in one word is "Grand." Caesar's Palace isn't just a hotel. It's a city; I wouldn't be surprised if they had their own unique zip code.

Architecture: Yeah yeah I know, it's Vegas; of course they have an endless amount of funds to build whatever they want. But still, I have to say that I was amazed & couldn't resist admiring the amount of craftsmanship put into every little inch of this place. The close attention to detail on their replicas of Rome landmarks is pretty incredible.

Food: We tried a few things at their food court. The pastrami & corned beef sandwich at BARBQ with the fries from the restaurant identified with no name, but a picture of a burger. Fries were bomb, and the sandwiches were pretty good. We also got the macho nachos at Ole! which comes in a giant bowl, the two of us got full off of just that. We also tried the Trevi restaurant which sits in the middle of their shopping forum by their beautiful fountain - I'll have a separate review for Trevi soon. I haven't tried their main Italian restaurant, the Raos, but we'll mos def try it next time.

Shopping Forum: The pretty much have everything here: LV, Gucci, Burberry, Tiffany's, Banana Republic, and a bunch of overpriced brands that I can't even pronounce.

Pool: I've been to other pools in Vegas and I've gotta say that Caesar's has my favorite pool. There's actually 5 pools here all located in one area, but one main one. The main is designed so that it's more like a fountain, where a statue\/monument type of thing is in the middle and the pool water surrounds it - quite beautiful. A small pina colada at the bar here is $14. eek. Another cool thing is they have tables to gamble at in one of the 5 pools. The players are waist-deep in the pool while they play at tables, while the dealers stand in the middle of the dry area of the pool - cool!!!

Room: The suite we had here was no "Hangover" status. Supposedly we were put in one of their older towers, so the tv & technology is a little outdated. At one of our mornings the bathroom lights just would not turn on for a while. This is my one and only gripe I have about Caesar's. Regardless of whether a tower has been made recently or was the first one made, they should do whatever they can to keep even their older towers updated to keep every single one of their rooms relevant. For a place like Caesar's, updating\/maintaining their rooms shouldn't be hard at all. Goodness, if they just sold one of their millions of statue replicas that's hidden away in the corner of their rooftops that nobody looks at, I'm sure it would accommodate for their fees to update their older rooms.

Conclusion - awesome place to play and stay at, check it out whenever you get the chance!

I enjoy going to Caesars Palace.  Although, it is one of the Strip properties that we have yet to stay in Las Vegas.  So, why am I a fan?  During my gambling days, the casino has been good to me.  Hey, any casino that I leave with more money than I came in with....I am going to be a fan of that place.  Since I've married, my serious gambling days are behind me.  Nowadays, my budget is $20 for gambling.

What else I like about Caesars Palace:

1.  The atmosphere and decorations are cool.
2.  The casino ventilation is much better than most other Vegas hotels.
3.  Celine Dion was amazing!
4.  Great place to people watch.
5.  They have Cheesecake Factory!!
6.  Browsing the Forum Shops.
7.  Centrally located on the Strip.

What i do not like about Caesars Palace:

1.  Actually, everything is fine.  No real complaints from me.  Sure, it's kind of pricey...but they are not overly priced on their hotel rates.

I do not know if we will ever spend the night here.  I do know that we will continue to come here in the future because of all the reasons listed above plus others not mentioned.

First time staying at Caesars Palace and boy is this hotel HUGE! Our experience had its greats and not so greats. Firstly check in wasn't too bad - our front desk associate was Leilani whom was very helpful and accommodating. She was able to check us in early, get us a quiet room towards the back and put us on a higher level away from the smoke and noise of the casino! Our room was your standard hotel room and definitely the room has a lot of wear and tear. Not a bad stay for one night! We were located in the Forum Tower which was very close to food and self parking. The pool was a little walk to get to but was so stunning! Lots of chairs to sit on and relax! My suggestion to Caesars Palace - use that outrageous $40 resort fee to update your rooms! Also get rid of charging for self parking - parking should always be free in Las Vegas!

I've stayed at 4 or 5 hotels on the Strip and Caesar's is continually my favorite.  I have stayed in the Palace tower and the Forum tower.  The Palace tower deluxe rooms are among the best in that price range.  Beautiful.  The food court downstairs across from the Colosseum is yummy, the pools are beautiful, and the staff is incredibly friendly.    The Colosseum is BEAUTIFUL, I've been there three times to see Celine Dion.  Amazing.  We've eaten inside Caesar's at Mesa Grill which is ou t of this world if you are a fan of Food Network Chef Bobby Flay.  It is worth the extra money to get a deluxe room, I think the general rooms are the "old" rooms and they do need revamped.  I have never been disappointed at Caesar's Palace though, for sure.

Caesars Palace Las Vegas Hotel & Casino offers one of the best, and probably the largest hotel in Las Vegas, and probably the best bang for your Total Rewards.  It's a big boy hotel that resembles a real palace, with spectacular structures, views and art throughout the property.  It also has one of the best pools in Vegas; this picture speaks for itself: http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/user_local_photos?select=CJUrqehidg3Wo9QVx66KyQ&userid=p5RcabsU9DXQEDef9RiRlQ  The property also offers a mall, a very nice club with robotic lighting and several dance floors, and the best buffet in Vegas.  While it may be one of the oldest hotels, the property has been well maintained and upgraded through the years.

Rooms range about $500+\/night and offer various amenities; some even include shaving cream, razor, toothbrushes, etc.  Lucky for me, Platinum status often gets us comped.  Make sure to sign up for Total Rewards when you play.  Comped rooms make playing at the casino all worth it.

Never ever in my life will I spend another day in this disgusting place. Worst customer service, one of the cocktail waitresses in the casino was so rude & racist. They need to upgrade on their waitresses because she is the reason I will never step foot in Caesars Palace. And by the way try not to move around too much they might charge you for that too.

I would give 0 stars if I could. Horrible, so disappointed in our stay, after all it's Caesars so I expected so much more! No chocolates at turn down, no more robes, the walk to our room is 15 + mins and forget about valet unless you are 7 stars, or diamond members. The staff are rude, no one says hi or even acknowledges you. The sheets smelled like mildew and when I asked if they could change them, they housekeeper gave me a look that could kill. My complaints are too long to write here, besides it won't change anything. I will never, ever stay here again. And I will never, ever recommend anyone to stay here.
Attended the show for Elton John....great place!  I don't think anyone could sound bad in the Coliseum.  This place is beautiful.  Easy to get into and comfortable seating.

I have stayed here 3 times in the past and this weekend my mother and I went to celebrate her retirement! Little did we know our stay was about to be the worst one yet! We were told the bell men would hold our bags while we grabbed a drink and started our vacation. When we came back to get our bag a man named Jorge refused to give us our bag because we had not checked in- we hadn't gotten our room number yet because we were planning on spending more money to upgrade our room- after one of his coworkers told him to go get it he stormed off yelling "OH MY GOD THIS IS RIDICULOUS!" We shook it off that maybe he was having a bad day but now my neck pillow was missing and he walked off ignoring me that it was not still attached to my bag. Again, I shook it off. I wasn't going to let a pillow ruin my trip. So now we are in our room- carpet had not been vacuumed, hair in the bathroom sink and the wood furniture was scratched up. We tried to call the front desk but our room phone didn't work- then we tried to look up the phone number and wifi didn't work. We went down and they reset the modem but no phone the whole trip- we planned on ordering room service and Champagne to celebrate the retirement but couldn't do that without the phone working. We called for extra towels and were told that housekeeping was too busy so we used the same dirty towels all weekend (gross I know). When we were about to check out there was a hidden money amount charged to my card not the same price as what the bill originally said. They charged my card an extra $72 for god knows what. The front desk couldn't explain what it was and put me on told for 25min! We will be taking our business elsewhere next time- HUGE mistake to the hotel for not trying to make it right for us. We came prepped to get A bottle of champagne, upgrade our room, and spend money in the forum shops. We even purchased concert tickets through the hotel but I guess customer service has gone out the door for this place.

What I like about Caesars Palace is that it has what it takes to be a timeless casino. It's in a perfect location on the strip and the layout is wonderful. Truly one of the biggest icons of Vegas even though many of its neighbors has taken the spotlight away from it. This casino is definitely more upscale than others but fun none the less. The mood is alive and fast paced. I am filled with ambition and dreams when I walk into a casino like Caesars. This is a place that people want to experience when they come to Vegas. You see it in the films and coming here will do it justice. You can shop, eat and play your heart out here for your entire trip if you'd like. Though I feel Caesars can use a slight face lift to stay classy, I also know it is going in the right direction. Case in point, Omnia nightclub. Its moves like creating one of the best, if not the best, nightclub on the strip that makes me feel like I'm never going to waste my time by heading to Caesars. I'd like to see it continue its renaissance by parlaying its nightclub with better shows, headliners and pool parties but as we know, Rome was not built in a day! Overall, if you're looking to live out the Vegas experience and all it's glory, then Caesars needs to be on your bucket list!

Great experience. Beautiful room with jetted tub and a vanity built in to do your makeup. We felt like royalty. Also the valet staff and bellmen were so kind and remembered us when we came back again. The pool was gorgeous and they have servers who take your drink order at your lounge chair. Also they have sun block for sale and check your room card when you enter and hand you a towel. So there aren't outsiders at the pools. They have cabanas and nice cushiony lounge chairs to rent if you want to splurge but I don't think it's necessary. 

Overall, you could do so many things in this place alone that you don't have to actually go on the strip! It has a mall "the forum shops" which is gorgeous and has plenty of eateries. It has a "Qua Spa" which is an all day adventure in spa luxury with the robes, private lockers and all. 

Why the 4 star review: poor check-in experience. The staff is rude and unhelpful. And it also room half an hour in line to check in. I suggest you do the online check in but I don't know because we haven't done it ourselves. 

Tip: if you pick up the $13 m&ms they won't charge you if you place it back within 30 seconds. I accidentally did this when we first arrived!!

House keeping pulled rotten food out of our fridge... and left it on the counter in our room. I can't decide which is worse- the fridge not being checked between guests or the fact that it's still sitting here even after calling attention to it.

I unfortunately have to come here every other year for work - and each time I've been here the room has been horrendously dirty!!  From vomit spatters on the wall next to the sink and a lipstick stain on my pillowcase to some leftover, um, bodily fluids on the couch and curtains in my room, I really think this hotel is just super dirty.

As a disclaimer, I am impeccably finicky about cleanliness, but I really think this place is just super gross.

This has been a very disappointing experience for me. Caesars has lost their charm, it's not like it was 20-30 years ago. Very disorganized, no customer service, at all. They think they can fix it by offer a $50 credit when a Bloody Mary is $18? I was misinformed at check in they now have $500 tied up and can't refund for 6-8 weeks. I'm so over this place, I certainly won't return. I'm sure this place will end up like quite a few of the other classics, gone!

It's ok! I know many people swear this is the best place ever. Maybe at some point it was, but to be honest - I was not impressed. We won a trip to Vegas to see Mariah, and it included a room here. So we didn't pay for it, thank goodness. We had a room in the forum tower. We did have a nice strip view, and found the forum tower to be an easily accessible location. Our room was nice, but you know what bugs me - you can't use the frig - it's stocked with their stuff that they want you to buy (at very high prices - water was $7.50). They have a keurig coffee maker in the room, but no coffee - you have to buy it from the stash in the room ($13). For the prices they charge for the rooms, they could give a couple free coffees. Or a bottle of water! The daily services fee was $35, which I feel is high too & it doesn't include wifi. We were charged $13.95 for 24 hours of wifi. I felt gouged and we didn't even pay for the room. Bed was ok, felt like it was slanting, like I was going to fall out of the bed. Water pressure was really lacking. Furnishings were nice. Decor was nice. Location on the strip is excellent! Good food court, excellent shopping in the Forum Shoppes, All the staff are super friendly and helpful, so there are some positives, but we won't be staying here again.

Out of dozens of trips to Las Vegas, this hotel has the worst service!

I must first start out by writing I only chose to stay at Caesars because I was offered a complimentary stay and a $300 dining credit. When I arrived, I received a call in my room telling my which restaurants I could choose (so I was aware that the hotel knew the restaurant choices). The following night I visited the concierge so I could hear the list again since I didn't have a pen when the call was received the night prior. A restaurant was recommended to me as was instructions on how to claim the dining credit (since it was my first time using a credit). Unfortunately, the concierge was incorrect and that restaurant wasn't covered by the voucher. More unfortunate was the price of the bill. I had to pay $380 for a dinner at a restaurant that I didn't want to eat at, but was presumed to be free (for the first $300 anyway).

I understand the concierge made a mistake with the restaurant, but the hotel front desk and the concierge would not honor the mistake or even credit me for a future voucher. I'm confused that as a marketing tool, Caesars offered me a dining credit to entice me to stay at their hotel in the future but would rather lose thousands in opportunity costs for retaining me as a future loyal customer than honor a $300 mistake. Bottom line: I trusted their concierge, was extremely let down, and will never stay at Caesars again. There are plenty of great hotels in Las Vegas that understand the importance of loyal service and how it is cheaper for a hotel to retain customers than find new ones, and I'll be loyal to the first hotel that can demonstrate that they value my business. P.S. I spend thousands on gambling and entertainment every time I visit. It's not about the $300, it's about the service.

Pretty hotel though..

This is another enormous property in Vegas, and it's elegance is wonderful and affordable. Caesar's Palace is a great place to go with a few girlfriends and just chill in the gorgeous pools. Or a great venue for a bachelorette or bachelor party. The hotel has been around for years, but the columns everywhere make you feel like you're in Rome. There's lots of competition on the strip and hotels know this. There are always great deals with Caesar's Palace. 

Top headliners work out of this hotel: 
Jerry Seinfeld (September 18 & 19, 2015)--GO SEE JERRY SEINFELD some time in your life, cause we all know how funny he really is, but go, cause you will laugh and won't regret the price of a good ticket. If there's one comedy show you should see in your lifetime, it's JERRY. For me, when the show was over, my mouth was permanently stuck in a laugh, from laughing non-stop. I don't remember the comedian's name who warmed up for Jerry, but he was almost as good as Jerry. I was highly impressed with this show. Be prepared to pay big bucks for a close seat. There are plenty of TV's around the Colosseum if you're seated in the nosebleed section, like I was, at $100\/seat.

Celine Dion, Rod Stewart, Mariah Carey, Britney Spears, Elton John, Reba McEntire, and others all are performing here at Caesar's Palace's Colosseum. 

There are lots of 5 star restaurants here, including Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill. Nobu, Gordon Ramsey's restaurant & several others are located here.

Caesar's Palace is all about excess, everywhere. It's a Palace, after all. Both pools and rooms are gorgeous. I especially love they have many pools (7-of the Seven Gods), and they go up in opulence and amenities, depending on what pool you like that day. Nice to be able to have that choice. This hotel charges each 'visitor over 21' a fee when they come to visit friends, and to be able to hang out together at the pools. Both Caesar's Palace and Nobu Hotel use these pools, so they can sometimes get crowded.

Love this place though, and would go back in a heartbeat.
Beautiful hotel. Superior service. Great restaurants. Just a bit crowded. But loved everything about it.

I was just here for business... At a convention and I was "working" as an exhibitor. So basically I was on the expo floor talking to customers for hours... and then I would go back to my room... collapse and then roust myself and go back and do it again...

So I wanted food, a bed, that nice big tub with the jet, peace and quiet and whatever service I required... given quietly, with cheer and yet not too much and you know what?

That's the difference between a slightly "old school" hotel like Caesar's and a maybe hipper newer place like the Cosmo...  My room was great for my business trip.

If I had brought someone with me - I might have been disappointed because it was a mix of really great and then slightly cut corners here and there... so yes, I'd have been not happy with having been trying to "impress a girl" with it...

however... it's where i'd bring my Wife... Because Caesar's is 5 star service all the way.  If you know what that is... REALLY know what that is... then you know what I mean.  Unobtrusive... cheerful, quietly giving you what you want, when you didn't even know it's what you wanted.

For example. Room service... they offer to come back and clear the dishes an hour later. And they do.  That little added effort where they don't make you call them to come get the plates...  of course you want them cleared... that's the difference.

yea... the suite at TheHotel was more Impressive or the Balcony or Japanese Soaking Tub View of the Belaggio Fountain I had at the Cosmo last time... yes that is what I would bring someone who I was courting (yea, I was on another business trip and alone... ha.) but they made me call them to get my dishes and i Had to wait for them like two hours... and I ended up putting them outside the door so I could crash. So they forced ME to act trashy... ;)

I was surprised. I'd actually never stayed at Ceasars although I have dined and visited and enjoyed the casino... 

Oh... and the bed was awesome. Slept like the dead.

My Home away from Home...When my husband and I come to vegas this is usally the place we stay at.  Amazing food, amazing suites, and great service.  Gotta love being a Diamond member as our Host takes great care of us and sets us up with a beautiful suite with a beautiful view....how can u not love it? Celine Dion also sings here...also recommend Absinthe show here!

Caesers get 5 stars for the Forum Shops alone.

Other than that, this hotel is a classic. For being as old as it it, its really keeping up with the new faces in town. No matter, this place will always be a classic. I love it.

4 star hotel with a 1 star reception.  There were 3 separate counters with 1 staff on 1 line, while another counter has 3 staffs.  It took a good 20-25 minute to check in 1 customer !   After one hour or more of waiting it was my turn (I was only the 5th in this line) !  Makes me wonder if they are still using systems back in the '90.  If you don't want to pay a premium for this type of SLOW check in service, look elsewhere !

It was more like 4 1\/2 stars, since our stay wasn't flawless. In my opinion this was among the most aesthetically  pleasing casinos in Vegas. 
         It's not cheap, but our room was top notch. One of the most overused (but true) cliches is "You get what you pay for".  The room was spacious, exceptionally clean, and we had an awesome view of the strip from our window. However, my favorite feature was the giant jacuzzi tub with large roman tapestry designs on each size (I'm a sucker for large bathes). 
         My only minor complaint was with the room service. Our breakfast was about 15 minutes late and they forgot our sides. I know that sounds a little nit-picky, but for the price paid for the service, I felt it needed to be flawless.  
         I also appreciated the large fountain and aquarium in the shopping area and all the roman replica statues and busts. The casino\/shopping  area have a lot cool little details so be sure to look around.
         Overall, if the opportunity arose I'd be thrilled to stay here again.

Caesars has an online check in and then a kiosk where you can retrieve your key. This was the first time I had seen this and I love the efficiency. Thanks to this process it only took about 2 min to get my keys and then someone pointed me to the direction of the room. 
They had the same online process for checking out as well. 
The room was very nice and clean. We had a great view of the pool from the 64th floor. The fridge is only for the items in the minibar so it would have been nice to have a separate fridge.

I stayed the Caesars Palace Las Vegas Hotel & Casino from 8\/15\/15 - 8\/17\/15. This is my 2nd time staying at this hotel, I wasn't impressed the first go around and even more disappointed this 2nd go around. 

First off our check in started off on a bad note immediately. The young lady who was checking us in was extremely rude and when we tried to tell her we had booked a room with two beds she insisted that we had not done so, and continued to brush us off when we provided her our confirmation for our reservation which stated two double beds. 

So after a lot of back and forth with the bed situation we head up to the 12th floor to try and access our room # indicated on our key and to our surprise the door has a "do not disturb" flyer hanging from it. So that was strange we proceeded to try and scan our way in our room but nothing we tried numerous times with all the keys we had and still nothing. So we decided to knock since we could hear someone in the room and thought it could be the cleaning lady, and next thing you know a man comes out of the room. We felt so embarrassed standing there while trying to access the room that was given to us.  

From there we head back down to the lobby and a new front desk agent which was much more kinder assisted us and found out that the other agent had given us the incorrect room # to begin with and that was why the reservation only had one bed instead of two like we insisted to her in the very beginning when we were trying to check in. 

Finally we enter our room and to my surprise it's still EXTREMELY OUT DATED, and why I say STILL is because I stayed at this hotel before back in 10\/13\/11 - 10\/16\/2011. The room looked exactly the same, super old and crusty. To top it off they only provided (2 people) from each party access to their WI-FI, which of course didn't work for us since we had booked a room for 4 people and paid for 4 people NOT TWO! 

The room itself is very old and crusty NO FRIDGE, NO COFFEE POT, NO MICROWAVE, NO MINI BAR, NO BATH ROBE, NO IPOD PLAYER (they have a super old cd player by the bed), and their wall panels to charge our phones weren't all working so we had to take turns using the few that did work. Also, their phone to call the front desk wasn't working so there was no way to reach anyone in the lobby without actually traveling from 12th floor to the lobby. Not to mention that the phone that they had outside of the elevator didn't work either to reach them. And their check out option via their TV didn't work either, so we had to wait in a long as line in the lobby just to check out when it could have been avoided.  

One thing that really annoyed me that could have been an easy fix on the hotels end was that we wanted to really enjoy our window view from our room which over looked the pool but we couldn't because the whole window was plastered with water spots. For a hotel that charges so much damn money you would think they would quit being so damn ghetto and stingy. Since I wasn't able to get a good photo from our bedroom window due to how dirty our window was I figured id go take one from the elevators since we were on the 12th floor, and here we go again the one big window that over looked the pool in front of the elevators on the 12th floor is ALSO completely dirty and plastered with water spots all over it. So i was not able to get a single photo from any of our windows... 

ALL IN ALL I MUST SAY THIS HOTEL IS GARBAGE!! WAS GARBAGE WHEN I STAYED HERE IN 2011 AND IS STILL GARBAGE NOW IN 2015. NOT WORTH THE PRICE TO STAY HERE, THE ONLY THING THIS HOTEL HAS GOING FOR IT IS THEIR POOL, EVERYTHING ELSE IS A WASTE.

Great experience so far . Service has been spectacular . Anthony at the front desk was extremely helpful and took great care of us ! Only bad thing was the traffic getting into the valet on a Saturday night but overall great !

Loved my room, huge, bathroom was ridiculous. I would totally stay here again. Overlooked the pool, my only complaint was when I tried napping in the afternoon to rest up to go back out, the music from the pool was so LOUD that you could hear it in the rooms. Otherwise, great experience with checking in and the room being ready when we arrived. Cleaning crew did a good job. Beds were very comfortable.

Walking into Caesars palace is like walking onto the set of a very lavish "Ben Hur" with gaming tables. 

Caesars is home to the "Forum shops" and "Joes stone crab." with credentials like that, what more do you need?

First time in Las Vegas. Caesar's Palace was the right choice. The grandeur of this Hotel is outstanding. Food Was exceptional although most entrees are $ 26.00 at restaurants. Hard to justify $27.00 for cheese Omelet. 
Service was outstanding. Ivy was my concierge, she was able to arrange Limos on short notice to go to shows. 
This Hotel is 5 Star. Bell Hops, Valet and time the maids did a great job. 

Thank you for an outstanding visit !!!!

John & Dar Hamilton

I stayed here for a Bachelorette Party this past weekend.  On Thurs, we were in room 832 in the Palace Tower.  Room was nice with a view of the pool.  I think it was a small suite.  Only had one bed and one shower but 2 bathrooms.  Bathroom was nice compared to where we ended up staying next.  On Friday to Sunday, we were in a 4-bedroom suite in the Roman Tower in 1182.  This was cool, but I wasn't a fan of the bathroom.  One of the rooms smelled like smoke.  None of us stayed there.  There were 16 girls.  

I was surprised that such a nice hotel didn't have flat screen t.v.s yet.  It was nice they had a counter, fridge, and dining table.

I did not like the service.  I asked for 16 towels and they asked why.  Then they said, well we can give 4 towels per room, and I was like duh!  4 bedrooms, 4 towels each so 16 total towels.  I also asked for 20 paper cups so we can drink our alcohol.  Waited 30-40 min and said forget it.  

Overall, I would stay here again because it is a nice hotel in general.  I think they just need to fix a few things.

I was so impressed w their buffet! Everything tasted amazing, their was so many different things to eat, we went for breakfast and lunch combined. They had a fresh seafood bar w real lobster and crab claws, shrimp n grits, chicken n waffles, red velvet pancakes, specialty French toast, 3 different kinds of bacon including turkey bacon, Mexican themed breakfast, a full cheese and meats selections, full area of Asian foods from steam buns, sashimi, and on and on!! Organic juices great customer service from the waiters and waitresses it was easy tip $20. Coming here will mandatory when coming to Vegas!!

This was my first time staying at Caesars, I found a good rate on online so I thought I would try it out. I think the Hotel is fine, but the Roman tower must be the oldest tower. NEEED UPDATING. I use to staying at VDARA or COSMO and it is not up to that quality. I have to say the 2 things that drive me nuts about LAS VEGAS is the resort fee. You really get nothing for it. It may as well be called extra profit fee. The other thing that made me mad while checking is was the desk staff telling me that my room is ready but you can't check in until 4pm unless you pay an extra $30 dollars. WOW, I was shocked, it was 130pm, the hotel was NOT busy, and they tell me this? I decided at that point that I will never stay here again. I thought that was BS. This is just another way to add on to the EXTRA profit charges. BEWARE of these extra profit fees. Its not that great of a place.

I've stayed at 25 plus hotels in Vegas over the years and I have to say that, year in and year out, Caesars is about as good as you are going to find. They have great restaurants and shopping. The people are nice. The rooms are just fine. It has pretty much everything you need to experience Vegas. 

The Venetian has better rooms and THE Hotel is a little bit trendier\/ hipper but, for the total package, Caesars is as good as there is in Vegas.

This review is for the colosseum at Caesars palace. Wow!!! What a valuable memory and an outrageously gorgeous venue! I came to see Shania Twain before she retires and wow. I was blown away by the absolute beauty of this colosseum!
 
When you enter for the event it is organized, short lines and a helpful staff (a comforting start). There are bars located periodically throughout the venue and it makes the lines shorter than most other places. Drinks of course are outrageously priced but that is to be expected. 

The show itself, words can not explain how amazing it was. So organized and entertaining. There was really never a dull moment when it came to the performance of the beautiful Shania Twain on the beautiful colosseum stage. 

Staff walks around the audience snapping photos at your seats and this is great because I have never seen this done before and it is a great way to get the memory captured on a better quality camera then a cellphone if you're an average joe like me. 

Overall the experience I had at Caesars palace was incredible. I highly recommend this venue! You won't be disappointed!

I'll be cordial because I work within the hospitality industry, a hotel with a far better rating than Caesars Palace. My problems started at check in, I arrived at 1:30 pm, check in is at 4-6pm. At first I was told my room type wasn't ready, ok. Then I was told he could get it for me for 30 extra check in fee. So again working in this industry and working with Mgm Resorts, Caesars, Wynn etc.  I'm used to the sales pitch, so I'm no beginner here. I kindly explained that to the agent. Who by the way was not nice to start out with. Moving on, so I didn't want to pay the 30 extra, then he tells me my room won't be ready until 6 pm. But if I paid it would be ready now., I talk to a manager of the front desk. I ask the right questions, and she's talking to me and I can see it in her eyes and in her speech that she knows this charge is bs., I also let her know what the agent stated before. I reiterated everything back to them to make sure I didn't sound crazy, and they agreed., but 30.00 check in fee was mandatory if I wanted my room before 4-6. I said ok, fine I'll pay it. I did it to see if their attitude changed, nope. She pressed enter and walked away. No thank you, have a good day, etc. Again working in this industry their standards are high, so they teach them how to talk to and greet guests, they do this to make the guests want to come back and stay again. Moving along, he processes my check in and charges my card for the night stay and 200 deposit, however I had a pre paid stay. He explains to me it will come off my card within 7-10 business days. Hands me my keys and keeps working. I said kindly and nicely to him, have a nice day. He said nothing back, so I said it louder and he fixed his watch and said it back with a bad attitude. 

Now for the room, this room was part of their laurel collection, so I wanted to see them and enjoy the comforts. Room was clean, but the bathroom you can see there was flood damage on the foot of the walls, and door was moldy and painted over. There's nothing Lux about this room, at all & to pay 100.00 more per night is a waste. 

There are no rugs in the bathroom, cold marble is all you get with a touch of mold. No robes to wear around the room, no laundry bag for dirty laundry. There's a keurig coffee machine but no k cups? No luggage valet so your bag doesn't have to sit on the floor. No central light switch to turn the lights on, you have to walk around the room and turn them on one by one, towels are old and rough. I wanted to like it here, I won't stay here again. 

Now for the check out, I went to check out on the tv. It didn't work, it kept failing and having an error. Go downstairs to the kiosks that say Check in and Check out, check out button is gone. So I left, I didn't check out with anyone. So I'll probably get a 30.00 charge for that as well.
Mmmehhh... This Hotel\/Resort\/Casino seems a little outdated and it seems there are only a few amenities that make it worth a visit. This Hotel is everything that I expected it to be.

I get that Vegas hotels are ginormous with multiple towers, but I really don't like having to wander through the entire casino just to get to the elevators that will bring me up to my room. Especially while drunk. That is my only complaint :)

Thank you to the front desk for bringing me not just one, but two types of cough drops when I lost my voice from partying too much. 

We were upgraded to some sort of suite that is either meant for a single couple or a group of kinky individuals. I'm not sure why you would place 2 bathrooms in a hotel room, but have them jointed by a huge shower with glass doors. It kind of defeats the purpose of having 2 bathrooms, no?

This Place from the Rooms to the Food to The staff to the Environment to the Pool
Is Awesome Specially the Buffet ,I love it :-))))

People complain that Ceasars Palace is always busy & chaotic... but just like with restaurants, there is a reason why it's packed & there's a line to check in. Caesars may not be the best, but they do a pretty damn good job! The location is where the main heart of the strip is. The employees\/staff were very courteous, upbeat & always smiling. It's definitely worth staying here at least once.

I like the fact that CP continues to improve, expand and keep up with the times.  It hasn't faded (or disappeared) like so many other casinos (Sands, Stardust, etc.).  Our room was pretty nice, big (considering it was the standard room) with a nice bathroom (but why no door?).  I've stayed in newer and nicer hotels in Vegas, but not much better.  The casino is really nice, although the table games tend to the more expensive side).  The drinks flow pretty freely, even in the slots areas.  There are many restaurants (Neros and Mesa Grill are great) and of course there are a lot of stores in the Forum Shops (currently being expanded).  Be sure to check out Tourneau if you have a watch fetish like I do.  The staff was great.  I think they are planning on renovating a lot of their rooms over the next year as well as build a new tower, so it might be worth it to go now for cheaper rates, or wait for brand new rooms.  I would definitely recommend a stay here, but I wouldn't go here exclusively either.

Wow! This place has everything: great shops that are hard to find anywhere else, awesome restaurants, and its a great concert venue! We saw Shania Twain here...super cool! I wanted to eat at bobby flay's mesa grill...maybe tonight:-)

We decided to come here and stay in Cesar palace hotel for celebrating my brother 21 birthday

Stayed at the hotel a little while back and ate at the buffet. The lady there was really disrespectful. My fiance is a wounded warrior and can't stand for prolonged periods of time. We called the concierge and they said they would make necessary accommodations if we let them know. We spoke to someone working at the front that said we could pull a number sit down and come back when our time slot came. Little did we know that we had to stand in line at the time we pulled. We explained our situation again to the cashier lady and she laughed in his face and said that we must be joking. He could not be a wounded warrior and retired since he was so young. We were in shock and disbelief that someone could be so rude. We complained to the manager and the front desk because we felt very disrespected and all they did was casually apologize and said it would be investigated. 
A couple weeks later he called corporate numerous times with no response. Then he gets a letter in the mail stating that this incident could possibly not have happened because they were rated the number one buffet in vegas..what B.S.

I used to love this place in 2009. However, for the past visits I have had, the rooms have not been nice. We were checked in to a room where the shower is like a rubrics cube. U have to work a little magic to turn it on. No joke. The wall even has damage to it. The wallpaper was peeling. Also I called house keeping for some robes because it was not in our room. The lady told me they do not have robes anymore that they had totally stopped using it. So I said ok just send me 4 towels coz I have my son with me. The lady said ok I'll have it brought up now. We waited and fell asleep and no one came. Waited again the next morning till 10am nothing came. I had to call again. I asked for 4 towels again. 5 mins later a guy came and brought us towel. My bf asked his if he can grab us 2 robes too. 5 mins later they broght us 2 robes. So yeah the lady I spoke to the night before lied to me. I was so upset.  
This was a room given to a diamond rewards member by the way. 
Next was the time when we went for a group get together. me and the bf stayed in Caesar palace. OMG! The toilet in our room in the agustus tower kept clogging up. Seriously we would not go number 2 only number 1 and it would just clog up. I had to call someone Everytime we used it. I was so irritated by this. 

I am seriously about to give up on Caesar palace. Not worth the time anymore.

Got there Sat 9\/21 - Valet reps. - in a hurry - don't ask them any questions - too busy trying to get the next tip, as well as baggage handlers. Check in smooth and friendly- even assisted me with changing my reservation for a later time at Gordon Ramseys Pub. Got to room- very disappointed- first thought Howard Johnson- didn't even have a flat screen TV. However, restroom top notch. Overall hotel shopping and resturants are good. BTW- got up next morning with small bumps on leg, may need to change mattresses. Also, when leaving customer outside complaining he was waiting for his personal car for over an hour and was also disappointed in his stay. Future visit to Vegas definitely not Caesars for accomodations.

Good things: online check in\/check out. Reasonably priced rooms. We got an upgraded room that was a junior suite in the Palace tower. Huge room with a view and 2 bathrooms. Nice meeting rooms for a convention.

Not so good: $28\/night resort fee--not sure that included anything other than air to breathe, as every item was ala carte. Want a bottle of water? $7. Need Internet? $12.95 for 24 hours. Early check in? $30. The casino seemed old and smoky. The shops have hawkers that insist you enter their stores and then hover over you while you shop.

I don't know how I got them confused, but somehow, I made an unconscious association with Caesar's Palace and Little Caesar's Pizza Chain.  You know, Pizza! Pizza!  So I had low expectations when I heard we were going to stay there during our trip to Vegas.  I anticipated a general aura of sleaze that was so not what we got.  

We stayed in the Palace Tower and were thrilled with our flat panel TV, HUGE room, comfy bed, jacuzzi tub and beautiful decor.  It was truly an oasis of calm and relaxation above the chaos of the strip.  And the shopping!!!  Good Lord!  It just kept going and going...I even got up the courage to try on a $4,000 Versace dress with gold heels ($800) and damn I looked good!  Just getting to try it on made my day.

The pools were gorgeous, but unfortunately it was so windy we weren't able to get in the water or hang out...  I thought the coffee at Rao's was better than the coffee at their food court...  We ate at the buffet and got gouged.  We went for lunch but got charged $6 more per person for "brunch."  That blew.  

The hotel was recently renovated, and I think they're really invested in keeping up with the Wynn\/Bellagio\/other new developments.  This was a top tier experience!

A-OK 4th of July weekend stay. We usually stay at Bellagio next door, but decided to make this a "budget" trip and save a few $$$. I chose Caesars because we usually stop by the Forum Shops a few times, they have a few of my favorite restaurants (Mesa Grill, Border Grill, Nobu, Gordon Ramsay Pub, etc.), and my hubby smokes a cigar everyday at Casa Fuente or Montecristo. I figured we spend so much time at those places, why not give the hotel a chance to stay...

+ Awesome 4th of July fireworks show
+ Nice pool area with multiple pools
+ Great selection of restaurants and shops
+ Nice, large bathroom in Julius Tower
+ Super comfy bed 
+ Early check-in
+ Friendly staff
+ Clean

- Julius Tower room view sucked
- Thin walls
- Housekeeping was soooo loud every morning
- People and children running up and down the halls all day and night, laughing and talking loudly
- Ice machine but no vending machine on our floor
- Taxi stand was kind of slow and disorganized
- Not enough seating at the pool

Overall, we saved a few bucks, but I missed the peace and quiet, as well as luxury and ambiance, of Bellagio next door. I'll probably be going back to Bellagio next year and walking over to Caesar's to shop and dine.

Vegas Baby, Vegas!! They're gonna give daddy the Rainman suite, you dig that!!

What else can be said about this prestigious hotel that hasn't been said before. It's by far an icon, staple and legendary hotel on the strip that's been featured in countless movies, quotes and shattered many dreams as it stands the test of time.

Staff is always friendly when we arrive, caters to most needs from room service, concierge and pet service.

Great shops
Huge casino
Amazing decor
And free $5 when you sign up for the players club

I've stayed here in the past and every time I visit Las Vegas, Caesars is a must. The shops and restaurants alone are worth the trip. The property is very large and offers plenty of venues for all tastes and budgets. The rooms are on the higher end and the service is great for a hotel this large. 

My favorite spot is Cheesecake Factory because it's right next to the large aquarium and that makes for a pleasant way to wait for your table.

Caesars has done a terrible job managing their ongoing remodel. I stayed at a recently renovated room and noticed many issues that should have been easily picked up by either a quick inspection of the room or by housekeeping. These issues included a bathroom door that wouldn't close due to the door being too large for the frame, the shelf in the shower being at a near 45 degree angle making it difficult to use, paint and scuff marks on furniture, and large scratches on the bathroom tile. I was willing to ignore these issues, mostly due to fear of getting a room that was even worse since they obviously didn't inspect the remodeling work properly. 

This morning, on the last day of my stay, I awoke at 6:30am to the sound of hammering and drilling directly above my room. The front desk confirmed this was renovation work... Why would they start so early and why would they place customers in the floor directly beneath the one being worked on?

If you're in Vegas and looking for a hotel the size of Rhode Island this is the place for you!  But seriously....

The gaming it's what it is.  Didn't find a lot of new games (slots).   Normally if you game you drink for free.  A word of caution some of the bar slots have a green light system.  Which means you need to play a bit before you get free service.   You can always buy your own drinks.  

The sleeping room are scattered across a 1\/2 dozen towers.   Julius' tower claiming to be a newer towers was nice.  Basic room!  Warning don't breathe on the snacks that are displayed in the room.  Seriously, you move one item and you might just buy a $50 fun size pack of M&Ms -- same goes for the fridge.  

The event space.  They should consider installing a monorail system to get the meeting space.  Bravo!  To the planner and the staff.  A huge ballroom was pack and we got a 3 course meal with an open bar and an awards ceremony and we were done in an hour and half.  I know you're thinking the rubber chicken meal.  Nope- 
Seafood cocktail - huge chunks of lobster and shrimp in a light tomato broth and an avocado cream.  Perfectly cooked and balanced.  
Filet with beef with sweet potato purée and veg - nicely cooked to medium.  Solid dish but I was saving room for dessert. 
Dessert was a trio - 1 chocolate macaroon which I believe was from Payard. 1 chocolate Napoleon 1 vanilla mousse.   The chocolate portions were petite yet so rich I had no room for the mousse. 
I've eaten more than my fair share of hotel banquet meals this is by far was one of the best.

I'm born and raised here in Vegas and have adored this casino since I was a child.  I used to come here to the Omni Max theatre which is now where the celebrities perform.  I also remember when the race track was in the back before the Forum Shops were built.  I remember coming here when the Dunes was imploded on NYE in 94'. Amazing memories.  

This casino has always been a Las Vegas Strip fixture and it continues to improve and maintain its status.  

The rooms, dealers, sports book, Forum Shops, Coliseum and sports book are all top notch.  

If your a Vegas native or just visiting this place is a must.

I did not stay at this hotel but I have visited the hotel too many times to count and I must say this hotel and casino is impressive. Definitely awestruck every first time coming back. The hotel is practically littered with Román statues to fit the theme and the walls and floor are themed for the era as well. The ceiling is painted and when you walk through the shops you really feel like you're in a completely different place and even outdoors! In my opinion this is the most beautiful hotel on the Strip with artistic qualities in overabundance! A must see and must go place! Despite what I'm writing, you'll probably still be left breathless exploring this hotel. Go at it!
Great hotel.. Nice view of the strip from the rooms

We didn't stay here, but we plan on doing so in the future. It's such a BEAUTIFUL place to visit! We walked through the mall area with all of the statues and it was stunning. The kids loved it!  The ceiling of the mall is a blue sky dotted with clouds and the statues are very well done. We were disappointed that the Caesar's moving statues weren't working. That was a downer :-(. However, everything else was lovely and it's a great place to just go walk around and admire. The casino was fun. We played the Wheel of Fortune slots there and won a bit of money :-) The atmosphere is lively and fun. I hope the hotel rooms are as nice as the casino\/mall area because that would make it a prime destination. Great place to just cruise and check out the statues. Just don't be surprised if the moving statues don't work :-(

If it works as possible to give this place "no stars". I would. Always wanted to stay here, come to Vegas 4-6 times a year. Love to gamble and fine in great restaurants. Usually stay at #mlife hotel casinos. Definitely far superior. 4 hours to stand in line to check in after I checked in online!!!! If the Kiosk was programmed appropriately the  's of people that stood in line after being severly delayed by airlines would have made everyone so much happier. Clearly #Caeserspalace cares not for its many guest.

We didn't choose this place, but it was a great choice. Got a smoky 1966 room at first. Asked for new room, got overlooked, then complained and got a great upgrade for free. Marble bathroom with huge shower, jacuzzi tub. 500 thread count sheets and view of the mountains and pools. GREAT room. Loved the whole hotel. I went in and out of almost every place on the strip and Cesar's offers an overall best for ambiance, quality, and service. Sure its expensive, but I felt like I was in luxury. Venetian is a wanna be Italian ambiance with cheesy shops and painted on tiles. 
Pools were amazing! Casino was high end and attentive. Good choice of restaurants (choose Sushi Roku) and gym was really nice. 
Hate that everything has a price tag--like $12 coffee in the rooms, but get the gym and you get fruit, water bottles and free coffee. Worth it.
Not a bad stay.
Hubby and I LOVE Caesars Palace.  It's always clean.  The dealers and bartenders are awesome. There are so many dining options and it's right in the middle of the strip.  We always stay here.

In July 2017 I stayed at Caesar's Palace (Octavius Tower). I was very impressed with my experience as outlined below.

CHECK IN: FAST & easy at the self check in kiosks.

ROOM: The room was Majestic and spacious. I couldn't have asked for anything better for a hotel room. The bed was so comfortable, the whirlpool tub in the bathroom was great, I loved the way the room was decorated.

POOLS: Many pools here and it was fun & relaxing to swim there.

I enjoyed my stay....so much so that i booked a second trip there arriving a week after my initial stay

I haven't stayed at Caesar's Palace so cannot really rate their rooms but I loveeeeeeeeeeeeeeee the fact that they have so many slot machines! My favorite is wheel of fortune slots and I can find plenty here at Caesars Palace. :D

I also love how they have bunch of boutique stores! Nice break from gambling splurge and drop all your winnings! And last but not lease, the newest buffet on the strip, Bacchanal buffet! Haven't tried it myself but heard pretty good things about it, so excited to try it on my next vegas trip!

we got a room in the octavius tower.  it smelled of the drain in the shower.  we suffered through the first night because we arrived at 2 a.m.  and were too tired to complain and wait for another room.  the 2nd morning we called front desk to request for another room but we did not get one until almost 5 p.m.!  the 2nd room smelled better. but both rooms' showers were very weak.

Late posting...i was able to get a vip ticket to the vegas uncorked grand tasting..vip ticket not necessary becuz same food being served as the ones out by pool area where all the diff restaurant booths were...but not all of it..jus from a few restaurants...so i left the vip tables..i had more fun walking around n trying all the diff foods n drinks..i even got a free gift bag from a cigar company! There was a cigar bar upstairs...even when i left the venue i got another free gift bag containing cookware..actually a bakers digital scale..cool

Thank you to Anna and her trainer Ralph!  My husband and I decided to have a staycation for his birthday. I booked the room through Expedia as we were parking and let Anna know at check-in that it was my husband's birthday. Also, I asked Ralph if Anna was training and he said yes it is our lucky day because we get an upgrade. The room was in the Augustus tower facing the Bellagio fountains on the top floor. The room was amazing, the view was amazing, and we enjoyed our stay.  Also, the only room within our price range was a king size bed on Expedia. We told Anna and Ralph at check-in that our son was with us and they changed the room to two queen beds for no extra charge.  We truly enjoyed the room at Caesars Palace!  Too bad it was too windy for the fountains to be turned on or everything would have been absolutely perfect. Safe travels to everyone on their flights in and out.

Friendly service and clean room.  I stayed in the Forum Tower, which appeared to be recently renovated.  I was really impressed by the built in TV in the mirror in the bathroom.  This TV was not just mounted on the mirror - it was INSIDE the mirror!  While the shower had a rain head and a regular shower head, the water pressure was lacking.  The other con was that there was no bathtub.  Boo.  Otherwise, bed was comfy, and this was a nice place to stay.

I didn't stay in the hotel but we played the casino and loved it!   Also the shops and shopping is awesome here.  I love Caesars because there is so much to look at in the casino.  They have the American Idol slots which I love too.  Awesome place check it out!

For my first trip to Vegas, I went around to over a dozen different casinos and Caesars was the most fun.  I played craps and slots and had a good time.  When I picture casinos in Vegas, this is what I imagine.  It's loud, fun and cheesy.  And since I won the most there, it's definitely my favorite.  :)

who is going to complain about the decor at this place? great cocktail waitress, higher payout in little time. just wish they had more cocktail waitress near the slots. seem like you have to play table to get a drink

I came to Vegas for a conference, and I did not stay here. I have been to Vegas several times, and I have never stayed here. Although the food and shopping are great, it just seems as though this is the first of the "big" hotels that is starting to go down hill. With all of the newer hotels around, it seems as though it is time for this big boy to get a major overhaul. At the time, I am sure that it was the best of the best, but over the last 20+ years, this place has really taken a beating. When compared to the Venetian, Bellagio, Wynn and others, this place is struggling to keep up.

Several of the tables where we were gambling were also filled with very grumpy dealers. I can understand that higher buy in tables having a more experienced person with expectation of players knowing what they are doing. However when you are with a bunch of non gamblers, you go to the low buy in tables and expect a little bit of latitude in your play. I have even been impressed at other casino's that they are even willing to help you learn the games, thereby staying there longer to lose your money. Not here, and will probably be a long time before I lose my money here.

I've stayed at many hotels in Las Vegas. Generally, many are similar in terms of rooms and casinos. What stood out to me was the service that one employee in particular. At the front desk, Kioki helped me later on in the evening with sending a letter. It blew me away while in other places I was being blown off. Thank you Caesars Palace and Kioki!

Very clean, very elaborate, very beautiful! Had a good time staying here for a few days with my mother for a little getaway. There's definitely plenty to do here- you could have a week long vacation and never need to leave the hotel! Everything was very opulent and well done, never cheesy. Hotel services were always extremely polite, and fairly quick even though there was a massive amount of people. One of my favorite parts of our hotel room was the bathroom- it had the biggest, most relaxing bathtub I've ever had the pleasure of soaking in! To take it up a notch, visit the Lush Cosmetics in the Forum Shops and pick up a bath bomb or a bubble bar! Another absolute favorite of mine was the Qua Baths and Spa- a must do if you're staying here, and I'm on to review them next!

The most UNPLEASANT Caesar experience ever!!My card key didn't work after I enjoyed the outdoor winter pool. Me and my friend was locked out of our room and need to come downstairs to ask for new keys while our clothes were damp and uncomfortable as we just got out of the pool. 
It was FREEZING and HELPLESS at the front desk. I asked one of the manager if she can expediate my request since she only need to give me a new key; however, she gave me zero attention and careness and insist that I will have to wait in line. I did explain I do not feel good and need to go back to my room to retrieve my medicine, but she still doesn't care and walk away. I am very disappointed with the service like this. I have always been a loyal customer to Caesar place and this is my countless time staying here. I couldn't accept the service today, it's been a very very frustrated experience.

Overall an incredible experience.  The staff is very friendly and professional.  The room was clean and spacious and we had 4 people in our room.  They were very accommodating by bringing us a rollaway bed and complimentary wifi.  The tables are great and the dealers are very helpful if you aren't comfortable with table games.  Be willing to lose what you bring.....happy gambling!

Pessoal, passei uma semana nesse hotel, simplesmente fantástico!!! Como minha viagem para Vegas era para assistir o show da minha diva Celine Dion, nada como ficar no hotel onde ela se hospeda e onde respira-se Celine. 
O Hotel é um encanto, enorme, o teto dele muda de acordo com o tempo lá fora, ou seja, se está de noite, o teto fica escuro com estrelas, se está de dia, fica azul clarinho com nuvens. 
As lojas dentro do hotel são ótimas!!! Os restaurantes que ficam no hotel tem para todos os gostos, desde lanches rápidos até maravilhosos jantares. Confesso que a recepção do hotel não foi a das melhores, pois no dia em que cheguei com a minha irmã a atendente não estava muito de bom humor e foi um pouco ríspida conosco, mas logo depois o humor dela melhorou (do nada, vai entender) e correu tudo bem. Ai ai ai o que falar de um belo quarto, com duas entradas para o banheiro GIGANTE do quarto? Nesse banheiro tudo era duplo, duas pias, dois chuveiros, dois vasos sanitários (em cômodos reservados) vários espelhos etc...uma banheira enorme e um monte de toalhas...Sem contar os cremes, shampoo, condicionador e outros "brindes" que o quarto fornecia. A vista era incrível, dava para ver boa parte de Vegas da janela do quarto, além de ter um amplo espaço para DUAS CAMAS KING, poltronas, escrivaninha, tv, ar condicionado, armário e tudo entapetado, como já é de costume nos EUA. Além de tudo isso, você ainda têm uma ótima localização, bem como piscinas e vários tipos e tamanhos...além é claro dos casinos que o Caesars Palace oferece!!! E não poderia deixar de falar que como a Celine faz show e está hospedada nesse hotel, como disse acima, a música ambiente é toda dela, salvo em alguns lugares do casino, sem contar na loja dela, com um monte de coisa que você só encontra lá!!! E o show dessa mulher gente, foi emocionante, fico emocionada só de pensar. Bom, é isso pessoal, recomendo muito ficarem no Caesars Palace, NÃO TEM NADA DE RUIM LÁ, VOCÊS VÃO AMAR TUDO!!!!

Overall, I liked the room, our tower, the pet policies, the bellmen, the uber-friendliness, the shops, and the gym! I had to dispute minibar charges and wait to check in because we had dogs. I'll stay here again!

We stayed at Julius tower..it was a nice comfortable clean place..a little tear on sheets and little dot stain which is not that noticeable..called housekeeping and when we're back they changed it right away.. nice big bathroom with double sinks,small fridge,no microwave,no alarm clock,nice big closet..view is pretty nice you can see high roller and part of the strip..pool and resort was nice..lots of close shops..walking distance shows like cirque du soleil, madam tussauds..i enjoyed it
Got family in town and they love the room they have and the service. It's definitely one of the best casino in Vegas. It does have a amazing pool
This is our go-to place in Vegas when I can get a room at a decent price.  We've seen Celine, Rod, Shania and Bette at various times, and it's convenient to shopping and the Strip in general.

Watch out for all the new rules for blackjack in Vegas. Different rules at gaming tables than players used to have. Some tables don't let you double down,some won't let you split at certain times, and on and on. Or pay double if you want to split again.the odds are definitely favoring the house. "Real" blackjack players will not be happy at these tables. At Caesars alone, we visited 3 blackjack tables with different rules at each table. I guess Vegas is going to win no matter what. Guess it's time for a new city to gamble in.  Had tickets for shania twain but she cancelled the day before. They refunded our money. I did want to see her. Bummer. Vegas weather was nice, 60s for February. But it's really dry here so drink plenty of water and bring lotion for your skin.

I had very high hopes for my first time at Caesars Palace, but unfortunately I didn't really enjoy our stay. Our experience at the front desk was great. The agent was very nice and did upgrade our room since it was my birthday. Sadly this is where things seemed to take a sharp turn left. We left our luggage with the bell desk, all of which was in tact. We were waiting about 40 minutes in the room for our things to come up when the bell hop called us and said they had taken our things to the wrong room. When he arrived one of the compartments on my suitcase was completely busted open and the zipper no longer worked. He said it was that way when he received it. We called the bell supervisor and told us the situation, emphasizing that the luggage was broken and it was not that way when it was left in their possession. He kept asking if it was really broken or not, as if we didn't know for sure. Finally after a while of back and forth, they agreed to have the suitcase repaired. We had to call multiple times to room service just for two forks and it took a long time to be delivered. Service on the floor was lackluster, especially from the beverage servers. One bright spot was our blackjack dealer, I think his name was Armando. He was very friendly and polite, and made losing money on the tables less painful. I will say that our room, which was on the 26th floor, was very nice. It had a great view of the pool area. Overall for this to be the infamous Caesars Palace, I left feeling unimpressed. Because of how nice our room was I would be willing to stay again in hopes of a better experience.

I really enjoy the  "feel" of this place!  It's difference from the new Vegas . It still has the MAGIC  I  expect from Vegas.  I don't really care for many of the newer hotels,  I feel they have non of the old time charm of the "rat pack" days.

Ok so I just stayed here last week, and I must admit Ive always been impressed with this hotel Great night life, great places to get drinks and the breakfast cafe next to the registration is great for food! BUT HORRIBLE service! It took them 10 mins to sit us down with no one sitting down any where in the cafe, plus it took us 20 mins to get our food and 30 MINS to get our ticket! I was outraged!!! To me this is unacceptable! I dont care if its 4AM or not! It should take that long to get my bill! But I give them credit for the food it was really good. I had the waffles and eggs with bacon! I was very happy but it was putting me asleep! Which is a good thing I might add, but it took way to long to get my check. At this point I was tired and cranky and the beer buzz was gone! hehe But the hotel is nice and I like having a good time here. But i wasnt to happy with the room. It was average and nothing really im pressive about it. Other than the 3 by 3 inch tv's in the bathrooms. It was affordable and the service desk was very helpful with anything I needed I just think they need to update the rooms. Though I did enjoy the pool and that was alot of fun, did look a tad bit dirty but I blame that on the amount of people that come and go in that pool. But still was fun and enjoyable. I will give this 4 stars because i understand the hotel is old and perhaps seeing only about 15 years of its life now.. But over all I had a great time and enjoyed myself. But I would rather spend an extra 100 dollars and stay at the wynn or the hotel and get a tad bit more luxury. Thats my 2 cents.. But if you are looking for a good place and is very affordable.. This is your place! Ill be back though, its the only hotel in the strip that played NON STOP soccer in the bar next to the casino which was impressive to me! enough said, I was sold for my whole entire trip!

Meiner Meinung nach das schönste Casino in ganz Vegas!
Man kann gut Essen, das Casino bietet alles von Mall bis hin zum Pool.
Die Zimmer sind riesig und bequem, unser Bad hatte sogar einen Whirlpool.
Parkmöglichkeiten sind genügend vorhanden, allerdings muss man schon ein weniger mehr laufen.
Und in der Mitte des Strips hat dieses Casino die perfekte Lage.

This was my first and last stay at Caesar's Palace LV.  I prepaid for 3 deluxe rooms at the new Octavius Tower and was expecting a smooth check-in process when my family and I arrived but no such luck.  Driving up to the South Entrance Exclusive entrance was smooth, the guy at Valet was nice and helpful!  Walk into the hotel and head towards check-in and the girl at the front desk was not the smartest.... I gave her my name and reservation numbers along with letting her know that I had paid our rooms in full prior to arrival.  She smugly replied to me with a "we'll see about that".  From there my registration experience only got worse,  it took her 20 minutes to verify that the rooms were paid in full and after that she proceeded to ask for a CC for incidental authorization which is customary in some hotels but for whatever reason she ended up charging $600 to the card instead of the authorization.  I asked her why and she said well since you already paid for your rooms the computer system won't allow me to just authorize $200 a room so I charged it and when you check out  the charges will be reversed.  Well I found this whole ordeal to be completely unacceptable being that Bellagio and Venetian did not do that and even worse a trip to Laughlin a couple months back staying at Harrahs no problems.  So I asked to speak with her manager so sue called him and then hung up and said to hold on, she went out a door and was behind us talking to a man on a desk who followed her to her workstation and said he was the guy in charge, his name was Justin Prince.  We explained to him the problem of charging the card vs auth and the fact that even after we checked out the reverse normally would take a couple of days to process. He really didn't care not even when I told him about the other much nicer hotels and even Caesar's sister hotel Harrah's.   Not very customer service oriented.  

We finally made it to the rooms and they were nice large marble floor bathrooms with jetted tub, comfy bed and nice linens, flat screen TV and a decent view of the Bellagio.  After unpacking and getting situated we realized the lack of outlets in the room.  With 3 people staying in the room in a gadget dominated world with only 3 open plugs, certainly not enough for the iPhones and iPads and laptop to all charge at the same time.   I did call the front desk and they sent a maintenance man over with a power cord and I do have to say the lady at the desk and the maintenance man were quite nice.  My only other issue was they only provided 2 sets of towels, so I had to call down for that too. 

Now the Casino- well it's the same OLD, same OLD.  Not much different than when walking thru in visits past.   They need a make over or major refurbishment. 

The Forum Shops-  Very nice shopping as usual.  Probably the only reason for a future visit.

Just got back from Vacation. Stayed in the palace tower deluxe room 2 nights.

Pros:
1. Property was well maintained and clean
2. Comfortable bed and well maintained rooms
3. Great food court.
4 Pool was awesome, with comfortable chairs.
5. Service was good - Cocktail waitresses and pool waitress were attentive.

Cons:
1. Their room pillows were less than comfprtable.
2. Ventilation in the casino (especially the older part) could be improved. Smoke oder was noticeable. But I can't complain that much because I was smoking.
3. Due to the season, the towers blocked the sun at the pool until maybe 4:00. The waitress says this does not happen in the summer.
4. Our wait at check-in and waits in the food court were a little long.

I will be back for sure. Lounging at the pool was the highlight of the trip.

Friendly staff when asking for directions around the hotel! A lot of food places to choose from and a lot of slot machines as well. Really pretty hotel and love how it's connected to a big mall so you don't have to walk outside In the blistering heat. Definitely not a boring hotel!
