We arrive at the hotel rather late in the evening to a reservation that we made at least 9 months ago for the front desk guy to tell us the room was not available. 

With my whit and charm I was able to swing on of the suites for that night until our room was ready. This suite was a one bedroom two bath with a living room and dining room. Pretty fabulous!

They notified us the next day that our room was ready...we were moved to the remodeled part of the hotel. The Augustus Towers. Pretty nice and spacious...the bathroom was big with a "royal bathtub"\/seperate shower. There were two queen beds and a sofa. 

Location is ideal as it is smack down in the middle of the strip.

Oh and last thing, make sure to go poolside at some point...all of the pools they have are fabulous.

The nicest standard rooms in Vegas are in the Augustus tower at Caesars (just narrowly beating out Palazzo).  The older Roman and Centurion rooms are no where near as nice.  I would recommend the upgrade if you can get it.  The Palace tower is also very nice and the Forum tower, while smaller has also been done up.

Nothing says Vegas more than Caesars.  It's corny, garish and cool all wrapped together.  It's also dead in the middle of everything.

Make sure you have good walking shoes as everything requires a bit of hike.  Also Vallet park as the self parking is remote and hard to get in and out of.

Best Diamond Lounge of all the Harrahs properties.  I've stayed here at least 20 times over the last 10 years, probably more.

A few months ago I had a problem concerning charges to my card after I already checked out of Caesars Palace. After several months of an ongoing battle with everyone on the phone at Caesars palace and them denying all my claims I finally decided to go all the way to Vegas and settle this myself. I was extremely disappointed I had to take such extreme measures to get my money back, but I did. I would just like to thank Justin Prince. He was the only one who actually looked into my case and within just a few days he was assured my accusations were correct. If it wasn't for him I would have paid for extra nights and a lot of room service\/ amenities that i never received. So if you want to risk staying at a hotel that will continue to charge your credit card after you check out and try to never refund your money, then Caesars palace is the place for you....

My stay at the Vegas Caesars Palace , excellent venue Beautiful in fact , the architecture in this hotel and casino is breath taking , the rooms are also very nice of high class scale I've been in better but the room i was in was top of the line , the service was good considering the long wait time it toke to get my room ready , 3hrs , and the buffet the food was very good but also very pricey $162. for three and they did not accept my $120. food comp not a good way to do business the service was very poor , no greeting and no smile , and i was told i didn't have to wait because i am a VIP but was told this after we waited 2 hrs , and it seemed that all the personal where reading out of the same book of rudeness as if they hated their job . I did meet a very nice young lady in one of the shops going to my room she had a perfect attitude so on my way out at check out time i bought a small bust of Apollo very nice ladies working in this shop , the parking is in the back and a long way to walk but beauty is every where , i did enjoy my stay three nights of exploring .

So, my review may be a little bit skewed. My mom is a Diamond Rewards member with Harrah's, which owns Caesars, so my experiences here have always been FABULOUS.

We stayed in a great room in the Augustus Tower, which had an AWESOME view of the Bellagio Fountains. It was exceptional. The floor was also nice and quiet, considering it was packed. 

We ordered room service a couple of times - they were surprisingly quick, and the food was good. 

The customer service was exceptional - from check in to check out, and everything between, we were treated exceptionally well.

Perks to Diamond membership? Skipping the line at the buffet!! The line was literally over an hour wait, and we walked right up and were seated. Awesome.

My husband and me stayed there for one night on my bday. At check in I asked the receptionist if they have special birthday deals for spa or anything else and he said no, but instead he upgraded our room to the suit with hot tub and said now there is no need to go to spa :) and that was absolutely free! We enjoyed our stay at Caesars palace. The pools are amazing. The hotel itself and casino are very beautiful! Lots of food places and fine shops. Next time will choose this hotel again.

Ceasars owns Planet Hollywood. We booked tickets at PH for a Jeff Dunham who on may 2 2015. They never sent the tickets and when we got to the box office they had no tickets and had never heard of Vegas Tickets and Sports. We had to buy a new set of tickets. So were out $1800. Caesars won't bother to talk or deal with any of this. It's just too bad. Well screw you Caesars and Jejj Dunham and Planet Hollywood too. Bunch of rip off kike mother****ers

I went here a number of years ago with 5 girlfriends and we decided that despite being on a budget, we wanted a nice and central hotel...likely because my friends had been before and stayed at Circus Circus not knowing how far it was.

Well we fit all 6 of us in one room (2 king beds and a cot) and the room was amazing and we had a view of the fountain. The inside of the hotel was beautiful and we had a pretty good time at the clubs so goof that I had to leave a little early one night after discovering patron and coining the term patron eyes (the same as drunk eyes basically only slightly classier). 

The beds were comfortable and even though it was like Charlie from Charlie and the chocolate factory's bedroom, we slept well and there was enough room for us....although not all of us stayed there every night.

The bathroom was nice as was the tub although I doubt any of us even used it. The staff were friendly and it was a great time had by all.

If you are 6 in one room, I am pretty sure you are breaking some kind of rule so you may not want to be super open about it. Since this happened a number of years ago, I feel it is okay to post about it now.

Pro- Room is very nice and clean. 
Con- Poor service

The guy who came was nice to let us in but it takes forever. The kids are tired and sleepy after so many hours of walking.

This happened not once but twice!

Since we were celebrating my birthday, I got upgraded to the AUGUSTUS TOWER DELUXE 2 QUEENS. It was much better and bigger then the Forum and Palace rooms. I love staying in the Forum tower because they have everything I need and like, right there in that area as well, Total rewards booth, numb bar, starbucks, pizza and the Forum Casino. I had rented 3 scooters to get around town with everyone, some of course walked, and they all fit in the room. I also had a roll-away bed brought in, that fit too. This room like any other room is very welcoming and big. It's clean, the staff are all very friendly and they always say Hello every time you pass them. Access to the Diamond Lounge, Valet, Starbucks, Front desk area are all right there. The High slot area is the place to play. It has the best games to play then the other properties in my opinion. My son got his first hand pay, $2500 playing the wheel of fortune in high slot area. I was playing right outside the high slot area which I believe is the Palace casino area and while playing the dollar wheel of fortune, I  spun the wheel and got that $1000. It was pretty awesome. Of course, my son won his hand pay on my birthday and I won the day after.He gave his girlfriend and I $200 each. It was a fantastic feeling.I wish my birthday came every month so the Slot Gods would be generous each and every time. But overall, we love all the games they have there and there's always action. The Sports book was crazy as we watched the MLB games. The atmosphere was awesome. Almost like we were at the Stadium, it was live. I would recommend this to everyone. If you can't get a room at the Augustus tower then I say he Forum tower. It has a lot on that side of the property. Don't forget to rent a scooter, you won't be tired and you can fly anywhere in the hotel without any problems. Conventions are plenty with a lot of people so having the scooter makes everything a little bit more fun and not being tired from a lot of walking. Caesars bell desk can have a scooter dropped off and picked up for you. All you need to do is call and reserve in advance. Thanks Caesars for an amazing time, beautiful decor and friendly staff!

I travel to vegas roughly 4 times a years and I was excited to stay at Caesars for the first time. That excitement ended as soon as I got in the check in line. I arrived at 10am so I figured I might not be able to check in right away unless a room was ready. Lucky me there was a room ready but I had to pay $33.60 to check in early even though the room was clearly ready and just sitting. They I was told no free wifi and it was $25 a day to use the gym! Within the first hour I was ready to leave. Never again. Stay anywhere but Caesars!

I roamed through the casino a few times, and boy, the amount of cigarette smoke is overwhelming from 50 feet outside of the entrance. There is more cigarette smoke concentrated in this casino than all of the casinos on the strip combined. Not sure if it is due to the overwhelming concentrated group of smokers that venture here or if it is the poor filtration system. My eyes were parched and stunned.

This place must have killer acts. The current feature is Celine Dion's "A New Day." My friend watched the show and was moved. I met her in the Celine Dion store after the concert, and the place was mobbed! It was unlike the Cirque du Soleil 'O' store in the Bellagio. If you just stood still in the store, you still got trumped over. Celine Dion is about to say bye-bye to Vegas. Her contract was only suppose to be through 2003, and it was extended through 2007. So hurry and get a glimpse of her live performance. She definitely appeals to a certain market. Jokes aside, I have to admit I really like her moving music. =P

Next up is Elton John.

And Pure was...well read my next review...

I did not stay at the hotel.

I've stayed everywhere else other than this place.  However, my buddy wanted to be at the center of stuff so Caesar's Palace it was.  The table games area wasn't super massive, but we did have fun losing $$$ there.  

I feel like we overpayed for the rooms since we were there for a massive convention.  We stayed in the Roman Tower and the rooms were standard.  The bathroom was the standout since it was all marble with a huge soaking tub (I never used it, though).

The food choices were great (cheap (food court, augustus cafe) and expensive (palm, joe's stone crab, nero's) and the traffic was cool (simon cowell was playing blackjack at the table across from me).

The big perk was the Pussycat Dolls gambling area.  It's cheesy as hell, but they dance and deal while PCD music plays.  It is so much easier giving your money away to a good looking dealer.  Also, it's fun seeing all the people waiting to get into PURE.

I get that this place is older but there are some serious items lacking...
1) the bad smell, cigarettes and funk are not appealing when entering any casino
2) the line that never ends, checking in and out is like waiting in line at Disney
3) let's not even talk about the taxi line, there was not a good system in place or a lack of drivers wanting to pickup from there 
4) simple things like rust in the bathroom from the shower constantly flooding and after reporting it, nothing was done
5) going back to the smell... we didn't even want to hang out or gamble there because of it

Don't get me wrong, there were positives like...
1) room service was delicious
2) the shops, eateries, cafes, that are right there 
3) the jetted tub was definitely the best thing ever in the room
4) room size was great
5) convenient location

Would I stay there again? Yes... but my sincere hope is that they fix their biggest issue, the smell.

Love this hotel. It's one of the best hotels along the strip.  The decor is beautiful all through the entire building. The attachment to the Forum Shops makes it that much better. Every time I visit Vegas, I always stop in. Even if I'm staying at another hotel along the strip. If you've never visited Vegas before, Be sure to stop in whenever you visit .
Excellent hotel imho. The service here was friendly and the rooms really nice.

Fireworks show was unimpressive - won't be back - seriously? You advertised a grand fireworks show so I flew in early paying a premium to do so and I had better fireworks in my cousins backyard in Colfax EI last night - what a gamble, and I lost!

Home of the Movie Hangover
Very Classy very clean. I don't really have alot of complaints from this place. Kind of pricey to gamble at. 
Free drinks if you gamble. $8 for those same drinks if you don't. They are very small plastic cups though so kind of a bummer. 
Hangout at the pleasure pit to see the beautiful girls. 
Hangout at the sports area to watch your favorite game and place bets. Big area but they have way too much seating reserved for their heavy betters. 
Still like this place though.

Who doesn't love Ceasar's? I've stayed here several times and have never had any issues.   The new tower that we've stayed in the past two times have been very nice.   The layout for rooms  have been the same but they are a lot larger than the older towers.  I would not mind visiting here again soon.
I love this hotel. They have so many statues. All the employees are great. It's never too crowded. I gets crowded but it isn't as bad as some of the other casinos on the strip. Beautiful atmosphere!

DO NOT LET THEM PUT YOU IN ROMAN TOWER!  Unless, of course, sleeping in an ashtray sounds appealing.  

The rooms are tired.  Not clean... and overwhelmingly smell of cigarette smoke.

I am so sad of this pathetic experience... I anticipated I would like Ceasars.

Stayed here for two nights for a business trip.  Definitely WON'T stay here again.  Last time I stayed at the Bellagio and I remember it being all around better.

Since I'm not much of a gambling man, this review focuses on the hotel aspect and primarily the room.

First, the hotel, like many have said, is too large and the conference center is buried in the back of the compound, with some of the longest escalator rides ever.  Casino\/hotel signs and directions are generally lacking and not clear, especially in the conference center.

Second, my room in the Roman tower was outdated and lacking.  Tube TV with 20 channels; a cheap power strip sticking out from underneath the tv stand with a plethora of items plugged in.  A Motorola cable modem blinking away down there too.  Lacking some standard amenities (coffee pot, mini bar\/fridge, ample power plugs on desk or near bed).  The only redeeming factor was that the bathroom was huge.

Third, in-room wireless internet is an ungodly $14.99 per night PER device.  Other "standard" business hotels (Hilton, Marriott, Westin) charge for internet, but all your devices can use it.  And to top it off, the wireless service was extremely slow.

In summary, if it weren't for the business trip and conference at Caesar's, I would not have come here - and I definitely won't return.

My sister (the bride to be) booked a special rate for our hotel room about 5 months in advance. We  made two changes to the reservation before coming for our stay. Both times were very easy and I had excellent customer service.

My other sister (fellow bridesmaid) checked in while our other sister and I were on our way to Las Vegas. She got an upgrade and it was beautiful.

Our stay was great. We were in the towers right next to the pools, PAYARD, and  not too far from the entrance. 

It was really nice to wake up and think "what should we do today? sit poolside? shop in the forum shops?" 

We walked from our hotel to places like the Monte Carlo, Venetian, Planet Hollywood, and it was fine. 

Although there are a lot of places to stay in Las Vegas, I think I will have to come back to Casear's Palace!

For how old it is they have surprisingly clean rooms. This is having lived in one of the older towers as im sure the new ones are still fairly sterile.
Harass addition of pet friendly rooms have made them a definite choice when visiting with (my sisters) dogs.

This was by far the worst hotel experience I have had during my many trips to Las Vegas. I expected "Caesars" to be a top notch hotel with a modern feel and excellent service not a "run down" "your on your own" approach. Im not sure where to start but here it goes. First off I needed a frig for some medication. They wanted to charge me $20 but after talking to them they waived the fee and made me feel like they were doing me a favor by giving me a frig that other hotels provide as a standard for their rooms. The frig came 3 hours later and I had to call guest services to remind them. Good thing I had ice and a small ice chest on standby. When the frig came it looked like it had gone through a war and functioned poorly. Second the room was very outdated. The bedding was poor, a few of the lamps and electrical outlets were not functional and the furniture was mismatched\/faded. Third was the view. I know I didn't pay for a room with a strip view but could I maybe get a view of the freeway instead of looking out the window at a concrete wall with a ladder. I think a jail cell would have a better view of the outside world then the one "Caesars" had. Fourth they said at the front desk that I would be charged $25 for the resort fee but at checkout they charged me $28 per day for the resort fee. With the price that "Caesars" charges for their rooms you get the room quality of a motel and not a Las Vegas Resort. Bottom line is I was so disgusted and angry about the hotel quality, money I paid to be there and the service that it ruined my trip. I was so mad that I didn't even gamble one cent in their casino and will never set foot at "Caesars" again. If you are contemplating staying in that area of the strip just stay at "Treasure Island". TI has modern rooms, good service, outstanding amenities, and all at a price point that Caesars cant even dream to accomplish. DONT BOOK OR STEP FOOT INSIDE this sorry excuse for a Las Vegas Resort. Learn from a guy who works too much and wanted to enjoy a nice break with my wife in Las Vegas. We were cheated out of a wonderful experience by "Caesars" and at our own financial expense.

I recently stayed here for 3 nights with a few friends and we had a blast! The room was newly renovated and beautiful. The bathroom was amazing, glass door shower, spa bath tub and double sink. The only issue we had with the bathroom was the toilet. .... it ran all day and night. We called to get it fixed and no one ever came to fix it. The whole hotel\/ casino is gorgeous,  we walked around looking at everything and got lost a few times because it's so huge. The forum shopping area is beyond beautiful and has an amazing fish tank filled with lots of cool fish. The staff was pleasant and helpful, always right there when we needed something.  I would definatly recommend this hotel to anyone!

I checked in at 3:12 pm,there something loose at the bottom of the window and you hear the constant winds. For over 2 hrs I've been waiting for someone to come check to see if they can fix this or I need to be moved to a different room! It is now 6:25pm and the guy just got here and the resolution is he's gonna tape it up. Bravo! First time staying at Caesars Palace and we are so disappointed!

This review is based on our attempt to have an event with Ceasars Palace. This should also be a little education for you event planners that decide to use any Ceasars property in the future. 
Pretty simple. We contact the property. Explained we were having an event and we would have to park 3 cars inside a room that will be awarded to our top performers. Dinner, a stage, cocktails etc. pretty simple event. Nothing out of the ordinary other then maybe the cars. 
So we were contacted and given a contract. On the contract we had s food and beverage minimum that we would surely blow right through. In addition a charge for using the room of 7000. My assistant contact Ceasars and said we throw party's every year. We have used many of the resorts to do so and we have never ever paid a fee to use the room. Response was this is how we do things. My assist brought it to my attention and of course I said no. I won't pay a fee to use the room and inflated food and beverage costs plus AV. 
Ceasars came back with another option after getting a couple more people involved, and quoted us a minimum of 12500 or 1500 for the room and a minimum of 9000.  Can't make this up. Doesn't even ad up. I think at this point they were just stroking us. So we went back and said ok to the 9000 plus 1500 for the room. She described the 1500 as labor for the employees to set it up. So I told my assistant to make sure they give us a quote on the AV and stage. This is where I simply dropped my jaw and thought what bs. 
The lady first said to my assistant you have to sign the agreement by tomorrow or the prices and guarantees are gone. So I was already out of my office at the time on Tuesday and we assumed we would call in the morning and work out the details. My assistant called in the morning, late morning and early afternoon. Finally she gets a call back at 5:30. The lady at Ceasars said you need to sign this agreement right away or we will not guarantee the price. We said well what's the price on AV and stage etc. she replied and I quote, "you need to sign the contract for us to give you those numbers". Now, I was born at night just not last night. This was a joke. And she was serious. 
 I'm in the car business. A heavily criticized business. But this is just a fools agreement. There is no way you can trust these idiots. They will not honor nor will they keep your best interests financially at heart. 
So I booked the event at the HardRock hotel with no brain damage. No room fee and they were happy to quote A to Z costs. 
Beware of Ceasars for your next event.  Or at least give yourself enough time to come up with a plan B.

Being a Vegas local, I would recommend to go else where.  I had had the impression that Ceasar's was one of the premier resorts on the Strip and I found this to be incorrect.

I had a conference this past weekend at Ceasar's and had a room in the Roman Tower.  I am aware that Ceasar's had recently built a new tower, but in my opinion, they should have spent the capital upgrading the original towers.  The room was nice enough, but I have been in Comfort Suites that were nicer.  There was mold in the shower and hair on shower walls and ceiling.

The first night, I froze in my room.  The second night, I turned up the thermostat to find that the vent was only blowing cold air.  I placed a call to Front Desk and a serviceman called upon my room 90 minutes later (around midnight, when I had a 7:30am meeting the next day for my conference.)  The on the second night, the electrical breaker blew in my room and I, temporarily, had no electricity in my bathroom.

I stayed at Caesers for the first time this past Memorial weekend. 

CHECK IN:  We arrived around 12pm and as we were in line, there was a "check in nazi" walking up and down the line telling everyone that check in doesn't start until 1pm.  Okay...  We of course ignored here and proceeded to the next available front desk staff.  Jason was sweet and checked us in, also offering us an upgrade option to one of the newer towers.  if given the opportunity... STAY IN ONE OF THE NEW TOWERS!!   Jason pleasantly checked us in and sent us on our merry way. 

ROOM:  The room in the new tower is BEAUTIFUL.  The beds had pillow tops.  It was spacious and CLEAN.  My biggest complaint is that the vents\/walls\/etc are THIN.  We can hear our neighbors opening\/closing the cabinet drawers, running the water in the bathroom, flushing the toilet, and parts of conversations through the vents.  

HOUSEKEEPING:  The rooms were well cleaned and maintained.  My only gripe is that one of our robes were damaged and we called for a replacement.  I checked out 2 days ago, i'm still waiting on someone to come in and give me a replacement. 

GROUNDS:  I went out to catch a cab. One of the groundsmen were dusting the marble steps.  He was off to one side of the step and i slowly was going to shimmy through the other side.  He practically had an anurism and did not let me pass.  He shoooed me away to go a different route.... really???

RESTAURANTS:  Went to the following places.  These are brief reviews (please go to restaurant on yelp for full review: 

BEIJING NOODLE 9:  Absolutely Awesome!!  Loved this place!!

PAYARD:  Yummy pastries and desserts.  Kind of  a rip-off, but what do you expect, you're in a hotel in Vegas!!

NERO:  Horrible horrible horrible service.  Not a fancy steakhouse...even though they pretend to be.  

RAO's:  Loved this italian gem.  Food good.  Staff friendly.  Ambiance.. wonderful!! 

MESA GRILL:  Good... but it's fancy Southwest\/Mex food.  They do NOT offer substitutes (not even egg whites vs eggs).   Pricey and you may not get full.  

It's  a great location and with the Forum Shops, you really don't have to leave the compound.  Would i stay here again...... probably not.  Would i come back.. of course!
We were able to get a suite in the Augustus Tower.  I hate the following adjective, but, the place was AMAZING!  I enjoyed living it up for once.

Classic new Vegas. A must see and Caesar shops are great. Parking is hard though and not easy to access. I have never stayed here so I can't comment on the rooms. 
The sports book needs some major love though. It is pretty much in a hall, hard to get a seat which are just roped off swivel chairs. The book really needs to readjusted somehow and it is not comfortable or a place I would like to spend much time betting.

Octavius tower is beautiful! Room was huge. Bathroom had a jacuzzi, stand up shower, his and her sinks and a separate room for the toilet. The bed was nice and comfy, there was a couch, plenty of room for two people. Room was clean.

Caesar's palace is huge, staff is friendly, Octavius tower is near the pool and buffet, a walk to the stores, but that's okay, we didn't mind. We preferred being closer to the pool. It was never an issue to get a lounge chair. Check in was easy, there is a separate place to check in and valet is free.

Food poolside was pretty good, had a panini, wings and fries. Staff is helpful and valet service, just call ahead since there are ton of cars. Price wasn't bad at all. We would stay here again, but we would ask for a room with a view. We only got a view of the highway and Paris Hotel partially.

We came 4th of July weekend and Caesar's was the only hotel to put on a fireworks show. It was great! I love the location too, middle of everything and it wasn't hard getting a cab.

Qua spa is fabulous! I recommend it! We got massages and spent  a couple hours at the different treatments\/pools. Well worth the money.
Holy wowzaaaaaaaa! This place is unbelievable. I came here because they do in The Hangover...I didn't stay here I just played and lost money in the casino! Amazing!

I finally paid more than I wanted just to say I stayed here. I was disappointed. The room wasn't any better than an upgraded room at Excalibur. Also, if you're young and like to party, this casino isn't for you. It has an older person\/ family friendly\/more laid back feel to it and it gets pretty quiet\/dead about midnight. I feed off of the energy around me and enjoy lively casinos even at the wee hours.  The adjoining mall is cool and convenient. And there are a lot of places to eat. Overall, I think it is overpriced and kind of dead if you like to get your party on. Unless I got a great deal, I would NOT pay their inflated prices to stay here again.

Caesars Palace is one of the first casinos built on the strip.  I haven't ever stayed here but got the opportunity to experience it first hand when my cousins stayed here.  I've made pit stops at Serendipity 3 for frozen hot chocolate; this is a must!! Also had the buffet with the crab legs which is awesome.

Spent time down at the pool which is a great; there is a ton of seating and three different pools plus the private pool.  Not a ton of shade so going in the middle of a summer day might be a little brutal.
This place reeks of cigarettes and it takes them 15 minutes to check a single person in.

We stayed here from a Monday to a Wednesday....booked the "Julius" tower and my first impression was that it was very nice and new! But it stops there! The next morning at 6:30 a.m. they started construction on the floor above us! Apparently they hadn't finished construction on that tower and just decided to book rooms anyway! I mean.....are you serious? So we call them and they give their standard apology and an offer to switch rooms! Fine, that works. However, they do not switch rooms until after 11 a.m. The room we were given was in the "Augustus" tower which was nice. But it wasn't ready until after 4:30 p.m. and we kept having to call and check on it! Overall, not impressed with them. Which is disappointing because we have stayed there in the past with no issue. However, we will not be staying there again! On to the next!

$73 a night room on Priceline--during Spring Break and March Madness, of all times.

Was super nice to front desk person and got upgraded from the Roman Tower to Octavius, which was swanky.

Anyone who knows the property will tell you that's about as lucky as you can get.  

Also, the buffet rules.

Keeping this one really simple. 

*Inside: Gambling (meh), restaurants (meh), decor (neat), hotels (neat).
*Outside: Bright lights (Neat), tent where absinthe show is held (really cool), bellagio fountain show right across the street (cool), parking (aight).

They have a few different hotels within Caesars. Each one having it's own style and room design \/ layouts. In the immediate area around the hotel you have some pretty cool sights and restaurants. I'd recommend Mon Ami Gabi across the street for breakfast. The 'club' was closed while I was here but from what I read it sounded like the outdoor area of the club has a great view - I was actually looking forward to this. They also have a few pools that are worth checking out. Staying at one of their hotels might score you "VIP access" (actually pointless) to different things throughout the palace and complimentary valet parking.

Tip: If you're looking for the general \/ guest parking garage just google map "caesars palace parking". "Caesars palace" will lead you right towards the main entrance valet.

Definitely the BEST hotel that I've ever stayed at. You have to play BIG to get the benefits but I didn't mind. Bachannal is just down stairs and trust me, you have to experience at least once in your life. The MACRONS are AMAZING!! There are two different towers for each room. Augusta & NOBU. I Like the privacy at NOBU and the luxury decor in the room. This is my 5 STAR pick if you're going to stay in Vegas. Plus being a 7 star diamond card doesn't hurt either

So disappointed! Couldn't believe that such a popular, well-funded institution could forcibly nickel-and-dime you to death.
The hotel does not care about its patrons, as evidenced by:
-the pool closing at 6
-no space in the mini-fridge (chock full of exorbitantly expensive booze)
-not informing you that the mandatory resort fee includes wifi
-not having an information\/guide book in the room
-not giving clear parking payment information 
-minimal amenities in the room
Yes, the decorations are cool and buffet is ENORMOUS, but I would stay at Quality Inn and Suites (5 stars) and come here to eat ::shakeshead::

Nice and clean guest room, in a walking distance to anywhere, the hotel is huge so the walk to your room could be tiring if you have to do it often in a day. So many brand name shops in the Forum and that's what I enjoyed most!!

This place is nasty.

My fiance and I went there to celebrate our engagement. They said that we could upgrade to a better room (for $40\/ night) with a jet tub so that we can have a nice time there. Little did we know that we would be joined by someone else's pubic hair in the tub.

When we called down they said that they would take care of it but they never did.

We were free of any drama on the 2nd night but on the 3rd night we were joined by bugs in the bed. I was eaten alive all over my back, arms and legs. When we called the front desk for a new room and some benadryl, they patched me over to security... wtf? So security came up (an old man and a young women - both incompetent) with no meds and a flashlight. Seriously?

My fiance was furious and went to the front desk to talk to the manager. They finally got us a room at 4am but we still had to check-out at the reg time. After this whole mess, we just wanted to hit the pillows but was greeted by more pubes on the pillow!!

Upon leaving, we asked to speak with a manager, just to be greeted by someone who started that week. He said that he could not help us and gave us a $60 coupon for breakfast and sent us on our way. Are you kidding me?

Overpriced, wifi practically non existent, telephone in room didn't work. lighting in room had to be addressed by engineering, Buffet breakfast for 2 $68, that is unless you wanted to go to restaurant and pay $24 for an omelet.

Pools overcrowded due to one being closed due to special event and space at main pool was limited due to setting up for special event with banging and beeping, loud workers hollering to each other and cursing.  

Never return.
Had just he engaged and the amazing staff gave us an incredible upgrade to a suite in the Augustus tower and the service was fantastic. Fuck yeah Caesar's!
What a crap-hole joke of a hotel. Customer service clearly doesn't exist on this part of the Strip. Been waiting for my "room" to be ready for 7 hours. Stick with the Aria

Our room was in the Palace tower, but the way the hotel management handled our issues, I would never go back to any tower in caesars palace.
We didn't have high expectations and still got disappointed. We fully paid for a package and when we checked in the guy at the front desk suggested to upgrade to a better room. We asked for the price and he said he cannot tell us because we booked through a third party. It was obviously a lie so I said that we have to get the numbers before deciding. A magic happened and in 3 seconds he had the numbers, which were additional $800 (!!!) for our 6 nights stay, for a room that doesn't sound better.
Then, we went up to the room and were surprised to see that:
- the carpet was dirty (dried cranberries), and very OLD,
- the faucets were full of corrosion,
- one faucet was not working,
- you have to flush the toilet twice because the first time does nothing,
- very low light in the bathroom,
- overall, the entire room was very old, felt like going back in time to the 90's.
We called front desk and they sent someone to fix the broken faucet, but that's about it. So we asked for a room transfer, and we asked to see the room first, they took us to see a room that was SMALLER (!!!) than our room, which was a waste of over 1 hour of wait time. We specifically paid for the slightly larger room because we were 4 in the room (3 adults). Then, they showed us a room which was the same size but had roughly the same issues as in our rooms, probably because the room was in the same tower (palace). We had to go all the way to the reception to get the key to the other room because they didn't want to send someone to give us the key (!!!). Even worse, initially they said we cannot see the room, we have to move without seeing it. Obviously I insisted on seeing it first.
Then, we realized we will be billed for resort fee, which is common on the strip (as they said), even though our package said we fully paid for everything. We thought we don't have wifi so when they said the resort fee includes wifi we were at least happy about that. BUT, we only had one bar when we used the wifi!!! just in case it's not clear -- wifi with 1 bar feels like dial up, which completed our experience of a hotel in the 90's :(
So, we asked to talk to a manager after they suggested to take down the resort fee for a couple of days, which is a joke. The manager called us only at the next day at 10pm! and only to the room, even though we asked them to call our cell. And then we gave them our cell phone number again and they did the same thing after 2 more nights! so we only got to talk to a manger just before our last night there, after spending hours on the phone with probably almost 10 different representatives, explaining our issues over and over again.
Eventually the 2nd manager removed the resort fee completely, but it was not enough, I will never go back there.
Just to be clear, if we had paid $60 a night as in the Excalibur then we would accept the poor maintenance of the room and also the service, but we paid much more for Caesars (hard to say exactly because it was a package with the flights) and we did not expect to feel like we're in the 90's.
Other than the room, the casino stinks from smoking, slightly more than the average on the strip, and extremely more than new hotels such as Aria and Cosmopolitan.
The only reason we gave Caesars 'poor' instead of 'terrible' is the location, and also some restaurants were ok.

Caesar's was recommended by a member of our group. He stays there often when he goes to Vegas. After this stay he apologized profusely and never wants to go back.

We arrived around 1pm and were given the option to pay $25 to check in immediately or wait until 3 for the room to be cleaned. We waited.

We checked in at 3 to find our room hadn't been cleaned and the bell hop had us carry our bags from the service elevator. In the room, we found assorted trash (medicine and old key cards) and food left under the furniture. The front desk offered us a $50 drink comp and promised to clean the room. We gladly took it and headed to the pool.

At the pool, we found toilet paper and other assorted trash in the water by the blackjack tables. Be extremely careful entering the pool a member of our party slipped on the stairs and about 30 minutes later another  hotel patron slipped no the same stairs. Luckily, neither was severely hurt.  

After 1.5 hours we returned to the room to find the assorted trash removed (we had piled it next to the tv stand) but the old food remained. We again asked the front desk to help. First, they asked if it was our food (we'd spent less then 30 minutes in the room at this point) and then asked for the exact location so house keeping could remove it in the next 10 to 15 minutes. They also offered to comp all our drinks at the pool. Over the next 1.5 hours while we prepped for dinner, house keeping never arrived.

While prepping for dinner we found that using one sink would cause the other sink to fill with dirty water. Again they assured us that maintenance would be right up (10 to 15 minutes) to correct the problem. Maintenance hadn't showed when we left for dinner an hour later. 

When we returned they told us we were changing rooms. The old food was still in the room and the sinks were still clogging. Again, we were told the bell hop would be right up. The bell hop never came. While we were waiting, another group had been given keys to our room and our keys were deactivated. 

1.5 hours after we were told the bell hop would be "right up" the room change actually occurred. The room change occurred at 1230 am after a visit to the front desk when we needed to be up at 7 am for flights. 


For the trouble, we were promised that all our drinks would be comped, a $50 food voucher (for breakfast), an upgraded room, and $50 off our original rate.

Supervisor Jonathan Grant was extremely helpful in finally remedying the situation. If the story ended here, this would likely be a 3 star review. However, our problems continued the following morning.

When we tried to use the $50 voucher for breakfast we were told we couldn't charge anything to the room as Caesar's had listed the room as cash only, even though there is a $200 hold on my card. We ended up paying for breakfast ourselves and headed back to the front desk to fix the situation. 

At the front desk we were promptly told by Supervisor MacKinzie Sherlock that Caesar's would not be honoring the comps we had been promised and would only remove the drink charges and $35 of our breakfast. Having spent roughly 1\/3 of our stay speaking with the front desk and needing to leave for the airport we simply checked out.

All in all my Caesar's experience was way below my expectations. If you're looking to stay on the strip near Caesar's, just stay at the Bellagio where I've stayed multiple times with no issues. Chances are I'll never go back to Caesar's and have already changed hotels for a large bachelor party in September.

I really enjoy this hotel. It was our 1st stay at the Forum Towers this time.  We were on the 66th floor and had a partial view of the Strip.  The bed was comfortable. I wasn't so happy about the down pillows which never retain their shape and do not give you enough neck support.  Pity the folks who are allergic to feathers.  

Bathroom was clean and the shower had 2 shower heads - one over ceiling and the other on the wall.  Ample closet space with a safe which can hold an iPad or small PC but it stands upwards so if you're not careful, your items can fall out when you open the door.

I'm giving Caesars Palace 5 stars for one reason. Employee Ricky London. It's rare to see someone this friendly and professional anywhere. Let alone in Las Vegas. He has gone out of his way to make sure we have a great weekend here. What a great asset he is for this hotel. This would not have been a 5 star rating without him.

Caesars Palace can be rough around the edges sometimes, but it is the best spot to party in Vegas. If you are looking for something, just as nice, but less crazy, please see my friends at the Bellagio. They are truly the best at making everyone feel right at home. So much so, you may never want to leave either place!!!!

Happy Hunting. 
Abe

This hotel should receive no stars, at all. The check-in process was long, the room, soiled and for $225\/night I received no robe, no coffee maker, no refrigerator, no make-up mirror and was charged almost $20\/day for a three cup coffee service. There was smoke everywhere and most attendants were too busy to assist in directing me to my meeting room. I was ripped off and am now upset. Furthermore their internet service is over $20\/d, their restaurant offerings, overpriced and the selection - poor. The bell hop was friendly so I tipped him well...

We stayed in forum towers and our room was great, housekeeping was amazing, all levels of service above par and the conference space is massive and lovely! We gambled, we ate, we had a blast. The pools are beautiful and the outdoor lounge area is well designed and relaxing.

I was in Vegas last week and i've stayed in Bellagio. Before 2 days, i had to come to Vegas and for this time I've chosen Ceasars because Bellagio was sold out. I had really good experience woth this hotel last year in Vegas and Atlantic City but this time was absolutely terrible. Customer population, staff, rooms, pool and PARKING ! It is going to be last time here, i think they have to thing about satisfying their customer instead of making trick on gambling !

This pricey hotel (compared to other hotels in Las Vegas) is almost in the middle of the strip. There are tons of places to eat and drink inside the hotel. If you love to shop, there are shops within the vicinity too. 

I stayed here for business for a week and my entire week was pleasant. The convention staff was helpful including the business center. 

Gordon Ramsay restaurant is awesome. Rather cheap - about $ 100 or so for two people. The Central by Michel Richard will cost you about $ 30 for an oily meal - good after 12 bottles of beer. My blood was filled with alcohol and needed comfort food - they sat me right away! Think of it as Food 911 or Post-alcohol 911. 

The room? Decent. I've been to better hotels like Mandalay Bay. 

Nice features: 
- Electronic curtain because walking four steps is way too difficult
- Big desk so I was able to spread out my clothes and 3 laptops (that's why they hate me at security)
- Bathroom has nice amenities just like most hotels on the Strip
- LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION - keep your wallet handy, you'll spend money in drinks, food and shopping. Guaranteed. 

Tip: 
- Be friendly to concierge, they'll make your life easier
- Tip your bell captain well
- It's very noisy, bring ear plugs

Will come back because I like the location!

I can't count how many times we've stayed at this TR property. It's always a good experience from valet parking to checking in and in room services. I don't know what's with the 3 stars? We've ate at Bacchanal buffet like 3\/4 times only because it costs more and they have the best buffet from all the Total Rewards properties.  Last weekend we went to Omnia for a bachelorette weekend and the line was longgggg but got in pretty fast (25mins in line) and I don't think I should be reviewing it under here . No complaints from the rooms we've stayed in, lots of choices of restaurants and you can always go shopping if you don't gamble or just explore the inside of this property. Checkout their pool and if you're feeling wild they have a topless one!!

Finally got a chance to do a review. I've been to Vegas several times but this was my first time staying at Caesars Palace. We visited about two weeks ago. Wow. I was impressed. Check-in was a breeze.  I used the self check in kiosk. Very quick and if you are not computer savvy, there is an attendant who can help you out. This place is everything Las Vegas.  It can get very crowded, so be patient wading to your room to one of many guest towers. Guest services was awesome and so was the food,  but a bit pricey.  $9 and some change for two medium cups of coffee at Starbucks,  yikes. Oh well,  when in Rome.  The pool is a must visit!!! There are several pools to choose from.  We caught some rays near the poolside bar. Not too crowded and the pool directly in front of bar is for 21yrs and older. For those of you trying to save a few bucks, there is a CVS store across the street for your everyday essentials...I recommend getting some water if you're staying a few days because room bottles are $7.00  Other than that, we had a really great time. This is a must stay and visit.

We only came for the lunch buffet. Wow! Food was incredible and held us over for the rest of the night (I'm not kidding). Free mimosa's and a 2-hour seating limit (it was labor day weekend so it was very very crowded). A fair price for the quality\/quantity of food.

Review for casino and ticketing only:

I've been to Caesars many times for shows and I've always found it to be an interesting place to people watch.  I like the different ways to get to the Palace and Forum casinos and how people I'm with often seem to get lost without proper directing.

I was here today to buy a ticket for the new show "Absinthe."  OK, off to the box office by the Colosseum.  Nope.  Try check in.  No  box office.  Ask the concierge.  Oh it's outside by Serendipity 3.  Who knew?  Well they did.  And then, the box office doesn't open until noon, so I sat in the shade and played Angry Birds.

The box office attendant was great!  She was very competent and helpful.  Now for the show in another week.  I can't wait!

I love coming her and checking out the Forum Shops. Also, the bartender at the sports bar makes a mean, stiff drink. Super tasty. I'm also a big fan of all the Roman inspired architecture. So this is what it felt like to live in Rome back in the day, huh? I wonder if they also had lots of stores and stuff. I wonder what the equivalent of Louis Vuitton was.

I'm rating the hotel as a place to stay 2 stars (poor value) and the service, restaurants, Qua spa and shopping 4 stars (consistently good to excellent quality and decent value for Vegas).
  
I just stayed here with some girlfriends for a 3 day weekend.  We loved the location and that Caesar's had so much to offer, but the room was nothing special, and I won't pay full price to stay here again.  The 2 bedroom suite we payed about $1000 a night for (Fri-Sun) was actually a 1 bedroom suite plus an adjoining regular room (a bedroom with a TV and a small bathroom).  It was comfortable, but not impressive.  

Cons: The decor was plain and outdated, the TVs were old and crappy and there was no view.  There were Krurig coffee makers in the rooms but you had to pay $12 to get 3 K-cups at the honor bar (getting nickle and dimed while paying $1000 a night to stay here = not cool and not classy!).  There is a fee to use the fitness center ($25 per day), a fee for wireless internet, and the pool was closed despite the weather being perfect for laying out =(.  The hallways smelled of smoke.  There was a mini-fridge stocked with drinks, but no place to keep our own snacks and drinks cold and no microwave.  

Pros: The master bathroom was impressive, and the beds were comfy.  The couch was also large and comfy.  They will bring you a mini-fridge on request (we didn't take them up on this, so I don't know if they charge extra for it).

Love love love. Great restaurant options, great late night dinning, great location, and a beautiful property. 

*** Pool area was a cool vibe and a fun atmosphere. We are normally big MGM Grand fans, but we surprised with how much we enjoyed hanging here at the pool too. 
*** I liked the location especially because you could walk to the cheaper casinos to gamble but still a great spot on the strip and close to the nicer places too.
*** From fancy food to a food court, you literally have options for everything you need here. I highly recommend Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill and late night Beijing Noodle #9. 
*** Walk through the forum shops for an awesome atmosphere.
*** Being Italian and having been to Italy, this place def transports you back there in a fun twist and highlights some of the best Italian culture.

The hubby and I will def be back here :)
What's not to like about Caesar's?  Great restaurants, beautiful hotel and casino, shopping, concert venue, obnoxious talking statue show & giant fishtank!  Fun for all ages!  :D

Caesar's USED to be a great hotel. Now it is an overpriced,gigantic piece of garbage that NO ONE should go to. First....They have a huge theft problem. My brand new Ipad Pro and two others trom out group of 15 had their Ipads or laptops stolen OUT OF OUR ROOMS! Security there is worthless...both the people and the infrastructure. Some of the hotel door are "fixed" so they don't close all the way without a significant pull. Which is of course a way to easily break in. 

There are other issues...but Caesar's totally dropping the ball on all problems. I will never stay there again as there are so many nicer more client friendly places to stay. If not with my company (who I will also recommend to NOT use this hotel) I cannot think of 1 redeeming feature of this once iconic hotel...now like the fall of the Roman Empire, in ruins.

Last year I stayed in Caesars Palace several times.

My flight got into town earlier than check-in and the clerk was nice enough to find me a room that was available and it was pretty nice and I enjoyed staying in that room.

If you never been to Caesars you are in for a treat. There are shops and places to eat galore and of course gambling. I think I am the only person who has gone to Vegas didn't gamble but still came back with more money than I came with. That's because I found a quarter in the casino. lol

On my next stay at Caesars, I stayed in a room that was EXTREMELY close to the club which was not good and it was older than the prior room I stayed in. Will I go back to Vegas probably will I return to Caesars probably but will I stay there, I have no idea.

This is for the BUFFET.

Although it was a very small buffet... EVERYTHING I put on my plate was DELICIOUS... Well besides the yogurt but I didn't know it was PLAIN yogurt... I thought it was vanilla. 

But I ate every bite of each plate I had and was satisfied to the t!! The server was decent and earned her tip!! :) It was the last buffet that we decided to go to for our wrist band. 

I loved the breakfast\/brunch and definitely loved the french toast!! YUMMMM!!!!

:)
stayed here over the Christmas weekend and had a great time. our room was expensive but worth it over all. thank you to Marie for picking up after us. we'll be back

I've stayed at Caesar's multiple times, usually when visiting for March Madness, Bachelor's Party, or other guys weekend.  The rooms have normally been fair-to-good and the convenience to the restaurants, sports book, and casino cannot be beat.  However, I recently visited for business and actually wanted a nice, quiet room where I could work and sleep and I would NOT return to Caesar's for that purpose.  Paid up for Octavius Tower (newest bldg), my room was next to the freeway with semi-trailer noise, the room wasn't very clean, there was noise coming through the vents (no joke), the pillow top beds are mediocre... Overall it was overpriced by 80% compared to other hotels. 

So if you're in Vegas to party and gamble with the guys, get a room in the old towers, you probably won't be worried about sleep anyhow.  If you're here on business or with your wife, seek a different property.

NO SALES TAX and every store you could imagine, literally!  I had a mini orgasm just walking around!  You don't even have to buy anything and you'll still take something away from the experience.  If you're shopping with dudes who hate shopping, the decor of the mall is really tight.  We all win!  Yeay!
Stayed in the forum tower nice clean room with two queen beds. Wish it had a bathtub but otherwise ok

Did Caesar live here?"LOL. I had to ask that question at the registration counter as I loved the movie Hangover. This place is huge...really huge and it operates like a well oiled machine. It's been 50 years of existence and I must admit that the owners have done a great job of constantly renovating it. We stayed at the Forum Tower which is close to the mall. Be prepared to walk a lot and remember how to get to your room as you might get lost. The pool and the fitness centre are awesome. They charge a resort fee for it - so make sure you use it. Given the place is huge, don't rely on the folks to listen to your personal details. For example, the coffee machine in my room was not working and I had to make a couple of requests before the problem could be addressed. Most of the folks there want to have a great time and I don't fuss about all these smaller things in life. I don't think they also entertain late checkouts - they might but the process is long. The wait at the registration counter can get frustrating but you can try the self check in-check out feature. Overall, the location is terrific and that's what this makes so special. Have a great time at C

While I've never stayed at this hotel, I have spent my fair share of cashola into coin here. A beautiful hotel with an even more beautiful venue space, it's a definite stop off on any Vegas adventure. Last year, we came here for the Comedy Festival to see Dane Cook and Dave Chappelle and got shit howdied with a bunch of the comedians after the show. (Note: We didn't get shit howdied with Dane or Dave, but other comedians were nice enough to buy two single gals drinks...imagine that)

I won't even deduct a star for the fact that Celine Dion calls this place home. You go with your power of Luuuuurve.
I love staying at Caesars.  In the Forum Tower, maybe I'll try for the Augustus Tower next time.

The hotel is huge and very nice. The casino is great too and full of nearly everything one would want. The prices are high but that is expected. It is Vegas. With that said, I never expected seeing a $12+ charge for one cup of coffee on the bill at check out. Seriously, after paying $1000 for 3 nights in the hotel, this is the silly reason I will NEVER stay in this hotel again. There are too many options in Vegas to subject myself to this type of ripoff. Seriously.

Stayed here for about 5 days. This hotel is amazingly beautiful! And the hotel staff was helpful. I dined at Gordon Ramsey's and Spago during my stay and also ordered room service breakfast. 

I'm giving it 4 stars b\/c it's a gorgeous place and the staff is wonderful. But there's room for improvement. Didn't like that I didn't have robes b\/c didn't pay resort fees. I thought that was ridiculous. Also wifi is not free unless you paid for resort fees as well. Runs at $15 per day which is kind of high. 

You can get lost easily here and it can be hard to locate a staff to ask directions. Prepare to do a lot of walking. Not very convenient in that aspect. I wanted to use the gym which is located at their spa at a different tower than where I was staying. I didn't like that fact. As huge as this place is I think it makes sense to have another gym. Their hours is also limited for the gym and since I was here for work I want able to utilize it. By the time the gym opened I had to be at my meetings. 

The casino area seems dated and could use some renovation. I've seen better ones at the other hotels on the strip.

Still sticking to my 4 star. It was overall a good stay and a gorgeous hotel with good staff.

Although I am giving Caesars only 3 stars, I would absolutely stay here again. The pool, the price point, the proxmity to everything, and the fact that Mariah Carey is now doing a residency here, the food, these are all reasons why I'd definitely stay at Caesars again.

The reason Caesars did not get 5 stars from me is because I felt like they skmped on the little things that really matter in terms of making a person feel like a hotel is home. First off, they did not provide complimentary coffee in your hotel room. They provide the machine, the cups, but you have to pay for the pods to make coffee in your room. Secondly, they only let two people in each room have free Wi-Fi for the day. For reference, we were staying in a 4 person suite. And the Wi-FI was slooooooooooow. We were barely able to go online at all. Thirdly, they charge you what they call a resort fee per day, which is for using the pool and the fitness center ( which again, only two people could use a day. Although everyone can use the pool) It doesn't seem like you can opt out either, so why not just include it in the price?

Other than that, I really enjoyed my stay here. The Pool of the Gods is so relaxing early morning before the crowds arrive. You're right across from the High Roller at the Linq and next to the Bellagio Fountains. Bacchanal Buffet is right inside the hotel. Forum Shops are right there, need I say more?

This place is huge. The forum tower rooms were small but modern and nice. The bathroom was spacious and included a television installed in the mirror which was awesome. The bad part about it was that our room's view was of a wall. The Augustus tower rooms were HUGE, like twice as large as those in the forum tower. More space than necessary but it was nice. Great view too, of the Bellagio fountains. I preferred the forum tower bathrooms more but the Augustus tower bathrooms weren't too shabby. We were lucky enough to get one of the few rooms around the elevator area which are roughly ten feet longer than the rest of the already large rooms in the tower.

While leaving the hotel on our way to LA, we came across an extremely buzzed man walking unstably in traffic next to the hotel by the parking lot. All of a sudden he stopped walking and we waited for him to move for maybe a full minute? He was not budging so we finally honked at him. It took him maybe another minute to respond after wobbling in place with a bottle of beer in hand...

Just got back from a wonderful three night stay at Caesars Palace we were on the 45th floor of the a Gustus tower in a beautiful new remodeled room couldn't have asked for a better view!!! I don't see the point in ever booking somewhere else in Las Vegas because Caesars is the way to go every time you literally don't have to leave the resort they have everything from shopping to gambling great pools and of course the good restaurants we are total rewards members so we get great discounts etc. definitely the place to say of course it is huge and you can't come here without getting lost a time or two but overall great experience and great customer service all the employees here are very friendly besides the ticket pushers a try to push you to buy shows etc. but besides that we have no complaints will be back soon
Also quick sidenote we came here eight days after the tragedy at Mandalay Bay and you wouldn't take nothing ever happened here everything seemed as if it was back to normal but we couldn't help but think of what happened the previous week I don't think they lost much business here though

What a blast it was to spend some time in the iconic Caesars Palace. We spent some time exploring their casino as well as shopping area, and we have to say that we loved every minute. 

The slots are great, the atmosphere was incredible, and shopping here was like being in a mall. The staff here was incredibly polite and we could see ourselves spending a lot of time here in the future.

Been meaning to write a review for Caesar Palace, finally have the chance today. When I go to Las Vegas I stay at Caesar. I usually stay in the suite rooms at Augustus or the Palace Tower which are nice and roomy.  The location is very convenient right in the middle of the strip. We were at Omnia night club for NYE @Caesar's palace, it was an experience with Calvin Harris.

We arrived around one p.m. to check in and were informed that unless we paid $30 that we would have to wait until 3 p.m. for a room, no exceptions, corporate decision!  We went to the restaurant near the lobby to have lunch and think it over, the chopped salad was pitiful.  The meat in this salad is Salami, I asked that they substitute that processed junk for chicken.  The $16 salad was as unimaginative as you can get.  Of course they don't serve any rolls at lunch, another way to short change the guest.  We phoned another hotel and decided to go elsewhere.  They didn't get an additional $30 and they didn't get our business either.  
Wouldn't you think that they would just add the $30 to the room charge, rather than piss people off this way?

Our mini bar had old food smelled discussing had to call house keeping and then they said it would be stocked in the morning and then the next day when i went to get a drink it was locked and we were not given the code for it 
I left my car with valet and when we went to leave i requested my car and they came back and said my car was not starting and it was my remote and i told them thet left somthing on and they try to blame me , and the worst thing in a 4 star resort i asked the to jump it and the supervisor said their jumper kit was broken you have hundreds of cars comming in and you only have one jumper starter ya right then i have to use my owne AAA road side to jump my car and the AAA service guy said they left somthing on and ran down my bateriey 
They took no responsibility for their actions and made me pay for it 

WILL NEVER RETURN THERE

Really a great hotel start to finish.  The many reviews suggested that it was like old vegas and honestly I would agree.  It just had a different feel overall... still a gambling resort\/hotel, but almost everything was in good upkeep and the people seemed to have a little more... class.  I'm not 100% sure I can describe it, but it seemed they were still paying attention to a lot of those little details.

For example, we went one day to their little mini food court to grab a slice of pizza... long story short the CHEF of the little pizza place and I had a long discussion\/teaching lesson about the proper way to not create heat and acid in pizza sauce.  Along with how their 60 degree oven temp difference and humidity difference caused them to use 4 different flours versus up in front of the hotel which only used two and the overall gluten content difference in oz's.  It was so incredibly detailed for just the random pizza food court chef.  Honestly, there was multiple honest to god chef's in the food court, that just floored me in general.  

The check in was nice and we got Jasper to check us in who was FANTASTIC.  She was super friendly and knowledgeable.  We mentioned it was my wife's birthday weekend and she offered a different tower, but a much larger room, which was fantastic.  Supposedly they were doing construction nearby, but we never heard it.  Marble bathroom, comfy bed, great pools.  We really enjoyed it overall... ended up at Cleopatras barge which I had heard about from my mother from 30 years previous.  We almost might say we liked cleos barge as much as we liked some of the mega clubs as it was super lowkey and fun, but honestly, we're talking a fun chill bar with a mini dance floor vs a mega club...not in the same ballpark.  Still relaxing and fun.  

Overall had wonderful food and an excellent time... couldn't have asked for more, wonderful visit.

Meh, it's just alright.  I was pretty unimpressed with the rooms although the bathrooms are great.  The service sucks though as you get on the phone with the desk and you get put on hold for 10 minutes.  Oh and it smells hella funny.  Haven't seen the pool yet but I hear it's amazing... C'mon Caesar's impress me!!

I'll preface this review by saying we don't frequent the strip all that often, but have stayed most places along the strip over the years. I've always wanted to stay at Caesar's, but for whatever reason, haven't until now......and probably never will again. 

They are lucky they are in the middle of the strip, because that is really the only reason they get the 2 Stars. Upon check in, they are trying to get you to spend money. The woman checking me in says, do you want to upgrade for $40\/night? So I say, what do I get with an upgrade.....and she says, "uhhh, maybe a bigger room and a flat screen"? No thanks....I'll pass.

The hotel is old and out dated. The positives of Caesar's are everything BUT the actual rooms. The casino\/sports book is decent. I hate the renovations that have done at the Sports Book. They basically cut the size in half with the new bar they put in.....oh well, they take your money the same as before. Location is center strip, convenient to a lot of attractions. The rooms are garbage. We had a single King in the Roman tower. Your basic run of the mill room that you can get anywhere else on the strip. The hotel is freezing cold.....the room doesn't provide you the option of water bottles like every other place on earth does. My wife and I have been married 11 years.....but NO bathroom door.....that's a little interesting. The tub was brown, and the shower had mold on the ceiling. Just your basic room at a higher rate than a lot of other places. We will be going somewhere else the next time we visit Las Vegas.

Awesome time at this casino last night. A lot of slots and video poker, forum shops.... it goes on for like three blocks! There were craps and all sorts of other table games. Was so fortunate to find a $5 minimum table and had some kick ass dealers. Absolutely love the $1 video Poker machines. They take the Total Rewards cards and offer discounts on food. I played here everyday during my Vegas stay because it's just that awesome. Love the art and statues and just overall feel of this place. Had dinner at Joe's Seafood one night and had a great filet. Wait staff at Joe's are great (shout out to Todd ). Would definitely return to  Caesars  my next time coming to Vegas.

I am currently a hotel guest on a five day stay at caesars palace. The worst customer service and lack of interest in helping a guest. Waited almost an hour to get into my hotel room after leaving my key in room.
Walked to front desk and they said security would be at room by the time I got back up elevator. 
After 45 minutes and countless calls to front desk nobody came.
The property is nice and the restaurant nice but the overall staff lacks knowledge.
Kaoki is the front desk manager and is not qualified or friendly or professional iin dealing with guests. He has no business being in the industry as is one of the rudest service person. I challenge the hotel to look at video and audio of my horrible experience. 
Also, if you gamble at sports book you cannot place bet until after 9am because they open late. Posted hours on sites say 8am. If you are here for a conference, you are in meetings by 9am so you miss out on betting. 
Overall a poorly operated hotel. People make all the difference. 
Stay somewhere else. Caesars lacks service.

I went to Vegas for my best friend's moms birthday. I wanted to stay somewhere nice as it was only for a few days and figured that it would be worth it to splurge on an iconic location. Boy was I wrong! After checking into our room, which smelled like cigarette smoke and looked like a seedy motel of route 66, I went to check out the strip with my sister. When we came back our bathroom had completely flooded. And not just with water. It was covered in this black muck and it was clear that housekeeping had tried to clean it up but then gave up and settled for throwing a towel over it (the logic in this move is just crazy). It was also over all of my makeup and brushes. Obviously it was a bathroom so the water wasn't the cleanest. We called the front desk and explained the situation, they did give us a room upgrade right off the bat which I appreciated. We had to insist that they send someone up test the water to make sure it wasn't contaminated. 

I was expecting a few other comps as well considering how gross\/traumatic it is to have your expensive cosmetics covered in dirty water but they were pretty stingy. They replaced my brushes for me but since my makeup containers were "closed" they washed them for me and gave them back to me. 

2 stars because the upgraded room was nice. But I would have liked a free dinner or something, we ended up almost being late for a show due to this nonsense!

I'm here for work (convention + training) and was expecting this place to look like Excalibur.  Lol.  We arrived, they booked our room next to the convention center with a view of the pools and statue of Caesar!  Hale Caesar lol.  Real awesome!  Love the entrance of the room, large room, king size bed, good size tv, large jacuzzi, desk, couch and just fancy :).  The maids cleaned daily even x2 a day!  Constructive criticism just to be nitpicky - the closet door has a crack, one of the blankets had a lil hole, the food in the room is pressure sensored so be careful if you nudge or they will charge you, they only allow 1 laptop or device to connect to the room or they charge $14 a day, when I first arrived there was a small drop of what seemed to be blood by the toilet floor, some towels lost their luster which should be thrown away and the food during the convention sucked except for the cream puff (I am very detailed oriented).  All in all this place was good.  :D

Caesar's Palace is my favorite hotel in Las Vegas. I have never stayed at the hotel, but I definitely make a point to visit it ever time I am here.

I think that it has the best location on the strip. It's located right in the middle of the strip, so it's easy to walk to both ends from the hotel. It's also located across the street from one of the newer parts of the strip; an outdoor "mall" that has new restaurants and shops along with a giant ferris wheel!

Inside Caesar's Palace they have a shopping center with every upscale store that you can imagine. The shopping center is beautiful with a ceiling painted like the sky with clouds and it's really pretty. Also inside the shopping center is a "Fall of Atlantis" animatronic show which I have to watch every time I am in Las Vegas. It's really entertaining with fire, lights, water and everything!

There are also plenty of great restaurants inside Caesar's Palace so you don't have to go to another hotel to get something to eat. My Husband and I's favorite is Joe's which has great snow crab and seafood. I had to make a reservation two weeks in advance for a 5:30pm reservation on a Saturday in March! We have also tried Mesa Grill which was absolutely horrible but I'll save that for another review.

I hope to stay at Caesar's Palace next time I come to Las Vegas, but it sells out quickly so make sure to make your reservation early!

Mid-June reservations at Caesar's Palace proved to be a most expensive and disheartening experience!  Nothing like the Las Vegas of old.  Prices were through the roof, room was over a block long from the front desk.  Never again will I go to Las Vegas.  Totally unacceptable how they gouge the patrons with their exorbitant prices, but the smell was disgusting.  Sewer, sewer, sewer.. Should tell you a little something about this place.  
Las Vegas is going to price themselves right out of customers!

Caesars Palace is always off the hook when we go here! I REALLY enjoy this casino. The architectural design this place displays is really amazing! I wish they would eliminate smoking here, totally sucks! Unfortunately it's in every casino I've visited in Vegas. I'm not a "huge" gambler, but when I do, I usually win a few times. I really enjoy attending the shows and fighting events here. Also there is a good buffet, however it's pricey. The free parking is also gone which is a bummer. If it wasn't for the paid parking, expensive buffet and all the smoke!inside I would give it five stars. If you're in Vegas Caesars Palace is a must place to see.
Horrible customer service. Asked the valet for directions And he got on his walkie talkie and told someone that he is over here with two dumb asses. Don't waste your time or money here.

I like this casino\/hotel. I've never stayed in the hotel but its a great place for tourists to take lots of pics - with light shows and to get Fat Tuesday refills you can watch said light show. Hard to understand everything they say in the shows which I've seen several times, too many to count - and still have no idea what they are saying. 
The casino is attached to the forum shops - with all kind of high end shopping to be done. Ooh and if you are a boxing fan, the other night we saw they showing the fight for free in the sports book. Unfortunately we had out-of-towners that didnt want to stay unless they could sit.? pshh. not me. I needed to stand after that great meal @ cheesecake factory!

oh and by the way "this is not the "REAL" Caesar's Palace."

This was where I spent 4th of July this yr. Great fireworks and snowboarders showing off their talents. I always make it a point to go thru here when I make it out to the strip. 

that being said. drinks @ their bars can be pricy. $15 for a mojito that tasted like Crest. No thanks.

What a dump.  I had stayed here several years ago for a conference and was back in town this week for another trade show.  Instead of being at the Venetian or the Wynn, I was one of the few unlucky ones who got stuck at Caesar's.  

Let's just do a quick rundown of what was crummy about my stay there:
- Official check-in is at 4 PM but my room wasn't ready until 5:30 PM.
- Room was in the Roman Towers which smells musty.  
- TV was broken, 2 lights were out, 1 flickered, and there was no TV remote.  Not offered a room switch although I should have insisted on one. 
- Paul Mitchell convention with tons of young hairdressers who unfortunately were in the room next to me and got back drunk every night at 3-4 AM yelling & screaming.  Rooms don't have much sound insulation so I heard much of their conversation.  It also took the Front Desk over 15 minutes to send someone up 2 times to get to finally shut up.  I wasn't offered another room either or a comp.  
- $25\/day to use the gym which had the cheap eclipital machines, no rowing machines and a single bench press.  YMCA typically have more impressive gyms and equipment especially in regards to free weights.   
- There is no express check-out.  It took over 30 minutes just to hand in my key & get my room receipt.    

It is clear as day that Caesar's has been really hit by the economic downturn & really been skimping as much as possible on room maintenance.  Also not a place that is business traveler friendly as evidenced by the disaster that is the check-in\/check-out process.  It never was a great place for service but you frankly get better service from the Front Desk at a Motel 6.  

The only good thing about the stay was that the bed was comfortable & the bathroom had a shower & tub.  I would have just been better off staying at the Hard Rock or another place off the Strip instead.

Oh my god!!!!!!!!

This hotel has it all. Luxury room, huge casino, biggest and luxurious shopping mall, awsome night club, beautiful pool, fantastic shows, classy restaurants, nice bars, nice employees, safe and huge parking lot...etc.

when you stay at caesars palace, you don't have to go to other hotels...
This hotel is like a K-mart. One stop entertainment. 

I stayed here three times and two thumbs up!!!

When you book this hotel, be sure to book a room that has a spa tub.
It will make you feel better after you ------ like there is no tomorrow.

My wife and I just got back from Vegas, we stayed there March 4-7th. We ended up getting to the hotel to check in around 430pm and we only waited around 10-15min. The front desk person tried to up sell us a different room and we declined because my dad purchased this room for us and we didn't want to pay extra money. We stayed in the Roman Tower and when we got to the room, we had mirrors on the ceiling and a hot tub in the bedroom. Oh and you can see in the bathroom from the bedroom, because one of the walls is glass (nice touch) Our view from the room was of the pool that had constuction but we could see the sunset and a good view of the Palms (which is where we will stay next time) and the Rio. When we got to the room it was clean and we had no issues. 
I lived in Vegas for almost 2 years and I still got lost in this hotel. I started to figure it out only one day in but still. This place is huge. The only things we played at Caesar's was penny\/nickel slots. We went across the street to O'Shea's to play table games since it was cheaper. We didn't eat anywhere in this hotel so I cant say anything about that but over all it was a nice room and the people working their were kind. 
Don't even think about checking out at the front desk on a fri-sun, for its WAY to busy. We carried all our stuff downstairs and then saw the line at the front desk and I wold have been in line for like an hour. So we went back to the room...checked our balance and checked out through the TV...much easier. 

If you have any questions you can always ask me. I am a travel agent so I will give you all the info I have. 

Peace Out,
MZ

We visited here to see the Seinfeld on tour bus.
