They were giving away lot sof seinfeld colectibles and t-shirts and the bus was an exhibit of memorabilia with Monk's Diner serving Non-fat Yogurt and other free snacks like junior mints,twix and black & white cookies. The event itself was very dead and somehwat hidden. The parking was the worst, you had to park out back on the 5th level and then take the elevator to the casino which was impossible to navigate to the front so we ended up back outside & having to walk to the front with no sidewalks on either side of the road. 
We did however enjoy the aquarium at the Forum Shops they had a diver in the tank and you got to see the fish even more close-up.

Here for a seminar, there are a lot of exposition halls at the bottom of the Forum Towers and probably that's why our room was there too. Well, the second room we got, because the first one we unlocked and got in was occupied! Luckily no-one was in, so we got out fast and went back all the way to the Reception and asked for another room. But while in this new room others tried to come in, we had to let them know we were inside, so the occupied rooms mishap was still going on! Probably their system was messed up, they offered to give us new keys and cancel all other ones. This was just our bad luck I guess, other than that the hotel is "old school" fancy, meaning that it was fancy a decade ago but now is just weirdly outdated. There are few power outlets in the room and none by the bed, I had to unplug a lamp to charge my phone. Same at the desk, everything was designed before people had phones and wifi, they still have network cable ports. Same with the TV, no hdmi or even vga inputs, those things are too new for them. Other than that the room was clean and the drapes covered the windows to keep complete dark in the room, a must in the mornings in Vegas! The hotel has a lot of nice amenities from huge pools to great restaurants and bars, plenty of cafes and convenience shops, a lot of popular shows, food court, the Forum Shops and tons of gambling options. Heck, they even have a hotel inside this hotel (Nobu) and one of the nicest night clubs on the strip - Omnia. The location is great, right on the strip with driving access from both sides.

Remember 3 stars means A-OK! I do like the casino floor here. The rooms that are newly updated are great but then again I've seen some that need work! There's a few great places to eat here, plus great shopping. Do the tourist thing and snap your photos and pretend you're fancy pants!

I went to Vegas the first week of January for the hundreth time it seemed.. but this time  was different. Why you ask, oh because I went with my parents and baby sibling.. yes that's right a family vacation to las vegas. The pain of having a 12 year old wingman.. I can't even describe. But... a little sweet relief came to me at caesars. Every 5 minutes while sitting at the slots or the tables a cocktailer would come by.. now i didnt order one everytime, I'm not that much of a fish, but the consistency was very nice, seeing as at the wynn it took like 15 minutes of play to have a drink in hand. Anyways, idk if it was because i was there for CES but the rest of vegas.. no hotness.. caesars.. lots of hotness! Great tables, great clubs, excellent, my next trip to sincity i will be staying at caesars. Plus they have SERENDIPITY!!! love fro cho. 

Caesars is where its at.

I had a very amazing stay at the Caesars place hotel, it's a very Nice Hotel and the supervisor Leah foster was just so helpful with taking care of us and making sure our stay was as great as it was, we will for sure book again at this hotel.
Great location on the strip. Hotel with a ton of food options, great shopping. Have never actually stayed there so can't tell you how the rooms are

Always wanted to stay at this casino hotel - finally I did.  I'm in the 1200 sq ft suit  1 bedroom With Mom - got a great rate with my total rewards. Nice decor , tv clarity poor , furniture is scuff up , I'd prefer a bar or powder room than a walkin closet. I had fun.  Maybe I come back

Never stay at ceasars palace. The worst. I have been a customer since 1975 the place has gone right down hill. I tried to check in yesterday when the hotel was 60% of capacity. It was 2:00 The front desk clerk said come back at 4:00 or pay $30.00. I said I am playing a tournament at ceasars and won't be done till 2:00 am and it would be greatly appreciated if I could check in now  he got his manager Roland Deguilmo who came out and was extremely rude and seemed to be doing whatever he could to be disrespectful and cause a terrible customer experience. So I came back at 2:00 am and 15 people were waiting to check in I did not get my room till past 3:00am. They only had 1 person working. The room did not even have a clock in it and the lighting was so dim I could hardly see. The rooms are 15 years past updating. Ate breakfast their also. Paid $22.00 for an omelette that was a 4 at best on a 1-10 scale. Toast was cold and they make u butter it yourself even though you ask them to butter it before they bring it to you.  Overall a miserable experience. They have lost me as a customer. I will never go back. It's no wonder they are in BK. They simply don't care

If there was an option for no stars at all I'd choose that one.  I used to think Caesars Palace was one of the best hotels to stay at in Vegas and I've always recommended anyone and everyone to stay there.  Obviously, I was wrong.  In a recent trip to Vegas for a work conference, I experienced the WORST customer service EVER - in general - c\/o Caesars Palace.  I've gotten better treatment at the Holiday Inn.  

It took over an hour for me to check in.  They didn't offer any apologies for losing the paperwork that was faxed and emailed to them and they made very little effort in trying to find it.  There was no "sorry for the inconvenience" or any attempts to remedy the situation.  It was such a waste of time.  Caesars is no longer one of the main hotels.  You're better off spending your money at Bellagio or Palazzo.  Good luck.

Me and my girlfriend stayed here over the weekend, went out Friday night and had a good time. Woke up Saturday morning in our hotel room, the front door was propped open with a hand towel....WTF?! My girlfriends wallet was scattered on the bathroom floor...WTF?! My wallet was missing..WTF??!!! Turns out we were robbed in the middle of the night by some fucking assholes! Finally got a hold of security supervisor only to have him tell me that the hotel assumes no responsibility to stolen items....ARE YOU FUCKING KIDDING ME???!!!! We pay good money to stay at your hotel to feel a sense of security only to get robbed in the middle of the night and now that's OUR FAULT??!! 100% DO NOT RECOMMEND STAYING HERE!!!!  FUCK YOU CAESARS!!!!!

Overpriced. Checking at\/out at guest reception counter is a nightmare...long lines. Using kiosks instead is faster for checkin with no issues needing resolved. 

Parking is 10 bucks\/day plus $18\/day if you use valet service. 

Don't move anything in the mini-bar refrigerator (bottles sit on sensors and automatically charge your account if disturbed ! Then you will have to stand in reception line to get reversed. The hotel will rent you a refrigerator for $30\/day !

 Basically, Caesars 'Nickel- dimes you to death. A far cry from the good old days when the client was valued

This flagship of Caesars Entertainment has seen better days.  The Corporation should change it's name back to Harrahs Entertainment because that is the quality you are now getting at Caesars Palace.  My wife and I are both Diamond Total Rewards players, we come to Caesars quite often from Florida.  The following is what we have experienced just the last 3 visits within a year; the bed box spring out of it's frame and refusing to fix it, broken heater, broken lamps, room not the cleanest, room requested not available(normal), mattress quality very inferior, and rude Casino Hosts.

The Restaurants at Caesars are often quite busy, the quality is hit or miss at any one on any day, except for Mesa Grill, which has been excellent at every meal every time.

Always love staying at  Caesars Palace because:

-All the rooms are updated and very nice with plenty of room.
-Room views are really nice either being the pool or strip.
-Check in is very fast
-Plenty of services available on site

Bad:
Valet sucks
Great ambiance! Beautiful hotel. The pool is fantastic. Really elegant decor. Very high priced service and restaurants. Great place to stay. Eat somewhere else.
Bad service. It takes an hour to check in. Only two hotel receptionist were on duty. Never chose this hotel!

I play poker here semi regularly when I'm in the mood to play a quick tournament and at 20 min levels it feels alot like a turbo. The guarantees for the cash outs are decent and I have played in over 5 tournaments in last 3 months where there was 20 or less entries thus improving your odds of cashing substantially. 90% of the players are tourist looking to try their luck so be prepared for all ins  level one with A J off suit. Don't say I didn't warn you! The dealers here are warm and welcoming and floor managers are super as well. If you have limited time and want to sneak in a poker tourney, give them a shot with games at 10am 2pm 6pm and 9pm your sure to find one that fits your time constrants.

Beautiful hotel however we got lost way too often.  We stayed in one of the Forum tower rooms and they are very nice.  They are also located next to the forum shop so thats a plus for people who like to shop at high end stores.  The beds were very comfortable and the pillows were feather down.  Theres a flat screen tv and there is a dual head shower that can fit up to 10 people like on the real world lol so there is no tub.  Room service did a really good job tidying up the room and my personal stuff. Automatic drapes were a plus so we didnt have to get up and do it. One thing I didnt like was there is a mini bar and snacks so if you pick up an item for more than 20 seconds it instantly charges your room.  We were never warned about that and had some charges that we didnt do. They did prorate it for us but they should have a lock on the mini fridge. You can also request a fridge for your own food our drinks by calling house keeping.  We also order room service for breakfast Saturday morning and it was not that great. My smoothie was watery and the hashbrowns were cold and dry. Toast was also dry and it taste like it was toasted before everything else was prepped. Only thing that was good was the basted eggs and the mini blueberry muffin that came with it. There is a $5 fee plus 18% gratuity also so I say skip room service unless u really cant.

Wow.  

I was upgraded to a deluxe room in the Augustus Tower with a view of the Bellagio fountains.  

I'm a bit biased.

Let me just tell you, though, if you can get this room... you should.  I didn't want to check out.  The room was huge, the beds were comfortable, the view was breathtaking, the bathroom was god-like and I just fell in love with it all.  Now I'm withholding a star from this rating because the other two people I came with, who were also upgraded to this tower, did not get the same view and their room just wasn't the same without it.  Still nice, just not 5-star worthy.  

Some things to know...

1.  The taxi cab line is crazy.  It's really not worth waiting if you are going somewhere within walking distance.  I waited over 45 minutes one night.  

2.  The pool at Caesars is top notch.  Don't make the mistake of finding this out on the last day (like I did).  Experience it, love it and oh yeah, get there early cause it fills up quickly!

3.  The 24-hour buffet pass is worth it.  I know it seems steep, but just purchase it and you won't regret it.  Ceasars for breakfast (seriously, it's the best for that) and Planet Hollywood for dinner.  Rinse and repeat.  I left out lunch because you should be a) at the pool b) at the spa or c) raking in money at the craps table.  

Overall, I can definitely recommend Ceasars Palace, but just make sure you don't get stuck in one of the old rooms.  Whatever you can do to get into the Augustus Tower, do it.  And request a view of the Bellagio Fountains!

Truly one of the worst experiences I've had in Vegas as far as hotel stays and accommodation goes.  Long story short they stuck me in a hotel room instead of the two bedroom suite that was booked in their oldest and smelliest tower (Forum Tower), basically I paid for the two bedrooms suites and got two connecting rooms instead. 

Rooms are old and smelly, ice bucket didn't have the plastic liners and I know we didn't get a suite as booked cause there was no bath ropes or slip-on in the rooms and when I called guest services asking for it I was told ropes\/slip-on are only for suites and my room is not a suite. 

I've asked multiple times for a copy of my recorded reservation recording conversation but I still have not receive it. 

I asked for a medical refrigerator at the time of check-in since  we had diabetic medicine with us and didn't get it till 3 hours later and 3 phone calls which by then it was already too late!

Whole in the wall and missing handle bars in elevators are just the icing on top!!!

Caesar's Palace is the Walmart among the strip's big properties.

Crappy customer service - making me wait while they train their newbies (how about training them on the process BEFORE you put them in front of people and try training them on how to serve customers?).

Price gouging runs amok. $15 a day for in-room WiFi ($25 for property-wide access), $25 to use the health club, a crappy meal at the noodle shop costs $9 for a small bowl of soup \/ $20 for kung pao chicken \/ $5 more for noodles or rice (really?), $17 for a HOUSE red wine at RAO.

The layout and furnishings are as old and tired as the brand itself.

If you go there expect to grab your ankles and bend over a lot.

Currently sitting in the room running the water waiting for it to 'warm up'. It takes a good 20 minutes to get hot water out of the sink and their answer is that there are lots of pipes so the water was sitting and the hot water needs to just make its way here. Only staying two nights and wasn't worth fighting them to move rooms. So much for saving the planet. Casino is very smokey. Pros good shops and pools.

We decided to stay here because the rate was competitive at just under $385 total for a two night weekend stay at the Forum Tower. We originally booked at the Mirage for the same price since we wanted to see the Beatles Love show but there's less casino crowds at Caeser's so it seemed like a good buy. 

The week of the trip we received an email stating we might be able to upgrade the room for $37 for a deluxe King Octavius Suite or Augusta Tower so we gladly submitted our request for an upgrade if available. I wasn't surprised that neither upgrade was available but I was a little insulted that a King Bed Octavius Tower room was offered to us at $74 a night extra. It's like a bait and switch tactic telling me you can get less and pay more for the upgrade. We took the upgrade even with that because the Octavius tower is closer to the Garden of the Gods pool and it's supposed to be nicer then the forum. 

I made the mistake of using a debit card to secure the 1st night so that I could collect reward points from my bank but this ended up being a mistake because the both the credit card (security deposit) a bank card were authorized for the same amount. I wasn't worried about being double billed but when you're in Vegas, you wanted a much money on hand to gamble and eat with. So lesson learned, don't give them a debit card since they take a larger room deposit and in my case, they authorized both cards on file. 

The person who checked us in at the front entrance was VERY pleasant (Leza) and I felt like she was very welcoming. Not saying some of the other front desk people we worked with throughout the week were bad but she's wasn't as stiff as they were :)

Because of the upgrade, we were able to check in around 9:30am. We ate at the Bacchanal buffet as part of the Buffet of Buffets pass. (Separate review of both the buffet and the pass). Headed to the pool only to find that the Augustus Tower blocks most of the sun from the pool until late afternoon. The pool is amazingly beautiful, well-kept but the lack of spots with sun could be a reason for us not to book here during the warmer months. On day two, the entire pool for the day was closed because they were filming a movie there. Not cool ... especially with no advance until the day of. We end getting into the Bellagio pool for a small price and spent our money at their pool which is much nicer since they get more sun. This is my only real negative comment about Caesars.

Octavius Tower: We had a standard size King Room facing a view of the back of the Bellagio. We could see the water fountain show from a far which was cool. The room was spacious with nice furniture but a little on the basic side. I thought there would be a Caesar's flare to the room but that was limited to the one painting on the wall. It seems that at all hours of the afternoon and early evening, there were maid stations parked in the hallways so if two people were moving in opposite directions down the hallway, one person had to let the other through. This happened at least 6-7 times and this isn't something I should have to deal with from a 5 star hotel. Maybe they were understaffed that weekend but still. The bathrooms were nice and did have that flare to them. Overall, I really wouldn't pay more for the Octavius King Bed tower if offered the upgrade. 
Resort Fees: Ugh. You can't get around these unless you trade in Reward Points and the services that you could use with the resort fees are pretty limited. I don't want a $25 credit towards an overpriced spa and I shouldn't have to pay for use of the gym or internet. Caesar would be better off charging you $25 as a resort fee and giving you a $25 poker chip. That way I'd feel like I got something out of it when you lthe $25 anyways. BTW. We could not use our mobile phones in the Octavius Tower room so if you're banking on using that as a tethering device, you can't unless you want to move the desk by the window for spotty service. This could also be a problem if you're trying to connect with other ppl.  

Would I stay a Caesars again? Yes but only if I got a deal.  I felt like we overpaid for what we received but I liked being in a casino where I didn't to elbow yourself a spot in a crowd.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for three nights and though we both enjoyed the hotel as a whole and were pleased with the restaurants and other amenities (Garden of the Gods and Buffet of Buffets) I don't think we'll be returning anytime soon, if at all. 

Here's why:

Check in and out were a breeze with the self services stations. Navigating from the parking garage (free - yes, one perk) with our many overloaded bags to the room was like competing a Spartan Race... Our room was great - clean, spacious, and luxurious - up until we tried to use the Jacuzzi tub and it spewed tons of unidentified black stands into the water...

We brought this to the attention of the hotel and they sent engineering and housekeeping up.  When we returned to the room there was a note from engineering saying the job was complete. Housekeeping cleaned up the black things. 

Fast forward to our last night in Vegas when we planned our night around relaxing in the Jacuzzi tub.... Deja vu.  Seeing as it was close to midnight, we called the hotel desk and filed another complaint. The boyfriend told them we were giving up on using the tub but were disappointed since the problem was supposed to be fixed. He made it clear that since it was so late we did not want it to be fixed.  

Just as we were falling asleep (almost 2am) the phone rang. We didn't pick it up. Seconds later our door opened and someone came in (we assume to fix the tub).  We asked them to leave since we were sleeping. The boyfriend couldn't sleep after that and spoke with the front desk about the rude awakening. 

The worst wake up though happened at 3:30am on our second night when a concerning alarm stating that there was an unidentified emergency and that we should stay calm and in our room was blaring in our ears. The automated loud speaker message said that security would keep us "apprised of the situation". After what felt like 10-15 minutes and of the alarm going off and another half hour of being freaked out and thinking worst case scenarios, the alarm stopped. We called the front desk and they said everything was probably fine but to stay in our room until security said otherwise. Lovely way to relax on vacation. 

Needless to say, we never heard from security and had to call to find out that it was a hot shower that set off the smoke alarm. REALLY?? Either we were lied to or they need to fix their smoke alarm so it doesn't alert the whole hotel of some unknown emergency. 

For all of our inconveniences we did get some monetary resolution. While I respect that the hotel tried to better a not- so-great stay, money doesn't fix the fact that we spent a lot on what we thought would be a fun and relaxing getaway. Not so relaxing when you can't use the amenities you paid for or get more than one night of uninterrupted sleep....

If I could give it 0 stars I would. A motel would've been so much better than this place, well that may be exaggerating but you get the point. Huge hotel, 1 single line to give out keys, I'd say that's pathetic. It's nice to admire the place but don't stay here, it's not worth it. Front desk employees are very rude. Rooms are disgusting, never again so many other great hotels.

It may not be the newest or most trendy of places on the strip, but Caesar's is a good place to stay. There's a ton of dining options (most of which are pretty good), they have a lot of good machines for gambling, and several bars throughout for the mid-casino pit stop. Our room was clean and comfortable, with a very nice bed for crashing. I would definitely stay here again.

Complaining! Drove to Las Vegas yesterday 3 o'clock made it here about 7:15 p.m. End up having to drive around in circles at Caesars Palace because they said the valet was too full.  Finally I parked in the self parking which was far away and had to go find the registration desk for the hotel. I had to use the  hotel self check.  I was given a room on the 24th floor in the Augustus tower, room number 2466.  Before i took the long walk back to my car to retrieve my luggage, i decided to go check out my room. Stepping off tle elevator, I was greeted with the sent of dog (yuk).  When I open the room door I was greeted with the stench of cigarette smoke. My reservations called for a non-smoking room and my reservations were made sometime in September last year. I complained at the front desk and they said sorry that's all we have available. Needless to say I filed  my complaint, they did not try to accommodate me, they only asked if I even went to see the room....duh!!!   I gave back my room keys and left because they would not give me a non-smoking room.  I told them I will just drive back to Los Angeles  and file a formal complaint later.   Worst experience ever.

After posting exact same review on their Facebook page- the total rewards program responded and had us moved to a very nice king non smoking room for remainder of visit.  Now I can honestly say I enjoyed our stay and would return\/recommed

I would like to advise all of you to NEVER stay at Caesars palace or any other Harrah's property. This week I attended a conference there and I left in a wheel chair. There was no drinking involved in this incident. Because Harrah's is apparently broke, they can no longer afford appropriate maintenance, or they don't care. I don't know. But this is what happens when a large, steep, packed escalator comes to an ABRUPT stop. I go tumbling down the escalator. My ankles are on ice, bruised. Caesars was terrible. If it hadn't been for the kind gentlemen in front of me, that caught me, this could have been much worse. There was also grease on the hand rail, SO UNSAFE AND SO IRRESPONSIBLE! For your safety, please never go there. I would not trust any Harrah's owned property.

This is probably my least favorite place to stay in Las Vegas. The customer service is horrible. My fiancé made reservations and was informed that the resort fee would be waived through the online receptionist. Upon checking out, the supervisor (Theary) explained that the Resort fee could not be waived and was part of the casino policy. Her poor attitude and unwillingness to honor a previous employee's statement was beyond disheartening. 

Other fees that were charged included valet parking, which was explained that members staying at Caesar's Palace would not have to pay. We were charged for two rooms (even though we only had one room). The inconsistency about hotel charges was disappointing to hear about. Lastly, the initial room that was appointed to us was dirty. We asked to change rooms and were afforded another room. Get it right the first time!

I would urge others to seek other places to stay. The hidden, inconsistent fees and poor customer service along with lack of clear communication are not worth spending your time or money at this casino.

Favorite place to stay every time we come in! There's always plenty to do and it's in a prime location on the strip. The only downside this time around was with the taxi line. Uber\/Lyft are finally available in Las Vegas which is great since the taxi's are such rip offs. Unfortunately, the hotel puts the rift between the taxi's and uber\/Lyft above the convenience of their customers. The pick up location for our Uber rides was basically nonexistent and if you ask any worker there they refuse to help you find it. Other hotels put a line for them right up front next to the taxi's. Hopefully Caesar's will do the same soon.

Stayed here for a work conference last week and I was so impressed! This hotel is gorgeous, very clean and the staff was kind. I loved coming back to my room being nice and "tidy" everyday. One morning I was in a rush and left make up scattered all over the place. The maid cleaned up everything so nicely. Staff was very helpful and I was always greeted with a smile. Having the Forum shops connected to the hotel is a plus too! Lots of great stores. Omnia nightclub is always a good time as well. I cannot wait to stay here again.
One of the more epic casinos in Las Vegas. I loved the interior and it had some of the cooler machines and tables.
One of the better casinos.  I've always had a thing for Caesar's because I was a stone sculptor, like, 10 lives before this current one.
One of my favourite casinos! We must've hit up 2 Starbucks here and spent too much time at Victoria's Secret for that sale! Geeez!! It was fun but exhausting.
Cool place! makes me think of Hangover. All the hotels in Vegas are very cool and unique. Not for kids. If i was a kid i would have been very bored

This review is really for the food court. Particularly..... "Ah So" the asian cuisine..... I didn't look for this place and I'm not making the name up, but I was a little upset at the name, not to say I didn't try it, but still!

The prices here in this food court of non commercial eateries is fairly expensive, but somewhat satisfying. The menu's are small but the different places remind me of the buffet at the Planet Hollywood (Spice Market).

The bowl of udon cost me 9.95 and it was pretty good. The best part was the soy sauce packets, heck with red and yellow packets, or white with red packets.....these are fish! 

Like they're little fish where you unscrew their mouths and squeeze them and they barf out soy sauce, I mean if I was full of soy I'd barf too...

But if you're in the area, across from Bette Midler, and hungry for some sterotypes and people watching, enjoy a bite at the food court of the Caesars... don't forget to get your cigar at Casa Fuente afterwards!

Been going to Caesars for the last 5 years. Got engaged and married at the property. I've been an avid Vegas person since I was a kid. Best hosts in Vegas by far. As with any older hotel there's always some work that could be done but I've yet to encounter any reason to go anywhere else.

This place is not worth the money unless you are a whale. I'm an average joe that scored a room through his wife due to a conference.  The room was paid for but the cost of the room was about $189 a night. For that amount I expected Wynn quality (where I have stayed) only to get your basic Las Vegas room. Heck I had to fight for Valet. I'm staying here. No cheap eats to be found. Although AH SO is the saving grace to this place. Never liked it here and I still don't. Not even my money being spent and I'm still not happy. The pool is nice. Oh and you have to pay for Wifi.

The surcharge  for parking is $18 for valet, $10 for self park. The self serve check in, does not live up to the hype. You still have to stand in line to pick up your keys. Don't expect complimentary coffee or tea, a K Cup with cups are in the room, nothing else. My first night both sinks were not draining. Call and inform engineering, they show up at midnight, yes midnight when I called them at 10:15 pm.  This hotel has gone down in terms of their amenities. House keeping

Stayed in Vegas for a business trip for 5 nights\/6days. We all stayed at Caesars Palace. Friends that stayed in the Palace and Octavius towers had beautiful rooms. My room in the Roman tower was disgusting. No glass shower or closet. Old bedding and decor. Would not pay $50 for this room, let alone $219 a night. I am not usually one to complain, but it was horrible. Tried to switch rooms after first night and rude front desk lady declined to help me.
The room was just okay, I think that they could offer free Internet though for the price.

I think this is gaudy and pricey.  I used to love the Forum Shops but I got lost looking for chocolatiers the last time I was there.  My mother took us here to see Celine Dion when she was performing.  The construction still looks nice though.  There weren't many children or temperature control problems in January.

After having a bad experience in SF for memorial weekend, we booked a room here and were completely in love with it! Upon our arrival the staff was very friendly and gave us a free upgrade. Despite a moth that we found on the window, everything was perfect. The beds are nice and comfy. The shower and the tub are beautiful and clean. We will definitely be staying here again.

I have always loved this place; it is somewhat tricky to locate your tower and enter acne but overall this place still had updated rooms; my room had electronic blinds; which I believe had become a normal element within hotels in Vegas; it's nice to see that this place is up to date; the check in process is very simple and easy; staff is very friendly;

Worst hotel I've ever stayed at Vegas and will never stay here again. Came here for a conference for work. Check in to a room with NON-STOP construction noise. Called the front desk to complain about it. They just told us the noise will stop at 6pm and they couldn't switch the room for us. But the room is free for today and the construction noise will only continue 9 am-6pm  the next day. We could not stand the noise at all because we couldn't even heard each other even when yelling at the room or speaking on the phone) I wish I could upload a video of how ridiculously loud the noise level is), so I  came down stairs to DEMAND my room switched and waited in line for half and hour and was told okay to switch the room but I had to pulled my husband out from the medical conference because the room was reserved under his name. Caused so much necessary troubles to us. They should not even give out the room at the first place. The noise level is beyond tolerable. No apologies at all. Will definitely not stay here in the future.

There's a lot of art on the walls. Pretty funny to be honest. They use Greek God names for a Roman building... Okay.
It's a pretty place with a huge casino. It's beautiful in some places and hang funny art in others. It's huge, has lots of people and lots of rooms.

What an amazing place! The environment is absolutely lovely, although very crowded. I enjoyed the moving statues and the shops, but the best part were the slots in the casino. We did not play much, but when we played here, we won! I loved the Wild Red and Wild Blue Quick Hits. The staff was helpful and the cocktail server was efficient. On one of our three visits we did not see a cocktail server for about 45 minutes, but when she made it on the floor she stopped by often. My favorite drink was the Pina Colada. It was very creamy and yummy. There are a lot of cash out stations and the restrooms where nearby. My only complaint (if I had to have one) was that the hotel\/casino was so huge that it took a very long time to get from one end to the other for the Tram. Other than that, awesome experience. I plan to stay here on my next visit.

I've always loved the architectural aspect of Caesar's Palace since the first I've been there as a kid. Of course, things and buildings get old as time passes. Nonetheless, I am never sick of going to Caesar's every time I am in LV. They have Forum Shops, Max Brenner, Serendipity, to name a few worth to try places.

My boyfriend and I just returned from our trip to Vegas where we stayed at Caesars.  We wanted to stay here specifically because we had a great time at PURE and when we were walking through, we loved it. 

Flash forward to when we actually were staying there.  We got in super early, so we did was was called a 'pre-checkin'  which was awesome.  Basically it was taking care of all the paperwork without actually checking in.  Lisa was very helpful and very nice and basically one of the highlights of our precheck-in.  Once we successfully killed a few hours, we were still early but we wanted to check in.  When we approached the desk to get our keys, the woman working did not want to help us at all. Instead of being customer friendly, she almost refused us because we had 'refused to pay the early checkin' (which is not true..  Lisa did not pressure us at all and we were told we could come back we could check in at any time, and if it was early we had to pay a fee.).  I advsied Zandra that I never refused the fee and she proceeded to check us in with no additional conversation.  With Zandra, I was immediately disappointed.  Not a good start to the vacation. 

When we got up to the room, it was beautiful!  It was comfy and cozy and very well decorated (and there was a tub.. score!).  One complaint, there was no signage or anything that the snacks on top of the minifridge were on magnets that once you had it off for 30 seconds, it charged you (we found that one out when the wonderful bell man - i believe his name was Amir- told us when he brought up our bags). 

When we checked in, we got a coupon book for some deals within the hotel.  With each coupon, we ran into some stipulation that was never stated on the actual coupon (one was at Serendipity 3 and the other at the gift shop). 

Caesars is a nice place to stay, but watch out for cranky front desk agents and coupon books that have fine print not even written anywhere you can see.  Most likely, we will not be returning to stay again.

We held our annual convention at Caesars this year. The hotel staff always takes very good care of us. The room for my committee meeting was set up perfectly. I got there a half hour early, it was already set up and waiting for me. 

The way they set up for our large speaker events was also done well. You could sit in your chair and you still had foot room. 

This place is huge and it's easy to get lost so learn your landmarks. If you get lost just ask directions. Everyone there will help you get where your going. 

A good place to hold your large meetings and events.

Background:

I made reservations Oct 10, and they took a deposit down, so I thought my hotel room was secured for Nov 17.  I made the transaction on the total rewards site and not a third party discounted site like Kayak, Priceline, etc.  

The problem:

I went with 2 other friends and we checked-in around 11:00 PM on Friday and when we checked in the hostess mentioned that they gave up our room with two queen beds.  My friends and I were shocked.  The reason was because even though you booked your room, mind you we even paid the deposit a while back of around $210, we didn't call in to fully reserve the room.  Apparently there's fine print regarding this.  Additionally, because I had a third person and initially only had two down, was also another reason to switch the rooms and put us all in ONE KING SIZE BED.  What in the worldl!?  

What hotel would allow you to not have your room when you put a two hundred dollar deposit down.  It's business at the end of the day and they're looking to switch rooms around at 11:00 pm so they can accomodate others because there's a chance people like us come in late, OR don't show up so they anticipate that.  Regardless of coming in late, we should still have our room!  It's analogous to flights being overbooked BUT at least you get often times a voucher OR you actually get on your flight.  In our case, we had to bring a roll away cot, which made our room tinier.   So guess who ended up getting screwed on the cot - this guy.

I go to Vegas often.  This was my 3rd time in the fall because I bet college football.  I'm not a high-roller, hence, the lack of treatment.   But this was really unacceptable!  I'm still super frustrated at the lack of hospitality regarding our situation.  At the end, our friends got screwed and we were all pretty upset about it during the trip.  

Luckily my friend works at Afar Travel Magazine and will likely tell the writers his situation so write about it.  Truely unacceptable, especially when we paid a deposit for $210 a month before the reservation.

Possibly my favorite casino. Good service all around. Played at the slots before going to Mesa Grill. I had a few rounds of drinks from one of the waitresses. I was very pleased with everything. It's huge and wonderful. Will be back.

I really like what Caesars has to offer, but there isn't really a lot of value here in their accommodations when you compare to, say, Palazzo or Aria.  Sure, the location makes it nice, but still can be redonkulous pricing.  But still, it's a great place to stay at if the price is right.

Now if you do stay here, I recommend the Augustus Tower, which is located next to check-in.  Otherwise you're gonna have to hike your shit through the casino maze all the way on the other side of the hotel to your elevators.  Augustus rooms are kinda like mini-suites, not nearly as big as Palazzo but I think run the same price or even more...so again not worth it unless you're getting a deal or bribing the checkin to upgrade.  Good views of the fountains from here.

Forum shops, Pure, and the pool are cool things to do.  Serendipity out front for you to indulge your choco desires.

There seem to be alot of hookers that hang out here in front when you're walking back late at night...so if you're looking for some hoodrats or "just a mouth" to entertain you, stroll on through.

Pai Gow: I've had some good runs here (once got 4 straight flushes in about an hour)  but unless you can hang with the typical $50 mins, this ain't the place to play.  I'd only come here when starting out or if I'm up already.  Cool dealers too.  Crystal is funny as hell.

I won a two night stay and two tickets to see Celine Dion in concert from a radio station in San Diego. Stayed here November 17-18, 2015. Even though my stay was free we were not treated any differently. All of the staff were professional and friendly. Stayed in the Forum Hotel and had a nice room. No free in room coffee or even a continental breakfast. The stay was totally free except for tips that we paid to the bellhop and valet parking staff. The room was comfortable and clean and the beds and pillows were nice and soft.

We got wonderful seats in the Coliseum for the Celine Dion concert with not a bad seat in the house. Plus it was nice that it's a no smoking auditorium. I wasn't what you would call a big Celine fan before I saw her in concert here, but I was very impressed and was entertained by her singing and vocal abilities. It actually gave me chills! The sound and the orchestra and the backup and guest singers were all wonderful! The show lasts about an hour and a half. I would see this concert again if given the opportunity and was able to get more passes for free. 

The only complaint I had was that everything was rather expensive inside the hotel and casino areas. A foot long hotdog was $8.00! Really?

Other than that I really enjoyed my stay here.

First time guest, last time guest.  A\/C didn't work.  80 in room entire time.  Called desk and they replied with...we can't help you till we find the problem.  Valet...slow.  Stayed at Wynn 2 nights before and SHOULDVE STAYED THERE!  Caesars could learn a few in efficiency from The Wynn.

Loved our experience. The hotel room was nice, clean, spacious and comfortable. We had a nice view looking out towards Paris. The service was efficient.  We brought our 6 month old and I didn't even have to say anything and the bellhop girl asked me if she should call for a fridge. The location was great because all that you really need is in the hotel. The best buffet and the best shows. I can't wait to book my next room here and see Celine dion! Btw the fact that I got this room for such a great deal on Expedia makes me super happy. 

Only thing that was a turn off was that we had to wait out in the desert heat to wait for our car instead of waiting in the valet lobby area such as the Cosmo.

Roman tower room 1362: This room is dated, tiles in the bathroom seriously needed to be regrouted. The view to the pool was good and made up for little imperfections here and there. Tv remote is not OEM and does not offer all functions to the tv.

Casino: Games r very diverse from slots to table games

Restaurants: very good choices. From chinese noodles to high end steak house, u get a great variety of some of the hottest restaurants around

Shopping: fabulous, the forum shops have luxury stores for men and women. Big plus is Tourneau, they have many luxury brands under one roof.

I absolutely love this place!! The shops inside the Palace are the best! There is literally every type of place to shop at from super pricey and chic to cheap and fun! They have great restaurant options which I love!! There is never a dull moment when I go. 

The scenery is great to check out and the casino is always poppin!!

Almost all went well from check-in to checkout. After spending a day at the Hoover dam, we arrived at the hotel around 11 pm. We were pretty much the only ones in line. Our reservation was initially made on hotels.com and we got a pretty good deal for one of the standard rooms at an average of $115\/night (or something like that). We thought we were going to get the Roman tower room with the classic-looking (a.k.a ugly) pattern green sheets as shown on their photos. 

The front desk agent made the deal sweeter with an upgrade to a lavish corner suite in the Centurion tower facing the Strip and the colosseum. Wowie! We didn't even have to ask for an upgrade. I want to give 4.5 stars but because the hack job TV and sound system didn't work. Even after calling to get the system reset, nothing happened. Then again, who needs a TV in vegas when you can watch drunken people on the Strip from the bedroom window. Despite the suite looking spic and span, a closer look at the marble counters is a little gross with leftover bottle\/glass rim marks and what looks like blood stains on the very worn banquette. Oh well, there were more than enough towels we could lay down and use. Definitely did not sit on the banquette. 

Anyhow, five stars for giving us the suite which will eventually be part of the new Nobu boutique hotel. Plus it didn't take too long for housekeeping to get us a shaving kit (razor and shaving cream) as we had requested. Overall, good customer service on this visit. Hope it's as good next time.

I really like the inside of Caesar's, I think they have some of the more unusual decorations, The gambling is alright, but tables tend to have high minimums. The hotel was really nice though, they were nice enough to upgrade me to a huge suite with a separate sitting room. The housekeepers were also unusually friendly. Minus one star for wifi not working entire stay.

Our room was great. We appreciate the upgrade and also the quality you take to maintain the hotel   it was over all an excellent trip we had. But you might want to double check and make sure the towels are a little cleaner next time

Beware older tower(s), lest you encounter the following astounding nuisances:

1. Service carts (with attendant traffic) lined up outside your room
2. Cold water
3. Stray hair on towels and TV remote control
4. Tub stains

So i am over Caesars. It feels like a madhouse of people roaming around and the clientele here has dramatically changed for me over the years. 
Check in was horrific, and didn't have the room i was confirmed in... That has never happened  to me ever. There is no decorum in the vibe, people allowed to walk thru the hotel with no shirts on going to and from the pool.  No one says please put a top on in the casino and hotel. If you have to be here id stay at Nobu, at least you'll get the room you want in a quiet  Surrounding.  But it wont fix the rest of the hotels issues

We chose this hotel because it was quintessential Vegas and it was my first time. I wish we had talked to more people because clearly this place is going down and has been for some time. After mentioning how disappointed in the entire experience here, multiple people have told us they aren't surprised at all. 

I was in the same room as Veronica C. (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/caesars-palace-las-vegas-hotel-and-casino-las-vegas?hrid=sT5qOunkSBkT42y4Eubd8A) She already mentioned the check in run around, cold shower challenge, and power outage maze runner fun. Every day there was a new problem. I really couldn't believe it. Veronica ended up emailing the hotel manager to file a formal complain and the response was that they would refund the resort fee and room service bill we had. It was all under my card so we'll see if that really happens.

Doing my part, I'm spreading the warm feeling Caesars spread throughout my stay.

Beautiful hotel & casino! Staying here with friends and the woman at the front desk upgraded us to a junior suite because there was so many of us going to share a room for no extra charge! The rooms are beautiful, our junior suite had two separate bathrooms with a huge shower and spa bathtub. Room service is excellent, they came within 10 minutes of our requests for towels and toiletries. Our room had a beautiful view of the palace pool area which included about 8 pools and spas. Heard great things about the buffet but didn't get a chance to try it since we ate at a bunch of other local places. We ate at the planet Hollywood on the 3rd floor & it was ok. Tried to find it on yelp to review but couldn't. The service was great but the food was just ok. Felt like it was sitting under a heat lamp for a bit. The tables and chairs felt like I was sitting on my back yard patio, which wasn't bad but it would have been nice to sit at a regular table not so far away from my chair to eat a full meal. 
All in all I had a great stay at the Ceasar's palace! They also have tons of shops in the forum if you wanna hit the mall!

Still one of the best hotels and casinos in Las Vegas.  Can anyone imagine the Las Vegas strip without Caesars?  If you go to the other casinos out here, there's a little of Caesars that has been adopted into their casinos.  Just a bunch of biters out there. 

I don't get to Caesars too often anymore since I now live here, but was a regular when I wasn't local.  I love how Caesars didn't sell out with its looks, feel, and ambiance.  I still like the modern casinos that were built in the last 10 years, but Caesars is a staple in Las Vegas.  Overall, they can't be touched. 

The only reason I would visit Caesars now is for the Forum Shops.  The Forum has stores within everyone's price range.  It's also a good break from the heat and gambling.  

Parking is easy at Caesars.  You can self park or valet to their Forum Shops or Casino.  I still prefer to valet when I visit Caesars.  I don't gamble much, but the gaming is still live with a lot of action on the weekends.  There's still ton of eats, shopping, and sightseeing in Caesars.  If you've done Caesars, you know what I'm talking about.  If you haven't, then it's time for you to pay a visit.

PS: Caesar never lived here. I didn't think so either.

Conveniently located in the heart of the Vegas strip. Reasonably priced and such a beautiful venue. The shopping and restaurant selection here is endless. The casino floor is huge and dealers are so nice! Checking in and checking out is very easy. We had the best experience here, wouldn't take our business anywhere else in Vegas.

its more than a casino and hotel. they have shops and restaurants inside, and club pure. serendipity is conveniently located right outside the building, so you can go downstairs and get some frozen hot chocolate!
the hotel is really nice inside; very spacious and classy looking. they have very comfortable mattresses and pillows so its easy to fall asleep and not miss home! pool area looks pretty too.

Stay away from Caesar Palace. Horrible experience at many levels. Management needs some serious overhaul.

1. Slowest service I had in any hotel in stayed at in Vegas.
2. The world offers water for free, $7 for a small bottle at Caesar.
3. No hair drayer
4. Two towels when the room is reserved for 4. An hour to deliver additional ones
5. Dust everywhere, dirty air and air vents
6. Unnecessary valet complications
7. $14 for a coffee bag .. i never seen any place where the coffee bag must be purchased for the machine.
8. Internet access isn't free
 
Garabage, never again.

I'll start by saying that i've always wanted to stay here.  Since I first saw pictures of the Palace when I was a kid to being an adult watching the Hangover.  My wife booked us for my birthday and we were able to go.

Needless to say, I was pretty disappointed.  The main valet is ALWAYS full.  This results in needing to use the alternate in the back, which is a pain.  Check in was a pain, it took an insane amount of time to even get to the desk.  Once there it wasn't any faster.  Although I do need to admit that the attendant was very friendly, and gave us some great restaurant recommendations.

Once we got to the room it was pretty much what you would expect.  It was clean, bright, and pretty luxurious.  Yet, that soon gets overlooked when you start noticing how they nickel and dime you for everything.  For example, they charge you to use the provided styrofoam cups.  They charge you if you reorder the dry good item (not consume, MOVE).  If you open the fridge and shift a bottle to put in your water, there's a charge for that too.  It got to the point where I was scared if I called the operator I would be charged for that too.
This place is the epitome of what Las Vegas should be. I love this place, from the shops, to the food, to the casino, this is the number one place in my book hands down. Hail Cesar!

For my second stay EVER in Vegas, I got to check out Caesars, and overall, I'm pretty impressed. 

I shared a room with another girl in our bachelorette group; between the two of us, we paid $544 for three nights. That's about $181\/night. However, when she arrived to check us in, they informed her that they only allow groups of three or more to have rooms with two beds. Apparently, the room we'd booked included one FULL-sized bed. Now, that's not the end of the world, but really, who pays $181\/night to share a full bed?! She was able to pay $20 for an upgrade and from then on, everything was awesome.

We ended up in the Octavius tower, which is the newer one. Our room was HUGE. Two amazing beds, huge bathroom, tons of space. Everything seemed clean and in good condition which is always a plus. The blinds on the (giant) windows were amazing as well - I would up at 8:30am and thought it was the middle of the night because it was SO dark. Well done, blinds.

I loved the pool, as well. We had a ton of pools to choose from and that whole area seemed pretty clean, too. The first day we tried for the pool we could only get a few chairs because it was so packed, but the next day was quite a bit easier since we went early. 

I really have no complaints other than the "two beds for 3+ people" thing, because that's pretty annoying. Nothing a crisp $20 bill won't fix, though.

We did not stay here but we walked through and ate at Cheesecake factory and later went to Pure nightclub.  This hotel is soooo beautiful and clean, and was all decorated for the Holidays was a pleasure to walk through.  

We were able to sit 'outside' at Cheesecake factory and it was the best people watching spots ever!! And we had an awesome view of the huge fish tank and live show.  Super awesome!!! 

Cant wait to go back and explore some more.

So we had to wait a long time for a room. I was definitely getting worried. We decided to go to dinner and try again for our keys. However.  When we finally got our room it was a massive upgrade.  Thanks so much guys. I would definitely return based on this experience. They most definitely went above and beyond.

Really enjoyed our stay at the Augustus Tower.  We had a nice high room with a view of the Bellagio fountain.  That view was such a pleasure at night and even during the day when we were resting between excursions.  Room was clean and spacious with comfortable beds, a sitting area near the window, and a small dining table that came in handy since we brought food back to the room a few times.  Bathroom was big, with jetted tub, walk-in shower, and fortunately the toilet had its own separate room.  For being a newer addition to the hotel, I will say that you do notice some slight wear and tear (like a small rip in the wallpaper on window sill and ceiling), but considering possible party crowds in rooms over the years, it's held up very well and still has a luxe feeling to it.

Loved the location of the Augustus Tower.  Never had to walk through the casino to get to the Strip, pool, front desk, or buffet.  This was a huge plus since we had our young school age kids along on this trip.  Also, Starbucks was near the ground floor elevator, so convenient for a coffee fix on the way out each morning.

Regarding hotel being family friendly, we had no issues at all taking our kids around.  We never felt unwelcome anywhere on the property, even at the pool.

Front desk staff was nice and professional.  (Common knowledge, folks, that if you treat people well, they tend to treat you well.  It pays to be friendly, especially to those handling your room arrangements.)  The staff kept the line going and did a good job combating people who had a tendency to "casually cut" in front of others, making them return to their original place in line.  (Thank you for that, Caesars!)

All in all, great 3 night stay!  Would definitely return with or without the kids.  4 Stars.

Wow - I broke a tooth and the phone book gave a mobile dentist at the same address. It was close, so we went and asked the concierge. He recommended his family dentist, gave the address and told us where to get a wheelchair cab. We weren't even staying there! I am so pleased and sorry I didn't get back to thank him. I hope he sees this.

Great room, and the service was definitely two thumbs way up. They made sure my stay was top shelf! Room service was prompt and on key! Will i stay here again... Definitely.. The weather was great (108 degrees on friday) and the pool was hoppin. Great music and good times.

Little mix up with our reservation (that I made last November!)

I've been staying here every year for about 8 years (meet here yearly for a Trauma Conference) so it with some regret I'm only giving this visit\/stay a 3 star review.  The little mix up to my reservation was that I had requested a King bed and was given a two queen room, in addition they had placed me in a free upgrade without asking (in a brand new tower) and when i saw that and requested my original room back they found that my requested room type no longer existed. 

To explain more fully I will say that the conference meets early and runs late, and we found early on that to stay in the tower that the conference rooms are actually in (20 floors down of course!) is much more convenient and there is no lack of luxury in the wonderful jacuzzi suites. Because of this when i make my reservations FOUR months in advance I sort of expect a place as wonderful as Caesar's to be able to keep the original reservation or maybe at least mention that all bets are off and i may not get what i wanted in spite of the fact of early reservations or that they might upgrade me without my knowledge. We routinely stay at the Langham Pasadena (formerly Ritz Carlton) and while I'm not a total snob, they are really the template for the ultimate in customer service. Think Nordstroms gone crazy...that's the Langham.  I guess because we only have a couple of fancy trips per year I appreciate the effort that goes into making my stay that much better. It saddened me somewhat to see that Caesar's was not able to meet or exceed the quality of customer service at the Langham.

So here we are, finally in the correct tower but in a double queen room only 12 floors up (I also request the highest possible floor just for the wow factor of the gorgeous strip views!) Is it a nice room? Yes. Is it the room I had been hoping for for the past four months? No.  

We'll survive, though, and trudge on bravely facing the harsh reality of our measly little queen room but still...visions of the King room still bounce around in my head.  Next year I plan to call in the summer to talk to someone in customer service so that I can use their system to try to not have this happen again. 

Room service was delightful and every staff member I've called on the phone so far has really wished us well and asked how our trip in was. They are so friendly, that's for sure.

Just checked into the hotel ... the worst check in process ever .. the guy arranging the lines should be fired totally screwed up the order of the line . People in the back of the line got in first .. every check I seems to take 15 minutes .. I've stayed here before but this will be last time I stay at a caesars property
Checked in... $300 room hot and stuffy coffee $13 water $7...( motel 6 rooms cool & coffee free) Will post if it gets better but so far so bad.

Paid 900 for a weekend stay in a room that smelled like sewage. Complained and they sent maintenance out . The man said the rooms have this problem in the summer, and all he could do about it was spray air freshener. TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE! This facility has unsanitary plumbing ventilation and is too cheap to fix it.  Should be shut down until odor issue has been resoved.

Yelp needs a zero star.  I've been to Caesars many times.  I will never stay there again or gamble a penny there.  I won't even walk in the door.  I paid for a room, which I didn't get.  We booked 4 days with an Augustus tower room.  They put us in an "upgrade" in the Octavius tower.  The upgrade was krap, which is why the Augustus tower sells out before the Octavius tower.  Go for the cheapest room before the Octavius tower if you can't find a Motel 6...it's an upgrade.  We asked for our actual room after a night and they said no problem, real soon...we waited in our room until 4pm and they gave us the typical excuse that the current people stayed an extra day.  When have you ever changed your flights and spent an extra day...BS.  Needless to say we never received what we paid for, even after eating at Guy Savoy's.  The desk clerk said the manager would call and make it right.  Well two weeks later and not a word.  Liars, cheats, thieves...I own bonds on this company and it's no wonder why they're going down.  This company is going out of business, not because of the venue, but because they suck.  Ya, the odds in the casino are horrible too.  Never waste your money here.  I only have regrets.  I gave them a chance to make it right and they failed, I gave then another and they didn't even bother to call.  The restaurants are the worst on the strip.  How bad does it have to get before they just close up?

Made our stay in Vegas memorable.  Cesar's has always been my all time favorite hotel! Upgraded room at check in! Rooms are immaculate. Comfy beds luxurious bathrooms and room service was quick and tasty (may I say a little pricy but definitely worth it since we were still recovering from the night before). I know where I'm staying again for my next Vegas trip!!!

Stayed as Caesars Sunday and Monday of this week for business.  We checked in on Sunday early, upgraded to the palace tower so they waived the early check in fee.  Room looked clean, changed and we went to the pool.

At the pool: ready to spend some $$ on drinks and food since work didn't start until Monday, took 3 different requests to different people for a menu.  Finally, a server came over and we received great service once we ordered (approx 45 minutes to get a menu and order).  

Went to the room and I wanted to use the bath \/ jacuzzi (paid for the upgrade so yes!).  Had to wash it with a washcloth and shower gel because it wasn't clean (sparing you the details).  

Went to dinner at Nobu - Noriko was our server and was super AWESOME!

Went to the tiny little lounge that has a ship - Cleopatra's lounge. Good DJ, fun!

Went to the room.  Pillows smelled like they were a billion years old and sweaty.  Bed is SUPER uncomfortable.  Slept with no pillow.

Next day, called housekeeping and requested they replace the four pillows. Not just the cases.  Came back to the room at midnight and the pillows smelled. No change.  Called housekeeping and 15 minutes later they brought two - not four pillows like I had requested since I wanted them all replaced.  They had to go get me two more.  

Then they had not replaced all of the towels we had on the floor. They took them but didn't replace all if them. Plus, they didn't replace all of the amenities.

Not staying ever again.  Ever.

After well over a decade this hotel & casino remains in the top ten according to several trip advisory websites but it's struggling to keep its position.

Gorgeous architectural design that's kept clean and a vast amount of space to roam and play.Amenities are immense and beautiful,especially the pool area.
There is plenty of upscale and non upscale shops that one can browse around for a hot minute.And of course,the awesome world renowned restaurants all within speed walking distance.One can forget 
about exploring the hotel in a day because there is a lot of ground to cover.Speaking of ground,for a couple of days I noticed that after five o'clock there was no concierges to be found.What a bummer for people checking in late.If one isn't familiar with the hotel this can be very frustrating for first timers.

And my parting shot will be about the rooms.Twice we had to move because of the air conditioning and the room we ended up in had stripped facets.The room service was decent but the food was down right horrible.One would think that they would invest in some decent backup after those great restaurants close.And that's my take,Peace Yelpers

The rooms in the renovated area are very nice and I like the atmosphere which is slightly more refined than place like TI (but less than Wynn).  Otherwise, I find that they fail at providing the basics of a hotel accommodation, especially when compared to similarly located and similarly priced hotels on the strip. I will not be back.

Pros: 

- Right in the middle of the strip
- Lots of places to eat around you
- Lots of shops and a mall located inside
- Rooms are renovated
- Bachannal Buffet

Cons: 

- Air ventilation is horrible here
- Check-in takes a while
- Some towers of the hotel are way in the boonies
- Refrigerators in the rooms leave no space for you to bring your own drinks back to keep them cold.

This was my first time staying here since I was a little kid and I loved it. Being centrally located on the strip was a plus. It meant that everything is really around you and within walking distance. The farthest casinos away from you are the Encore and the casinos around the MGM. Other than that, everything is close.

The casino is spacious and never really seemed super crowded even during the peek times Friday and Saturday night. My room was awesome with a huge bed, flat screen tv, plenty of space and a double shower head bath.

The hotel itself seems geared more for the adult crowd. I didn't see a whole lot that kids could do but that didn't bother me. Walking through the Forum Shops was fun with their 120+ stores. I am sure if you wanted to find something to buy, this would be the place to do it. Their food seemed a little limited as they really didn't seem to have some of the fast food type places if you wanted a quick bite. See my review on the buffet to see how that went. 

I loved staying here and would gladly come back here at any time.

This hotel is in a great location and you can easily go to other hotels and restaurants on the main strip from here. The food was good, including that at the food court, and they even had someone bring you items in the food court which was more service than I had expected there. We had a comfortable stay here.

I like the rooms.

The gambling is "OK".

Total Rewards sometimes cheats you on purchase credits  (and you need to submit and resubmit receipts for credits for purchases). I've also found credits for table play to be inconsistent.

Avoid the hotel concierge - the concierge is my number on issue with this hotel. They will make full on mistakes - charge your credit card and then have the galls to tell you they made a mistake, but it's not refundable and there isn't a manager. It wasn't a one time issue either - I've had a major issue with the concierge every time I have used them.

I was so incredibly disappointed during my stay at Caesars Palace. My parents spent so much time and money planning this amazing 21st birthday for me. We flew in and arrived a little late.We booked 2 seperate rooms that were suppose to be conjoined. We checked in and the rooms are on the entire opposite sides of the building. We showed our concerned but they didn't really seem to care. The next day my dad was just so irratated and decided to take it to the next level and speak to the manager. They ended up upgrading us. They told us it would be an hour until we could move rooms... We were content with that. Four hours later, nothing!!!! I called down stairs to see what was going on they upgraded the wrong effing people. Any ways by 5PM we got to our new rooms still a distance apart and my parents room was still standard nothing too fancy. Wasted a whole day waiting on moving stupid rooms. We go to our "upgraded room" It was still dirty and gross. Only the beds were made. By that time we were just over it. Not enough energy to complain any more. It was really upsetting, the problem could have been handled in a much better way. Needless to say, I will not bring any more of my services to Caesars palace. Completely and utterly disappointed. The only plus was the chill bell boy Ron ! The only staff member who took his time out of his day to show he actually cared.

OK...I'm going to start off by saying this: Unless I make a specific comparison to another hotel, you can mentally add "but it's The Strip, and that's just how it is on The Strip" to any negative thing I may say here. Some things are just the way things are in Las Vegas hotels, you know?

OK, that said, here we go! We usually stay at The Mirage in Vegas, but I got a super-good deal for Caesar's Palace this year and thought it would be fun to try another place on The Strip (and hey...who hasn't heard of Caesar's Palace, right?).

To jump right to the good stuff: Our room was fantastic! We were in the Forum Tower, room 6215. The room was really big, with plenty of room for the king-sized bed (with mirrored headboard! Wowza!), a lounge-style sofa, an arm chair, a desk and chest of drawers, and a big flat-screen TV. Not much of a view, but then there's not much to look at from a hotel room in Vegas, so no worries there. The real "wow," though, was the bathroom! It consisted of a large "dressing room" area, with a washstand and huge mirror (with a TV built in!), a lighted closet big enough for both our suitcases, a separate toilet room, and a huge walk-in shower with TWO big "rain-style" shower heads and a bench to sit on...very posh!

Now for just a few negatives: The room didn't come equipped with a fridge (the mini-bar was crammed full of items for sale, and the room information warned you about moving things in there to store your personal stuff...they are on a motion sensor, and if you move that $6 can of Diet Coke to store your own $0.50 carton of milk, they WILL charge you for that Coke. Refrigerators may be ordered from housekeeping, but be aware...there will almost certainly be a charge for that also). We decided to save the money and use the ice bucket -- Yay! Free ice! -- to store a carton of milk for our breakfast cereal.

The room did have a nice Keurig coffee\/tea maker, but guess what? Yes...there's a charge to use it. (Let's all say it together: It's The Strip, and that's just how it is on The Strip, so...")

The TV had a good picture. The selection of free channels was adequate, but limited. Plenty of pay channels, though!  ("It's The Strip, and...").

The resort fee (Added on to your room charge. But it's The Strip...) included internet connection for one device. Just one. We had two. But it's The Strip.... My husband needed to connect to work, so we ate the $14.99 charge for the second connection. On the upside, the wi-fi was fast and reliable! There were plenty of outlets too, which is a big plus for us.

The bed was very comfortable (a wee bit on the firm side for my tastes, but still comfy), and the pillows were wonderful! (we looked for a label on them, in the hopes of being able to buy a few for our home, but the labels had been removed).

The room also came equipped with ironing board, iron, hair dryer, etc. I didn't ask about charges for those, as we didn't need them. They're probably free, but if you need to use them, ask, because, after all, this is The Strip...

The hotel itself is HUGE, and rather convoluted to navigate. Yes, I know, this is The Strip, and all roads lead either to the casino or to the shops (or both), but Caesar's seemed rather more difficult to navigate than The Mirage. That said, the people were absolutely WONDERFUL, and always willing to help with directions. The Forum Shops are worth a visit even if you're not staying here (the ceiling is gorgeous!), but they're pretty convoluted as well...we got lost there for an hour before asking for help after attending a show at another hotel.

The only real negative about Caesar's Palace is the Bacchanal Buffet. It gets a lot of hype, which is why we decided to try it, but frankly, it's overpriced, and simply not worth it. I've written a separate review about it, but to sum things up: 1) it has nothing you can't get at any other buffet on The Strip, 2) it's about twice the price of any other buffet on The Strip (and, unlike the Cravings buffet at The Mirage, does NOT include beer and wine, 3) it is a total wasteland for vegetarians, and 4) neither smelled nor looked clean. If you decide to stay here, I highly recommend either trying one of the other restaurants in the complex or, if you want a buffet, going to The Mirage.

All in all, not a bad experience (except for the food!). It is, after all, The Strip....

I was so excited to stay here because I loved coming here to go shopping when I was younger. Shopping at the forum is great, not the best anymore but when I was growing up this was the place I saved my Christmas money for. I would go on a shopping binge with that saved up money. Anyways, staying in the actual rooms was great! The rooms were spacious and there are little hot tub baths. Pretty impressive. 

The pools were amazing. They were fun to hang out around and the group we were with rented a cabana and we all had a great time hanging around and having some shade when needed. I loved it! The pool is what made the trip so fun, I didn't stay out too long because the sun seems to zap my energy, but for the two days that I spent out there I was not disappointed. Service around the pool is great too. 

The only thing that bothered me was that every time I had to go to hotel registration for anything, I was in line for a good half hour before I gave up because it was not moving. It was very irritating. I waiting in line for almost 30 minutes for them to tell me that I couldn't get a new room key (I accidentally demagnetized mine) because I was not the one who rented the room. On the bright side, at least they were not going to give keys to random people so I felt a little safer. Last thing, this place is ENORMOUS so set aside some time to figure out how to get from place to place just within the hotel, it is a pretty massive hotel.

If you are going to Vegas, it's best to go on the back of a whale. Caesars Palace spoiled us rotten with limos to & from the hotel along with a private check-in & separate entrance to the hotel\/casino. The staff went out of their way being accommodating during our stay. What really surprised me was how clean the place was. From the room to the casino floor the place was maintained. 

Our room was really lovely & well appointed. The bed & bedding was super comfortable & snuggly. The bathroom. OMGosh, the bathroom. Oh how I wish I had something like that at home. HUGE tub with jets, a very roomy shower & closeted toilet. The toiletries were lush as were the towels. My only complaint? Get better toilet paper! 

Even though I like staying at different places each time we visit LV, I would definitely stay here again.
A lot of shops there and that show was pretty good. It was Xmas in Vegas but not the way you think . . . Family lives there!

What a disappointment.  On top of the expensive rooms they charge a resort fee of 29.00 a day!!!!!.  Never going back.  When we checked in the man acted like he was doing us a favor.

never again

While the shopping area and some of the restaurants are quite excellent, the rooms are not up to the standard of a $500.00 a night room.  Much has been done to maximize profit for the hotel. The staff work short hours and there are insufficient staff to assist, which results in long lines everywhere.  Want to make your own coffee in your room, it goes on the bill at premium rates. Nothing included.

Also, skip Old Homestead Steakhouse at this hotel, it is not the same quality as the one in NYC.

Just like Caesar ..he was great at one time.  Unfortunately that day is long gone.  If you find a good rate then location may be worth it otherwise spend a little more for a better experience.  No outside beverage at pool forcing you to pay up (not all hotels do this).  Dated rooms with limited amenities..

Not the worst but no where near the best.  Keep expectations low and have a good time

And they play 90s country at the pool.  Im fired up now.

My biggest comment about Caesars is be careful when booking your room type.  One wrong move and you could be staying in very tired, old conditions (i.e. the Roman Tower).  I checked in and immediately was disappointed with my room.  There is no closet--only a rod and luggage rack in the bathroom. Um, yes there was and no I couldn't.  I immediately switched to the Palace tower--a much nicer, newer and bigger room.  Other than that minor hiccup, Caesars has it all: the Forum shops, a great sports book, Omnia nightclub, great restaurants, a number of huge pools...I could go on and on.  You could easy spend a whole weekend there and never leave.  Cheers!!!

One word- MASSIVE!!!!!!!!  You can easily get lost in the place!! 

As soon as i walked up to the front doors of the beautiful Hotel, I immediately thought of "The Hangover" scene where they all check-in and Zach Galifianakis' character asks the Lady if this place is pager friendly.. LOL!! 

Anyhoo.  This place is filled with not only a HUGE casino but its home to some famous restaurants such as Bobby Flays' Mesa Grill with his take on southwestern flair with his grilling skills!! 

Also u gotta check out Caesars Forum shops! Another indoor mall which makes you feel like your outside! beautiful fountains, Aquariums and  sculptures surround this place. They even got a live statue show of the Gods! This is truly a Hotel that's gone above and beyond!! I would definitely recommend this place for anyone !!  i might even get the $4500 per night Villa like in the movie.. lol. ya right!

I stayed here for the first time last week. I find that they are under staffed. House keeping takes forever to arrive. I've stayed at Cosmopolitan and housekeeping comes within 30 minutes. At Cesar's it's like 3 hours. We ordered room service and it took two hours. We had to relocate because our bathroom toilet kept running. This place needs a deep cleaning. I will not stay at Cesar's ever again. The good thing is that they have many stores to shop at and there is not an overwhelming smell of that cheap air freshener other casinos have in Las Vegas upon entering.

I have two stars because of the excellent service we got from the valet service which I think is part of the Nobu Hotel not Caesar's palace, which makes sense why their service was excellent. As far as the hotel is concerned well that's a different story. I already wrote an email to the manager of the hotel just like his staff either no response or slow to respond one or the other, I guess as the saying goes the apple doesn't fall far from the tree well this saying fits it. If you want extra towels, pillows or blankets don't call them if you need it immediately because you won't get it until maybe four calls later or two hours later. This hotel doesn't cater well to non total rewards members I think they cater to their high roller I don't really know all I know is the service of this hotel is so horrendous that my first stay will be the last.

We stayed here to see the Elton John show last year.  On a previous trip we also explored the shopping mall.  I'm not into gambling and I'm too old to try to get into Pure so I can't say much about those.

I made our reservations for the hotel and Elton John over the I-net.  Upon arrival they put us in a room of a less nice type than what I reserved.  Fortunately I noticed that at the desk and complained about  it so they put us in a better room.  When I got up there they had a huge basket made of chocolate and filled with chocolate waiting in the room, with "Welcome (someone else's name)" on it, apparently thinking someone else was going to stay in the room.  We waited around for about 8 hours to see if they'd come get it .  Nobody showed up to get it so we ate it.  It was yummy.
