I suppose I could have called them to come take it away but after they almost stiffed us on the room reservation I didn't feel like it. 

Elton John's show was pretty cool.  We ate elsewhere (at the Eiffel Tower and Stratosphere) so mostly we were there for the show and the shopping mall.  The bathroom was really, really nice with a big sunken tub.  I didn't have any complaints with the room, however there are so many cool places to stay in Vegas I'd probably check out another one on the next trip just to see as many as possible.

I always wanted to stay at Caesars palace and I finally did this past weekend . I luved my room. I stayed in the octavious tower
And had a great view of the bellagio fountains . The person who checked me in was great but, the concierge desk was stuck up and offered no help what so ever.

Here for a conference and found myself walking around this beautiful place.  Love the Forum shops and the casino floor is so unique.  It helps when you are sitting in lectures all day to be able to sneak out for a break and take a few pulls on your favorite machine, or walk though the forum shops browsing for a special item. Someday, perhaps I'll get a room!

Stayed here for a conference.

The hotel was great. Little pricey, but that's Vegas.

My issue was with the conference staff.

The coffee was burnt. I never knew what burnt coffee tasted like, until now. The whole time the area was under construction.

I've never seen such jaded, apathetic, and irritable staff. The staff here are miserable and terrible looking.

They are mean and clearly hate that they work there. They were clearing plates, while we were still eating, and they would just reached over you for it, without saying word. I'm not sure if there has been issues with employee relations, but probably a recent pay freeze or a reduction in benefits.

The staff could use some training in customer service. Just rember you are the entertainment capital of the world. act like it.

Worst casino ever. I book a comp 5 nights at Lauren collection tower , I even check in on email on date of arrival.  When I arrive they did a switch and bait and gave me the old tower which is dirtier than a motel 6.  I didn't fly from ny to get this type of service n quality. I ask them next 2 days if they can switch room , they can't help. So I cxl my rest nights and got myself comp room at MGM. Even the cheapest room at MGM looks 10x and update them Cesar.  At Cesar casino the valet is a mile work from the room or check in so having kids with stroller is terrible experience. I would never go to Cesar again. They will lose customer

Go to MGM and they will waive the room if you get a casino host. Cesar won't let me talk to a host.

I've only been there once for a poker tournament and didn't have a good experience. Parking was not free and I could not get it validated even though I bought into a 150$ tournament. Playing in the poker tournament was a bit disappointing. The cards were old and worn out. Tables were ok. 
Getting out of the parking lot took over 15 min because the road was blocked by drivers on the main street. This might not be the Casino's fault but it still made my impression worse. 
Probably wouldn't play a poker tournament here again.

Last March, we celebrated my friend's birthday and with the help of our two VIP friends, we got two comped rooms. I had stayed at Caesar's with my family previously and hadn't enjoyed our accommodations as the rooms were small and dark, so my expectations were low.

However, my friends had gotten two rooms in the Octavius Tower and I was pleasantly surprised by how nice the rooms were. Even though there was only one bed in one of our rooms, we had plenty of room and there was more than enough space for 4 people (eight total).

Caesar's is one of my favorite hotels on the strip because I love the location, theme, and design. However, I do have some complaints. Even though the rooms in the Octavius Towers are nice, the walk to and from the casino and lobby was tortuous; almost never-ending at times. And you know after a long night of clubbing in heels, girls just want to get back up to the room as quickly as possible.

Another thing is the only 24-hour cafe in the entire hotel happens to be one of the most expensive and with a very limited menu. Maybe I've grown accustomed to the vast menus in cafes at Mandalay Bay, Wynn, and Bellagio, but I would've appreciated a more diverse menu with more options.

Overrated and overpriced.  The rooms in the old section of the hotel are bad.  

The only worthwhile parts of CP are the gaming floor (great sports book) and the food (MeSa is great), but you can do that- and shop in The Forum- without overpaying to stay here.

Not impressed. Just checked in after waiting 45 minutes in the ridiculous check in lines. The front desk person was so rude, actually spoke to me like a dog when she raised her hand and said STAY. Are you kidding me?!?!? Got to the room, not the room I paid for. Called down and yet another rude person tells me "sorry, the hotel's at capacity, try calling back tomorrow". Tried calling back down to speak with a manager and was told one wasn't available. $970 for three nights and I can't even get the room I'm paying for?? And a manager isn't available!!! They charge you $34.28 per night for the resort fee, but the wifi doesn't work. When you call down and tell them this, they say the hotel is at capacity and it's not working well. But I still have to pay for it?!? So, because of EDC this weekend I'm stuck in this crap hotel until Monday in a room that isn't what I paid for running my phone as a hot spot so I can have wifi. I come to Vegas every two weeks and have been doing this for years and this is by far the worst experience. I'll take the dirty shower at Mandalay Bay over being treated badly. At least Mandalay's service was IMPECCABLE. This place ought to think about who they treat like dogs, some of us actually write professional reviews for travel magazines ;)

Over the top and gigantic.  We enjoyed that you could find some quite spots in random lobbies, or outside by the fountains, etc.

If you are looking for cheap amazing drinks, look out infront of Caesars where there is a little Mojito stand.  The pineapple mojito was amazing and the employee was very kind to make it the way I want it.

We have had several enjoyable stays at the Casino. The multiple casinos, restaurants, and bars mean you really never have to leave the resort. The pool is beautiful but often crowded. At the pool, you can "buy" pool side beds, cabanas, and couches but they are over-priced if you don't have a group ($300 \/ day + includes food service). The rooms are just really average, even the deluxe rooms.

This is a very long overdue review.  I stayed here for three days this summer with my husband and kids.  We stayed here because we wanted to eat at Mesa Grill in the evening and wanted to be in the same hotel as the kids (yes, we're mean, we didn't take them to Mesa Grill with us.)

There was plenty of good and a little bad, but the short version is, it's not the greatest hotel for kids.  There's a time to spend a lot of money and a time not to, but frankly, kids don't have the most sophisticated taste and don't appreciate the finer things so much.  If I am going to spend $17 on a burger\/fries\/drink in the food court, it better either know how to style my hair or give me a big O.  But really, they're just standard fare for double the money.  But, you're kind of captive because if you take your car out of the valet, there might not be a place for it when you get back.  (True story.  We had to self-park the night before we left because the valets were all full.  This made checkout a NIGHTMARE because it is a LONG way to the self-park with several suitcases, laptops etc.)

I loved the room.  We were in the Octavius tower.  This is the newest one I think, and it's highly renovated.  The beds were super comfy.  They have a ginormous spa tub in the bathroom that takes 30 minutes to fill.  My advice; don't get in until it's close full, or you'll get bored before you can put the jets on.  Try not to feel too guilty for using SO MUCH WATER in the desert.  (I failed.  I felt guilty so only did it once and stayed in there long after I was bored so as to get good use out of it.)

The pools are gorgeous.  I wish there was more shade near the pools, but the lounge chairs are comfy.  Drinks by the pool (like the food court) are crazy expensive.  One small pina colada:  $18.  HOLY CRAP.  I'm glad I didn't order the large.  I only brought a $20 down from the room with me.  I am such a poor plebian, not worthy of the Palace!  If it hadn't been so hot, I wouldn't have left the poolside except to eat, sleep, poop.

Aside from the not-so-exciting-and-way-too-expensive food court, there are lots of good dining options if you can afford them.  Mesa Grill is awesome as always (though now that we've found a local-to-us place with amazing lamb chops for 1\/2 the price of Bobby's, not QUITE as awesome).  We really enjoyed the Gordon Ramsey grill as well (though somehow the waiter there managed to convince my husband to try a $25 bottle of BEER.  It was good, not $25 good.)   We had a pretty nice meal at the casual Chinese food place in there.  We never made it to the buffet because the lines were always crazy (and again, the prices so high we couldn't justify bringing kids with us when they'd be just as happy eating McD's.)  

I do not like that you only get ONE internet connection in the room.  My husband, the kids, and I are all geeks.  We had to pass the laptop around.  That is seriously lame.  

Check-in was horrible.  I stood in line for about an hour.  Apparently a few hours before arrival an email came to my box inviting me to check in online, but, Muppet News Flash -- I was travelling at the time and didn't see it til later.  If it had come the night before I'd have been able to do it from my previous hotel.  

I'm giving them a 4 star overall because my biggest complaints are price related.  If you can get past the prices, it's a great hotel to stay at overall.  If it had just been me and my hubby I probably wouldn't have balked so much.  If you're budget conscious, even with "I'm on vacation" face on and expecting to spend a good deal of money, you'll spend too much time thinking about how much things are costing you.   Don't bring your kids.  I'd be willing to stay here again with just my hubby, but I am not sure I will.  I'm tempted to stay at Paris so I can eat breakfast at Mon Ami Gabi every day without having to walk, and it's probably a bit cheaper overall.

First time staying here and it was for a bachelorette party and they upgraded our group from a standard double queen suite to the deluxe where we had TWO restrooms!  So key especially for females. Only issue is that the two restrooms are connected by dual glass shower. It's only one shower with two shower heads. If you're not afraid to treat it like a girl's swim locker roommate, then you're all golden.

The beds were comfortable and felt clean. Super important when staying at hotels. Also, I need to note the location of our room was kinda inconvenient. It's way deep into the casino but past the Bacchanal buffet. You walk through some stores before getting to the Palace Tower's elevators. Hopefully, you're able to walk and find them. It took the whole day for me to get oriented as I am terrible with directions and sense of geography.

The weekend during prime time, they had $15 minimum at the roulette and Blackjack tables. Only two of each the rest were like $50 at night. Of course. The section where the Palace Towers side felt limited in table games in general.  Very limited unless I really didn't explore other sections but I know we walked around looking.

First time at Cesars stayed in the Forum towers.  Beautiful batroom, with ceiling and wall shower, tv in mirror.  Room has been updated but they need to update the dresser counter, looks old and scratched up.  Why would they update and not change the dressers Beautiful casino and love the forum shops, even though they are expensive.  Loved the pool area.  Would stay there again.

I had always heard great things about Caesar's Palace, So me and my cousin decided to go for my Birthday in late June, Stayed there one night. The people in the front desk were really nice, and they ungraded us for Free! So thank you for that, Though it was EXTREMELY hot outside about 112 degrees, we decided to relax the whole day in the Hotel with the A\/C on . We went walking around and found the indoor mall very great place with a great feel to it. The place just feels a little too cramped & I wish we had a fridge in our hotel room as well. Overall , Good Casino and Hotel to stay at, Love the robes too!

I was in town to get married.  I'd gambled, ate, and\/or drank at Caesars Palace Hotel & Casino many times, but on this visit I finally stayed there as well since we were doing the ceremony in one of Caesars' wedding chapels and we'd secured a block of rooms in the hotel for us and our guests.  Our rooms were in the Augustus Tower, which had its own registration desk, a short walk from the main entrance, but accessible to an even more convenient side entrance off of Flamingo with a requisite cab stand.  Our standard room, non-smoking with king bed, was spacious and had a beautiful view south down the Strip overlooking the Bellagio's fountains.  The bed was comfortable, perhaps not as comfortable as the ones I've found at the Cosmopolitan, Palms, and Hard Rock, but the pillows were very nice with good support.  The bathroom was equally spacious with a glass shower, Jacuzzi tub, a large vanity with dual sinks, and a separate W\/C.  The only minor critique would be the 42" flat panel TV, which seemed to only get standard definition signal.  Not a problem, though, since we spent very little time in the room.  

As for the common areas, like the casino, they seemed much more smoke-filled than I remember from previous visits.  My clothes, skin, and hair reeked of secondhand smoke after any time spent in the casino.  There weren't that many smokers around me, but I'm guessing the air exchange\/filtration system was not as efficient as the ones installed in much newer casinos like the Cosmopolitan and Aria.  Still, the gaming, drink service, and overall service from the entire Caesars property staff was very good to excellent.  Caesars Palace is a place that I'll definitely stay and play again.

One of the superior hotels in Las Vegas!

A very luxury hotel that meets all expectations. No need to write everything I want to praise, because it is certainly well known.

I can only complain about one little thing: The windows do not open. Not even a small gap, as usual.

Their customer service SUCKS! Below is a copied email which I wrote to their customer service after a recent visit to their property. Several days later, all I received was a boilerplate response basically saying sorry your experience sucked, I hope you'll come back and give us another chance. Why should I? They've given me no reason to.

"As a Las Vegas local, I often have visitors from out of town who I take to the Strip for various events or sight seeing. On 7\/11 my sister was in town and we were going to see Mariah Carey at the Colosseum. We arrived early so that we could do some shopping in the Forum Shops. I valeted my car at the valet closest to The Otherroom. There were no hours posted at the valet there and no signage as to pricing. It was hot though and I really didn't care how much it would cost as I was simply wanting to get out of the car and have some fun. The temperature inside the forum shops as well as in the casino was WAY too hot for summer in Vegas. We did not enjoy shopping or going through the casino because we were sweating bullets by the time we made it to the Colosseum. Once inside for the show we bought some (extremely overpriced) water and sat down to wait for the show to start. At 35 minutes past the time the show was supposed to start we both needed to use the restroom after having been sipping on that overpriced water for so long. We made our way up the stairs and once at the top we were told that the show was about to start and if we left we wouldn't be let back in until there was a break in the performance. So we decided to hold it. Once the show was over, there were too many hoards of people leaving for us to use the restroom in the Colosseum so we decided that we'd just stop at a restroom on our way back to valet. The first restroom we passed in the Forum Shops had a line extending into the hallway. At that point I decided I'd just wait till I got home and we proceeded to go pick up the car. We arrived at the valet at 11:03pm only to find a sign that said "VALET CLOSED. Please pick up vehicles at The Forum Shops lower valet." That's it. No directions to get there, no map, no employees to ask, NOTHING. If the Forum Shops close at 11, then it stands to reason that the valet specifically for the Forum Shops should be open AT LEAST 30 minutes past that time. At BARE MINIMUM there should be clear signage stating that the valet will be closed and your car will be moved by the time the shops are closed. At this point we had no idea where we were going, we'd already been walking for what felt like miles, we both had to use the restroom which seemed few and far between and impossible to find, and there wasn't an employee or map in sight to help us figure out where our car had been taken to. Finally, we found a security guard to ask. He was the first and only helpful employee that we encountered. The place our car had been sent to was so far from where it was originally, that he couldn't even give us verbal directions to get there, he felt that he needed to walk us part of the way. During our LONG walk, we encountered at least 2 escalators that were non operational that we had to walk up -it might have been 3, but at this point I was practically delirious from the heat, the excessive amount of walking, and still needing to use the restroom so I can't be sure. Once we were finally in the right direction and almost to the valet I spot another restroom located near the L.K. Bennett store. I head down the hallway and just as I'm about to turn into the bathroom a housekeeper pushes her cart in front of me and blocks the door and states "Closed for cleaning" to which I replied "do you know how long it will be or where there is another bathroom nearby?" and I kid you not, she looked me right in the face, didn't say a word and proceeded to walk away. I was literally in shock at the rudeness.  I never did find another restroom to use. By the time we finally got our car back and left, I was very irritated. I will think twice before I ever bring guests back to Caesars. Valet parking needs signage- hours and prices that is clear and easy to see. In addition, Forum Shops valet should not be closing at the same time or BEFORE the Forum Shops close. They should be open at least 30 minutes later than the shops, otherwise each guest should be informed upon arrival that their car will be moved extremely far away at a certain time. Bathrooms need to be easier to find- again, you need better signage. When it's 115 degrees outside the shops and casino need to be kept cooler. Broken escalators and such should be fixed promptly- not left non-operational with no one working on it and no signs. There needs to be better access to maps so that people can find their way since there are virtually no employees to ask for help. And lastly, people like that housekeeper need to learn better customer service skills. I have seriously never been so blatantly treated like a ghost in my entire life.

I love love love this place!! We stood in Octavius Towers and the rooms were brilliant. The bathroom was out of this world and the beds were like waking up a queen. I was so comfortable here and loved my view from my window! 

Thank you Caesars for always making me feel at home!

Great place to gamble!  Saw a lady hit the jackpot on the slots!!  Never in my life seen someone win over $20k in cash from slots...  She was playing $1 slots betting 5 at a time and she hit red white and blue jackpot!!  Good for her and seeing that this hotel pays out makes me feel good.  Even if I lost.  Haha.  Table games are great and table waitress are really fast to bring ur drinks.  Happy gambling and good luck.

I don't really go for nice hotels (as long as there's a bed & a shower I'm happy), but my papi decided he would take me here for a night for the experience. He chose this because this hotel is... Caesar's Palace! Caesar lived here! Of course we'd love to experience this, too.

Checking in took forever. We were unaware that you can check in thru text 24 hrs prior to your check in day, so we didn't do that. It took 45 mins before we can have our room keys and the bellhop to take our bags to the room. And so we enter the room... 

It was nice! I loved it! There's a bed, a purple couch... Ooops. The couch has a stain. We check out the bathroom. A tv in the mirror too! Just like the Flamingo! And the spa tub? None. The view? The strip... If not for the Colosseum blocking it. The comforter looked dusty-white, and the hidden part of it under the pillows were white-white. I wonder when they last washed these linen! Papi got confused. Our room should come with a spa tub and all the works. So he called guest services. 

They said we can either stay in this room and we will be given a $50 credit towards food and beverage, or move to our new room. We asked if we can get a credit towards gaming instead. No, they can't do that. So we decide to move to another room instead because we have the Buffet of Buffets and we don't need their f'n food credit, our faces are already stuffed. And we have to use it within our visit. 

48 years later, our bellhop has not arrived yet. We came in at this hotel at 1pm, and it is now 3pm.

So... We FINALLY went to our new room. I know this hotel have different towers but this ours was just a freaking far walk! But, when I got in the new room, voila!!! It's twice the size of the other room! The bathroom is the size of our apartment living room. You can actually put a couch in there and a love seat and there will still be room for our flat screen... and the spa tub! No stains on the couches this time... And our view was the pool... or should I say pools. Pools of glory. Super fancy!

But.
I would not have stayed here if not for the deal my husband found. I would come back to say hi to Caesar and maybe to try the Qua Spa (good reviews), but not to book a room. 

Unless somebody else pays for it.

Love this place. I called room service couple of times and they give me the items I needed like more blankets and towels. This place is clean, but they don't offer free wifi. Employees here are nice and friendly. Definitely coming back here again!

We had a king room in the Palace Tower.  Very nice diggs!   Super clean and nicely appointed.  We were pleasantly surprised to find a swimming pool sized jacuzzi tub in our room.  That's a good thing because with something like 4-5 pools that Caesars has, I didn't spot a jacuzzi anywhere. 

The bed was awesome.  Very high quality linens and fluffy pillows made for an awesome nights sleep.  (Well that coupled with the fact that I was up waayy past my bedtime every night we were here)!   Housekeeping was very nice and made quick work of cleaning the room.  We had to wait for about 15 minutes for her to finish.  

This place is spendy.  There is no two ways to say it.  $8.00 for a Coors Light by the pool.  Cocktails were like $16.00.   Never in my life have I paid $16 for a chicken quesadilla.  And for the close to $300 a night, I probably wouldn't return.  

Harrahs Entertainment has a really good deal for its Buffets... $49 gets you a 24 hour pass to ALL of its buffets.  That's right- you can dine at Caesars for Breakfast, Paris for brunch, Flamingo for Lunch, Rio for Dinner and Ballys for a late night snack...

Garish in it's design, and over stuffed with forum shops targeting only the 1% of society high rollers, Caesar's Palace is a decent hotel at best with a few good things hidden amongst the profligate pomp. 

Absinthe is a big hit show and is very popular here. As a benefit you don't have to enter this hotel to find the big circus tent where the show is held. Furthermore, the restaurants help boost this hotel beyond it's extravagant and off putting design. Mesa grill is a decent place though there are decidedly better options even in the strip for the price point. Raos, Guy Savoy, Ramsay and even Nobu are names people in the business will recognize. The rooms here are alright but it is neither the most comfortable or romantic, as they advertise it. Caesar's is in the cusp, already feeling quite dated due to it's unnecessary and cartoonish theme, but it does not help that even among other strip hitels, this one reeks of extravagant abundance. Unless you are quite wealthy and want the luxury of ridiculous, high end shop near your room, then this place can be quite uninviting. Even it's size makes it less appealing than plenty of the other options both old and new.

I recently spent a week at Caesar Palace for CES. Anyone who has been to CES knows the craziness that is that trade show. I spent a lot of time driving back and forth from Caesars to The Venetian on a daily basis delivering customers to our exhibit booth or dropping then off at their hotels, that I began to know the valet staff pretty well. Two people I would like to point out are Nathanial and Serena? (Works the valet desk outside) these two single handedly made my days stress free. Addressing me by my name and having my ticket ready by the time I got out of the car. As a Diamond member this was well appreciated. Thank you both VERY much for all that you do on a regular basis to make our stay there so pleasurable!

On another note, as busy as the hotel was, the room service really suffered. I ordered breakfast one morning so I could do some work. By the time it got to me, it was cold and not what I ordered. When I called and talked to a manager they offered to take the drink off my bill, but that in no way made up for the cold food. Very disappointed in that part of the stay.

If you want the original Vegas atmosphere with a spoonful of trendy and a two heaping cup fills of customer service,this place is for you. There's a reason this place is iconic and featured in a number of movie hits. CeasAr's has been a staple of the Vegas BrAnd for decades. The customer service is very accommodating and I felt like our satisfaction was a priority. We had a suite in the palace towers and for some reason the TV would not turn off. Engineering had to come at 3:30 am just to turn off the tv. The manager comped is Resort feed and seemed genuinely apologetic for our inconvenience. This place is building exponentially every time I come back there a new tower and th

I've been to Vegas 8 times now in the last 7 years and this was my first time staying at Cesar's Palace. I must say I love this hotel! I had a great time, the food was great the pool was amazing and the casino dealers and staff made it fun and very enjoyable playing the games. I've never stayed at a Harrahs resort before usually I stay at M life and I will prob stay at a Harrahs resort from here on out.... At least gamble.

1. Bacchanal Buffet : I've tried majority of the Vegas buffets (Aria,Bellagio,Mandalay,Wynn,etc..) but Cesar's easily took the cake. The dinner buffet was outstanding. The variety and quality of food made it worth the weight gain. From Prime Rib, Briskett to the Deserts I would highly recommend this buffet regardless of price.


2. Pool: I stayed at Aria a few months back and was so disappointed in their pool that I went elsewhere when I wanted to relax in the sun and swim. Cesar's Palace pool area made me feel like I was living luxurious. Beautiful pools with great vibe to make you feel you are really living in a palace. There are waterfalls with blackjack in the pool. The best pool so far I've been to in Vegas..... I wouldn't really say this is a party type pool but highly recommend you become royal here.

3. Gambling: For anyone who is I to gambling you'll understand me on this. People gamble for the enjoyment and fun of the game while making money and if you lose it it's okay cause you had a great time, you pay for entertainment. I've always stayed with M life resorts (MGM,Mandalay bay, Aria,etc....) and have gambled a lot in the past, majority of my trips but the rating system and comps for mlife has become so horrid and cheap that they just don't want to give anything in return. They told me at aria you had to average $130 per betting hand to really get good comps or let alone comps at all. I used to get comped buffets,hotel rooms, promotional chips all the time and that's what brought me out but they have declined so much and never comp anything that I've decided not to gamble at their resorts anymore. I stayed true to my word and haven't...... People should realize this as well.

One day into playing at Harrahs resorts (Cesar's palace,Paris and Planet Hollywood) they comped me a room and sent me offers as where I never receive anything anymore from mlife other than a 30% off your room..... Cesar's has a handful variety of games with very good and friendly dealers. The floor get to know your name and your story making you feel part of the them.

The hotel is beautiful, the room are very spacious with a big hot tub and glass shower, the food is phenomenal and even though it's pricey we don't go on vacation to be cheap, esp in Vegas.

Thank you Cesar's and Harrahs for an amazing experience.

A+++

Worst stay ever in Las Vegas!! I have stayed in most of the major Hotels on the strip and I must say I will NEVER stay here again!! The experience was terrible from start to finish. So many issues, they are impossible to list. Check-in was horrible, waited in long lines for 45 minutes just to be told no room was available (cleaned) yet and it was after 4:00 check in time. Waited until almost 6:00 p.m. to get in a room??? Room was old and furniture was all damaged and scrapped up, curtains were torn. One day room was not made up at all, and we were out of the room most of the day. When I called guest services to get maid service I was told it was our fault, the room was not made up because the red light was on?? This is not true, the green light was on indicating we needed maid service. Every time you call guest services, they are rude and un-helpful and the guest is always WRONG? Some of the overhead Bathroom lights did not work. No extra toilet paper is left in the room so when they do not come to make up the room we had no T.P or clean towels. Also you only get three towels per day? There is NO COFFEE provided in the room (free of charge) they want you to pay $13.00 per day for a few K-cups and some sugar and creamer packets!! Outrageous . . . .even Motel 6 gives you FREE coffee each morning!! There was a Keurig coffee maker in the room so we went and bought our own coffee and supplies. Once we did this, they stopped giving us PAPER CUPS for the coffee!! Really, I am not kidding . . . .how CHEAP can you get!! The Pool area was lovely BUT, it is not kept clean and the place looked like a FRAT house. Garbage, cups, glasses and food debris all over the place, lots of drunks as well. We saw large groups of young people, drinking to excess, passed out in the lounge chairs, being loud and throwing their drunk friends in the Pool, the lifeguards watched it all and did nothing? Not to mention the irresponsibility of serving excessive Alcohol to people! This Hotel is NO class act, that's for sure and we could not wait to check-out!! I was "forced" to stay at Ceasar's due to a convention I was attending there. By the way, they do not send out any survey after your visit, to rate your stay in their Hotel? Why, because they do not want to know, because they don't CARE!!! Hated It . . . . .

Love it!! Checking in was good, our rooms were immaculate, service was excellent.  Loved the mini coffee bar in our room. Loved the variety of restaurants, the mall and their amazing drinks. Let's not forget to  mention the beautiful Roman theme.

My boyfriend made reservations here because it was convenient since we had tickets to see Elton John on Valentine's weekend. My bf also made reservations at The Palm restaurant  (also highly recommended) since it was just a few feet away from the  Colosseum where Elton John was performing. So everything was so perfect and accommodating that we didn't have stress or worry about being late or anything. We definitely had the time of our lives. I can never finishing telling you how incredible and sublime Elton John's performance was. A MUST SEE!! NEVER NEVER SEEN A STAGE LIKE HIS IN MY LIFE. it was worth every dime!!.

Look at the lines at the Checkins.  Waited 1 hr.  All to force customers to use Kiosks.  We have connecting rooms so we had to go through this line.  The service is the worse of the worse.  You cannot force customers in this type of situation.  It is the worse hotel!

I WILL NEVER USE VEGAS.COM OR STAY AT CAESARS
We were booked to stay here 7\/3 for 2 nights & left after the 1st. The bathroom fixtures were rusted, the bottom of the door was broken & coming apart, urine had ate away at the marble around the toilet the grout around the tub was dirty & moldy. The other doors were 1.5 inches from reaching the floor, we could see out into the hall & into the adjoining room. the air conditioner was very clanking. They sent someone to fix it which was no help. They switched our room to an nicer room that had 1\/2 the crystals stolen off the wall sconce chandelier. The blanket had a big hole in it & the lighting was too dim to apply my make-up. We asked where the buffet was & they said it had been closed for month & vegas.com should have told us & they didn't. They suggested we go to Flamingo's buffet which was closed for 4 hours due to a water problem. We then walked to Paris who's buffet was open but were out of food. No meat, no fresh cooked veggies. The salad bar was old wilted lettuce with no tomatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes or other fresh veggies. At least the Phantom of the Opera at the Venetian was outstanding. I will never stay at Caesars and never book from Vegas.com & will tell everyone i know to avoid both of these when booking a Vegas get away

I'll begin my review by addressing some of the common concerns previous reviewers had written down. 

Checkin: We were asked to come back an hour later because the room wasn't ready. Not a big deal because we were shopping in the mall anyway and as another added benefit, we were upgraded to the Augustus tower from the Palace towers. 

Dirty Rooms: Our room was clean however there was a slight smoke smell (we were in the non-smoking section). It wasn't a big enough deal for us to switch rooms but it was noticeable. 

I've stayed in a total of four hotels now (Palazzo, Mandalay Bay, Aria, Caesars) and I"ve been comparing them together trying to get a ranking going on and Caesars would be in 2nd place. Palazzo is still my favorite (you can refer to my reviews for information on it), but the location of Caesars gives it a big advantage. With Palazzo, I hated having to walk so far to everywhere. It was nice being able to get pretty much anywhere I needed to be (Bellagio, Aria, Venetian, MGM Grand, PH), via light walking or the tram. 

Bed: A+ Very comfortable
Safe: Box attached to the wall, very shallow
Location: Augustus Towers would be more appropriate for anyone who spends more time on the Bellagio side of the strip. The entrance to Augustus Towers is right near the stairs to go to Bellagio, trams. 
Parking Garage: Incredibly hot, they need to create more ventilation in there. Depending on where you park, the walk can be far and walking through that garage is like walking through the Sahara

Surprised the suites are not nicer. I paid for a deluxe tower room at maniacally and it was a nicer room and not a suite. Sort of odd. But location and price were good. No complaints just nothing to rave about

I've been staying at Caesars almost every Vegas trip for the past couple of years and overall it is an excellent hotel.  I can't speak for the other towers but the Augustus and Palace towers are worth staying in.  I've heard the Centurion is one tower to avoid... 
Overall service has always been excellent.  I actually don't think I've received bad service over the past two years - which is actually pretty amazing. The casino is large so there are always open tables to play.  There are multiple bars around as well to just relax and drink.  The spa Qua is really nice and relaxing.  Best of all Qua is very large so it doesn't feel crowded.
If you go there make sure to ask for an upgrade to the Augustus tower.  Will definitely go back.

From 12\/24\/15

This is my first time going Caesars Palaces, and I know for a fact I will be a returning visitor! This is a colossal sized casino, which makes sense with it being on Las Vegas BLVD, but for some reason, it felt bigger than most on the Strip. 

Inside of this casino\/resort you have a slew of restaurants, and a bunch of galleries, including a big one.
If you're in need of retail therapy, the forum shops have four floors of jewelry and clothes for you to buy. The shops are a mix of High-end stores like Micheal Kors to affordable clothes like H&M. 

The decor in Caesars is epic, everything is just pretty and Roman-esk, Of course, there is the casino floor for getting your gambling on.

We stayed in their newest renovated tower overlooking the pool. Quite the trek to get to from any lobby or casino but close to the dining and entertainment. On the eighth floor we were above any noise of the pool parties. Service was mediocre at check in. Descent place to stay for conferences for comfort but nothing extraordinary to write home about

Just came back from Vegas. Stayed at Caesar's. Room was beautiful, Venus pool was OK. Went to drai's rooftop pool across the street at the Cromwell, got free admission, drinks were priceythough. 

At caesars staff were very good and prices were reasonable. Went to the bacchanal buffet for dinner it's 50 ahead but sooo good and so many options. 

I would recommend Caesar's it's pretty cool and central. Just the no free wifi was a pain for me. So it's really a 3.5 star for me but still I would return.

Check-in.  They want $35 for early check in but no compensation for room not being available at 4 pm.  Then at 7 pm at check-in the front desk gives me the wrong keys and room.  Wrong beds and view.  They tell me to wait in room and it will be corrected.  Now 40 min later and just spoke with manager Sammy at front desk $50 food credit, still waiting for bellman to show with keys to correct room and luggage.  Really Caesars this is not how I want my vacation to begin.

Updated....Took 50 mins for Caesars to finally get a bellman to the room.

I am super disappointed with Caesar's right now! I booked a room online for an upcoming trip in which I will have my golden retriever puppy. Upon booking there was no mention, even in the fine print, of the reservation that you had to call to specifically request a dog friendly room. Luckily with less than a month left until my trip I had the foresight to double check the reservation. The woman on the phone the first time was excruciatingly unhelpful. She told me that there were no "dog rooms" (pet friendly?) available during our stay and that it was my fault for not calling sooner. When I asked to speak to a manager she transferred me to Expedia (!?) to see if they had a pet friendly room in the block of pet friendly rooms they allegedly own at Caesar's Palace Las Vegas. I was skeptical at best. The man at Expedia clearly could not understand me. He was more confused than I was about what was going on and he gave me the run around for 40 minutes calling Caesar's and putting me on hold. At the end of the call he could not book me a room and nor could anyone at Caesar's. Frustrated that I was not originally put on the phone with a manager when I requested I called Caesar's back. I spoke with the nicest gentleman (the only reason this review even has 2 stars is because of him) and he was so helpful. Instead of pushing me off onto a third party vendor he found a solution and booked me a pet friendly room at The Cromwell, a boutique sister hotel of Caesar's Palace. I really appreciate this young man's service and I would give him 5 stars if I could. Caesar's Palace however needs to get their ducks in a row and make sure their cliental has ALL the details before they book rooms. Online booking should provide a client with the same resources and information as booking over the phone. Pet owners beware and make sure you get all of the details form this shady place before booking online.

upon arrival they didn't even have our room thaqt we booked in january\/'13 for a check in of 3\/6\/13 the guy had to go back and get approval......not saying he wasn't nice or courteous but seriously?!    we play a lot and come to vegas 15 times a year don't have the patience for ish like this . and i'm not the type of person to ask for an upgrade or a favor maybe i should be. the rooms were already comped by the casino host based on our play from our last stay. the room was nothing to write home about ur avg room you would think they could have done something nicer given the fact that my friend was playing 1500 a hand for 7-9 hrs.i averaged 450 a hand for 7-9 hrs   we ventured down the strip and mandalay bay saw the amt of action we were bringing they comped us rooms immediately which was nice not that we even needed them but its nice to feel appreciated some times i guess maybe im just old fashion like that. however back to the Caesars Palace  they do have nice forum shops and ample pools   but the gave us a room in the octavio tower which is no less then a half mile hike to the room from the registration desk and our room was at the end of the longest hallway i have seen in vegas yet it was like we were being place on time out lol.       after looing 23,000 we aptly named the walk to the room "the walk of shame" not i cant write a review based on loosing that would not be fair now would it lol    ( after all vegas wasn't built on winners , trust me on this one) 


all in all the host jay craviotto reviewed our play and comped the 100.00 something room a night haha and the 200 in food and drinks we charged to the room) which was obvious was going to happen but he was a pleasure working with and we may return here but we get way better comps at cosmopolitan and mandalay bay for some reason) we get show tickets and mny to play with and large rooms etc etc . who knows may try them again but this time i would have to go through a host like jay who is understanding of the gravity of the situation

I was pleasantly surprised and impressed with my stay at cp. I was hesitating between the newer Aria hotel but ultimately picked cp because we were only staying one night and wanted to be near the forum shops, the buffet, and I got a decent deal for a room in the Julius tower. I read tons of reviews before booking the room. Much to my surprise we had a pretty nice view of the strip and the room was nice and clean. We stayed in room 1492. The water temp did fluctuate here and there. The beds were comfy. Check in and out was easy and fast. The Julius tower is located right next to the big pool and the bacchanal buffet. I was able to charge everything to my room so that made things very convenient. I highly recommend staying here!

I'm staying here right now. The rooms are nice. Seem clean. That's about it. That's all I've got that's positive. 

The service is awful. All staff treat you like you're unwelcome and a nuisance. 

It took 20 minutes in line to be able to speak with a front desk person to check in. 

The restaurants (Bacchanal and Payard) are overpriced. Service is so slow. And food is sub-par. 

The gym is nice but it's not 24 hours!!  It closes at 8pm?  What's that about?

I literally hate this hotel. 

Oh, and by the way, the hallways and elevators in the Palace Tower smell like vomit and have smelled that way for the last 3 days I've been here.

This is getting old.  This is the second review I've had to redo after the original disappeared into cyberspace.  I stayed in the Augustus Tower.
The property is obscenely immense and spread out.
The room was spacious but smoke filled.
The bed was comfortable
The entire place reeked of smoke.
They charge a fortune to see performers at the end of their careers.
They actually charge only the guys  to hang out at the topless pool.
The convention facilities were nice but smoke filled.
I'd stay there again if at a convention but otherwise there are other more interesting options.
Always been one of my favorite hotels in the Strip! I feel I am in Europe everytime I am in this place....beautiful architecture, lovely fountain and  amazing shops!

Three of us checked in to Caesars on a decent deal that we thought was a great deal.  After walking from the parking lot to the lobby which we schlept our luggage approximately a half mile (No exaggeration)  We checked in and schlept  the luggage for another half mile.  We got to our room opened the door and found it to be occupied.  Tired of walking, I contacted a maid and tried to explain the problem, after she realized what I was saying she stated "that happens often"  I telephoned the front desk and was immediately given an upgrade.  So I had to return to the lobby and get the new room key.  We were directed to a new tower.  Upon entering I noticed the room looked nice.  When going to take a shower the shower tile was full of black mold, the water drained slowly and the previous residents hair was stuck to the drain.  Several phone calls to fix the problem and plenty of exasperation.  

12 dollars for 3 k cups of coffee, 25 dollars to use the gym, internet was not free (i used my hot-spot so I don't know the cost)  7 dollars for a beer in the refrigerator, but considering that was the price for a beer at the bar at least they are consistent.   The prices throughout the casino were high, this caused me to leave the Casino and go to a casino that at least had decent prices.  A beer at a local casino was $ 2.75, I put the rest into the slots. Caesars is too big to fail!, and to big to manage.  Wynn, encore, mirage is much better.  Caesars should hire Steve Wynn to decorate the place.  Might help, though i'll never go back.

This used to be one of my favorite places to stay at. Here are some quick tips though!

1. Parking here is really ample, there's a lot that leads to the back part of Caesar's Palace. Park on the 5th floor on the outdoor rooftop for easy elevator access without walking too far.

2. The check-in counter from the parking lot is a long ways away! Try to take the Appian Way to cut through most of the building and read them signs!

3. The $20 tip trick holds true here, try your best to score an upgrade to another resort room!

4. No resort fees! Though I think the price is just built into the hotel total price anyway.

5. The Bacchanal Buffet is tremendous! I wrote a review about it separately from this one about the Hotel itself.

I stayed here multiple times with different people. My family and I visited some time in 2005 and stayed in the nicer suites. It was really comfortable, the decor was awesome, and the jacuzzi tub was a plus. Fast forward a bit and in the last year or so my girlfriend and I wound up in Vegas for our first (of many!) trips to Vegas. I was excited to relive my experience in a suite that my family and I stayed in.

There are a few things that cause me to believe that whoever designed Caesars was a guy who wanted people to walk long distances for no reason. The property for Caesar's is humongous. I mean walking through the whole property would probably be a nice day's exercise. Everything is far apart.

What probably makes the least sense is the fact that the parking lot and the hotel lobby area are really far apart. The last thing that I wanted to do was to walk with all my luggage to the check in counter that was about ten minutes away. The other thing that bothered me was that the room elevators for each of the individual towers was also far, far away. It seemed like there was no central design in mind for Caesar's Palace.

Anyways, it's good to get exercise, but one of the bigger design flaws is the lack of signage that tells you where to go. It's hard for first time hotel guests who parked in the lot to find the lobby area by navigating the vast ways around the hotel floor. Besides the complex design, the whole casino feels like something that is semi-transformed from being part of old Vegas legend. It feels kind of like some of the games have seen their fair share of days. 

The rooms within the casino though are pretty comfortable provided you do not get hooked up with the rooms near the parking lot. The day we came to Caesar's, we tipped $50 to get a "complementary" upgrade. As a side note, $50 is way over paying, usually a $20 will suffice! Anyways, the room we got upgraded to was comfortable, but I would say that there were many small issues with room cleanliness. Speaking of which, the service is mediocre and is typical, nothing to rave about, but pretty standard in Vegas.

The bottom line is that if everywhere else in the 5 star hotel category is sold out\/expensive, I wouldn't mind staying here again for cheap. Otherwise, I  would say that staying at this hotel is pretty skippable.

While the property itself is beautiful and the location is supreme our room was not what I would consider luxurious. It was nice and fairly large, but there were no plugs, only an extension cord running behind the bed. There was one wall plug behind the curtain where the cover was actually hanging out of the wall with a lamp plugged into it! That just didn't seem to safe.
The positives: the bed was super comfortable and the bathroom was very large.

I realize I was in the cheaper tower of this hotel and I actually used the app Hotel Tonight to book the room so it ended up costing me $54 for the night so if I had the chance to stay there again for that price I would. If I had to pay full price I think I would look elsewhere and happily walk down the strip to see the sites.

One of my fav places to stay in Vegas! I'll try to keep this short, but here are my favorite things about it:

*Rooms are great. I recommend trying the old $20 tip. This upgraded us to a large suite with a HUGE (largest I've seen in vegas) jacuzzi tub and a nice strip view.

*best poker room in vegas, awesome sports book, and the best mall attached to a casino. 

*Nice pool, but it isn't the biggest, and it isn't as great as Mandalay Bay's

*Fine dining is great, but their food court blows, and there are only limited other options.

The room is acceptable.  But you can get much better for the same price at other hotels on the Strip, without getting nickled and dimed every which way.  I can afford whatever but, really?  We arrived at 2 p.m. and our room was ready.  However, I was told I could not actually get my room until 3 unless I either paid for an upgrade or I paid an extra $35.  There is a Keurig coffee set up in the room.  But we didn't see any coffee, so we called down.  I was told the coffee was $12.50 and was part of the minibar set up.  My wife called to point out there were no robes (we're in an expensive room).  "We don't do that any more".  Come on!  It's not a ton of money, obviously, but just not very hospitable.  Normally stay elsewhere, but the show we're going to was at Caesar's so we decided to stay here and save on taxi.  Should have stayed elsewhere; for same price get a nicer room, better service and less "nickle and dime" b.s.  I hear they're going into bankruptcy; I can see why.

Beautiful, convenient hotel but terrible customer service. Seriously no point in having the self service check in kiosk and such a waste of time being "helped" by employees there. After being told by the kiosk to see the key desk, the employee there ( will not disclose her name ) convinced us to try the kiosk again. After another failed attempted with the kiosk we were told to go to the platinum line. And even though we told her we weren't platinum ...she insisted that we just tell the service desk we were sent by her. After a 40 min wait in line, the service desk told us to stand in another line because we weren't platinum. So, back of the line we go again which was another 40 min wait. Once we finally got our keys, with slight optimism, we walked to our rm to find that our keys didn't work. I know at sometimes keys malfunction, but after a series of bad customer service here....its just wasn't a pleasant stay. Very frustrating!

Horrible service!! The people at the front desk seem nice and trustworthy, but when it comes to billing and service, I recommend you check thoroughly. The Bacchanal Buffet was a complete rip off. And the service for wifi was frustrating. If you stayed in the Julius Tower, you would be expected to call customer service every time you returned to the room. Don't trust the front desk people and don't eat at their restaurants. The only one I liked there was "The Bejing Noodle Co." That was the only restaurant that was worth eating. The walls were incredibly thin. Disregard the renovations because in the Julius Tower, the views are horrible. That was another thing the front desk promised, a good view. The fact that they are regarded as one of the five star hotels probably contributed to the fact of not going the extra mile for each and every one of their customers. We paid the resort fee, but we did not get robes!!

Here is a copy of a letter I wrote them after my recent stay.  I replied to the "Please rate us" email they sent and it bounced back.  Then, of course, it is impossible to find a way to send them an email via their website.  I know Im just a little fish in the grand scheme of things but I cannot believe how lousy this stay was!

I hate to say this but honestly, I had a horrible experience at your property.  I was assigned to a very nice, reply renovated room, unfortunately that's where it went downhill.   Sunday was peasant enough, no issues, until I went to bed after a long day or aggressively working a conference (NAPA). I went to shut my blackout curtains and they would not close all the way.  Their was a 10-12 inch gap where the tracks wild not allow the curtains to come together.  I literally could have read a book with the light that streamed in but that wasn't the worst of it.  The morning sun woke me up waaay too early and started my day off on a miserable note.

After cleaning up I called down to guest services and told them of the problem and they said they would have someone come up to fix it.  I went to my conference and came back up around 2pm for a break.  That's when the room sounded like a freaking train was running through my room.  Apparently the front desk person chose not to tell me that construction would be going on in this tower until 5pm.  NOT GOOD!!!!!  I went to close the drapes and saw that no one came up to fix the curtains so I called down again to ask for it to be fixed.  

I went back to work my conference and came back up to get ready for a dinner event and noticed that the curtains STILL were not fixed s I called down for a 3rd time.  Guest services????  I'd say NO!

After my 3rd request an engineer came up to my room and said he wouldn't be able to do anything about it so he proceeded to safety pin the curtains together.  Ok, thanks for the band-aid.

The two days at the conference were the most miserable hotel room experience iv'e had in 25 years of going to conferences and traveling for business.  Last year I had ~110 hotel room stays so this is saying a lot.

Very disappointing especially from an institution like Caesar's.
The hotel is ok but their staff including management leaves a lot to be desired.   They are definitely due for some employee training on all levels.
The gambling area fit the whole Caesar theme!! Loved it!! Very live and staff was very friendly =)

I always love coming to Caesars Palace. Even whenI was kid (especially after watching Rain Man) I always enjoyed CP. They've done a good job at staying relevant as Vegas has aged. Great upkeep of the facility, and a knack for thoughtful marketing.

Well what a poor experiance  have had at the resort in las vegas .Don't stay in the palace tower room 1406 unless you want food exhaust pumped into your roon most of the day and night. I 'V Been in vegas many times but this was my worst experiance i offten stay at The Wynn and will return to them with open arms as Caesars palace is not a Palace. Upon calling the front desk for a solution i was offers a room air freshener  well that stinks 
Pass on the palace and move over to another Casino in vegas you will be glad you did

Had a four night stay in the old roman tower.  Newer rooms and except for the old tv room was nicely and newly furnished. Really soft pillows.  There was NO door on the bathroom   Room was clearly designed for couples but if you are shy about showering or going to the bathroom be warned. Toilet is in a corner but not private

Service ok.  One bad thing there were two small old probably blood stains on the carpet.  Food comes out. This had not. More gross the anything. E mailed and called hotel. Still no response three days after we left

Great pool

Decent food but pricey and except for Mesa grill pretty standard fair.  Coffee shop good but horrendously slow.  20 minutes to get a bill.  If clearly caters to large parties and known customers. 

A fun old time place with a history and some flaws.  Really 3 and a half stars

First time going to a concert here we sell Rod Stewart last night Rod Stewart was amazing 90 minutes of music I know it was billed as the concert was called the hits but Rod Stewart has more than 90 minutes of hits the band was amazing the stage was amazing the venue was amazing even the free parking was close and easy to get to my only problem was the outrageous concession stand $17 for a mixed drink and $7 for a bag of popcorn a very small bag of stale popcorn

This was my fifth stay, and the most unimpressed I have ever been. Check in time is 3, and they informed me that my room wasn't ready, to check back at 7. OR I could pay $60 to 'rush a room'. Sorry? You are going to charge me extra money to give me a room you were supposed to give me already?? No thank you. I was highly disappointed. I had to check my luggage and go to my conference without freshening up first. Once my conference day was done at 7, I waited in line for over an hour to be told my room still wasn't ready. At this time, I missed my dinner reservation. Finally, they got me into a room. The hotel seems to be showing its age. Probably won't be back.

Great hotel experience but not so great customer service.

We stayed at the palace tower which was Amazing, but here were some downsides:
-TV was broken and when called to be fixed nobody came.
-there was no hot water coming to any of the showers

Disclaimer:  I didn't stay at the hotel, but I used the pool facility for the day and I have shopped   there.

I spent the day at the Caesar's pool complex and it was out of this world.  I felt like I was at the Hearst Castle!  The pools and grounds were very well kept up.

I really enjoyed the main pool, but the Apollo pool that is tucked away in a back corner was very peaceful and quiet. 

I hope to come back here and stay at the hotel in the future.

Beware of the Starbucks, they charge a LOT more than usual at this location.

Attended a conference last last month.  Had never stayed there, but had fond memories from my younger days.

In a word, disgusting.  Bathroom tiles had moldy grout. Wood trim and doorjambs around the tub warped, moldy, and dry-rotted.  Ridiculous 70's phone by the toilet that I am sure costs 2.00\/min.  No fridge in room, not even a mini-bar.  Staff could care less about you as a guest - not one even a hint of a smile.

Worst thing was the pool - we wondered why it closes at 4pm?  Happened to be in the pool area after hours, saw a roach, then 2, then 16, then 128 - we left before the invasion overhwelmed us - apparently they own the pool after dark.  Like someone turned off the lights and the real nightlife of Vegas came out to play.

Cant imagine having people, especially kids sitting on the same pool deck and loungers covered with roaches the night before - shouldn't this be some kind of healthcode violation?

And the food was terrible - bland, uninspired, did not have a good meal on property.  Had better meals at in my highschool cafeteria than here.

My first and last overnight stay at this hotel - the nerve to charge 160\/night for what I consider worse than a 50$-a-night motel six.

I have stayed here over the years and it was always great. BUT last wk we were there for a couple of days & will never go back. @ check in we asked for an upgrade , $100 more per nite. It was a small suite but nothing worked . 2 TVS both very bad reception. POOR lighting in bedrm. 2 lites burned out. Every lamp shade hanging on for dear life!!!  Called desk re: TVS , they came up but couldn't do anything .
NO WINDOWS TO LOOK OUT but there were sheer curtains. Didn't want to change rooms as we were not staying long. 2 electric outlets broken. 
OVERALL it's past its prime, NEEDS facelift badly. Oh I forgot very difficult to work lamps.
DID eat at a fabulous restaurant RAOS!!!!! Highly recommended

Booked a king size suite in the Laurel collection  my wife booked it for my 40th birthday. The check in was quick and easy and staff were very polite and efficient. The casino was very clean and easy to get around beside the size of the casino the place was HUGE!!!!!  Our room had king size bed, lounge,and dining area, the bathroom had double vanity jacuzzi and seperate shower photos online were exactly what we got.  

BE WARNED IF YOU TOUCH ANYTHING IN THE MINI BAR AND REMOVE IT FOR MORE THAN 30 SECS YOU OWN IT......

We were warned by staff at check in. i would highly recommend Caesars Palace to my family and friends and look forward to future travels.

This place is HUGE! My friend got comped for this hotel and I literally got lost here a few times. Even though this place has been opened for a long time. It's still very nice and well-kept inside. 

Don't stay in Palace Towers.. it's hella far! The walk was crazy from the casino floor to the room.

The room was very pretty. It's better than any place I've ever stayed at. Right when I entered the room, the bathroom was on the left. There was a shower, closed toilet room, 2 sinks, and a jacuzzi tub. OMG! I didn't even get to use the tub! No time! The closet also has a motion censored light! Love it!
We had a very nice service during the whole week, fabulous room at the 24th floor, great pool.  Not much negative to say. I'll go back anytime!

Disappointed.  Haven't been to Las Vegas in 15 years, so want sure about all the changes. Figured we would stay at a classic. I don't see myself staying here again. Room was ok in size but nothing in it. Always felt crowed and cramped. For the money I'd rather stay at another hotel and walk over if I wanted to
This casino is huge and has everything: restaurants, buffet, shops, etc. I love coming here with the grandkids for a nice weekend getaway! No complaints

The worst place ever. 
Smoky room in a non smoke room
No hot water
Locked me out of my own room. 
The customer service is better at taco bell.

Good:
 
Nice statues, lobby area, restaurants (expensive though), rooms were nicely decorated and bed was comfortable. 

The maid service was very effiecient. Every morning we would leave our room for about an hour and come back and room was completely clean and towels replenished. 

Bad:
Very expensive, the casino was poor imo.. I liked the bellagio or wynn much better. The bathroom sink nobb wasn't working well. Our Palace Tower room 2525 in a conjoining room and you could hear the conversations of the neighbors easily.. they weren't even speaking loudly. 

The pool area seemed pretentious.. didn't like all the private club cabana stuff.. but i guess that's vegas.  

Long line at checkin and didn't get the Forum tower room I had reserved.
This review is for the food court. It sucks. The price for what you get is ridiculous. Ive had better burgers at McD's and for a third of the price!

Way over-priced.  Our room was nice and all -- but it was comped -- so it would not have been worth the $300 a night tab that would have been charged.  The casino is smaller -- and the casino floor seems harder to navigate than The Venetians...if you can imagine that.  The buffett sucked btw.  ICK.  The mall on site helps -- but like my friend Erin B. says, the only ones that can afford to shop there, are both rich and skinny.  Basically, at Caesars, you pay for the privilege of being at the "Famous and Fabulous Caesars Palace!"  Yeah.

This was my first experience staying at the ol' Palace. I must say that if I had a choice I wouldn't have stayed here...because I know the table minimums are not MY minimums but, who gambles where they sleep anyways?

We stayed in a room in the Roman tower and while it left something to be desired it was definitely ok. 

I love that the Forum Shops are right there although I do wish the food court in the hotel were...better....alot better. As it was...pretty terrible.

My favorite thing about Caesar's Palace? The customer service!!!!! I got lost like...10 times? Nobody ever got annoyed. The people ALWAYS introduced themselves and gave me perfect directions. I live in Austin so a smile to me means "excellent" customer service.

it's SO big (that's what she said), no really, it is.
I stayed at this place for 4 days and probably didn't see all of it.

The daytime check in staff was pretty mediocre and almost quite rude (you know who you are) though it's worth mentioning how nice  the checkout staff was. I guess the front desk staff can be hit or miss.

The bellmen were awesome and very friendly. One guy who brought our bags to the room for us spent a good half hour filling us in on the scene and giving us a few tips and tricks for everything from gambling to eating. He wore out his welcome after the first 15 minutes but we still appreciated it :)

The casino was nice and has a bit of my money tucked into it's fancy money machines! Pussy Cat Dolls area with dancing ladies was interesting. I kind of felt like I walked into a lame strip club on accident.

The rooms were ok, the bathrooms were awesome, don't touch anything in the fridge or you'll pay, and that goes for the digital camera and $3 mini pringles. I don't think any of the hotels in Vegas smell nice mainly because you can smoke in them so don't count on roses and fresh laundry scents. 
Great place to stay and I always felt close enough to the action.
Stayed here only one night. Receptionist at front desk was rude and tripple charged us for the room. She claimed it was an accident....Caesars Palace was nothing special.

I really enjoyed my dinner at the Mesa in Caesars Palace. I ordered a 22 oz rib eye in the bone. It was cooked perfectly. The service was excellent. I can tell thy take pride in their food and service. It's a must go too restaurant while staying at Caesars Palace. Its close to the sports room.

Loved our stay here at Caesar's Palace.  We stayed in one of the Palace Premium rooms which was located very conveniently close to our favorite Bachannal buffet I was very impressed with how clean and well insulated our room was.  Normally in other Las Vegas  hotels we have stayed at there is a lot of noise in the hallways.  During our stay, I did not hear any noises outside of our room at all.  There is also a lot of attention to detail all around the hotel with the statues, plants and marble floors and columns.  I didn't get a chance to check out the pools, maybe next time. The free drinks that were served to us  while we played were nice and strong and not watered down at all.  The slots were a little tight but I would definitely stay at this beautiful hotel again!
This is has got to be the best hotel. I love the architect of this area. It really inspired me to go to Italy someday lol. The statues and all the stores were amazing.
The only time I've been to Vegas and not stayed at The Venetian, I stayed at Caesar's. I was pleasantly satisfied. I had no complaints, the staff was helpful and friendly, and it was a good value.

Charging $34 for early check in at the front desk? How about you try to accommodate your guests, and if you can't, so be it. But they make a point of saying that you will only get notified after 4pm if you're not willing to pay. Even if some rooms become available sooner, they won't give them to a waiting guest. Pretty terrible from a customer service perspectice. I'll be avoiding this place like the plague going forward. Too many other options in this town.

This hotel is so huge, I've been there a million times and I still don't know my way around completely.  The Caesars Forum Shops mall is pretty cool.  There's plenty of places to eat and drink.  And there's a theatre with huge headlining acts (I saw Jerry Seinfeld there, my aunt is seeing Cher there).

I've played poker quite a few times in the Caesars poker room, and it's definitely one of the best in town.  The have two rooms... the main room for cash games and another for tournaments.  It's pretty well run, and if you call in advance you can get on the list for some games.

I think my favorite thing in this hotel is right when you come out of the elevators from the parking garage -- make sure you go through the door on the right.  Trust me, it's awesome.

We actually stayed at Caesar's this time, so this is a review of the Hotel. They are rather large and it takes forever to get anywhere, but the room itself was great. We'd booked in the Augustus tower and they ended up upgrading us to a suite in the Palace tower. First complaint was that the guy checking us in didn't bother to tell us that we were in a different tower or that we'd been upgraded, so we ended up going back thru the line to get our questions answered.

The room was spectacular even though it was way more than we expected. Two-person jacuzzi, his and hers bathrooms. King size bed and 3 different toilet areas. The TV's in the room were way too small and the remotes didn't work very well. 

I tipped the maid after the first night and apparently that wasn't up to par as she didn't refill the coffee or do much on the 2nd day. 

All in all it was a good stay.

Sicherlich ist das Ceasars Palace gegenüber den neuen 5-Sterne Hotels nicht mehr auf dem allerneuesten Stand. Allerdings haben wir für eine Übernachtung auch nur 120 Dollar bezahlt. Selbst die älteren Zimmer im Roman Tower sind völlig ok und ausreichend !! Die Zimmerpreise für die neuen Top Hotels gehen in der Regel erst bei ca 200 Dollar los. Ich mag aber den Charm des Ceasars Palace und würde jeder Zeit hier wieder nächtigen. Besonders beeindruckend sind die 8 Fahrspuren ( nebeneinander ) vor dem Haupteingang und der tolle Valet Service !! Ich kann das Hotel nur empfehlen . Einziger Minuspunkt ist, das kostenpflichtige Wlan ( für 13,99 $ pro Tag ) . Selbst in der billigsten Absteige ist das mittlerweile kostenlos ........!

This was place is amazing ! The statues the architecture everything is beautiful walking in and even on the outside of this place. Caesars Palace known for parts in the movie "Hangover" walking in there was statues over looking the lobby and casino. The tables though in the casino are for mainly high rollers although there is places for non high rollers. The hotel even offers valet parking,limo pick up and drop off, bell hops, has about 2,000 rooms including suites for very high prices. Again in this hotel it's so big it would take you forever to walk through and see everything so I didn't get to explore the place. But what I did see it was AWESOME. The pool area wow it's like something out of a resort on a beach just everything from the lobby to the casino to the pool this place has it all casino,shopping,fine restaurants,pool everything at your finger tips.

Vegas BABY! You're so money and you don't even know it. 

Here we go... 

Checkin was kind of a drag...they only had 2 people working the front desk, hello! It took me about 30 minutes to check in and the line wasn't even that long, but the guy was very apologetic when I got to the front with a sour look on my face. The concierge was SO friendly as well the bell man who brought up our bags. The taxi cue was great, really funny guy. The little shop in the hotel is SO overpriced I wanted to smack someone...you mean to tell me this pack of smokes is $13??? Bottle of Diet Coke $6....Where's Ashton? It's Vegas. Prices to be expected...sort of. 

I've stayed at most of the hotels on the strip and I thought Caesars was just as it should be. We stayed in the Forum Tower (which I would TOTALLY recommend). Not sure if any of you have stayed in the tower...but that's where you SHOULD stay. The beds were soooo comfy...room was cozy, updated (fabulous bathtub!)...yada yada yada. Honestly though...you go to Vegas, not for the rooms...you go for the experience...casinos, shows, food, nightlife. I mean the room is important, but you just want someplace to sleep for 4 hours or so. This is great place to do it. 

Great restaurants...Mesa Grill (Bobby Flay), Beijing Noodle 9 (BEST KUNG PAO SHRIMP. EVER!!!), Guy Savoy...I mean really people. 

Nightclubs, Pure...I saw tons of stars...such a celeb hangout. The place gets so crowded though...I mean, to the point where my face was in some guys armpit, at least he was wearing deodorant. 

I like Caesars...its a big hotel, clean rooms, nice service, cool dealers and a Las Vegas Casino...I mean what else?  

It's VEGAS! ENJOY!

This hotel is one of my favorite hotels I've ever stayed in! The only reason I gave it four stars instead of five is because they don't let you plug in any video game counsels. The tv has a place where you can plug it in but the input buttons are gone on purpose! So I called the front desk and they said oh sorry, we don't allow anyone to plug anything in our tvs. I bet the only reason is that you can't do that is because they want you to go out to that casino and waste your money! But over All, this hotel is amazing!!

This is my third year staying at this hotel for business conference and I had endless headaches the past few years.This year prior to my arrival I had contacted a reservation specialist and set it up where she reserved my room and tower. I did this in hopes to prevent the same headaches from the years past. She made numerous notes and on the day do my arrival I called to verify my room and  was informed it was assigned, alI had to do was show up and there would be no issues. It was also documented I was arriving late as that too has been an issue in the past. I showed up and was told sorry no room available...oh and you only pd x amount so you get the palace tower. Umm no..the reservation special was for the run of the house, any tower, cost not an issue. I got in an argument with the lady at the front desk, Karla, to the point where I needed to speak to a manager. She called him and I noticed a few eye rolls which is not acceptable. Justin, the supervisor came up and again proceeded to point out I only pd x amount. Umm ok, so you need to mention that again when that's not the issue? Justin did set me up in a better tower which is nice and all, but the manner in having to get that was not acceptable. I'm upset with the attitude from him and Karla, and the fact that after numerous emails and effort on my end I was dismissed like garbage. So in order to get what I was supposed to in the beginning I had to create a scene? Nice....great  customer service there. I can honestly say if it wasn't for business, I would not be spending my personal money here. I emailed customer service last year and received nothing but a canned response. I was also in a scooter and no accommodation was made as no space was available. I did contact ADA and it was documented on their end. I did receive an email from management, but it was  a typical canned response of oh this shouldn't happen, I'll speak to Karla, hope you have a good stay, etc. In speaking with others at this  conference they too were not given the room reserved. One was given a smoking room when he specifically asked for non smoking. As he was a late arrival they gave it away. He asked about it and they said, rooms are not guaranteed. In other words unless you are persistent and cause a scene they don't care. They are out for the money, not the customer service.

Our suite + 2 regular rooms were so beautiful and amazing. Beautifully set up and in one of the room, we recieved a gift basket with asian teas. Yum.

The service was always quick and friendly, especially for room service. Well, the food took awhiel, but we did order around $200 worth of food one time haha.

I've done several review on Vegas...hotels, restaurants, etc...and I have to preface this one by saying that I prefer to try different things when I go to Vegas, unless I've been totally overwhelmed (Mon Ami Gabi!).

Ceasar's Palace...you were a great trip...but you did send me mixed messages at times.

What you need to keep in mind:
-ROOM TYPE, ROOM TYPE, ROOM TYPE.  Research what you are booking, go to YouTube and look at video reviews...this will greatly impact your stay experience.
-Agustus Tower: Big room, not a great bed, sunken tub with jets is amazing.  Double sinks are luxurious...but overall appointments are average considering you have to pay more.
-Casino is oddly shaped...I have never liked playing in Ceasar's because it's dark and super smokey (not near the outside doors - no air circulation)
-Food options are GREAT.  You can find great options here and I recommend any of them.  The Gordon Ramsay Pub is my favorite.

REDEEMING FACTOR:
Location, location, location! Center strip, easily accessible to so much all around!

I had a blast here! Lots of fun machines to play if you like slot play. They also had a nice variety of restaurants. The cocktail waitresses were attentive. I found it hard to get drinks at other casinos in the area but not here. I will return here for sure on my next trip out to Vegas!

I've stayed at Caesar's before but not in true baller status like this past weekend. 2,000 square feet of luxury! Get this...

-2 story suite
-Marble floors
-Jacuzzi bathtub
-2 huge rooms
-King size beds
-4 bathrooms
-Bidets
-5 TVs (including the ones in the bathrooms)
-Pool view
-Strip view
-Grand piano
-Spiral staircase
-Big living room
-Bucket necket sculptures
-Bar

This is just what our suite was like...but Caesar's Palace also provides one of the best shopping in LV. 

Ummm...is it wrong to say that I don't wanna stay in regular rooms anymore?? Cuz I don't. ;p

I've always liked Ceaser's they are 1 of the first strip hotels & casinos & they've always kept it up through the years.  i remember when i was a kid my dad used to take me to the omnimax..
