That was cool...also i can remember when tragedy struck here in 1982..i was still a kid & my dad took me to the professional lightweight boxing match with Ray "boom boom" Mancini & South Korean boxer Deuk-Koo Kim..in the final round Mancini knocked Kim out to never regain consciousness...Kim later died from his injuries at Desert Springs Hospital..very sad ordeal..

Went for my 21st birthday, got upgraded to a forum tower suite 23rd floor overlooking the pools. 2 bathrooms with an entrance to a double shower headed shower in each bathroom. Huge tub, tons of mirrors and closet space. Beautiful room, within walking distance of the best hotels. Had the time of my life.
Fantastic hotel, beautiful interior, huge place to play for adults. Very ornate interiors  so many restaurants to choose from. The supposed best seafood buffet in Vegas is located in there.

Do not stay here. The service is terrible and staff is rude. Our AC was broken the whole time and we asked 3 times to have it fixed with no results, which is real fun when it's 107 outside. Next our water went out and we couldn't bathe or flush the toilet, another fun situation.  When checking in they were suppose to call us and we finally went back at 5:30 and said they text us which is a lie we never received a text. Then we called down for bags and it took 1.5 hours to have them delivered. All of this is unacceptable when you're on your only vacation for the year. Caesars Palace needs to start caring more about customer service and hire some people that care.

hoo-rah for their new poker room! I love that their poker room is out in the open now, so that it attracts a lot more people into trying Texas Hold Em. You can also get complimentary FIJI waters too when you play poker here. You have to request it though, or else you will only get the hotel-bottle water. You can also rent-out a free phone iPhone charger for free ($20 deposit) and there's free Wi-Fi too. 

I have never stayed at Caesars Palace but I gamble and eat here often. Their gaming selection is endless and there are restaurants of every variety to satisfy everyone's cravings. My favorite places to eat here are Bacchanal Buffet, Phillips Seafood and Spago. If you are wagering at the Sportsbook, you will only get a free drink ticket with a $100 wager. 

The employees here are very friendly and I love that the casino dealers are especially personable too!

This review is based on our stay in the Augustus tower - 650 sq ft of high end luxury. Bath held double vanity, marble floor, separate shower and a flat screen LCD just in case u got bored while soaking in the huge jetted tub. 

Knocking off 1 star for the view. Reception didn't offer to upgrade. It was just ok, can't compare to Bellagios fountain view rooms, but the view of the strip was ok.

Private VIP side entrance with no traffic off Flamingo and separate check in reception for all guests staying in the Augustus tower. Thank goodness, cause valet service at the main entrance was full and the main front desk check in was a zoo! Our friends got in same time we did and waited over 4 hours for their room.  It pays to pay more, will likely stay here again next time we're in Vegas.

'll begin by saying we are frequent visitors to Vegas. We are Total Reward members and every time we've stayed at other properties we've looked at Caesars and thought it would be a nice place to stay. This trip we got it out of our system. This was a one time stay.

II'll begin with the check in process. As many others have noted, slow, slower, slowest. On a Sunday night too!!! There was no organization to the lines, just two long bending lines and there was no one from the hotel to expedite the process or to tell you where to stand. After about 45 minutes(fast compared to some other reviews), we finally reached the desk. The clerk, Monica was very pleasant, thanked us for our patience, apologized by saying they were short staffed, and proceeded to check us in. Short staffed seems to be the norm since every night during our visit the check in lines seemed to be the same length. 

We got to our room and it turned out to be a smoking room, even though we reserved a non smoking room. I called the front desk and I was told no non smoking rooms were available, they would send someone up to spray the room but then we would have to leave for 45 minutes. I explained the spray would only be temporary since we were on a smoking floor and the smoke from other rooms would eventually make its way back in. They said there was nothing they could do, they would arrange to move us the following day. After I requested a follow up from a supervisor, the front office supervisor called me back about 45 minuted later saying the same thing. She said she would make a note and we would be moved as soon as possible the next day. As soon as possible wound up with me making several calls the next day despite assurances I would be called when the room was ready. The room was ready at 4 PM and I was the one who called the get an update on the progress. The room was very nice so no complaints about it at all. However, the ice machine on the floor was broken with a hand lettered sign that appeared to be there from a few days prior. The machine still wasn't fixed when we checked out 4 days later. Small complaint, I know, but if the machine wasn't working in a kitchen, you can be assured it would have been repaired immediately. It seems like maintenance isn't a big priority.

Overall every time I dealt with customer service, they were very pleasant and said they would do their best, but the system itself seems to need an upgrade. The amount of time wasted and phone calls that had to be made shouldn't have happened. This was a one time stay at Caesars.

I was in town for a national healthcare related conference hosted at Caesar's Palace in Las Vegas. I had never been to Las Vegas before this, nor have I ever gambled. I flew in a day early and stayed at a Marriott in Henderson. I spent the next day hiking to the Hoover Dam and some nearby mountains.

I had a rental car. For a first-timer, the Strip is a little daunting. After some maneuvering, I found Caesar's Palace. I didn't know they had free valet service and wouldn't you know it, the free parking garage is a loooong walk from the check-in desk. 

When I checked in I made a grave mistake that only someone who has never been to Vegas makes. I didn't tip the registration person before I checked in. This guaranteed me the worst room available at that time. I hadn't done enough homework on the nuances of Vegas. I would be paying for my initial error many times over again during my stay.

I asked if there was a cart I could use to haul my week's worth of clothing and tradeshow materials to my room. I was curtly told that wasn't possible, but I could employ a staff member to do it for me. I declined. Even though it was going to be an ordeal to carry all of it through the floor of the casino, I could physically handle it. I was in the Roman Towers. It took three trips.

After I checked in the room, I took a shower. The room itself was a nice size. I had a view of an interior courtyard rooftop. There was no door on the bathroom. There was a handset phone next to the toilet, more antiquated than quaint.

A small TV screen was next to one of the sinks. The bath tub was large and in-charge. 

I went downstairs and signed up to get a player's club. I also signed in on FourSquare and was given a free buffet at Lagos as a special. 

I told them I had never gambled before and they took their time answering my questions. You can't buy chips with a credit card, but there are ATM machines all around that take plastic. You don't even need to know your pin number (you just pay a higher fee).
I had set my limit at $100. When I withdrew it, I got a hundred dollar bill (instead of 20s). Next to the ATM is a machine which will turn your $100 bills into smaller denominations. 

I found a helpful young lady at the small concession stand near the parking lot elevator who gave me a map of the facility.

I had dinner at the Noodle restaurant by the lobby elevator. The décor is a shocking white pattern with mirrors reflecting light into your eyeballs which still maybe adjusting from the dimness of the casino floor. They had massive fish tanks filled with thousands of goldfish.

The beer that says draft on the menu is not what we in America consider a draft. It was a weak beer in a bottle and draft was the brand. The noodle dish was okay, but average isn't what I want from Vegas dining, not at the price for my dinner.

All night I was roused through vigorous banging on the hotel wall at random times. Several thumps were hard enough to shake my bed. In the morning there was no cold water in the shower. Thankfully the bathtub had a hand-held shower extension and I could bathe there. That was the only morning that the shower's cold water didn't work.

I discovered my room shared a wall with the servant's elevator and work room. That is what had made the noises the night before (and every night at random times during my entire stay).

I ate each morning at Lagos and each time, it was excellent (except the last day). They have two lines. If you are a diamond or seven club member, there is no waiting. Otherwise, come at the wrong time, and the line looks like a crowd waiting for a Disney ride. I arrived early enough (8AM) each day that there was no line. Typically by the time I left, folks were accumulating, much more so on the weekend.

They had wonderful lox, capers and other delights. The waitstaff, almost to a fault, was exceedingly attentive. The only negative experience was when I asked to see if my friend had arrived before I did for our meal. I was told to look from the door but was discouraged from entering to see if he was indeed there.

On our last morning, the buffet had turned from being breakfast into being a 'brunch'. What that meant for us much greater cost and almost none of the good food we'd been enjoying all week. Lox were gone, and most of the regular breakfast items were either low or out. 

Another friend of mine who arrived separately was incredulous that we didn't know the tip rule. He had the same level of room reserved as we did (same conference) and tipped the front desk $50 on check-in. He was given a palatial, presidential suite. 

You can smoke in Vegas casinos. I don't mind second hand smoke, so it didn't bother me.

The TV doesn't get many channels other than Caesar\/Las Vegas promos\/Asian ones. The internet is woeful and expensive, but I didn't expect anything else. I brought my Sprint hotspot and was getting 4G almost everywhere.

The pool is nice, but randomly, private parties bar all but diamond\/7 stars.

First, let's start with the poker room, pretty much my first destination on arrival.

My first impression was, "chilly". I mean that literally, you need to wear pants and a light sweater to be comfortable in here.

I just play tournament poker, so I'll give my impressions of the two $65 + 5 add-on games I played in.  The add-on is only 500 chips on top of a stack of 2,000.  Blind levels every 30 minutes offer little time to play solid poker and forces more aggressive play very early.  Not my style, unfortunately.

The drink service is pretty quick, I'd have to say.  There's a food service available too, and one a.m. massages at the table.  Not bad, though I've always hated card players on T.V. getting massages during the World Series.

We enjoyed a show in the Coliseum and wowza, what a theatre, and Bette Midler, what a gal.  She's still got it.

My girls and I stayed here a few weeks ago for 2 nights, and the hotel room was beautiful, with a straight-shot view of the gorgeous pools.  Our room was pretty large, and it actually had TWO bathrooms (two toilets, two sets of double sinks, 2 bathtubs, even 2 showers).  The only thing was that the two showers were right next to each other, with glass doors so we could only utilize one at a time, and had to have a system of hanging out towels over the glass doors so that someone else can use the sink and get ready.  The only thing I didn't like about staying here was that it was really confusing to get around, and we got lost multiple times... and our rooms were so far from the forum shops that it was kind of inconvenient.

This review is for the conference center since I didn't say at the hotel or gamble.  Overall the place is nice and well maintained.  The rooms held people... so there was that.  The screens they had the projectors on were rather small though.

My husband and I love it! We've stayed at both Octavius and Augustus Suites. They are both excellent.  Extremely clean which was great, I like everything to be perfect. Great views from every room we've stayed in. Room service was always fast and they had some amazing steak!  Bottle service was also great. Plenty of times we even got treated like royalty,  they didn't allow us to get up from bed to get our food. They brought us drinks and food right to our beds. They make sure you enjoy your stay. We stayed once for an entire week and every day our room would get a deep clean even if everything was super clean. I'll also be leaving a review for the spa and gym. Let's just say it's well worth your money to get pampered to the fullest while enjoying a few mimosas.

great rooms and casino was clean the people working were little rude  seemed like never seen someone that was 25 have money even though i was staying in the penthouse ....seemed like couldnt get help because i was young till i told them what room i was in seemed like they would start kissing ass

Don't be mislead by its over-the-top shopping mall or the massive size of the property.

As magnificent as it may visually appear and sound glitzy, Vegas newbies looking for a luxury experience should learn that Caesars Palace is not really on par with the resorts it attempts to align itself with. It is steps down from Wynn, Encore, The Venetian, Bellagio and The Palazzo --- the "big 5" on the strip, which are collectively the only Five-Diamond rated casino-resorts on Las Vegas Blvd. Caesars may have had his own empire, but he just happened to not make the legitimate luxury-club cut in Sin City.

Caesars Palace is on fighting ground with Mandalay Bay at best. It's a second tier upscale resort.

The hotel and casino are getting rather dated and because the entire property itself heralds back to more than 50 years ago and has expanded every decade, you will see parts of the resort that look shiny and new, and other parts that look like you're strolling through a 1960's movie. It's rather bizarre and unsettling at times, especially when you're hammered.

The biggest problem I have with said expansions that occur in intermitting bursts is that it has created sprawling and confusing grounds that literally pass off as the ancient Roman Empire itself: a clusterf*ck of numerous hotel towers that appear to grow from patches of randomly placed restaurants, show buildings, gaming areas and stores without any real coherent planning. Good luck trying to make your way around this place, especially from the front desk to whatever hotel tower you're checked into. Those faux direction signs everywhere don't help.

But don't get me wrong. It's not a bad Resort. The property seems never-ending and thus has every sort of amenity...so you're guaranteed to have every need and want fulfilled here. From shopping to live entertainment; buffets to energetic nightlife, you'll find it here.

But unless you're willing to fork over the astronomical prices for one of its "newer" rooms for a real 5-Diamond luxury resort experience, take a look elsewhere.

Let's make this simple.

What I like:
- Great freakin' rooms.  I was recently upgraded to a suite on a high floor at the Augusts tower and the views were amazing.  Perfect view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains.  The beds were comfortable and the in room hot tub was kick ass.  
- Probably the best casino to stay at in Vegas if you're a hardcore shopper.  The Forum shopping area is huge and has a great variety of luxury and mid-level brands.  I often find myself buying the most stuff here (aside from the outlet mall) when I'm in town.
- Huge gambling floor.
- Baccannal Buffet is great.  Totally love the great selection of food ever since the big renovation a couple of years ago.
- The colosseum is a great venue for shows.

What I don't like:
- Huge gambling floor also means lots of gamblers - and that means it gets pretty smokey here after awhile.  That's saying a lot when I'm a smoker myself.
- Can get pretty expensive to stay here versus other casinos of comparable quality.
- Not exactly the cheapest place to gamble.
- Wish their famous restaurants didn't feel like it was all ripped off from NYC (Nobu, Mesa, Serendipity, Old Homestead .. etc)

Had great service! We needed a refrigerator because I'm a pumping mother and they gave us one to use at no charge. We had Maria helping us at checkin and she was extremely helpful and kind to work with

Good Strip location, lots of game space and variety.  Some newer buildings and hotels (although some are older and more rundown).  Not as fancy as the Venetian\/Pallazo, but not as Stuffy or as much as the Bellagio either.  Would go back if the price is right, but there are better choices if you want Ultra Luxury and willing to spend for it.

Depending on how you look at it, Ceasar's is either the bottom of the high end hotels on the strip, or the upper of the mid-tier ones. It's more comfortable than the cheaper hotels, but not as modern and streamlined as the newer ones. It has to be one of the biggest casinos on the strip as there are just tons of restaurants, bars, and lounges, all without ever having to leave. The restaurants are fairly good, particularly the celebrity chef ones which though pricey, have good food. The bars aren't the best places to get good craft beer though, so head out to the strip for that. The rooms are nice though starting to feel their age a bit except for the great bathrooms which seemed recently remodeled. Most importantly, they are quiet and comfortable.

Here for business. Every interaction I have had so far has been positive and friendly; from the phone reservation staff to the front staff. My room is beautiful. Large and well apportioned. Unfortunately, the walls are very thin, so I can hear one neighbor cough and the other flush the toilet. What also stands out is the lack of cigarette smoke smell! When you enter the hotel\/casino your olfactory senses are greeted with a perfume scent. If you stay on the outskirts of the casino, you can somewhat avoid the nicotine cloud. Once up on the floor, there's no cigarette smell. Huge plus- as I was just in Reno and couldn't escape the smoke, and I've been in other Vegas Hotels that don't do as well managing the smoke. Will update this review after my stay--interested to see how the thin walls affect sleep

Clubs, cocktails, casinos, crazy weekends ... if you love Vegas as much as I do there is no better place to stay than Caesars. 

Caesars is located in the heart of the strip, right next door to Bellagio, and a short walk from both the Venetian and the Cosmopolitan.  

The casino is huge, filled with blackjack and craps tables. Bring your friends, bring your chips, and enjoy the night with free cocktails. If you have never played craps before this is the place to learn. Be careful though, your first roll of the dice is intoxicating after one night you will be hooked. 

Caesars also has the best sports book in Vegas. If there is a game you want to watch, this is the place to come. You can bet on anything and the environment cant be beat. 

Caesars I love you more than you will ever know, I miss you dearly, keep a light on for me, I promise I'll be back to visit soon.

Caesar's hasn't learned a thing. I took a big chance and stayed at Caesar's in their Palace Tower. I hadn't stayed at Caesar's since a customer service debacle a decade ago. But I was comped a room so I decided to take chance.

Big mistake.

Customer service is as bad as ever. They have no check in lines! It's basically an all man for himself opportunity to find a makeshift "line" to meet with one of the three clerks at THE HEIGHT Of CHECK IN TIME AT 3 P.M. Further, I was comped the room so when I asked if the the "resort fees" were comped they checked and said that if I don't use the resort amenities (i.e. wifi, gym) I wouldn't be charged. 

First off, the room, although it's a large 700 sq ft size is no where near the quality and layout efficiency of a Venetian or Palazzo. The layout is so bad that you still feel you are in a 350 sq ft room. 

Second, the rooms still need updating. They aren't keeping up with the other premium hotels on the strip. Get some new carpets please!

Third, the pool was closed late afternoon to accommodate a company party. Since when do company parties take precedence over tons of hotel guests? 

Finally, at check out, I WAS charged the resort fee of $28 per night even after confirming I wouldn't be charged for not using wifi or the gym. Worse yet, I had to go to the customer service line again to resolve. I was told that unless I had the name of the customer service rep who told me about the non-charge they couldn't help me. I gave them a physical description and they said they would get back to me in an hour via text or phone call. Nothing at all. I called after 12 hours and a couple of weeks afterwards, no one responded. I ended up getting charged for the $28 per day resort fee. Now, most casinos do not charge for resort fees for comped rooms so this was very sneaky.

Bottom line is the customer service is still bad and deceitful. If you want to wait in long lines just to pay them money, be my guest and book the once proud Caesars Palace.

Palace tower hall smells like vomit. Every time I had to go to and from the room I had to hold my breath. They need to fix it. All the shops in the hall area were empty( I think due to the awful smell). Other than that the room was clean and we liked the restaurants.

Sie waren alle da Muhammad Ali, Sinatra, Diana Ross, Sammy Davis Jr.... Der Klassiker in Las Vegas und auch hier mischt sich Hotel, Casino und Shopping Mall.
Beeindruckend und erschreckend zugleich, man ist noch nicht ganz drin und schon mischt sich Hotel Lobby und Casino mit Spieltischen und Automaten.
Inzwischen sind wohl weitere Tower renoviert worden, wir waren Julius Tower in einem Tip Top Zimmer.
Die Poolgebühr von ~40$ kommt pro Zimmer und Tag hinzu. Irgendwie gibt es sogar in Las Vegas die Unsitte mit der Handtuch-Reservierung wie auf Malle. Nur einige Plätze bekommen den Schatten der Palmen ab. Also, rechtzeitig aufstehen:-))
Falls man einen Essengutschein im Paket buchen konnte, kann man diesen in den meisten Restaurants, die direkt zum Hotel gehören, einlösen. Leider ist alles sehr teuer und somit gibt es nicht viel fürs Geld.

This has got to be the worst big casino in vegas.  If you would like to experience CAESARS,  Take a $100 bill, light it on fire and watch it burn for about 2 minutes as it leaves a bad stench in the air.  Yep that about sums it up.  WARNING: this will be a long review. ..
I stayed here for 5 nights and 6 days for a convention that i had to work.  From that point of view, very poor service and they nickel and dime you all the way. Charged us extra for moving meeting rooms.  Moved us out of areas we thought we had in the middle of our days. The escalators to convention rooms are Filthy gross.  The bathroom sinks in convention area are so calcified that very few worked.  
As a hotel guest:   Rooms have bare minimum unless you want to pay.  They do everything they can to keep you gambling.  No free wifi. VERY limited TV stations.  Fridge is $20 a day unless for medical reasons.  Keurig coffee pot only that they do not provide any K-cups.  Broken light switches. Broken safe. Cracked moldy tile in shower.  Pool is over-packed, can't get a chair unless you want to pay $200 or come when they open.  Water is FREEZING cold and it was 105 outside.  Then the barrage of the sales women (Palace Tower) trying to give you free samples to lure you into their store is annoying and uncomfortable.  Its like being in Mexico. I had to pass that at least 4 times a day.  Oh and you can hear your neighbor taking a shower as if he was in YOUR bathroom! It is outrageously loud.  Luckily we both woke up at 5 Am every morning but I was on vacation, I would be ticked! 
As a customer. ... EVERYTHING is outrageously expensive.   I thought going to food court would save me money but any full meal ran you  $15-$20 for fast food!  $7 for a Venti Mocha at Starbucks.  Went to Homestead which is a upscale steakhouse and they wanted $28 for 3 slices of bacon! The forum casino bathrooms smell like sewer.   Nothing there was what id call reasonable in pricing. 
As a gambler... terrible gaming!  Never seen so many dollar and $5 slots.  You hardly see slot attendants because nobody wins enough for a hand-pay or has any money left to get change. I literally only saw 2 during my whole stay and i gambled every night.   Never heard anyone scream with excitement over a win which is very common in casinos.  Slot selection is severely lacking and even small wins are minimal.  It takes me 7 mins to smoke a cigarette and $20 on a .30 cent machine should last that long. Nope, it rarely ever did. I am an avid gambler and i have never experienced losses like this consistently from day to day.  Ie: I went to Fremont st and my $100 lasted me 8 hrs while here, it was about an hour.   Poker room had only one no limit game going.  Then the kicker... I played video poker at the bar and ordered a virgin daquiri and I was charged $4.80! I have NEVER been charged for a drink while sitting at the bar gambling.  I was appalled.  
I am afraid they have tried living on their name alone.  Their attention to service and detail is greatly lost.  Their greed is also evident. I will never return to Caesars by choice.  It was a terribly expensive experience!  Come to the Forum Shops but not to the Casino.  UCK!

The resort fee of $25 per DAY is total BS. Wifi and gym are not included in your hotel fee... Was disappointed about that... Why try and screw the hotel guests for money on these basic amenities? I think it's a bad approach. Also didn't know about the automatic sensors in the fridge and was charged $240 for moving some drinks out of the fridge to make space for some birthday cake. Got the money back but was rudely informed that the fridge wasn't for personal use. (Ummmm sorry but if Im gonna pay $200+ a night for your hotel room, I'll use your fridge for whatever the f@ck I want to) Overall, I think Caesars is desperate for money (they're in huge debt) and is taking the wrong approach on trying to screw guests for small things. I'd be more inclined to spend my money there if they weren't being so tight and obviously desperate. Will be staying somewhere else next time I go to Vegas.

This review is only for their poker room. I've never stayed in there rooms here. I like their deepstack poker tourneys and this time, they've improved their tourney structures and I think they have one of the better tournaments in Vegas.

Poker room is spacious, tourneys well run, clean well lit room. Didn't play cash this trip here as I was on a small bankroll this trip.

Still one my favorite casinos on the Strip. 

Great location, amazing food spots, and the shopping is plentiful. You really can't go wrong with Caesars, I mean Evil Knievel jumped the famous fountains here!

I'm a native, believe or not, and this is one of the first casinos I experienced as a child. I came here for the opening of the Forum Shop with my parents back in the last days of old Vegas. Not only did I get to see insanely high ceilings, crazy sculptures, and toga wearing cocktail waitresses, but Caesar himself chatted with me and the crowd about the history of the hotel and his throne. This was in the days before the Forum Shops Show changed to, "Atlantis". 

Beyond the food and shopping this place still has a fun atmosphere and is aesthetically pleasing to the eye. Just a heads up this location can be a bit on the pricey side.

First experience and worst first experience staying at Caesar's Palace.  Specifically there for Rod Stewart show.  Couldn't check in until 4 pm.  Although, we pre registered on line as well at the registration desk when we arrived @ 2:30pm.  Still we had to get in another line at 4pm for the key, 45 minute wait.  Then had to go outside to the valet service to collect our luggage we checked when we arrived.  Crazy system!  Made a reservation for dinner at Raos.  Then went to a bar for a drink before check in.  Another long wait for the room key gathered our luggage and went to the room.  That exercise took so long we were running late for the dinner reservation.  Hurried through dinner so we wouldn't be late for the Rod Stewart show.  Arrived there to learn the show had been cancelled 20 minutes before the show was to start.    So now we have a room charge, $250.00, dinner, $160.00, a photo taken, $10.00, and two drinks at the bar $36.00.   A total of $456.00, that does not include the tickets for the show.  Stood in another line to talk to a supervisor, 45 minutes, thinking Caesar's Palace would be classy enough to discount our room for our inconvenience.  No, they accepted no responsibility for the inconvenience.  Absolutely no class what so ever.  I would not recommend this bankrupt hotel to anyone.  Cancellations for entertainers is part of the fine print but classiest on the part of the hotel would have been a nice touch.  I DO NOT RECOMMEND this hotel.

All i have to say is the forum shops are the it place in Caesars its not the place to shop on a budget. But just to walk thru and sight see all of the beautiful things here and not to mention the cheesecake factory is bomb!! i would most definitely say stay here but go shopping off the strip at the blvd mall that sit blocks away from the strip on Maryland parkway if you are tryna stretch your bucks  here in vegas!

Pretty disappointed in this hotel! The room rate is not exactly cheap, and then there extra charges every which way you turn, and rude staff to top it off. 
My partner and I stayed here 4 nights. We wanted to use the mini bar to store some milk; so on the first night we called to have the mini bar emptied (it is packed right to the brim). The guy on the phone says no worries, he will organise someone to empty it. A few hours later we come back - the fridge is still full - by this stage it is later at night so we pull out a few bottles of soda to squeeze the milk in (soda doesn't go off right?). The next morning we call again, and are informed there is a $25 fee to empty the mini bar, or a $25 fee for an extra fridge. We think that is ridiculous, so they suggest using the ice bucket to keep the milk cold. We decide to do that, and put the soda bottles back into the fridge the same way they were removed - no big deal I guess.
Then, upon checking out we receive the invoice - a $25 minibar restocking fee, and over $50 on charges for items from the mini bar (we used nothing). The lady at the front desk informs us she will remove the item charges, but there is a "sensor"  that registered the items being removed , so we will still be charged the restocking fee. Because we removed the items in the first place. So, $25 just for taking the items out, and putting them back?
Further, a total of $122.44 in "resort fees" - which we knew about, but are a complete rip off considering its winter and the pool was actually closed (resort facility) and the fitness centre if you want to use it also costs and additional $25 per session (something I also thought was a resort facility). 
We won't be going back.

Spacious rooms that can fit at least a whole family in here.  The PALACE towers are spacious overlooking the pool.  We stayed at the 16th floor. No key access required.  Style is more classic.

Bed was a bit wobbly and the sheets not as nice.  

There is a stand shower and spa jet in the spacious bathroom.

After two nights in that horrible Palace Tower room, we went to the front desk and requested a room change. One of the managers said he could switch us to the Octavius Tower but we would have to wait another day before doing so. It was very annoying and a huge hassle having to switch rooms and frustrating that they couldn't switch us on the same day we requested, but we agreed to the switch nevertheless because our first room was so bad. They moved us to a non-smoking King room with a nice view of the Bellagio fountains. The Octavius Tower is really nice and pretty much the only tower worth staying at if you're at Caesars.

Nickel and dimes you to a ridiculous extent: there's a Kurtis coffee maker but you have to pay $14 for a "coffee kit" to make usually free in room coffee. They tried to charge me for a cup of water when I bought a sandwich at a restaurant. So tacky. No chargers by beds, low tech. Decor is fine but pretty low rent in this town. Wouldn't choose it again

So, I work a lot, and when I go on vacation (which is very rare) and spend my hard earned money.... the places where I spend my money should normally provide things that one expects when going on 'vacation'..... a normal vacation is a pleasurable experience, that's all.

Our room was nice and we did get a free upgrade, which was really cool.  But that tells me that they are hurting for business and had an excess of rooms on a weekend.  Now I know why they had plenty of rooms on a weekend.

I go to Vegas for the pool experiences, which at Caesar's is a total FAIL.  

They have two pools right next to each other which both play different music.  In one ear you get crappy country music and in the other you get 3AM deep house.  Being at the pool at Caesars, felt like being torn in half by dueling lions in the Roman Coliseum.  Instead of providing towels when you enter, a strait jacket would be more appropriate, since that is what you will need when you leave.

And the food ?  Two stale dry falafel wraps, two average tasting bloody Mary's and two tap waters... which took 45 mins to get.....  $78 .. So, basically while be tortured by nails on a chalk board, you get food that I wouldn't give to my dog .. and fork over $$$$ for it at the same time.

And best of all, they already know there is a problem.!   When I politely asked about the music issue to the waitress, she said..' ya, good thing you are not sitting over there, closer between the two speakers... I don't know how those people do it over there'... she then put her finger to her head like a gun and went 'POW'.

It's basically the classic example of how a corporate mentality has ruined Vegas and the right hand does not even know there is a left hand.  Different departments, directors, managers (located in Kansas, New York or whatever) all with TPS Reports and not one of them has come down to see or experience first-hand what they have created ...  let alone have the balls to do anything about it.  They don't have a clue that they are torturing their customers or spend the time to think through how to run a hotel and provide a pleasurable experience.

NEXT.

Aus dem Film Hangover ist das Caesars Palace mittlerweile weltbekannt und gilt als Insitution unter den Casinos\/Hotels in Las Vegas. Zum Positiven: Die Lage direkt am Strip ist kaum zu schlagen und von außen und im Eingangshallenbereich macht das Hotel einen richtig guten, pompösen Eindruck. Auch der Poolbereich ist super, auch wenn man für ein Bier hier 11 Dollar hinlegt.

Was mich sehr enttäuscht hat waren die Zimmer: die wirken sehr alt und fast schäbig, diverse Mängel wie keine Lüftung im Bad, Türschloss im Bad funktioniert nicht, keine Minibar, sehr teures Internet das man tageweise und pro Gerät dazubuchen muss sind nur ein paar der Dinge die ich richtig schlecht gefunden habe. 

Da es in Las Vegas so viele neue, billige und richtig gute Hotels gibt, fällt mir eigentlich kein Grund ein, im Caesars ein Zimmer zu buchen. Also lieber Geld fürs Zimmer sparen und dann hier im Casino verzocken :)

I took my wife here for her birthday. We got a really nice room in the Augustus Tower. The private check in was terrific because the valet was right there to take our car and upon entering the small lobby...no line for check in! The room was clean and fresh and very comfortable. We had a short walk to the pool area. The pool area was super crowded and it is difficult to find a place to even lay on the concrete. The girls bringing drinks were great at getting things to you quickly though. We also had a short walk to the buffet. If you haven't heard, the buffet there is super good. They have incredible selections of delicious food. We ate wayyyy too much, but it was sooooo good. The casino area can be fun to watch high rollers lay down big bets. Their are some famous chef restaurants to enjoy there. Bobby Flays place was great. The Seafood place was just fantastic...can't remember their name, but boy or boy can I remember that expensive bottle of wine I had there...it was delicious. We also tried Gordon Ramsey's Bar and Grill. Ehhh I got sick after that meal...to bad it seemed good when I ate it but ugh I was really sick afterwards. Come to think of it just forcing myself to watch that Prick Gordon Ramsey on TV has the same effect on me.

I've been meaning to write a review for years, but the service here is to die for! My husband and I were traveling from Washington state to Tennessee and stopped here in February. Everyone at the hotel was so friendly, and even the cleaning service was great. We left a large some of cash in our hotel room by accident and called two weeks later to see if anyone turned it in. We were so lucky to have an honest cleaning lady turn it in without taking a single dollar out of it. They sent it back to us after verifying that it was us. I will never be able to thank them enough for this. It's so great to see there are still honest businesses here. If we ever travel back to Las Vegas we will stay here again no questions asked!

We lived here because it's convenience to shop and casino in both Caesars and Bellagio. They are connected by a bridge. The place is a little bit old but clean and comfortable. The only thing I feel wired is that we check-in for two nights but it looks like the room card key only available for one night, we have to go to check in counter to continue our room key for the other night....

Yelp 100 Challenge * 30\/100

Joined some friends from Colorado and checked in for a personal staycation twice, once for each of the past 2 years - courtesy of Samantha. Both stays were comfortable and service was swift. During my first caesar's palace experience - with two other ladies - our room overlooked a beautiful view of the bellagio fountains. We were driven there by a service limo and driver was very nice and helpful. When we got to the hotel, bell service took our luggage and we ran up to our 2-queen bedroom. Toothbrushes, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, even cotton buds were ready in the bathroom drawers. Towels were plentiful. We would make use of the jacuzzi to soak our tired feet at night. 

Second time around, there were 4 of us. We checked in to a suite with a king size bed separate to the living room. Called for an extra bed and staff brought it up to us in less than 5 minutes. We were also welcomed with a table full of fruits & bottles of water. Plenty of space to lay things out. There is no free wi-fi. You would have to pay by the hour. So what we did was head down to the starbucks right by the elevator lobbies and lounged there to access the internet. 

Forum shops are not too far of a walk away. We strolled around the casinos and headed to serendipity - which is right out the main entrance - for breakfast the next mornings. Luxurious shops surrounded us but you have to realize that you don't have to spend a dime to enjoy yourselves. At times, Cleopatra and her guards hang out at the lobby and welcome pictures. Check out the Elton John and Celine Dion gift shops to view memorabillia and souvenirs. Luxury can be found in every corner. There are endless things to see here.

I had my wedding at CP in the Venus Garden. As part of the package, they gave us two free nights. So, we went on a Saturday and Sunday and the service was exceptional. The guy checking us in happened to be from the same city as us, and gave us free upgrade to a top floor suite. The room was absolutely stunning, the décor, the cleanliness, everything was absolute perfection. My husband and I were very impressed.

However, if you make a reservation at any CP restaurant, make sure you will attend. They charge a cancellation fee if you do not. We went to Mesa grill and it was very good. 

Overall, a very nice hotel, with very nice people. They let us check in early and treated us very well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
Five stars all the way through! I love this property! I'll mos def be back!!!!!!!! Love love Las Vegas!!!!!!

Este hotel no necesita nada de reseñas el solo habla por si !! Es un sueño donde no dejas de estar con la boca abierta ,las tiendas todas son de lujo estuve ahí un Black Friday pero creo q ellos no se enteraron ya que los precio eran los mismos de caros !! En el casino había demasiada seguridad cosa q no vi en otros hasta presencié un arresto de un hombre el porque desconozco pero nada bueno era,me fui a jugar  en una maquina y se me acercó  una de las de servicio de máquinas para perderme mi ID cosa q no entendí porque creo q ellos no son security ni tan siquiera la de los tragos a pedir ? Comimos en un restaurante llamado Homestad o algo así la carnet una delicia y el servicio fue lo mejor la chica de las bebidas fue tan linda y agradable no me se su nombre pero sin duda cuando valla de nuevo la buscare  para su servicio .

Cesar's Palace - how do I love thee? Let me count the ways!

1. General outlay: GORGEOUS classical Roman architecture which I gazed upon often from my room window, the pool, the conference center balcony...big sigh... Your décor is elegant, classy without being the least bit tacky. Cesar's palace you are one beautifully adorned lady and I could walk your Italian marbled hallways and never tire of gazing at you!

2. Room: Was upgraded to a two queen non smoking room from my requested single king bed room in the Octavius tower overlooking THE POOL. Perfection. I lounged in her Jacuzzi bathtub, luxuriated in her waterfall shower, slept in a very comfy bed with ENOUGH pillows (I am a pillow hog).

3. Service: My dear lady has hired so many helpful and always friendly staff from the quick no-bother check in, the nice people who clean, the lovely folks working at the pool...every face had a smile.

4.Things to do: Where to begin? Huge casino with many open chairs at slots. Tables were full in the evening but many free seats during the day. Many restaurants, some of the best in Las Vegas but PLAN TO PAY ALOT. We stuck with Michel Richard's Central located in the main lobby. They have the BEST cosmo's on earth. There were shows there but we didn't go to one. We enjoyed standing at the main entrance watching all the dressed up super rich pull up in their limousines though.

5. THE POOL: Come to this place JUST for this lovely lady's pool. Several roman style pools about 3.5 feet deep scattered amidst plentiful chairs and literally beds to lay on in luxury. Wait staff will come around but not quite often enough so there's a food outlet with a "cocktail window" What's not to LOVE about a cocktail window?? LOL I'll never be the same after my blackberry mojito - dee-lish-ous! Amazing tiled pool floors, water fountains. I find I simply don't have adequate words to tell you how much I loved the POOL.

Gambling: Not a big gambler but if you are on the squeamish side, I enjoyed playing the penny slots. It took me nearly 2 hours to lose 20 bucks there and I got 2 complimentary drinks. I also enjoyed the video poker (quarter single bet per draw) at the bar right in front of where the betting on sports games is going on. Sorry can't remember the name of it but you can't miss it. Had a wonderful Bailey's and coffee complimentary while playing - nice and STRONG. Highly recommend. 

Nice extras: Privacy button and a clean request button easily within reach from the bed. Hey, don't want to get up this morning? You can just roll over and flip a switch and no one will disturb you! You will WALK a lot. Now I'm a runner and struggle with getting enough exercise while traveling. Not at Cesar's! I put over 10,000 steps on my pedometer EVERY DAY. This is one huge place so if you have a hard time getting around, they have scooters for rent. Soaps and stuff in the bathroom are very high quality. I often do not use them. These I stuffed in my bag and took home :)

Minor issues to be aware of: You must pay for use of the spa\/workout facilities- daily, you must pay for wifi -daily. The long hallway between the Octavius tower and the Bacchanal buffet smells like ass. I mean really bad. I have no idea why. People smoke everywhere but here's the deal - you barely notice. Cesar's has some amazing ventilation and I barely got a whiff of smoke. The food everywhere is EXPENSIVE so don't plan on staying at Cesar's on the cheap. In fact nothing at Cesar's is cheap, come with cash but in my opinion she's worth every penny!

APPALLED!!! I AM BEYOND DISGUSTED WITH THE SERVICE AT THIS PLACE THAT ONCE HAD A REPUTATION. In only one day they managed to change my perception of the hotel. Walk into my room and the entire place was fumigated with a rotten stench. Immediately I start looking around and find LEFTOVER food in my mini fridge. On top of that the food was moldy, OK so I'm paying over 500 for two nights and I can't get my room properly cleaned? Mold! That's a health hazard! Mold does not form over night!!!!   I have to call 3 times before someone came to clean. Housekeeping comes and forgets the cleaning supplies on our room counter. My shower didn't drain. At all. People next door flush their toilet and we get water coming out of our sink. As if that wasn't enough I find blood stains on my pillow cases!!!! Blood stains? Really that is so gross. I have family in town from Costa Rica thinking it's an exceptional hotel and this is what they see. At this point I'm livid. I want to be compensated so I go speak to someone and their idea of compensation is to switch my room to another. I have 3 families in two different rooms with tons of luggage do you know what a hassle that is? No that's not a compensation that's an inconvenience. Manager David comes out to speak to me after 20 min of explaining WITH PHOTOS he agrees to speak to our third party so that they could refund us. I call Travelocity they need to speak to the manager. They call 3xs and the employees refuse to transfer the call to him claiming he was unavailable. I am forced to come down to the lobby I ask to speak to him once again and he tells me he never said he'd tell them anything. He screamed at me and my party in front of everyone at the lobby claiming he wasn't going to refund anything because he didn't want to. " we can argue for as long as you want I'm not going to help you." What type of customer service is that? A manager? Supposedly no one with a higher position there to speak with but he provides no type of help. Right off the bat he was rude and extremely unprofessional. I will never be staying here again. I spent three hours trying to communicate with these people on my mom's birthday and on vacation. I'd give Caesars palace a 0 in stars if I could.
Stayed here to watch Celine Dion.  The show was awesome but the hotel is a bit pricy for what you get. They nickel and dime you for everything. Don't waste your money on this place

Do not stay in the Roman tower!!! 

This is my first time in Vegas, my friend who I'm vacationing with has been a lot. He checked in last week Sunday in the Augustus tower, his room is really nice. Huge tub with jets, and a walk in shower. His bed is much nicer. I arrived Thursday night, and although we are paying the same I was put in the Roman tower. The only way they could put me in the same tower as him was to pay a huge fee. If I had know then how horrible this room was I would have considered paying the fee. The Roman tower is clearly very dated, and in bad shape. The bathroom in my room has a very small tub, that is incredible stained, and the closet is in the bathroom. Also upon check in my toilet was not working, and they were unable to fix it until the morning. The room is very bare bones, no coffee maker, fridge or anything. This would all be totally tolerable, but the thing that makes this room so horrible is the insanely loud music and Base, nonstop since about 11pm. Its now 2:30 am and has not stopped. I called the front desk to ask what options I had, and they told me to buy earplugs downstairs. When I asked if they had any I could come pick up, they told me no I had to buy them. It looks like I will be sleeping when Vegas does... never. Good thing I have itchy sheets and dated wallpaper to keep me company. Also the view from my friends room is stunning, it over looks the strip, my view is the roofs of a building all painted beige...


extra things, unless you book a resort package wi-fi is 14.99 a night, for 2.5 an even larger fee for 10. If you happen to have a coffee maker, its about 12 dollars to make coffee so bring keurig pods with you.

I went to Vegas for the first time about a year and a half ago. We visited many many casinos, but I am NOT a gambler. My sister and I enjoy the complimentary beverages as she gambles quite a bit lol. Was just a temp to the waitress of $1 per beverage she brought beverages about every 6 minutes... it was awesome!! We did not sleep and the hotel so I cannot comment, but I can tell you that the drinks were the best in Vegas!!

BE AWARE TOTAL REWARDS MEMBERS!!! 

THEY WILL NOT COMP YOU THE WAY OTHER HOTELS WILL COMP YOU. 

THEY WILL LIE TO YOU!!!! EVEN WITH A DIAMOND MEMBERSHIP!!!

They said room was free. NOPE!!!!
If you don't care about getting comped... this is the place for you. 
The view on the outside is spectacular, view on the inside is just as great!

Rooms are nice, gambling is OK. 

Won't be staying here in the near future. Plenty of other great stays on the strip.

Stayed here on a business trip.  I really enjoyed all the things you can do here.   But be prepared to spend. Don't buy drinks at the bars here, make sure you get them for free when you play the slot machines or you'll pay $15 for mixed drinks at the bar.  I was a little disappointed with directions to our room, but did enjoy the amenities in the hotel. There was hair on my bathroom wall when I got to check in so maybe question little bit about the housekeeping .  Otherwise if it was comped by my work I would return.

Expected better. stayed there first part of June, 2010. Booked two rooms.  The rooms, at least in the Centurion Towers and Emperors towers were very thread worn, smokey (claimed to have been non smoking rooms) noisy . Ceratinly not what I expected. Maybe in a motel. Never again. I think I'll try the Palazzo next.

This place is absolutely gorgeous. Everything  has a nice classy, business feel to it. Everyone is really dressed up. It's nice to see people wearing suits for a change. Especially black people. Of course, when black people wear a suit there has to be a "reason". Like a funeral, job interview, or a court appearance. I haven't been to the club here yet, but it looks interesting. The mall is sensational. I'm sold. I'm blown away. The only knock on this place is that everything is very expensive here.
Really not happy. . Came all the way to Vegas for Mariahs concert and without any notice she cancels

This place has become a dump. This used to be my favorite casino on the strip because of its stature, reputation, history, location, comps and pool! Not any longer! Our most recent stay here was an absolute joke of an experience. 

We arrived at 10pm on a Saturday night and valet was completely full. We then drove around to the rear self parking and carried our bags nearly a mile to the Hotel Lobby. Self check in was broken. We had selected a smoking room in the PetSuites section of the hotel. We were told that we had been upgraded to one of the nicest rooms in the hotel and that room would be equipped with dog bowls, beds, treats, etc. 

We arrived to our room and found that it was a non smoking room. We then noticed our room was looking directly into the roof and parking garage - definitely not one of the nice rooms in the resort. We then noticed that there were no dog beds, bowls, treats or anything dog related. We called the front desk and they said they would bring up immediately. We waited about 90 minutes until 12:30am to receive dog items that were included in PetStay rooms. 

The next morning I woke to the maids coming into the room un-announced. I went to make a coffee using the in-room coffee maker and found out there is a $16 charge to make your own coffee. 

The $34 daily resort fee does not include much - internet is 1mbps - coffee is $16 - service was terrible from front desk and concierge - room service was horrid and outrageously expensive. 

Why not stay at a nice place on the strip where the management will actually pretend to care about your experience and stay?

Within the first 5 minutes of getting at Caesar's I could already sense someting was not going to go right.  Waiting in line to check in, there were two people doing the room check in and they did not look happy.  That is when I sensed things were not going well for them.  After one of them finished helping the people in front of us, we stood there waiting and both clearly did not want to help us.  Finallly one guy gave in and called us up (we were not dressed trashy),  the whole time he helped us check in he did not smile.  He booked us into the Roman Tower and we had booked the Augustus Tower.  When we mentioned it, he told us they have more high rollers booked into those towers, so we felt "not worthy".  He handed us our keys and points to the left and really said "over to the left"  that's it,  we have been to Vegas many times for years and I would have to say I never been treated worse checking in at all the hotels on the strip.  The room is small, TV is from the 80's and the towels had stains on them like the people previously used them and hung them back up and the maids left them there for the next guests.  I will say the dealers at the tables were all nice and friendly. Sorry to say, probably last time I stay at Caesar's, there are plenty of other hotels on the strip that treat you better and have cleaner rooms and don't make you feel "not worthy" just because your not considered a "whale".

Well this is one of the oldest hotels in Vegas yet still one of the classiest looking.  Off course which tower you stay in, will always makes the stay different.  I love the Augustus tower as its one of the newer towers and very nicely designed and the views are incredible.   It doesn't hurt to have a new buffet, which in my mind is the best I Vegas, (I think better than Bellagio's).       They have always taken care of me as I'm a repeat customer so I will always be back.

This place is HUGE. The decor is over the top, but not super gaudy (is that possible). Stayed in a suite in the nicer, newer tower overlooking the pools. Awesome views, great access to the pools, which are as amazing as everyone says they are. My only complaint about the pools is my general complaint about Vegas: the mix of kids and naughty adults. We have children here! Please refrain from rubbing up against each other in the main pool. kthxbai.

The room was nice, modern decor similar to what you'll see in nice hotels in urban areas. Very large, but a bit warn (dents in the wall from the doorknob, a kid had scribbled pen on a chair, chipped corners on the furniture, etc.). Great bathroom, but needed upgrading. The shower floor was spongy and the jacuzzi tub didn't work. BUT, at 11:30pm we called the front desk and they sent up a repair man to check out the tub - how's that for service? It worked, but then only spouted scalding hot water. We gave up after that... didn't come all the way to Vegas to take a bath anyway. TV was kinda small.

Gambling is ok, good variety of things to do. Really like how it's connected to the forum shops. The shops are fun and not too ridiculously expensive to browse in. The moving statutes are entertaining. Selection of restaurants\/eateries is better than most hotels. 

Overall, a good time was had by all. Doesn't hurt that we didn't pay to stay, either.

I love staying at Cesars Palace. It's close to everything, has great restaurants, and the forum shops are right there. 

All of the employees (except for one room service lady) are super polite and friendly. Also, the rooms are nice and spacious. I'm a fan!

Hosted a group for a birthday celebration and working with the VIP service of Caesars could not have been easier.  In total, 20 attendees.  

Great accommodations.  Wonderful casino.  Overall a BIG success.  Thanks Caesars!

Stayed here for 4 nights total. Got a great deal for round trip flight, plus 4 nights at this place with an upgraded room (the palace tower), 5 free shows and a $20 food credit all for $535! So yes I was pleased!

Pros:
-great shopping at the forum shops
-cool free show inside the shops about the fall of Atlantis 
-great food selection (with starbucks)
-room was spacious and had a great view 
-the pools are nice

Cons:
-the mile long check in line no matter what time it is (like seriously get a chair because you're going to be standing for 30+ minutes just to check in\/out)
-the room had small chips and missing pieces that were unsightly 
-cleaning services could do a better job (ordered room service and asked them TWICE to clean up the food and after a whole day it was still in our room and it reeked)

I didn't even want to put ONE star! But couldn't post without hitting at least one.  Best to just STAY AWAY FROM CAESAR'S PALACE! I was told that my trip over New Years would be totally complimentary, and without so much as a warning that my debit card would be charged, I got home and over $900.00 was taken out of my bank account! I complained to the management saying that the MOMENT my stay became on a "charge" basis, rather than complimentary, they should have notified me. That at least would have given me the chance to go home and not be charged!  I heard back from management and they WILL NOT RETURN THIS MONEY!!!This was my first and LAST trip to Caesar's Palace!

I am a big fan of Caesars Palace! It's so royal and beautifully decorated. It has great restaurants and shops located inside this massive establishment. The casino itself features a lot of the same slot machines and tables seen in the other casinos. It is centrally located on the strip and easy to access.

LOVE this hotel... It's located right at the center of the strip... The hotel itself if HUGE, you don't even need to step outside... The Forum has amazing shops whether you actually purchase anything, of just window shop.... 

The whole place is beautiful and clean!

Anyways, we reserved a room in Octavius and went to check in at their VIP check in. They ended up upgrading our room for free to an Augustus suite! Score! Sadly, we only stayed one night... The room itself was clean and comfortable... 

Their pool area is relaxing. The fitness center is located in the spa.. As soon as u enter, they offer you water, headsets, and a towel.. There's also a nice bowl of fruit on the counter. Machines are all relatively new.. 

Only downside.. As with everything on the strip, things were a bit overpriced... $7 for a grande Starbucks drink :(. Next time were in Vegas, we don't want to stay anywhere else!

So I'm in the casino floor. And a lady can't serve me because I'm not in her area? Anywhere else they would let you go for not attending a customer\/ guest. Very disappointed in a casino where I waste a couple hundred bucks.

Stayed here for two nights last week. The hotel staff were very friendly.

We got the Luxury room in the Augustus tower.The room is pretty spacious, but most of the amenity in the room is kind of old, and outdated compare to other newer hotels like Aria and Cosmopolitan. The showerhead in the bathroom is old, it's cover and clogged by mineral so that it doesn't put out a nice spray. Took me much longer than usual to take a show.  I think for most guests, enjoying a good bathing experience is very important. The TV is small and lacked some modern features. The Wi-Fi speed is decent and but you get disconnected often. 

What? No free coffee in the room, they charge $12 for Keurig coffee. Good thing there's a Starbucks right by the elevator on the first floor, which is way better value than keurig.

This hotel is very nice, the exterior is very pretty.  Our room was nice, clean, and had a nice shower with dual heads.  The beds were only full and we would have preferred queen since we had to share beds.

Some disappointing things about the hotel, internet is not free 15\/day. The food and convenience store are expensive ( I know its vegas).  Also if you don't vallett, be prepared to carry your luggage all through the parking lot, then through the casino and back through to get to your room!  In 100 degree heat its not fun :(    But all in all nice hotel and the pool is relaxing even though we attended pool party's at other hotels during most of the day.

Let me start off by saying that this place hooks you up.  I received an email about concierge service prior to my arrival.  I made a request and was told that I would receive a call within 48 hours about the items I was inquiring on.  Well since I didn't get a call back, I called them.  When I told them what happened, they quickly apologized and deducted $200.00 from my stay and sent me a limo.  What service.  I will always make this hotel my go to hotel.

The detail that was put into this hotel is amazing.  The design the decorations were breathtaking.  The rooms were spacious (Palace Tower Suite).  I was totally taken back on the intricate detail of the columns, the pool area, and the statues on top of the roofs.  Beautiful details all around.  The huge mall inside was amazing. Anything you needed was in there.  The restaurants were great.  There was one that was open 24hrs.

If you must go to VEGAS, definately stay here!  Its an experience you will never forget.

Terrible billing experience.  After a wonderful stay and show with Shania Twain, the front desk changed the rate on my hotel stay at checkout.  The desk left me to wait 45+ minutes while they contacted their billing department to straighten it out.  They then said I owed 200 more for a two night stay.  I tried to give them the info from my confirmation regarding rate on my package and the manager was only interested in getting me to go away as I was agitated after waiting 45 + minutes to get them to sort everything out.  The manger (anthony Pyne) then went on to complain to me that sorting out my account would take up the rest of his day but he would give me a call before charging anything to my card as I refused to sign anything.  Lo and behold my card has been charged and no call from them.  Apalled at customer service manager attitude that my "billing dispute" would waste his time for the rest of the day, wouldn't even try to go through his math with me which was obviously wrong.  Needless to say I will be submitting my confirmations to cc company and I will win since their staff obviously can't add.
Awesome hotel excellent customer service and beautiful rooms... My only complaint is that the Octavious Tower (which we were upgraded to for free) was a quarter mile from everything!

I stayed in a hotel room with 6 people (shhh they didn't know).  We informed them that 4 people were staying, but at check out we only got charged for 2 people...which made the 3 night stay incredibly cheap for 6 people.  This pleased us quite a bit.  The room was very nice, bathroom was large and also nice.  We were able to get a cot and it was a little bit cramped, but not bad at all.  We had a good view of the strip and the beds were comfortable.  

We spent a lot of time in the hotel wandering around, the first day or two we continued to get lost but finally we were able to figure everything out!  All in all I had a great stay here and would definitely recommend to anyone.  The location is great, as it's right in the middle of the strip.

My review is regarding my stay in the Julius tower in a Parlor room. The room seemed to be newly renovated and had although the view was non-existent, the lamps made for nice lighting. There was a separate living area from the bedroom separated by a type of partition with a TV in each portion. The bathroom was spacious with his and hers sinks and a nice big walk in shower. I however had multiple issues during my stay. One was the multiple hairs I found on the pillows as soon as I got into the room from checking in. Suffice to say I was super grossed out about it so I called guest services and they sent someone up right away to change the sheets. I couldn't really say they were as apologetic or as surprised as I thought they should have been but it was fixed right away and I was happy. My 2nd issue was about the drilling during my 3rd day there started at 9 in the morning. I called guest services again and apparently they're renovating something else. Renovations are always great but guests should be forewarned. I normally wouldn't mind since it's Vegas after all and being in the hotel room during the day isn't my idea of a vacation; but of course it starts on the day I plan on being in the room to do some work. They told me the room would be ready no later than 2 and that they would call me once it was ready. I did not receive a call but instead had to call instead. By the time we got into our new room, it was 4 pm. We get a Petite suite in the Forum tower which is nothing like the Julius tower. It's older looking compared to what the other room had and the room is dark with dim lighting. There's no separation of rooms and only one TV. I called guest services again saying that I feel like I was downgraded for something that was an inconvenience to me but instead got the run around with no sympathy whatsoever. The rep said I could go back to the Julius tower if I liked but really, the tower with the drilling?!? I received no real apology and so I just gave up; after all it was one last night. Little things happen once in a while which is unavoidable but service recovery is the key; Caesar's Palace is subpar from my standpoint.

Place was super nice! I must say, in the casino area, it didnt smell so bad. Normally when you go around the casino areas you sell smoke but here you barely smelled any cigerrette smell. Nice place to take pictures. never ending structures. definitely love the forum shop! when your in vegas must go to the forum shop!

..is this place beeper friendly.."  It has turned into one of the best hotels on the strip.  The have some of the best restaurants from Baccannal Buffett, to Rao's to Mesa grill to Joe's Seafood and Crab Claws to Payard's to Serindipity to now Nobu's.  The service is wonderful and the hotel has amazing gambling.  The shopping at the Forum shops is wonderful and they have some of the best shows in town.  This is one of the greatest resorts in all of Las Vegas.  There are many mega resorts that popped up, but Caesar's really stepped up their game!

Its all about the Octavius Tower. The rooms are new, clean, and well designed. The bathrooms are the best. Large tub, separate shower, his and her sinks and separate toilet room. The beds are comfortable and the robes perfect for day napping. 

Pool - well, poolS. They have 7, but with that said they really have the two main larger pools. One was cold, one was warm. Amazing mojito drinks (32oz.) run about $24. AHH! So needed on these hot summer days though. Pool s crowded in the summer, go early if you want a group of lounge chairs together. Better yet, get a cabana if you can afford it. 

Food - I think Caesars has a great variety. Some of my favorite Vegas restaurants are here. Bobby Flay's Mesa is amazing, and the new Gordan Ramsey Pub & Grill is very good as well. They have one Starbucks in the hotel and anytime after 9am you will probably wait 30 mins in line. Usually its worth it, compared to the off brand coffee shop they have.

The Forum Shops - Walk right on over to the shops without ever going outside. YAY! They have some designer stores (think GUCCI, LV), then they also have an H&M and Ann Taylor. The Forum also has more restaurant choices like Spago and The Palms Steakhouse. They have a little of everything. Perfect if you don't want to be at the pool or gambling during the day. 

Gambling - lots of tables and they seem to have the limits not insanely high, even on the weekends. The dealers we had were generally nice and helpful if you had questions.

Overall, I love staying at Caesars because they have a little bit of everything for everyone, and the rooms are comfortable and nice!

I stayed here with a large group for a week, renting over a dozen rooms and a conference room.  Even with that level of investment, I repeatedly found extremely poor customer service.  I don't think this was a matter of people being rude, but rather not having the motivation to excel in the service arena due to Caesar's bulk business model.  In other words, they don't have to cater to you because they have a thousand other folks in line behind you.  This is truly a shame since I've stayed at larger hotels in Vegas that clearly take pride in the customer's experience.

As for the facilities, my room was spacious and clean, though there were some facilities issues.  My toilet ran, the hot water in the shower required a plumber and 2 hours to fix, my sinks made odd noises at random, and the walls were thin enough that I could tell you the age and ethnic composition of all of my neighbors that week.  The view from my room in the Palace Tower consisted primarily of air conditioning units and the conference room was a meat locker despite repeated requests to adjust the temperature.

The pool was nice, but got almost no sunlight as towers have subsequently been built up on all sides.  This means the pool is in near constant shadow.  The gym was nice, though very very heavily tilted towards treadmills (like 20 of them), so if you're a runner this is the place for you.

The lobby bar had a nice selection of high end whiskeys on the menu, but ran out of two of them during my visit.  For me, the dining highlight was definitely Mesa Grill.  Another plus is the easy access to the Forum Shops, which are quite nice.

In short, (I can't believe anyone has actually read this far down), this is middle of the road Vegas for khaki wearing folks from the heartland.  If you're looking for a high end, sexy Vegas experience, you should look elsewhere (like the Aria, Cromwell, Cosmopolitan, Wynn, etc).

Not a happy camper...was very excited to come back here..paid extra to check in earlier..staff is not very friendly and when you complain give you face..after waiting additional 15 minutes in line got to the room with construction view..was upset even though I said I was not mind waiting..had to complain then was told have to wait for manager to call me back?what?? I was already upset mind you..they told me they will give me a better room but I had to go back in line to exchange and get a new key for a better view..I got a good view still waiting on my bags from bell service..just missed my breakfast buffet hours due to that meaning now I have to pay for lunch more ???Thanks Caesar I won't be staying here any time soon very unpleasant experience..in order to get a decent service you have to complain??

the room was clean, roomy, and beautiful! i was truly impressed with the bathroom & hallway vanity as well. the customer service was great and room service\/hospitality were quick. i especially loved how you can stay in this hotel all day and not miss out on a thing because it has EVERYTHING. i sure did not want to venture out of it and into the 100+ degree heat, although i did. it's definitely a plus to stay in a nice, clean, fabulous hotel that is in the center of everything so you can walk to your destination when cab lines are ridiculously long.

the complimentary spa tickets were also quite nice!

would definitely stay here again!

(one piece of advice: please fix the shower door problem, the little airway underneath the door causes water to get EVERYWHERE!)

Do Not stay at Caesars Palace when the Cinemacon event is going on.   We stayed there during the event and our room was shaby, and the service staff  was really slow.   The room they gave us,  the bathroom sink was plugged up, the faucet was dripping which was a minor problem, and the toilet handle was broken. I complaint to the manager at 10am and the problem wasn't fix until 5pm, plus there were no available rooms to change nor upgrade.  Avoid staying at Caesars Palace during the Cinemacon event, go stay other beautiful hotels near by.

Caesar's Palace is really magnificent. I know the hotel has been around forever, but you can't tell by how well maintained the whole resort is. And it is huge. And I mean HUGE. Having walked thru most hotels on the strip, I feel Caesar's has to be top three for sheer size. 

The check in process actually went pretty smooth. We only waited in line for less than ten minutes before being helped. We were assisted by Zandia and she was great. She made easy small talk, and was super nice in fixing our error. Our group thought we booked three rooms, but apparently we had only booked two, and in different towers at that. She was able to get us a third and put us in the same tower, and on the same floor....right next to each other and with a view of the awesome pool area. That is true customer service. 

The hotel, being so big, can be a little confusing, but there are signs above everywhere to make sure you know where you are going. We stayed in the Palace tower, which is one of the premium luxury towers. We were here EDC weekend  and room prices for this tower were going for about $500-600 a night. The rooms are spacious, well decorated, stocked, have great big bathrooms with jacuzzi tub and separate shower and toilet, as well as a makeup vanity desk (for us girls who need our own space). The shower pressure was great, and in my opinion a bad shower experience can ruin a hotel. My one regret was not being able to visit the pool as we were hereon business and couldn't spare the time. 

We ended up eating at several of the restaurants in the hotel(Mr Chow, Cafe Americano, Paynards-see separate reviews), and all were good quality. The only staff member we found to not lend to our good experience was a bartender at the circle bar closest to the Palace tower. He was noticeably impatient with everyone. Also visited was Qua Baths and Spa. See separate review, but a wonderful experience. 

There was one incident our last night with one of the rooms. It started to develop a sewage smell coming from the bathroom. It wasn't too bad at first, so our friend called the desk to report it. They were supposed to send someone up to "spray". That person never came. By morning the smell was so bad the door to the bathroom had to be shut and our friend come to our room to shower. We were three doors apart but thankfully didn't experience the smell. We went to the front desk the next day and they compensated us for the incident. 

Bottomline, I would highly recommend Caesar's. The overall experience is one you would expect for Las Vegas. Bring your money though, because you do pay for the experience.

Always a great time in Vegas and as usual staying at Caesars was a wonderful experience from the bell hops to the people that check you in everyone is friendly and very accommodating! Our view was perfect, and the price was reasonable! And everything was conveniently inside the hotel...there was the mall a food court, shops, and of course casino! Great place to stay whenever you go to Vegas!

Booked a room online at Caeser's for my hub & I while he had a business trip in Vegas.  The kiosk check in was a complete cluster & after spending several minutes there we had to wait in line to ultimately check in.  Got to our room in the Palace tower.  I immediately noticed that my nose started running from the fact that the room didn't seem like it had occupants in a while as it appeared quite dusty.  Walked into the bathroom & it was pretty and newly renovated but I couldn't get past the overwhelming smell of sewage coming from the toilet stall.  Okay, I'm thinking it will dissipate with the door open but it never did.   While taking a shower I was looking at the floor to find a drain because it was filling like a bathtub.   I recently had surgery and need things to be super clean to avoid any chance of infection.   While showering it filled up so much that I couldn't rinse fully.   As I stepped out of the shower I had to be extra careful because the floor is quite slick.  Disgusting!   My legs are itching as I type this because I'm sure it's the soapy residue and backed up water that dried on them.  I complained to the front desk and they offered a new room in the Octavius tower.  After walking all the way to the Palace tower to retrieve our items and then walking all the way to the Octavius tower I am beat!!!  Come to find out the darn reading lights don't work for either bed!  They have an outdated iPhone clock radio, a phone that didn't work properly unless its on speaker and I'm completely annoyed and don't have the strength to move yet to another room!   The prior shower that didn't drain had room for my toiletries.  This shower is older and comfortably holds a bar of soap.  I then realized while hastily repacking my belongings that I forgot my personal pillow in the other room.   I called guest services and was informed that if I wanted it, I'd have to walk all the way back to the room!   After I said no, that's not going to work for me, I was disconnected    The gal called my room back and said if they find my pillow, they will have it delivered.  It was just in the other room.  How bout they accommodate the guest and go get it.  Stayed at numerous nice hotels in Vegas all were clean & nice.   This has got to be one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in.

As soon as I got there I met one of the worst employees in the valet service he was rude ignorant and didn't care then the doorman every time we went out trying to sell his stupid limo I don't recommend going to Caesars
Wort experience for my honey moon very disappointed ... Plus they wanted to charge me another night because they said I had to call after dropping off the keys to check out...

I had a very negative experience in the lobby of this casino.  Walking through with my partner a security guard was standing near the fountain. As we came closer, he stepped next to me and said, "Please go--nevermind" and shook his head. The next step I took left me sliding across the floor and I landed on my butt. If my partner hadn't been holding onto me, I would have probably continued falling backwards and struck my head. Alarmed, my partner asked the security guard what had caused me to fall. The man yelled at him, "It's vomit, that why I told you to go around!"
