Both my partner and I were people watching, so we are to blame for this incident but I was very disappointed with how the guard responded. First of all, he told me to "nevermind" shaking his head and using a rude tone, not "go around." Secondly, he did not ask if I was injured or offer to help in any way. My partner had to pick me up off the floor and we cleaned my shoes off in the fountain outside. Finally, there were not wet floor signs or cones of any kind alerting us of danger, just the guard standing to the side, not in front of, the vomit. 

The sheer lack of concern and disrespect requires negative stars, unfortunately,  I have to award them one.

My friends and I shared a room together during Evo 2012 and we stayed at the Roman Towers floor 14. The room was pretty nice, BUT on the day we checked out our friend was removing luggage from the top of the TV Cabinet (pretty tall at least 6 ft) and a DUSTY, OLD, USED CONDOM FELL TO THE GROUND. Idk about you guys, but I was pretty pissed that our room ended up not being cleaned from top to bottom especially with it being Caeser's Palace. 

My boyfriend called the front desk and explained the situation and they said they'd send up a manager. We got a call about 10min later from front desk saying they'd comp a phone call that was made for $62 (boyfriend had called me "long distance" because it was a call from NV to a CA cellphone - was about 5 minutes long). Obviously that wasn't the point and they ended up sending up the manager. So the manager and another random lady showed up, we explained the story and he pretty much confirmed what had happened. To be honest, I don't think anybody believed us because we all LOOK like we're teenagers but I was the youngest in the room and I am 23, so they probably thought we made everything up.

ANYWAYS, 10 min passed and we got another phone call from some random person who was obviously given the task to call us and he said they'd comp us $50 for the room. Our other roommate then chimed in explaining how what had happened was a completely violation to cleaning standards, but nothing else happened. On the way down I reminded them that they said they would comp the WHOLE phone call and not just $50, so when we went to the Check-Out desk we explained to the lady our story and she was happy to do it (of course she was, so we wouldn't cause a commotion most likely). We all remained professional during the entire thing and kept telling them it wasn't about the money, it was just disgusting and they acted like it wasn't a big deal.

Anyways, probably never staying here again. Completely grossed out and disappointed with the lack of customer service with this place. Caesar's Palace is going to SH*T.

Our stay at Caesars Palace was great. We stayed in the Palace Tower and I thought the room was very luxurious and everything you could want in a hotel room. The bathroom was huge and gorgeous. The bed was unbelievably comfortable. I wish I could have a bed like that at home. 
The Palace tower was definitely conveniently located compared to other towers. Others in our party stayed in the Octavius tower and it was equally as nice but they had a very long walk to their room. 
The location of Caesars on the strip is also great. It's right in the middle of everything!

Casears palace seems a bit overrated.ive been staying at this hotel everytime i have a family trip out here and some of the rooms are nice and some are completely horrible. The only thing that i would make me rate this place as one star is because customer service i.e valet annnnd bell boys are fucking rude. They do NOT greet customers with a smile nor do they treat you with good hospitality. Valet denied us even though we were diamond members and bell boys talked down to my dad when he was checking our bags in.bell boy even had the nerve to question why we tipped him what we did.excuse me? He doesnt even derserve a tip for how he treated us! He should be thankful we even tipped him! THANKS CAESARS FOR A HORRIBLE WELCOME AND GOODBYE!

This was a great hotel to stay at.

Having been to Vegas a few times, with a budget and without - I have experienced 3 stars and 5 stars.    This would have been a hands down 5 star experience - except for what happened at the very end...

My story begins on a cool summer day.  Strolling in with luggage in tow, a beautiful statue of three bare women engulf the main lobby.   Camera flashes, chimes and screams echo through the open air from the casino floor just yards away.   

The wait was over quickly, and I approached the desk as a woman graciously checked me in.   I was happy to know that my room was located on the 32 floor of the new Augusta tower - where the showers are bigger, the Jacuzzi tub fit 2 if not 3 comfortably and the rooms were fit for a king to be. 

Blah, blah, blah.... You know how vegas goes. Let's get to the good stuff. 

So I order roomservice, and holy crap was this stuff expensive!! At no time did i spend less than $50 for a meal - i mean $10 for Orange Juice????  Okay - whatever....  I'm at a 5 star resort - so 5 star prices.

The real kicker came at check out.   I wanted my point on my card, so I wait in line.    I wait in the Platinum line.  and I wait....  and I wait..... as I see the non-platinum LINES moving quickly.    At no time did a customer service rep. look up at and me and pull me from the PREFERRED "I SPEND A SHIT TON OF MONEY HERE- GIVE ME GOOD SERIVE" line.....

And so I leave my special line and go to the line next to me.... and it moves quickly - but just as I am about to go up the girl takes her break!!! 
 
SERIOUSLY!!

Well, as I was waiting in the non preferred line - a rep goes back to the platinum line and is playing on the computer.  I rush over to her and say, "Ma'am I just need to check out".

she replies "Sir this is for the platinum guests only, please remain in your line"
I say - "ma'am I am platinum, and was here before that man"
--- "Sir, he was in line and you cut across, please go wait behind him" 

I turn around and say to the man "Was I here before you".... ... "Yes he was" the man tells her. 

45 seconds later I was checked out. 

That whole process took me 27 minutes!!!   

No 5 stars for you Cesars!  No 5 stars....

Very beautiful resort filled with roman statues, fountains, columns, etc. The architecture is beautiful and I was very impressed with the curving escalators. There's lots to do in here and there is a little bit for everyone (shopping, restaurants,   etc) to enjoy.

we took a vacation and stayed here, it has really gottan real bad from past years we stayed there. the worse thing is the ventilation it's really stale and warm, the whole place smells like a brothel.
House service however was still good.

They charged for parking ,when we made reservations for a complimentary room and they said which is recorded that your offer says free room stay two days and no parking at valet charged, my husband been platinum card holder , we love Harrahs properties Paris never did this . Ivy are concierge was so pleasant and helpful. She  was wonderful band they did take off 20$ of valet because I ran to get my bag of clothes that I left , check in and ivy personal concierge.. we appreciate what you try to help though maria at front desk . Regards...
Great hotel, but huge and takes a bit of a while to get around. If going to the restaurants it's best to be dropped off in the shops area.

First time at ceasars palace and It was a long walk going back to our room from the front of the hotel. We did have two showers but they were joint together with see through glass doors which made it hard for both bathrooms to be used at the same time. It was also an inconveinance for us to park on the other side of the hotel property  because not just the front valet was full but the back valet was full too and we were not able to get a bell boy to help us with our bags to our car. Overall, I rather spend my stay else where.
Don't stay here.  Bad security.  Car got broken into in the parking garage.  They were no help whatsoever!

Purchased a 24hr buffet pass and though Caesars is on the list of buffets to visit they charge a $30 fee on top of it because they have seafood. Paris which is also on the 24hr buffet list has seafood too but no upcharge. Caesars is that desperate for money?

I don't think I was as impressed as I was supposed to be, though my time here was enjoyable. If I were coming to Vegas for shows, this would be my first choice. I didn't find anything about the casinos to be that exceptional. As I was walking along the shopping venue, I kept thinking more about how it reminded me of the Mexico ride at EPCOT more than feeling the need to shop here. And for a place that is supposed to be so high end, the rest rooms in this area of the casino were pretty small and appeared to be neglected a bit too often in terms of maintenance. But Caesar's is worth a visit, if only to say you've been there.

My friends came from overseas and I booked 3 rooms to stay there with them. When we checked in around 4pm on a Sunday afternoon, the guy at the front desk asked us to wait and went to the back office for couple of minutes, He then came out and welcomed us with a big yawn. After he got all the info, he swiped my credit cards 3 times, one per room. I was told all was set. The following day, I got a message from front desk that they need my same credit card again to complete the procedures.  
The fridges in all 3 rooms were locked until I complained and the same guy unlocked for me. Obviously, he did not do it when we checked in on the first day. This front desk guy I interfaced with never wear any smile or apologized for his low quality service.
I got the electronic bill after I checked out. I found there was two bottles of water which I did not consume but charged to my room. I called the front desk and disputed the charges. That was a different guy answered my phone but he handed me up twice until I requested to speak to the manager.
From the service quality stand point, this hotel only deserve one star but because it has a nice swimming pool, I gave a two star.
I stayed in many other hotels on the Stripe before, the service provided from this hotel I have to say is the worst from my experience.

Sam

Super annoyed that they don't provide in room slippers for guests. A housekeeper let me know I could request them by calling house keeping and they will send a runner up to deliver them but when I called the lady said you can't have slippers unless you're staying in a villa and they don't have extras. I asked how there are not extras since they are disposable and she continued to let me know she didn't have any. I then ask to speak to a manager and I spoke to a Daniel who before listening to anything I say, picks up the phone only to repeat what the girl before him said and kept telling me he couldn't do anything. I then go down to the gift shop to look for slippers to purchase but the lady there told me they don't sell any. This is crazy... everyone knows how dirty hotel floors are this is such a basic item that all basic hotels carry. Note to all: if you care about dirty feet bring your own slippers!

* update, I called the spa to see if they had any for purchase.. they said yes then when I walked over they said they didn't have any...

I've been here many times and I keep coming back. The casinos layout is good, lots great restaurants and there aren't too many low cost tables to play blackjack. 

Haven't tried playing at the poker room here. Maybe one day.

Stayed here recently because we got married in Caesars Palace. We stayed in a "deluxe room" in the Augustus Tower. We originally werent placed there but our taxi driver said to ask for that tower cause it over looks the Bellagio water show. Well we got the tower... but on the wrong side. Instead of seeing the water show, we got to see the roof of the building under us. Oh well.

The room was HUGE. I wish I had taken pictures. The bathroom was HUGE!!! The bathtub had jets in them and there was a tv on the opposite side of the tub! Watching tv while taking a shower was an amazing experience haha.

The bed was so comfortable and the pillows were amazing. I wish I knew what type they were so I could buy some! Our room was right next to the hallway where people get off the elevator (why do we always get placed near the elevator) but it was quiet. 

Overall, I would definitely stay here again!!

Stayed at the hotel with my husband for a Christmas week. Nice clean hotel. Very pretty pool area. We stayed at the Palace Tower with a pretty cool view at the pool area. Big bathroom with 2 sinks, huge mirror, jacuzzi , big glass shower and toilet in the separate room. Big room with king bad, bar, sitting area with sofa and chairs. Hallway with big closet, and special area for girls to get ready (loved it!). Totally worth the money.

What I didnt like was:
-too many families with kids (kids and Vegas doesnt go together)
-hard to find smth to eat at 4am within the hotel  (come on, its Vegas!!!)

Stayed at the Ceasar's for the weekend. Rates were discounted because we're part of the players club but look to spend at least $200 a night. Plenty of amenities, restaurants, state of the art gym, and a mall. Rooms in the Palace Tower were ample. Bathrooms were huge and included a spa. Although there are plenty of amenities, and the Ceasar's is a top tier hotel, I don't see the value when there are other hotels with similar amenities for less.

Very nice hotel.
Well taken care of and very good service.
We really enjoy staying here each and every time....

Summary:  Terribly weak shower. Water temp problem.  Hot shower NOT available at nite after 9pm.  Stained dirty carpet.  80s CRT TV.  Truly An old, filthy, outrageously overpriced, poorly-maintained hotel in a glamorous disguise.  If you want 2 star-worth motel quality room at a 4 star hotel price, be my guest, Caesar will deliver it. 
 
My husband was attending a wk-long conference at the Caesar palace. They offered a standard room to us at a special rate which made it an apparent choice for the stay. 

We didn't have much expectation as we knew it is going to be a standard room after all. But as an acclaimed 4 star hotel in Vegas, we expect their most basic room quality to be, if not above standard, at least decent.  

The hotel looks great and glamorous from the strip but that's all.  All hell breaks loose once you check in.  At first they checked us into a room on the 5th flr in the Roman tower right next to service elevators which was so noisy that we demanded a room change right a way. This time they switched us to another room on a higher floor on the 14th in the same tower.  To our pleasant surprise, they are thoughtful enough to provide  not 1 but 2 shower caps, vanity kit (2 cotton balls, few Q tips, a rubber band), sewing kit.  It has a stand up shower with 2 weak shower heads, mini TV in the washroom, light shutout blinds, a safe, hairdryer, but no tub, no jazzcui, no bathrobe, no slipper - o well, no big deal; but the lack of a fridge, coffee\/ tea, coffee marker, 80s CRT TV just is not acceptable by today's standard.  Even a std Hilton rm has them. Slow In-rm wifi is $14.99 per day.  But here comes the WORST part - we tried to take a shower at 11pm. And guess what, the water came out of shower at the max hottest setting was COLD.  It was so cold that it generated no steam at all.  No way we could shower. We let it ran for 5min at the max but still no change.  While we were half dripping wet, it took us 4 calls to the front desk, every 10mins before a rather handyman-looking "engineer" showed up at our room.  He looked at the shower and was not all surprised, and said the most ridicious thing i have ever heard, "sometimes the water temperature does drop thru out the night. It takes time to pump hot water to this (14th) floor.  Just wait and let it run for 5-10mins until the temperature is ok for shower.".  What?! Are you kidding?!!!  This is NOT a Motel 8!!!!!  We just couldn't believe our ears!  At the end we had to let it run at max setting for as long as 10mins before the water got warm enough to shower (yes, still NOT hot!).  Obviously this boiler \/ water temp issue is a known problem to them. Possibly this is some lowlife hotel management's idea to keep the boiler off as much as possible or they are just too cheap get a new \/ additional boilers, at just to save money.  We called to complain but receive no compensation.  The hotel management should have offered us another room, or even a free upgrade, instead of having this problem dragged on for 1 whole hour and produce some very unhappy customer.  Crappy, non-existent service.  Period.  This is just plainly ridiculous for a 4 star hotel.

Others had mentioned how filthy the carpet.  I watched them seviced my room. For some reasons their maids are trained to vacuum the carpet ONLY at the spot beside the bed but no where else.  Why they were trained not to vacuum the entire room is beyond me. May be another brilliant penny-pinching measure from another management folk.

Dining in any restaurants in Ceasar are criminally over-priced just like anywhere else in vegas but not necessary good quality, unless you live on food court food.  The Cheese Cake factory in the Forum shop is actually a gem.  Price is reasonable for a sitdown restaurant.  Speed is efficient.  Food quality ax the board is consistent and is above and beyond other restaurants in the franchise.  We like their salmon lunch special (miso, simply grilled) so much that we went there almost for every day we stayed here.

Summary: Shame on you Caesar Palace.  Our money will be better spent else where should we be in Vegas again.

They had a mix up with our reservation and the first gentleman at the front desk basically told us to step aside and call the third party we booked with. Not at all the kind of service you would expect from a world class resort. We ended up talking to another gentleman (named Tommen) who happily and expeditiously took care of the mix up. He even upgraded our room to a higher floor with a view. The rooms were ok, but a bit dated for a 4+ star resort. Definitely not worth the price we paid for the room.

We were visiting a trade show here in Vegas and stayed in Caesars Palace for one night. We enjoyed the hotel and its amenities. The good thing is that we didn't gamble so we didn't lose. How about that?

We valet parked our car at Caesars to see Rod Stewart in concert.  The valet stole my Giants baseball cap that I happened to toss into the backseat.  I figured the hat was black and the car seats were black - you could barely see it.  But nope!  GONE!  You'd think they would hire a higher class of personnel.  Glad it was only the hat I left in the car.  Jerks.

About the room my boyfriend and I had:

Can I first start off by saying that checking in was probably the most torturous thing... I live in Las Vegas, but I've never had the pleasure of staying at one of the hotels here. Somehow we managed to choose a line with the shortest amount of people but waited longer than those standing lines double ours! And the guy who checked us in put us in the wrong room (and a smile wouldn't have hurt either). Luckily we had a friend who works there looking out for us, we got a call and they promptly brought us our new room keys.

Now aside from the waiting and the little mishap... The room was BREATHTAKING. Absolutely better than anything I could have never imagined! We got a suite in the Forum Towers on the 66th floor and the room was divided into a living area and the bedroom. 

The living area had a dining table big enough for 5-6, two huge windows that covered almost the whole wall with an amazing view of the strip, a large L-shaped couch, a lounging couch, a little coffee table, a TV, and a mini fridge stocked full of everything to quench your thirst (if you don't mind paying the extra money for it...). There was also a little stationary area, a coffee maker and built in controls for the curtains. You may be thinking, "wouldn't it be easier to just pull the curtains shut and open?" Well yes, but doing it with a push of a button is even better! And there's even a little half bath!

The room... Oh the room is to die for! There's another huge window in the room with the same great view! A large king sized bed fit for well... a king! It had six super sized pillows and two little throw pillows and all white covers and sheets. Two little couches and another TV. This may sound like it's super cramped in there but it's not! There's more and enough walking space between everything. There's a... (wait for it) lovely walk-in closet that I wanted to steal! The room is very regal looking, yet still has a comfy feel to it.

And the bathroom. Oh how utterly amazing the bathroom was... I was looking forward to having a nice relaxing bath before dinner and the wrong room we were in didn't have one so I was super bummed needless to say but this bathroom... oh this bathroom had a wonderfully amazing jacuzzi tub big enough for two! And the shower had 4 different nozzles (and no, that's NOT overkill). One slanted down, one over-top and two on the side; each with it's own knob and a separate temperature knob. The mirror has a build in TV with a touchscreen remote built right into the wall. Of course, there were complementary soaps and lotions and whatnot. There's beautiful marble and travertine tile (or at least their lookalikes) all over the place which gives it a warm and rich feel to it. Not to mention soft and comfy bathrobes in case you don't feel like putting on your clothes after your nice relaxing bath (like me!).

Mirrors...  there are mirrors everywhere lol... A top ceiling to floor one in the living area, another in the bedroom and a checkerboard wood framed one behind the bed (for... you know... checking yourself out in the morning...). Everything was nice and clean and everything was perfectly in place. The carpet was very clean, normally I like to bring flip flops when I stay in hotels but I forgot mine this time but my feet didn't get dirty at all so that was a major plus for me!

I got a huge break on the price of the room because of my boyfriend's friend, but it was still kinda pricey... However, it was worth every last dollar! And I mean it! We loved the room so much we didn't want to leave, and honestly, I would model my future house based on this room. But checking out was super easy, done right from the TV, which was good because we were running a little late. I highly recommend the Caesar's Palace and if you can, spending a little bit more for one of the suites. Trust me, you won't be disappointed!

We came here to shop and watch the fountain show in the middle of the shopping center. Caesars palace is beautiful inside but the fountain show was a little dark for my liking. The huge aquarium next to the fountain was nice to look at the kids really enjoyed looking at all of the fish.

This is probably one of the most grandest hotels of all. If your into the Roman like style where everything is elegantly carved and you want to take pictures of every little thing that is there. Then stop on by! but make sure to have a buddy system! The place is HUGE! It's possible to get lost in this crazy maze! What's there to do? Well there's slots, there's food, there's bars, there's plays, there's parties! Oh and wear comfortable shoes! there's going to be lots of walking!

Just recently I stayed at Caesars Palace for the weekend and was NOT impressed at all. We checked in late in the afternoon and they could not find our reservation that was booked 4 weeks prior to the trip. When they finally got us into a room, it was DIRTY and still had food, drinks, notes, change, and little things around the room like someone else was staying there. (Who knows if they had even changed the sheets). They relocated us to another room that had wet carpets and the shower was broken. I have stayed at numerous other hotels in Vegas and had much better experiences then this one. I would never stay there again and it NOT worth the price, especially when you can stay at one of the newer hotels for A LOT cheaper. 

The pool is nice and relax, but very expensive for drinks and I've had better drinks and Hard Rock and Mandala Bay.

Very nice hotel but so large a person has difficulty finding their way. I wandered looking for the self park entrance despite following the signs that ended abruptly and picked up later. Overall too much wasted time going from the room to any point in the hotel. The rooms, restaurants, and stores are clean and beautiful. Overall too pricy. I bought a margarita and Bloody Mary at the pool and paid $37. I was in disbelief when I was told the cost. A beautiful pool area where finding a chair is challenging. We found two and were then asked if we wanted to pay $60 per chair to rent for the day. Lol  No! So we went to the Venus (Euro) Club only to learn men (staying at hotel price) had to pay $20....women are free. Seriously?! My wife and I considered it just to get a chair, until she went in to check it out only to learn there were no chairs. Seemed like a gathering for horny guys looking for a peep show. I'm not sure we would stay here again given our walk through of other hotels.

First, want to start by saying that Caesars is an ideal location for staying on the strip. It is close walking distance to many of the main attractions on the strip, especially with the addition of the Linq and the new promenade of shops, restaurants and bars. The service was above average, yet very slow when we checked in (took 45 minutes to get through the line and 3 minutes to check in - we were timing it out of sheer curiosity as to why it takes so long).  
The room - bed was too soft for me, my back hurt the first morning there. TV was so old it took 1-2 minutes just to turn on. However, the room itself was a good size, love the couches and the shower. 
The pool was good. Go early to get a seat without having to search. Cafe - fish tacos are small and not good...about the size of a fish stick. Veggie panini and chicken tenders were good and better options for the price you pay. 
Oh!  And there is an earl of sandwich in Caesars!  I never knew...what a great find.

It's Caesars and it is 2009 now, no Frank isn't going to come around the corner, well at least the real one, LOL. It is a great location to stay so you can't go wrong there. 
The European pool is small and if you're with someone worth being watched look up above at the convention level windows! 
CP is a pretty wild place. Have stayed there a number of times over the years, best room actually had a view of The Fountains at Bellagio! Rooms are OK, will be interesting to see what the new space brings. The casino is OK, pretty good visuals (people watching), WATCH OUT FOR THE RASCALS!!!!!! 
The fun part is the entire complex and seeing how lost you can get. The shopping area is a hoot, what a collection of retailers. Say hi to Steve Garvey at the Collectors store, ask him how CINDY is doing!

i love this buffet! although there is a "normal" 2 hour wait just to sign into there kiosk TO STAND IN LINE!! so that adds a 30-40 min wait while in line. so 2.5-3 hours to eat?  nahhhhh its worth trying once but that wait is tooo long :) still 5 stars tho cause its that good :)

We stayed here this past weekend and it was our first time staying at Caesar's 
1. I used my Rewards account and got a significant discount on the room 
2. upon check in the staff informed us that our room sold out for the weekend, so they upgraded us for free... no questions asked no hassle 
3. Everyone was very polite, they were helpful and I felt so welcomed 
4. the rooms were clean and beautiful
5. the new buffet was amazing... (which i review on separately) 
6. NO RESORT FEE... like every other hotel in Vegas... really?

I would definitely stay here again! Friendly staff, decent prices and a beautiful hotel

Staying here for my 21st birthday celebration and it really is quite extravagant. The staff seem friendly (especially the most enthusiastic housekeeper ever), and there is a lot to do, including the Atlantis show and rows of stores in the design of an Italian town during sunset. I love the architecture and the sheer massive scale of the visuals (love Roman stuff really), including the enormous columns and statues. It makes you feel like you're in a Roman shopping and entertainment center, only it's Las Vegas obviously. Definitely one of the best casinos on the Strip.
My room was in the old tower...my bad didn't t know that one sucks. Thin walls and a tube tv? Wasn't in room much thank goodness

Came here on a Saturday night on my way to Omnia.

Casino floor allows smoking, so at times it can be a it overwhelming. 
Inside are relatively clean given high traffic of the hotel
It has a great spot relative to the strip. Bellagio and Vdara are a 10-15 minute walk, and you can walk through each hotel to avoid the heat!

Caesars has an older vibe than the hotels I typically stay at. The major positives to me were that it is central to the strip, and it now hosts the popular Omnia nightclub. There are various towers throughout the hotel. The older rooms are larger but I recommend staying in one of the remodeled rooms. The Julius tower was remodeled this January and I still felt that it was pretty basic. Beware that when you're drunk it is extremely hard to find the elevators to your specific tower! I probably walked around in circles for 30 minutes after leaving Omnia trying to figure out where I needed to go haha. 

As far as things to do in the hotel, there are tons of nice restaurants including the popular Bacchanal Buffet. Because we were just there to party, we took advantage of the food court with Earl of Sandwich, DiFara Pizza, and Smashburger, among others. I was left with a very middle of the road impression of this hotel. Its nothing special but gets the job done, especially if you plan to party at Omnia.

They have staff dress up in ancient Roman garb so you can have a glorious time of getting your cheesy tourist photos taken to your hearts content.  The casino itself wasn't one of the nicest on the strip but it will do the trick.  The location is very central to everything else on the strip and they also have the awesome Forum mall that can give a lot of added value if you need to do lots of shopping.

Horrible!!! I feel like I'm staying at a motel 6!!!! We have mold in our bathroom the bathroom outlets don't work!!! There's a horrible smell in the hall way!! NEVER stay here if it's in the Roman tower!!!! Called to complain cause we got a package thing and from the pics online it made it look like it was nice completely wrong!!!! Nasty, dirty, old and ghetto!! They said if we are so unhappy to pay $50 extra a night to upgrade ummm fuck you how about not lying with online with the pics you post!!!

Just returned from a mother\/daughter trip to Las Vegas and my daughter and I stayed 3 nights at the beautiful and classy Caesars.  Check-in was a bit slow.  We were instructed to used the self-check-in kiosk, but still ended up having to get in line to get our keys and it didn't seem like they had enough staff to service the number of people checking in.  Our service rep was very nice though and ended up giving us a complimentary upgrade to the newest tower, Octavius, since we were there to celebrate my daughter turning 21.  It's a bit of a trek to that tower, but worth it.  The room was spacious (2 queen beds), with a sitting area with a sofa, chair & coffee table and a nice large bathroom with a jacuzzi tub, separate shower & double sinks.  Our room had floor to ceiling windows and we had a great view (to the left) of the strip and the Bellagio fountains.  We could watch the fountain show right from our room!  Downsides to the room were no refrigerator (except for the mini bar but we were told from the get-go that if you remove anything, even if you replace it, you'll be charged for it. There was no extra space to store our own water bottles, food, etc) and a Keurig coffeemaker that did not have complimentary k-cups.  The mini bar had them....for $14!!  Makes you feel a little nickel and dimed when you don't even get complimentary coffee.  Upon leaving, I received an email welcoming me to use online check-out, but when I viewed my receipt I found that I had been overcharged for my room.  Luckily I had my email confirmation showing the rate that I had been given and they adjusted it without a hassle.  

All in all though, I give Caesars 4 stars because of the quality & cleanliness of the rooms.  We've stayed here a few times and have never been disappoointed.  Our friends stayed across the way at The Flamingo and had to deal with numerous issues...an overflowing toilet, a light that didn't work, uncomfortable beds, etc.  My daughter and I felt pretty spoiled after hearing about their nightmare of a room!

I was super excited to stay at Caesar's Palace for my 40th birthday.  We booked our room 6 months in advance and had very high expectations.  We stayed at the Palace Tower Room 2618, where the toilet was a constant problem.  It overflowed a few times, leaving the carpets soaked.  I slipped when I went from the carpet to the tile, with my wet feet.  The staff came and fixed the toilet\/cleaned the water, but we were never offered another room.  By the sceond day we could not flush the toilet anymore, and it was close to check out time.  The area by our pool lobby smelled like vomit, as did a few of the elevators.  There was a hole in the wall near the door by our room.  This was unacceptable.  There were few cocktail waitresses in the casino.  The place is very large.  Our friends stayed in the Octavius Tower, which was very far and inconvenient.  The sports book could be so much better.  There were two large screen tvs that were very outdated and the tv screens were blurry.  Overall, I expected excellence at this hotel, but what I got was fairness.  I would not stay there again.

So excited to stay a Caesars Palace for our wedding! So disappointed in our stay. We booked our room over 3 weeks prior to our stay. We booked a room in the Palace Tower that was supposed to have couches and overlooking the pools just as our previous stay. We asked for early check in. When we arrived about 1 pm we were told no rooms were ready yet. They took our cell number and would call. At nearly 5 pmwe went back to check on our room. They assigned us a room. When we got into it the room was NOT the large room as requested when booking. At that time we had a dinner engagement.  Went to from desk next morning at 7 am and politely asked about it. The lady at the front desk was so rude. We told her it was our wedding stay and we just wanted theroom we paid for. She told my husband..oh just go buy her a purse! She did not care at all. 

At the bar across from the front desk the blond male bartender was worse than rude to our party of 8. He insisted they were out of Makers Mark and Jack Daniels. There were plenty of both on the shelf above the bar at the other end.

The concierge was rude when we asked about ordering extra flowers. 
Caesars took what should have been a very special stay and turned the time there into a non memorable experience.  Money was no object but they have lost out because next time we will go across the street and try the Palazzo!

Let's call it the Bait and Switch hotel

We stayed here for three nights over New Years, last week. Stayed in the Palace Tower, I did that with the (mis) understanding that it was close to the Qua spa, (turns out they had moved it to the Augustus Tower). Got it through hotels.com so may have been their error. 

The room was very spacious, nice bathroom with jacuzzi tub, bed was very comfortable and it was quiet. The day after New Years there was a faint odor of cigarette smoke (coming from another room?), in our nonsmoking room and the smell of vomit in the elevator we had to use. 

Fortunately they had taken care of it by the afternoon. 

The housekeeping was less than stellar. I turned up the sofa cushion and it was full of crumbs, yuck. You just don't want to see evidence of others in your room before you! 

The shops are wonderful, every high end designer under the sun has a shop there in the Forum shopping area. The spa was awesome (will review that separately). The location was great too. 

I won't go again on New Years, just too crazy and crowded.

WARNING!!! ATTENTION FOR INTERNATIONAL TRAVELERS!!! SUCH A DISAPPOINTMENT!!!! CHOSE DIFFERENT HOTEL!!!
If someone has extension of the passport, please stay at any other hotel but this. My entire family was treated by staff very rude. I was told that US laws are not applicable in this hotel. And even if you have valid extended passport with valid US visa you are not allowed to play or be near gambling area. It was such a disappointment after paying thousands of dollars for the flight and hotel ( where at the check in they accepted same passport with no problem). 
When we tried to resolve this Security employee treated us the way that no one deserves to be treated. Throwing our document... I have never had this kind of attitude in my life anywhere in The world.
If there is a way to submit negative review- this is for this hotel.

Of all the casinos in Las Vegas this is by far the best.  This is the main place and it's been here fore ever.   Has great restaurants, awesome night club, food shopping and the casino area is legit.  

In the summer it's a lot of fun too for the pool

The rooms here are huge!  I'd say they have to be close to 650 to 850 square feet!

The rooms are nicely appointed with marble tiles, a jetted bath and walk in shower and a private enclosed toilet.  The bathrooms even have a flat screen tv in them.

Our room 3263 had the view of its ugly white roof but you could also see the strip as well.  Bring binder clips to clip the black out drapes together so no light gets in.

Overall great place to stay for the sheer fact that Caesars is so centrally located to shopping, dining and entertainment.  You really don't need to go outside a mile radius.  The pool is great, the buffet is the best on the strip, there's poker and high limit area, forum shops and friendly staff.

Definitely would recommend staying here again.

Sue me - I kind of loved it. It's just so over the top in that Italianite - gilt - fake columns kind of way. Over the top ostentation at its finest. The grand entrance, the cloudy muralled ceilings. They have a great Gap store in Caesars to top it all off. It's just HILARIOUS and Vegas is best when it's hilarious! Also, some of the best food is here, incl. Max Brenner's "the Bald Guy" from NYC.

I have so many memories with this hotel. From business to leisure, I am never disappointed by Caesar. They have one of the best buffets is Vegas and their architecture is incredibly breathtaking. I've stayed at literally 90% of all the hotels on the strip and this is by far the best one next to Bellagio. 

I've stayed here few times during my business trips, and they have huge conference centers available for business and last time Expedia rented out their club, it was such a memorable experience.

Clubs, food, swimming pools, poker, ambience is all there.  ( Poker rooms may be classier found at other hotels nearby but I would still continue to play at Caesar while my stay)

Having a blast and expanding my knowledge and expertise at the 2017 Zillow Premier Agent forum. The Convention Center is mediocre but nothing bad about it. Was more impressed by convention center at previous forums in another strip hotel.  All in all would still recommend for convention needs.
I love walking around this well maintained and updated classic casino but the gambling is not as good as off strip & downtown.  The shops are great for looky lous or rich people,

I think my sister and I have shown our parents another side of Vegas to make them want to come back for a second time within a year :)

My PG trip with my parents was still amazing!  We booked a package deal where we got Celine Dion tickets which also included our hotel stay at the Caesar's Palace.  There was a minor difference in price between the two hotel rooms that we booked, but they upgraded us to the Octavius rooms (which are newer) from the Augustus Towers.  

Some reasons why our Caesar's Palace stay was awesome:

(1) Octavius tower rooms are luxurious!  Although the Octavius towers are smaller than the Augustus Towers, there is more of a sense of luxury and peacefulness once you enter the Octavius tower rooms.  

(2) Huge variety of slot machines here! Which means hours of fun for me :)

(3) Not only that, but Caesar's palace has so many restaurants to choose from, which makes it very convenient for my very particular parents.  

(4) The location of Caesar's Palace places you right in the middle of the strip and easy to get to where you need to go.

(5) Caesar's palace houses the Celine Dion concert.  One of THE best concerts I have ever seen and one of the best shows in Vegas.  Her voice is amazing and she is still breathtakingly glamorous.

(6) Caesar's Palace Forum Shops are right downstairs.  Tired of gambling?  Or, have you won big?  There are tons of stores here for you to shop at your heart's content.

(7) Most importantly!  The Bacchanal Buffet at Caesars is AMAZING!!! It is my new favorite buffet in Vegas!  Stay tuned for my buffet review! :)

Only reason why this place is not getting 5 stars is because the lines when you check in to the rooms are EXTREMELY, PAINFULLY slow.  I wish they had a better\/more efficient way to get their guests in and forward them on to where they need to go.  Places such as Aria make check-in\/out seamless and Caesar's needs to catch up!

OVERALL:
I'd come back again and stay at Caesar's.  Great rooms, great entertainment, and great buffet. What's not to love? :)

Very over-priced.  Conference was here, so I booked it. Would not stay here on my own.  NO FREE COFFEE in the room: $14 for a four-pack for the Kuerig!  I was surprised that they did not charge for the hot water in the shower.  $32 resort fee in addition to the room rate.  $8 for a bottle of water.  Hotel under renovation, so noisy in the room at times.  Took almost an hour to check in even though I used the Kiosk to speed things up.  It is amazing that a hotel with this many rooms has only three or four agents at the front desk.  Check-out was worse.  In-room check out did not work. Maybe it is that I do not like Las Vegas.

I was in Vegas for a work function, and the entire company stayed at Cesar's palace.
I'm only giving it three stars because everything was a- ok, really.  I say this because I was put in a room at the Palace Towers and another room at the Roman Towers, and let me tell ya... YIKES! All those rooms are horrible! The rooms smell funny, and everything looked old! I was expecting something a bit more nicer especially for the price we are paying to stay and dine there.  Finally, the hotel workers were nice enough to put me in the Augustus tower, which is by far the newest and best tower in the entire hotel. The rooms in Augustus was actually decent compared to the other two towers.  One thing I would suggest is... as soon as you arrive in your hotel room, call the front desk and have them change your sheets.  This is not just for cesars' palace, but for most hotels- especially in VEGAS. My sheets were dirty, but they were nice enough to accommodate me.  Actually, the entire Cesar's palace stuff was very accommodating through my entire stay.  I'm guessing they had to be accommodating because there were over 2500 folks from the same organization I was with staying at this hotel.  Knowing that, the staff was probably trained to be more hospitable with us. 

I can't speak for the shops or spa services.  The gambling tables\/casino was pretty standard, and the room service was decent.  The lady who's in charge of the kitchen during room service at night (I think her name is Linda) was very helpful.  The food came out quickly, and the food was also decent.  Just don't expect it to be top notch just because you're paying $15-20 for one item.  

 Not bad, just an ok experience.  I would return, but I hope they're as accommodating the 2nd time ....

This is about the room. I was in the Palace Tower last week. It was fine. It could have been in Peoria. There was a bed, a desk, a chair, a servi-bar, a couch, a bathroom. Nothing spectacular. No cable on the TV. I was told by others who were staying there that the hotel doesn't want you to stay in your room; they want you to gamble. 

The bed had pillows, blankets. The bathroom had shower, bathtub, toilet and sinks. Absolutely nothing special.

The room was good - clean and comfortable and we had premium view of Ballagio fountains.  However, the WINDOWS WERE DIRTY - seems they haven't been cleaned in long time. 3 foot bird poop on window.  No coffee in room. We ordered $37 champagne and they charged us $57. Watch your bill.

ok after I wrote my last review they offered us 2 free nights . it was like the one we had long ago so it was pretty good. but was getting pretty old.but we had to fly out there again round trip.we stayed the 2 days there and stayed the rest of the time at rio.
Caesars is SOOOO much fun! Can't say anything about the hotel but the casino, shows and shops are always a great time!

I would never stay here again and, being a travel agent, I would NEVER send someone here.

I was here as part of a conference (about 80 people in about 40 rooms) and was able to see several rooms. My room had no mirror in the bedroom and a terrible view. Some of my friends had no closet--just a bar in the bathroom. Others had windows into the bathrooms, or walls so thin they could clearly hear the conversation their neighbors were having. People universally complained about the uncomfortable beds.

When checking in, the president of the company was advised that we could all check in at the special "diamond" line. But when some people tried, the desk clerk sneered and told them to get back in the regular line. If you aren't there to gamble, service is pretty poor.

The hotel was enormous and very poorly signposted. It was easy to get lost and turned around.

The conference room was freezing and the food was *atrocious.* Food that we paid for ourselves cost an insane amount--$24 for breakfast at the Augustus Cafe, for example.

You had to pay for everything--the business center, to work out...everything. LAME.

I really did not like it here. It was claustrophobic, service was rude, food was either disgusting or expensive, and the rooms were terrible. I thought my distaste was because I'm not really a Vegas person, but I spent some time at the Paris which I loved (and which was less expensive). The only thing I liked was the Forum...I'm a sucker for fake sky.

I've stayed several times here at Caesars and have mixed feelings about this place. Obviously good feelings prevail because I keep coming back! The downside is that this hotel and casino is so large. I mean you really have to keep your time if you have to meet up with someone or have reservations anywhere. I do enjoy the gaming as an upside, the upgraded rooms I seem to get at check in, and the fact that everything is under one roof with a bonus shopping area attached. I think that's why I'm a sucker for this place.

2 visits back, I was coming in from the Grand Canyon and the room we had was not ready. We were sent to a room that had empty food takeaway boxes and empty juice bottles. Once we called down to the desk, they were quick to send us to a better and much larger room. I can't complain on how they handled the situation. I love the spa here Qua. The products offered in the rooms are no other from my favorite spa ;) this is home away from home.

If it were possible to give this resort zero stars I would. Our entire stay has been a NIGHTMARE. We came up with our two kids to go to the iheart music festival. Which was great btw. We booked what was supposed to be a 1400sqft suite. There is NO WAY our room is 1400 sqft. It's nice, with a couple couches and a table. But there's no fridge, no microwave (you can get both for $30 a day for each one) no pullout bed, the thermostat only goes to 65 which in vegas equates to your room remains at about 75. There's a pretty good size shower but only one, piddley little shower head. But the worst part is that the side of the hotel that we are on faces the Cromwell, which has a dance club on the roof that is open until 4am. They play their music so loud, and this hotel is insulated so poorly that you can hear every lyric to every song played until 4 o'clock in the morning. Neither of my kids could sleep a wink until the club closed, and NO ONE cared one iota. I called guest services (aka guest disappointment) every single night we were here. All that happened is I got passed around to various people for an hour or two each night. I had the pleasure of speaking to one particularly useless security guard that interrupted me, outright said no when I asked her to listen to me, and hung up on me. On night 4 a supervisor offered to refund my resort fee (30 per day) for 3 nights which I told her was more insulting than a show of good faith. They didn't even offer to change our room. 
It was like pulling teeth to get housekeeping up to our room if we weren't ready the first time they came (around 9am). We literally just had to call 5 times to get the bed changed bc my youngest son had an accident. It's 8pm and they just now knocked on the door. No joke. 
Their pool closes at 6pm so there's no taking the kids for a dip before bath time. No going down to sit in the hot tub with a beer after the kids go to sleep after a long day sightseeing. You have to go in the middle of the day when you're out doing other things if you want to use the pool. 
We asked valet to bring our van around so that we could get our car seat out...took an hour and a half. AN HOUR AND A HALF!!!!! 
They lost a room service order, they refused to let us have more than 2 blankets in the room despite the fact that we're paying $35 a day for a rollaway. They argue and try to refuse the request for extra towels even though there are 4 people in this room, their ATM charged me $1000 when I only took out $500...I could go on and on. What it boils down to is extremely, extremely rude staff who couldn't make it more obvious that they don't give a hoot about the guests experience or customer service. Every employee with the exception of the girls that work in the shop by the lobby and some people on the casino floor made it very clear that they would budge for no one. Not even a glass of chocolate milk for my kid after he got cut twice on the back of the neck by their knife like handles on their furniture. I know it probably sounds like I'm nitpicking. But honestly, we are not difficult people to please. All we ask is to be able to sleep warm in our beds, be able to dry off after taking a shower, have housekeeping do their jobs and have our concerns heard. I'm not complaining to get something for free. We have very valid concerns and complaints that we wanted addressed and all we were met with is apathy and excuse making. A true disgrace to a Las Vegas landmark. There are too many fantastic hotels to choose from for my family to ever step foot in this "resort" again. If anyone chooses to take a chance here, I truly hope they have a better experience than we did. But I doubt it.

Take a cab to the shops and restaurants, but for the love of God, DO NOT STAY HERE!

We just spent Thanksgiving weekend in Vegas where my wife's family lives.  We thought we'd make it into a nice vacation too and got a room at Caesars.  We'd never stayed here before and were really looking forward to it.  It started off pretty good, then rapidly descended to one of the worst stays I've ever had.

When we arrived, the Valet sign at registration said it was full.  WTF?!  I told my wife to just stay there and I ran in to get our room.  I upgraded to the Augustus Tower Deluxe room and ran out.  Luckily, the valet went ahead and took the car and it was a relatively short walk to the room.

The room itself was actually really nice.  Great jacuzzi tub and a nice bed.  The pillows were worn out feather pillows that needed to be replaced, but the rest of it was nice and had a cool modern look.  You have to pay for the coffee, which I thought was pretty ghetto considering every other hotel I've ever stayed in gives you free coffee, but that's the kind of crap I expect in Vegas.

Then things start their rapid decent.  We ordered room service.  My stomach has still not fully forgiven me for that mistake.  We got fried chicken and a chicken soup.  The soup was good.  The fried chicken was something that they pulled from a KFC dumpster, stuck under a heat lamp for 5 hours then took up to our room.  It came with a discus... oh sorry, that's right, it was a biscuit.  Took a bit and a liter of water later could finally resume conversation.  Eating a tablespoon of all purpose flour would have been preferable.  Needless to say, we stuck to the restaurants from then on -- Payard is actually quite good.

Then next batch of horror was coming and going to the resort, since we were visiting my wife's family we had some visiting to do everyday.  Well, the valet at registration was ALWAYS full!  So they made us go to the colosseum area -- on the opposite side of the resort from our room!  It was at least a 15-20 minute walk every time we needed to go back and forth from the car.  Had I not upgraded to the fancy new tower, maybe that would have been better, but as it was it made us dread coming back every day.  Long day, exhausted, sleepy -- no worries, have a nice 20 minute walk, cross two separate elevators, go through two smoky casino areas to get to your room!  Methinks not.

The other horrible thing was the room was making us sick!  Seriously, the second morning of our stay both my wife and I woke up congested and had a sore throat.  Later in the day we realized that it was the heater!  We would start to feel better and then the heater would kick on and we started getting congested again.  I turned it off and opened the air vents on the window and we both started feeling a lot better.  Ultimately, I think that saved me, but unfortunately my wife got a full on cold that I blame on Caesars.  Maybe it's because they are still doing some construction on other parts of that tower?  I don't know and don't care, it's unacceptable.

Sorry for the long review, but really there are lots of great places to stay in Vegas so why deal with this kind of BS.  I know next time it's back to Bellagio for me...

In a word, terrible. I would avoid at all costs. We were put in a room on a party floor and weren't able to sleep until 4:30am. The party destroyed multiple rooms. Maintenance was fixing the bathroom in the room next to ours and black liquid started coming out of our sink, splashing on the counter with such force that we were scared for our health. We were charged over $500 for the room! I called to express my concerns and was on hold for 15 minutes. The customer service and registration was a joke. I was offered $25 for my inconvenience and told no other rooms were available. I escalated to management and somehow a room magically became available. They only budged when I said I would dispute  the charge on my credit card along with sharing the video I took of the black stuff coming out of the sink. The furniture was beat up and tired. The carpet was gross. And there is no coffee in the rooms. You have to pay $13 for 4 k-cups to use in the rusted keurig machine. If that isn't enough, the cable was out for 2 days and the resort fee only covers wifi for 2 devices. It's BAD. I just don't understand how a place this large could be this terrible. When people say avoid the Forum tower they aren't kidding. The other towers may be nicer, but I will never find out because I will not stay here again.

If you want a Vegas experience this place is it. There's money saving hotels off the strip, but staying here feels like your really on a Vegas vacation.

The crowds the glamour the games the food it's all here. This place is sooo packed than even most top hotels people are literally shoulder to shoulder packed. Everything is shiny in gold and marble it looks amazing.

The food bacchanal did not disappoint. The line was dreadfully long about 1hr wait, but the choices and the food more than made up for it.

Overall great destination.

So disappointed with stay in the Roman Tower.  Dirty and dingy complete with mirror over the bed and bathtub in the room.  No closet.  Thought Caesars was a nice hotel but was shocked to find a room that was likely nice 20 years ago but today is in dire need of refurbishment.

I am never staying at Caesar's Palace again.  Repeat - I AM NEVER STAYING AT CAESAR'S PALACE AGAIN.  Harrah's has been laying off boatloads of staff, and as a result the service at their hotels sucks ass.  

I had a decent experience there Memorial Day Weekend 2009, so I foolishly booked another stay there for my 25th birthday, December 27 through 29.  

I *could* have booked a standard room through expedia.com or some other online agent at a substantial discount.  Instead, I figured I'd make use of my Total Rewards Players Card to book a room in one of their upgraded towers.  My rationale was that I would be fighting with one of a million NYE travelers, and they would likely honor my reservation for a nicer room since I legitimately book through their website using my Players Card. 

Well, guess what?  I show up and my friends who booked through expedia.com end up in a upgraded King Suite, while I end up in the crappiest of crappy room in their oldest tower ON A SMOKING FLOOR.  I mean, really?  A smoking floor?  Who has those anymore? Of course, I call and complain.  This is NOT what I am paying for.  They were unable to transfer me to another room, but said that they would give me a $50 discount and transfer rooms for me the next day.  They stated they would call me between 11 and 1 the next day to arrange for the room transfer. 

Well, guess what? They never called.  When I called the Front Desk to inquire, I was placed on hold for 30 minutes before being hung up on, TWICE.  So, I gave up.  Next, i thought, why don't I order some food?

Well, guess what? Room service showed up 2 HOURS after I placed my order, an order that consist of a plain ol' burger.  No apology, no discount despite having complained several times.  

I checked out the next day.  And I NEVER got the $50\/night discount they had promised to me.  Whatever, go figures.  

I go to Vegas several times a year.  Caesar's has lost a would-be loyal customer forever.  AND, they have lost a would-be loyal gambler as well.  I won $2500 Caesar's in 2009, and I'm never letting 'em have it back.  Take your money and run. 

If you are looking for a great place in Vegas, I *very highly* recommend the TRUMP HOTEL. There is no casino there, but the service is amazing, every room has a full kitchen, and the rooms are huge!  The staff there even made evening arrangements for me: chauffeured me to and from Tao nightclub and got me a line pass so that I would get right into Tao.  Free of charge.  Seriously.  Try the TRUMP. 

If you want to stay somewhere with a casino, I recommend ARIA.  The hotel and casino are beautiful, and they have the best buffet in town.

i overhear a lot of conversations that involve many quotations from the movie, "the hangover" when walking around caesar's palace.  i seriously think the people that go to caesar's now live to reenact the movie.

as a gambling hall, caesar's will take your money.  as a place to stay, i think staying in the forum tower is worth it as it's newer, but it's really pricey just for a night (fortunately i get comped rooms).  as a place to eat, eat anywhere besides the buffet.

the decor is somewhat mixed; some tacky, some classy. but hey, this place is classic las vegas, so no matter what caesar's will always be a palace.

Specialty: Taking your hard-earned money (duh, it's Vegas)

Recommendations for first timers: Ask if Caesar really "lives here".

Service: 7\/10 Variety: 8\/10, Parking: 10\/10 

marc out.

The guy actually said we weren't in a smoking room, that it was "smoking optional."  My wife replied that she was glad it wasn't "smoking required."

We finished our vacation at the Venetian where we had an incredible time....read below for the full story.

I would go back to Caesars for the restaurants, and Forum Shops...which you don't need to stay there for.  I wouldn't stay there again.

This all comes down to Customer Service.  I also gave them several chances to fix this and they didn't so I have no problem sharing here.  I booked a non-smoking room, at least six months in advance.

When we arrived, they offered us an upgrade as soon as we got there.  Great...all seemed fine.  We get to our room and it smells like the last guest stomped out his\/her Marlboro light just a couple of hours ago.

We go down and tell them we reserved a non smoking room.  They tell us, they upgraded us to the Roman Tower, but that all non-smoking rooms were taken..."we're very sorry."  The guy actually said we weren't in a smoking room, that it was "smoking optional."  My wife replied that she was glad it wasn't "smoking required."

Too make a long story short, they allegedly couldn't get us a non-smoking room until the next day.  The night manager told us to come back at 11am the next morning and they would give us a non-smoking room.  At 11am the manager on duty explained they couldn't give us a room until after 4pm, since no one had checked out yet.  That makes sense, but I was done with Caesar at this point...thousands of rooms in this hotel, even more in their sister properties and they couldn't find one non-smoking room.  They didn't even care to try...every answer, without even walking away from the desk, was..."sorry."

We finished our vacation at the Venetian where we had an incredible time.

It started with them sending me a check in request to do on my own. That didn't work but it sure took my deposit .when I arrived at Caesars my room wasn't ready the type of room I requested wasn't given to me nor was my niece who is staying with me in a room close by as I requested months prior. The lady who checked me in at the diamond check in name was Jessica and she was not very friendly at all. When I inquired about why the room I requested wasn't given to me nor was my niece niece put next to me she told me I should read the fine print on my reservation. I told her my host booked the rooms nearly three months back and we had requested certain rooms at this time it was late in the evening we've been standing at the Diamond check in for over an hour she was not helpful so I just took the rooms that was given to us.. The room wasn't bad although it wasn't very clean there were roaches in the light fixtures the sheets were torn and upon check-in I requested an extra blanket and extra hangers and they were never delivered. After waiting an hour and a half I finally went down to the lobby for some dinner after returning the items were still not in the room I called twice more to get the items I requested my room was comp the tickets were comped and yet I was charged for the rooms and all comp items. I was double charged for the deposit on both rooms . Charged for my comp tickets.I spent most of my three days there trying to get the money back that they double charged me for and basically didn't have any great time at all. The service was lacking to say the least the only good service was in the diamond lounge by the young women working there it was awesome however it was the only night we could get the diamond lounge because the line was over an hour long . You couldn't get a drink on the casino floor to save your life when I approached one of the bars on the casino floor the bartender told me to go sit down and wait and perhaps some will come by and take my drink order I asked if diamond players were allowed to get drinks from the bar and she said she didn't care what my status was. The only good part was my host. Who is the only one working on my have to get all my money returned that Caesars overcharged me. The room in the Augusta tower is ok at best it  needs to be refurbished needs to be clean  and  cockroaches need to be gone I cut my players card up and left it at the front desk I would never go back to Caesars and and probably never stay at another Caesars or Harrah's property. Almost 10 years is a diamond player and you can't get any service whether you're a diamond player gold  player or seven star player they simply do not care.

Wait, Caesars didn't actually live here?

Tagged along with wifey's conference and brought the baby and in-laws too. Our meeting rate was 210\/night in the Palace Tower. We stayed in room 1004 and the room kind of overlooked the swimming pool.

Here's a recap of the stay:

Pros:
- Caesar's Palace is HUGE - has everything you need and you literally don't ever have to leave the property. There's food, games, wide range of restaurants, shopping, pool, clubs, etc. 
- Middle of the strip, so it's a good location to streak up and down Las Vegas Blvd.


Cons:
- It's an older hotel; the whirlpool didn't work and the temperature of the water was temperamental. 
- Not baby friendly. They wanted to charge 30\/night for pack and play and 20\/night for a mini fridge (for breast milk).
- Wide range of people. I like to stay with people around the same age as me. The hotel accommodates everyone from the broke college students to the grandparents that are shuffling to the Rod Stewart concerts.

So we came here for a very short visit to check the place out. We stopped at the bar and the bartender was awesome. I wanted something with blueberry so he got creative and concocted a drink with blueberry stoli, st germain, sprite, and probably a few other things. It was great! The hotel itself was gorgeous. I loved the architecture.

Reading all the 1 star reviews, I guess we should consider ourselves lucky that we had such a great experience at Caesers.  Like any other hotel, there were some small issues but I have very few complaints.  

I booked a room in the Octavius tower and used the option to request an upgrade for $29.  The valet\/check-in area was crazy busy when we got there and there was a sign that said valet parking was full and to keep going to another lot.  When we told the valet that we were checking in to the Octavius tower, he told us to leave the car there and enjoy our stay.  The lobby was packed but we proceeded to the Diamond check-in area and were the only ones checking in at the time, so it went fast.  The girl helping us was friendly and even asked if she could help us with tickets, offered us water and gave us the upgrade with no problem..  The walk to the elevators is a long one but it's away from most of the crowds so we didn't mind.  With the upgrade, we ended up with a great a view of the entire pool area from 63rd floor!   

Our room was clean and decorated really nicely.  GREAT marble bathroom with a huge Jacuzzi tub and separate shower, really nice toiletries, double sink, huge vanity area and even a TV.  The bed was super comfy and had tons of pillows.  

The bad...well, $13 for in-room coffee is just robbery.  Seriously Caesers, you must be high!  The resort fee was supposed to cover internet for one device but I was still charged $4.95.  Not a big enough deal for me to argue over but I guess everyone should check out their bills carefully.  The line for Starbucks in the morning was insanely long but I guess when your other option is two $13 Keurig pods, standing in line isn't so bad.  And there was a really bad sewage odor all along the walkway to our elevators.  We smelled it on Monday afternoon and it was still there Tuesday morning when we checked out.  

Luck or not, we really loved our stay here and hopefully if we come back, we won't have any of the bad experiences so many people have written about.

This was our second time at Caesars and we had an enjoyable stay.  One of the biggest perks to this hotel is the location; pretty much center strip.  Lots of other places are within an easy walking distance.  You can also pick up the tram in the back of Belagio that will take you to Aria and the Monte Carlo.  The shops attached to the hotel are very nice.  There are also plenty of dining options right in Caesars. 

We had a nice room overlooking the pool.  The room was spacious with a large bathroom and two sinks.  The closet was large which was a big help since I had to bring  attire for the conference I was attending. There was a nice seating area with a couch and a single chair.  

They used to have fresh air vents on the windows.  Those appear to be screwed shut.  The TV was ok; the picture looked very analog and the sound was grainy.  But if you're in Vegas, you're probably not watching a lot of TV.  

The wifi was so-so.  We used both the regular and high speed.  Both performed about the same. The signal in the seating area wasn't that great.  It got better if you moved closer to the door.  I had a number of messages that were stuck in my outbox that had to be resent.  Wifi is free with the "resort fee" for the basic, and more money for the high speed. 

Like most casinos, they have free parking which is nice. The valet is free as well. The valet was very handy during our stay; especially towards the weekend when it got busy.  The valet staff was always friendly and asked if we needed directions whenever we were leaving the property. 

We were charged and early check in fee since we arrived before 11AM; rooms weren't available until 4PM. (The $20 sandwich did not work for an upgrade in my case). 

The pool is sweet. They have a few to choose from.  Ample seating.  But it always helps to get there early for a nice spot.  

Overall, we enjoyed our stay.

We didn't stay here. But we wandered the hotel and even got on the guest list for the pool!

The decor is stunning! I love all the elegant statues!
The casino was huge! Lots of slots and table games. There were beautiful chandeliers in some areas of the casino!

The pool complex was absolutely gorgeous! Statues, a garden, a little fountain with fishies swimming in it! Oh and a bar! Gotta go to the bar!

I'm hoping to actually stay here next time we come to Vegas!
Not too happy w\/Caesars. Moldy shower, paper thin walls w\/a baby crying all night. Called front desk spoke to Charles who was just completely lacking any kind of empathy. No need to come back.

I used to like this place but my last trip was an industrial strength colon cleansing.  

CASINO
Let's start with how the casino has effectively become the United Federation of Douchebaggery on the strip.  Many years ago, Caesar's was the sh-t & it only took $10k to be treated right.  Then one day, all the hosts up & left, taking their high rollers to Mandalay Bay & Caesar's Palace was effectively f-cked.  Caesar's had always been pretty dependent on its VIPs & this exodus rocked the place to its core.  With few whales available to sustain the revenue column on the balance sheets, the joint was forced to re-jigger its image.  That's when you started to see all that advertising on Los Angeles billboards for the milquetoast Venus Pool Party & that ridiculous TV show, "Caesars 24\/7", positioning the resort as a purported "hip & cool" place to stay & play.

Apparently this appeal to the young & infinitely stupid worked:  The tables are packed with guys that have that "I'm a Maxim magazine subscriber" look, playing 6-5 Blackjack on $10\/$1000 tables packed ass-cheek to ass-cheek.  One Federline-lookalike got so excited over his $10 double down win I thought he was gonna up & cash his chips in for a Red Lobster gift card right then & there.  Don't be surprised to see at least one dipsh-t thinking he's the shizz & splitting tens:  This always has me in stitches because when the dealer bellows "SPLITTING TENS", all eyes lock onto that table for a brief second as if f-cking TeddyKGB himself just opened a package of Oreos.  Then everyone realizes that there's no way this alcoholic asshat with a tribal arm tattoo is doing anything other than being a Grade-A chode.

And then there's the gold diggers crawling all over black chip players like a fart in a spacesuit. Yes, the ghetto 'Paris Hilton' skank parade here is quite possibly at the root of why Caesar's has degenerated from a once proud denizen of upper class well-dressed high rollers to wife-beater-wearing lowlifes that adorn their Ford F150's trailer hitches with "truck balls".  The soulless atmosphere of Caesar's casino is a side effect of all the 21-year-old-lip-gloss-laden brats trouncing about half-naked in this biohazard of a casino.  You can sense these self-important harpies leeching the joy out of everyone else in the pit as they shout intoxicated epithets at each other & spill Red Bull & Vodka drinks all over on their "You say bitch like it's a bad thing" tank tops.  If they breathe on you, look into getting treated for gonorrhea. 

Take my advice:  Even if you completely disregard the horrendous atmosphere, anyone that plays Blackjack here is a masochist.  Putting aside the obnoxious number of 6:5 tables here, the table rules that Caesars has on their 6-deck shoes are possibly the worst on the strip.  It's indicative of how they're clearly targeting dumb & dumber.  Check http:\/\/wizardofodds.com\/blackjack\/vegas.html for ongoing playing conditions but in general, I've never seen a good game at Caesars outside of the high limit tables.


FORUM SHOPS
What's there to say about this Roman bastion of commerce?  The walkways are loaded with f-cktards that wear faded clothing labeled "Hollister", "Affliction", & "USC Football".  Oh, by the way, in case it wasn't clear, buying anything here is about as enjoyable as a prostate exam from Rosie O'Donnell but what were you expecting?  Going to a 4-star hotel's shopping mall & being surprised at the craptacular markup at "Brookstone" is like buying hot wings at a nudie bar:  Wrong place, wrong agenda, dumbass.

But let's face it:  No one you know is really buying anything dangerous here.  While you drink yourself silly at Fat Tuesdays & hurl insults at Pete Rose who's usually signing autographs at the sports memorabilia joint, your girl's gonna get moist over the leather in Salvatore Ferragamo's, ogle the red soles of Christian Louboutin which she once saw on "Housewives", then get self-conscious & head on over to Banana Republic to buy something cotton that her self-esteem will actually allow her to buy.  The big ticket purchase isn't likely going to happen here so you can holster that Amex, Tonto.

And you know what else isn't going to happen here at Caesars?  You getting laid.  At least not with anyone that doesn't work for Benjamins & hangs out at Cleopatra's Barge.  For those of you looking for that kind of pay-for-play action, those ta-tas hanging from the barge aren't just a coincidence:  It's an "open for business" sign.  Yes, this place is tacky enough that anything with double-X chromosomes & even a few brain cells that can recognize what a classy Vegas experience is isn't going to be bend-me-over-the-mini-bar impressed... which of course only reinforces the explanation as to why there are so many Vegas virgins here.

(I originally reviewed the rooms, dining, & other parts of the resort but don't have space to include it all.  The rest is at: http:\/\/bit.ly\/5TImS)

2-stars.

If you're staying at Caesar's the best thing to do is valet your car because it is near the hotel check-in area. If you park in self-parking, be prepared to walk about 5 minutes to get to check-in. You have to walk through the casino and around a bunch of people just to get to the reservations area. When we got there, there were no lines. No where that says where we should line up. So some lady comes by and directs us to line up at some random spot in the middle. She directed 4 other couples to different areas. Those 4 couples got helped before us and I'm not sure if it's because we were younger but the 2 girls she put behind us was about our age as well. I was upset. If we weren't up next I would have complained. They need to figure out a better solution on how people line up or that lady needs to do a better job with directing people. I don't care to stay here again. They only reason why I give it 3 stars is because the hotel is clean and they have a lot of tables open for gambling. Also the person who helped us with our reservations was very helpful. Other than that their service wasn't great either with coming around for drinks.

Staff at this hotel \/ casino all worked hard and had no troubles with any member. The 3 day stay was great and the deal was amazing. Didn't get too lucky at the tables but held back a little for the next time. The Hot water did take at least 10-15 mins to kick in but it's probably because we stayed on the 15th floor in the hotel.

Octavious tower is nice, hotel centrally located on the strip. Great overall vibe at Caesars and a great pool as well. I am diamond total rewards level and stay here when comped. Restaurants, shopping and literally anything you could want is in the complex.

Checked in to my room to find used soaps in bathroom and an empty personal shampoo bottle from previous guest still in soap dish\/rack. I'm wondering if they even cleaned the bathrooms :-\/ staying at the Augustus tower. And then my peeps were assigned a room and they walked in and saw a couple still sleeping in the bed. Crazy!! How can mgmt let this happen?

Hmm what can I say about my experience? I did the early check in via email, was supposed to receive a text when my room was ready, never received a text. We got to the hotel around 4, and we went to the parking garage elevator and it took approximately 15 minutes to make it up to the casino level, for the hotel registration. Once in line at hotel registration, it took 45 minutes to get done due to the lack of staff assisting the hotel guests. We immediately proceeded up to the room and we found various inadequacies, which I have posted as well. The TV remote was not programmed to the television, when we got in. Also, you can hear the showers and the bathtubs running in the rooms above you. Before you book, make sure you understand everything you are getting. Caesars is definitely less than a palace.

It's amazing how they keep building this place to the size it is.  From the outside, it really looks like a huge empire with their enormous towers spreading all over the horizon. Inside, Caesars is still classy as always, but the older towers are really outdated and rather than remodel they've expanded.  

I was able to stay in the newest Octavius towers this time around, the last time I stayed at Caesars was over 5 years ago and I remember the room being small and dingy.  They called it a suite, but it's about the size of a regular room. What was convenient is it's located right around the corner from check-in and overlooked their recently remodeled swimming pool with a great view.  The bathroom area is huge though with a jacuzzi bathtub.  We were hoping for a jacuzzi in the middle of the room, though but it wasn't.  Also we were expecting it to be big enough for 3 people (a suite with a large couch they said) but it was smaller than pictured and the couch was uncomfortable so we ordered a roller bed which cost $30 a night.
