Wireless Internet access also costs about $12 a night too.

I will say that their swimming pool is a good reason to stay at Caesars.  There are about 5 pools in the area with a couple jacuzzis on the side, and a blackjack swim up resort style area as well (not worth playing though,double down on 10&11 only, no re-split Aces, no surrender).  There are ample amounts of free lounge chairs, which is important because of the amount of pool loungers. You can also charge drinks to your room from the waitresses but you'll need to bring your id.  Prices for a large slushee drink here (pink lemonade, pina colada, strawberry dacquiri) ranged from $13 for a small and $17 for a large.

The Forum Shops and the plentiful full bars scattered thoughout.  Bobby Flay has his Mesa restaurant her too.  Negatives are the only late night 24 hour restaurant (Cenral Michel Richard) is over-priced and the food wasn't very good. They're trying to be more foodie friendly and more than the avg bar but at 2am we're not really looking for that.  I guess we could've ordered room service but they said it would be at least a 1 hr wait and I was hungry.  

The food court by parking has decent selections, but whatever you do don't go to the Lobster Chowder place!!!! Go across the street to Planet Hollywood for lobster roll fix or get something else instead if you must. Seriously!!!

Nice rooms, great express check in\/check out kiosks.  The food is outrageously priced at all of the restaurants in Caesars. The rooms were nice, but no wifi included, no fitness center included...they will Nickel and dime you to death.  I have stayed at other hotels that were just as nice with way more amenities.  The location is great and the staff is terrific.

I stayed here once before with my anti-breakfast bf when I (was the best girlfriend in the world) surprised him for his birthday and flew him to Vegas for a night. We stayed here because he *loves* the Hangover, and I found a great room rate. 

Our room had like, 27 tvs and a view of the entire north end of the strip. It was incredible.

Caesar's was nice...our room was great. It had a great view of the strip and this lovely red velvet couch. However, it was missing one integral part- a full length mirror! I'm willing to bet Celine hordes them all for herself. The room also doesn't come with a fridge or coffee maker...yet there is a tv in the bathroom. Caesar's is probably one of the most confusing places on earth- if you get yourself into those Appian Way shops good luck!  The pool was great, very crowded but lots of fun. The location of CP is the best....we never leave that part of the strip!

All in all our stay at Caesar's was great.  I would recommend it to friends.

Definitely showing it's age.
Was attending a convention, and upgraded to the Octavius Wing.  Liked the coffee in the morning down at the separate check-in area.
But the tile in bathroom is getting grimey, shower fixture was rickety, bed sagged.
I hope my convention is in a different hotel next year.

For a five star hotel, I expected and have seen much, MUCH better. My room in the Augustus tower was poorly maintained and surface cleaned. I was grossed out by finding "stuff" on the carpet everywhere. Everything is tremendously overpriced. Be aware of the taxable, hidden "resort fee" on top of your room rate, which allows you to use the gym (which I cannot use right now due to my disability) and use one wifi device. Additionally, this is not a disabled-friendly environment. I attended a conference during my stay and the shortest distances between the room and the hotel were all closed and barricaded, which meant a 25-minute walk using a cane. The elevators are hidden and not well indicated. They all go to different places, so you will never know where you are... No assistance was offered at any time. I cannot recommend this hotel. Not worth the money. Oh... and if you are allergic to smoke, brace yourself! There is no effective ventilation system in the common areas so you may end up with severe congestion and a headache, like I did, for your entire stay.

When our flight got cancelled we booked one night at the Caesars Palace.  For some reason we were upgraded to the Augustus Tower King room which was amazing and quite the surprise.  Next time in Vegas I'll definitely want to return to the Caesars Palace.  It's such a beautiful place!

A great value and place to stay.  I was upgraded to the Augustus tower with a view of the fountains.  The rooms were large and the bathroom had plenty of space and an extra TV.  

The pool area is huge but get there early for a chair.  Ate breakfast at Payard.  Avoid the buffet (the bellagio buffet is right next store!).  

Exceeded expectations.

I've stayed at a lot of hotels in Vegas throughout the years and hands down Caesar's palace stands out because of the service. We arrived Friday around noon so obviously the place is gonna be crazy. We wanted to valet as our car was jam packed. We saw that it was full so we tried to valet at the forum shops but when we told the valet guy we were guest he told us to go back to the front and we will be taken care of. We pull up and sure enough our car was taken in for valet. Our bellman Jim was patient as we tried to pull stuff from our bags before it was stored as it was too early for check in. 
We go eat return and we do wait a bit to check in but that's understandable. The gentlemen checking us in was informative and even though it was busy he mad us feel like we were the only guest and did not rush us with choices. He set us up with a great view of the pool which I recommend over the city view. The pool is majestic. We get to the wonderful room and it was spacious with a jacuzzi. The new bellman that dropped off our luggage oriented us to the room and even got ice for us. Now that's service! 
I encountered many of their staff and everyone looked like they took true pride in their work. 
I loved the dealers at the pool in the water, they were personable and taught me how to play hehe don't get that everyday. My only bad experience with service was the server at the black jack table. I just asked her how much the drink was as I was so used to paying for drinks at pool parties and she just gave me this stare like i was stupid. She was fairly rude and said we just work off tips. I tried asking her a question and she just walked off. She had about 6 black jack tables to serve and she was gone for about 30 minutes before coming around again to ask us if we wanted to drink anything. She was the only one though that I experienced that was rude.
Upon check out I called the front desk and Sheree answered the phone. I remember her name cuz that's my name and she was friendly and helpful upon checkout over the phone. 
Overall great stay and wonderful pool! We ate, partied and shopped here. They had everything we needed.

This review is for the Sports Book:
Sports Fan in Vegas = The Need For a Sports Book Fix
I admit it....I am a sports book whore, so it is about time I actually wrote a review on one. Caesars is the best....the absolute best when it comes to sports books in this city. Televisions galore! There are about 6 screens that are movie theater size lost among 20 other smaller screens.  The seating area is awesome....great Easy-Boy type chairs for you to sit on for your comfortable viewing pleasure. A great way to spend a Sunday in fall during football season, but you must remember the saying "early bird gets the worm" if you plan on spending your morning\/evening here. People have been known to get there at 6am to reserve the lounge chairs for the 10am games.

If you don't plan on being early... there are plenty of seats to go around but they do go pretty fast. The cocktail service is great....I love that fact that Caesars always staffs about 6 servers for their busy Sundays. There is always someone around to take your order. The satellite beer\/cocktail carts that they have stationed all around are handy too. The fans that come here are the rowdiest I have ever seen. Always in their fav. jerseys....friendly, cheering and clapping as if you were in an actual stadium. I do wish the food court was a little closer... after 5 rounds of beer and hunger starts to set in, it always seems as if it were located in Utah. Overall, if you want the best sports book experience especially during football season....this is the place to be.

Caesar's Palace remains classy in an ideal spot along the Strip.  However, I think I enjoy visiting Caesar's more than I do staying at Caesar's.

The rooms could be cleaner - I found dirty underwear under the bed in our $350 room in the Octavius Tower!!  In addition, the Octavius Tower is literally half a mile from the main lobby, too much of a trek.

The food court is crazy expensive and not exciting.  

A redeeming feature is the pool, or should I say pools?  There are over five pools and each offers a different clientele.

I would do Caesar's again...if I have a free room.
Had 3 nights at Caesars Palace August 9,10,11 2014. Good room service and good.I stayed at 43rd floor,could all of the Bellagio fountains. I lefted in the 4376 room.

Was looking to stay at Caesar's for a while. Got a room in the Augustus Tower, paid $315.00 for 2 nights.
I expected more for the price, the furniture was ok, nothing modern. The tv was small. Don't touch any food items on the counter or fridge or you will be charged for it.
The bathroom is great, jacuzzi tub, used it both days. There was a tv in the bathroom which was pretty nice.
 Great view of the strip.
Complementary slippers, chocolate and water in the evenings.
The location is great, close to everything.

Stayed here for two days and I gave four stars mostly for the location and property. The room was mediocre. I couldn't believe the minibar costs, I'm not a cheap person these prices were just so laughable. Even the coffee for the coffee maker in our room cost money! That's so tacky. Room was spacious and very clean, you could tell our tower, the Julius tower had recently been remodeled which was nice. Our view sucked though lol room number 766 and we were told we had a strip view when really we could see the dirty roof and the very top of the flamingo. Casino was nice but they blasted the heater for some reason. Everyone was really nice and they gave us a really late check out so we could hang out until 1pm in the room which was cool. Overall it was ok but probably not worth the price.
Recently was in Vegas and stayed at Caesars, where I stay whenever in town, never disappoints me. Very nice hotel and great restaurants...buffet was great too!

My mom and I have been going to Caesars Palace for years, and have always enjoyed our time there -- until our last stay, and, unfortunately, it will likely be our last. My mom is a diamond member, which means that she receives certain benefits since she is a "high-roller." They offered us three free nights at Caesars, and they told her that we were going to stay in the Octavius Tower, but she requested the Augustus Tower, which is technically a downgrade from the Octavius Tower because she likes the beds better. She has really bad knees and can't get in and out of the beds in the Octavius Tower easily. The reservationist assured her that we would be staying in the Augustus Tower and that the room was secured. Great! We flew into town and upon checking in were told that the Octavius Tower and the Augustus Tower were at capacity and we were being downgraded to the Palace Tower in a mini suite. We had stayed in the Palace Tower once before and requested never to be put in that tower again because it is a much older tower, and despite renovations the rooms seem to have mechanical problems. We explained that at checkin and they assured us it would be fine. Okay, we aren't unreasonable people. We took the room. It's not a great situation to come into a hotel expecting one thing and then being downgraded, but whatever. Not a deal breaker. What happened after, however, was completely unacceptable. We go into our room and it's hot. I mean HOT. About 86-degrees. The room overlooks the pool and has sunlight almost all day. I closed the drapes and turned on the air conditioner, which was only pushing out hot air. Not wanting to complain, we gave it time to cool down while we went to gamble and eat. After about four hours, we returned to the room was still hot. I called downstairs and they sent a repair man to work in our room. We left when he arrived and went to play some more. A few hours later we returned, the repair man was gone and the room was still hot and the a\/c was still broken. I called downstairs and told them that it still wasn't fixed. They switch our rooms for us 5 stories above where we are, which meant repacking our the bags, paying for another bellman. The a\/c in the room worked. We were happy. The following morning we are getting ready to leave and a repair man shows up to repair running toilets that the maid had reported. We had noticed the constant hiss from the two toilets, but didn't want to complain again, but apparently they had an efficient maid who does her job well. Unfortunately, I can't say the same thing about their customer service and front desk \/ VIP in this instance. He was there all day, changing pipes and doing his job. We didn't complain about it, but here we are in another room, and we have a third roommate. We go to dinner and gamble some and returned to the room at about 8pm. No sign of a repair guy, toilets are still running and the jacuzzi bathtub was not working. We put out the do not disturb sign, get in our pajamas and decide to watch a movie. About twenty minutes into our movie, there's a knock on the door and there is the repair man, who apologizes about knocking in spite of the do not disturb sign and he asked if he could come in to work some more. I allow him in, my 58 year old mom is in her nightgown and he worked away while we finished our movie. The toilets aren't running anymore, but he has to come back the following day to repair the jacuzzi tub. I call downstairs and explain the situation. We are staying in a reassigned, downgraded room and are plagued with exactly what concerned us about staying in the Palace Tower: something is always broken and there's some repair that needs to happen. They didn't offer to change our room again, upgrade us, or do anything to accommodate our stay or to make up for the poor experience they had been providing us because of their faulty rooms. They gave us $100 credit toward a massage that we had and took off the movie rental charge because the repair man was there pretty late working while we watched it. I explained the the assistant customer service manager who I spoke to that this isn't about money, it's about our experience and making it right. We were downgraded, put in a room that was unbearably hot because of a broken a\/ then  were switched into another room that had even more problems and we are now in the middle of a construction zone. To not upgrade our room at that time to get us comfortable is a shame. I told him that I appreciate the $100, but that the room is the real issue. We could have stayed anywhere. The Cosmopolitan, Wynn, and Bellagio all offered us 3 free nights. We chose to stay at Caesars because we have always had a great stay and a great experience with their customer service. I explained to him that I had had a room issue at the Cosmopolitan when I stayed there the first time. The room when I walked in was dirty and the bed wasn't even made, and they immediately upgraded me to a wraparound terrace suite.

If you can afford to, I recommend you stay at the Caesars; they've really got this whole Vegas luxury and no need to leave the property thing down. 

I was set up here for a few days while attending a trade show. All the staff are really helpful, nice all the time and know the ins and outs of the hotel. 

The property itself is ridiculous. HUGE, gorgeous and so comfy you don't want to leave. Sure you walk a mile every day if you go from end to end, but who cares. You can shop without going outside, eat varying cuisines at the buffet or at their other restaurants or you can people watch at the casino. 

Having stayed at other hotels on the strip I'd really like to be able to come back here again, but like I said, it's a matter of affording it. Caesars = serious dough!

I need to express my disappointment in this hotel. Requested a non-smoking room, was given a smoking room and then was basically told to my face I was lying when I requested a new room. They did finally offer me a different room but made sure to let me know it was inconvenient. The next day I went sightseeing with my car and on my return was told I have to park behind the building ad they had invited "Special Guests" and Valet and upfront parking was for them.
I was so mad at this point I went to find a manager and was stared at and asked "what do you want me to do." (make it right) I picked Caesars for the location, never again unless I want to be treated like a door mat.

Every time I come here, I always have to fight the urge to ask them if the real Caeser lived here. Every, freaken, time.

Ok, so down to the review. I don't like this place. I just don't think the gambling floor is comfortable and conducive in its layout. For the size of the hotel, the buffet is kind of weak. The selection is limited and the food is forgettable. The vibe of this hotel is also teetering to "old", due to natural causes of aging but its more apparent when you compare this hotel to the other new kids on the block, i.e. Cosmo, Aria, Wynn, Venetian. It's still steps up from Bally's-esq type hotels, but Caeser's is no longer synonymous with upscale.

The rooms... If you're unlucky, you'll get the Octavious Tower (I believe) and have to walk a mile to arrive at the elevators to your room. Also, if you book a regular room, you'll run the risk of staying in a room that is on par with the room at the Motel 6. 

The nice thing about Caesers is that its part of the Harrah's properties, so if you record your play, you can get rewards at the other casinos like Planet Hollywood, Ballys, Flamingo, Rio, etc.

Perhaps the best thing about staying at Caesers are the Forum Shops. The ever-evolving forum shops are still cool to stroll through and pick up a few things.
Stayed here twice. WAAAAY overpriced, no matter what time of year. Parking is a total pain in the butt too. I can think of a few better places in Vegas to stay than Ceasars.

Sadly not a fan. First off how can you have a giant sprawling resort and not have 1 single healthy organic place to eat! Secondly the Internet service was terrible and came in and out despite paying a hefty premium for resort wide coverage.

Lastly I was here for a convention and we were so lost trying to find the location and the staff was indifferent to helping.

Really bummed as was excited by SPG\/Ceaser's deal but less enchanted now.

I'll break it down:

In the room: the bedding and towells are laundered with some kind of industrial detergent,  so if you have remotely sensitive skin,  you'll need itching.   And they have no hypoallergenic option.  The bed itself is comfortable,  but the pillows are terrible.  They look big and fluffy,  but they're not.  They're quite flat, even with two stacked up.  There is a coffee maker,  but you have to buy the coffee for $14. No microwave. The fridge is full of mini bar items that you get charged for even of you nudge them,  literally.  They're is a space for a water bottle left for your personal use.  But you might nudge something.  The bathroom is very nice,  nice shower,  nice jacuzzi, double sinks.  Nice view from our room towards the mirage.  TV with cable. The free WiFi on the 12th floor was pretty weak.  Aesthetically, everything looks nice.  

Like any Vegas hotel,  it's huge and confusing,  hard to get around.  Payards,  the "affordable" cafe in the hotel was pretty good.  Good coffee. 

Service overall was fine. 

The valets were probably the best of any service at the hotel.  Make sure to tip them.

Overall,  it's a very nice hotel.

When it comes to gambling this is the place you don't want to be. The crowd here is definitely drawn in as a result of the glitzy name and not much else. My most recent visit was this past Thursday and will probably be my last time gambling at this casino. 

My first issue was at the blackjack table. The dealers are fine with players using their phones to text and even make calls during a hand because why not, rules don't matter here. This is a great bonus to those people who want to multitask while you're sitting next to them trying to play your hand. The other issue is that cocktail waitresses don't come around ever, no matter how many times you ask. I had a waitress come by after 45 minutes of complaining to the pit boss and when she finally brought my beer 20 minutes later, I already got my own drink. She told me I'm not allowed to have two drinks and said she would come by later to drop it off. Ten minutes later we see her in street clothes walking away as though she obviously clocked out and was done for the day. Even the pit boss Craig said that it was embarrassing and he has no excuses for it. Sadly, this inability to get a drink has happened to me every time I've sat at a blackjack table at Caesars. 

The main issue that is the reason I'm writing this review is the poker room. Floorman John Hayward is the worst floorman I've ever seen. There were belligerently drunk players sitting at our table making threats and insults and repeating racist and anti Semitic comments and the floor man did nothing to stop or resolve the situation. Every time it was brought to his attention he only acknowledged and then walked away. This was terrible to endure and honestly, the Venetian and bellagio both have way more action than the dingy Caesars poker room. They had to have multiple tables short handed instead of combining them just so they could collect more rake. It's sad that the Caesar resort is luxurious in their accommodations but it stops there as the casino itself is more suitable for you more undesirable crowd. Hopefully the floorman Mr. Hayward soon realizes that his ability to control the room is less than adequate for the job he's been given. Perhaps he would be better serving drinks at the blackjack table. It does seem like they are short handed.

I have stayed at a number of Harrah's properties and I gamble at Harrah's in order to get the Total Rewards points.  I have never had bad service up until this last weekend when I stayed at Caesers Palace.  We chose Caesers because of its reputation as a top notch property, but let me tell you, this place is nothing more than an overpriced Motel 6 with a nice lobby.  

Our adventure started when we went to check in.  After receiving our room key, we trudged around looking for the appropriate tower, and after about 15 minutes finally found it.  Took the elevator to our room, open the door for my wife and she screams "Shut the door, there's a lady in the bathroom".  We did not feel like dragging our bags back down again to get a new room, so we used the conveniently placed phone to call the front desk.  Unfortunately, after 10 minutes we were still on hold so it's back to the front desk.  The one nice thing was that the desk clerk apologized and gave us a $100 food and beverage credit.  So off to the new room and fortunately this time it was unoccupied.

For the price these rooms go for on a weekend, we were severely disappointed.  The room had obviously not been refurbished since the hotel was built, and it had signs of severe wear and tear (missing knobs on the dressers, shower doors that did not close all the way, and a front door that had to be pulled shut in order to make sure it locked).  The TV was vintage 1998, and there was no minibar or coffee maker in the room.

About the amenities at the hotel , there is not much to say because this hotel has a severe lack of them.  None of the bars serve coffee, only one I could find served draft beer (and no decent drafts), and there is only one place to get breakfast besides the overpriced buffet (more on the buffet later).  Coffee at the cheezy Java Coast was $4.00 for a small.  Even Starbucks doesn't have the audacity to charge that for a brewed coffee.

As it was a milestone birthday for me, I invited a number of friends to Vegas to have dinner at the Café Lago Buffet.  For the price, which is way more than most other buffets on the strip, the selection was truly anemic.  One small line of food where most others are 3 times the size.  We had only 12 people but they required us to split our party or pay an 18% gratuity charge.   I'm sorry, but I am not going to pay $6 per person just for someone to refill our iced tea twice.  We asked for tables that were close together, but were told (of course) that if we had the same server we would have to pay the gratuity.  The servers themselves were snotty and obnoxious and told us that "our union fought hard to get us that".  They must have heard my wife say that we weren't going to tip because they proceeded to ignore us.  Really?  You think you deserve a big percentage at an overpriced buffet to bring us our beverages?  The last straw was after our meal was finished, my wife had a tiny piece of cake left which she was going to wrap in a napkin for later.  The waitress saw her and said "If you take that cake I'll make sure security is waiting for you".  

Not only will I never stay at Caesers, I will never stay at, or gamble at another Harrah's property.  If this is the way you treat people at the "the most prestigious resort in the world" and a place with "Impeccable service" (to quote the website), then you really should rethink your corporate culture.  There are plenty of other places that make an effort to keep their customers happy so why should we spend our money with Harrah's?
I love staying here the rooms are big and spacious. The jet tub is amazing. The pool has a dj spinning but its kid friendly.

Caesar's Palace could be one of the top noch hotel in Vegas but there's something about this hotel that you should know,  their policy is really  unacceptable.  1. When you check in will be between 4 to 6 pm because the room is not ready yet but if you check in before 4pm there's an additional fees to pay I don't really get the logic meaning they're lying about the availability of their rooms just to make additional fees. 2. The check out should be 11 am so here's the scenario you're paying them full day but you only stay there actually half day. This is not the right hotel to check in. Very bad..

Terribly overpriced.  15 bucks for internet?  20 bucks for a fridge?  Two bucks extra for lettuce and tomato?

Definitely not staying here again.  Theres a massive lack in value.

I've heard that Caesars Palace has a good tower and a bad tower.  I've must have been in the good tower because my experience was pretty good.  Checking-in was a breeze due to the many cashiers working in the large lobby.  Like other Vegas hotels, going from lobby to hotel room here was a long trip.  When someone says, "Drop your bags off in the room and meet back here in 5 minutes."  You better tell them to make it at least 15 minutes.

I was pretty high up, which gave me a beautiful view of the Strip at night.  The rooms were very nice and spacious.  Definitely a comfortable enough room if you want to bring several people back and chill late at night.  The bed was also very nice and extremely comfortable.  The bathrooms were also strong--everything performed as it should, and it even had a slightly luxurious feel to it.  I loved the showers.  The rooms weren't cheap, but the experience was good.

Caesars Palace has a few other bright spots as well.  There is plenty to do around Caesars Palace--such as the Forum shops.  Plus, it is very close to some other marquee casinos like the Bellagio.  I've heard mixed on this--but based on my experience, Caesars Palace does a good job of clearing up the cigarette smoke on the gaming floor.  It isn't as good as the Wynn or the Bellagio, but Caesars Palace is definitely more comfortable and non-smoker friendly than a Harrah's or a Sahara.

There are plenty of other Las Vegas hotels I would like to check out, but I wouldn't mind staying in Caesars Palace on my next visit.

I stayed here with my best girlfriend and her husband. The place is really pretty, super gay...I mean Cher, Elton John and Bette Midler were playing here. ha ha ha  LOVE IT

After a few cocktailsI was so turned around I wasnt sure I would ever find my way out, but I guess that is the point. 

The "shows" they have of the statues freak me out, maybe I was to drunk. 

The pool is under construction, so make sure and check on that before you make a reservation.

Stayed here for a conference for 3 nights and was in the "Forum Tower" likely due the proximity to the ballrooms. I have not stayed here before am usually at the MGM Signature or the Wynn. Have been to the common areas and restaurants many times and found it clean and well run; I incorrectly assumed that would be true of the hotel. 

Arrived before check-in time and told room was not ready unless I paid an extra $35 for early check. So, room was ready just trying for a little revenue bump. Dropped bags at bell station for the day - getting them out of hock can be slow. 

The room: I was in the Forum Tower and these could only be described as dingy and in need of a good cleaning - a remodel would be best. Worst bathroom lightning I have ever seen - the eco bulbs had to be warmed up like a 1950's Philco TV. The furniture was beat up and scratched and the couch had many mystery stains. 

In general, the room did not feel clean and did not have any matching or cohesive styling. The room had a coveted Vegas in-room coffee machine, but alas it was not free - they were selling the K-cups via the mini-sensormatic thing for $13. Yikes!

Room was booked through the convention to receive the convention "rate" with taxes went over 2 Bills a night.  So, within striking distance of the Wynn or a number of other better properties and almost 2X of the MGM Signature.

I do not see the value for that price point. There are dozens of better options than Caesars Palace.

Monumental, a piece of history, old time mobster Las Vegas type place with the constant ding-ding-ding of slot machines and loads of people wandering around lost inside the tangled web of casino, forum shops and hotel grounds.  The rooms are quite nice as well.

Here are my biggest gripes:  
- NO jaccuzzi in the pool area (they used to have several but they were removed)
- Pure Nightclub is quite weak.  The drinks are overpriced, the layout is terrible, sound reverberates like in a tin can and the crowd looks like they have never been to a club before.  
- Slippery blanca carrera and marble.  I love white stone but people slip so add white no-slip strips please.

Omg  got two nights for 87 dollar a night clean great service  good food would stay there again anytime  yes felt like a queen  great view went the for valentine's day weekend it was the cleanest room ever the food their is great have to try the seafood buffet have to do again

Another year, another MURTEC and once again it was held at Caesar's Palace Convention Center.  As far a convention space is concerned the hotel is great, but staying there for a convention is hectic at best.

I arrived in the morning and attempted to check-in.  It was well before 3pm so I wasn't expecting to be put in my room but I wanted to leave my bags with the bell desk at a minimum.  I was booked into the Forum Tower which isn't the newest tower but it is remodeled.  It was the tower that was built in the 80's if I'm remembering right.

Like I expected the room wasn't ready, but I was told they would call my cellphone when it was ready.  It came around 2:30 and I hadn't gotten a call so I checked and the room was already ready.  I don't mind this but if you're not going to call, just tell me 3pm.  Don't let me find out later that the room is already ready and you haven't called.

The room itself was nice, I was at the end of the hall on floor 59, which i believe was floor 9.  I had a room that faced the strip, although on floor 59 you're looking more at the top of the Colosseum than the strip.  Like they said, it was remodeled recently.  There was a 40ish inch flat panel on the wall, 2 cordless phones, king size bed, a chase lounge and overstuffed chair.  The bathroom was also nicely done.  There was a over sized shower stall, a separate water closet for the toilet, and a 15in TV mounted in the mirror.  They also furnished two robes and had a safe in the closet.

If I was gambling only or wanted the shop at the Forum I wouldn't mind staying here.  For a convention its hectic, I would have preferred something in City Center like Mandarin or Vdara which are calmer to say the least.  The Convention space is just awkward to access and requires wondering through the expansive casino and back hallways of shops.  Its clear that access to the convention space access was not part of the original focus of the resort.

Aside from the hiccups with check-in, the service was top notch.  I needed a new iron and they brought one to the room within 15 mins.  The checkout process was easy and could be done from the room, the front desk or the guys with Ipads in the front desk area.

I personally wouldn't stay here on my own personal trips to Las Vegas.  I think there are newer equally priced places that aren't such a cluster.  Having said that, they provided a good product (Forum Tower or newer) and good service.  If you want the crazy hectic Vegas experience and a good strip location, stay at Caesar's.

Don't ever stay here! Resort fees are out of control , staff is rude! Talked to front desk manager was no help at all. We were stuck all the way in the back corner like rosa parks. There also was a nasty stench in the hallway on the 7th floor. Our bathroom had mold everywhere and when we called the manager didn't care at all! I felt so discriminated against. Only was here to see Mariah Carey! Would rather stay in the Bellagio!

Never fucking come here. Stayed here for 3 night on a business trip. They have a club right next door that plays music so fucking loud i can feel the bass in my room until 3 am. They dont provide complimentary earplugs. If you like listening to loud blurry music until 3 am then hey, go for it. Customer service here kind of sucked too. Theyll tell you theyll bring you something and forget about it. Take your money to bellagio or venetian. Much better quality and service.

The rooms are very nice but small compared to the Venetian, Palazzo, and Mandalay Bay. The clubs, food court, shopping, and restaurants are decent but not all they are hyped up to be. The sports book is nice but the Mirage is little nicer and quieter. The service was mediocre at check-in, bell hop, concierge, housekeeping, and poolside bars. The pools and buffet are fantastic though. Table games are good. The poker room after renovations is small and filled with unprofessionally behaved dealers, odd rules, and idiotic managers. There were 3 scuffles during a Saturday night in the poker room and management didn't try to figure out what was going on or get control of the situation. Valet was great and had better information on tickets to shows than the concierge. The Total Rewards players club has limited hours, even on busy nights. Try the Venetian or Bellagio for better food, service, table games, poker room, and room amenities. Caesars Palace is supposed to be one of the upper tier casinos but falls short in several areas. At least, they don't charge for parking like the MGM properties.

We celebrated our engagement here after booking such an amazing celebration deal. Even though we were bounced around for hours from different departments to make this trip happen, the experience on the phone and through emails were amazing.

When we checked in, our two hotel rooms that we booked were horrible - beautiful view of the roof of another building with smoke coming out of it in the Forum towers. I called and asked the front desk to change our rooms with a better view; unfortunately, they asked me to go back downstairs and wait in the 30+ minute line. Where were the notes that we were celebrating our engagement?! So, even after our flight was delayed five hours and I was exhausted, I went back downstairs to change our rooms.

I was very fortunate and lucky to get Lisa L. To assist with the change of rooms with her supervisor. Lisa was SUPER HELPFUL, so sweet, and accommodating - she did everything she could to offer us better rooms with the pool view in the palace towers. She made our trip so much more enjoyable. The ONLY reason I'd come back to Caesar's Palace would be because of Lisa L. 

When we checked out this morning, I noticed our emailed bill\/receipt that said we had been changed for the resort fee for two nights for two rooms, which initially they said they'd waive that on the phone call due to our Veteran's status. I went over to the front desk and asked about this, but the supervisor named Theary stated that they don't offer waivers for Veteran's status even though a Caesar's palace employee told me over the phone. 

We kept going back and forth, and she wouldn't come up with any solution other than telling me that there's nothing she can do and I was mistakenly told that, and would have to get a phone number to track the call. I booked our trip through my work, which is a blocked number so she said that my phone calls cannot be traced, which means: 1). She won't waive the measly resort fees, 2). She's right; not the customer because that's Caesar's Palace mentality of good service, and 3). She didn't care for our satisfaction; just hers (we felt so bad the poor, young man in training standing awkwardly next to her). 

Next time, I'll make sure that I call from an unblocked phone and write down everyone's names so Theary can complete her investigation in order to waive the resort fees (that's what she requested and made a scene about at the front desk) - how ridiculous! I don't even care about the resort fees at all at that point - it was her horrendous attitude, rude personality, and unhelpful service that I'm so upset about. How can Caesar's Palace call this hospitality?! 

I don't know anyone in her position of leadership who would ever raise her voice and speak to any upset customer like this! It was very, very rude and extremely horrible customer service. I will be sure to tell all my family and friends to NEVER celebrate anything special at Caesar's Palace due to the lack of service offered at the front desk by Theary. Everyone else seemed super nice and helpful except for the Theary - that's really unfortunate since employees learn emotional intelligence and good service from their supervisors. 

I even read an article on Forbes regarding managers teaching their employees great customer service at Caesar's Palace - where was Theary's manager in all this disservice to the public?! Not there to help! I'll be sure to tell every single friend and family member of mine (who always ask for my travel recommendations) to never stay at Caesar's due to my terrible experience with Theary. Never again!!!

Stay away from Caesars Palace! I have stayed at Caesars Palace several times before and each time my experiences get worse and worse. I continued to stay there because of location but if you are going to spend over $500 a night on a room don't spend it at Caesars, go to the Venetian, or the Wynn properties. The VIP check in clerk was completely incompetent. When he looked up my reservation he asked me if i knew how much the rates were even though i had already paid the first night, frankly insulting. He gave us a smoking floor room when my wife has bad asthma and I had requested a non smoking room. He never took my credit card information when I handed it to him at check in, and was woke up at 7:30am to put a credit card down. Food Court was slow and serves cold food. Room service was ridiculous. They got our order wrong every time, and it took at least 1 hour plus for delivery of the cold food you pay an arm and leg for, and I got two harassing phone calls asking us to immediately put the cart back in the hallway (one of the phone call the cart was already outside). Our room had a broken lamp that flickered off and on all day. I really got the overwhilming impression they do not care about people anymore only the bottom line.

I had a wonderful, lovely time staying in the Augustus Tower. There was a nice bedroom with comfortable king-size bed, an adjourning bathroom with vanity table, bathtub, and shower, and a large living room area. It was so spacious, comfortable, and luxurious to have so much room and it was decorated so nicely. I was really happy with our room. It made me want to just lounge inside. 

The only reason I'm not giving Caesar's another star is, it was incredibly difficult to get the free slotplay advertised. First, I signed up for Total Rewards and was told when I checked-in at the front desk to ask for the required $10 coupon. At the front desk, I was told they had run out of coupons and didn't know when they would get another shipment in. 

After I checked out, I went to Total Rewards and told them the front desk had run out  of coupons and could they just look me up in the system. The Total Rewards person told me I had to be still checked in to get the free slotplay. In the end, I didn't get it. I was given the run-around.

At least our room was lovely!

Not a bad place to watch sports if you can find a seat.  VERY VERY minimal seating at this sports book & they are totally anal about you sitting in the racing section to watch the big screens.

I don't mind hanging out here because I love Caesars Palace but there are other sports books *ahem, M resort, ahem* that provide better viewing experiences.
if they check you into the roman towers, tell them no way!  its the last tower to be renovated in feb 2013 and right now its OLD!  yuck ...

There was a new problem daily with my room 1 day a flooded bathroom floor in the morning and the jetted tub spewing out a hairball and stopping in the same eve. The hotel continued to charge me $200\/nite and refused to discount my stay. I will never stay here again or book a client. Their is No Hospitality here!

While I have stayed at this property in the past, this review is for its banquet facilities. 

I attended an indoor wedding and reception here and it was seamless. The staff members were phenomenal and the venues were beautiful. 

The catering was great too. While I cannot speak to its pricing, I would say it was a top notch celebration. 

Job well done.
Not sure what I did, but at my fourth stay they bumped me up to a suite.  FABULOUS!  Great view.  I always love the casino.  This is my favorite place to stay in vegas when there is a conference.

This hotel is very very very pricey & expensive! I say this because all of the stores are too darn expensive and pricey. Gucci, LV & etc.. if you do not have money then don't come here Lol but it's a nice place to walk around and eye candy it up! I love walking outside of the hotel because there are so many places to pass by and the escalators are unique as well.. meaning you just don't go straight down or up but in circles! preeety fun 8)

I stayed here for 3 nights for a conference. I have not been to LV for about 13 years. We stayed in the Octavia tower. The rooms were modern, beautiful, and clean. The shower and tub were great. The beds were soft w good pillows. The hotel exterior is magnificent. The pool area is beautiful. The hotel is enormous. I got turned around several times the first day and the staff I ran into weren't really able to point me in the right direction. The fitness center is by the spa and it's a fantastic gym.  I do wish that there was an in room guide w more detail w the restaurant, shop, and entertainment information. We stumbled upon the shops at the Forum while walking back from a show on Saturday night. I would have definitely shopped had I realized there were plenty of regular stores interspersed w the high end shops. We did not eat w\/in the hotel, mostly bc the prices seemed high with mixed reviews. But the breakfast and lunches served at the conference were incredible so kudos to Caesars for their delicious catering.  We also used Valet parking about 2-3 times a day w great, friendly service.  One kind of annoying thing is that w the resort fee you could only have two devices w WiFi per room.  Also the hotel staff that walked is to the room warned us not to use the fridge for personal items. I found fine print information that stated there may be a 25 dollar fee for placing items in the fridge. Kind of ridiculous. All the staff that I encountered were pleasant. No complaints on the service.

This was my first time staying here. We got a room at the Octavius Tower. Initial impression was that the rooms were a bit larger than other hotel rooms that we've stayed at in Las Vegas. The rooms had a nice decor and were very comfortable. The bathrooms were huge and had a shower and jet tub bath tub. The walls however are very thin and you can hear everything your neighbors are doing. We had a kid running back and forth in the early morning hours and what seemed like all day. We had an adjoining room and we could hear our neighbors talking, their kids screaming and their toilet seat flipping up and down. On the other side of us, we could hear our neighbors TV on all night even though our TV was on too. May as well have no walls at all. 

The Octavius Tower is far from the casino. It's a good 5 to 10 minute walk. The upside is that there's no cigarette smoke around and the non smoking rooms don't wreak like casino. The worst is that it's a good 15 minute walk from your room to the self parking lot. If you left something in the car just leave it. It's at least a 30 minute round trip walk to go get it. 

We saw the Shania Twain show. Overall a good, entertaining show. The theatre is nice but the production was a little cheesy. Shania was good though. 

Food options are nice. Great BBQ at the food court and the French onion soup at the Central restaurant was good. This is a 24 hour restaurant. We attempted to have lunch at Serendipity III but had to leave. They had the heat blasting inside so we asked to sit outside but was told they aren't seating outside. It was a chilly day and they have warmers in the outside seating so I don't understand. Inside was crowded and really hot\/uncomfortable. We left and ate at the food court. 

I doubt I will stay here again. It's way too pricey for what it is. For a 5 star hotel, I had high expectations. It was just okay for me. The rooms and accommodations are probably some of the best in Vegas but considering the thin walls with noisy neighbors, I'll be looking elsewhere for a good night sleep. Glad I experienced it. Now time to move on.

The room or pretty decent, but their WiFi policy is INSANE.  $25\/day PER device.  I sucked it up and paid for my work laptop, and then determined it was $25 more for my iPad and $25 more for iPhone.  Absolutely ridiculous.

So i heard from one of our lyft drivers that harrahs bought them out which shows why it didnt have the same ambiance and luster as before but what was really evident was how they nickel and dime you and downright scam you on their ride service.

We requested a taxi for 7 to go from caesars to mgm which would have been a 6 min ride $10 for taxi for of them or 8-10 for uber\/lyft. But of course they recommend stuffing us into a denali, driver asks should i play music we say no its fine, he then proceeds to play some bangers super loud which was good for 1\/2 the crew in the car other crew was downright sleepy.

But to make the matters worse the driver charged us *drum roll please $65 plus tips wtfuhhhhhng fail caesars you have managed to make our trip which was super fun. Make us feel scammed seriously messed up

Loved this hotel! The casino, shopping and restaurants were out of this world. There was so much to do and see we actually went back two times during our trip. I did  it stay there but would like to on our next visit. I have loved in both the northeast and southeast and they had two of my favorite restaurants from each area!!! Carmines and joes stonecrab AMAZING :)))

We had been wanting to try out Caesar's palace for some time now, and on our spontaneous trip over the weekend, we finally got to. It was a great choice, as we were given outstanding customer service and were made as comfortable as possible.

First off, we were lucky enough to have Nayel help us with our super early check-in at 10 am, which I might add, only cost us an extra $30! That was awesome. What was even more awesome was that she gave us a free upgrade from the Roman Towers to a luxury room in the Augustus Towers. Score! Sure, there were two beds and it was smoking - but that's fine with us since it was such an amazing upgrade! When we stay at Caesar's Palace next time, we are definitely going to look for her to help us again.

In addition, the room was gigantic, with both a large tub with jets, as well as a separate shower. The beds were spacious and comfortable. We were warned about the motion censors on the food and beverages in the room, but one of the items had already been opened and moved. We let them know about this at the end of our stay, and they didn't charge us. Everything was spotless and neat. We had a great view of the strip from our side room on the 25th floor. 

It was also delightful to have the cleaning staff greet us as we would come down the hallway. I'm not used to staff being so friendly! It was great!

I'm looking forward to coming to Caesar's Palace again.

My favorite hotel in Vegas. I stayed in the laurel collection in the premium King room. I have stayed here twice so far and both times were very pleasant. The room had a spa whirlpool bath tub and separate stand up shower. The room view was of the garden and pool area, very beautiful. Very clean. The hallways and casino were also very nice. Can't wait to stay here again :)

On December 1,2017. We were on the Sin-city Night crawl party bus. This was the second stop for our itinerary. Once we got in the Omnia, my cousin Kizzy Fosten who is legally blind needed to use the ladies room. Her friend Angela assisted her to the restroom because she needed someone to guide her to the restroom. Kizzy had on a jumper so it needed to be unzipped from the back(mind you she can't see;legally blind). I waited by the restroom door for Kizzy and her friend Angela to come out so we can enjoy the rest of my birthday trip. Kizzy flew from Chicago, I flew from Dallas and Angela drove from Arizona. After I noticed the ESV attendant come rushing out of the restroom to get security. I immediately went in to check on my cousin. There I saw the attendant beating on the door like she was FBI or some kind of law enforcement. I stopped her and asked what was wrong. She ignored me and continued to beat again on the door. By that time, two men security came rushing in and asking what was the problem. I tried to explain that my cousin is legally blind and she needed help in the restroom. One of the officers asked me to come out of the restroom but I told him that I needed to help my cousin walk out of the restroom with me as well. After that Morgan,(security supervisor) then approached Kizzy, Angela and myself, he stated that he needed to talk with us outside. We cooperated with him and proceeded out back where other officers followed. By that time we were totally embarrassed, upset and confused of what has happened. After requesting the ESV attendant name, her supervisor name we were declined any information. After completely explaining the situation to Morgan, the situation wasn't handled properly. The attendant mistakenly thought my cousin was intoxicated but couldn't walk alone to do anything. One of the officers asked was she intoxicated or something else was wrong with her and I replied, yes she's legally blind. His answer to me was she doesn't look blind to me. By this time I was livid and wanted something to be done about this at this particular point. Morgan insisted that I had an attitude but again its how the situation was handled so I had to stand my grounds. Morgan even said to me you better be lucky I am in this uniform and I'm a changed man. I responded back, what are you getting at because I'm not going to back down from you at all. After the going back and forth, Morgan declined for us to gain access to the club again. I asked Morgan to call for us a Uber to pick us up and take us back to the hotel that we were staying at(Tropicana). Morgan answer was for us to walk back to the hotel in which was 2 miles away. Morgan walked us back in the casino where he told us to have a seat. We thought he was going to get the attendant's supervisor but we sat there 20 mins waiting and nothing. I then said, I needed to express my concerns to someone else because this isn't right. Working in a night or casino atmosphere, there should be more training in these areas like TAP. Once I walked over to the restroom and requested an ESV supervisor, I talked with Teresa and she was very helpful. Teresa walked us over to the security podium and we spoke with Melinda(supervisor)and she was extremely helpful. After we expressed our concerns with her, she walked us to the front so we can catch the Uber that was waiting on us. I will never return to the facility and wouldn't recommend this place. This isn't how you treat disabled customers.

The hotel was fine, but don't play their slot machines. I got bonuses and didn't win a dollar. The casino is a large open space, but they don't have a big selection of machines.  In the gift shop, I paid over $9 for deodorant and over $4 for a bar of soap.

DO NOT Pay for parking at the check in desk if you self park! You will still be charged for parking when exiting the parking lot!!! And the Hotel will not refund you because they are saying the parking co is an outside third party company!

Not a fan of this hotel except the buffet and the Forum Shops. Staff unfriendly, rooms old, plumbing problems and bad atmosphere. 
Can't understand why people would stay here instead of the Bellagio.

Love!!! Timeless!!! It will always have a high place for me when considering where to stay or at least stop at. We always love to walk the forum stores and do some people watching.  There is a huge H&M, cute cigar lounge and a wonderful show you can watch across from a fat tuesday. The salon does great facials and nail services with a reasonable price. Definitely worth stopping by and great location right in the middle of the strip.

I booked months ago for my birthday trip a suite with a connector QQ room- the day of (today!) I get an email to pre check in, so I do. I notice the connector email confirmation now says connector King (we have 5 grown women for this suite). I go back to my original confirmation and it says clearly connector QQ. I call. here the nightmare begins. Im on hold 30min, then 30min then 30min and so to finally be told they don't have my room. Well they have it but it is held for a 7 star quest. Nothing I can do this late. Leaving me with zero options. its a busy weekend in vegas. I booked out back in August. Can NOT believe the horrible customer service. Seems they decided I am no-one once I do not track my points here to be their 7 star customer, and so taking away the room I booked they are ok with the causality. What a way to ruin someones 40Th birthday. I still have no idea what we are going to do as I am typing and I am so upset. Who does this? I hope their 7 star guest is worth ruing a birthday trip. I have gals flying in and am in disbelief.

Just got off the phone with the 'Manager' who says she believes we will have our room we booked, she acted as though she was doing me the favor not that they had made an error and are ruining our trip before it even starts.  Apparently even through I have an email for the suite with conector room clearly starting 2 Queen beds this is NOT a guarantee.  This is a suite and clearly starts the beds.  I wouldn't have booked this otherwise, we have 5 grown women, no way would I have booked thinking we could end up with one bed in the connector room versus the 2 beds.  

BEWARE- apparently if you ever travel with someone and want to share a room and think you are booking 2 beds you could end up with one bed.  No where else does this.  When i travel with my kids and need 2 queens I book and pay for 2 queens, it's not a guessing game of what I will end up with.

At the very end, she says 'we figured it out and have the room you need, (that I BOOKED!!! IN AUGUST!!) but no guarantee, it's pretty sure but not for sure, but have a safe travels and don't worry'  I explain kindly as I can, do you realize what you are saying?  So I am suppose to go all day not knowing if we have a place to properly sleep or not?  even though my confirmations in AUGUST say we have exactly what I 'need' and what I booked?  

What a nightmare-

Horrible experience!
1. Rude check-in.
2. Faulty keys.
3. Double booked room occupied with other guests.
4. Our new room smelled awful and the cleaning was sub par.
5. The "free" breakfast was a joke.
Its a great spot in order to stay and one of the most famous destinations however the assistance is not so wonderful and by this I mean the personal.

DONT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!

It was my first trip to Vegas ...I had trouble experience 
First I made reservation through Hotels.com and requested 2 connected rooms since my mom on wheelchair .
The receptionist was so rude and was yawning all the time. He checked me in and gave me the keys for my room and told me" sorry since you made reservation through third party we cannot honored your request and there is nothing we can do to help!!! Really!!
I got room at the 10th floor and my mom at the 15th floor which been such a hassle for her.
Got to the room and even though we claimed my son through our reservation there was no bed for him so I had to call to request a bed. After 15 min there was no bed ...my husband called again and after 30 no bed I have been told I can leave the room and when we are back the bed should be there.
I got back to the room after 2 hours and still NO BED!!!

At the check out  I have been asked if my visit was pleasant and I informed them that it was horrible all I got SORRY !
This is our first visit to the hotel and Vegas and this will be the last visit to the hotel.
My mom visiting from out the county and I really wanted to make her feel special .
I hope this will help you to improve your service !!!

This review is only for the valet parking service at caesar's palace. I left my car with the valet parking service. The guy who took my car seemed ok. The Asian girl who brought me my car has no business being a valet. I drive a 2013 Toyota Prius which is one of the most common cars on the road. She screeched my tires and said she couldn't find my brakes. A Toyota Prius is so common. She acted like she's never seen or driven one before. If that's the case, Caesar's should train their valets or give a basic test when hiring valets. When I drove off, I noticed the incompetent valet popped open my hood.

I am torn on what rating to give this place so I gave it a three star. 

PROs - Location is awesome. Hotel is very nice. We stayed at the Augustus Tower and we had a great view of the strip. Our room is freaking huge and I love the bathroom (his and hers sink, whirlpool tub, huge shower). The pool is great too. I also love that it's connected to the Forum Shops. My bank account definitely suffered a bit because of that. 

CONs - We stayed there for 5 days and the chambermaid only cleaned our room ONCE. What was that about? For the money we're paying, I was expecting the room to be cleaned EVERY SINGLE DAY. Of course, I did not leave a tip. For what?

The pool can get crazy and I hate that people who are not staying at the hotel can access the pool for a fee. They're so rowdy and obnoxious too. Oh and the drinks? $12 bucks for a daiquiri mix coming out of a slushy machine? I know this is Vegas but really? 12 bucks?

What is up with the long lines at the registration desk? Ridiculous because with the amount of guests coming in, there should be more than 5 people working behind the desk.

Will join in keeping this simple:

Check in kiosk: Neat but the new mechanical airport-esque kiosks aren't incredibly user friendly with ID's from certain states we were informed. Didn't seem to take well to Colorado.

Hotel Room Cleanliness: Questionable stains on cloth furniture. And in general everything is chipping from the wood to the paint. 

Gambling: Better than hotel room cleanliness.

I've been told this place is better than a lot of the other options on the strip... Unfortunately I'm just not seeing it. The ONE THING it does have going for it is that it is the closest hotel in proximity to Absinthe (which is absolutely amazing). But if you're looking to do Vegas in style... Keep looking if you find yourself at Caesar's.

It's HUGE!! (In my Trump voice). This hotel is a monster. So big. So many towers. So many shops. So many things to do. So much money to spend. So little time. We did not stay here in the hotel but we visited it and it was great. Loved walking thru the forum area with the shops and the "sky" roof. Apparently Jerry Seinfeld does shows here Friday's and Saturdays ! Wish we came at that time! Omnia the club is here too. Lots of nice restaurants. This is a must visit. It's a little older than the other hotels for sure which is very evident when you visit the ladies room compared to the newer hotels. The decor is gorgeous and I enjoyed the experience so much. Even if you don't gamble or drink (very few folks in Las Vegas fit that description  ), you will still find something to do at Caesars!

FYI I'm their #1776 review. God Bless America

Me and my buddy came here on New years Eve. 

Lets say you have about two hundred bucks in your pocket. Your buddy does as well. You live in California too. You feel spontanious and decide to go to Vegas. 

Well here is what to do. Fill up the tank. Also bring a bag of nice clothes. Then make sure once you get to Vegas fill up the gas tank again. Then go to the top floor of Caesars palace parking lot and park the ride. You could change in the parking lot if you want or you could go to a local 24 hour fitness if you have a membership and change there. 

Then once your there you can club hop, gamble , eat , play cards, hook up. But, be careful there are alot of hotties who are really hookers. You could waste your time thinking your gaming when really it is just a hooker. They happen to be drop dead gorgeous too. So I would talk to the girls with slight flaws. The ones that look perfect are probably hookers. Easy way to spot them is if they happen to be talking to an old dude with money. Drinks alone can cost you 100 bucks for the whole night per person. Save like twenty to thirty to get into the club that seems to be popping the most. The clubs in Vegas are far nicer than Californias. Also far more expensive. But, the good times are rolling all around the place. Obviously if you have never been to Vegas you have to go at least once in your life. 

Oops I almost forgot if you really are low on cash you could drive to the rest stop on the way back and sleep.
It was like one big mall inside of here. Yes it is visually appealing but the place is pretty much one big indoor mall. Stores everywhere. You can get lost inside of here I have ahha.

Ah, Caesar's...you disappoint me. You're employee parking area on East Flamingo Road is always filthy! Everyone sees this as they drive or walk by and it's highly disgusting! Beer bottles, paper, escort cards...ICK!

My wife and I booked a king non-smoking room.  When we arrived we were informed that our room was not yet ready and that we would have to wait 1-2 hours.  The front desk staff member informed us that the only comparable room available was a double queen non-smoking.  There are several reasons I wouldn't have considered this a "comparable" room.  Namely, a second bed is rather useless for a guest party of two individuals, the beds were smaller than the one I had actually booked, and the bathroom configuration for the double queen did not include the separate spa tub which was included in my originally booked room.  At no point did the front desk member offer any form of consolation (e.g., drinks, food, casino credits, late checkout, extended stay), nothing.  When I asked if it would be possible to be placed in the queen room and be moved when the king was ready, I was denied.  

After flying in and spending a long day lugging our luggage around the strip, waiting for check-in time, we were essentially being told that we couldn't have what we had paid for and if we didn't like it, oh well.  

My wife and I decided to take the queen room in lieu of waiting the additional 1-2 hours.  I spoke with the front desk later and requested a late check-out but I was initially denied until I explained the situation my wife and I had experienced at check-in.
 

I am extremely dissatisfied with the truly minimal effort the staff put forth with regard to resolving this problem.  This was my first trip to Las Vegas and I had insisted to my wife, who has been to Vegas multiple times, that we stay at Caesar's because it was, to me, synonymous with Las Vegas.  The hotel's lack of preparedness and the staff's seemingly non-customer oriented mindset will be remembered as a black mark on my first Las Vegas experience and my perception of Caesar's Palace.

Reviewing the Augustus Tower only. 

Self-Parking: Make sure to drop off all of your heavy luggage in front with someone and have them check-in because to self-park you will have a 10-15 minute walk... and the person that went to check will most likely still be waiting to check-in. Take a picture of where you parked!

Staff: Friendly & more than happy to answer all of  your questions. Great attitudes! Lisa was especially helpful for so if you need assistance\/special requests, look for her if you can (curly brown hair). 

Room: Perfect for every couple because of the views of the strip & the Bellagio Fountains!! Modern decor, clean, spacious & worth every penny you will spend! 
Funny that there was a phone by the toilet but still gross as hell. Who would touch that?? 

Went to the bar closest to check-in and it's a comfy spot to just chill with friends\/fam and drink\/sip\/talk\/watch people walking by lol. Drinks are of course a bit $$, but it's to be expected. Servers constantly walk by ready for drink orders & selling cigars. 

Haven't been to the pool or other parts of the hotel yet but next time. Can't wait to go back!

Caesars is no palace. Plan to double whatever rate you get online. We arrived at 1:00pm and were told our room wasn't ready. Really? But we could pay $30 for early check in. I asked if we could hang out at the pool till 4:00 but the rude check in attendant said no, we would need a key (not true).

We then asked for a late checkout and were told we could get 12:00 noon instead of 11:00. I got to the room at 10:55 and was already locked out. Went downstairs and the check in line is an hour or more. I am waiting in line to get BACK into my room so I can get out of here.

Be prepared to be nickel and dimed to death. I would never recommend this hotel. Customer service and friendliness is non-existent, it's a take it or leave it situation.
I definitely recommend the Octavius and Augustus towers. Room was fabulous since it was newer. I also appreciated how close the towers exited to the strip.

Me and my family stayed in Caesar's last month. And the place is grandeur. It is beautiful and quite spacious. The Forum Shops contain numerous stores, such as a 3-STORY H&M store, Louis Vuitton, etc etc. There is definitely a lot of stores and boutiques. The front of the hotel is so beautiful. 

The swimming pools of Caesar's Palace. There were so many pools with a massive one in the middle. Beware: the Pina Colada costs 11 bucks. no exaggeration, no lie. 

the hotel is in a nice spot relative to the Strip. Close to a lot of big hotels. i just can't stress the beauty of this place enough. The front and the inside and the pools...Caesar's was absolutely beautiful. There's spas for you, dining.

I think what's impressive is the Forum Shops, shopping section (east wing) of Caesar's Palace. Holds probably about what? over 100 shops? 
Do keep in mind these stores are high-priced stores. There is an antique store , having like 1980s or 1990s or before 1960s and such posters with autographs. Pretty cool to look at. 

So if you don't mind pricy shopping, Forum Shops are the way to go.
If you have children along, definitely try the pools at least once. 
Again, the hotel is convenient in terms of location on the Strip (in the middle).

I really liked this hotel. Very big and not small at all. I had fun.

My husband booked a room in the Forum tower (through Costco) and we were upgraded to a suite when we arrived.  It was very nice in terms of size and comfort, but it could have used a little updating (chipped paint, worn textiles, etc.). For a free upgrade, it was fabulous, but I think I would have been annoyed if we paid rack rate for it.  

The Forum tower was very convenient for the pool and for parking.  We had a bit of difficulty locating any empty lounges at the pool, but we eventually found two and had a good time.  The poolside drinks were a bit pricey, but I think that's true of all similar situations.  

All of the employees with whom we interacted were extremely friendly and helpful.  We were very happy with our experience here, and we will likely stay here again.

This is a honest review I'm about to write here. First of all, let me just say I don't normally write reviews about any place that's good or bad. However, this is an exception because this has gone far enough. 

I frequent their SportsBook to watch games and place some wagers. Let's just say I see every part of the service sector that goes on in that place. 

YOU WON'T GET GOOD SERVICE UNLESS YOU ARE WHITE. 

Yes, that's absolutely correct. You will get profiled and you will be treated with a second class service. Everyday tourists who are not white do not know that it is being done on purpose. 

This includes Bartenders, servers, casino staff and even the representatives at the wager counter. I've seen this day in and day out. I personally have had profiling and bad service given to me many times by different people. 

Short Asian Bartender at the SportsBook bar is by far the worst. He has treated me with hostility. He proceeds to ask for my ID with an attitude even though he has served me before and I had a wagering free drink ticket. Note to everyone: you cannot wager unless you're 21 and above in order to receive a free drink ticket. I have explained this to him before even though he knew the procedure. Anyhow, he will serve a white person first before any other person of any race. I have witness this many times before. He is as arrogant as you can get towards people who are not white. I will get his name next time as I have not seen his name tag properly every time I had an encounter with him. 

No, I'm not white. I don't dress to impress (although, I dress well). I speak fluent English and born in America. I have money and education. I'm not racist nor am I prejudice. I have friends and family from different races and background ethnicities. 

These are based on my personal experiences and observations. This place only cares about a FORM of a person, not a SUBSTANCE the person has. 

This place needs a lot of training when it comes to accommodating people of different background. 

Why do I keep going back there? Well, I like their SportsBook. That's it.

Will not stay here again going back to staying at the Venetian! Better service and bigger suites! Caesars parking situation was rediculous charging people staying the night for parking because they can't handle the amount of people?? That's a joke, they also require a large deposit even after u already paid for the room which I have not seen at other Vegas hotels. Was looking forward to staying here but left dissapointed...

I recently stayed in the Palace Tower and was not impressed.  The room and bathroom was large and spacious.  However, it was noisy all weekend.  It sounded like there was construction going on in the hallway.  The walk from the front door to the tower elevators goes through the casino and you have to walk through all the second hand smoke.  Also, there was ALOT of black mold in the shower.  The view was nice though overlooking the pool.  If i stayed here again, I would not choose the Palace Tower.

Ceasers Palace is so classic Vegas. Always the same everytime we come here. Never stay here being that its too over priced and over rated for me.

Nice place to gamble, take pics, great restaurants, shopping and their new club is pretty dope. This casino is such a nostalgic vegas spot you just gotta come to when you visit.

We checked in around 2am on 6\/19.  The front desk wait time was 25 minutes and there was only two groups ahead of us.  When we got our turn we were told we were upgraded which was $50ish more per night which we were excited about as this was a trip to celebrate a couple things. This was our babymoon and my husbands birthday celebration.  We've always wanted to stay at Cesar's so we were super happy after we go to our room and saw how many relaxing options we had.  Double shower, jacuzzi bathtub and a spacious room.  

We finally got settled and in bed around 4am to be woken up at 7am with the sound of drilling, hammering and loud vibrating.  After trying to sleep through it a couple hours, we called the front desk to ask what was happening above us and the lady was very apologetic and advised us that we should've been notified at check-in and there should be a notification letter in our room about the construction on the floors above us.  Which neither of those had happened as we never would've paid additional to cut into our rest and relaxation as that is something vey important to us. It was frustrating that we paid for an upgrade but was never advised of the construction at all.  She then said she would waive our resort fee for the night and we could possibly move rooms on 6\/21 which would be our last night.   She then advised me to go to the front desk and speak with the manager to make those arrangements or discuss other options.  

I went to the front desk and the agent was very condescending and gave information that was opposite of what the previous agent gave.  She said "I am surprised you can hear the construction it's no where near you.  It's nearly 20 floors away.  It cannot be that loud where you are."  I then said that regardless we were not notified and I just spoke with someone who gave information that contradicts that and the previous agent advised us to see the front desk manager less than 30 minutes ago and that we never would've paid more for something that would interrupt our rest.  She then responded that "you got an exceptional deal on that room so you should be happy and that it normally is a $200 a night upgrade."  Again she dismissed the request and said she would speak to her manager.  She disappeared for about 5 minutes and came back, no manager with her and said "all we will do is move you to a non-upgraded room or we can waive the fee for two of the three nights."  I said I would like to discuss it with my husband but he's trying to rest so I would be back with our decision and she became very short with me and said "you should call him, you don't want to save $100?"  At this point I now knew customer satisfaction was not the priority and accepted the $100 offer.  It was never about the money it was about the lack of sincerity and absolute dishonesty and disrespectful tone she used towards me.  

This experience is enough for us to avoid Cesar's in the future and not recommend it to anyone as the least we expect is respectful behavior from the staff as we are respectful people.  Additionally, the construction started everyday 7am on the dot so we're leaving Vegas more exhausted than when we arrived.

One of my favorite casinos. Home of my favorite buffet and other restaurants I enjoy dining at. Nike town is also located here. Huge two story of nike products. H & M which 3 stories. 
Infamous forum shops filled with tourist and locals. Huge statues all over the casino. I bring my family here all time because my son loves the large aquarium next to Cheesecake Factory. He'll just sit there and play with the fishes for hours. 

Can't come here without thinking of The Hangover movie lol. check it out. It has a lot to offer for the whole family.

We had a group of 14 for my sisters bachelorette party. We had 4 rooms with majority of the group that stayed at Caesars palace. The remainder of party of 5 stayed at another hotel. The 2 rooms that our family stayed in was fabulous and very comfortable. However, the shower and the sink drainage was clogged, we had to shower with our feet soaked in water... It was so gross! We called for service the next day, it was too late in the night trying to figure this out. Day two, our second room  had issues with the key cards. The key cards would de activate every time we used it. Each and every time we returned to our room we had get new keys. Not only was this an Inconvenience, it was really time consuming. We almost missed our show because they only had 3 staff working and the manager Carol didn't even bother to hop on to assist the guest. After 25 mins of waiting in line, I had to ask the manager to get more assistance because were going to be late for our show. Some of us needed to freshen up before heading out and had no idea it was going to take over 1\/2 hour to get new key cards. So, make sure you have at least an hour saved up to get back into your hotel room. Caesars palace worker bees "front desk clerks" is so slow and short staffed. After waiting for an half an hour, Carol finally assists us and we went all the way up to the hotel room and found that the keys doesn't work. We've tried to get some assistance by calling the front desk but no one picked up, I've hanged up after 5 mins. Personally, I would not recommend this place if you are going to Vegas for an important event. We were there for 3 nights and lost counts of the amount of time we had to waste to get new key cards. They really need to upgrade their services by offering a key card envelope\/ holder - also, one of the front desk clerk was so rude!!!! You shouldn't have put the room key with your credit cards or cell phone, it deactivates it. REALLY??!!! Who doesn't own a phone or a credit card, that means, this happens to all of the guests that is staying here.
Beautiful hotel! The buffet is soooo good too! I got sick eating too much seafood but it was worth it... haha

Like! The hotel is beautiful. Great location, right in the middle of the strip. No reason to spend more for other hotels near by. 
Go there!

The rooms here are really nice.  I stayed here for the first time a few weeks ago but I got lost the instant I walked in.  The elevator to the room was over at the treasure island.
