I havent stayed here, but I was in the hotel in October of 2013. Me and my friends went to Fat Tuesday's on the strip, and then we began to wander into all of the hotels and gamble\/eat\/whatever. We ended up at Caesar's and by then our drinks were almost empty. One of my friends said that Caesar's has its own Fat Tuesday. We went up to some employee (some older lady) & asked her where the Fat Tuesdays was. She responded very rudely "...well it looks like you all already have one" (Mind you, no one was even close to drunk, we got the smaller cups to start with so everyone was entirely fine, she was just cranky) & we told her that we were almost out and wanted new drinks. She ROLLED HER EYES at us & responded "wow... scary that you guys are our future generation..." and then turned away. LIKE REALLY?! Dont you realize you are working in LAS VEGAS?!

This is for the awesome pools..didn't stay at Ceasers
Does cost to get in $50.00 (30.00 men-ladies 20.00) lawn chaise and seating in pool ( which is where you will be in June) is free.
4 pools to play in lots of sunscreen 
Only shade is either cabana $$$ or play in the water black jack, very cool. bucket of chilled beer is $40.00
....NOW The VENUS POOL CLUB IS different property but on Ceasers Proprty another 30.00 guys ladies free, lounge 30.00! So $50.00 initial doors of pool house then roped off entrance for Venus and additional feeS
PAY TO PLAY AT THIS POOL!!
Overall I wouldn't pay addtn VENUS FEES for a topples view. Have fun

Long story short - beautiful pool and friendly dealers (gregarious, sweet, and full of stories). Do not book the Roman Tower (didn't even realize they had different tier towers). I'm used to comped rooms at the Water Club \/ Borgata in AC - and they blow the Roman Tower rooms out of the water. 

Very dated (think Trump Plaza in AC - now defunct). The water pressure was horrid. Should have brought it up, but was so exasperated I wimped out. In-Laws stayed at the Forum Tower - slightly better so deferred that room to them. The dining is decent, but Venetian\/Palazzo has them beat on both dining and hotels. 

Also the rewards system is a bit lackluster. The comps earned here vs. what I might earn at Borgata are $20 vs. $150 ($200-$1000\/hand for approx 3 hours). I stopped when I won enough to pay for the trip and realized the comps weren't accumulating at all. I don't play for comps, but it puts a bad taste in my mouth so went elsewhere. 

If you can get it for the right price and aren't looking for sleek or stylish rooms, it's a decent property to stay at due to its location on the Strip and the pool. Be sure to hit up the Bacchanal Buffet and the Mesa Grill while you're there!

This is based on the Buffet alone

Don't let the extravagance and massive size of Caesar's Palace
distract you from how freaking horrible their buffet was.
I'm not sure if this rule works but when you go to a buffet for dinner in
Las Vegas and no one is in line for it, I'm thinking it is a first warning.

The eating area looks nice enough, but when you see the spread
it is just awful, at no point should you pay $25+ for a buffet
and you're able to be at one end of the buffet and you can see the other
end of it, the buffet was THAT short. It was just unimpressive.
I don't know about you, but when I go to a buffet, i like SELECTION.
Thank goodness they had snow crab legs because if they hadn't
i would've FLIPPED, so of course i tried to get my meal's worth.

The food in general was just unappetizing for my eyes and my stomach.
Avoid the buffet at all costs.

I was speechless when we got to our rooms!! Very Speechless!!

Thank you to my hubby for taking care of the reservations. 
& Wow! What a special day to check in,  
on our 19th Anniversary. 2.9.2015 

Ceasars Palace is huge!! very huge!!
 My hubby had to show me how to get to our rooms a few times, 
but I still can't get to it on my own. 
He has to drop me off to the room, before he hits the casino.

Hubby got the deluxe room @ Octavius Tower. WOW!! 
Its very beautiful & huge!! Very Beautiful & Huge!! 
We stayed here for 2 nights, ( wish we could stay longer here)

The bathroom comes with a Jacuzzi, his & her sink, & walk in shower. 
+ television + telephone. 

The bed is so comfortable, I couldn't wake up the nexts  2 mornings!!

We didn't make it to the Forum Shops, so sad!!
 (Only 2 days here, not enough time!! )
LOL-ness, we would come to the Forum Shops on our other Vegas Visits but when we stayed here, we didn't make it to the Forum Shops at all. 

Just FYI: We removed a bottle of beer to put our water bottle in, but forgot to put the bottle of beer back in the fridge. This was on our bill right after we checked out. Wow!! how did they pick that up so fast, I called Ceasars to get  a credit on the beer. 
Also they charge a resort fee of 28.00 per day.

The parking lot is very far to our room, We had "fun" getting our luggage and shopping bags to the room & car.  

To Sum it up-
We really enjoyed our stay, I didn't want to leave!! I was so sad, when it was time to check out. :(

I am blessed to have such a wonderful hubby & an opportunity to stay here for our 19th!!  :0)

This was my first trip to Vegas and definitely my Last trip to Caesars Palace. This was my honeymoon night, and I had a friend recommend this horrible place. When I dropped off my car, I was going to just carry all of my luggage to my room. But they insisted they carried my ice chest for me. Whatever, I'd rather not wait for my luggage by if they really wanted to carry it, I wont stop them. Then as I was checking in they were hesitate to check me my reservation because I had a temporary ID. After waiting long enough minutes, they finally let me check out my room. When we finally got to the room, there was a guy that came to drop off the ice chest. Now this is my first night, I didnt know that I was supposed to give the bellhop a ticket, I just suspected he was going to drop it off. When he asked for the ticket, I just asked "Oh, am I suppose to give it to you?" and he replies with attitude with "Yeah" I cant emphasize it online, but it is definitely not a way to talk to your guests. Then we go downstairs to the casino, but it turns out they wont let me gamble or drink because of my temporary ID. I am of age, but they still wouldnt let me. Ended up spending the night OUTSIDE of the hotel because the hotel I paid for doesn't even want me to pay for any of their activities. (Though they'll supply me with overpriced liquor in my room. Funny isn't it?). When the honeymoon was supposed to begin, we were disappointed to find out that the showers didn't even have hot water.

With that night finished, we were going to leave (not sad to leave), and just used their express drop-off feature they have because their lines were long. When we called in later to complain they said we didn't even check out, and were going to charge us another night. They finally decided to check us out for that one night, and when I then complain about everything that happened, their customer service rep, Jose, only had sorry to say. No sincerity to it at all, apparently "sorry" is good enough for them to fix a  honeymoon that they ruined. Well "sorry" for the bad review, and "sorry" for not coming back ever again.
Worst cab line ever. 30 cabs waiting.  30 people waiting.  1 Ceasar employee putting people into the cabs.  If he wasn't there, it would have been more efficient.

Cesars is a nice hotel & they sure has grown over the years. The mall is a big attraction for shoppers. Can't say that its one of my favorite casino's to hang out & gamble in. There's not a lot of tables or slot machines compared to other hotels on the strip. 
They have some really nice rooms, more in the newer towers but it's gotten so expensive to stay there. Room rates are ridiculous!! 
It's a great location on the strip where there are other hotels & attractions within walking distance. 
Not sure if the buffet has changed over the past several years but when I went with some friends in town I was so embarrassed!! Smallest buffet I've ever seen & couldn't believe it. Was soooo disappointed with it!

My kids were impressed with the downstairs bathroom which had a vanity area for make up sessions!  

Beautiful hotel with lots of shops and the cool ceiling.  Didn't venture too far only to the food court and took some pictures in front of Gordon Ramsey's and Bobby Flay's restaurants, just because they were too expensive and busy to actually eat there.  Instead, we tried the food court and were still satisfied, although pricey of course as expected inside a fancy hotel.

I love this hotel.  The rooms are luxurious and spacious the restaurants are a plenty and the buffet is hands down the best buffet in town.

The shopping in the Forum shops is some of the best, from luxury like Prada and Gucci to affordable like H&M you cannot go wrong.

The place is just truly amazing and worth every dime to stay here.

0 Stars!!!!! Beware of false advertisement on their website about room types!!!!! 
I booked a room with 2 queen beds,non-smoking and strip view in Laurel Tower. It says right in the selection box that this particular room features two queen beds and shows 2 queen beds in the picture. It also says these rooms are nonsmoking rooms.

NO PLACE IN THE SELECTION BOX DOES IT SAY YOU COULD GET ONE BED OR A SMOKING ROOM INSTEAD. IT LEADS YOU TO BELIEVE THAT THIS IS A SPECIFIC ROOM THAT HAS 2 QUEEN BEDS AND NON-SMOKING AND A STRIP VIEW.

I checked in at a kiosk at hotel and got to room and it was one bed and a smoking room. When I talked to the supervisor on phone she said no guarantee and in my email confirmation (I did not read), it said no guarantee of room type!! So email confirmation note is different from what i purchased but since i didn't read the email confirmation which was different I could not get money back and no room with 2 beds or non smoking which I had to have both since I was there with brother had to have 2 beds and I am allergic to tobacco so had to have non-smoking. I  NEVER would Knowingly book a room with no guarantee of 2 beds and non-smoking. Finally after an hour or more of arguing they gave me money back but our Christmas Eve was ruined by then and all of our plans had to be cancelled. DONT STAY HERE, DECEPTIVE MARKETING PRACTICE!!!!!!!

I will be letting more websites like yelp know about my experience and try to reach as many as possible. Cesars Palace ruined my Christmas with my family visiting me from out of state and no amount of money can change the lost time. This should never happen to anyone, so wrong, hotel so unprofessional.

7 star guest treated terribly from Get Go I stayed all the Caesars Entertainment Properties for more than 20 years this year 2016 at the Rio Las Vegas during the WSOP poker championships was my worst  stay ever I was in the wrong suite to begin with no hot tub no view of the pools and I was told if I needed a room change they would see if they could upgrade me being Seven Stars they automatically put you on the top level with the greatest View somebody had it out for me here is my analysis the common area pool has a hot tub that had been shut down for two months prior to my stay I came in on June 23r to July 19th it took 12 days for the hot tub to be fixed I asked for a couple hundred dollars credit to my room stay they denied it the water policy is 4 Waters per person I had never heard of this I have pancreatitis and suffer from sciatica pain the medication I take deals with the central nervous system I was unusually thirsty and ask for more water because I complained and received a phone call from Michelle Hsu who is the director of Casino marketing for the properties Rio and Harrah's she started off by telling me" my standards are too high for the hotels" and" this relationship doesn't seem like a good one" , she should have said "what can I do for you" or" how can I help you" that is the professional way to approach a situation ,she said I would be getting a call in a couple weeks long story short I was barred off all properties and stripped of my 7stars status , is this how you treat any guest with loyalty no if you complain about anything they will get rid of you I hope they make the proper changes and get rid of the employees that are the bad apples

Caesar's Palace is a super sexy resort! What turn me off was how you pay all this money to stay here and they place you in the "Roman tower" WARRING!! When you book a room here, ask them where will you be staying & if they say "Roman tower" cancel & get your money back ASAP! I can't believe such a beautiful hotel have this part that look like it belong in old Vegas. I know it's The original building but damn it's 2015 no upgrades? They trick you into paying a arm & leg & you get put in a damn Circus Circus room look-alike. I even asked how could I stay in the new rooms? The customer service rep stated... You can't... I guess I don't fit the sexy nor does my money to stay in the new parts. Lesson learned won't make the same mistakes again. 2 stars for being beautiful resort. -3 stars for the room, Customer service & and flat out trickery.

Hotel from the Hell!!! Stay away at any cost and save you health!!! Reserved non-smoking room in advance (30 days before an arrival). Have severe allergy on a tobacco products. Had to travel to Vegas due training and conference. Used express check-in at the morning, got confirmation e-mail, had to stay in a line for 35 minutes, - "sorry, online check-in doesn't work like intended". Especially mentioned that I need non smoking room. Got in a room....room smelts like 100 years old tobacco house. Told by unfrinedly help desk person that it's OK to sleep in a smoking room, not a big deal. Had to escalate to the manager. After 10 minutes she promised to clean non-smoking room, but I have to wait 1-2 hours or just suck it up.

Stayed there for the first time. Room was filthy. There was jelly (or something like it) smeared on the wall and all over the nightstand and telephone. There was debris on the floor. A used nicotine patch was stuck to the bathtub!  Housekeeping was slow to respond but guest services gave us a credit on food and resort fees. However we will not stay there again. Other than the room, the casino and forum shops are worth a visit.

Casino only... one dealer skipped my action three times.  Next dealer couldn't remember the bets and quibble over $2, when he was in the wrong. Then he started touching chips like he was about to end the hand. Of course, reminding him I was still in the hand encouraged others to fold.  Same dealer short changed an all-in bet after a re-raise. I played for more than 2 hours and was never asked about drink service.  Horrible service! I really expected better.

I loved Caesars Palace! I scored a killer deal for a Forum Tower room with a King Bed (queens were extra.) When I checked in, I asked for 2 queens instead and they gave them to me free of charge. Our stay was great from Dec 20-24. The hotel is centrally located on the Strip so it's close to everything and has a Deuce stop right in front. 
We were also right next to the food court and the Forum Shops with all the stores, which was great! My only complaint is that the water bottle in the room cost a whopping $7 and the cost wasn't clear. Also, the casino has a HEAVY smoke smell. More than some others on the strip and it can be a bit unpleasant. Next time I would like to stay in another tower because the Forum was a little far back. 

We were also able to take advantage of the Spa which was great. I definitely recommend Caesar's Palace!

If I could give negative stars, I would. The rooms were dirty and old. The customer service was like nothing I have ever encountered.I felt truly disrespected and didn't feel like I was cared for whatsoever.

 There are no jacuzzis.

 They charge awful resort fees and rooms are ridiculously overpriced.

It was really not an enjoyable experience and I will NEVER stay here again.

The comedy "The Hangover" has had such an effect on Caesars Palace's image in the public eye in recent years that they've started to produce merchandise that basically play on Alan's quote on whether or not "Caesar lived here." When I saw said merchandise last weekend in the Forum shops (i.e.: the mall at Caesars Palace), admitting that they "get that a lot," I actually chuckled. The marketing for the resort is basically packaged nicely for the next decade for them.

Caesars Palace (for those who noticed, it's without the apostrophe) is one of the largest hotel\/resorts in the United States, if not THE largest (or constantly vying for it at least, depending on what your parameters are). Supposedly, the name of the resort doesn't contain the apostrophe because it's meant to be plural and inclusive (i.e.: this "Palace" is not exclusive to [Julius] Caesar, but to all who spend time and money here; i.e.: other "Caesars" like you, the patron (or "patrician," if you'd like)). 

Its theme is Ancient Rome during the imperial era. The architecture is monumental and imitates the former grandeur of the Roman Empire. The Forum mall is actually aptly named and was the first mall that was enclosed, but made you feel like you were outside Ancient Rome (complete with atmospheric changes that cycle through periodically). Even now, it's among the top five most successful shopping malls in America. I remember when I was a child being very impressed with the Forum mall, and quite honestly, I still enjoy walking through here whenever I'm visiting Las Vegas. If only more malls could find a theme like that and stick with it consistently throughout the facility.

If you enter the Forum mall through Las Vegas Boulevard, you'll likely see the spiraling escalators. They're one of only a handful in the world, and if you don't know where the rest are, it doesn't matter. This is by far the most impressive presentation of it. Nearby, there's also those talking statues of the Gods of the Festival. If you haven't seen a presentation yet, you'll need to, just to be able to say you did. Though it's a bit cheesy now, it was pretty impressive to a small child when it first debuted many, many years ago (i.e.: me).

As of this writing, Celine Dion is currently the house act here at the Coliseum (again, aptly named for the performing art center at Caesars), and apparently, she's one of the biggest shows in Las Vegas. I haven't seen her show yet, though I did like that Titanic theme she sang back in 1997 for film. Reason enough to see an act, I suppose.

I only noticed ONE person who actually got into the Ancient Rome theme this weekend and wore a Roman toga. He could have been part of a stag or bachelor's party or whatnot, but that got me thinking that Caesars should promote more of their patrons and some staff members to don period attire if they got 'em. Roman Empire, cosplay and history buffs would probably get off on such a sight.

Just like the hotel itself, I think it's a monumental task to describe all the elements of the resort in one review. You really should just take a moment to browse the pictures here on Yelp to get an idea of the kinds of things you'll see at Caesars Palace if you've never been inside before. There's just way too much detail in the events, rooms, casino, retail, restaurants, clubs, etc. to accurately describe and stay under the character limit.

On a personal note, I have to mention that back in the summer of 2003 or 2004, I recall coming across Chris "Jesus" Ferguson (the poker player) at the Pure nightclub here at Caesars while on a weekend trip with some college friends. I took a picture with him outside in the patio area and still have that picture here at my desk as I'm writing this review. I honestly, have never had any bad experiences with Caesars, and it seems that, despite not actually having stayed a night here, I find myself visiting the Palace basically every time I'm around town.

Hail Caesar!

Husband had a work conference at Caesar's, so that's how we ended up staying at this hotel. The package included a Palace Tower room (at $200\/night). Knowing how much it costs probably (does) factor into my rating of the room. 

I attempted to get an upgrade at check-in, but for $50 extra a night, no thanks. Also, no non-smoking king rooms available, so husband and I got to squeeze into a double bed together, how fun! Haven't done that since college. 

Upon entering the room, husband immediately said, "This is probably the worst room I've stayed in in a long time," if that tells you anything. It's not necessarily that the room was BAD, it wasn't, it was just dated. And for $200 a night, it's ridiculous, compared to the deals I can find in Vegas for that kind of dough. 

The television (maybe 22"..wtf) didn't work when we arrived, but a quick call to guest services and the tv was functioning again. Damn, I wanted a better room.

I was hoping for two queen beds since we were forced out of a king, but nope. Double beds it is. 

The room has two bathrooms essentially, connected by the shower. I thought it was cool at first. Then I realized how convenient it would have been to have double sinks next to each other. You see, we only brought one tube of toothpaste and face wash. I had to retrieve it from the other sink every time I need it. There's also a bidet in one of the bathrooms. I wonder who uses them? 

We had a half view of the pool and that was about it. Pretty disappointing. 

Overall, just not super impressive. I'm sure if we had been able to stay in one of the updated towers things would have been different. I wouldn't stay here on my own dime, that's for sure. 

I will say having the forum shops so close is convenient. I can appreciate having Sephora right downstairs, as well as a plethora of restaurants and other shops.

Came here on a summer Sunday around noon and checked in at the kiosk it was awesome I got my room within 4 minutes :)

I get to my room in the Julius Rowe and it's exactly how I saw it on the pictures . Clean, big tv friendly house keepers . 

I go out for the night and get back in around 4 am and need to take a shower .

The water is luke warm mixed with cold water fml!! 

I go to sleep wake up at 2 pm and take another shower and it's the same luke warm mixed with cold water fml!! 

I probably will not stay here again . 

I try charging my phone in the outlet and it takes forever like its not producing enough power .

This hotel and has something for everyone.  I've stayed here many times mostly in the Octavius and Augustus tower. I stayed in the Forum tower once and it wasn't as bad as what some of you experienced.  I just got back fm Vegas and we stayed in the Octavius tower again. We got 2 connecting rooms QQ and K and another QQ next door. The rooms and bathrooms were spacious and clean. I wish the towels were softer and better quality. My only complaint about the room is I tried to order room service but couldn't find the binder where they usually put the menu. I think they should update their system where they let us order room service fm our tV.  The diamond registration was efficient but they didn't serve us champagne this time bc we checked in on a Sunday.   The diamond lounge was ok. I wish they serve more variety of "hot food" and have a better wine list.   
Octavius valet was efficient and not as hectic as the main valet. (They only valet for 7 stars players)
For dining, I recommend The Old Homestead Steakhouse. You get a lot of bang for your buck unlike Nobu where you can expect to pay $500 for dinner for 2 ppl and you won't even get full.

Not cheap.  But I was happy to give them my money.

Stayed with my wife and 9month baby at Caesar's for a couple of days.  We had a very nice room on the 22nd floor of the Palace Tower overlooking the pool.  Good view.  The rooms are beautifully decorated.  The bed is very comfortable.  My son loved the bed!  They even provided us a playcrib.  Caesar's Palace is my new favorite Vegas hotel.  Caesar's Palace is effectively a city that it needs its own zip code.  There's so much to do.  So much to see.  The staff is friendly. The place is so beautiful.  Every place in the hotel is a picture opportunity.  The pool is definitely so relaxing and beautiful.  You almost feel like you're in the Caligula movie- sans nudity and stuff.  The restaurant and food selection is excellent.  Happy to try Beijing 9 and Ramsey's Pub.  Only doubt I have is the buffet.  It's good food and good price.  Except I think Wynn's is better and bigger. However, over all my wife loved it; which makes my life a lot easier.  Thanks.  We will definitely be going back again.

Stayed at the Nobu Tower. We were on the 79th floor & were promised "a room with a view". The room had a view to the rooms across the tower but still beautiful nonetheless. Loved the shopping, dining, and staff. We practically stayed at the Caesars our entire trip, except when we wanted to walk the strip a bit or watch the O show which was in the neighboring hotel - Bellagio. We would most definitely stay at the Caesars again, including the Nobu Tower.

For the price you pay, it is not worth it. The hotel is run down and needs maintenance.  Be sure to check in and out via email because the line at the concierge can be long! Get to the pool early if you want a lounge chair but the soft pads at the front of the pool is empty for a reason...unless you want to pay $$$$ to rent them. For the price I paid staying at this hotel, I would rather have stayed at The Palazzo. I came here because I used to stay here back in the 80's and it was real nice but it is not as nice as it used to be. Cesar's Palace is nice to visit only not to stay at.
Once again, another Vegas trip in the books! Always a great time! Got a suite in the Augustus tower. No complaints about this stay. Until next time (soon I'm sure since we come often).

Super crowded hotel and casino. Staff is very friendly (some dealers at the poker room i didnt like :P) and have always right information for the customers. We had a room on 54th floor and a view is amazing. Pool area is fantactic, not crowded as other areas so there is enough space for everybody. Only reason for 4 stars are some additional fees we payed for wifi and mini bar we didnt use. Very polite lade at the reception\/front desk waived a fee for mini bar after housekeeping person inspected the room, but we still needed to pay wifi charge. Thats the only star missing, all other services were extraordinary according to price.

Everything about this casino is world class.  The eateries, the shopping, the gambling...they got it down.  This place and Planet Hollywood are tied for best shopping centers in Vegas.  They're both huge and have lots of options to go to as far as retail.  This casino also expanded its shopping retail to The Linq across the street as they own that property along with the High Roller Ferris Wheel.  One of these days I will stay here and rate the rooms which are likely world class like this casino.

This resort is awesome and the staff was great and got us checked in without any delays.  We arrived early however there was a line but with all the excitement it went by quickly.  Ceasar Palace is upscale and it's name holds its worth.  We had the Palace Tower and it was the third tower from the Roman.  The buffet was number #2 on the rating (6\/2015)however we were here last year to visit in 2014 and wanted to try something different.  The pool area is great and opens at 08:00 and closes at 6:00pm.  Overall, best stay in town for our second stay in Vegas and it's ranked #1 against Mandalay Bay due to amenities and location.  I recommend this resort to family and friends.

Caesar's Palace probably has the best location on the strip since it is smack in the middle.  The poker room is large and gives me a very comfortable feeling when I'm playing in it.  The rooms, and hotel, is a bit old in general, but they have been well maintained and I spent some time soaking in the in-room jacuzzi to try to sweat out all the alcohol.  The drinks here (free ones that you get gambling) are probably the best along with Bellagio's.  The slot machines though they don't have too many of the new games and I usually end up going to other casino's to get my jackpot on.

Ok just so you know we have stayed at MGM, New York New York, Excalibur, Monte Carlo, Venetian probably a couple others I have forgot however this time we stayed at Caesers OMG never again!!!!! Oh my where to start. First pulling up on a Tuesday night the valet was full btw it was full every single night! We stayed in the Agustus Tower with a veiw of the Belagio fountains which was a very nice veiw. However the beds are awful way too soft did not have a good sleep the whole time. There are a very very limited amount of outlets in the room making it difficult for today's world of multiple electronics. Caesers is very nice they put a keurig in every room! However they then put the makings for coffee including the K cups in a box in the mini bar for $13 really???? I have never seen a hotel nickel and dime so much. A cup of coffee in any of their restaurants is $6. You can have a fridge in your room if you want to pay them $20 a day. In all honesty it really is not the nice upscale hotel it use to be. It all seems so run down and worn out. If you are paying full price for a room I really suggest taking your money and going elsewhere. So far we have found the nicest rooms you can get on the strip for the basic room cost would be at the Venetian. Honestly unless you have some huge want to stay at Caesers check out all the other hotels and leave this one behind. Not worth the nickels and dimes.

I was prepared to be wowed and was greatly let down. The casino is great, restaurants are fab, but the hotel itself is meh at best. 

First, we waited in line for check-in for 40 minutes. There were only 4 people ahead of us so it took 10 minutes to check each person. That's unacceptable. Second, the room had a gorgeous view but we noticed scuffs and minor damage to almost every piece of furniture in the room. It just has an overall air of rough use, not the luxury I was led to expect. The Wynn's rooms are much more splendid.

I love staying here, the new towers are gorgeous.   The rooms are super spacious and I love the view of the belagio fountains.   The bathrooms are huge the jacuzzi bath tub is glorious.   The Starbucks off the elevator is why convenient.   The pool is super clean and always a fun time. The shopping is AMAZING!!  all of my favorite shops!!!

tip 1.  dont stay in the old towers, there are no door in the bathroom.  not even to the separate toiled area.  

tip 2.  new tower suites... gorgeous!  we had a few issues with front desk, the key card wasn't working so we had to walk ALL THE WAY THROUGH THE CASINO twice to fix the problem... huge hassle.  

but the gorgeous suite made up for it... double walk in showers and a seat as well.  rain showers were amazing

Just about the rooms:

We stayed in the new tower, though I had never been to Caesars Palace it was by far the most beautiful room I've stayed in.  The layout was spacious, complete with a large bathroom, table and chairs, huge TV station - the room just felt sooo large.  The furnishings were amazing, chic, modern yet with that classical feel, clean, not too clustered and really tasteful.  It is by far the nicest room I've been in.  The bathroom was large, had tons of amenties, a great shower and tub and I really felt pampered just to be there.  The mini fridge was stocked with deluxe things as well, yet another perk.  Overall it was clean, amazing, comfy and made me feel really pampered!

OMG!!!! There was what we believe, dog feces in our room.  Called front desk, said they would send housekeeping manager to see.  Waited forever she finally comes in looks at it, asked if we have a pet or our friends.  Do you really think I would call at 2am if I had a pet?????  Spoke to supposedly a manager and she says "we will can take $50 off your bill. "  Are you serious my girlfriend stepped on it!! How long had this been in our room?  Did they even clean our room after the last guest?  I am floored!!! Then they say we will further investigate, investigate what?  If it's poop?  It's poop or feces or crap.  And now still waiting on the results of the investigation............

This place is a true 3 star rating. It is beautiful, humongous and offers many great sights, but has a hotel on the strip in comparison to all the others, services are lacking. First, parking no longer free and charges $18 for valet parking. This seems to be growing amongst Vegas hotels. We asked to be checked in early but that cost $40 so we opted to go out and enjoy the city. Caesars did however, provided bell service to hold our luggage. My last gripe is the room was BASIC and does not hold up to expectations. Slippers are no longer provided as described by the front desk. Besides shampoo, soap and body lotion, there are no other amenities provided. Ie. cotton balls, q tips, shower caps etc. you get the sense that Caesar's just wants to make every cent they can. The internet is free for only 2 devices, or else it's 14.99 a day. There is a Keurig machine in the room but no coffee, tea or sugar. 
These complaints maybe in comparison to other hotels on the strip but Caesars should be a cut above the rest, especially with one of the highest resort fees. I wonder where those fees go to?

Ceasar's has the most comfortable beds of any hotel I have stayed in. They are always fast checking in and provide great customer service. It's a gorgeous hotel everywhere you look. Also, the best quesadillas. Highly recommended.

The plus side of Caesars is that you never have to leave Caesars!
The forum shops, the mall, the casino, EVERYTHING is in Caesars.
The rooms were great, minus the 'sweaty wet towel' smelling pillows.
Room service was fast and the food was good.

UGH! had the worst experience trying to get our room at this hotel. i was checking in on a Sunday, around 2pm, trying to see if our room was available,  when the man (not quite) helping us told us rooms were ready, but we would have to pay a $40 early check in fee, or wait until 3 pm, to get our room sans fee.

Ok, I have never paid a fee to check in early- esp by an hour! at any hotel. this seems unheard of ,but fine,  we'll wait and hang out with some friends in the casino.  

So at around 3pm, we come back, see if we could get our room - and we are told no, rooms arent ready- theyll call us within 40 minutes for our room key. An hour goes by- no call. we go back to check in at 4 PM, and NOPE theyre still cleaning the room. 

It wouldnt be so bad if we didnt see the crowds of other hotel guests being given key cards and directions to their room. but seriously? 

So by 5 PM, we're pretty fed up. Our room was not ready. We need to get ready for dinner! It wouldnt have been so bad if the staff we dealt with were apologetic or even showed any sympathy for our situation 

We finally were able to get our room by 5:30pm. We thought the worst part had been over, but as we walked in, the room was unlike the other rooms we had previously stayed in at Caesars. The bathroom had no door, the room seemed cramped, I'm pretty sure it was a wheelchair accessible handicap room- but not in a good way. It's almost as if they saved this sh*tty room for us. It was in stark contrast to Cosmopolitan where we'd stayed the night before. I almost wanted to go running back to Cosmo, where the staff have ALWAYS been accommodating.

4 unsuccessful check in attempts, one sh*tty room later, i'm never ever staying here again. Zero stars..

Stayed here for the first time over Memorial Day Weekend and really liked it. The room was not as big as some other hotels I've stayed at, but it was definitely nice and up to date with the decor. The best thing about the entire stay was that we were put in the Palace Tower which is directly over the pool. The pool area is beautiful with many pools of different sizes including a pool area to gamble in. However, the Palace Tower is also super away from the casino, and the strip. Not an easy find after a night out on the strip...

Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed staying at Caesar's this crazy long weekend, and I would definitely stay there again.

They told us the check in time was at 3PM and if we wanted to get the rooms we wanted we should come early. We got there at 2:30 and waited until 5PM because the rooms were not available. 

When we finally got our rooms we found out there were only 1 bed per room instead of the two we ordered. We called customer service and told them but they couldn't help us except give us a folding bed to sleep on but only after we asked to speak to the manager.

The television in one room was broken so we called the maintenance guy but he didn't come until the day after. 

The shower was jammed and there was hair all over the bathroom floor. 

After the first night we stayed there the the maid did not come in to do room service. 

Also the wifi is pretty expensive. It's $15 per computer for 24 hours so we had to trade off and use one computer for the entire trip.

In addition, the casino area\/lobby is pretty dirty. People were smoking everywhere and the smoke was so heavy people kept coughing.

For the buffet we waited for an hour and the food was not really good. The food selection was not great. There is a ice cream area where you can order ice-cream but the lady behind the counter who was scooping the ice-cream put the ice-cream metal bucket on top of another ice-cream bucket (so that the bottom of the bucket was inside another ice-cream.. very unsanitary). 

Other food wise, there is a food court in the casino area and lot of restaurants. But the restaurants are really pricy: all the main courses are $40+ per dish. Breakfast wise, there is a bakery open and a few food court stores plus this breakfast buffet but the are all very expensive. ($10 for two eggs and a toast at the food court). We ended up driving down the street for McDonalds ($4 for Big Breakfast) since there is no McDonalds or Starbucks in this hotel.

The only good thing about this hotel is that the forum shops are right downstairs so if you want to shop, it's easy to find lots of shops.

Super disappointed with our stay here. It was my husbands first time in Vegas so I excitedly booked Caesars *thinking* it's one of the best! We got to the receptionist and I asked if there was any complimentary upgrades (total rewards member here and I was told
To always ask) my luck wasn't with me and I guess there wasn't because she just asked for my card to swipe and just proceeded with the check in process. Every other time I've been to Vegas all other front desk staff politely let you know there are no free upgrades but still offer other upgrades at a price which I was willing to pay. She didn't even offer me ANYTHING. It didn't sit well with me. Also note it was not even busy. We checked in early, which we were also charged for. It was a weekday not a weekend. She put us in the Julius tower and the room smelled! Like musty, moldy. I was just really upset. But we didn't complain just sucked it up at that point. The hotel itself is beautiful the Julius tower was what it was. I unfortunately won't be back because of that experience. I do realize that you can't always "win" in Vegas but I just wish that the front desk were a little more courteous.

Me and my boyfriend stayed here for a late Valentines day weekend and it was so much fun. We both had such a good time. Starting off our visit here, at the concierge we had a check-in with Desiree who made us feel so at home and accommodated us the best that she could! She was very sweet and upgraded our experience to a 5 stars. Great customer service!! We stayed in a Julius Luxury room which had a pool view and a jacuzzi in the bathroom. Beautiful beautiful beautiful. Awesome choice and upgrade. Thank you Desiree! 

In addition, we went to see the Celine Dion show while she has residency in Cesar's on Friday night and it was incredible. One of the best nights of my life, it was a full house and every seat was taken up. Her voice was beautiful and everything I would've imagined. 

Of course we made a visit to the Bacchanal buffet right downstairs our room.  It wouldn't be complete if we didn't pig out at the best buffet in town. Wide selection and fresh food and so much seafood. 

I loved staying at Cesar's. It was all 4 in 1. Hotel, Celine Dion, Bacchanal Buffet + the gorgeous pool. Highly recommended for a sweet romantic getaway

OK, I do not mean to sound snooty, I'm not, I work hard to enjoy my lifestyle, I am not the beneficiary of a trust fund. I love Ceasars Palace becasue they do it right. I always stay in the Centurion Tower in the Presidential Suite. The room is 2000 sq ft with marbel baths and sinks with real gold fixtures, 2 toilets, a roman steam shower, a lace canopy bed, 24 hr personal butler and all the ammenities only a king would want. I love having them plan my morning service to make my room without the bothersome knocking. In the afternoon, I request a bowl of fruit and sushi placed in my room with a bottle of Cakebread Chardonay for entertaining. After an afternoon of frolicking in the garden of the gods pool, which you would be hard pressed to find a better pool anywhere in the world. The pool has fountains and roman coloumns galore. It is submersed withing palm trees and if your a confident lady, the Venus pool offers topless sunbathing and is arguably the pool to be at and where you will find me. After the pool, I go to my room to find Russian Beluga Caviar and assorted toast points and chocolate covered strawberries...yummy! then it's off to dinner at Pacific Seafood in the Casino with the best sushi and seafood swimming on the strip. After some gaming, I go hit the pussycat lounge to down a martini or two before heading to the best club bar none on the strip called Tryst located at the Wynn hotel. Ceasars is the best becasue they cater to the person who wants and expects the best. You pay a premium for this service but when I'm playing, I don't give a rats ass how much it costs becasue dammit I'm out to party like a rockstar and thats why I work hard. I don't live to work, I work to live. You gotta do it Caeasars palace way folks.

I stayed here for a week. I'm a Diamond member. I got a room which they say was with the discount. I checked on Expedia which they had a lower rate. The casino was okay. The service with the staff was terrible! 
I literally sat down at the tables and played for almost 2 hours. No cocktail waitress stop by at all! I finally after pit boss and he apologize. He told me that they were shorthanded. 
Finally a cocktail waitress walked passed by.  He pit boss waved her down. She did not want to serve the people sitting at the tables. She still stood there and argued with the pit boss and said this is not my section I have to grab the server for this section. The pit boss told her that no cocktail waitress has stop by this section for almost 2 hours. She replied and said that the server doesn't know this is her section I have to tell her. Took almost another hour just for the cocktail waitress by. 
Be very careful staying at this hotel they try to charge me for an item from the minibar in the room. Which I did not use at all. So look over your detailed receipt before leaving. 
The diamond lounge was the worst I have ever seen in any casino I ever been to. This is supposed to be "Las Vegas Caesars Palace". It is so sad and despicable that this is supposed to be a big major hotel\/casino a.k.a. total rewards headquarters. Diamond lounge serves bad food. As I said before I've been there for one week and they been serving leftovers. 
Been to plenty of casinos such ass Tunica Mississippi & Metropolis Illinois there Diamond lounge is way better. They treat all of their Diamond and Seven Star players with class. Unlike Caesar's Palace.

It follows that every hotel would have to have a "worst room." Bad luck that we had to get it. North-facing with a view of the air conditioning ductwork, and a smoking room (after we had requested non-smoking some six months earlier when we booked). In an effort to get some fresh air, we opened the window vents, to discover that we were right above the spa with its overpowering perfumes. When we registered, we were told that the hotel was so very busy and nothing  could be done. Later in the evening I saw hundreds of people continuing to come in and register. Woke every morning with a raw throat. We asked one more time for a different room, but were again rebuffed. Had a great week in LV, but it would have been nice to be able to relax in the room a little. Won't go there again. Found the staff overwhelming disinterested. (The young men working the doors were exceedingly pleasant.)
And the pools were closed!

We took advantage of a mid-week deal.

So despite the accolades from The Hangover, and the hotel being known for being a little more on the high end, their filters for clearing out cigarette smoke from the hotel leaves something to be desired. Our floor was smoke free but we could still smell it.

Other than that, we really enjoyed the room. It was a Forum Tower Suite which had an OK view we could see the Rio in the distance but there was also the parking lot and walls to contend with. 

The bathroom had a hot tub, separate shower, and smaller bathroom off the main entrance of the room (which we took full advantage of!). Also, it had insane closet space, the bed was comfy and huge. The LCD TVs were just okay but who watches that much TV while in Vegas?

It's a bit of a walk through the hotel to get to our tower but it's close to the Forum Shops (hence the name of the tower) so that helped.

Location of the hotel itself is unbeatable, the minute you walk out from the lobby you're on the Strip.

We ordered room service on our last morning there (too lazy to look for options outside and had a flight to catch). It was really tasty but costly. Totally worth it if you don't have time\/energy.

Overall, I liked the hotel and would recommend but the cigarette smoke might lead me to stay elsewhere.

Buyer Beware!!!  I booked my Vegas Vacation at Ceasar's Palace for my Birthday weekend.  I booked the Romance Package that says it includes $100 credit at any of their restaurants & $200 credit at their Spa.  But upon checking in they claimed to know nothing of my credits & that the Romance Package is now sold out!!!  I ask to see the manager & she came out to speak with me but basically just restated what the desk clerk had already stated....I'm sorry but there's nothing I can do!  So much for customer service!  Won't be staying there again!!!

Octavius tower. Old school Las Vegas tries to attract luxury clients like us. Where the FAIL Begins is you can tell old school hotel management run the new towers, not caring about the clients they are trying to attract. 

 You pay Ritz or Four Seasons prices, for a room in Vegas mind you, you're expecting a lot. They renovate, build new towers, name them, give you exclusive entrances, exclusive checkin-ins ( they don't tell you when you are paying a premium... that these check ins  have early hours so if you don't arrive by 3, you have to go stand in the Disney long lines with the riff raff) and even exclusive elevators. You think ok, it's super cheesy, but the room is going to be amazing. NOT. It's big, modern appointments, but IKEA like furniture. 

Here is where they lose us luxury clients...They give you a Kuerig in the room.... but you have to pay $12.00 if you want to have the pods and set up for one person, for coffee or tea. They have a big beautiful bath tub.... but only offer soap shampoo and conditioner, if you want bath gel or salts you have to buy them in the gift shop down stairs! (WHAT?!?!) There are no robe or slippers! If I am coming to they're rumoured amazing spa (more on that later, I am going later today), or shop in the epic Forum shops and not to gamble,  I want amenities for my $$. Not even a cotton ball or q-tips, 
Simple amenities....  if we pay these prices we expect things. The bed is comfortable, the pillows are great, you can still smell smoke from rooms around you supposedly non smoking floors. I will talk the the manager today and see what the reaction is and modify my review to include that as well as a spa review. 

Not happy and sticking with the Cosmo (#1 because of non-smoking policy, outside balconies and hip culture)  and Aria next time. They really know how to treat their guests!

I've stayed at Caesars Palace a few times, and at other resorts on the strip, while I enjoy Caesars for its history and place in Las Vegas (and its amenities, like location on the strip and the massive pool area), this was a very, very disappointing visit. 

After checking in, we took the mile and half walk to our room. What's that??? A mile and a half walk to your room? Yes, this is a large resort, but more to the point, the designers of it should have thought more about the location of the elevators in the towers! They also should rethink charging people for coffee in the room. That's right, you'll pay for the Keurig cups if you want coffee in the room. Free coffee in a room is like a hotel standard, isn't it? (Notice I said hotel, not motel). It's still free to use the iron. 

At any rate, after refreshing in the room which overlooked the pools (great view - we did however have to request the view and upgrade). We headed down to the casino. After another mile and half walk back through long empty corridors we arrived in the lobby and casino area. 

It's Caesars 50th Anniversary but you couldn't tell that in the lobby, unless you happen to gander the tiny sash tossed across the chest of the Caesar statue at the front door...My point being, other hotels and casinos on the strip - Paris, Aria, Wynn, Bellagio - make considerable effort to bring in decorations and dress up their lobbies - and for just regular seasonal events (I noticed, Halloween for example). 

Would it kill you Harrah's (owners of Caesar) to spend a few grand on a nice floral arrangement for the lobby to celebrate your 50th? Perhaps a giant birthday cake or a display of the many entertainers that have graced your halls...But no, your marketing department deemed it much more suitable to hang a giant vinyl banner touting a hashtag and place a mall-level fiberglass horse and chariot (for selfies or photos) off to the side of the entrance. 

In the casino we found the experience no better, we played Blackjack for an hour before any table service - and asked the pit boss twice to request a server...But anytime during our three day stay, the same issue, getting a drink in the casino took considerable effort, even when playing any table games for any length of time. We had to either ask a manager to send over a server (and then waiting for 20-30 minutes for her to show) or wait an hour for one to come around. Casino was clean and common areas were also well maintained, in fact the housekeeping staff was very good. Requests for extra towels or other items were delivered promptly and with a smile. 

I would also like to call out the exceptional service and demeanor of a dealer named Jim, this older gentlemen dealt Blackjack and has worked at Caesars for over 30 years. He was both friendly (helping with gaming tips) and incredibly informative, providing great history lessons on Las Vegas and the casinos while we played. 

Finally, food here was average at best. We ate at Rao's one night - extremely disappointed, and at Gordon Ramsey's Pub & Grill another afternoon. Neither the meal or experience were at all notable or recommendable. We also had a basket of fries at the pool - which took asking the runner where the fries were after about 45 minutes - fries showed up an hour after we ordered them. At least they were hot. Swim up Blackjack? Neat concept, but dealers were not friendly or welcoming.
 
Unless we were to get an extremely good deal, we would not stay at this resort again, as there are many, many other and better options on the strip. 

Oh, and one last item. As I mentioned, as a long time Vegas visitor and I am well aware of the "working girls" that roam the area. Caesars seemed to be overrun with them (WAY more so than other casinos we visited in the evenings). To the point, I and another male in our party were engaged by them, not once, not twice, but three times on property (sports bar, casino and walking back to the room). I have never had that experience in my 30 plus years of coming to this town (being blatantly propositioned like this). We of course refused their offers, because of wives, and morals. But if you are looking for "who-ors" this is the place to find them.

I love Caesars! 

Pros:
* The service is great, whether you're a high roller or not
*Spacious rooms, very clean, nice large bathrooms
*Unbelievable shopping 
*Incredible restaurants, and a huge selection of them. Recommended: Spago, Neros and the place near the fountains in the Forum Shops (I forget the name)
*Very good room service. No little trays, they wheel in a whole beautifully set table. 
*Good drink service on the casino floor.
*The wedding planning services are great. Its very nerve wracking to plan a destination wedding, because you can't see anything in person, but they have everything down to a science. I highly recommend their wedding packages.

Cons:
*Pricey, and getting pricier. We weren't able to stay there on our last trip to Vegas because the room rates have gotten so high. The shops are mostly really high end as well, but there are some lower priced shops too.
*Lousy wedding photographer. That was the only part of our wedding I was disappointed with. 


Highly recommended!

Bottom line up front: Elton John was canceled. They sat us and waited until 10 minutes after showtime to let us know this show was canceled.  They were tacky, unprofessional, and unaccommodating to customers.  

My family and I traveled to see Elton John and were completely ripped off. We were not notified of the cancelation until the auditorium was fully seated and everyone had spent their money on overpriced concessions. It would have been acceptable if they let us know prior to settling in for the show so we could find another show to watch. We were forced to wait until at least 10 minutes after showtime to figure out our Saturday night when most venues were completely sold out. You would think a business would try accomodate their guests who spent $200 per ticket for the Cesar's palace experience. However, they thought it was more important to make money. This place is tacky and incredibly unprofessional. 

If I could give this place zero stars, I would.

I have never had the pleasure of staying here but we do visit every time we are in Vegas. I love to shop here, they have many high end stores as well as regular shops. The club here is also a great place to party, but it gets extremely crowded making it hard to dance and maneuver around. The show they have in the middle of the forum shops is great to see at least one time, only problem is people stop and gather around making it hard to walk through. This is a beautiful hotel inside and out.

It's my first time here and truly wanted this to be a special weekend celebrating my 2 yr anniversary & seriously this place is over rated and over priced. The staff at check in was rude the room is not to par. I paid 600.00 for 2 nights and a surprise 200.00 dollar deposit that I was not informed of. I will definitely never bring my service back to this place nor will I ever recommend anyone to stay here. The rooms are exactly like the Hilton a d the price there  is 2 times cheaper. Thanks for ruining my anniversary.

This review is based on my experience with the Total Rewards Center--their service was awful! We aren't high rollers and hadn't been there for 2 years but the wait to get a card renewed was almost 45 minutes! We were there to pick up Elton John tickets and decided to gamble a bit and perhaps eat. I was so frustrated by the time I left the counter that I couldn't wait to get out of there and I certainly wasn't going to have dinner there after the show! Terrible customer service.

So unbelievably average. Below average actually, for the price, but I have had some GREAT nights in the casino here and the Forum Shops are amaze, so I gotta give some props for location. If you are here to see Celine another benefit is that  you might run into her before the show. This happened to us when we stayed here for my cousin's 21st birthday and she was so excited (she's a huge Celine fan)!!!!

Pure is pretty disappointing, I don't really like the crowd too much but I have had a TON of fun at Shadow bar. 

The rooms are the major problem - expensive and not worth the price. If you are going to cough up that much for a room, you are better off staying at Venetian or Belliagio or better yet at the Wynn or Encore. Nothing special at all about the rooms and for some reason even the newly re-done rooms look worn and the bathrooms are kinda janky. Don't bother with the room-service. The food isn't very good and, although there are some great places at the Forum Shops, it would be nice if there was something right downstairs when you just need a quick bite (there's a food court but I'm not really a food court type of girl). And the breakfast is weak which blows after a long-night of partying when you are looking for brunch \/ possible hang-over cure.

Anyway, it's popular and you will probably have a great time if you stay here, but, like I said earlier, you can do better for the price.

Well, there was an Orthodontic Convention going on there  Feb 20-23. After we had to fight for the rooms that were paid for by our boss, not to mention he paid for upgraded rooms as well. We had received an E-mail indicating that our rooms were ready however, they were not. Not only were they not ready we were not getting the rooms that were paid for. They wanted to put my co worker and I in a smoking room with 2 double beds. My other co workers were going to be put in a smoking room with 1 king bed. Ummmm I don't think so! Once I got the manager he then all of a sudden found our rooms go figure. There was another member that was with us however, she was in a different tower. Once we got to our rooms they were very nice and could not complain about them at all. 

When we checked in, although our rooms were paid for we each had to give our own credit cards for incidentals. Ok didn't think anything of it. Both my co-worker and I gave our CC and one co-worker out of the two in the other room gave her CC for incidentals. The other member we were with in the other Tower gave hers as well. I think there was only one charge to one of those CC and it was for WI Fi. All other charges to our cards were done as we went through our weekend.

By the time we returned home on Monday all 4 out of the 6 CC were compromised and had to be canceled. There was activity going on in stores that we were not anywhere near. Now 3 weeks later my bosses CC has been compromised. Activity going on in one of the Casino's. Why it took so long to get that one figured out is beyond me. Needles to say now 5 out of the 6 have had to be canceled. The only CC that was not compromised was the one co- worker that did not give hers to the front desk for incidentals. Now seriously don't you think there is something funky going on or what?  

Such a shame as we really enjoyed our time there. It's a beautiful hotel a little to big but beautiful and the food in all of the restaurants were very good. Not only am I concerned about returning to Caesars, I'm concerned about any of the hotels and who can and can not be trusted.

We are having a pretty bed experience with Caesars Palace:

The room was too hot and the control for the AC would not let us cool it down, so it was very hard to sleep in the room.  We called the for help around 11pm, hoping they can tell us how to fix it -- they said they need to send an Engineer.  The Engineer arrived and try to fix it and could not, but in the process of trying set the AC too cooling without the ability to stop it (not his fault, there was clearly something wrong with the AC control and\/or unit), so he told us that we need to change rooms and he's already asked front desk to get us another one.  That was around 12 midnight, well over an hour after we had gone to bed trying to sleep - and the last thing we wanted to do was pack up and move to another room, but we had no choice.
15 min later, no word from the front desk, so I called and sked if they could expedite getting us to another room. I was told they will check on this and call me back.  I was assured someone would "help move us" so no need to pack.
No word for another 15 min, then I called again and this time stayed on the phone until the person said promised "a bell staff is on his way to us."  He again assured me someone would help us move.
5 or 10 minutes little later, someone called to ask if we are all completely packed up and ready to go.  (It was obvious no one was on his way to us and the person was contemplating sending them now.)  He sounded annoyed, and came off as pretty rude.  He assured me that if the bell person arrives and we are not all completely packed, the person would just go away.  No hint of customer service, let alone any kind of 'hospitality.'
We ended up mostly packing our suitcases.
The bell person did eventually show up around 12:45 and brought a cart on which we put all of our stuff and he helped us move.
The hotel moved us to a smaller room, on a lower floor (which, thankfully does seem to have working air conditioning).  No apology from anyone

Stayed here for a business trip because we got a good deal. Typically we stay at the Aria or Wynn when we are in town and will continue to do so. Caesars palace is just wayyyyyy too smokey inside the casino. Feels outdated now, crowd is pretty interesting and the layout is difficult to navigate with small and narrow passage ways. Sports book needs updating. On the positive side, their cardio machines in the gym were state of the art and absolutely awesome! And the service we received upon check in and check out was fast and friendly.

First of all, the check in and check out times are far too late, and too early respectively. 4PM is unheard of for checking in, and 11AM is also unusually early.

Secondly, we checked in at a kiosk, which had a lot of disadvantages. We were not given a map of the hotel, and we were not told where anything was. In hindsight, I would have waited in the long line to be checked in by a person. This is especially important when it comes to a hotel the size of Caesar's Palace. We walked in circles literally miles looking for things. The gym was not clearly marked, and neither were the pools. Speaking of the pools, free convenient ice water should be a no-brainer in Las Vegas, but not at this resort! Expect to pay $2 a cup for water by the pool, even if you are paying for a $20 cocktail.  

Lastly, when I booked our room, I had no idea that the "Forum Tower Rooms" were the downgraded rooms at the hotel. There was no indication that this tower is a long walk from everything, and that it was the oldest of the towers. When we called and asked about moving rooms, we were told that we could not be accommodated due to availability, yet there were still rooms in the other towers for sale that same night. Poor customer service and an old building in need of a refresh. I will say that the WIFI included in the resort fee did work well. 

Overall, the entire stay was just more exhausting than it was relaxing which is very different from many other hotels that I have stayed at in Las Vegas, which were comparable or even less costly than this stay. We were not offered help by any of the staff, and there were not a lot of staff available to answer questions. The best part of our experience at Caesar's was the bell service, which is kind of sad.

I have stayed at multiple resorts in Vegas and this by far is the worst one. When I arrived the registration was packed, no organization and the people were rude. I get to my room in the roman tower and its worse than a motel room. Smelled, outdated and dirty. I called and forced them to move me to one of the newer towers. I was put in the Augustus tower which was better but nothing compared to the venetian. I did see the octavious and palace rooms and those are much nicer. I asked for a humidifier and they never sent., called back that night and of course they were then out. The restaurants in the hotel are just as bad. I made a party reservation for 22 ppl and the people acted like it was an inconvenience.. It was the hotel
Contacts not the restaurant. There also aren't many options for food. The hotel is old and outdated and the conference area is so confusing and the stupidest setup ever. I hope I never have to return here. My opinion is the workers act like we bother them and the hotel rooms are about as nice as a Hampton.

Rating all the Vegas Hotels\/Casinos that I have been in, it is only fair to give Caesars one up, because when it comes to Vegas, Caesars is as good as it gets!
I think its everybodys highlight to walk through here when enjoying what the strip has to offer.
Though the shops and restaurants, the bars, everything is more expensive here than elsewhere on the strip, everyone still wants a piece of it.
We wanted drinks but they were so expensive we went for some pralines at Max Brenners, shopping wise they have great lower budget options like H&M and a really nice one at that.
It's beautiful and fun to stroll through every single time.

Poor Alan got gypped when they told him Caesar didn't live here - I have a picture that proves he TOTALLY does! :) See uploads.

This hotel is a prime example of Las Vegas decadence, and I LOVE it. Granted, I've never stayed here, but I've spent enough time in the Forum Shops and casino and bars to know it's my kinda over-the-top fabulousness that defines Vegas.

The main check in area is pretty fabulous, with the ridiculous painted ceilings and domes. Gorgeous.

I'll write a separate review for the Forum Shops, but needless to say, they're equally as awesome. 

One of these days I'll stay in the hotel itself, but either way - I always make multiple visits to Caesar's when I'm in LV, and really love being immersed in the classic theme.

Speaking of which, I still have a $12 casino credit if anyone's headed there anytime soon ... :)

The 5 star review is based on customer service- amazing!

I was there for Memorial weekend- and everybody knows any holiday in LV is crazy... Sergio at the check in counter was suuuper helpful. He was able to get the two rooms I had booked upgraded complimentary and they were connecting.

I would give 3.5 to the "upgraded rooms"... They were so plain and standard I wondered why they were considered an upgrade. But I was thankful the checkin process was smooth and easy on a holiday weekend- so any room there would have been fine.

In all honesty- I'm not sure if I would stay here again... For the money- I'd stay at another hotel... But I'm really happy to know that their customer service goes the extra mile.

My second time in Las Vegas, my boyfriend and I stayed at Caesars. What a great choice. We originally booked the room through hotels.com, one of the rooms in the FORUM tower (one of many at Caesars). The rooms in FORUM tower are recently renovated with updated furniture and it looked very nice. Upon arrival, we realized that the rooms in FORUM tower don't have a bathtub, (which was a big deal for us) so when we checked in, we asked for an upgrade to a room that had a bathtub. There was a small extra fee per night but it was definitely cheaper than paying the regular rate for the room we were upgraded to : AUGUSTUS tower. 

Our room was very spacious (probably bigger than my old apartment) with a very comfortable king size bed, sitting area with sofa, dining area, a HUGE bathroom with  a bathtub and glass door shower with the toilet in a separate room. This particular room had the view of the strip and the pools at Caesars. We totally lucked out.

It is a HUGE hotel\/resort so it's very important to know exactly which tower and which casino you're in so you can find your way back after a few drinks. They have great restaurants : MESA grill by Bobby Flay, the Buchanal buffet (50 dollars but totally worth it) and others. 

Their pools are more mellow than most pools at other hotels, it's more of a relax and sip drinks kind of atmosphere, not let's have a huge party with 1000 people and a dj. 

The only downside to this great place was that there was a fee for everything. Like, if you even moved an item (even if you were to put it right back) in the bar fridge in the room, they will charge you. There will also be a charge upon checking out for resort fees and pool fees. Nothing too outrageous but no one ever wants to pay anything extra at the end. 

Overall, my experience was just fantastic and I would definitely stay at Caesars again.
Beautiful place with nice decor! Valet parking is very complicated, much more easy go to self-parking. Lot of great shows!

INCREDIBLY EXPENSIVE FOR NOTHING, SO JUST GO FOR THE ROOMS.

Look, here's the deal. It's Vegas on the strip - So most things are going to be very expensive. But this place seems to charge more than usual. We went for our 25th wedding anniversary but the simplest things were over the top. ie: Coffee in the room was $12.00 for four of the little Keurig K-Cup packs. That's just nuts for something that should be complimentary. $ 39.00 for two beers and Margarita by the pool. 

We drove there from L.A. and when we got there, it seemed like your only choice to park was Valet parking, when all we wanted to do was drop off our luggage and self park as we weren't going anywhere for the weekend. It was unbelievable to see all of the people confused and getting railroaded into valet parking - they basically stick a ticket in your windshield and hand you a valet ticket - there was no provision whatsoever for dropping off luggage.

Check-in was a running ball of mass confusion. We stood in a line of about four or five couples in front of around 11:15 PM on a Thursday night. It took almost 45 minutes to check in. No, there was not a convention or anything going on that weekend.

The property is massive, so you need to be careful about how much you are trapped.

Take some of your own things to snack on and drink, and keep your money for gambling or spending.

And there ain't no welcome wagon or red carpet rolled out for you. Only stay there if you get a deal on the rooms and for nothing else.

We stayed at a Double Tree in Del Mar the week before where the room was just as nice. Note: We stayed in the Palace Tower in an upgraded room.

We came here on a last minute decision for LDW. We found the hotel had rooms (via hotels.com) for roughly $150\/nt (check-in on Sunday). This was for a suite that included 2 queen beds & the site clearly showed that it accommodates up to 4 people. Well, it's my husband, my 2 small children & I = 4 people right??! We book, check-in , enjoy the pool, the buffet & hang out. 

A week later, my husband sees that his account was charged another $32.48 for their resort fee. I could've sworn that was included in our total as when we checked out it was a over $200 (this was for resorts fees & tax). But NOOOOO! They charged us an additional $60 because there was 4 of us. Are you F'ING KIDDING ME?!?!!!!!! The room clearly accommodates 4, there's 4 of us & yet...HERE'S AN ADDITIONAL CHARGE?!!!! OMFG. This is ridiculous. Were we supposed to split the family up? 1 parent with 1 child in 2 separate rooms?? What about the families that have 3 kids? This is absurd!! 

We could've easily stayed at one of the newer hotels for the same price without all these extra fees. We're never staying at Caesar's again. I can't believe how easy it is for them to rip people off & think it's OK. 

THANKS FOR LETTING US KNOW YOU'RE NOT FAMILY FRIENDLY!!!

For my first trip to Vegas, I stayed at Caesar's Palace. My cousin got married here in the garden next to the amazing pool. Everything about this place is overwhelming yet fun. The place is ginormous and the Forum Shops attached to the hotel is an incredible, upscale mall. Restaurant selections are great too, including Spago, Mesa Grill, Palm Restaurant, and Rao's. The pool area is absolutely amazing - there are a number of separate pools with snack bars and a bar, cocktail waitresses that will bring you drinks all day long. There's even a "private" pool area, part of Pure nightclub, that you have to pay to get into (I didn't bother).

The rooms were nice enough, but I knocked off one star because they were lacking certain conveniences...like a soap dish in the bathroom. The bathroom at first glance looked nice - marble floor, big marble bathtub, even a red light in the ceiling (it looked like a security camera!). But the shower stall had only one soapdish to place your shower essentials, meaning I had to put my bottles of toiletries on the floor, which is not so convenient. Also, the shower stall was clearly designed by a man, because shaving my legs in there was no easy task. 

The casino area at Caesar's wasn't as big as some of the other casinos I visited, but it seemed like enough to me as I'm not a huge gambler. The Pussycat Dolls Lounge Casino area was fun, with leopard print chairs and go-go dancers. 

Luckily I was with family so I didn't have to pay for my room, otherwise I probably couldn't have afforded to stay here. It's not the most upscale of the Vegas casino hotels, but it's pretty damn nice. I'd definitely stay here again.

Finally able to stay at Caesar's flagship hotel over the Thanksgiving holiday. We got two complimentary nights due to time spent at their properties in Reno & Lake Tahoe the past few years. 

We checked into a deluxe room on the 24th floor located in the newish Palace Tower. 

Pros:
**For a deluxe room, it's quite spacious
** The views of the strip and Vegas valley = spectacular
** Excellent maid service 
**Bathrooms are spacious and lux
**Deep tub..nice 
**Ample closet space 
**Bed & pillows are comfy 
**Lots of restaurants w\/food court 
**Adjacent to Forum Shops (if you're into shopping)
**Overall, CP's location is great for walking along the strip 
**Excellent lounges throughout the casino to relax, converse, people watch, and sip drinks

Cons: 
**The "you touch..you buy" snacks & mini bar is annoying. If you have little ones..BEWARE!! The price for convenience is expensive-- $13 for  snack sized peanuts! 
**The walls are a little thin at  the Palace Tower.. We heard screaming children, crying infants, and very loud parents next door..A Jack n' Jill door ( which could be opened) separated our rooms. 

Overall, our two night stay was pleasant. ..would stay here again. We'll ask in advance for no loud families right next door. 
Yay! I'm a fan.

I booked our stay 5 months in advance at hotels.com they where offering buy 3 nights get the 4th night free! I figured for the price we payed we'd be stuck in the back without a view so I checked out yelp and seen a tip from a past visitor... when checking in give the person checking in $20 with your credit card and ask for an upgraded room... worth a try right! It took some convincing to get my husband to actually do it there was all women at the registration desk so I sent him solo as I waited in the backround.. he did exactly as I asked and it worked!! we got a BEAUTIFUL room in the Agustus tower double beds, couch lounge chair coffee table, table with 2 chairs to eat the bathroom was beautiful!! huuuuge  double sink jacuzzi tub and seperate shower... The best part... 36th floor with a beautiful view of the Bellagio Fountains!..The location was perfect the casino was beautiful we ate at mesa grill high priced but worth the experience $16 tamale... but it was good I would definately reccomend asking for the upgrade and would definately stay again!

I've stayed at a lot of Vegas hotels. This is my fav hands down. Try to stay in the Octavius tower. It has easy strip access and is the closest to the pool. The room was gorgeous!! Nice furniture and really big with a view of the Bellagio fountains. Will be staying here again.

Worst experience ever!!!!

I went last October & decided to take my daughters blanket since it was my first time leaving her. Mind u this was the blanket I had at the hospital when she was born. Anyways on our second day we decided to let room service clean the room while we walked the strip (my cousins idea, I never let room service in the room). We were gone a few hours came back, got ready for the night & left again. When we returned to the room to finally go to sleep I noticed it was missing. That was the worst feeling ever. It was bad enough I was away from my daughter, then to lose the blanket made it worse. The next morning we went to the service desk to tell them it was gone. We got the run around about how "the policy" worked & at the end got a # to call when we got home. After a week I called & I was told it was "under investigation" & I should give it some time. I waiting almost a month & called back & wasn't able to get through to anyone. I left several messages & to this day have not received a call back. I'm not sure if the cleaning lady took it or if it was in the pile of sheets she took. I was absolutely heart broken. To think I was so happy to stay there for the first time & then this happened. The hotel employees didn't give a crap about the report I made & I don't think there was ever an investigation.

I really love Caesar's Palace. Located in the middle of the strip with just about everything you need. A nice mall to walk around to spend your winnings, food everywhere from pricey Spago to cheaper food court....hotel rooms are spacious and nice as well. Definitely one of my favorite hotels in terms of practicality! For looks, it's nice, but I personally like the theme\/colors of Cosmo and Aria.

Oh, and the fact that it has Payard makes it even better!

This casino used to be my husband's favorite back in his 20s so we decided to stay here on our most recent trip to Las Vegas. It looks much the same as it did back in the 90's but they haven't let it get run down or anything. I wish we could afford a room in the new fancy Nobu tower but unfortunately we were in the Forum tower which I believe is the oldest one. Our room was still nice looking and clean so I have no complaints. However, if you are planning to use the spa or fitness center they are both located in the Augustus tower so it might be worth paying a little extra for that. It was also a pretty far walk (thru the middle of the casino) to the swimming pools. I think all the other towers are closer to the pools and restaurants but the Forum is closer to the shopping. It is also somewhat close to the sports book which was in full swing with it being March Madness. Apparently Caesars is like March Madness Central because of the ginormous TV they have that you can see throughout that entire wing of the casino. Even all the other bars and restaurants had the games on. And they were all packed with people watching. I did place one bet at the sports book and I will say that they were friendly and efficient and had plenty of staff to handle the crowds.

I felt very overwhelmed staying here and was very ready to leave by the end of the trip.
