Ice machine on my floor: BROKE.  called the guest service and let them know, 2 days later, still wasn't fixed.  

No bathrobes: so i called guest service again, and was told only in suites have bathrobes...i would have stayed at one of the suites if i was told i had an option.  Asked if i could pay extra for those robes, my request was declined.  Fine, only 2 nights, i thought.  

Coffee machine was dirty-as you can see in the pix- and there were no k-cups(coffee) to be found.  idk if i was supposed to purchase those as well????? 

2 fuc*ing MOTHS in my room-only 1 in the video. by the time i found the 2nd one, i had already made my mind up never to stay again, didn't bother to record i-  the hell??? really? 

Old, broken down outdated bathroom-see the photo\/video**since when yelp doesn't take videos??

Wifi-not free. $14 for 24hrs period only.  So, i called the guest service again thinking daily resort fee should cover the cost, which i was told when i call them, then i was told 2 different things back to back.  first the guy said it'd apply to my resort fee, so i told him i already prepaid all that when i made the reservation, then he said it's actually separate. i was confused.  Then when i asked again to confirm, he said it's part of the resort fee, and i would be charged....i gave up n hung up the phone. 

I was on my family road trip for the 1st time in 10 yrs, and Vegas was our last stop and was super disappointed, learned a lesson again.  you get what you pay for.  Mediocre at its best, just plain ghetto. 

NEVER again. NEVER!

Gaudy old school Vegas. This is the place you want to go if you feel the need to be in the company of fanny pack wearing mid-westerners, and camera toting Japanese tourists. It's not my style and the marble statues everywhere do nothing for me.

The snack I had there was far from spectacular and way overpriced. I wont return for the food or hotel accommodations. I don't know much about the casino, I had lost all of my money by the time I visited here.

Great rooms, jacuzzi tubs, and awesome service make this one of my favorite hotels on The Strip.  As much as I love walking down Las Vegas Blvd, there's really very little reason to leave Caesars.  Great restaurants by Bobby Flay and Gordon Ramsay, an awesome mall at the Forum Shops, and incredible shows and performers make this an easy choice when looking for a place to stay.

I love staying here, especially at the suites. I love the theme, but hate the smoking environment.. ahhh! They messed up once by checking us into an occupied room and we ended up getting upgraded to a beautiful suite, as well as a free certificate of $100 to spend in their hotel. Not to mention, the several knocks on the door, dropping off gifts. They seem to treat their diamond members very nicely. Probably my fave hotel in Vegas.

Hail, Caesar . . . here cometh before you, oh mighty Caesar, a couple from the West to attend a DUI conference as they have in years past . . . 

Why do I stay at Caesars?  Yeah, 'cuz the conference is there.  Although I would prefer to stay at Vdara, the Aria, the Cosmopolitan, even the Wynn or -- sigh -- the magnificent Mandarin Oriental, Lynn and I frequently stay in the Palace Tower at Caesars because you can roll out of bed, roll downstairs, and into a seminar . . . it IS convenient.

On the other hand, the former Emperor of the Strip is smokey, loud, and showing its age.  In the rooms, this (or that) doesn't work, this is damaged or "dinged," and the bed is about as comfy as the one found in a Motel 6.  

You have a choice:  pay $12 for the K-kups of coffee in the room (with powdered fake cream), or go down to the lobby and get a latte and croissant at François Payard's place.  So, it's down to the lobby in the elevators -- walk the (seeming) half-mile to Payard's, wait in line, and then back the way I came so Lynn can have some coffee wile getting dressed.  

It's convenient:  you can get off the elevators in their convention center -- that way you only have to (seemingly) walk halfway back to California to get to the ballroom where the conference is being held -- instead of down to the lobby, walk the half-mile to Payard's, across to the escalators and back up to the conference floor and the trek to Barstow . . . . 

And of course, since the restaurants at Caesars are not my first choice, you have to go down the elevators, walk the half-mile to Payards, then the extra mile through the smokey casino and noisy slots to the front door, stand in the l-o-n-g taxi line with people carrying those three-foot high plastic containers filled with once frozen margaritas, and hope the line moves quickly enough that you aren't late for dinner . . . .

OK, the spa is nice.  And there's now a Christian Laboutin store in the Forum Shops.  

But the wi-fi and cell reception in the conference center is dicey at best, which makes it difficult (to say the least) to work\/stay in touch with the office while you're at the conference -- and that's kind up important for a Criminal Defense Attorney, don't you think?

Bad news:  next year's conference is also at Caesars, and -- against my will and better judgement -- we'll probably be back . . . 

Hail, Caesar . . .

I think this might be my favo hotel\/casino in all of Vegas. Now, I've never actually stayed here, but it just looks nice, you know. I have, however, been in here several times, and I will eventually stay in it one day (maybe in a couple months, if I decided a trip to Vegas is necessary). 

When I was in Vegas over Memorial Day weekend, I went to an awesome pool party here. The regular Caesar's pool was pretty awesome, but there was an even awesomer pool that was gated off to the side. That's where the pool party took place. And you're probably wondering why it was so awesome right about now. Well I'll tell you why. Cause it was a topless pool party. Yeah, let that sink in for a minute. You're in Vegas, on Memorial Day weekend, it's hot, you're in the pool, there are hot topless chicks all around, and you're just chillin' drinking pina coladas and beer... that's the life. 

Btw, I'm not sure whether or not it's pager friendly...

Bullshit!! Fees fees and more fees. They won't tell you about them, but they will be there. In fact we had a whole nights worth of "resort fees" when we checked out. No mention of them anywhere! Not even in the fine print. I don't even know how it's legal. $200! They will tell you you have food credit that you can use, nowhere! Their game is to play dumb, act ignorant so they can sneak fees on you. It's old and haggard and I am disgruntled. I won't be back because I don't enjoy being tricked and lied to.

First time we stayed here to try a different hotel so here are some FYI-

Palace and Forum rooms are closest to the pools and buffet

Aug and Oct rooms are on the opposite end of self parking.

Self parking is also at the opposite end of check in\/hotel registration

Checkin time is 4pm but if you want to check in earlier, they'll charge you $28. There is a complimentary late check out at 12pm only. On top of any reservation fees, the resort fee is $28 pp.

Pool side beds for lounging are rentable for $25 pp or you can lounge on chairs for free. Pools were pretty but the cabanas are not as cool as Encore.

Lots of fees for everything. I still prefer Wynn\/Encore.

I don't really gamble. I was just here for the free aquarium I read about. The casino is very busy, loud and full of cigarette smoke. Pretty easy to get lost here and lots of walking involved to get to various parts of the property. I asked directions from a waitress walking by and she walked right on by and didn't even look at me. The second waitress I talked to was very friendly and showed us the right way to get to the aquarium. While walking to the aquarium, I was impressed by all the things to see and do. The interior of the building blew my mind with how beautiful it was. Lots of things to see outside of the casino, on the property. The second larger aquarium that I had been looking for, turned out to be in the Forum Shops which was quite a walk, easy to get lost and hard to get back outside. The aquarium was mediocre and small but I thought it was funny watching the sting ray try to eat a shark in the tank lol! This place is worth a visit, make sure to ask for a map and if you can't walk well, this place can be troublesome. Everything is spread apart.
Kitsch, gaudy, gilded awesomeness with high-end shops that will thrill everyone, from the poorest, paupered window shopper to the wealthiest bizzle on the block!
Beautiful lobby and shipping area. This hotel is definitely a classic. It really aids in someone experiencing the vegas ambiance.

This was my first time here.

I was playing black jack at one of your tables and the dealer was rushing us.  

I told her i wanted to split my two cards and she got mad.

Also i didnt know the 3+ rule on the table and she got angry and tried to force me to do it the next hand.

Same lady kept urging me not to hit on a hand and didnt speak much english and was very impatient.

Im never playing black jack here again.  Or any cards.

Very poor trained dealers.

Out of all the hotel I've stayed at, Caesar's my favorite. Three time here to be exact! Big, clean, beautiful view and I can go on and on. 
The only disadvantage is it's so big it takes forever to get to my room especially when I'm in high heels. Definitely will go back to Caesar when I'm in town.

We stayed for 4 days and it was fabulous. We were upgraded to the palace tower--a little far from everything except the pool but it was beautiful. Clean rooms and huge bathroom. 

We were there for a wedding in the Venus garden. Beautiful gardens and peaceful. 

The pools were beautiful and fun.

I absolutely do not like staying at Ceasars. I've heard great reviews and perhaps mine was one of many who had a bad experience. We arrived and the front desk was super kind and friendly and told us our rooms were not available since we came early but made us feel like she would take care of us. When it was time to get our keys the front desk lady (different lady) by the name of Maria and she was absolutely RUDE from the time we arrived immediately. She failed to mention how to get to our rooms based on our room number. We were totally lost. Gracious people helped us out.   The bell desk guys were very helpful and arrived with our luggage very quickly to our rooms. The Palace Tower pool side view rooms are horrible and construction was happening the entire time!! You can hear everything!! The toilet leaked water all over and it just did not look luxury at all. The Arial is much more luxury than Ceasars.  I don't recommend staying here unless you money to upgrade big bucks.

This review is for the Colosseum valet:

These guys really have their s**t together! While attending a show at the Colosseum Friday I used the Colosseum valet. It is located behind the hotel past the Forum shops valet. A little hard to find but definitely worth it. Only a short walk inside to the casino, restaurants and Colosseum, 

They are very fast and friendly. We were given great directions and excellent service when we arrived. After the show it was very crowded but extremely well run and efficient. We waited only a few minutes after giving the attendant our card and our car arrived. It was also easy getting out back to Las Vegas Blvd. 

Thanks Caesars valet!

Do not stay in this hotel! The only thing they care about is the night club. They have no organization in the check in progress, just shove your way into the line you think is shortest. The valet parking is always full, and if you can get through traffic back to the door parking good luck finding a spot. 

If you do manage to find a parking spot, you have the horrible floor plan to deal with getting to your room. Choke points where foot traffic stops, and then the battle to get by the people waiting to get into the club.

This used to be such a nice place, but now it's obvious why they are in bankruptcy.
A really nice place for a convention.  Clean and lots of room.  Good catered food even for large groups.

Not bad for an old relic. This dinosaur of a casino is actually a lot nicer and more modern than what I was expecting. The suite I was staying at overlooked the pools and was located in the Palace Tower, which is one of the newer towers (the Palace Tower opened in 1997, while the Augustus Tower opened in 2005 I think). The size of the suite was roughly the same, if not larger, than a standard suite at the Palazzo. But, the bathrooms are much nicer. There were 2 bathrooms (his and hers) with a 2 person shower with 2 shower heads joining them. The smaller bathroom consisted of a sink and toilet, while the larger bathroom had a toilet and bidet, sink, and hot tub. The suite was tastefully decorated with modern furniture. The king-size bed was comfortable but a little softer than I prefer. The view from the 11th floor was decent -- overlooking their pools, but there's not much else to see except the other towers and I-15. My only complaints are that the hot tub was extremely loud (like having a lawn mower in the bathroom) and it took close to 10 minutes for the hot water to kick-in with the showers. Other than that, the suite was amazing. It was a little bit of a hike from the parking garage and the signage could be improved but it's well worth the trip. Caesar's has done a good job staying relevant all these years among the mid- to top-tier hotels in Vegas. Although their clientele is definitely a mixed bag of high-rollers and some... um... not-so-high-rollers... and everything in between. They may not be in the same class as Wynn\/Encore or the Bellagio, but they're a good option if you're looking for a hotel one or two steps down from that.

Stayed hear on the 4th of July weekend...pretty crowded and HOT HOT. But the pool was awesome and will most def book this hotel during the summer or anytime the pool are open. Hotel was great and shopping was perfect has all the stores I needed to go.

I have been to vegas three times this year. Twice i have stayed at Caesars during business trips. I loved this hotel. I have stayed at many of the Las Vegas places but i did like this place. My room was in one of the new towers and it was so nice. I have many fav hotels and places i love to eat. I will be writing more reviews. This is worth a stay, o and go to Pure. Fun Fun Fun.

Stayed July 2011

This review is strictly a review of CP LAGO "BUFFET"

PASS!!!!

Although beautiful from the outside, Caesars just isn't that great inside. The buffet was a big let-down and it cost 26.00 for dinner...when you can see the entire buffet in one glance, thats just ridiculous!!! Our waiter looked like a washed up sailor. I asked him what kind of sodas they had, he then asked me what I wanted and told me no several times before giving me 3 options, on top of that he totally sprayed my face with his saliva while he spoke to me. Then when we came back with our plates...he brought each of us 2 sodas...I am assuming this is so that he has to do LESS work? 6 sodas on one table looks kind of ridiculous. I have never had a waiter do that to me ever. Super Lame. Do not come here for their buffet.

I went with three friends for St. Patrick's Day (and it was a Saturday). We parked in the back and had such a hard time trying to find check-in. We were constantly getting lost in this place. We had booked two suites but when we got there the man at the check-in counter recommended that we upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite, Augustus Tower Senator Suite. It was actually cheaper for us to get that room for all 4 of us instead of just two separate rooms. 

That room was amazing. It had a double door entry, a huge living room with a table that seated 6, 4 bathrooms, bidet, large whirlpool tub, two bedrooms, great view. We were in heaven. So many amenities, I could have left my toiletry bag at home. Fantastic time at the beautiful Caesar's Palace.

We had our wedding at the Venus Garden at Caesars and most of our family & friends stayed at Caesars 3-7 days before\/after the wedding.  The hotel itself was ok.  I was disappointed with our room, the wedding contract states you will get luxury accommodations for 2 nights, however we were in a standard room, actually some of our family had nicer, more up to date rooms than we had.  We were also supposed to have a limo take us to get our marriage license, however we had a standard suburban take us.  Overall it was ok, just less than what I had expected based on the package description online & provided by our wedding coordinator.  The wedding ceremony itself was perfect, our wedding coordinator took care of everything and our officiate did a great job.  The photographer was ok, we didn't upgrade that part of our package so we had him for the ceremony and about 20 minutes after the ceremony.  We received about 90 proofs to look thru online, but several of them were the same pictures only in black\/white.  We had our family take pictures before & after the ceremony, which was much cheaper.  We only stayed at Caesars because we were getting married there, in the future we'll probably stay elsewhere.

The service in Cesar palace  is terrible. I stayed in one of the suite, we broke a beer bottle when open the mini ref. I called and asked someone to clean up the floor. No one showed up for an hour, I come downstairs ask for help, no one come over for 2 hours. We called again, and waited for 2 more hours and still no one showed up! My advice to you - do not stay here and I will never ever come back again!

Really LARGE and cleverly crafted escalator setup inside the this mall. The shops are obviously priced for profit (this is the strip) but they do have some cool art galleries to check out while you walk. The  best part was the fact that Caesars has cleaned up the problem they had with ladies of the night. So you can actually come here and enjoy yourself without worrying about being propositioned.

A beautiful & very busy hotel & casino.  Stayed in the rooms here, gambled, & even worked at the Forum Shops.  No complaints at all.  =) This is where the colosseum is where Celine Dion is back here performing.  Very popular show to see in Vegas.  Luv her! Still have yet to go see her perform though.  A lot of beautiful indoor decors.  Great for taking pictures when visiting.  As well as outdoor decors.  Night clubs\/lounges\/bars seem to be super busy in here as well on a daily basis.  Drinks aren't very cheap so have lots of $ w\/ you! =) I've only gone to Pure night club & some of the bars.  Which are pretty good.  The Pussy Cat Dolls lounge is here.  This hotel is HUGE so one tip for you girls.... COMFORTABLE SHOES especially if you wanna just cruise around the place.  The mall (Forum Shops) in this hotel is pretty good too.  Good restaurants. There's something  for everyone.  If you're wondering about the costs of things... moderate to very expensive.  You got the most finest shops to some of the everyday shops.  Hotel rooms are are very nice.  The ones i've been in anyway.  Always kept clean & maintained.  Of course you have the pool area (which I haven't been in myself but have seen it).  Beautiful!  Then you have the spas here you can also check out.  You can also plan weddings.  You can pretty much do a lot here & the staff will cater to your needs.

We asked for non-smoking (Palace Tower) but we were hit by a wave of smoke when we opened the door. Worse, the bathroom had been used - towel on the floor, wet sink, open tube of soap or lotion. They said sorry, although we requested non-smoking, they could not guarantee it. They could, however, run an ozone machine there for an hour, but we would have to be out of the room. It was near 11:00 PM and we were exhausted from our trip already. They insisted no other rooms were available. But we insisted that we could not stay in that room, especially since it didn't look like it had been properly cleaned, and that they speak to their manager, after which another room magically appeared.

It was a bigger room with two bathrooms sharing a common shower, so that was nice. But you could see it was falling apart. The toilet flush handle would get stuck and keep flushing. Water leaked out of the shower stall door. The shower heads put out fine needles of water, mildly uncomfortable.  The bidet water pressure was too low for use. The TV had the wrong aspect ratio set (which we could not unset). But it was better than the "smokehouse". Our room at the Venetian was more updated, with motorized shades\/curtains and a real sitting room.

The main attraction (apart from their new spa, for $45) is their pool area, which was very windy that week, but still ok when the sun was shining. If you like sunbathing, it's a nice area. But there was a soda can floating in the center pool. Gym is $25\/day.

Restaurants there are Vegas-priced, expensive, but you can get a set lunch for about $24. Best deal is the food court burger for about $6 (using free Total Rewards card). Also great BBQ there. Lobster roll not much lobster, though everything there is cooked well.

There is also the Bachannal buffet, but arrive early to miss the line. We paid $43 for dinner. Good selection includes crab legs and prime rib, but not much fish or lobster. (The Bellagio's buffet had awesome sea bass.) Lamb was tough, dry. Also had some Asian dishes. Great ice cream selection, e.g. Balsamic fig.

We stayed at Caesars Palace for 5 days\/4 nights.  We had what they called a Classic Guest Room.  One big bed, 2 sinks, 1 toilet, shower, & tub\/shower.  No bathroom door - I guess for people with wheelchair but really no privacy in the bathroom area.  Tiny TV & blowdryer in bathroom.  2 rolls of toilet paper!

No coffee pot so couldn't make my oatmeal packs.  They have a coffee stand downstairs so people had to buy coffee $4+.

View - could see the Rio from a far.  Nothing special.

Huge hotel.  Forum Shops downstairs.  Lots of restaurants downstairs too.  

Munchbar skip it: http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/munchbar-las-vegas#hrid:CHX86xMBwnSzXGA7n7MHWg

Serendipity3 - Skip it!
http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/serendipity-3-las-vegas#hrid:T_pmHN05z5kxpguPVDfP8Q

Self parking FREE & pretty easy to find parking.

This review is for my experience yesterday 4\/27\/16 at a concert here. The staff working this event were incredibly UNFRIENDLY AND RUDE. The security yelled at me and my group for waiting outside the bathroom for my mom... I expected much nicer treatment from such a "classy" place.. . The hotel itself is beautiful but I don't think I'd rush back to see a show here again based on how we were treated by the mean staff. We were also yelled at by the security coming into the show. They yelled at my grandma (who cannot hear in one ear).... what a way to represent such a nice hotel! I hope they hire some new people.

Caesars was awesome easily one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed in, I mean what isn't there to like.  First off the place is massive, just flat out huge, multiple restaurants, multiple bars and of course an assortment of slots and table games for your gaming pleasure.

The pool area is magnificence; I believe there are good 7 or 8 different pools for your swimming and also ogling pleasure.  Chairs are on a first come, first serve basis, so get out there early to snag the prime locations.

The room I stayed in was amazing, probably bigger than my apartment, huge King size bed, a couch and two arm chairs.  The bathroom alone was a prize, huge walk in shower with dual showerheads, a huge Jacuzzi tub that could comfortable fit two or more people. Two separate toilets in two different rooms and also a bidet and nothing says classy hotel like a bidet.

The only downsides are that it is super pricey, 8 dollars for an aluminum bottle of Miller Lite at the pool side bar is a bit extreme. 25 dollars for a Long Island ice tea poolside. Everything is way more than it should be but then again it is Vegas and on the strip, so you should know what to expect.

The TV was acting very bizarre, the channel would randomly change to the menu screen several times by itself and then it would be impossible to change the channel off of the menu screen.  Finally called down to the front desk and they were able to reset the TV but then the TV would no longer turn on, called again and they sent someone to replace the batteries, they seemed to fix the issue but it was still an annoying situation.

Also for some reason I was standing on the side of the tub and noticed that the paint was chipping in the ceiling above the mirror, come on Caesars you're a classy establishment, you've got to be more through with your upkeep.

Still wonderful hotel and definitely looking forward to a return visit.

PS I won 52 dollars on a penny slot, like I said what's not to like.

By far the WORST hotel and over priced  POOR SERVICE disgusting old food!  John Bernard the hotel manager appears lazy and irritated with his job!  THE ABSOLUTE WORST check-in service!   Don't  expect help or short lines!!!!  I Am a  rated player in the Harrahs chain and by far this is the WORST OVER PRICED HOTEL IN THEIR CHAIN!  We left went to ARIA & ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT!!!!  IWILL NEVER GO TO CAESARS AGAIN

Caesar's is a 5 Star Hotel that still caters to the rich and famous.  It has been featured in countless movies from Rain Man to Casino to The Hangover.  This used to be the hotel to be seen in and in all honesty is making a big come back.  Caesars is old but they have expanded and modernized the entire property a number of times.  It also goes to mention that the Resort Property is absolutely HUGE.  The pools, the restaurants, the glamor,  and the shows are still first class.  

The rooms have all been redone and are very nice now.  They did a great job in making everything modern looking with decor and amenities.  The Forum shops are still the best in my opinion with all the Designer names mixed in with upscale stores.  This hotel is always full with a good mix of people.  I bumped into Jay-Z (literally), NBA stars, actors etc here throughout the years.

The High Roller reputation that his Casino holds has been earned and solidified for decades.  It has over the top Roman decor but has kept up with modern times surprisingly well.  It can be intimidating gambling here as more fortunes have been won and lost here than anywhere  else in the world.

If you are a VIP this is still a top 5 hotel, if you gamble especially poker you will be in heaven, and if you are a high roller you will be treated like Caesar here.

Love Love Love our room for the night. My boyfriend and I booked through Expedia prior to our visit at the Caesars Palace. We were told that we were staying in the Roman Tower but upon checking in at 6pm there were none available so (I believe) the clerk upgraded us for free because we got to our hotel room and it was actually a 2-room suite with a living room, HUGE walk-in closet, big screen TV, 2 bathrooms, dining table for 6 people, and plenty of couch space for guests. The best part.. we had a jetted spa, multiple head granite shower and his\/her sink style in our bathroom. Such a gorgeous room-- you will love it! 

We stayed in room 5827 of the Forum Towers, you won't be disappointed if you book this room! 

My only complaint or concern.. when we were checking out they told me I had a $150 balance due. When we went to check what it was for, we found out that it was due to us removing the drinks in the refrigerator for more than 30 seconds. Apparently the fridge is weight censored and they charge you for removing them. We removed the drinks to put our own in, not thinking anything of it. It would have been nice of the clerk to inform us of this policy upon checking in- luckily they removed the charges. 

Also, be wary of your check-out bill. Someone charged $25 to our bill for Starbucks (which I had no idea the hotel even had) the front desk lady said "were supposed to check ID, and if it matches then we'll charge the room." Well apparently they didn't check and ID because we never went there once.  Thankfully- they removed this charge as well.


Don't go to the 24-Hour diner by the hotel check-in. It took over 30 minutes for one to go meal and it was cold\/soggy by the time we got it. Not only that but it was $35 for a simple fish and fry meal-- way too overpriced. Mcd's has better food than this!.

Never stayed at this hotel (although I wouldn't mind it) but on my last LV trip a couple friends did and they absolutely LOVE it. Rooms are huge, clean, and well decorated (so they say)...

For some reason I like the casino here... I dunno what it is about it but I just like it. There are TONS of places to eat... TONS of places to shop... and LOTS of sculptures... beautiful Roman sculptures to see...  curved escalators and a little waterfall\/pond inside... outside of the property there are Roman sculptures and waterfalls... it's really a gorgeous property inside and out. 

They also have a free show in front of the Cheesecake Factory called the Fall of Atlantis. Pretty cool show that shows the myth of Atlantis. I think they perform it every hour... and behind the show there's a huge saltwater aquarium with LOTS of different fish. Very pretty!

It's located pretty much in the center of the strip. Great location. Great hotel!

You can tell that this is one of the older hotels but it is still really nice.  My eyes must have been huge the whole time.  Its so extravagant!  There is this place in the middle of the forum shops that every hour the very large statues start to move and talk to each other and its fuckin bad asssss!!!!

But the buffet in Caesars sucks ass!!!

We had our wedding ceremony here at the Juno Garden and got the "Caesar" wedding package. Melissa was our coordinator and she was amazing! She handled every question, concern, and bump in the road in a timely and professional manner. 

We opted out of the included photographer since the photo credit got you a few prints and a handshake, and our family wouldn't be allowed to take pictures of the ceremony since the photographer had "exclusive rights." $200 opt-out fee well spent!

The floral credit covered my bouquet, three bridesmaid bouquets and a corsage. The flowers were pretty and not dead. 

The "complimentary gift" is two nice champagne glasses, so don't buy any at the gift shop! ;)

Our limo driver was very courteous, extremely nice, very professional, and on time! (Included in package)

The suite we got was GORGEOUS. Two bathrooms with a shower bridging them. The window overlooked the pool area and our ceremony site which was pretty cool.
This place needs new management.  Nothing to eat past 11 pm. The cafe has 3 items for ridiculous price and they are out of ingredients of those items?!?!  Time for a new hotel manager!

In the world of Vegas, Caesars Palace is one you must tick off your list as having visited.  I've stayed here a few times and always enjoyed the experience.

For me, I visit the Forum Shops every time, the dining and shopping options are fun and a great time suck.  The Forum Shops is a huge indoor mall of stores and restaurants under a blue sky, which gradually evolves into dusk.  It's an experience to see at least once and take in the architecture, statues, and animatronic performance at the large fountain.

Caesars represents everything that is Las Vegas.

Overall, a great all encompassing casino\/restaurant\/shopping experience!
I'm usually here for some freebie event and I enjoy the relatively easy self-parking. 
Even though it's an older property, it retains the Vegas vibe of yesteryear. Never a dull moment in the teeming casino! They manage to bring in a buttload of celebrity chefs for an unrivaled dining experience!

When I placed my reservation over the phone, the gentleman was nice and helpful.  He informed me that if I add about $80 or $100 (not sure the exact amount) to my original reservation, I can get a larger suite in the Augustus tower.  I placed the reservation, he sure sold me.  I received an email confirmation that did not give the details of the room I reserved, it simply gave a confirmation # and explained that I can set up a text message service that will provide for a quicker check-in.  I signed up for the text service and I was so excited to use it and know that I can avoid the check-in lines and go straight to the bell desk to pick up my room keys.  

Upon arrival, the bell desk claimed my keys were not ready and to continue to the platinum members line to ensure faster service.  I waited in the platinum members line for over 15 minutes, not one person came to the desk to greet me.  After 45 minutes of what was supposed to be the "fastest check in"  I was finally greeted by staff who said they will check me in. By the time my reservation was pulled up ( an hour of wait time had passed)  he gave me keys to a regular room.  When I noticed he wasn't directing me to the Augustus Tower as promised, I quickly mentioned that I paid extra for that type of suite.  He questioned me and asked if I had any proof.  I told him when they sent a confirmation email, it says nothing about Augustus, so I have no proof, other than the extra price I paid for the room.  Another 3o minutes pass, several arguements, and a lot of disappointment occurred before the check in attendant finally found my correct reservation. 

This is completely unaccepatble.  I dont understand why Caesar's doesn't automatically send an email confimation including the correct room reservation?  Or why the computer system is not updated correctly.  Either way, after a huge mistake like that happens at the resort's expense, the customer MUST be compensated somehow.  After such a stressful and aggravating check in, I went up to the room to settle in.  Only to find dirt and nasty body hair all over my bathtub! I had to clean my own tub before I got in.  This entire experience was very disappointing and unsettling.  I called management and notified them of my experience.  They took $100 off my reservation, which did not solve the problem or satify me one bit.

The ONLY reason I would ever come back to stay here is because this is the only hotel on the strip that is pet-friendly.

Recently stayed at Caesars. Enjoyed my stay. Hotel staff was very friendly. My only complaint is that it was difficult to get seats at the pool area. Searched for about 40 minutes one day. The food court is kind of pricey too. I would definitely stay again.

OMG, LOVED staying at Caesars. From the hotel check in with impeccable customer service to our room in the new Forum Tower, this place was amazing.

Our room was spacious and had just the right combination of class and Las Vegas vibe with a TV in the bathroom mirror to make us happy!

The casino was bumping with tons of people from all walks of life and featured excellent shops and dining experiences from Food Network faves as Gordon Ramsey and Bobby Flay to megastars like Celine Dion and Shania Twain, to the popular Forum Shops.

This is definitely a wonderful place to stay when you come to Las Vegas.  Can't wait to come back and stay here again.

I've stayed at all of the Harrahs properties at 1 time or another so I think I can give an accurate review. Ceasars is 1 of the best Harrahs properties by far in Vegas. The rooms were nice, the restaurants we ate at were all good and the pools are really nice. The only negatives I remember was that they don't provide a fridge in your room unless you pay 20$\/day...bu11sh1t! They also check your bags when going to the pool so you don't bring any food or beverages...although I guess that's common at the nicer places. Overall, I would def recommend staying here!


*******Update  Just visited Vegas again and came to gamble at Ceasars...they just lost a star from me...if you play blackjack, be very careful! They have pits that pay different odds and the pit with the dancing and provocatively dressed woman...DO NOT PLAY BLACKJACK HERE!!!! They not only pay 6\/5 on blackjacks (which is something you really need to avoid...you'd be surprised how much you're losing), but at these tables, you can ONLY double down on 10 and 11, and CANNOT double down after you split pairs!!!! The most ridiculous thing I've ever seen...KNOWHERE in Vegas do they do that!!! I think because they're right near the club, kids come out drunk and don't care...run away from those tables!

Room review! I'm under 21 and yet I still keep coming back to Vegas! We got a free room here at Caesar's courtesy of my dad's Total Rewards membership and requested for an Augustus pet stay deluxe room but it wasn't met so I was quite bummed about that since we brought a dog with us. We got bumped down to a room at the palace tower which wasn't too bad since it gave us easy access to the pool. Big hallway, lots of closet space and cabinet, 2 huge queen beds, 2 'restrooms' adjoined by a shower (one had the big jet tub and bidet, the other just had a vanity mirror and a toilet), and one teeny TV. Seriously for a big room, you would think the TV would at least be 30 inches. Stratosphere has better TV's! However, for someone who can't drink yet and gamble and only had the yummy patisserie and desserts and outlets to look forward to, the room at Caesar's is a good place to stay at for having quick and easy access to all the good touristy spots.
7 Stars and Diamond Lounge located near the Augustus Tower. The Forum Tower is located near the food court. This is the place I stay when visiting Vegas.

this story goes way back...we were in our senior year in college, all old enough to gamble, so we drove to the sin city.  if my memory serves me right, the best thing we did was eating at caesar's palace buffet, sharing 1 lobster with 3 other girls.  the hotel was beautiful, the people were beautiful and even the staff here were beautiful.  we were too poor to stay at this hotel back then, but i promised myself that one day i will be back as a guest.  what a sad story...

fast forward 10 something years, i finally kept the promise last weekend.  10 girls checked into a 2 bedroom , 2 story suite, and when we opened the double door, our jaw dropped.  a grand piano, a whirlpool bath tub, a wet bar, marble floors, huge rooms, a livingroom and even a bidet...it was absolutely amazing.  we used every single amenity (played piano when we were sober and threw ourselves into the tub when we were drunk).  i know this hotel is a little outdated compared to wynn and bellagio, but it just has the old charms and grandioso vibes.  what a comeback story this is...

the staff at the front desk were very pleasant to deal with and even remembered my name the next day when i asked them to accommodate us with some stuff at their rival hotel.  

be sure to take pictures with a lot of naked men standing in the hotel entrance, lobby and outside.  they are mute, deaf, blind and many are even limbless.

A hotel whose time has come and gone. Long gone. I am a diamond member, which means free rooms etc. Each stay you can see the hotel is sliding further down the abyss.  I'll write it out point by point should the management be reading, which I doubt but anyway..

1. We booked months in advance to stay in the Augustus Tower only to be told (literally) by the desk that they moved us so they could accomodate the Asian guests. Seriously. Got pushed to the way back of the hotel which really the room was fine, it's the principal of it. 

2. Qua.  Sad. This used to be spectacular.  It varied in price from $45 to $100 if you were not a hotel guest. If you were a hotel guest it was up to 2 people for $25 dollars. Plus if you were a diamond it was free a few years ago, then crept up to $25, then $30.   That's what I mean by "nickel and diming" .  $5 will make that much of a difference to you???   It doesn't to me, but it feels skanky.

-  This last visit to Qua, I brought 5 people. We paid and went in.  In the ladies side, in the Roman baths, the lights were on full tilt. this means bright, under the microscope lights.  I went and mentioned it, the girl at the desk was a wet noodle and basically hemmed and hawed and said the maintenence guys had left the lights on high. No, she didn't offer to fix it.  I've been to QUA maybe a hundred times, the whole point is dim lights, candles, soothing music. Not lights up like on a Broadway stage.  At this point, I got really annoyed and said "don't worry, I'll go handle it myself".  In my robe I marched out of the spa and to the Spa Desk and told them the situation.

Next.  I'm back sitting in the pool putting up with the bright lights trying to decide what to do. A spa employee comes up, and i kid you not, says  "we'd like to offer you a full refund it you leave, and a half refund if you stay".  Seriously?  I'm a diamond status guest, and you are telling me that?   I told the employee  "what you should be saying is  We're really sorry about the situation, let us treat you to today's spa experience"  and give me my $30.   I gamble a hundred times that a day, for them to offer me $15 was beyond funny.

Then.  They are elminating the special valet on the side of the Augustus tower, which was amazingly convenient. One of the valet guys said it was so they could let a few of them go.

Caesar's is done.  I would rather pay moving forward to stay somewhere with a sense of pride in what they're doing than stay there for free.  Contrast with the Cosmo where the employees seem to genuinly love what they're doing, and treat the guests with respect.

We stayed in the Octavius Tower. I loved it. I had no problems with noise & It was very nice looking (I'm not some high-end, rich person though). 

I wanted to compliment their service answering the phones. Every time I needed to contact them the person on the other end of the phone was SOO nice! Extremely nice. It instantly put you in a good mood!
Great Hotel..... super nice staff great shopping mall....... I will see u soon again.

Sounds like Harrah's may have bludgeoned its bondholders and blown out its cost structure enough to keep the multi-property CRM behemoth from having to put any of the golden gooses -- Caesars Palace foremost amongst them -- on the block. As a consumer, I suppose that's a good thing, because that monstrous combined inventory pool, and the infrastructure and tactics to shuffle loyal customers amongst its properties like pawns on a chessboard, is what lets them comp rooms even for occasional visitors like me.

The rooms at Caesars Palace must be highly variable, because my $500\/night room looked like a Motel 6, but clearly that can't be representative.

It's nightclub Pure will of course not be able to compete head-on with Tryst\/XS, but it's still the Tuesday night spot and worth stopping by once just to check it off the list.

Poolside brunch is fit for a...Caesar. Legendary.

Probably one of the worst customer experiences. They have you check in, give you no idea of what time your room will be ready and leave you hanging for 5-6 HOURS!!! It's clear they want you to spend $5 for a coffee at Starbucks, $50 for a t-shirt and drop dough in their swanky stores, but after a coast to coast flight, I just want to sit down and not have it cost me $50.  Place smells of stale cigarettes. Just better options on the strip. Missed a business dinner waiting for my room! UGH!
Wow...great service all weekend. The room was excellent, nice view of the pool. We gave stayed at several Vegas resorts and Ceasers is on the top of my list.

Once upon a time on a random Vegas Sunday morning...

Cell Phone: *ring *ring

Jimmy:  *Groggy  * Clears throat   * coughs*  Hello?

Cell Phone: Hello Mr Ngo, this is Chase Bank just checking to see if you have your card in possession.

Jimmy: Ummm, yeah, why?

Cell Phone: We noticed some irregular card activity this past weekend and just want to be sure everything is ok.

Jimmy: What do you mean?!

Cell Phone: We noticed a withdrawal of $500 from your account followed by another withdrawal of $500 at 3:15 am.

Jimmy: Oh, I'm in Vegas.

Cell Phone:  I see Mr. Ngo, just know that any significant withdrawal followed by another within 20 minutes will draw a red flag.

Jimmy: Oh ok, thanks.

Phone: *ring *ring

Jimmy: Hello?

Phone: Hello, this is Bank of America...

**********************************************************************************************
Now every time I stay @ Caesars, I book for only the Augustus Tower.  Private checkin' and entrance are there for Diamond players.  Beautiful rooms, 550 sqft. standard.  Better in person then in pictures.  Nice comfortable white beds.  Plenty of lighting, unlike several Vegas hotels.  LCDs are Sony... big plus!  Nothing much bad to say about property except for it being so huge.  Staying in other towers is a b*tch to get to.  Not only is it far from the front entrance, it's easy to get lost.  Too many nook and cranny and seperate pathways.  Palace towers is one of the worst to get to.  Stayed in a room there once and almost always forgot how to get to the elevators. 

Beautiful pool areas... can't say the same of eye candy.  More of the "mature" folks are here.  

The only Vegas property that has two separate casino areas.  I don't like how they take commission right away for winning hands at the table games.  Wished high limit area was more secluded.... then again, I would love it more if I won there.

Forum Shops, best shopping destination for lovers of designer labels.   Almost every major player has a boutique there... LV, Gucci, Balenciaga, Ferragamo, etc.  Just wished Prada and Dior Homme set up shop there instead of having to jaunt over to Bellagio and Wynn, respectively.    

Despite the minor setbacks, it's still one of the best properties.  You can stay here the whole weekend in Vegas and never have to step foot out of the resort.  Believe me... it's happened before!!!
Very happy in the palace tower.  Wife and I came for a convention and the staff are very helpful and friendly.  Room is quite large with a spa type tub and a great view.  Comfy beds and a large TV.

Caesars Palace is one if the largest and best known hotels in Vegas.  I have stayed here and it was lots fun.  Huge casino that actually has single deck black jack (the other is Hard Rock) forum shops are awesome and connected to Caesars.  Central on the strip and was great for us to gamble and sit in the sports book.  The rooms are pretty basic and reasonable.  I like Caesars, I love the Bellagio that is next door. Two different atmospheres, Caesars is more party mode.  It was perfect for the Vegas bachelor party I went on :) Sushi bar Hyakumi located across from Cleopatras Barge was pretty good but pricey,  the best news I have read is that the highly acclaimed Nobu brand brings the world's largest Nobu Restaurant space to Caesars Palace Las Vegas in the heart of Nobu Hotel. The 11,200 square foot dining area and adjacent lounge features a sushi bar, private dining area and circular central bar. It's also the only U.S. Nobu offering teppan tables. With a menu that pleases the most sophisticated of palates, feast on imported Asian and Japanese fish, imported seafood, sushi rolls and exotic delicacies. I love NOBU and there is one at Hard Rock, hard to believe another is just down the strip!!

Ill give it a couple of stars do to the fact there is alot to do HOWEVER 

We valet parked ( taking parents to ramsays. ) closer to the planet Hollywood area and not alot of sign age direction to casino we got lost about 4 times and was about ready to head out. While yes there is a directory they need to change the sign color or something either have the business in side the casino separate plaque or have single Large signs directing  you to the casino.

Also the casino floor layout is bad -- i.e 1 $ 2$ slot games mixed in with 25 cent and penny slots, and then realizing after you go past the pus.cat doll poker room or what ever that was that there is a complete penny room adjacent from the exit room. 

We nearly walked to whole back side of that casino and ramsay's is tucked all the way in the back we where thinking about going to another restaurant due to the fact. 

Me personally I wont be back the casino floor was really tight on a Friday -- I didn't win nothing not even a dickie bird ha. 

Get some better signage and also they need to work on there floor cleaning pick up I saw alot of beer bottles, plastic cups, etc. overall impression was meh. If I wanted to go old school I would stay in Fremont.

First time at Caesar's. I got a great rate by booking online and using my Total Rewards card. The room was very spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was luxurious. 

I didn't care for their method of check-in. I received an email the day before, saying I could check-in online, and I did. The reply email stated I would receive an email telling me where to go to pick up the keys when the room was ready. Check-in time was 3pm, and if the room was ready earlier, they would also let me know. There I was in the check-in line at 3:15, never receiving an email. 

Also, their check-in line is more like grocery store check stand lines, not like most other hotels with one long line. This way is more unfair, as the people in front of me took too long to service, and I watched a lot of people who came after me, leave with their room keys before I even got to the counter. And talk about no sympathy from the clerk. I guess They must hear it all the time,  "I didn't get an email. This line took so long, I wish I was in the other line."

But why only 1 star? Though just bad luck, the hot water system broke down and I was unable to bathe on the first night there. Yes, it was important for me to get clean before going to bed and I couldn't, so I had to go to sleep feeling dirty.

Still, why the knock? Well, when I called to ask about the hot water, though I did get an apology and an unfortunate, "we don't  know when it will be repaired," I felt I, and the rest of the guests who complained, should have been compensated in some way. (There was no hot water for hours, and I gave up around Midnight.) So I guess it was really a "I'm sorry, not really sorry" feeling that I was left with that brings them down. 

So, I guess that's the bottom line. Apathy for customer service nets you only one star.
Early check in just $30 amazing huge beautiful hotel, our room was just perfect on the Julius tower ... I havent yet visit the spa but cant wait

I am a sucker for themed hotels, however, in addition to come to the hotel to look at the detail, I like the Forum shops. It's the closet thing to the mall that you will get on the strip, at inflated prices. Personally other than FAO I've never actually bought anything, just browsed. It is a good way to kill time, look at expensive stores and admire the decor inside the mall. For the most part, the store are no different than the ones we have in Vancouver. I enjoy the feeling that you're outside instead of in a mall (faux cloud roof). It is actually a big mall worth checking out, just not strip shops.

Yes Sir, the best hotel at Vegas handsdown you already know, anyone whos anyone stays at caesars their wuality of everything is unmatched i dont know what it is about the place i think its the great pools. Or the staff, Or that ive had a great time in vegas everytime we stayed here maybe im bias oh well, but i have stayed in alot of hotels here! Take my word, pay a little more, will be well worth it. ****UNLESS OF COURSE ITS YOUR FIRST TIME AND YOUR GONA BE ABOUT TOWN, THEN JUST GET A CRAPPY MOTEL*** LOLL


TFR

I love their Total Rewards Club card - not!  It brings you such privileges like waiting in line to cash in your chips while the upper reward tier attendants are sitting there doing nothing waiting for customers. I was having trouble using my Rewards card online, and the attendant at the Rewards desk  very snarkily told me she couldn't do anything for me. You would think I had leprosy the way she treated me. She told me I had to call the number on the back of the card, so I did. They told me that they couldn't help me either and I had to call still another number to get help.  At that point I told her I was done wth the Ceasar properties. Now, I'm not a bad gambler, I.e. I don't loose thousands at a time unlike those who seem to get wasted and get tons of service while they gamble (and who,BTW, are totally rude and disruptive to the other pleyers without any comments from the pit bosses) and I typically walk out of a casino with at least what I walked in with or just a little less, and I play the higher value tables.  But I guess because I don't get drunk and lose 1,000's at a time, I'm not considered a good enough customer to be given half way decent service. No more going at their casinos and time to look for better. Time to avoid:


Nobu Hotel at Caesars Palace
Harrah's Las Vegas
The Cromwell Las Vegas
The LINQ Las Vegas
Bally's Las Vegas
Caesars Palace Las Vegas
Rio All-Suite Hotel & Casino
Flamingo Las Vegas
Paris Las Vegas
Planet Hollywood Resort & Casino

These are Ceasars properties in Vegas!
Rooms are outdated and the restaurants Gordon's appears run down.

If you are looking for a nice room I would not recommend the Roman Tower, the room was outdated and needs update ASAP.  Of all the hotels I stayed during my trip in Vegas only Caesars Palace still uses tube TV.

This in my opinion is one of the better hotels and casinos in Las Vegas.

Up front with pricing. Good service is a plus.  Yes it can be expensive, but it's the Las Vegas strip if you can't afford it folks stay home.

While the convention center facilities were great, can't say I enjoyed the stay at Caesars Palace as much as I would have liked. Walking by the shops on the way to the Palace towers felt like running a gauntlet every time. Trying to dodge the offers of "free" lotion only to get you into the store.  Then there was the sleepless night with a party going on next door. Calls to guest services did not resolve that issue. Finally there was the inability of the hotel check-in\/check-out staff to take my tax exempt form as a federal employee (after accepting one from my boss). Needless to say I was happy to leave.

i walked inside this hotel as I was walking the strip, and this place is fa-a-ncy! They have great decor and fancy sculptures and fountains... 
I wish I could afford to stay here for the weekend, but unfortunately its quite pricey :(

This place is huge!!

Very roomy casino.  I only played a couple of slots here, mostly walked around the forum shops.  Love the seahorse bar, complete w\/seahorse aquarium.

The alarm clock in the room was falling apart. They told us at the counter they bumped us up into a nicer tower, but based on my review-hunting, that was a lie. But i'm a bit of a push over so we let it slide (also JUST in case my research was off)

The hotel itself is elegant but outdated. Once you take trips into other neighboring hotels (Venetian, Bellagio, etc), you'll see what I mean.

However on the plus side, if you are staying in Caesars you get into Pure VIP style. So that was a bonus.

Wouldn't stay here again.

My husband and I decided to take advantage of the deal they offered, $170 per night for the Palace Tower room with a jacuzzi. We had certain expecations since their rooms are usually $350 and up.
Good air circulation\/ventilation which means it did not smell of stale cigarettes and the smoke did not linger throughout the casino. Very helpful, friendly staff.
We booked the Palace Tower room and needless to say, it did not meet our expectations. For a jacuzzi room, it was average. Nothing special about the room, decor and the bathroom. The only plus side was the view of the pools. (We recently stayed at T.I. in a jacuzzi suite and the room was better!!)
Bacchanal buffet was AWESOME and worth every penny!!

Caesars' Palace was a total disappointment! At check-in I ask for a pool view room and am told none are available, we get a mountain view. So I say it's not looking over a parking lot is it? "oh no, you're too high up for that". Huh??? Sure enough 14th floor Palace Tower looks directly over their parking garage, and if you have good vision you can see the mountains in the daytime in the distance (if it's clear out). 

Because we need a fridge for medication, when a we get a knock on our door not 2 minutes after walking in, we are surprised to find maintenance there asking if we have a clogged toilet. What??? So, we flush the toilet, seems to work fine so no clog. Little did we know that it wasn't clogged, it just didn't seal and refill. So, had to call maintenance back later that evening and wait for them to come fix it. Of course they didn't have the right parts, so several trips later it was fixed. 

This room was a mess, not from poor cleaning, that was exceptional! The gold faucet was peeling off, the shower leaked everywhere and had a teeny quarter round shelf that had a hole in the center and dipped down to drain for holding toiletries. Most of our things were on the floor. 

Lights were either out or blinking on or off constantly, even after they were changed. 

Then there was the TV which went fuzzy, and lost reception constantly. You missed portions of what was going on of whatever you were watching. 

WIFI was horrible, and if you signed up for theirs, very expensive.

There was a Keurig machine in the room, but unless you brought your own K-cups it was $13.00 for 4 cups and whatever else they included in the box (I'm assuming it was sugar, cream and stir sticks) but didn't want to be charged to open it.

And, every time you left your room, you had to walk past very rude sales people asking you to try their products. After saying "No Thank You" more than a dozen times, we finally just ignored them. I don't like that behavior at the mall, and I didn't like it at Caesars'.

We were there for a conference, so unfortunately we were stuck.

The rooms are very nice and everything is very clean at this hotel. My only real complaint was how ridiculously over priced the alcholic beverages were at the pool...really 18$ for a 16oz drink that had only one shot or $24 for a 24oz drink with 4 shots...come on,,be reasonable with your paying hotel customers and they will return for years to come.

We stayed here for 3 days and 2 nights with my college friends. 7 adults. Our room is located in the 21st floor, Palace Tower. The room is modern, spacious and has a gorgeous pool view. 

The hotel itself is so big that it will take time to go from one place to another. Tiring most especially of you're wearing heels. Lol! They have top restaurants, shopping center and casino. The newest club, Omnia is in Caesars too.

Just like the old ruins and monuments in Rome, this place has withstood the test of time and is a Vegas institution.  Since Caesar's was built, there have been many other casinos that have opened and closed in that same time frame....but this place stays relevant and in the top tier of the Vegas hotels.

When we're back in Vegas, we'll drop by Pure at least one night on a weekend.  It's a fun nightclub.

The shopping and food options have remained top notch through the years.  We'll keep coming back.

Return Factor - 90%

The costumer service was bad. I've tried to connect to the wifi but it would not go through. So I had to call customer service, they could not help me. The way they could connect you to the wifi is by getting your IP address. So far I have been waiting for almost an hour now.
Beautiful property, well maintained.  If you are a travel agent mention upon checkin my room was upgraded to suite free of charge.  Thank you Ceasars.

Drinks are overpriced.  I wouldn't mind paying $11 for a small bloody Mary if it was decent, but it was not even decent \/: came to try and have bacchanal buffet, but the wait was 3.5 hrs.  That's outrageous.  Forget it.. And my bf and I hate the layout of the casino.  It's confusing.

My hatband and I visited to hotel for 2 nights.
When we checked in we also got a free upgrade to the a palace room which was pretty amazing. It was big and had a huge bathroom area with a jacuzzi.
The facilities were great. Amazing pools and a lot of entertainment within the hotel. The location is great and close to everything. 
I would recommend the Bacchanel buffet (hope I spelled it right..) - amazing and worth the price. 
cons:
-The Resort fee is high and only provides wifi for one device, otherwise you need to pay $14.99 a day - high! -coffee in the room is $12, crazy! 
-the comfy lounge beds around the pool are $50\/bed(!), we moved to the regular beds. I would expect a more reasonable price for that or even free, as we are paying a lot for the hotel already. 
-self parking is really far from the front desk, consider dropping off bags first and maybe then go park.

Have decided to write reviews for all the places I've stayed in Vegas, but be warned that my stay here was over a year ago, so things may have changed.

I was apprehensive about coming here because I've heard things about how campy and outdated they are.  I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. Yes, there's an awful fountain of naked muses in the lobby right when you enter, and there are similarly bad imitations of Classical sculpture everywhere in the hotel, but it's Vegas, so that's to be expected!  I was there for a conference and my employer had already pre booked everything.  The check in staff were very pleasant and offered a tempting upgrade to a better room for a mere $30 a day.  I waffled, then agreed to the offer.  When I got to my room, I was stunned--what a great bargain! It wasn't the largest room in the world, but it was around 500 sq. ft, VERY ample space.  The decor did not make my eyes hurt.  The bathroom was huge and had a TV as well as a jacuzzi tub.  And it only came for $30 more!  I slept very well--it was quiet and the air smelled clear (rare in Vegas).

The conference center was also a pleasant surprise. Very well appointed and large.  It was hard to get to from my rooms though.  And it was so big I got lost.  

The casino was average--seemed a bit empty, but the economy had just tanked when I was there (October 2008).  The one restaurant we went to, Rao's was good but pricey.  I think they were trying to capitalize on their reputation as one of the hardest restaurants to book in New York.  I'm still very much an MGM Grand fan when it comes to restaurants, though.  Maybe I am limited, but it just seems easier and more dependable, since they've managed to amass just about every noteworthy chef on the face of the earth over there.

My colleagues were a bit annoyed with the catering staff at this hotel for our business luncheon, and I must say that they were pretty rude to her regarding her gluten allergy.  But that aside, I had a very nice experience here, certainly better than the Venetian, which is supposedly a better hotel.

5 stars all the way!  From the time you register to the time you leave, the service is impeccable.  We were billeted during the October 1, 2017  tragic country music festival shooting.  Caesars Palace allowed me the comfort of feeling safe.  The hotel was on lockdown from the time the incident occurred until morning when law enforcement cleared everything.  I called a couple of times to get an update on the situation and received apologies for the inconvenience and assurance of safety.  I knew I probably was not the only one inquiring as the situation on the boulevard was tense.  The phone calls were answered promptly and with amazing courtesy.  I appreciated being addressed by name each time I called.  As expected, the accommodations were wonderful.  Gorgeous hotel and casino! Would definitely recommend and will be back.

My husband and I stayed here last year during our vacation. Their website is confusing because it doesnt tell you which tower you're booking. I did plenty of research and was able to figure out the towers based on pricing. If you choose the cheapest room, most likely it is the older towers. I chose the room with a king size bed, strip view & non smoking. It was roughly $151 a night, not including resort fees. I could safely assume that this room was located in the Augustus tower. When we checked in, I confirmed it with the receptionist.  This tower has more updated fixtures and furniture. It was a good sized room with a great view of the strip and fountain. I enjoyed the room.

What i didnt like was the parking. The structure is a little confusing and you have to walk through the restaurants and casinos to check in & it is a very far walk. I highly recommend valet parking because it leads you right to the check in area. The staff was friendly except for the staff working at Nobu. They were all stuck up & pretentious. Food was definitely over hyped. We might stay at this hotel again, but want to try others before returning.

Stay on 2\/18-20\/2012. Suppose to have the Deluxe Suite - Roman Tower reserved since Dec. Manager - not clerk switched our room at checkin to a smaller room that was not fit for the Caesar's name.  Outdated ugly furniture, dirty carpet, overall crappy room.  Complained but all 3 deluxe rooms (1300 sq ft w\/piano) had booked for evening.  Guess we were low man on totem pole.  Would have to move next day to promised room & received a $50 credit.  (wow that was worth it!)  Awful! Next day they were to call when room was done as we had a wedding re-newal to go to (ours) at 2:45.  They never called and we finallly called & said what's up?  Oh its ready, it's now 1:15 and bell hop on his way....1:30 not bell hop..another phone call..finally in room at 1:45 to leave 20 min later.  They could care less.
One bright point was the bell hops and desk clerk Adam.  Not one to one staff's fault but management unforgivable.  Stay away from any room in Roman Towers.

Overall, I really liked it. We stayed on the 7th floor in the Palace Tower for 4 nights during the week. Great location because it was pretty much in the middle of The Strip. Just some tips:

TIP #1: Don't mess with items inside or on top of the mini bar if you aren't going to use anything. It has sensors. Got charged $25 even though we never used it.

TIP #2: Check out at the front desk so you can go over your bill in case you have random charges. Also, don't be in a rush.

TIP #3: Use one of the sinks or put a trash bag in one of the trash cans to fill with ice to keep drinks cold.

TIP #4: Join Total Rewards. It's free & easy.
Qua Spa is all I can say.  Experience it at least once in your life.

Stayed here for my 35th b day this weekend. We were upgraded to the Augustus tower wit ha wonderful view of the strip via flamingo ave. Room was spacious. Ronnie the bell hop was very friendly and shared some fun stories with us. East coaster and nice. Kennard was our bell hop on the way out and he was great also.. The valet was very accommodating as well. The supervisor I think his name was Eric(sorry if i forgot) was awesome. Valet was full but since we are locals they took care of us. On a down note, no bathrobes in our room and they have a coffee machine there but you have to pay for coffee. Whatever, no down side but no biggie. 

First class all the way. Would definitely stay there again

Been to Vegas many times and this was the first time staying at Caesars. Overall: amazing room. Casino: it's ok. Staff: mostly pleasant. 

Checked in the VIP room around 2pm. Was given a room in the Augustus tower. Honestly nicest room I've had in Vegas. The view was right of the fountains and the Strip with nice big windows and an opportunity to open a vent for outside air. The room was big, bathroom huge with a great big tub, and a great shower. The beds were also very comfortable. 

For some reason I feel like their casino is weird\/small. Not a huge fan. I much prefer Planet Hollywood's casino layout. 

I don't recommend the cafe that's attached. Food is ok but service is downright awful. We waited 50 minutes for a table outside when we were told it would only be a few. They updated us every so often which was nice but it was fine, we had drinks we were talking and relaxin. No rush. Walked away for two minutes while someone from our party waited. Came back and I was told they gave our table away because we weren't there. Literally 2 minutes. I was annoyed at that point and told them. They magically Had a table ready. We say down. Waiter comes over 10 minutes later for drinks. Comes back 5 minutes later with drinks. We wanted to order he said to hold on. 15 minutes goes bye so we flag him down, ask for the check, and leave. I told them we're not interested in waiting this long for average bar food. The workers were pissed but so was I at that point as well as everyone I was with. 

Anyway, Caesars is great. I would definitely stay again. The pool was fun and beautiful. No waitress by the pool which was weird so we brought our own drinks in. The pool also closed kind of early for a wedding but no biggie. 

I didn't get to try the buffet this time, but will next time!

Great experience at caesars. I use total rewards and when I went to the desk to get something, they told me it would be $50 and issued me a comp slip for $50. When I actually got to the place where you redeem, it turned out to be $60. Rather than making me go back and get a new certificate or paying $10 in cash, they acknowledged the desk made an error and just let me pay with the $50 comp slip. Very happy here and would recommend the hotel and casino to anyone.

***YELP 100 CHALLENGE 4\/100***

Over the weekend we had family come in from out of town and stayed at Caesar's. Octavius Tower, room is very clean and spiffy without being pretentious. With modern amenities as well as a Keurig coffee machine which is very convenient after a drunken stupor lol. The bathroom was immaculate which usually for me is a tell tale sign of a well kept establishment. We had killer views of the strip and the water show at the Bellagio given that we were on the 61st floor. I guess my only complaint is the place being like a big maze which kind of needed some getting used to. All in all very impressed with the stay, from the food to the décor to the over all feel of the place.

Back in the days, it was the best casino until Bellagio outstaged it.  There's a nice mall in here as well.  One where you can do more than just window shop, though there are designer shops in here as expected.

They have everything you need, no reason to leave, but it's close enough to the fun you can take a little walk! They are always adding to it but keeps it's classic image. The restaurants are great: Gordon Ramsay's Pub for dinner before going out, Mesa Grill for Brunch the next day, and Searsuckers for happy hour! 

I would stay here again! :)

Caesars Palace, delivers a nice , warm, cozy atmosphere for the weekend getaway. Customer service is excellent (front desk, bell hops, casino runners, bartenders, etc.) Very clean and classy place to stay, tons of entertainment, food and drinks available.

This potentially could've been a 2 star review if it wasn't for Delano at the front desk. I showed up on Monday night and booked a room on the phone with Mary after their website wouldn't process my online transaction. I was traveling from NY to CA and just happened to book a night in Vegas because it worked it's way into the schedule at the last minute. So I show up and valet my car, then go inside to the self check in. I get room 6883 in the Octavius tower. I walk in the room and I felt like I was in the Hangover movie. The room was outrageous! Huge, and all kinds of cool gadgets- 2 bathrooms, high tech surround sound, elaborate bathroom and a penthouse view. I re-checked my confirmation to see how much I paid and saw it was $180 something. I couldn't believe it.. I asked for a simple room and got this suite. My wife said "they give you a nice deal in Vegas". Meanwhile my mind is thinking I'm going to get a surprise $3,000 charge. That never happened. Apparently there was an "upgrade" or "glitch" nobody knew what it was. My wife and I planned on getting tattoos in Vegas the next day and decided we would stay again tomorrow night. I asked one of the girls if I could at the front desk. She said she couldn't keep me in that same room another night. I told her that I understood that but if I could at least get the same floor or tower since I never asked for this penthouse to begin with and I really didn't want to be inconvenienced with the 7 bags that I had with me. She said the most basic room in that tower for tomorrow would be $225 a night after additional taxes and fees. I really just wanted another night at the same price though.. the one I originally paid for. So I told her I'd think about it and went out on the strip for some food and drinks. I come back later that night around 11:30PM or so and talk to another girl so I could figure out my plans for tomorrow and what room I'd be in. She said she sees the quote the other girl gave me and that's the best she could do. I wasn't happy to hear that but I then asked "well I won't have to wait until 4 to check in right? I'd like to get in a room at 11 when I check out of the other one". No she said. She then picked up the phone and dialed the supervisor to come out in a murmured voice. The lady supervisor was direct and a little nasty that "we'll have to see what we have at check in. Can't make you promises". I was pretty pissed at that point. Never asked for an upgrade, wasn't asking to stay in a penthouse, just wanted a close basic room somewhere close (because moving was already an inconvenience) and I just wanted a basic room at the price they gave me for the first one. I left the counter and figured I'll just find a cheaper hotel on the strip, screw them. Morning came, and I have to say it sucked to leave that beautiful room. I go downstairs in the morning and am checked out by Delano. His charm was there from the start. I felt like he had no attitude and maybe could understand my situation and handle it more professionally than I've been dealt with in the past. So, screw it i asked him too. I really didn't feel like having to leave the hotel, would've been more inconvenient to go. So he listened to me and sprung to action right away. He apologized about the way I was dealt with previously and dialed his manager. He told me "let me see what I can do" he briefly explained to his supervisor my ordeal and they were able to give me the same beautiful room that I had for the same price! I thanked him multiple times. The resort needs more employees like Delano. He understands what it is to give exceptional customer service. I even ordered room service and threw a couple rags in the casino. They wouldn't have seen that extra money if it wasn't for Delano keeping me there. Had a great experience and would definitely return regardless of the room I receive!

I was very happy and surprised.

I read the reviews of the long waits to check in. I tried to this texting sign in and the technology really did not work. So I started frustrated but when I got in there was no wait. I had a friendly person who upgraded me to the 27th floor on the Palace tower one floor away from the suites.

Second the casino and area is beautiful. I really enjoy the area, the shops and the cleanliness of the place. It feels like it remodelled.. 
The service was great. The toilet broke. I think they addressed it right away. I lost my key and they replaced it very quickly. 
The staff were just genuinly friendly.

The price was a little high but Las vegas is just pricey. That is the way it is.

I did not eat there but I think there are a lot of options. I did have a drink at Shadows. It was really nice.

I played poker in the poker room. The service was much better than the Flamingo. The only problem they want everyone to play No limit.

Caesars has my heart. Starting from the check in kiosks in the lobby to the check out by text. Stayed in the Octavius tower with a view of the pools. Room was impeccable, comfy bed, and a soaking tub with multiple jets in the bathroom. There is so much to experience at this hotel that I could see how easy it would be to not go anywhere else for a few days. LOVE the pools here, and there are 4\/5 of them. Fountains, cabanas, day beds, snack bar, drink service, comfy loungers. The casino was always lively with many bars and areas to hang out at. We got lost multiple times in the casino. High quality buffet, and if people are hungry at midnight, there is a full service restaurant off the lobby. Saw Elton John at the Colloseum, what a great venue! Customer service at check in, the total rewards desk, Colosseum box office, Cafe Americano, Bacchanal, and Qua Spa was OUTSTANDING. I didn't even have a chance to shop in the Forum shops..which means I need to come back. Soon!

I stay here usually. Mostly because I love the salon. Go to color salon and have any service done, and you will be beyond happy. The spa is also very nice. They have re done it so there are a lot more steam rooms and cool rooms. I like the location of this hotel. I Prefer to stay in the Augustus tower and come in on flamingo road entrance. No crowd or wait. Fast check in. Obviously you can't beat the forum shops. Room service is not good, but luckily there is a Starbucks beside the elevator

If you know me and you know me well then you know I love the movie, The Hangover.

Of course, I have to throw out a few references...

Julius Caesar really didn't live there.
The place is pager friendly but I'm taking cool points away from you to be on the web reading this review with a pager on your hip.
You won't find pay phones here.

I suppose this review is about the gambling experience I had here --- AWESOME. What a really cool place to hangout for the night. From what I understand this place is old but the atmosphere here is amazing. I would have thought that this place was recently built because everything here appears brand new. Everything here is taken care of daily and taken care of well. All things appear brand new to me.

People smoke here but the place doesn't smell like cigarettes. You'll find lots of action going on here even late at night or early in the morning (however you look at it). The dealers at the tables (I'm a craps shooter) are extremely friendly and they made my experience very memorable. You'll find a few different nightclubs here, Pure, being one that I previously reviewed.

One quick funny story. I was here in November 2010 with two friends who wanted to turn $200 into a $1,000 over a few hands of black jack. The dealer, a very old Asian man with a thick accent, spent almost six or seven minutes cutting the cards in front us and didn't say a single word to anyone (I was just watching my friends gamble). I was wondering why the hell it was taking him so long and within five hands and not even five minutes of dealing my buddies were each out $200. I suppose this dealer was trying to provide some sort of experience because dammit Vegas will get you.

I plan on making several more trips in my lifetime to Sin City and will soon not only patronize Caesar's Palace for gambling purposes but for the hotel stay, clubbing and for dining. You must visit this place if you are Las Vegas.

Had the best time at Caesar's.  Every interaction with staff was friendly and helpful.  Shout out to Fabian at the front desk for helping us get a room last minute after a bad experience at another hotel.  

Our room was beautiful, the casino was clean and the pool was awesome! Will definitely stay here again!
