This hotel is a the place to stay. I have nothing bad to say at all. a good hotel room could get a little pricey but it was totally worth it. I stay here for 3 nights. I got the best service from the front desk. That was like the fastest check in I ever got. The hotel was so big and I had so many places to go in Las Vegas, I kind of feel like I have to go to fully appreciate this great hotel.

I'll say this...I gambled prior to coming to Vegas. Here on a bachelor party I was going to room with my brother. The other guys decided that they didn't want to share a king size bed and requested for two queens beds instead. My brother and I opted to gamble a little bit and pay for just a king size bed. If the hotel had a room with two queens I figured I come out ahead since I didn't have to pay extras like the other guys did. 

Well...we checked in and I got my king size bed. Figured, ok I'll share with my brother...nothing wrong with that. The other guys...we'll they ended up getting a room with one king size bed. They told the check in girl that they reserved through Expedia and paid extra for the beds. She was nice enough to provide all parties an extra twin bed without any charge. So I guess in a way I got a bed. Didn't have to share with my brother, which again I wouldn't have minded, but it was free, so F it. 

We ended up staying at the Roman Towers, which is the original hotel before they expanded. They are a little worn out, but it's a room, it's clean and had a nice view of the roof tops. But there were no coffee maker in the room. I guess that's the new tread. Funnel you down stairs for coffee that will cost you $8.00 and not the $1.50. 

One problem I have with the room was the toilet. After dropping the kids off at the pool, if you know what I mean, you flush the toilet and it seems like the water rises to the top of the toilet. You think "man I need to call the front desk to unclog the toilet and they'll ask me to stop eating at White Castle for the rest of my trip...how embarrassing". Nevertheless the toilet eventually eats up whatever is in there and you stop worrying, for now. 

The pools they have there are nice. Lots of good looking people...some girls in their bikini's and some not so hot in bikini's. Don't worry gentlemen...the cold water will kill off any erections you might have when you stare like a creep at some hot chicks...not that I did that...I'm married. If the cold water doesn't kill it off than the guy walking around in his European Speedos and pierced nipples might kill it. 

Shirts are required when you leave the pool area. If you walk around shirtless or just in your bikini security will come by to escort you to the elevators and tell you that shirts are required on the premises. CP has high standards. 

Overall I thought it was a good experience. It was clean and everything you expect from CP. The employees were helpful when you got lost and the people at the sports book area explain all the questions you have. Most of the games there are pricey, I suggest if your not into the slots but don't want to pay a lot for table games just yet, go to Harrah's or the Flamingo (which are all related to CP anyways). They got cheaper table games there. All you have to do is cross the street...in 100 degree weather...

Our stay at the Caesars Palace exceeded expectations! Everyone had superior customer service everywhere we went in Caesars, from the casino, to restaurants\/shops, and all other places like the pool area. 

The resort itself is absolutely gorgeous. we stayed at the Augustus Tower Deluxe King room, and the room itself was very spacey and gorgeous. We got to see the beautiful pool from our view to the left, and part of the strip to the right. The bathroom was huge as well with a nice jacuzzi bathtub next to the shower area. It's definitely a plus that there's a his and hers sink set in the bathroom as well.

There are all types of restaurants in the hotel from Gordon Ramsay's Pub, food court for quick bites, the famous buffet, etc. there's so much to do in the hotel and out of the hotel to keep you busy. If you love shopping stroll around in the shopping area enjoying the "view" and their outdoor feel ceilings as well. There's a Walgreens on the strip nearby as well which helped for us to get generic items we needed for the trip.

Overall, this experience was the best so far that we've had in Las Vegas out of our many trips out there. Definitely going to come back!

As many times I've been to Vegas, staying at CP for 11-11-11 weekend was a first for me.  I was pretty stoked about getting a great deal on-line for this hotel months before the date of the big fight the same weekend was announced.

CP served its purpose for our visit to Sin City, it provided a clean room, comfy bed and the convenience of it being centrally located on the Strip near all the other spots we checked out over the weekend.

However, if you can have it your way, I'd strongly suggest you request for a room at any other tower than the ROMAN tower.  After waiting in line for fifteen minutes for my check-in (I was next in line by the way), we made our way to our tenth floor room and was quickly bummed out at how aged it was.  From all the pics I viewed on-line, I thought our room was going to have all the modern amenities, but it had none of it.

I would probably stay at Caesars again, but will make sure I can request for one of their newer rooms.

Sweet Casino and Hotel, good view of the Bellagio fountains.  However, I think you can get a better deal on a room elsewhere and probably have just as nice of a stay.  I think this place is a bit overpriced but they do have one of the best buffets known to man.

Caesar Palace has been in Vegas for a long time and has gone through many changes too it's been over 10 years since I've been there. So to me this was like a new Hotel\/Casino to see. It huge and this one also has a lot of eating and drinking places along with its own mall of shops which is in the forum area. We came here to check out the Omnia Club since Nadine was on the guest list you can read my review on that. The cool thing about this place is all the Greek mythology theme all around from writings to statues. Overall another nice place to see and visit.

Ecce Romani! 
This is my favorite casino. With a name like "Spartacurtus," you can't blame me. I totally dork out on the scenes carved in the wall by the casino floor. They are straight from a Roman sarcophagus! The statuary around the hotel and casino blow my mind, with their somewhat historical accuracy, and just really cool looking art! 
I feel like such an imperial conqueror when I come here. After a white wine spritzer or two, it turns into a true Roman bacchanal. 
The scenery here is amazing, and so much fun. A lot of the other casinos don't really have a theme, but these guys do. In full style. 
Everything here meets the Roman eye for beauty. Some of the statues aren't really historically accurate. Michelangelo's David is waay late for Caesar's. But most of the other temple scenes are spot on. 
The staff here is always very helpful, and the casino is always in good order and cleaned up. I always feel safe here, and really enjoy coming here. It's seriously one of the most beautiful casinos on the Strip.

Stayed in the Augustus tower. We had the top floor. It was clean, quiet, and nice looking. View of the strip from our room. Self check in at the kiosk and self check out on the tv was a breeze. Could use a mini fridge for own food instead of a mini bar but otherwise nice room and double sink bathroom.

My boyfriend took me here for my birthday and I fell in love with this place. They not only gave us this massive suite, but it was a corner room facing the Bellagio fountains, the strip and the Eiffel tower. Pretty amazing room, making it a birthday to remember. They also have black jack IN the pool, we played there for hours and had some great luck. Awesome place, I will definitely be back.

I've been coming to the Vegas strip for a very long time, and I've stayed at many different hotels.  My previous experiences with Caesar's were fine, and I guess this one was too, but I have to say, the Strip has better to offer.

If I'm trying to be brief, I'll just say that I'm sure that it's hard to run an enormous resort hotel on a holiday weekend (Thanksgiving).  However, Caesar's has to pull it together because there's just too much competition!

We stayed in the Palace tower, which has some nicely-sized junior suites with an added amenity that I like, but the rooms aren't renovated.  That's okay, no problem, except that the bed wasn't that comfortable.  Usually I sleep like a baby in hotel beds, so I definitely noticed the difference.

Also, we really struggled to get little problems fixed- a functional bathtub, for instance.  When we asked for robes and slippers, we were essentially told that we hadn't spent enough money for those, as they were reserved for (full) suites.  Whaaaaaa???  I can completely understand not stocking every room with robes, but if a guest asks for one, bring the robe!  Are they kidding?

So, from now on you'll find me back at my favorites- Palazzo\/Venetian and the Wynn.

Took another trip to Vegas and time was able to check off Caesars Palace off my wish list. My other visits to Vegas I had stayed at some of the less fancy hotels on the strip so this place is in a whole other league. Don't get me strong I still like the less fancy hotels and have no problem with them at all but I am saying the atmosphere is way different. Everything at Caesars is much more expensive so if you eat at the restaurants there the entire time prepare to spend a pretty penny on food. That pretty much goes for buying anything there. The mini bar in my room wanted $12.00 for plain M&Ms, lol. Just a fair warning. Ok now time for the details. 

Check in was a breeze. My cab driver dropped me off at the VIP entrance because it was quicker and easier to get to and he was very cool like that. I was not sure where to go from there to check in so I went to the VIP desk there and they went ahead and checked me in instead of sending me to the main desk in the front. It was a very quick and painless check in which I can always appreciate. The lady at the front desk was very polite and she called a bellhop right away to take my bags up to my room. My room was in the Forum Tower room 6504. It was quite a ways from the desk where I checked in. Instead of sending me of into the unknown to get lost the bellhop David very kindly walked me and my bag to my room. He was very sweet the entire time and he have me a tour of the place as we walked to my room. That ended up being very helpful because I didn't get lost once after that. Once we got into my room he set up my luggage for me and then as he was explaining where the ice machine was he offered to go get me some ice if I wanted some. I thought that was great. He showed me the room and some of the frills associated with it. He went above and beyond in my opinion and made me feel very welcome. 

Ah the room, here's the fun part. That room was bad ass. I have no other way of putting it. The bed was so comfortable!!! The room also had those comfy robes so you can guess what I wore when I hung around the room, lol. There was a TV in the bathroom mirror. That was the craziest thing I ever seen. Everything is digital now so it is very modern. The drapes and the "do not disturb sign" all worked by pushing a button rather than manually. The room had three phones in it. One next to the toilet even which I thought was funny. The shower was heavenly. It had an ordinary shower head alone with a larger one in the middle of the shower. The size of the shower was also great, very spacious and plenty of room to shower comfortably. The bathroom is also very large and has an excellent vanity area and the keep plenty of towels available. The size of the entire room in general was great. Very spacious. I also had a great view of the strip which is always nice. I was impressed with the room overall that's for sure. 

OK, I was feeling pretty tired the night I arrived and I did not feel like hunting for a place to eat so I decided to splurge a little and order room service. Fair warning and this doesn't count against them but the room service menu is very expensive and overall it is not worth it. The prices are clearly marked and I still decided to pay the extra amount for the convenience so that's my own fault. Just a fair warning that it isn't worth it really. Their customer service is stellar though. When I called the man who answered the phone was very helpful and he answered my questions about the menu and helped me come to a decision. They told me the delivery time would be about 40 minutes but they arrived much quicker than that. The person who brought me was food was very nice and polite and she set me up nicely. 

The casino was great. I actually had a lot of fun here. The table minimums here are higher than some of the other neighboring casinos but after a while I didn't even really notice. The dealers that I encountered were very fun to play with and I killed at the blackjack tables so that made me happy. 

Check out was a breeze and I hope more hotels are using this method. The sent me an email the morning of my departure asking me to schedule my checkout time so essentially I checked out via email so no lines. You can also checkout through your TV in your room as well. Very painless which is great if you have a flight to catch or something else planned. I just turned in my keys at the front desk and that was it. 

The last service I used was the bell desk for my bags. My flight did not leave until later in the afternoon so I had some time before I had to be at the airport so instead of lugging my suitcase everywhere I checked it in at the bell desk. They were excellent too. They quickly took my info and my bag and let me be on my way. When I came to pick up the bag same thing, I handed them the tag they gave me and they quickly retraived my bag and got me in a cab to the sirport.

Rooms are nice especially if you can score the Augustus tower since this tower has the best access and close to pool and main entrance. Yes octavious tower is newer a little batter but further away from everything. 

The main problem I don't like staying here is the fact that if you drive, the self parking lot is like a mile away and sometimes the elevators that take you to the casino from the parking lot takes forever. Also you can get lost circling around the casino it's almost like a maze in the place. I stayed here because of the comped room but otherwise would not pay to stay here due to the reasons above. I personally prefer a casino that's less fancy with better parking access like Ballys, Paris parking lot. Ballys may not be the fanciest and the newest but the remodeled jubilee tower is nice in my opinion and it's got a fridge that u can use not full of stuff the casino hopes you grab and then charge you and arm and a leg. 
Good accessibility is the key to me.

This review started for Bucchanal Buffet but yelp wanted me to cut it short. This review is for the pre-experience getting to Bucchanal. 

We all know the "strip" is busy at night but when you enter mass chaos making that right turn into Caesars Palace entrance, that's a warning sign to the highest! With such a huge property the most lanes available are 2?!!! In some areas I turns to one lane, wtf! You should have seen the line of taxi cabs which hog up one of the two lane roads. Very similar to ca I505! 

If your lucky enough or smart to get to the front you will be turned away by the valet unless you are checking in. However the valet guys don't tell you this immediately. So what they do is look around, mingle with each other and occasionally walk to the cars waiting to valet and give them the bad news. Second warning, crappy service! I ended up having to make a u turn in the very small rotunda and forcing my way out of the hectic intersection (where cars and taxis are trying to enter and exit onto the strip). 

If you survived you find you way to Caesars self parking garage. This is probably the best part because this is a massive garage (at least the length if a football field if not more)! There are open slots somewhere. I got lucky and found a spot on the 3rd level but the reason why was I was at the furthest end of the garage which is furthest away from their  elevators into the casino lol! 

So now I'm in the casino and first thing you'll notice is the stench of cigarette smoke. Now I know smoking is legal in NV but the good hotels (NYNY, Cosmo, Aria, Palazzo, Venetian, Wynn, etc) try to mask it with a fresh scent or have top of the line air vents to suck up the smoke smell. Strike 3!!!

Caesars did a great job in placing a gaming machine in every nook and cranny of this building so it's takes a good bit of maneuvering to work your way through the casino while avoiding to run into the thousands of people. Many high end restaurants on the main level. Very nice food court with lots of seating a food selections. After a few minutes of walking I noticed I was in the registration area of the hotel which is towards their night club Omnia. Lost? Kinda. No signs to Bucchanal! Looked and skimmed around but no signs until I saw a very small plain looking sign that said "buffet". WTF! This is the supposedly top rank buffet  but can't have a prestigious sign of showing  pride & direction?

Wow! What a beautiful property. The entire resort from the entrance, casino floor and rooms to the shopping and entertainment is amazing! The service is fantastic. We were upgraded to an incredible suite and will be back for sure!

Stayed in the Palace tower for 5 days. It smelled like vomit every day on the casino level floor (near elevators and shops in the tower hallway)! Surprised management didn't notice and do something about it. Yuck!!

This was our first time staying at Caesars.  We stayed 3 nights in the Augustus Tower.  When we first walked into the room we saw the towel ring on the bathroom counter, not installed on the front of the counter.  The other towel ring was about to fall off.  Obviously it broke off and someone just put it on the counter top.  Toilet flush handle didn't work.  I would think that the last people to see the room was housekeeping.  Does anyone inspect the rooms before they are given to guests???  We called 3 times to have these things fixed.  Each time someone said that they would be right up.  Items fixed the next day.  Room needed upgrading, drab blues from the late 1990's,  but comfortable.  Seems like the details of a landmark hotel are being ignored.  My friend and I saw a small piece of paper stay in the middle of the hallway carpet the entire time we were there.  We joked that, really, no one from house keeping saw it and picked it up....The blue rubber glove on the hallway floor outside our door lasted almost a day before someone picked it up.  Funny how the hallway always had housekeeping carts around.

Tip for drinks:  Bloody Mary's are $17 at the pool bar.  Get a free one in a plastic cup inside the casino and bring it outside.  The free one inside was better than the $17 cocktail outside by the pool.

Every time we talked to a cocktail waitress or had a question about the slot machine the employee was extremely courteous, friendly, professional, and helpful.  That is the expected customer service with a smile.......literally.

My friend unfortunately had a horrible experience with an employee of Starbucks on the first floor of the Augustus Tower.  Incredibly rude and condescending to him.  We have contacted Starbucks about the experience. I don't blame Caesars but they should monitor contracted stores on their property.

The heated pool area was great, especially in January.  Although it is obvious that things are getting run down.  A good scrubbing and touch up is needed.  Shame.

All in all our trip was fun but next time another hotel for our trip.

Had to pay about $32.00 extra just to check in early.  Elevator floors had duck tape taped to the floors, because they were so worn,  Pretty much in every elevator we got into at Caesars.  Upon check out.  There was a long line,  no one at the counter to check you out.  They said one person was helping another.   Just one for the long line.  They said it was because it was before 9:00 a.m.  Finally I went to self check out, only to find out that they had charged extra for 6 extra drinks from the refrigerator in the room, that I never even drank.  Beware do not remove drinks from refrigerator to put a cup of milk in.  The maid took my milk out put it on the dresser put drink back in.  My $9.00 cup of milk that came with 4 cookies,  sat out for hours while we were gone.  Had to throw it away. Come to find out if you move a drink and put it back you are still charged for it. $7.00 for one bottle of water.  No place to put your drinks to keep them cold or from spoiling.  This place will nickel and dime you.The wooden door to get to the refrig, was falling off of it's hinges.  The dresser was scratched up.  Our couch had a bout a 2 to 3 inch cut\/whole in it.  I took pictures of that.  How in the world do they not see the cut in the couch? Few amenities.  No bath robes.  The room was more on the smaller size.  We stayed in The Forum Tower.  The hotel is so big, it's hard to find your way from one place to the other.  I never want to stay here again. Buffet was great.  Many other hotels to choose from.  Check out The Venetian Hotel.  A very nice place to stay at.  Great customer service.

Here waiting to check into our room! This is very very upsetting considering how big of a bottle this is!!!!!! Ridiculous!!! They have all these people waiting including myself for over 1 hour an a half!!!! Will be the last time cooing here!!! That's for dam sure!!

I've walked through Caesars three different times the past 13 or so years. Since my first visit most of it looked exactly as I remembered​ it. You have the forum shops, random kiosks and different eateries. In my opinion the casino isn't as good as other casinos on the strip.

However, the views in this place -- like the wondrous ceiling or the statues of Greek gods -- are surely worth a walkthrough.

Well after speaking to an assistant manager named Melissa, I now know they don't care about guests .


I have a DND sign on the door. Yesterday they came in in, threw pizza away that I wanted and removed used soap I wanted to keep and cleaned the room. Guest services noted that no one was supposed to come in for the duration of my stay,
Today at  around 10:50 a housekeeping staff knocked loudly and opened door.

This startled me. 

I took a sedative earlier and was sleeping ..

For this to happen 2 says on a row, no one colllwing orders and a sign on the door , all Melissa said was "sorry, I'll note this and we won't allow anyone to come in again" 

This is useless because I leave tomorrow anyway...

Waste of time spending time on the phone with management .

I've had great difficulty with their Wi finand had to upgrade!

Terrible!

This place is huge.  Like Donald Trump would say   UUUUGGGE.

Good point:   Very large...lots of gaming options
Bad point:  Takes 15 minutes to walk across the place to your car.

Good point:  Lots of food choices
Bad point:  They have restaurants HIGH end prices or LOW end prices....nothing in the middle.

Good point:  Best buffet in Vegas... at least top 3
Bad point:  The new "kiosk" reservation system.   It stinks. Confusing and weird.

Bad point:  BLAH  check in person we had.  Just not friendly.  Grouchy.

We've stayed at 30 casinos in Vegas.... there are 15 that I rate higher than Ceasars.
I don't usually review hotels\/casinos... but this one bothered me for a few reasons.....
I loved this place! The mall is crazy cool! Old cars roped off on the first floor. Statues come to life ever 30 minutes or so. That is a must see! Freaked me out at first......lol! Loved it big time.

Slots are always super tight and not worth the incredibly long walk.  Shops are a bit overpriced but fun to look at.  Many of the sits are out of order that would take you back to strip.  There used to be a walking escalator to the casino but it has been broken for years without signs of being replaced or repaired.

Lifestyles of the (not) Rich & Shameless.

You know life is good when you're wading in the Temple pool, water falling down from the fountain above, massaging your head & shoulders, cooling off from the dry Las Vegas heat.  

My stay was at the new Octavius Tower, which recently opened at the beginning of the year.  The Augustus & Octavius Towers have a separate entrance & lobby, which successfully segregates VIP' s like me (LOL) from the plebs staying at the more economical Palace Tower.  Early check-in was a breeze, and I was soon on my way to room 6278.  

Room - OMFG!  This is nice!  2 queen beds with 4 pillows & a bolster greeted us as we walked in.  A large, flat-screen TV w\/ media hub, a Keurig coffeemaker, well appointed minibar & couch were available to peruse at our leisure.  The carpeting was nice & soft, and the room window had a pretty decent view of the Bellagio fountains next door.  

The bathroom was spectacular!  There were dual sinks w\/ another flatscreen TV, a whirlpool bath and a separate shower w\/ a rainfall showerhead & glass door.  I drew a couple hot baths during my stay and enjoyed soaking my old man body, with the jets seemingly making all my worries go away.  The complimentary bath products were Gilchrist & Soames Qua Bath & Spa.  It could be the just the fancy packaging, but they seemed luxuriant.  

Pool - The Temple Pool is gorgeous.  Forget going in the afternoon, because it's literally shoulder-to-shoulder.  All someone can do is stand & pee.  I made sure to head to the pool the next day when it opened at 8am.  About 30 patrons had the same idea, but fortunately, they were concerned with confiscating pool chairs for sunbathing.  I had the circular Temple Pool all to myself for around 20 mins, in which I swam and waded underneath 1 of the 4 fountains as described earlier. Great way to cool off.  

Complimentary coffee & tea is offered at the Augustus\/Octavius lobby during the hours of 7-9 in the morning.  Bonne Maman honey from France is offered in individual mini-jars, of which I have about 10 here at home awaiting for my disposal.  Hey, it's free!  Don't judge!  Across the lobby is a Starbucks in case you don't fancy the free stuff.  BTW, Starbucks located in hotels\/casinos don't offer free WiFi.  Bummer.

Express checkout was a breeze.  I reviewed my bill on the flat-screen TV, confirmed checkout and left the room keys in the room.  

I had the time of my life.  I felt like a foreign diplomat on my way to meet Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton over cucumber sandwiches to discuss diplomacy.  If you have the money to burn, I recommend staying at Caesar's Palace and re-enact your own "Hangover".

Good times.

Excelsior!

My boyfriend stayed here a couple nights ago for our anniversary. The entire experience was wonderful! Free valet (make sure to tip), very friendly concierge staff. Upon arrival, we waited in line to check in. When we got to the counter, it had appeared that the room we reserved wasn't available. The woman helping us gave us a complimentary $80 upgrade with a jacuzzi  tub! The room was beautiful and clean, the casino was nice and the entire hotel Exceeded our expectations. This was my first time "doing Vegas" and I was pleased. 


I would definitely come back!

Awesome. 

Caesars Palace opened in 1966, but you'd never have guessed.

Full size statue of David in all his glory

AWESOME pool(s). 5 total. One topless. 
Damn those mattress beds pool size are comfy.

Blackjack tables IN the pool

Friendly woman who comes around refilling water while you are eating in the food court. That's service.

Avoid the check out line, converse with the gal at the end of the line and receive your receipt via email. score.

Mike Tyson was not in our room, nor a Chicken

PS - the black hat conference goers are no joke. They hacked into my computer, back in San Diego, via my laptop in Vegas. Impressive, guys.
Outdated rooms. An old crowd and no Jacuzzi

Horrible Service! The room we paid to upgrade and waited from 2:30 to 6:30 to get in ( They told us they were cleaning the room) was disgusting with vomit marks near the bed! The altitude of services were horrible and they made us wait for 40 minutes to change the room! This is the the worst hotel I have ever had in Vegas!

Extremely slow check in. They want money for an early check in - no exceptions. The coffee pot in the room did not work. It took an hour to get one that did percolate the Keurig $13.00 coffee. There was not a hair dryer. They said they would send one right up. Borrowed one from a colleague. They had still not brought one to the room 12 hours later. It took a second call. Breakfast had pounding of construction. The waitress had a horrible headache from the noise. You would think they would comp a
cup of coffee or something. Not impressed at all. Would not recommend this hotel. I have not stayed in a hotel with such low customer appreciation in decades.
even it has been one of the oldest hotels in the strip..still has its great interior design and depicts the Romans architecture..awesome!!

I didn't get to stay at Caesars Palace, but we spent a lot of time here during our Vegas trip and boy its pretty. I love the shopping and the changing sky colors. I also loved the fountain show, the people looked so realistic!
My friend also got a mimosa for five dollars and said it was really good, they didn't go cheap and overdo it on the orange juice, but they actually used the right proportions. 

If I could choose to stay at any hotel, it would definitely be either Caesars Palace or the Bellagio. But I also gotta love Caesars Palace to quote from The Hangover "I have a question for you, and I'm sure you get this a lot but, is this really Caesars Palace? Like, did Caesar actually live here?"

Well it sure looks nice enough for Caesar to live in!

I am only reviewing the venue as I didn't actually stay in the hotel.

I arrived here for the EVO Championship Competition (It's a video-game fighting tournament.) to check out the new games coming out and also to support some of the vendors.

Casinos and hotels in Vegas are always very luxuriously and decadent and here is no acception. There are amazing paintings on the walls and roofs and giant statues of Greek... people throughout the building. Its bright and left me awestruck (First time visitor) and I was snapping my camera left and right trying to take it all in.

I don't know how many people on Yelp go to comic book conventions or video-game expos but for those who don't know: There is always a SERIOUS funk in the air. I'm not kidding. A large room with a ton of guys who put their lives in video games and comic books, and not so much into personal hygiene, it's gonna have a musk that could very well bring a tear to your eye. (I'm really being honest and not mean. I promise.) Thankfully, Cesar's Palace has a top notch air conditioning and ventilation system that left everything breezy and light. (Thank you sweet merciful Cesar...)

I don't know if it is just me but the staff here seems a bit intimidating! Maybe because there are more bouncers then anything else. There were a few staff members I interacted with that were very nice and helpful. For the most part though I tried to avoid them.

Note: Next time I go I want to try this Fat Tuesday place. Everyone was walking around with these amazing looking slushy drinks and I wants one.

The bar by the nude ladies statue had awful customer service. I was dressed very nicely and was treated incredibly rude by the staff there. The bartender asked me what he could get for me and I asked for a bud light. He proceeded to actually scoff at me then didn't even acknowledge me after that!! He easily could have said oh we don't carry that (which I saw a man drinking a bud light at said bar) or would you like me to recommend another choice? But he did not.  Instead he turned away and apparently didn't want my money or business. Unfortunately I will never recommend this hotel to anyone I know because of this little experience.

Love love love the pool area, and the renovated rooms. By far nicer then the mirage, MGM, Ballys and the belagio. I loved staying here. 
I knocked off a star because the check in process took FOREVER. They need one long line, that feeds into the 5 lanes instead of 5 lines  for the individual desk attendants.i don't know why they don't have the long ropes up, multiple people in line said that would have helped tremendously.

i did splurge & get a room here.  beautiful property all around.  big, lots of walking involved, but i quickly learned shortcuts to my destinations.  big beautiful rooms w\/pimpin' bathrooms & showers .  super-comfy beds.  i didn't dine here or play table games here this trip .  unlike Aria, this classy joint has soul.  they have a Nobu too

If I could give -0 I would but I can't here goes every one beware 
Stayed here Friday May 5 2017  thru Monday May 8th 2017 on Sunday night on one of our trips in and out of the casino I noticed some rats I will never ever stay on this dirty property ever ever again

DO NOT STAY HERE. The cleaning ladies robbed us. They took all of our cash, and jewelry this weekend. All the hotel manager did is give us a $100 credit that was used up with lunch and one drink. I have stayed at many hotels in Vegas, and I was giving Ceasars a chance since I had never been. I should have just gone with the Wynn or Cosmo where I normally stay. Extremely disappointed.

Del hotel no puedo opinar nada, pero abajo tienen uno de los mejores buffet de la ciudad el cual me recomendó el guía y no defraudó, tenía comidas de todo el mundo ( marisco, México, italiana, asiática, BBQ etc...) era increíble lo recomiendo eso si, avisar que el precio fue de unos 65$ por persona ( bastante caro en mi opinión)  teniendo en cuenta que tiene tiempo limitado y no incluye  bebidas alcohólicas.
Amazing hotel. Incredible amount of stuff to do and shows to see. Snazzy room with comfortable bathroom and clean. I'd definitely stay here again.

This review is strictly of the suite that we rented.  So after watching the Hangover, we just had to do it Caesar's Palace suite style for my good friend's bachelor party.

We rented out a huge place that held our whole group and it came out to be about 800 bucks a night.  Not a bad price considering the amount of people.  We walked in and WOW, it was a dump.  The carpet looked like it hadn't been cleaned in years.  There was stains everywhere.  Some people had lots of fun in this place.  There was dried vomit on the curtains.

We figured we weren't going to be in the rooms that long but still.  After the first night the people didn't even clean our rooms.  And then at some point on our second day there they issued the wrong keys to another group that almost came into our place.  So they reset the keys without telling our group so we were all locked out.

This place might have been the place to be 10 years ago but no more.

Sadly we booked rooms in January for the big 4th of July fireworks  and Ceasers thought it was ok to change America Independence Day to Sunday July 2 nd letting down countless children and people that waited hours on the strip for the annual fireworks show that never came then people pushing fighting in danger Emergecy vehicles called out a normal happy holiday ruined for thousands on thousands of people the internet wasn't clear even called the ceasers palace hotel in the morning confirming the fireworks and a lady said it started at 9:15 pm tons people walked miles to watch nothing happen kids were bummed out  thanks for wasting a beautiful holiday Ceasers! Just cause it falls on a Tuesday doesn't give you the right to change the holiday u made so many Las Vegas natives and tourists very unhappy ! Your CEO Managment needs to get on the ball with making sure the internet and their employees know what's going on !

Not that great. We stayed 3 nights. While the hotel is pretty, here are our pro's & con's...
-Hardly pet friendly, only a 10x10 Astro turf pen outside by the valet 
-Beds are too soft
-Air conditioner is noisy and clicks
-Wi-Fi useless as it's unprotected
-Parking is literally a 1\/2 mile walk
-Pool is only open until 5:00pm
-$39 resort fee
-$10 Self Park but free with NV ID 
-Middle of the strip is convenient 
-Lots of shops, eateries and bars

Sightseeing location #1: Caesars Palace

+: the forum shop is enormous; delicate sculptures everywhere; large casino; a walkway across from las vegas blvd. to the hotel itself, which provided me a great opportunity to snap a few nice shots on my dslr
-: compared to the other hotels, Caesar's Palace is more of a place to shop, rather than sight-see.

I can't believe that here just a "prestigious" hotel denies water! My friend was thirsty after coming out Omnia and the bar tender was selling her water when she only wanted a small glass. Who sells water?! I don't mind paying for water I have to the all hotels in Vegas but I gotta say if u want the best go to the the Cosmopolitan or any other hotel on the strip. There's a reason this place went bankruptcy bad service from the management to the whole staff. I'm a high roller I don't kind spending but this place is disappointing

Sure there's lots of stuff to do inside this enormous casino\/mall, but dear God, does that equate to a lot of inconvenient walking when all I wanted to do at the time was check in.  The self-park garage was clear on the other side of the property from the lobby and check-in took a long time.  But let's be positive for a second, the gentleman helping us check in was very helpful and was able to get my fiancé and I in a room down the hall from our friends (until they got another upgrade, more on that later).  I've also heard rumors that Caesar's is the easiest hotel to get lost in, and I'm a believer.

We stayed in a Roman tower room that was comfortable, but still visually reminded me of a Motel 6.  Our friends upgraded to a room in the Palace tower, complete with enormous tub and bidet.  I'll admit that room was much closer to the 4.5-star standard than ours was.  Wasn't that bad though since we were out most of the night anyway, but didn't feel like a good value.

If you're more interested in exploring and just need a bed to crash on when it's all over, then you're good - just bring comfortable shoes.

Fabulous!! One can spend their entire trip in this hotel without ever venturing out in the heat. The decor is impeccable, the service is 5 stars, pools are numerous and elegant and restaurants are top notch. Whatever your craving or desires to fulfill any one of the 7 deadly sins - this is the hotel!! 
PS - also good for kids

Such a beautiful hotel! 4 stars bc of check in....idk why it took so long for people to check in.....the room was nice and the bathroom was beautiful and big. I would stay here again.....you never have to leave the hotel

I go to Las Vegas a few times a year. Usually I stay at the Venetian. This last trip I decided to stay at Caesars Palace. What a mistake! Starting from a long check-in line 45 minutes wait. Horrible and abusive customer service. People were treated like dirt.  When it was finally my turn, I was told that "Good news we are going to upgrade you to another tower". I knew there was a problem there. There was no upgrades...... I did not want to make a big deal out of it then. After all I was going to be there only for two days. Horrible room: clogged sink and no hot water!!!! Talked to a manager "Justin" after that. He offered to waive one day Resort Fee $35.

Don't stay in this dump. BE AWARE!

A. Room Service. $50+ Chicken Caesar Salad\/Miniature Pepsi. Glass sticky with leftover juice from last customer. 1-1.5 hr wait.

B. Regular Room with adjoining door\/king bed ($300+ per night during the week). Outdated furniture mostly scratched and beat up, including the TV screen (most channels aren't in English anyway). Shower leaks across the small bathroom floor making exiting very slippery and dangerous. All snacks and drinks in room such as Aquafina bottled water ($7) and Keurig decaf coffee ($13) will accrue a one time charge of $25.

This is my favorite hotel to stay in. The rooms are amazing, especially in the new tower. You are close to the forum shops (and even though everything is too expensive for me to buy anything, I still enjoy looking), and you are centrally located to go to all other casinos on the strip. The pool area is awesome, and my friends and I laid out all day and people watched. There are 3 main pools to choose from, my fave is the round one. There is food and drinks available outside as well. Room service was great, fresh food. My only qualm with the room was the bathroom. Don't get me wrong, it was gorgeous, but there is a shower with glass doors in between 2 bathrooms, which might be cool if you are on your honeymoon, but I was with 3 other chicks, and I didn't really want to see them naked. But that's just me, I am sure a lot of people going to Vegas want to see their roomies naked! We ate at a couple of restaraunts inside, Mesa Grill was tasty (it's Celeb chef Bobby Flay's place. I don't like him, but it was good.) We had drinks by the pussycat dolls lounge and they  were strong and got the job done! On a previous time I had seen Celine Dion, and while I am not a big Celine fan, the tickets were free, and the show was pretty cool. All in all, there is a lot to do at this casino, and I had a really good time. One tip, though...there is always a cab line late at nite, so get a towncar. More expensive, but so much cleaner and faster!

Went and saw Mariah Carey and it was all good. Sure she should give up on the high notes, she hit most of them but it looks painful and it's really hard on my ears. I truly left there with a headache even though I did enjoy her show, especially when she did Fantasy and had all the old school stuff, it looked like the video she had for that song. She even had pics of Old Dirty Bastard on the screen while he rapped. It was good four outta five stars, go see her ::)

Stayed in the newest tower. Octavius.  Opened Jan 2012.  Nice room.  Qua Spa and fitness center was awesome. Great location. The Forum offers unlimited dining and shopping.  Good conference hotel. Casino a little too smokey but otherwise had a god experience

Lets play together!

Ok this place used to be my fave, but then ventured out and fell in love with Red Rock and The Cosmo and all the nice new casinos. I shouldnt say much though bc I now work for MGM! LOL.

So The newer rooms, like new modern bedding, are cute. The bathrooms were huge, but sometimes finding your area is confusing. Walk past the barge, 2 steps to the right and bam youre there! JK. But seriously, if youre not super familiar you can def get lost!

The slots here are so-so, they dont have a ton of NEW slots, but they have a ton of SLOTS... among sluts. LOL. I like to play in the back towards the Forum shops, thats where they have a lot of penny machines plus theres usually a cocktail waitress or 4 around.

Favorite shop at the Forums is def H&M! I love to just go and walk around and shit and people watch! I love the crazy wacky tourists! Beware though, those shops are freakin huge and you can also get lost!! Check out the giant fish tank and then go to Fat Tuesday!!

Here for convention. Our company is spending a lot of money and time in Vegas and Caesars this month. I have had TERRIBLE service from this hotel. Got here and they were unorganized and not prepared for lines at check in. Then, I have a very important package delivered to the hotel for meeting tomorrow .  After a dozen phone.calls and two visits to the main desk to try to get my delivery,  I have been told they are TOO busy to get my package to me. This is unacceptable. If you are here for business, good luck.

all i can say is free upgrade to a deluxe room in the palace tower at $60 per night! vegas must really be struggling if they've giving rooms away at this rate! I guess it all evens out since I made my contributions downstairs over several nights. this place was buzzing this past week (during the nahb conference), great overall service, i loved the airport limo service. don't worry, i'm not the high roller in the group, its someone else.

Amazing stay at caesers palace. This is my second time in Vegas and I wanted to stay here this time. Definitely worth it. We got an upgrade to the newest tower: Octavius. we got a suite, 500sq feet. Gorgeous bathroom, jacuzzi, king size bed and a great view. 

The man who checked us in, named kendahl was so awesome and nice. Thank you for an easy check in Man!

See you next year Vegas

Broken shower fixture, broken towel rack, something I'm apparently allergic to in the room, and all the 'joys' of staying in a casino in Las Vegas (loud noises at all hours, drunk frat boys wrestling in the elevator, and piss poor AC).  I really wish companies would stop having major conventions or courses in Vegas.

Oh, and the most ridiculously over priced buffet I've ever seen.  The food at Bacchanal is mediocre at best.  Cold bacon and eggs at breakfast seems to be a rule.

Really nice property on the strip with the main entrance lined with shrubs and statues; you really feel like royalty. The newer Octavius tower has really nice rooms overlooking either the south side of the strip or a pool view (good for checking all the eye candy in the summer). This tower also has close access to the pool from the elevators, however it's a long walk from the elevators to the lobby and casino. The casino is huge and I enjoyed gambling there.

The Hangover (it was a movie other yelp reviews referenced but I had to say it too, sorry for the overkill) is probably the epitome of a great Vegas weekend or one that has gone seriously wrong. For those of you fortunate enough to have visited the playground in the desert or better yet live there then you probably get what I mean. Cesar's is at a central location for you to meet up, play, stay, etc. I'm sure the style hasn't changed much with its classic Roman architecture and theme over the last 50 years but there have been some upgrades as expected. 

I went on one of my annual guys only trips and this year my cheap ass friends ponied up some dough and decided to live the sweet life at Cesar's for a couple of days. Well they didn't actually pay for their rooms but were comped from Total Rewards. I was shocked because rarely do I get free room offers from Cesar's but luckily my friends were hooked up. Me being me I couldn't be outdone and had to go with a mini-suite. It was enough room for me. The room had 2 bathrooms that were connected by a shower. The master bath had a Jacuzzi tub and a bidet. You need to try the bidet if you have never experienced one or have traveled to France. I lived in Europe for some time so it's nice to see these touches. FYI-you can always get an adapter for your own toilet at home depot or lowes. Okay, that was probably TMI on bidets. The room had plenty of closets, safe, and lots of room. The room does have a mini bar but the prices are outrageous. $7 for water, yeah right. There is a CVS across the street (diagonal from the hotel) where you can get all of your sundries, water, and beer. 

The crew and I ended up spending the eve up in my room b'sing and messing with the drunkest fools after a day of boozing. We got some pretty funny pics. I seriously thought we were going to get kicked out of the hotel but I guess Vegas being Vegas they let our antics slide. We were loud and obnoxious fools. 

The pool is one of the best I have visited in Vegas. Plenty of different atmospheres. There is a Euro style pool but I didn't check it out. We mainly stayed at the Neptune pool with the bar and the black jack tables in the pool. Those dealers were like Sirens in Homer's Odyssey. They kept calling us out with their songs to come over and play. They looked nice but took our $$$ quick. The drinks at the bar are way overpriced. I did have a few drinks. The mojitos were excellent. They will run you close to $30 for a large one. They have plenty of alcohol and will last a bit. If you're playing at the tables in the pool you will get comped drinks. 

There are tons of shops and restaurants. You basically never need to leave the resort. However, you probably will since you are a Yelper. I do recommend hitting up Sushi Roku upstairs in the Shoppes. They have a great happy hour. Cesar's is fun for people watching and having a great time. This last time there were a bunch of sorority girls passed out in front of the elevator to the tower I was staying at. I didn't have time for that so I kept on walking. Come stay and play at Cesar's Palace where you will have an unforgettable time. Just remember to drink and gamble responsibly. Just kidding, I don't give a Flying F what you do. Have a great time. Happy drinking!

I didnt even stay in the rooms and this place was BOMB! lol I love vegas and all parts of the strip! Step dad took us here just to site see and I loved it...alitte to busy for comfort but like i said i didnt see the rooms just the shops plus it was a saturday! I wil be back for the rooms though ;)

I love this place. Love it. I feel like a royal princess type person, and I haven't even really gambled here! Here's what I like about this hotel:

Instant upgrade to a huge suite
Cleanliness of everything
Pool -- so clean, and with many different ones, you can avoid gross people
Decoration -- SO modern and makes me never want to leave
View of Bellagio water show
Room service -- so speedy hubby and I barely had time to roll around naked in our piles of money on the bed before they rang the door
Beds -- so soft and comfortable, I seriously may never leave
Bathroom -- like a mini-mansion, only thing missing is a butler names "Chas"
Forum shops -- glamor glamor glamor
Costumes -- I heart togas. I can't help it. they're hot.

Stayed at Caesars Palace for a weekend, and it was a blast. I stayed in the Octavius tower, and the decor is very modern. Our room had a very nice view of the pool. The beds are very comfortable, too. I also used their gym, which is decent. They do need a few more benches for bench press, but other than that the gym is clean and well maintained. I definitely recommend Caesars to anyone looking for a nice hotel in Vegas.

Stayed at Caesars Palace last week for the first time after staying at many other hotels in Las Vegas over the years. It is an icon and we were curious as to how it would compare to other upscale hotels in Sin City....... we had a blast ! Great place to explore..... walk downstairs to Forum Shops , bars,many fun restaurants ..... convenient self parking...... very spacious rooms ... its an oldie but a goodie ..... highly recommend Caesars........ only slight hiccup was the check-in which was fairly crowded while we were there.... while the line moved well and it only took about 15 minutes in line.... it seemed to be something that could be easily improved by adding maybe 2 addt'l check-in people. Caesars was a fun and pleasant place.

I am madly in love with Caesars...I've stayed here twice now and it is magic every time! 

The good people at CP sent a limo to McCarran airport to pick my ass up...the nice man had a little sign with my name on it....sooo cute....he drove us to CP where he directed us toward the check-in counter and said our bags would be up in 15 minutes... 

The ladies at the counter were sweet and they tried to accommodate our needs as much as possible. We requested to stay in the Augustus tower since it has a view of the water show at the Bellagio we also asked for connecting rooms which they also made happen for us! 

The rooms were clean and big and we had a fully stocked bar....but uuummm don't touch or lift anything....I repeat do not lift or touch anything unless your ass wants to pay for it.....yes they have sensors that charge the merchandise to your room if moved. 

CP is right in the middle of the strip....everything is at your doorstep...the ambiance is amazing...casino is great! There are two pretty happening nightclubs: Pure and Poetry...(I'll Yelp those later)....The spa and salon are both magic (I will Yelp those two as well).... 

And room service is EXCELLENT!! Esp. at 6 am when you are drunk and stumbling in.....nice to know you can get some hot fries and Gatorade at your door step in a heartbeat! 

Stay here! Worth the 7.5k tab for 9 of us! (3 night stay, spa and salon services for all of us and room service twice a day......)

This place is miserable as the staff and will nickel and dime you for everything. The people at the front all seemed miserable when we checked in, the lines are long, there is no order with people just cutting in whenever they feel, and the staff that have any energy are rude. 
I get Vegas is expensive, it's a giant tourist trap. However, what hotel charges for Internet access these days? Also, I was floored when they said the gym is $25 per entrance. What hotel charges for the gym? They squeeze anything they can out of you. No free coffee in the room, but you can buy kcups. It's cheaper to go to Hawaii for a week then spend 3 days in Vegas. Never again.

Stayed at the Palace Tower (got upgraded from the Forum Tower)  - got a nice room - comfy bed with wonderful linen.  Spacious room.  Nice jetted tub.  Very clean.

Try the Lord of the Rings slots!  It's lots of fun!

Love the food court.  Try their Nathan's Chili Hot Dogs - out of this world!

Enjoyed my stay here!

Recently stayed at Caesar's for two nights (Monday-Tuesday) in a king room in the Forum Tower.

Though the hotel is insanely big and like a maze designed to lose you in the casino, the room and service were great.

We had a king sized room in the Forum Tower, everything was new, well-designed, and the bathroom was amazing (hello Porno shower with multi-shower heads!). 

Any questions I needed from the front desk were promptly and politely answered on the room phone \/ in person.

I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 though because the ding dongs who work at the pool aren't particularly helpful with getting pool chairs set up, etc. Just because most of the pools are closed doesn't mean you don't have to do your job...Also, the electronics in the room were utter crap. The TV was a flat screen with pixels as big as my thumb nail, and to charge $12 to use the coffee machine is offensive. Other than that, the place was pretty swell.

Impressed with this casino. It has been updated and though it is very "smoky" the restaurants and buffet that is coming soon will make this a great place to stay. The rooms are well designed and upgraded. The pool area appears neat and clean.

Very disappointed at the service at check in. We were asked to go to the counter by a lady with a walkie talkie walking around the counter and when we got to the counter a lady with heavy makeup and a pearl wedding ring asked us to back off and stand on the black tile. We waited there as instructed, she just stared at the monitor and I cant believe she just turned her back at us and went to the office. Thats extremely rude! She had no badge but I noticed she had a zebra phone case that's in her pocket. This is quite insulting. The checkin took 15 mins , no wonder there's a mile long line. I always stay at marriott chain and checkin never takes more than 5 mins.

I've stayed here several times over the years and it seems like this place has fallen on hard times. 

On arriving to a room in the Augustus towers we were shocked to see that in room coffee was $12 and if you wanted to use the fridge it was $25. Motel 6 has better service than this. 

I used a debit yard and was told there would be a $200 fee per guest for incidentals and this was fine,  however it wasn't until we were at the bar with drinks in front of us that we found out that they don't allow you to charge to the room if you use a debit card, even though they hold $400.

I went back and forth with  Calvin at guest services who was less than helpful and seemed to insinuate this was somehow my fault, while this is different than every other major hotel. 

In short, I have had better service in 3rd world countries, and even though I was here for the blackhat conference, I will never set foot on this property again. Anyone who raves about this place has no idea what constitutes good service
Not as good as it used to be... For the price range I'd go elsewhere. But not being a guest and just walking around is great! Inside is pretty
Headed here last weekend for some gambling fun w Hubby ... Had a blast! One of my favorite casinos. Simply gorgeous.

The main casino is beautiful  but  smoky which I expected. Lots of slots and table games to choose from. There are plenty of place to eat and drink but they are  EXPENSIVE. The buffet  was  overpriced but the food was good.

The pool area is beautiful. There is a topless pool area that is hidden at ground level but is it may be viewable from some of the rooms on the upper levels.

Alright, I gotta admit that this has got to be one of my top favorite hotels. The employees are so friendly and very helpful and that is what's most important to me because they make you feel so welcome as if you were right at home.

Aside from that the place is HUGE on general. They have a food court, high end shopping area (if your going to shop be prepared to make a dent in your wallet because it is very high end), and they're are many restaurants and cafes to pick from. My favorite tower is the Augustus tower - away from the casino and all the smoke. Augustus cafe has the best onion rings ever but that's a whole other review (:

The Augustus rooms are beautiful! It has a very vintage modern look to it. The tub is a jacuzzi! There also is a TV on the bathroom incase you get bored brushing your teeth or taking a bath. Love this hotel!

Caesar's Palace has always been a really nice stay for us. Besides the overpriced everything but you're in Vegas what do you expect!! We always stay in the Augustus tower and the views are amazinggg! This tower is close to the entrance, taxis, pool, etc wherever you want to get to.

A few complaints that I did have from my last visit was the broken tub. But I realized almost every visit all the panels of the tub on the outside are broken which is a minor hazard for small children which I had a toddler and 9 year old with me. Another is the pools close wayyy too early!!! 6pm?? That's so early for a pool in Vegas so that sucked. 

Bacchanal Buffet, apparently the best buffet with raving reviews etc...was just alright. We went twice and both times it was below mediocre. Lots of the food items were just bland, or cold, and just didn't really impress. If you're looking for a really good buffet that will never disappoint, go to the buffet at the Wynn! Hell, staying at the Wynn is always nice. Super classy, quiet, and bomb food! :)

I decided to try out Caesars Palace when I came to Vegas because of all the good thing I heard about it. When I first entered I felt high class. You then go to the desk and check in. After you check in you'll probably unpack and head either to the casino or one of their many shops. They have anything from sports memorabilia to cars and even a $2.5 million ring that features red, blue, and green diamonds. Their pool makes you feel like you've taken a trip back to ancient Rome. The only downside is the price of a room. If you are willing to spend a buck and want to experience some very high quality living I'd recommend Caesars Palace.

After being slightly peeved for having to wait for a good half-hour at the check-in desk, the rest of the stay was amazing.  Case in point: 
1) Reasonably priced upgrade got us a nice, big room with ceiling shower at the Forum Tower.  Lack of view (I never care much for the view anyway) was more than compensated by proximity to the awesome Forum Shops.

2) (most importantly) Helpful staff who, cognizant of my agitation for forgetting to bring my Blackberry charger and having to be Blackberry-less for the weekend, saved the day by directing me to the security desk who then produced a Blackberry charger that a previous hotel guest must have left behind.  Their loss is my gain.

3) Guest list @ PURE - no effort necessary.  'Nuff said.

Later on I realized, the abovementioned wait was not the fault of the check-in desk staff.  It was the two oriental ladies (read: supafobs - you can tell by the way they dress) who made a huge fuss about something and caused one of the staff to spend a good amount of time with them trying to explain the situation.  By the way, their broken English didn't help any.

I have stayed here 2 times once in a suit, complimentary upgrade, and in the Nobu tower. Great experience both times but prefer Ceaser tower over Nobu. Loved the room service but best of all the pool and the great 40oz mojito drinks.

Stayed here recently for a conference.  The room smelled like someone had smoked pot non-stop for a week.  It was intoxicating and gross. The front desk didn't do anything to help.  

I did enjoy eating at guy savoy and nobu everyday but that's about the only good thing going for them.  They should move to a trendier and cleaner resort.

Don't even think about playing the slots here.  With the exception of mega huge jackpots (for publicity) that happens once every couple years; it has one of the worst play back rate.  Guess all the marble floors need lots of up-keep.

Drinks were about $12-$18 for a well whisky and vodka.  Didn't even feel inspired to go for ballantine 30 or something more decent.

Rooms also get shitty ATT cell connection. You'll be lucky to get 3G with an LTE device.

The new buffet at this pathetic joint also has 2hr wait.  

Going back to vegas this month again for fun.  But you all know where I won't be staying.

I have tried just about all the buffets in Vegas. And I would have to say the buffet at Ceasars is by far thee best. I thought how they give you the choice to warm up your crab legs in boiling water that totally brings out the flavor more. Oysters taste so fresh and yummy. They also have so so many other delicious foods to choose from. Wait times are usually 1 hr on weekends.

Stayed there one night for my b-day in early January. Totally spur-of-the-moment decision btw! Anyway, since it was just after New Year's we managed to get a room for $150. Yes, only $150. Anyway, we get there and, surprisingly, it's quite busy though the line for check-in moved rather quickly. The lady who did our check it was super nice and even upgraded us to a mini suite! We get to our mini suite and it was beautiful, you can definitely tell they've done their job with updating the hotel.
I really don't think there's a point in me describing how beautiful the pool area is.. the hotel in general is gorgeous and there's tons of pictures of that already.
I guess my high rating if for the great quality of service coupled with the amazing price that we got.

I believe physicians all across America need to pull out their prescription pads and recommend a healthy dose of "casino action" for their patients who lost the zest for life. Lets face it, people in the US are over medicated and with a mere 40 hour work week they have too much time on their hands.

I believe people should work 60 hours a week. Six days a week at 10 hours a day. That would keep people out of trouble - they wouldn't have time to feel down let alone go to the doctors office. Sunday you would have off but you go to church and work some more as a volunteer only with no pay. Well, given I don't run things luckily you have a cushy 40 hour work week and two whole days off. I recommend you book at stay at CP and make the most of it.

This is time sensitive - you need to drop everything and make reservations fast. The end of summer is soon approaching and you've been thirsting for relief from the rut you are in. Dump the kids at grandmas and hop in plane, train or any other kind of transportation and get over here without delay.

Upon arrival you will be overwhelmed with luxury, excitement and all your ills will fade. Your center strip in the best location that Vegas has to offer. Beautiful rooms, delicious food, some night life and interesting people from all over the world to get to know.

In the afternoon enjoy the comfortable dry heat and let your pale blinding white legs catch some sun. Splash around in one of the many pools and cool off with some poolside drinks.

What are you waiting for? You've had enough of the screaming kids. Its time to get away.
Quick check-in. Nice and cozy room. $14.99 for 24 hours of Internet--yikes! Friendly service.

Don't know why Caesars palace currently has only 3 & 1\/2 stars. I have been coming here on and off since 1988. 
The linens and beds are extremely comfortable and clean compared to other major properties on the strip. Service is awesome; concierge and staff are considerate and competent. You can tell when checking in at other properties that the help has not been guided in the right direction. 

As for the shops and restaurants are all high quality and competent as well except for Gordon Ramsey's kitchen, stay away from certain waiters. Food is good, hostess and service is sub par by far. I had better service and competence at Caesars cafe by the entrance believe it or not. 

For steak and market fish or free range chicken or duck you have to definitely try Homestead. You will not be disappointed. Can't go wrong with Nobu or the Asian noodle house for that matter as well. Palms in the Forum shops is a sure bet, and so is the Italian restaurant by the Trevi fountain. 

I love the souvenir shop because of the hangover t-shirts and paraphernalia. 

You will not be disappointed staying at Caesars Palace. It's centrally located to other properties within a 10 minute walk which is rare on the Vegas strip. The fountain show at Bellagio, pirate show at TI, and other properties\/clubs are within a 10 minute walk as well.

Get to the pool early, the good chairs fill up fast
cesars was ... what I expected, but not more
don't think i'll stay again with so many choices

I rate hotels in Las Vegas different from most hotels because when I stay at a hotel in Las Vegas I gamble there, I eat there, I'll go to the nightclub or lounge there and possibly shop there.  I might go to other establishments for anything I mentioned above but it's nice if I don't have to.
   I love this hotel and all it has to offer.  First off the rooms are exquisite; especially, the Jacuzzi Suites.   I normally stay in the Forum Tower so the location is central and a short walk to 2 nightclubs,  Pure and Poetry.
  You have a food court steps from the elevator.
  You have the Forum Shops a few steps further with nice restaurants and designer shops.  
   I normally do pretty good gambling here.   :)
   It's even better when I get free rooms.

I love Caesars Palace for sentimental reasons. It's a big part of Vegas history and lore.

I appreciate how Caesars continues to stay updated & fabulous.
The restaurants, the shopping, the spa, the beautiful pool & gardens are truly amazing. The staff and service is great.

Why not 5-stars? Well, you have to pay for every little thing while a guest here.

I'll still return to Caesars as it's my favorite. Hail Caesar!

Where is Julius Caesar when you need him for Caesars Palace? The lobby is the only place you can appreciate it since the rooms are infested with BED BUGS! Once you're in the room, you're trapped & can't get out unless you're covered in a jumpsuit. There's no way out! Save your bucks $$$ and move to another hotel on the strip. That's why the Roman Empire didn't last forever! Probably because of the Bed Bugs! :-(
Oh yes. Loved staying in Vegas. Lots of space.  Easy to get around. Not too expensive. Will return.

DO NOT PLAY TABLES HERE. My self and about 30 other people waited literally 40 minutes to cash out our table chips because only one cashier was working. After about 30 minutes security was called due to people becoming extremely angry. The 30 of us in line we're repeatedly skipped for "diamond" members and we were never given a chance to cash out. We were told by security that as long as there is a diamond member in line, the rest of us peasants would have to wait. Security then has the audacity to tell us "feel free to continue playing and come back later". I will never ever give any more of my money to caesars or their affiliates. I've never seen a line more than 3 minutes for a cashier. The customer service was absolutely terrible. Like I said, caesars will never see another dime from me.

Hotel is very standard!!! Not impressed at all! My room was comped from points we earned from a casino in North Carolina and I would not stay here again even if it was free! I would rather stay at the Holiday Inn. Normally we stay at the Excalibur when in Vegas and shouldn't have changed our plans. They nickel and dime EVERYTHING. Nothing nice about it. If you want coffee in the room in the morning it is $10. Unless you're a millionaire steer clear!

*they over charged us, put another card down, for incidentals and then they ended up double charging me. Just have to wait til the money gets back in. Annoying.

*stayed in the palace tower. LOVED IT, but the bed was not comfy at all. 

 Overall the hotel is wonderful, I love the topless pool! Lol. It's Cesar's its nice, it has so much to offer I might go back, but the over charging rubbed me wrong. So I'm rating low because of that. They admitted that it was a mistake by the girl at check in... Thought they would give us a better perk rather than "oh opps!": 

 It's Caesar's

I will never stay here again. We got married here, which was wonderful. The wedding department deserves their own 5 star review. Our stay on the other hand is a different story. We check in and within 5 minutes I got electrocuted plugging my phone in the outlet by the bed, sparks were coming out of the wall. After that I went to take a shower and the entire bathroom flooded. Apparently there was a bad seal in the shower. My husband called the front desk and they told us they would comp is $25. Wow, awesome. They said they would send someone right up, which was over an hr later. My mom ended up going down to the front desk and they offered us another room, which was smaller and in a different tower than all of our guests. We declined, so they gave us the same room just on a different floor. Later that day my brother checked in and he got a comp upgrade. The next day our friends checked in and they got a comp upgrade also. When we checked in we were even going to pay for an upgraded room and they told us there wasn't any because of a convention. And, when my mom was at the front desk they told her we had already been upgraded and they wouldn't do that for us again. Um I'm sorry, what? Worst hotel stay ever.

I recently stayed in the Augustus Tower where the rooms were lovely.  My friend stayed in the Roman Tower where the rooms are in need of a serious renovation.  Casino is too smoky.  Very confusing layout in the casino.  Bellagio's casino has almost a perfumed aroma.  Big negative of Caesar's is that there is no security checking room keys at the elevators.  Much safer at the Bellagio.  Better value at the Bellagio too.  The only reason I'm giving Caesar's 3 stars and not 2 stars is the beautiful room overlooking the Bellagio fountains.

We had a reservation for a standard suite, however, when we checked in we got upgraded to a huge one bedroom, 1.5 bath, living and dining area suite. The room was as large as a condo, super clean, modern with an amazing view! The bed was very comfy and there was a tv in the bedroom restroom. The hotel is conveniently located on the strip. Many shops and restaurants located within walking distance. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay again. The casino is one of my favorites; it seems the more I drank the better I got.

Hotel - pretty nice
Casino - very fun
Pool - AMAZING!

Caesars is in a great location. You can walk right out onto the strip or walk through the Bellagio all the way down to the Aria. The restaurants are all pretty good and the best part is their absolutely stunning pool!! Kendra Wilkinson was hosting a party last time we were there so it was totally packed, but we still manged to find a nice spot in the sun to sit and relax. The cabanas are pretty pricey, but definitely worth it if you plan to spend all day at the pool. Pure is also one of my favorite clubs to go to during the week, weekends not so much but the cover is usually free or $5 and the drinks are great!

Loved it. We stayed in Feb 2017. Great location on strip. Clean. Loved the motif, shopping, nightlife. Felt nicer than say Plant Hollywood and some of the other hotels. Pools were closed tho for renovation. Cant wait to return!

Stayed here for the first time and had a great stay! I gave it a four because on arrival there was a slight smell of cigarettes..but the view was freakin awesome! The receptionist gave us a view for our room..in front of bellagios fountain!! The decor was nice and the bathroom was awesome and clean. Love how the showers and tub is separate. After day 1..we went back to our room and it was all clean. The maid even laid our my make up and put it under a clean towel. Thanks!! Oh and there's a TV in the bathroom too!!! Try to get rooms in the laurel collection towers. Great stay.

Let me start saying that I've been coming to Vegas for years, I've stayed in almost every other hotel from the good the bad and the ugly, Cesar Has been always one of my favorites, lately or I should say in te past couple of years I'm not sure what's happening but the rooms aren't clean! Specially the bathroom! I'm writing this as I'm leaving and I'll post some pictures (bathroom's) of when I got the room it was just nasty I couldn't believe and whoever knows Vegas and knows about Cesar Palace knows that they aren't cheap is just the way it is...I was happy to pay what they charge but I always got an amazing room so just for the records I paid almost $400 a night this weekend and you'll see the pictures... Why didn't I change the room or said anything? Because I'm not that type of people I hate to be complaining plus a hotel like this should know better! That room shouldn't be rent it to anybody they need to fix that ASAP and i'm sure the guy at -check in- knew about it but they just didn't care and just hoped that we wouldn't say anything and sure enough we didn't... The room was on floor 9 to be more specific room 927 SO if they ever give you this room DON'T GET IT!

Staying here for the week for a convention, and I am not at all impressed with the room.

The toilet requires you to hold the handle down the entire duration of the flush, otherwise it won't do it's job. Room is 2316 Incase management sees this. I will be checking out tomorrow so please come fix it for the next guest.

The other amenities in the room are lacking as well. No refrigerator, no microwave. Roughly. 30" LCD tv, which by today's standards is a bit small for the room.

I do not plan to stay here during future personal visits.

I recently stayed here for  the 4th of July long weekend, and I was pretty impressed with our room in the Octavius Tower, which is one of the newer buildings Caesar's added on. Our room was definitely more spacious than the typical Vegas hotel room I've had in mind - there are two queen size beds, a roomy couch, and a few sofa seats. The bathroom was definitely much larger than any Vegas bathroom I've previously seen - there was a separate shower from the big jacuzzi-style tub. Noise was never an issue and we didn't have any problems with utilities or cleanliness.

Over all, I'm impressed. While I long to stay at some of the more "hot" hotels such as Aria, Wynn, or Cosmopolitan, I definitely would not have an issue staying here again.

My parents and I visited over the 4th of July weekend. I was very satisfied with my visit! Our room was in the Octavius tower, and the room was spacious and comfortable. We had no trouble finding a place by the pool, which was gorgeous. I've stayed at many other Vegas hotels and the pool area definitely stood out for me. The hotel was well-maintained, and all the facilities were in great condition. The poolside mixed drinks were ridiculously overpriced I will say, but the beer prices were reasonable. 4 stars. Would definitely stay here again!

I came to Cesar's Palace to watch Jerry Seinfeld at the Coliseum. It is absolutely beautiful in here... statues everywhere, the ceilings have paintings on them... my goodness I didn't know where to put my eyes next! 

If you've never been to the Coliseum then I must say that it is gorgeous inside... Red curtain draping the stage... seats were comfy and the ushers will literally walk you to your seats and help you with anything you need. Very accommodating. 

The casino is beautiful as well.. we hit the slots before watching the show. Very fun! 

I had a great time here and plan on coming back. Loved it.

Ce fut parfait. 
Même si j'ai dû redescendre à la réception pour changer de chambre puisque celle affectée ne correspondait ni à notre résa sur Booking, ni à nos aspirations.
La suite vue piscine au 14e étage était sensationnelle et nous en avons bien profité. Jacuzzi, sofa, lit extra large... après 3 nuits de camping dans Yosemite où nous nous étions gelés, ce fut bien évidemment le Paradis.
Certes, cet hôtel est kitch à souhait, clinquant et too much mis c'est exactement ce qu'on voulait voir de Vegas pour une première fois. La prochaine fois, on testera le Bellagio qui au travers d'une rapide visite semble parfait pour une seconde fois à Vegas :-)

Great hotel and its location is outstanding. Right in the heart of the strip. They have everything you need here, great places to eat and great shopping where you feel like your in Rome. Casino is huge with many tables so you will not be sitting and waiting. The pool? Well that's the best part. Outstanding pool with hunts you can rent and waiter service to you wherever you are in the pool area. They have a tiki bar also and a private section where you can have a VIP party. The crowd is beautiful here so you can just sit and relax. The rooms were very spacious and priced perfect. the Suites are unreal. Next time I go to Vegas, Ceasars it is. There is not one thing bad to say about this place at all, very classy hotel and priced perfect.

This place was nice and It was clean.  I great place for your significant other to shop while you enjoy a fine cigar and a Mojito at Casa Fuente Cigars..  Because i am not much of a shopping fool I just sat around watching people go by..  Man it was interesting. . My next visit to vegas I a seriously considering staying here..  Classy and clean.  Two thumbs up for me.

Got 4 nights of a comp room at Caesars. Unless you upgrade they put you in the Centurion Tower, which is the older but renovated tower. 

The room was pretty large as it fit two beds and a couch. No desk. The bath was huge though - the size of a studio apartment in New York City. No ice machines in this tower so whenever you wanted ice you had to call room service and they would wheel it up. If you stay in this tower, do not stay on floors 30-32 (the first 3 floors in this tower).
