The tower sits right above Cleopatra's Barge (nightclub) and multiple people had told us that the could hear the club into the wee hours of the morning. 

The pool at Caesars consists of 3 pool areas. The pool bar is long, there are in pool blackjack tables, and massive beds at poolside that you can rent for $200 a day. The chair area is cramped and get there early to grab chairs. The sun also hits the pool at a weird angle, so only half the pool gets sun. The hot tub is the size of a small pool. 

All in all it was a good stay. But who is to complain since the room was free?

Das Hotel Ceasars Palace ist ein riesiger Gebäudekomplex, der es am Anfang erfordert nach Schildern zu laufen, um sich nicht zu verlaufen.

Tolle Poolanlage, die man in den heißen Monaten zum Abkühlen brauch.

Das Essen kann ich hier nicht beurteilen, da wir - wie eigentlich fast überall in LV - es leid waren uns in endlose Schlangen anzustellen.

Avoid booking at Caesar's. I definitely regret it and wish I had chosen the other hotel.

I booked via Hotels.com and I searched for 4 guests. They gave me the room options which were all 2 beds and up based on my needs. I only put my name on the reservation since I'm checking in.

I get here and find out they downgraded me from 2 beds to 1 bed. I paid for 2 beds and money was deducted from my credit card months ago. I believe that's the whole concept of a reservation. Caesar Palace's policy is that number of beds is considered a preference. I am appalled. Booking the number of beds to me is part of the deal, NOT a preference. They show 1 or 2 bed options. No one chooses the 2 bed rate thinking it's not part of the reservation. They also say only my name was on the reservation so they didn't save me my 2 beds. 

It got worse when we ordered food at 12 am. A room service person knocked on our room with the wrong food and said our food was right next to her. Time passes and I call dining. It has been 1 hour now, I called and they said they were out of the dish I orderes. It's ridiculous that I had to call and find that out myself after waiting an hour. 

We also asked for toothpaste at 1 am. Called at 1:45 AM to check and it was cancelled for some reason. Called again at 2:20 am and said it was coming. It came at 3 am. 

Last night Veronica from guest services could get me 2 beds the next night. I call today and surprise they gave it away again.

I did not pay $300 a night for a room to sleep on a rollaway bed.

Reservations do not mean a thing to Caesar's Palace. Number of beds is part of the reservation, not a preference. Management is horrendous with room service and guest dining. I am so disappointed.

Okay, I have a love-hate relationship with this hotel. LOVE that their rooms are so beautiful (well, in the Palace\/Augustus towers that is....) LOVE their pools, 5-6 of them? Their pools have blackjack tables in it and classic roman statuettes all over the place. It's PIMP. LOVE their Qua bath and spa.....it's soo relaxing. HATE their front desk service and the way they run the hotel. Two years in a row, they screwed up on our reservations. Even though they try making it up to us by upgrading our rooms and comps, it's still annoying that they can't get it right to begin with. The lines at the front desk are soooo long. For such a huge hotel, one would think that there'd be more than just 3-4 clerks at the desk. 

So there's the love-hate...in the end, more love than hate...We always have a good time at Caesars, so it's my go to Hotel when in Vegas.

Had a relatively nice stay here. At first, I was in the newly renovated Julius tower which was beautiful. The color palette was clean and airy. The renovations were so recent that the paint still smelled fresh. There was an issue with the climate control after a few hours in the room, so they gave me the Octavius tower on the 51st floor. The Octavius tower was very far removed from the casino, which could either be a pro or a con. It's very secluded and quiet. There's a side entrance on Flamingo that is closer to the Octavius elevators so make sure you tell the cab to drop you off at this side entrance. The octavius tower is more luxurious and the rooms have more square footage. The octavius room and bathroom was huge compared to the Julius room. The octavius bathroom featured an awesome jetted tub and amazing shower.  The room had a warm color palette with dark wood tones. The rooms had doorbells which I thought were super cute.

Stay away from this crap service poor excuse for a hotel. Loyal for years then they put us in a $500\/night room in the "new Julius Caesar palace" with hammering, drilling and construction happening all night. No Lie. And they want to refund the $35 Resort fee. Are you KIDDING ME RIGHT NOW????????  Never again.  Mandarin Oriental SAVES the day and is taking us at 6am!!! Now that's class. SUCK IT, Caesars. What ever happened to CUSTOMER SERVICE anyway??

UPDATE: My husband wrote them a letter when we got home. All we got was a defensive response defending themselves saying they have warned contractors and yada yada excuses. You are the WORST excuse of an establishment for customer service ever!! Who does that? Just admit you should not have opened that floor for paying customers when you did and say you're sorry. All we got is 'hope you give us another try'.  REALLY?? You haven't given us ONE reason to. Idiots. It's not like we were even looking for a "deal"-just a good experience. We were ready to pay for it too. Double IDIOTS. Take a lesson in service at The Mandarin Oriental.

You suck!!!   To make the mini-dramas into a shorter review, I'll just list the major\/minor issues and what was done.

1.  Hubby signed up for online early check in. When we checked out a couple of days later, low and behold there was a b.s. $30 charge for this service.  Hubby was unaware and went back into confirmation email and there was no mention of this, including in the "fine print".  Nice try, but no cigar, we demanded it be removed.  A manager finally agreed to remove it.

2.  Back to arrival and check in, our premium and upgraded room (which we paid more $ for) was meh and a problem to boot immediately!  The supposed new luxurious bed was so crappy and soft that after hubby sat it was sinking to middle.  After getting up, an indentation stayed.  After wasting over 30 minutes on phone a guest relations manager said she would have us moved to an older tower, with what "she was told" we're firmer beds.  She said go on with our plans and room would be made ready, bags moved and a call or text later when complete.  No call and no text, made our way back and bags not moved!  Caesar's apology was removal of the per night resort fees and $50 dining credit.  I guess it's something ...  Old Palace tower, far and old, blech!  Oh yeah, the bed was only a 20% improvement.

3.  The famous No. 1 buffet Baccahanal, a disappointment!  We did the lunch\/dinner 2:00 pm 3:00 pm switch to get to try more of the foods for the cheaper price, but it was pricier due to the Thanksgiving holiday!  Line for the kiosk was spitting out the call back text reservations for 3 hours later and then you'd have another line wait of approx. 1 1\/2 hours!  But wait Caesars will help you skip the line, for $25 pp additionally, you get to go immediately.  We had show tickets later and we couldn't wait all that time so a decision had to be made "on the spot".  How bad do we want to eat at the famous Baccahanal?!  Hubby and I forged ahead, paid  the extra extra money and guess what?, still had to wait in a shorter 20 minute line.  Finally food.   Continued below for easier on the eyes reading ...

Overall I definitely didn't get my money's worth with weak Bloody Mary's, not so great prime rib, ramen ruined with too much seaweed and noodles not cooked properly, fatty honey ham, definitely not like the taste or quality of Honeybaked Ham!  Lamb chops (a huge fave normally) that were seasoned & cooked well, with poor quality of meat used, definitely not New Zealand lamb.  The list could keep going but you get the idea.

There were a few standouts for me:  carne asada street tacos, warm chocolate lava cake, and bbq pork.  These were terrific.  Our waiter was also great.  Overall, Bacchanal was a huge disappointment.

I will never stay at Caesars Palace again.

We stayed at Caesars Palace this week and they had two ridiculous fails:

1. After an recovering alcoholic friend ordered a drink with no alcohol, they brought her one with vodka - which she drank all of, not realizing. She figured it out, told the waitress she was upset and stormed out. The waitress then brought me an un-itemized bill, which, when I asked for the breakdown, included $12 for the vodka. When I protested, the waitress said, "Well, she DRANK it."

2. Having moved the wildly overpriced mini-bar items on top of the dresser to make room for our things (and then moving them back at the end), they charged us $146 after checkout, because their motion sensors told them that we used every one of them (when we had used ZERO). When I called and protested that at the very least they should explain that possibility to people, they said, "Well, it's posted in the room, and we don't have time to explain every detail to every customer." Needless to say, we never saw that posted.

I got no apology from either. Nothing but a "have a nice day" through gritted teeth attitude from both. Caesar's will not see another dime of our money in this lifetime, and I'd suggest you send yours elsewhere, too.

This review is for the Laurel Collection part of Caesars, only. 

You come to Vegas expecting great service, right? 

The moment we arrived at the check in we were greeted by a dismissive woman named BLAIR who immediately shirked us off before we even got to the counter telling us just to wait in line. Her tone made me feel like I was at a Holiday Inn somewhere in the sticks. I thought: is she having a bad day and rude to everyone? But when I saw that wasn't the case i figured maybe it's because she assumed we were non English speaking Asian tourists and thought she could treat us like second class citizens. 

But we still waited patiently while she continued to ignore us. 

After a while we asked when she could help us and she just said "it will be a while". "How long?  We've been waiting for a while" "i don't know, a while.  I was busy when you came up to me so a while".  Her rudeness and attitude was shocking beyond being totally inappropriate. 

 90% of your job is to accommodate guests and make them feel welcome and all you can muster is a lousy attitude that makes guests feel like a nuisance?

When we called her out for her disrespectful tone she started arguing back at us giving us more attitude! I can't think of any other time I've come to Vegas and been treated so poorly. I suggest she leaves the service industry if she dislikes helping people so much.

Stayed here about twice, and the rooms are just okay. We stayed at the Spa Suite in the Augustus Tower, and the infinity tub was GIGANTIC! But with outdated walls, they lose one star. 
The big problem I have with this is the room service. Ordered a mocha to start the day and it didn't come til 50 minutes later. It went to the time that I forgot I ordered something. And the mocha was lukewarm. ????
But The Jupiter Pool gains a star. Secluded from the loud noises, sitting on a chaise in a cabana, and a back massage when needed, this is almost like Hawaii....... almost. 
All in all this place is okay. But I'd never stay here again after the second. The Encore, Palms Place, or Venetian is the way to go.

A long overdue review. 

Stayed here in 2015 and all I remember from my stay is the lack of a bathroom door!!! 
I guess it doesn't matter if you're staying with your spouse or someone whom you are super comfortable around. However, the bathroom is right next to the front door so if someone opens the front door, people passing by *may* be able to see you doing your business. 

I was on the toilet when we got a call from the front desk. I don't recall the details, but maybe they were calling about bringing our luggage up. My husband answered the phone and told them to come up to which I screamed that I was on the toilet and to not come up. I guess they heard me because my husband started laughing hysterically. :[

The hotel is pretty central to everything. Other than the door issue, I don't have any complaints.
Although I have not stayed at this hotel, I have played there. Really enjoyed the atmosphere, and how clean it is. Poker room is nice, and the tournament room is great.

Caesars Palace property is a place that everyone should check out.  It is one of the older hotels but now is more popular than ever.  It does not look like it is fading or anything and is still expensive as hell to try to get a room for the night.  It is now known as "the HANGOVER" hotel.  The movie craziness mostly are seen in the suite here, so this place has life again.  Rooms are pricey, tried to look into staying here one night recently and it was a higher price than we were willing to play. We got a good deal from Aria, this place was not offering any deals.  

Great place to walk around and check out the restaurants that are here.  I did not gamble here that much, it was just for walking around.  I loved the statues here too, I agree with some others.

I like the accommodating room with jacuzzi. 
I like the fact that we were loud at 4 in the morning and no one complained. 
I like how easily it was to get into PURE (but i guess who can't?)
I like the fact that we went from $50 dollars to $500 dollars at the craps table. 
I like the guy at the craps table giving away $$... wait.. I might love him. 
I like the waitress that comes by at least once every ten minutes. 
I like how we can bring drinks into the Pool. 
I like how Shaggy serenaded us from 3 ft away. 
I like the fast room service that cost a grip because we thought we're SOMEBODY. 
I like the fact that we were the only obnoxious people gambling at 9am. 
I like the pit box manager who didn't kick me out when I spilled the drink onto the table. 

I like you, Caesars Palace.

Nice hotel, great rooms, great location. Nightlife is OK. loses 2 stars because the hotel is way too big. i either didnt want to go back to my room or leave my room cause of the walk to everything. I guess thats the point. keep 'em downstairs to shop and gamble. ok. +1 star for craftiness.

Just spent few days at this hotel. Room was not the cleanest one and the bed was not that comfortable. Beer py the pool 11$ mojito like 16$ but very delicious french fries 8$ . Pools were awesome. The casino space felt very small compared to other hotels. I love slot machines but had not much to choose from. If you want to stay here be readdy to spend a lot of extra $. Dont even try to open mini fridge in the room cause ull be charged for it fast. Staff was very nice.

Stayed here this August in the Augustus tower. The room was nice, but the pools were freezing cold. I understand it was 100 degrees, but we tried 3 different pools and they weren't even enjoyable to be in. We were at other hotels over the weekend as we had friends also staying at Mirage and Encore and both hotels had a much nicer water temperature that was cool without feeling like ice water. When I brought it up to customer service, they just blew me off. Half the reason I chose Caesar's is because of how nice their pools looked but I wasn't even able to enjoy them. I will stay at an MGM or Wynn hotel when I travel to Vegas in the future.
Totally awesome resort... nothing to want here! Great rooms - spacious, clean, comfortable beds... Food options are fantastic... every option you can think of...

It is amazing how the little things can ruin your stay.  They now charge $12\/ day for guests to park.  We had it added to our room charge yet our room key would never let us out of the garage.
We would call for help and they will say it was added.  Finally we just used our credit card and we had a room charge.
All the restaurants have raised their prices.  $32 for chicken Mac n cheese really.  We were also charged for internet one day even though they charge a resort fee which is suppose to cover it.  
We come to vegas 4 or 5 times per year.  I guess I will need to find the lesser name hotels that actually want our business.
It won't be Caesar's any longer.  $1,000 stay and they lose a customer for $12 parking

Took my wife for a 24 hour trip to Vegas.   We had great tickets to Elton John so I decided to stay at Caesars for logistics.   Big mistake.    Not only is the price of a standard room high, they charge you for everything.   I should have known when I called the concierge a week before my stay to get a bottle of Champaign in our room when we checked in.   Impossible according to her.   No service from my perspective.   Second, I asked if I could Schedule a pickup from the hotel but since I am not a Total Rewards member, I guess I am not important enough.  Strike two and I hadn't even arrived yet.   I was willing g to pay for the ride but no dice.   I got to the hotel and waited about 16 minutes for a room even though I did online check-in. My wife went to the bar to get $32 drinks for two. They asked what was taking so long and she indicated she needed to talk to somebody to make it possible. I had put in for an upgrade on the room but that didn't go through but they still charge me. I had caught that mistake and have them take it off my bill. I was also charged $25 for a resort fee for both Saturday and Sunday even though I was this there one night. We got to the room it was nice and clean but small for what we had paid. The next morning we woke up we found out that even though there was a coffee maker in the machine they wanted to charge you $13 to use their grounds. I've never been in a hotelthat charged you for coffee in the morning. Especially when you're paying $25 resort fee per day. Doesn't make sense.

There are too many choices when it comes to hotels in Las Vegas. I will never stay at Caesars ever ever ever again

My review will be on the forum tower room. We booked with Expedia for Wednesday 6\/1-Friday 6\/3. We arrived 1130am and we're hoping to check in. The lady at the desk said check ins don't start until 4pm but we could pay $30 for early check it but it wouldn't guarantee early check in. We would possibly get a text from 12p-3p letting us know the room is ready if we paid the extra $30. After reading the reviews about check in issues we decided to use the bell service and wait it out. At 4pm we came back to check in to be told that had text us earlier to tell us the room was ready, we never received the message. As we walked to the rooms the halls were at a comfortable temp. When we arrived to the room I noticed it wasn't updated. Our sheets had a few holes in them. The towels that we had in the bathroom had a few stains on them. We couldn't get one of the lamps to work. The controls to open and close the curtains partially worked, we had to use our hands to close the other half of the blinds. Carpet showed stains. They have a Keurig in the room but if you use it, the cost is pricey. They also leave you water, candy at a very expensive price. Do not open the refrigerator, I was told that costs money too. Our toilets didn't flush all the way and the water ran for awhile. I didn't care for the showers since the water pressure was very faint. The cleanliness of the bathrooms were decent. Our view wasn't awful. I did hear people in the hallway in the early hours of the morning. I recently stayed at Tropicana and would suggest their rooms over Caesars.

A little disappointed and not what I expected from a 4.5 star hotel.  We had a room on the 3rd floor of the Roman tower.  It seemed pretty clean at first glance but a closer look showed a lack of attention to detail that you would expect from such a highly rated hotel.  The glasses in the bathroom were not cleaned we'll (big white spots in both of them) and there was a lot of dust on the ledges and base boards.  Additionally, we had a constantly running toilet in the room.  If I called, We probably could have changed rooms or had it fixed but we arrived later than expected and had to leave quickly to make a scheduled event and it just wasn't worth the hassle at the time.  The room was starting to show its age as well (peeling wallpaper, part of the baseboard falling down in the bathroom, dents in the wall where suitcase and luggage racks had banged, hair dryer didn't work and kept making the breaker  pop and the lights go off) nothing we couldn't live with but also something I didn't expect from a 4.5 star hotel.  I know Vegas is specifically designed  to get you into the casinos and keep you there as long as possible but the lack of amenities in the room was worse than I've ever seen in 7 other  hotels on the strip (no fridge, mini bar, or coffee maker).   

The food in the hotel was very good but also very expensive and the casual options left much to be desired.  Another mind boggler was that you couldn't get a table at 1040 pm in anything other than the lobby restaurant because they closed at 11.  We were there running a race that ended at night directly in front of the hotel and had 40,000 people participating.   You would figure they would extend the hours of at least a couple restaurants for that night; they were all packed so they definitely would have made $. 

The location was great, centrally located, Easy-ish access  to the monorail (across the street through the flamingo), and within walking distance to great local attractions (bellagio fountains\/mirage volcano) and perfect location for hobbling marathon finishers.

Overall, it'd take a really good price to get me to come back here.  It was nice but there are much cheaper options that Caesars doesn't blow out of the water which I felt it should have given the higher price.
It looks amazing from the outside,  and just as impressive on the inside. I am a fan of this place. The layout is a labyrinth,  but once you know where you are it is easy to get around.

The hotel management suck! I called them to let them know traffic in their parking backed up to six level, after talking to hotel manager and security managers I was told they don't have anyone to manage and direct traffic , this only happens in Cesar palace, all other hotels have security to manage traffic. Never ever come back

Yeah maybe its because i gamble here a lot and thats why they treat me like royalty here but caesars palace is probably gonna be the only hotel i stay at in vegas forever  unless i lose a shit load than thats just my luck telling me to move to another casino!! I want to thank all the pit bosses, dealers and my host for all the request and comps you have given to my drunk ass but i appreciate that no matter how drunk and obnoxious me and some of my friends have gotten you still take care of me and treat me well and i am forever grateful thanks!

Just one of the great hotels that I visit\/stay.

This is a classic Vegas hotel
Great selection of restaurants with awesome casino.

The staffs are friendly and knowledgable.
Great service.

From time to time, you'll see Caesar and Cleopatra roaming in the hotel with guards.

Depending on the rooms you booked, the view is awesome.
I like staying here.

We didn't stay in one of their rooms but while walking around, we came across The Caesars Palace Hotel.

There are a variety of restaurants and shops inside. The Bacchanal Buffet is an excellent buffet, so much variety. We came here to watch Celine Dion, which was amazing! There is a food court with affordable eats in here as well. The Payard Patisserie & Bistro has awesome chocolates and a great place to visit for any chocolate lover.

Came here for the Mariah Carey show, there was a store set up to purchase her goods\/souvenirs which was awesome.   Everyone in this store was packed like sardines it was so crowded, felt like Black Friday ha! 

CP is huge enough casino that everyone is comfortable, even with a popular show going on.  Lots of places to eat before watching a show, lots of things to do while passing time.  

We took a taxi here, the taxi stand isn't difficult at all to find, in-fact not too far from the entrance and where the arena is located.   

Love how organized the arena events are.  Doors opened early, ushers are at stand by to guide you to where you need to go even before you are in the arena.  The arena is so grand, the seats are comfortable, the show started exactly on time, in-fact I was in the lady's room and heard from the speaker that the performance was about to start.   

They also have a strict policy no video recording or photo's during the show, the usher made it a point to let each party know this and they do lookout for these people that don't obey the policy, and confronted when caught.  Kind of stiff though, I love concerts where everyone is up and dancing, this was not that type of performances, felt almost like watching an opera, so strict, but it was a great show.  

Thank you CP for having great shows and superstars performing.

I enjoy a lot of the great restaurants located in here. The biggest issue is that this place is a maze. It is very difficult to maneuver here, even with using the maps that are posted. The casino area is very expansive if you are here for gambling. The Colosseum is a great place to see a show, the acoustics are amazing.  But come early if you are going to a show or to eat, it may take a while to find where the place is.

Das Hotel ist äußerlich und in der Lobby beeindruckend. Die Zimmer sind großzügig, wenn gleich sie schon bessere Tage erlebt hatten. Die Poolanlage ist riesig. Das Personal ist freundlich. Das Gepäck wird einem aufs Zimmer gebracht. Wir konnten auch kostenlos parken. Standesgemäß wird das Auto weggebracht und geholt. Alles in allem ein sehenswertes Hotel. Wir fanden auch das Preis-\/Leistungsverhältnis okay. Allerdings hat die Dusche nach einmal Duschen den Geist aufgegeben. Gott sei Dank war ich nicht mehr eingeseift. In der Badewanne ging dafür nur heißes Wasser.

The downstairs bathroom is incredibly nice!
Outside, is a shoe shining booth and a couch. 

When you walk in, there's a triptych along the winding entrance.
Venus d' Milo and Statue of David photos on the bathroom stalls.
There's a powder room adjacent to the sinks.

I always make this my before or after stop on my way to Bacchanal

nice room, lots of hidden costs if you used a online site to book your room ( price line, booking) the staff was rude. and everything closed down early so we had to leave to eat and get drinks. over all with so many places to pick i will not be coming back. and watch the tables they want your money!!!!

I've stayed at caesar's several times now in different towers. Each time I was happy with my accommodations. The people here are nice. The rooms are clean. Overall, a pleasant experience.

They have a nice pool area with several pools.  I also was here for a convention last year and I enjoyed the accommodations as well.  This place has a lot to offer, from the casino to the pool to the clubs and the dining options, you don't really ever have to leave the hotel.  

The poker room is nice because it is non-smoking and the dealer are nice there too.  The housing staff are also very accommodating and if you need a cot there is no charge and they bring you blankets and pillows upon request.
What can I say, any casino where I win money is a fun place to be! Combined with an amazing Calvin Harris show at Omnia. 2 thumbs up from me!

Luxury all the way! We lucked out with a 4 day bday comp and wow picked the right Vegas hotel. Probably the only one worth paying the ouch $32.50 a night resort fee because it lowered the Qua spa price from $50 to $25 for the day pass. I could live there! Three different temp plunge\/jacuzzi\/waterfall Roman showers room another huge spa circle, wet herbal and dry sandwood saunas, a freaken polar snow falling from the ceiling room! Private locker for your clothes, tea room to lounge in your big white robe and private showers bigger then a bathroom. Quiet (thank u no cell phones!) soothing lighting and most relaxed I've felt in years mmmmm  :)  

For only $42 a night upgraded to the Augustus tower fountain view. Unbelievable & unobstructed view, could sit on the couch all night just watching the Bellagio show but then I couldn't melt in the huge spa tub and rinse off in the two person shower. Marshmellow goodness beds but WARNING look but don't touch the mini bar and snacks! Are you on crack?? $13 for 4oz. of M&Ms?? And ouch on the room service prices! But hey it's Caesars the buffet alone was $130 w\/tip just for 2 people and yessssss it was awesome too....

 Do I love Caesars? Am I endlessly dreaming of going back and already checking prices when I just left 5 days ago? Do I wish I spent my honeymoon there 18 months ago instead of just our reception at Trevi up in the mezzanine? (delicious Italian food, romantic, right by the fountain of the gods) Yes Yes Yes!

I concur with the check in time complaints. Took at least 30 minutes to get to the counter. So if you bring everything but the kitchen sink luggage wise like me it's worth getting the car valeted and the bell boy to bring up your bags. Very friendly staff. All hail Caesars!

While I didn't stay at Caesars Palace this recent time, I have to give a shout out to my boy JR at the front desk! 

I kind of got the vibe like he was new, but he stayed relaxed and was a very nice guy. He recommended a few places to go to, and got me setup on a Total Rewards card that gave me a $10 credit for a free drink or gambling at their hotels. 

The other employees nearby also were very professional in helping their customers. 

When I stay here soon, I hope their customer service is still top notch as what it seems like.

Slightly nicer than some of the Vegas Strip Hotels, but price point indicates a level of service I did not receive.  

Upon arriving for a conference around 10:30am I proceeded to the check in line.  I waited for almost an hour before deciding to check my luggage until later in the afternoon, so I wouldnt miss linch or the first speaker.  

There was no wait at the baggage check, but the employees were pretty curt.  Whatever happened to welcome, enjoy your stay?

I came back for my luhhage around six pm.  I then proceeded to the check in line for another half hour of standing.  When I got to the front of the line I expressed my frustration about the lines.  The young man started to help me check in and midway through went over to help another employee.  He didn't acknowledge he was leaving.  He just left and came back ten or so minutes later.  It was bizarre.  He came back and gave me a room.  I went upstairs pretty much exhausted.  

Best part of the room was a bathtub with air jets.  Really, I was sad that there was no royal treatment at Caesars.  I get why Vegas isn't so much an it town these days.

My other complaint was finding long blonde hair in my room on a chair.  My hair is short and brown.  It was a little gross, but I had some handi wipes and I wasn't about to brave the check in line again.

It's a Las Vegas classic!  They are always going through some construction to expand the place and that is understandable.  The Shops at Caesars are enough to keep you broke, but hey, that's what makes it all fun right?  Don't forget to watch the shows towards the back of the casino and I think they go off every hour or so.  This casino is Greek Mythology inspired and there are a lot of statues throughout the casino.  Truly a place for photo opportunities so have your camera handy.  It is also one of the more crowded casinos I've been to so try to get there early to find parking.

WORST HOTEL ROOM I have ever stayed at. Dirty. NO hot water in either of the showers in the room!! The sink in the guest bathroom in the room was broken!!! The elevator looked like it was an elevator from a great world war... Beaten up with black smudges all over it. Additionally the room had spots all over the carpet... SO GROSS! 

Do yourself a favor and book a room anywhere else in Vegas.

We were in a big suit 2 bedroom and for 2,000$ a night you would think the suits would be up to date, and they were not. They were located in the roman towers, and although they were very roomy, they felt like I was stuck in 1999...... On the other hand we moved the next day to the 2Bedroom Agustus towers where things were much better. The rooms weren't trendy like Aria, or vdara, but it looked better. Overall 4 stars I would say. The staff were nice.

So the hotel room was lovely.  We had room in the Augustus Tower.  The beds were delightful!  The bathroom "cabinet" for the sink was showing its age with chipping edges on the wood but still a very nice set-up overall.  We had a smoking room but no ashtrays!  I called down for some and they did quickly get them up to the room for me.

But that's where the good stuff ends. Valet was full unless you were Diamond or 7 Stars. Check-in was long... really long. I attempted to the use the self-check-in but it wouldn't accept my passport or other ID.  Finally one of the self-check-in clerks came over and did something to help check me in and told me I had to go stand in the Mail and Keys line, which was close to ten people deep.  None of them bothered to mention that there was a Platinum line we could have used - it was on the far left side of check-in for those of y'all with such cards.  Our desk clerk was very kind and nice though.  Bell staff took more than an hour to bring up our bags.... and that was an hour we could have been gambling.

However when we did finally go downstairs to gamble, we couldn't find a cocktail waitress until I was in the semi-high limit slots area and there was only one there.  She was too flustered to take additional orders as her tray was full and she promised to return but didn't after 20 minutes.

I couldn't find another one anywhere.  At one of the slots, the lady next to me had a machine error and neither of us could find a slot attendant until close to 30 minutes had passed.

Not good Caesars, not good.

Stayed here for 5 nights in Feb - it was a good stay.  We were upgraded at check-in to a suite in the Palace Towers.  Single LCD TV, jacuzzi tub, 2 bathrooms with 2 toilets and a large two-person shower... awesome.

The Palace Tower is nice, although if you can get a suite in the Augustus Tower, that would be nicer for the views.  Our suite was looking at the new Octavius Tower that's almost done... surprisingly, there's not much construction noise.

Pros:
- Nice upgrade and suite 
- Great central location on the strip
- Love the Forum shops
- It's classic Caesars... yes the Wynn and the Palazzo are swankier, but there's something nice about the history here.

Cons:
- They charge for everything... wish they would provide free internet
- The fridge is filled with their items on sensor - we moved stuff aroudn for our own items and had to get the bill adjusted at the end
- Pools currently closed for renos - I suspect it'll be nice when they're done

I enjoyed it and was glad we got the upgrade after reading horror stories about the standard rooms.  Would come back again.

First review in five years of staying at Caesars Palace after leaving MGM because of Harrah's and Caesar's customer experience. On average I stay here roughly two to three times a year when I can sneak away from my life and duties of my job. Caesar's Palace is my go to vacation stay in Vegas and always  impresses me on their attention to detail in their customer service. Even though some say it is old, it is the grandest of the old school Casinos left on the strip. I ask what is wrong with an old classy regal business? I believe there is no finer hotel than Caesar's Palace. It is nearly in the center of the strip and the service is beyond reproach. What we got this last week was a magnificent Palace Tower Premium King room, whirlpool tub separate shower bathroom with marble and granite everywhere. We had a partial strip view. The room was wonderful. Our stay was wonderful. Customer service was outstanding. Staff on the Casino floor was excellent. Valet service was  excellent, we pulled pass the valet full sign and even though valet was full the staff let us leave the car until a parking place was available since we had reservations for three nights. They even called me by name even though I never volunteered it. Somewhere someone on staff knew I was a returning customer  

F.Y.I.The Palace Tower while nice, is seemingly like miles from the Strip, be prepared for a walk if staying in this tower. This hotel is huge, they give you a map at check in.

I stayed at Caesar's Palace for 8 nights to attend training and a convention. Overall my stay was very nice and enjoyable. Boy, this place is HUGE. After the 2nd day I found some shortcuts back to my tower elevators. My room was comfortable and in good repair and was cleaned very well each and everyday.

The rooms are very large and there is plenty of room to move around. My one wish would have been to have coffee in the room without having to by a "kit" for $13.00. Oh well, it wasn't missed too badly. I had a nice desk in my room for a work area and I was able to "spread out" and be productive.

The hotel staff was very responsive and cordial anytime I had contact with them. I'll definitely return to Caesar's and stay there next time I'm in Vegas.

Less than impressed. We arrived today at 9AM for a two night stay for my husbands 30th. For us, caesars was a splurge and I noted on our reservation what we were here for hoping for maybe a comp upgrade. I understood that we would be early and before check in, but figured we'd at least get a room at some point before the normal 4 PM check in. They told me I'd get a call so we went out and did some things to kill time. We ended up back in the line at 3:45 and waited in their LONG line. We got up, I told them I still had no call and was there really no rooms available. She said no and I pressed and she had to call her "inventory" line. Literally she didn't say a word to anyone on the other line and about 30 seconds later she hangs up and says "something just became available!". I mean come on. Room is decent and location is good, but other than that, not the normal fancy service and experience I would expect from a place like Caesars.

I'm pretty much done with this hotel simply because their service is atrocious.  I was upsold to the Octavius Tower.  The main reason I did it was not because it was a nicer room but rather, for the parking.  The woman at the front desk told me they had special valet parking with an entrance on Flamingo.  It had just taken me 30 minutes to go 1 1\/2 blocks on the strip, so that benefit alone was worth the upgrade.  I picked up my wife at the airport about an hour later (she had arrived that evening) and we zipped into the valet without having to deal with the strip traffic.  I was very pleased until I was told that unless I was a "Diamond" or "Seven Seas" card level, I couldn't park there.  When I informed the valet what the lady at the front desk said and why I upgraded the room, he just said sorry and when they were full that didn't apply (he then preceded to direct me to the Forum Shops valet...which is all the way down by self parking.....what's the point?!).  When I complained to their customer service, the witch on the phone said since I didn't appear to be happy with the arraignment, we could just pack our bags and move to the room we originally had.  Imagine that.  They upsell me on false pretenses, it takes me a total of 45 minutes to get back to the hotel after being redirected, and now she wants to inconvenience me more by packing up!  I let her have it and insisted on talking to a manager.  He apologized for her behavior and gave me a $75 food credit.  Might I suggest to management that if there is some stipulation on your service, you sure as hell should mention it when you're upselling someone.  I wouldn't have wasted my time or money on it if I knew it wasn't guaranteed (and your Front Desk person knew that by the comments I made to her)

As for the casino itself, the best analogy I could give is a person living in a small town and going to New York.  The place has gotten too big for it's own good (and their staff doesn't seem well equipped to deal with the traffic).  No matter where you went, it was a long walk.  Ironically, for such a huge area, their table area is rather small.  There's very little about this place that's relaxing (I usually stay at the Wynn and it's much more enjoyable).  Their new buffet, Bacchanal, has lines the size of the bigger attractions at Disneyland (it was an hour and a half wait on Saturday night).  Of course, if you were a "Diamond" or "Seven Seas" member you got to cut the line (or you could pay a $20 line pass....hilarious).  Once inside, there were still lines everywhere.  

On the day we were checking out, I had to wait 2 hours to cash a sports ticket because their computer were down.  When I went to the "special" Octavius Tower registration desk, the woman said her computers had limited access, so she couldn't print my boarding pass and directed me to the Front desk.  The woman at the Front desk seemed annoyed that I had taken her away from some paperwork (keep in mind this was at 3:30am...we had a plane at 6).  She said the concierge normally takes care of that and they weren't open until 8 so I would have to go to a "paid" kiosk by the Total Reward Center.  Again annoyed, I went back to the Octavius Registration.  There was another lady there and she said she could print my boarding pass.  After 4-5 minutes she said she couldn't find my reservation.  I told her I was sure it was right.  Somehow the woman thought my first name was my last name (not exactly a common mistake).  I truly have to wonder when this hotel hires people if the manager just puts a mirror under their nose, and if it fogs up, you're hired.  Seriously, there are a lot of brain dead people at this hotel.  They also treat anyone that isn't a "Diamond" or "Seven Seas" member like crap.  When I'm at the Wynn, they certainly roll out the carpet for their high rollers (yeah, I get it), but they treat everyone else nice also.  There's no reason why you can't do both.  I never even notice the difference in service at the Wynn and am always treated very nicely.  I don't care what kind of deal I get at this place when I go back to Vegas, I won't be staying here again.

P.S.  I was just reminded about their marketing of their "no resort fees".  If you and your partner use internet, it's a joke.  They'll make more off of you then the resorts that offer a "resort" fee.  We paid on average about $10 more per day and luckily we didn't go to the gym (yeah, that's extra also).  The "no resort fees" ploy is just a gimmick for them to make more money.

Well, started off slow due to the 20 min wait to get checked in.  They need more staff  on hand to handle the mass amount of guest checking in at 4pm.  I stayed in the Augustus tower, 36th floor with a view of the fountain's at the Bellagio.  

The room was great, wonderful jetted tub, big enough for 2. TV installed in the bathroom also so you can relax in the tub and watch a little TV.  Bathroom also has separate glass enclosed shower. Bed was very comfortable.   Honestly, the best thing about this room was the view.   

The casino floor is HUGE,  one of the largest I have seen in Vegas.  There are restaurants scattered all over the casino floor and  the Forum shoppes.

Service other than when I checked it was great.

I have to caveat this review with the fact that I was very jet lagged when I visited Caesars and by the time I left, very very drunk.  As such the details are hazy and the names have been changed as I can't remember them.

This was the first casino we hit (besides our Hotel) and so I wasn't quite sure what to expect - in general I wasn't overwhelmed and it didn't come across as being particularly classy.  The bar staff were very friendly as where the dealers and waitress staff at the Blackjack table I spent the evening at.  They took full advantage of my willingness to drink their free beer and in that respect I felt slightly violated.  Not always a bad thing.

I had the New Your Strip at the Mesa restaurant which I recall being very good , but being as that was about the last thing I remember before waking up back at my hotel it's too be taken with a pinch of salt...

This property is very sprawled out.  It has a prime location on center strip, and the place has gone through many changes over the years.  I personally like the Forum Shops the best, and I usually eat at The Palm whenever I am in town.  They have a good mix of vintage Las Vegas, which is evident when you first enter the casino.

I would give it a better rating but I had an incident in this hotel once.  It ended up ok.  The statute of limitations has long since run out.  I am innocent, of course.  Mums the word.

Very pleased with my stay here.  Was here with a large group of friends for my buddies birthday.  The rooms were perfect, service perfect, and prices though high were reasonable for the nice service and luxurious accommodations.  I found the casino as fair as a casino could be and relatively clean.  

If I could change one thing in casinos it would be the cigarette smoke.  A casino should be built for non-smokers and I bet it would do just as well.  I enjoyed the indoor mall and some of the restaurants.  Thank you Caesar for the excellent weekend :)

We stayed in Caesars Palace on August 2014 for 2 days. We stayed in the Palace tower premium room with king bed (previously known as petite suite). In summary, we were very pleased with the entire experience.

Parking:
It is true!! Caesars Palace parking is quite big and very far from the main lobby, and even further away from the room you will end up staying. It will be much better to do vallet parking. 

Check-in:
We checked in on Friday, so the line was quite long. However, they managed to take care everybody somewhat quick (under 30 min). They also offered us (and other customers) water while waiting to be served. The front desk was very friendly.

Bathroom:
Our bathroom was impressive. We had 2 sides of bathroom (supposedly, one for him and one for her), 2 toilet (one is regular... presumably for him, and one is accompanied with a bidet). One side of the bathroom has Jacuzzi bubble tub where you can relax yourself while getting bubble massage.

Bedroom:
The room decor was quite nice. Room area is spotless. Carpet was clean and vibrant. The king bed was very comfortable. Definitely, one of the most comfortable beds we've ever slept on. Our room was facing the pool. Thus, the window view is quite spectacular.

One thing that caught my attention was how friendly the staff is..... from the front desk, room keeper, bellboy, etc. We definitely put Caesars Palace on our favorite Vegas hotel. It's Caesars Palace, you should not expect anything less.

Go to Vegas 3-4 times a year and stayed At most of the hotels on the strip except for caesars palace.
Always liked the forum shops so decided to stay this time.  I booked 2 rooms for myself and family members.
What a mistake, very disappointed in customer service since the front desk people are rude.
The valet parking was full.  You would think they would save space for guests at the hotel.
After a late night drinking and gambling I like to make the usual complementary in room coffee.
I've stayed in some crappy hotels before and they have coffee. 
It may be minor to some but Caesars has Keurig coffee makers in the rooms, get this they don't provide the coffee, you have to order it from room service (for a charge). Why wouldn't you order a cup of coffee.

I'll never stay at Caesars again , their competition can provide better customer service.

Stayed at Caesars for the Gartner IAM Summit. It is spectacular. I have never been there before, but I will be back. Luxurious, outstanding shopping, tons of food choices, amazing spa and fitness center. I do not gamble so all of these other things are important to me. Had it been warmer I would have spent time by the one of the many gorgeous pools. My room was so nice and the bed very comfortable. Loved the shower!

Very disappointed. The hotel is too big. They simply ignore customers requests. 

* We wanted to simply have 3 rooms on the same floor. However no matter how hard we tried multiple times in advance- we even did the pre-registration at the hotel in the morning, they repeatedly ignored our requests. They promized us in the morning, but they did nothing to reserve rooms for the same floor. At the end, when we waited until 3pm to pick up the keys, they simply gave us 3 random rooms on different floors!

** The lady at the bell desk was very rude. She would not listen to complaints about the hotel. She yelled back at customers! she did not realize that complaints were about the hotel, nothing to do with herself. She needs to learn about customer cares and responsibilities.

#1150 review written up for www.yelp.com- woo-hoo!

On the parking garage- FREE parking but yes, it is crowded, especially on the weekeds- Tip: park on the roof for a nice view of The Strip (take that selfie). 

On the Forum Shops- since the expansion; another wing of three floors of stores was added. It's huge! And navigation is sometimes tricky, you gotta use the elevator for access to certain floors. Or the escalators, on that note. Some of the STORES include: Sony (the only one in Las Vegas), Burberry, Christian Dior. Dolce & Gabbana, Fendi, Gianni Versace, Gucci, Hublot, Louis Vuitton, Salvatore Ferragamo, Tiffany & Co., Valentino. I can't list them all, or else I'd run out of space!

Lots of restaurants in the casino (kind of past the parking garage elevator entrance\/exit into the casino, it's elevated) and in the Forum Shops, DINING includes: Beijing Noodle No. 9, Bradley Ogden, Central by Michel Richard, Cypress Street Marketplace, Empress Court, Hyakumi, Lago Buffet, Mesa Grill, Munchbar, NOBU Restaurant, Old Homestead Steakhouse, Payard Pãtisserie & Bistro, Raos, Restaurant Guy Savoy, Serendipity 3.

Pools- there are six of them, including the Venus pool

Some example of past Entertainment: elton john, absinthe (variety show), matt goss, jerry seinfeld (comedy), celine dion (recently cancelled residency, or postponed it), rod stewart, shania twain, russell peters (comedy), jeff dunham (comedy)

On the casino decor and theme, it's changed over the years. I liked the themes back in the day (referring to most of the casinos on the Strip as well), but seems like the new direction is what my husband calls "Yuppie." Same thing with the cocktail waitress outfits, those have evolved too. I used to party at Cleopatra's Barge where local music lounge groups performed such as Jonathan & Music Magic (which was a hotspot for hookers back in the 1990s). Am I dating myself? Uh-oh! Another thing, not sure, if I saw it the last time we came here, but there used to be a man and a woman wearing costumes at the entrance of the Forum Shops; tourists could take pictures with them; I have some of those pics somewhere. On the casino size, seems a little small, especially in comparison with the shopping part of the property.
Wonder, overall, if this property being featured in "The Hangover" gave it more exposure.    

I used to come here whenever visitors from out of town would want to see the Strip and\/or walk around. And you know what? My family and I still come here to check it out from time to time  too (though it's not as often). One time we ran into a past co-worker of my husband's, who is now a police officer. Typical Vegas, you have to expect bumping into someone you know.

Went to Caesars to celebrate my husband's birthday and I thought CP would be a great place to spend that vacation and a great way to bring in the party.  I loved it!!! We stayed in the Augustus towers and we were super glad we did.  We loved the closeness of the Augustus towers first of all as it was very easy to to drop in and out without having to walk all over the place.  While the other towers were nearby, Augustus was the way to go.  The location on the strip is great and we were certainly excited we chose this place.  It also helps that those nights are included for SPG members as well.  We arrived and were checked in very quickly.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating to us and we got a great vibe from them.  Our room was ready and we had a high floor - that was a great upgrade.  The rooms in the Augustus were really big and I was happy that my money went to a great sized room.  We had so much space for my stuff.  The resort itself is well taken care of and since our family were also staying at Caesars this made it perfect.  The amenities were excellent and the housekeeping did an amazing job at taking our requests for when it came to cleaning the rooms.  Seeing as we were in the desert I was really wishing I had brought a humidifier because the air is SO DRY there.  I didn't experience that at one of the other hotels I stayed at last year.

My husband and I were able to go to the Bacchanal buffet and enjoyed our breakfast and brunch there along with trying some of the other restaurants such as Rao's and Spago (Spago was terrible by the way, but it's not officially part of "Caesars", and Mesa"  Everything was clean and flawless and really want to come back and stay at Caesars again due to our amazing experience when we were there.  Thanks to CP for making my husband's birthday celebrations memorable.

We have been here before and liked our stay. This time we purchased a pool Cabana, only to find the jacuzzi was inoperable.  The cost of drinks far outweighs the accommodations. Not sure I'll be returning.

OK, I will admit, I am not a big fan of Vegas. The smoking and gambling is not my scene and I find most of the hotels over the top and kitschy. I do like the shows and love the restaurants. 

One of the hotels that I have always enjoyed coming to is Caesars. It is kitschy too but maybe it is because it was one of the hotels that left an impression on me when I came here when I was much younger and it makes me nostalgic. Also helps that not everything smells of smoke.

Four stars for a free upgrade to a fat suite because our room wasn't ready in time.

One star for the jacuzzi tub.

One star for the amazing four fauceted shower (massage functions, baby)!

And two stars for the flat screen TV built INTO the bathroom mirror.

Sweet!

You know the Total Rewards card\/membership they're always promoting as having so many amazing benefits? Not even close. Platinum tier might as well be aluminum. I have no idea why we even stand in the "platinum line" for anything, because there is absolutely no benefit. Having a problem with your room, like renovation construction noise at (almost) 8 a.m.? With platinum tier Total Rewards, you can be told by reception that you're lucky, because it usually starts at 7! And no, there is no solution. None. You must listen to constant hammering and drilling from 7 a.m. until whenever you give up on sleep. Luckily Las Vegas is so quiet and conservative that everyone goes to bed by 10 p. m., so being awoken at the break of dawn is no problem. 

When we asked the Total Rewards representative if there were any spa deals at platinum level, she said, "At PLATINUM level??? Noooooo...". I mean, if you're going to maintain the pretense that this tier system even means anything, at least train your reps on having a poker face? Or maybe just eliminate all tiers that are not Seven Star or Diamond? Either way, I'll stop using this card and exclusively use the Amazon card, where I can actually see the benefit of my points. And they have excellent customer service.

I am sad to say i wont be back Caesars. We have stayed there more than three times and this was the first poor experience. Our room was very nice with beautiful showers and comfy bed but that is an expectation with any room at almost 250 a night. My issue is there was no customer service. Our stays in the past all had amazing views of the strip and un relenting customer service. This trip had a view of air conditioning units and another balcony fifty feet away. When speaking with the desk they offered 25 dollar credit to a restaurant we would never attend. If customer service is what you looking for "move on" because Caesar palace has lost its focus on who they serve.

Horrible is right!  I would never NEVER use my own money to stay at this hotel!
Rooms are filthy. Plumbing is a mess. Housekeeping didn't even change linens on the bed between me and the previous male guest. Gave me a $30 credit to make up for it. How do I know it was a male?  Because I had to change rooms because there were significant leaks in both sinks and the hot tub faucets. They called me in the new room (which had leaks in both sinks and the shower drain was clogged) and asked if I found his shirt he left behind. Went to dinner at Rao's and had to send my steak back.  Filet mignon tasted 'gamey' - the chef and my dinner partner agreed (I'm not one to ever send food back - my kids work\/worked in the industry - but the fact they credited the steak was supposed to be enough. Room service staff were terrific. Food was okay. Called to remove my cart and they never came till next afternoon. 
New room a bit , but not much cleaner. Layer of dust on the dresser. Not sure room had been used in months.  Safe didn't work. TV kept cutting out. 
Gym doesn't open until 6am and then there is a 2 part check in process to get a workout.  I thought this city never sleeps??  Seems like they are trying to make people sleep since I had to go to 4 different coffee places (all closed) at 5:30 in the morning before I had to go down the block to Starbucks.  Front desk couldn't even tell me that the one Starbucks near the gym was open at 5:30.  The service there is lackadaisical at best. Cashier is sweet, barista is unconcerned with speed. Took 5 minutes to make my latte and mine was the only one - reason?  She walked away after starting it.  Cashier noticed and finished it for me.  And DON'T get me started on the smoke and lack of ventilation.  EVERY square inch of this hotel leaves you gasping for fresh air.  50 Years OLD is right!  I didn't even comment on everything I could have.  Maybe they should implode Caesars and start over.   Was here for work not vacation, but travel a lot for work, in Vegas and elsewhere. This by far worst experience in 15 years.

After all these years, Caesar's Palace is still an awesome hotel\/casino and a "Must Visit" for anyone taking a trip to Las Vegas. The entire hotel and casino is stunningly beautiful and the decor is just gorgeous. The hotel is also located near the middle of the Las Vegas Strip, which makes getting to other hotels\/casinos very easy.

The Forum Shops are a real treat. Walking through was essentially is an indoor mall,  they have the ceiling painted to look like the sky. Paired with replica of the Trevi fountain, you've given the impression that you're shopping outdoors in Rome during the late afternoon.

At the far end of the Forum Shops, they have a large fountain that doubles as a fish aquarium. The statues in the fountain also come to life periodically throughout the day to provide guests with an awesome free show. (Note: at the time of this review, the Atlantis show has been closed due to remodeling\/upgrading. It's scheduled to be back in October 2013)

Besides the large casino and very nice shops & restaurants, Caeser's Palace also offers shows by big-name entertainers such as Celine Dion, Luis Miguel, and Elton John.

The room rates are quite expensive from my experiences and it's the sole reason I have to knock-off one star from my Yelp rating.

My advice... stay at a cheaper hotel on the Strip, but make sure you pay a visit to Caesar's Palace.

This isn't the real Caesars Palace, but it IS pager friendly! (I was trying to make a funny about The Hangover if you haven't watched it!)

We were able to get a room here for 2 nights using our Total Rewards comps which was pretty sweet. The good thing about Caesars is that there are different levels of rooms\/suites within one hotel to fit a variety of price ranges. (There's a $40K\/night villa!) Depending on where your room is situation, you *may* get a view of the Bellagio Fountains!

The hotel is H-U-G-E and you're definitely going to hit your FitBit\/Apple Watch step count goals here every day just by staying inside the hotel!  In addition to a large amount of table games and slot machines in their casino, they also have a wonderful spa (see my review for Qua Baths and Spa), several towers for rooms and suites, tons of restaurants, and a great shopping area called The Forum with a good mix of mid-to-high-end shops. Additionally, there's a bridge attached to the hotel that connects you to the Bellagio and to go across the street to The Flamingo.

Our room was located in the Forum Towers. For a regular room (vs. a suite), it was pretty spacious, the bed was comfortable, and the pillows were fluffy. The bathroom is stocked with Qua products (same brand that their spa uses). My only complaint is that the shower because it was lukewarm at 10AM and even though I put it at the max heat, it never got as warm as I wanted it to be.

Stayed at Caesar's Palace a few years back and actually enjoyed it.  I don't know what's happened since.  Most hotels on the strip had a pretty good filter which filters off the cigarette smoke.  I walked into Caesars and I was blown away by how it smelled.  I understand that smoking is allowed but I really think Caesar needs to step up their game when competing with hotels like Bellagio, Wynn, Encore, Aria, etc.  

On the side note: I'm starting to see LOTS of footprints on the parking lot ceilings which leads me to the conclusion that this place is heading towards Circus Circus status. Just saying.

I love Caesars.  Both times I stayed here my rooms were fabulous (one time comped, one time a great deal)...roomy, great bathrooms, and this time we had a great view of the pools and also of the Bellagio fountains.  The concierge also was amazing, she hooked some sistas up.  I will definitely stay here again, hopefully sooner than later!

update: was in Vegas for Memorial Day, and though we were staying elsewhere, we went to the pool at Caesar's--it was awesome.  Friendly, sociable crowd, good male-female ratio, and the area itself was really pretty.  If you are into European style beaches (e.g. topless), they have a pool for that too (we didn't check that out).
I also love playing the slots here.  I don't know what it is about Caesar's, but I just love the whole place!

I love vegas even though I do not gamble much but I go with my girlfriend and we have so much fun. I have been to Vargas many time and mostly we stay here because of their Spa "qua", sooo good.
I really like the restaurant variety even though we have been disappointed with the Mr. Chow restaurant. Room are descent and you can upgrade which I do often since the room is the most important to me. The only thing is I wish they supply you coffee pods. They have the coffee maker but you have to buy the coffee. 
Self Parking is easy and abundant. And all the receptionists are very friendly.
this is the second hotel i love in vegas.. love the rooms, and the amenities.. will definitely comeback here.

Definitely the best hotel I've stayed in Vegas. It's beautiful inside, the rooms are great, the casino is nice and big, and best of all they allow dogs to stay here :) They have a ton of restaurants and shops inside (Forum Shops). I never get bored here, there's a lot to do without having to leave the hotel.

My bff & I Stayed at Caesars during this past Fight Weekend (Yes, Mayweather won!!) Tom in Guest Services really made our weekend!! Great room, view (fyi our selfies were on point!), convo overall a great experience. From the time I checked in to check out I can say this was one of my more memorial time in Vegas (oh I'm a regular too :)  Front desk has the potential to making or ruining guest vaca, yall set the tone! But Tom...You Tha Man!!

Caesars Place oh how nice it must be to be able to stay at this location? I only get to come pretend that I live the high life when I want to see a top notch show or have a good meal.  Of the 5-6 times I've been here in the past 18 months I've only been able to use their valet once (its always full).  The parking structure always have spaces but you have to search a long while desperately waiting till someone pulls out to get in.  (send yourself a text so you don't forget where you left your vehicle)  Just be prepared and add a good 45 mins into your plans to find parking if you are coming down. 

I've been to three different shows here, spent time on the casino floor, in the bars\/restaurants, shops and have loved every minute of it.  Whether you want a 50k watch or a $50 t-shirt you can find it all in and around this lap of luxury just be prepared to pay for it.  I know it sounds like I'm complaining but trust me its nice not to have to worry about the haggard freaks you see on the strip and I'm more than willing to pay a few dollar more in order to enjoy some time with people who are dressed nice, smell good and still have a sense of class about them.

We stayed here over the weekend and had a great time overall.

Room: We had a room on the 69th floor in the Forum Tower. It needs to be renovated as the tables and dressers were clearly worn down and used. The automatic shade openers did not work. The wall paper was peeling away in some spots. We had no access to the refrigerators even after asking a few times being as they were locked for some reason. The shower and faucet would cut out for a few seconds sometimes.

Casino Floor: The blackjack and roulette dealers were top notch! Talkative and quick with dealing.

Pool: We had a cabana and some lounge chairs for the day. The service was excellent and the atmosphere was top notch.

The rooms here are pretty nice, especially the ones with the jacuzzi tubs.  I hate to be shallow but they need to hire some younger cocktail waitresses.  I totally commend them for keeping their loyal employees around but it's just totally wrong to see a 60-70 year old woman in a skimpy cocktail outfit.  It's even worse when they can't remember what you ordered 10 seconds after u ordered.

Was attending a conference in January for which my plan changed-still working it out with billing department as I was charged fees even though I canceled. No response from their "customer" service department.  With all the choices available in the area-can they afford to be so cavalier?

You are showing your age ...ungracefully!!!

The rooms in the Augustus Tower continue to be amazing.   However....as diamond members of TRW.   

Why did you downgrade our coffee service to only WHITE sugar????

Where's our good, real honey?    And when we asked for RAW sugar.  We're told all you offer is real sugar.   HELLO.  White sugar is NOT real.  It's processed with bleach.  

And standing at any gambling tabke....it takes 30 minutes for a waitstaff to appear.   And when they do.  They are old, tired and not excited about taking care of us.  

Have you surveyed your floors?!?   Do it.  You will see the lack of excitement and enthusiasm.    

Why should we be excited about spending money on your casino if your staff isn't excited to see us?!??

This hotel is TERRIBLE!!!!! Crappy room, terrible customer service and upon checkout it took them almost 45 minutes to bring us our car!!! We come to Vegas once a month and love trying new places, this is the worst place we have stayed on the strip. We will never stay here again.

To be honest, I had really unpleasant experiences at Caesars Palace. I travel frequently in Las Vegas. And this was my first time staying in Caesars palace. I usually stayed hotel at Venetian and Wynn. Yesterday I moved from Venetian to Caesars just for experiencing a new atmosphere; however, I was so disappointed! I really didn't want to compare Caesars with Venetian but I spontaneously will make judgements. I booked this hotel one and half month ago with the same price at Venetian which was $195. First of all, the light bulb in my bathroom was broken so I had to dial someone to fix this problem. Of course the room was old and even didn't possess enough chairs for customers to relax. Moreover, the sheets was not comfortable at all. Fortunately, I was provided with a coffee maker which is better than Venetian. The really unpleasant moment created when I checked out just now. I was required to pay attritional 20 dollars 24 hour block fee. I asked one of the assistant and she explained this fee was charged for additional devices to link wifi. I was not really cared about paying these 20 dollars, I was mad because there was no obvious or clean direction to inform me that the resourt fee only cover the wifi for 2 electronic devices! I have unlimited date why I had to pay additional money to use wifi in this hotel?! Moreover, Caesars are encouraging customers check in and check out by themselves with machine, I understand the hotel arrange someone to assist customers. The reason why encourage customers to check in and out is to save time and make it goes more effiecntly, and to save labor cost. In this situation, why hotel cannot arrange enough staff to work at the entrance door for example for valet parking or serves. In addition there is no seating area for customers to seat while they are waiting Valets to pull out the cars. And the serves I asked for information adopted an arrogant attitude, treated me like someone who was not capable of speaking English. I tried my best to not upgrade this issue to a racial  discrimination problem. However, I was really mad. The hotel Paris that I had stayed in two years ago was even better than Caesars, and we all know these two hotels have the similar price! Due to this bad expericences at Caesars, I will never ever stay in this hotel; moreover, I will also inform my friends and colleagues not to come to this hotel. I really hope that Caesars hotel will wisely deal with my issue and put effort into improving a better hotel.
I didn't actually stay here so I'm not going to give it a five, but Caesars Palace is really beautiful. The Trevi bar is amazing and I love their Bath and Body Works.

Beautiful hotel but the elevators in the Augustus tower weren't working well the whole time we were there and the price gouging is out of control. No free coffee, no free WiFi, even the coffee shop was 75.00 for breakfast. The Alto bar had the worst service I have ever encountered.  No bar service at the tables and we were there 3 times.  We sat amidst trash on tables that hadn't been bussed and kept having to go up to the bar to order drinks. I expected better from an iconic hotel such as Caesars

Classic Vegas, but it doesn't feel outdated at all. This is one of the biggest resorts along the Strip and it is REALLY easy to get lost in here. Stay with your party or you'll have a hard time finding them later on. I mean, this resort is epic. I would love to stay here sometime. It keeps its theme up pretty well. Definitely the forerunner for a lot of the newer resorts in terms of theme, shopping, decor, and general atmosphere. (I'm looking at you, Venetian.) If you visit Vegas, you have to take a stroll in here, HAVE to.
$300 hotel room and shower and sinks don't drain.  All the glitz is on the outside and the rooms are old and in need of repair.  Our bathroom has mold around baseboard.
Bar service is pretty stuck up and very rude if you don't have ID in hand

We stayed here for three nights in July.  We booked a room in the Fortuna Tower since we were sharing a room with another couple.  When we arrived, we were upgraded to the Augustus Tower and I have to say that our room was great!  It was HUGE for a hotel room -- especially in Vegas -- and we had a fabulous view of the mountains the pools!  

I love Caesar's because it is WAY over the top (just like most everything else in Vegas!), it is centrally located on the strip, and it has pretty much everything you could want in one place.  I love the shopping, the restaurants, and the pools.  

While Caesar's is somewhat more expensive than other Vegas hotels, it is definitely worth the price to me.  To have so many restaurant options available is fantastic.  I love the food court option too as it is a little less expensive and it allows you to watch the action on the casino floor while you eat.  Fun!  

The group we were with was not really interested in high stakes gambling, so we mostly stuck with slot machines here.  We did it for the drinks, mostly, and I have to say that for free drinks they were really, really, really strong.  

Another reason we chose to stay at Caesar's was for the pools.  We spent a couple of days floating in the water while having the friendly waitresses bring us drinks.  It was heavenly!  The food they serve is typical bar food, but it hits the spot after a long day in the sun.

So, the room was clean, the staff was friendly, the pools were great, the shopping is excellent, and the restaurants were wonderful.  All in all, Caesar's in heaven in Vegas.

Very nice hotel.  We got a suite overlooking the Bellagio fountain.  Our hair dryer was broken but they sent someone up right away to replace it.  The bathroom is super nice.  Bed is comfie. 
The furniture is high end and comfie.  The in-room snacks are very expensive.  It's like $5 for a bottle water and $7 for small bag of nuts.....yeah didn't buy any of that.  Again, hooked up because our friend is a diamond member.

My hubby and I celebrated my 27th birthday in what I considered "style".  I'm a bit high maintenance at times when it comes to hotels and if we were going to do Vegas, I wanted to do it on the strip, in a perfect location in an upscale hotel.

We took a cab from the airport and headed down the strip to the hotel...little did I know it took up like four city blocks! I was THRILLED.  I've always had a thing for Greece and Italy, so this hotel seemed fitting.  I was in awe ...considering this was my first trip! :) 

Upon arriving, I took photos of everything from the lobby to the casino...I thought it was gorgeous...was it crowded, yes!  Was it overdramatic, of course! Was it Vegas?  DEFINITELY! 

We pulled the "$20 Trick" by placing a $20 under our CC (thanks Sarah G.!!) and telling her about my birthday.  She upgraded us from a standard room to a junior suite with a Jacuzzi.  It had ZERO view, but I loooove Jacuzzi bathtubs, so the view was pointless. :) I was thrilled!!

What I was not perfectly thrilled with was the kids...they were freakin' EVERYWHERE...and there is a Pussy Cats Doll bar in the middle of the hotel that boasts girls dancing in cages OUTSIDE the door, so...hope your 5 year old enjoyed that show!

The casino was a bit out of our price range, so we opted to gamble in other hotels, but I really loved our room, the service was good.  There were tons of nightclub options all within walking distance INSIDE the hotel (which I thought was great) and plenty of entertainment without stepping foot into the 100 degree weather!  

I won't stay here again, only b\/c it was SO expensive and we didn't really spend enough time in our room to justify it, but it was a great experience and I would recommend it if you don't mind shelling out the dough but be sure, you LOVE big hotels b\/c you can get lost up in this joint!

Definitely gone downhill in the last few years. Bell desk is an absolute nightmare. Took us 15 minutes to get our luggage on a quite Monday morning. Two bell hops were just standing around. 
Service is clearly not their priority anymore. 

The Venitian is literally across the road! Peace out Palace....
One Of The Best Hotel On The Strip! Great Service. And Loved My Stay There! Thanks For My Upgrade Two Room Suit. Can't Wait To Come Back Again!!!

Always extravagant
Always a pleasure
I love the ambiance at this casino\/hotel
It's a must visit every time I go to Vegas.
The Atlantis Forum is a nice, short show to watch as you grab a drink to begin your evening. 
The shopping is fantastic to satisfy the shopaholic's desires. And the casino area is over The top with high ceilings and countless slot machines to black jack tables.
A must visit spot

Love this hotel! Rooms are gorgeous, bathroom is monstrous with a whirlpool tub and a tv in the bathroom (what?). Pretty easy to navigate once you do a couple laps. 

The only downside, is the mini bar is pressure sensitive, so if you accidentally touch one of the items in the fridge or on top, you bought it, even if you don't consume it. Also, there's a coffee pot in the room, but you have to pay for the coffee so bring k cups with you. 

Other than that, love it!

We enjoyed staying at CP on my BD week in Vegas this time. We stayed in at Bellagio last time for the fountain view but it was nothing really special other than the fountain view. It took so long to even check in so, this time, we decided to give the CP a try and see the experience. We are glad we did. We did the online check on arrival date so, it was quicker and easier to just pick up the key. The staff was also very nice and honored with the best view room available in our prepaid price range for my special BD trip. We reserved the Augustus Strip View Room where we can see all Bellagio fountain, Paris, Cosmo pretty much all the beautiful Strip view. I recommend going through their main website to book the rooms to have the best deal. Sign up for their rewards program free and book it. Trust me, It's way cheaper and you get the best room available rather than booking those third party Web which they never take any responsibility if there's any problem with your reservation. If you book directly through the hotel website, it's always easier to change the room, upgrade or whatever you need. They have different elevators section depending on where you room is so, it's always nice and easy access in and out. We enjoyed their famous Bacchanal Buffet which was pretty much free because we got the dining coupon back when we reserved our room directly through their Web. I really liked our room. It was very clean, nice, cool, fresh, modern bathroom decor with the nice big Jacuzzi hot tub, 2 big, comfy couches by the big window for the nice Strip view. It has a good space for our 2 large luggage and other stuffs too. You can also enjoy the big swimming pool free as a hotel guest in the day time but there was more elderly people so, it was kinda quiet and good for relaxation. You will have to go to the other pool party if you are type of a party people. Most of all we enjoyed our stay at CP cuz it was all good, nice buffet, nice atmosphere dining place and night club, fun time at casino, easy access to go anywhere on the strip. It's totally worth it for the price we paid more than any other hotel rooms in Vegas! Most importantly, it was a heaven for me as a shopaholic. The forum shops are right there, the Bellagio shopping place just right across the bridge and take a trams to Crystal or other shopping places wherever you wanna go easily. I would recommend to everyone I know and definitely staying in at this hotel again!

Staying here for work for a week and enjoying the stay so far. Not in the room too much but is roomy and my view is of the strip so not bad.  Outside my window it looks like it could be a balcony but it's not.  Would be cool.
