I am sure there are much nicer rooms at Caesars - we just didn't have one. Probably wouldn't stay here again with all the other good deals that are available on the strip. Regardless I moved down to Mandalay Bay, while far off the strip had very comfortable accommodations.

Excellent stay! Our room was immaculate upon check-in. We've stayed in this hotel 3 times and have not been disappointed! It's in the middle of all of the action on the strip.  
Our room was in the Julius Tower which was recently renovated & decorated nicely! Very surprised since the last hotel we stayed at was  the Wynn, which is showing its age! 
The buffet is phenomenal & there's even a French bakery, Payard Patisserie & Bistro. 
The rooms have coffee makers which makes a huge difference when you want to start your day off right.
The pool is gorgeous and its  a nice place to cool off.
Definitely recommend it to anyone coming to Vegas!
The checkin here always lags. Three people at the desk with 100 waiting to get registered and pick up room keys. Omg.

Two stars are only to acknowledge that our room was generally nice. A lot of buts come with that, though. We arrived at 8:00 PM with 9:00 PM reservations at Mesa Grill and finally got to restaurant at 10:00. Why?  Because there were only 2 desk clerks at reservation\/check in and each line had around 6-8 waiting and their check in process for each took longer than I have ever experienced. It was a joke. Clerk did upgrade but an upgrade on a room I spent almost longer checking in than in the room is not great solace. Then we find a little coffee maker but coffee itself costs $13.00 for a couple of Keurig capsules, the same price as a handful of M&M's conveniently located on top of the desk for those late night munchies. Then you find the only soft drink machine you really have to explore to find is completely empty. The bed was nice for the few hours we got use it but adding insult to injury we find a $32.00 "mandatory resort fee" added to the bill. All we did is sleep. Caesar's you can at least be honest enough to call it what it is a higher room charge, even if you cannot have enough clerks at check in desk.

The hotel has aged. I call this place $30. Reason being is they give you a good rate then charge for everything else. They tried to charge us for a chair by the pool, a baby bassinet which they called a crib, ice water and even a movie we did not watch. If you have a couple of extra dollars stay away. Ohh the worst part they have a bunch of middle eastern sales staff at the shops who try to lure you in to the shops.

We stayed for a bachelorette party and they gave us 10 keys for the 2 rooms.  The beds were comfotable, the bathrooms were easily shared, especially with a tv for us to watch E Celebrities on, and the service was decent.  The only thing was it took them 2 hours to fix our door lock which had low battery.  Afterwards, they ended up wiping out all 10 keys which had to be redone.  For the inconvenience of having us start our Friday night a bit later, they gave us $100 to spend in the hotel.

Do not stay here.  We paid a premium price compared to other hotels on the strip to stay in the Roman Tower and felt it was a rip-off.  Please read all the reviews, as I read them only after the fact to find out they are very true.

Check-in was very slow with only a couple people working and lines that were very long.  Customer service was horrible elsewhere too.  Example one, the people in the adjoining room to us were yelling, playing VERY loud club music, and smoking weed all night on multiple nights and Caesars could not help us out (could not move our room, could not get it to stop).  Example two, I heard a dealer tell a customer who walked away from a table without tipping say "hey, your not the only one with a family to feed." Really...really!?

Roman tower is a has been of the strip.  The rooms look like they were high end 30 years ago, but haven't been touched since then.  The pics will help to tell the story, but two name a few turn offs about the room:  the toiliet would not stop running unless you played with the handle, the shower had mold growing on the wall, the bed had no headboard, furniture was all dinged up, carpet was so old that it bubbled up when you rolled a suitcase on it, overall it seemed dirty with some sort of splatter on the ceiling, and don't get me started on the jetted tub....NASTY!

I do not recommend the forum Tower rooms at all very beat up and dated and doesn't feel clean. My feet stuck to the floor in the bathroom and I had to have housekeeping come up and re-clean and I still I'm totally grossed out , Hotel refuses to change my room and I am stuck with this 70s nightmare for two more nights and don't even feel comfortable enough to unpack my things . At over $300 a night with all the fees this is the biggest waste of your money you'll ever spend do not do it!!!!!!!!! In addition the check-in is an absolute disaster nightmare. The kiosks are difficult to use and after you do get them to work you never get an email when your room is ready, they charge you $30 for it on top of it complete rip off !!!!!!! people that show up after you get rooms immediately! They have the audacity to charge for parking. For years I always dreamed of staying at Caesars, seriously the biggest disappointment ever!!!!!!  run for the hills do not book i!!!!  Unfortunately I'm stuck here for another two nights Thabk God I did not book the extra two nights after my conference which they wanted to charge me almost $400 for a night.  I will be changing hotels to a quality level appropriate with the charge, again do not waste your money here!!!!!!! Biggest disappointment ever waited years to stay here and it's been nothing but an awful experience!!!!!!!!

I've stayed here twice and think it's okay. The beds are comfy and it's close to everything! There are lots of restaurants and a shopping mall on site. I feel like the rooms could be better, but it wasn't too bad. Caesars is super busy and super crowded. Be prepared because it will impact your stay. We like it for the most part but want to advise that there are trade-offs. Good luck!

I'm husband and I did not stay at the Caesars hotel; however, we did go to the casino and it was amazing. Slots seemed loose and we did make a few extra hundred bucks. 

My husband played on the roulette tables and we had Lew as our dealer and he was absolutely hilariously. One of my favorite dealers who made the experience worthwhile. 

I absolutely would recommend playing at this casino. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I will absolutely consider staying at this hotel on my future visit.

Lousy accommodations for vegas. I came here for business and was let down from the beginning. Front desk help was no help at all, room decor was below average. The beds were not comfortable and management doesn't seem to care. Overall there are many choices of hotel in Las Vegas, this one will not be an option for my next trip.

Worst hotel I have ever stayed at in the context of customer orientation. 12$ for coffee pods in the room; 25$ for fitness center!!!??? Unbelievable in this day and age that Las Vegas in spite of such high volume of tourism still allows such atrocities by the hotels.  On top of it the hotel has become old and the hallways are stinky by the stores. Never will I stay here again.

thanks and would like to rate you at 4 star not 5 star because of resort fees and valet parking fees. i rate palazzo 5 star because they don't charge none of that none sense. i have stay at cesar for years and surprise now they charge these kind of fees, i feel like when i go to the store buying hundreds of dollar of stuff and the store charge me 10$ cent extra for a bags. this is why i can only gave you 4 star, the room this time i stay was the small less room i ever had when i stay at cesar. very unhappy.
I've been an regular customer of this amazing hotel. Highly recommend coming here as the staff are so nice, friendly and they go out of their way for you.

I normally like this place because it is a free room but this time I'm less than impressed even for free. They lost my reservation and it took them about 30 minutes at the front desk after I showed them my confirmation to find a room. The next day the keys to get in stopped working and I had to wait about 45 minutes for security to show up. Everything about this place has been an inconvenience except the price and location.
slip the front desk a $20 and get a free upgrade!

My personal favorite in Vegas these days. My opinion only after 20 years of Vegas visits and watching the city change - I no longer come here to walk the Strip or look for a cheap deal since that doesn't really exist anymore. Everything is pricey. Slots no longer pay out when full. Basic table game minimums are high even on off times of the year.That being said, if you can spend some money for a good resort and do not want to go elsewhere this may be what you want. Pool is great in season,good food options and the mall is a nice walk every time regardless of the fact I cannot afford most of the stores . All hotels charge a daily resort fee these days even if you do not partake of their services. This place has always been a stop on my 50 plus ( no joke) trips to Vegas

THE WORST BUFFET in VEGAS
Is our family vacation here in vegas and we are doing BUFFET hoping - we tried 4 BUFFET (it makes us pro on buffet taste and price).
First we call the hotel asking how much for the buffet for that night and they say $27 per person and they confirm with on special pricing even though is Christmas Eve. BUT when we got there, they have SPECIAL CHRISTMAS dinner buffet for $37 which $10 MORE than their regular price. 
Well we finally decide to eat here anyway since the traffic is a mad house on the strip. 
Now the food:
THE only thing they call it special is 
1. seafood platter (they serve NOT all you can eat style) - skinny crab FROZEN leg, shrimp WITH SKIN - very lame and oyster (but you have to ask if not they will not give it to you).
2. cheap champagne which taste not like champagne.

The food quality is so so so bad - even the strawberry dip in chocolate.
The short ribs are burn and SUPER DRY.

Just pure awful. If you want nice buffet go to ARIA hotel or M resort (bit further but cheap $15) or Wynn hotel. 

WILL NEVER GO BACK to in this HOTEL BUFFET ever again. EVER

First off, I just wanna say this was my first time going to Vegas. So with lots of good ratings from friends, I decided to give it a try.

The first night I shared room with a friend and it was located in the forum tower. They had the reward points and earned two nights free which I thought was great! Their room was pretty nice with a flat screen in the main bedroom and one in the restroom! Called for room service to get some extra towels, toothpaste and covers. They bought it over within 25 minutes. They also includes extra toothbrush and mini mouthwash!!! Awesome!! 

However, the next day when I checked into my room. Located in the roman tower. It was kind of a disappointment because the restroom didn't even have a door! I know!!! I would of complain but I figured, why :\/ I was leaving the next day anyways . Some of my other friends who flew in the very same day got the same package and with my story to them about my room, they told the customer service n got themselves free upgrade. I guess i should of complain right!? Oh well. That's really why I gave it four stars.. Not meeting the expectations. On top of that the requested bed was a king n I ended up getting a queen size. Great right? 

But I do enjoy the customer services and been taking lots of pictures!!!! Love this hotel, compared it to the others n yes.. It's worth the money! Do go a cheap rate if u search around n get promotions code.

K, it's 3a.m.. Maybe I should sleep. Wait.. Who sleeps in Vegas!? Lol

When you come to Vegas, there are certain Hotel\/ Casinos you think of.  Caesars Palace is still the grandaddy of the Strip, and while its a bit old, it still draws the crowds.

They've built newer towers, but the best location to stay is the Augustus tower, located right by the lobby.  The other towers are located miles away, and frankly its just too far.

They have everything you can ask for.. .the casino, shows, restaurants with celebrity chefs (ie: Flay, Ramsay), and a huge shopping area which has high end stores like LV to affordable stores like Victoria Secret.  

Its still one of my favorite Vegas locations, and its even better when I get comp'd.

We stayed here for a bachelorette  party! Woot! Woot! I'm kind of a hotel whore and I loved it! It's such a nice and classy place. The place is also HUGE! I've never been to a hotel where we didn't need to leave the whole weekend. The only time we left was to get Subway across the street. 

The only damper was that the TV didn't work. So, they gave us hotel credits but then they didn't work and had to go back and I hate that! I still drank and someone else went but still...it sucked for that person. 

The club is definitely a little outdated but I loved the patio area and the fact that I didn't have to wait in line because I'm a girl? I guess. Success!

Arrived to check in at 11:30 AM and was told the room would be ready between 4 and 6:00 PM!  Since I had a conference to attend I asked about options.  offered to store bags with bell man or I could pay $30.00 extra to get in a room earlier.  Decided to pay the extra fee and was given a key to a room immediately 

Paid daily facilty fee of $17.00 to use gym.  Gym looked great.  Asked where to change told to change in men's room.  Asked about locker and shower for post workout.  told that would be additional  $30.00 daily fee!

No free coffee in room.

Many more examples of up charges to provide.  Caesars is acting like a discount airlines with many up charges, but not the low base rate.

Beware

Okay the ratio here between seven and eleven a.m. of geriatric motorized oxygen tank toting smokers is easily 2:1 over any other group of any kind. I noticed this one morning when I was trying to decide between tequila sunrises or bloody marys to ease the transition from the bourbon and waters I had been consuming the previous 12 hours. I plopped my drunk ass between 2 previously stated geriatrics at a dollar machine and slid my little paper ticket into the machine .....repeatedly......like over and over and over. I ask Miss Nebraska 1946 on my right if she had any problems to which she coughs a raspy "not me". That's when Miss Idaho 1939 looks at my voucher and says "that voucher is for Bally's this is Ceasar's".  DOHHH!!!
I went back to Ballys and subsequently straight to bed.

You had to be there.
Over priced, cancelled shows, bad food,bad service, shall i go on DON'T go here or book a show. you'll get #$%#* big time.

The hotel is absolutely beautiful and consistently busy. The service is phenomenal and I would recommend staying here with family or friends. The best part about this hotel is the SPA-OMG! The best I've ever been too:-)

Would not recommend this hotel. The facilities are less than expected given the price and the service is poor.  We booked 5 rooms, one of the rooms had a broken heater and no hot water; if I had stayed in that room, this would be a one-star review.

I've heard that quality of the facilities vary greatly between the different towers; we stayed in the Roman Tower.

I am a 22 year old female. This is one of the worst hotels i have ever stayed at on the strip. The shopping obviously is great. We had to wait 45 minutes in line on a wednesday night only when 4 people were in front of us. Very very slow check-in. Now the people who work at the Hotel is the problem.  At Qua Spa the front people are very rude and unpleasant to their costumers. They told me that i had to get my mother "in check" while we were 2 minutes late for our spa day (DO NOT BE LATE). We were 4 people booked for about $160 per person massages (for two days) and that is the way they were treating us, if not the other costumers\/guests as well. They never asked how our stay was going, nothing to make us feel comfortable as they should. And if you are late, your minutes will be deducted from your massage. 

The room we stayed in was nice and very huge!!! Grand piano and all! Didn't really bother me the we had a wall for a view but there were chunks of the walls missing and the room looked as if people tried to destroy it. The 90's tv was mostly static so we couldn't hear or watch it most of our stay..
(If you try to use WIFI it cost $14.99 per computer, per night. Rollaway bed is $30.00 fee a night. Room service is also a 18% gratuity charge.)

Another incident happened twice in the Caesars Palace gift shop. Two times i had went there to buy stuff for the flu i was having at the time. They would not let me charge to the room and was giving me a very hard time. My name was on the room with my parents so i immediately tell them that i was going to the front desk to complain. I did just that and the guy at the front desk apologized and told me there should be no problem. I went back the next day and the same thing happened, unfortunately i was so fed up and sick that i did not feel the need to keep complaining about the poor costumer service. 

As i am still sick with the stomach flu\/strep throat i caught there, i called front desk to help me out so i could go to a 24 hour urgent care. They gave me a number of an operator who informed me that urgent care was not 24 hours. I called the front desk again and had explained what had happened. Front desk this time gives me an address of an urgent care 4 miles away. Got into a taxi and by the time we got there, the urgent care sign said they were not open on weekends WHEN Caesars Palace assured me that it was. By this time i was so ill i had to go to the emergency room and they would not call me an ambulance. I was rolled in a wheelchair into another taxi going to the 3rd hospital, that did nothing for me, and they were not allowed to give me a throat culture or tell me what my fever was at that point. just prescribed me a bunch of drugs and sent me on my way to walgreens so i can wait 2 hours for my prescription while throwing up blood. Worst experience of my life. 


Moral of all of this ..The people at Caesars Palace treat their guests like crap. Everything is also EXTREMELY over priced. Even for people with money. They really like to rip you off and talk down to you. Never staying here again! And never get sick in Vegas..worst healthcare of ALL time.

Pool was all shade until 2:30pm:( tried to order food and drink at the pool- after an hour of waiting I gave up and went to my room to call room service-30 minute wait on hold before I could place my order. They did quote me 45 minutes for delivery and it was more like 30 which was a plus. Came back from a company event at 11 PM and every single restaurant in the resort was closed for the night, very disappointing. Came back to my room. I  tried to order room service once again and was placed on hold for more than 30 minutes and then hung up on. I gave up. I have stayed at more than eight hotels on the strip and this is by far my worst experience. Not to mention the room is tiny compared to other rooms and comparable hotels on the strip.

One of my favorite casinos in Vegas. Always a good lively vibe, cool bars and clubs inside (Pure, Pussycat Lounge, etc) , and connected to all the Caesar shops and restaurants - something fun for everyone.

Even though it's been around for years and years, they've been able to keep up with all the new casinos and keep it hip and lively.

Bottom line: Two thumbs up.

Came here for an event that was being held at the Caesars, only made since to stay in the hotel the event was being held in. 

We were assigned to the Forum Tower, and received a smoking room (Didn't realize this until we got into the room, we don't smoke...). We checked in the hotel around 1am, so I was pretty tired from the flight and just wanted to go bed. We were only there for the weekend, so to me it wasn't worth complaining or requesting a new room for. 

I was personally a little disappointed with our room, it had a small sink, tiny closet that was located in the bathroom, really old stereo system (it had a CD player, LOL) and a stand in shower. 

However on the plus side, it had a cool TV in the bathroom mirror, hair dryer, iron, makeup mirror and a king size bed. 

Caesars is a gorgeous hotel. Only problem is, IT IS SO BIG. It really is easy to get lost in here. But by the third day I think I finally got it down.

You could probably spend your entire trip in Vegas just in this one hotel. They have everything! From great restaurants, Forum shops, sports booking, gambling, Omnia nightclub, and the huge pool area was very impressive! 

Overall: I think I just had higher expectations for the rooms here, this is an older hotel. So I guess I should have expected an older feel to it.  It's a nice hotel, but I think I would rather stay somewhere else for the same price.

If I had my choice I would always stay here. For some reason I love Caesars. Im part of the rewards club so I can usually get a pretty good room for cheap. The location is the best part of this hotel. I feel like its pretty central to a lot of great things. I have never had a problem with service or anything else for that matter. The last room I had was one of the newer ones and it was beautiful . It does need an update and Im sure that the other newer hotels in Vegas have better rooms but I still love it. Maybe its nostalgia. The pool is nice, there are different sections depending on whether you want to relax or party hard.

Casino only: One of my favorites on the strip! Freshest air you can get within feet of smokers. We parked in self parking and was surprised to not they give free parking with a Nevada license. This is a privilege revoked by MGM so I was definitely happy! $10 max for the day otherwise. At this entrance, level 3 brings you to the food court. Most of these spots have lower reviews but I mean it's a food court, not Chef Ramsey's handpicked favorites. This is also the entrance for the Colosseum (hard word to spell halfway correct for autocorrect to pick up, fresh)! Overall, great game selection, fun to people watch (saw some summer NBA players walking around), great spot!

The GF and I dropped by Caesar's on our way to see ABSINTHE (which was fucking amazing btw) SEE IT, but I specifically logged on to give props to our man TODD W., a chef there who totally went out of his way to escort us to the "SPIEGELTENT" when we asked for directions. It's that kind of service that can really set off a great night and make an experience that much better. You're the man, Todd.

I come here every year for the same conference which happens to fall around the time of my birthday.  Being in Vegas for work is sort of a drag.  You're working.  Everyone else is partying.  You're up in daylight.  Everyone else is just getting home by daylight. 

The staff at Caesars are great.  I always get my room upgraded without any trouble.  The casino is completely useless to me.  I discovered the spa on my last visit and I'm planning to work it into my regular Caesars routine.

This was my fourth time in Vegas, but my first time staying at Caesars Palace.  I am a Total Rewards Diamond Member and was comped several nights in the Augustus Tower.  The room was a standard room, but the LARGEST standard room I've had in LV, at about 650 sq ft.  The Augustus Tower is the best tower to stay in if you want the easiest access to the front entrance that leads to the Strip.  The room was spotless and beautifully renovated.  The hallways leading to the room were almost shockingly pristine, pretty and well-maintained.

The entire resort is beautiful...but almost (for the first couple days of my visit, anyway) overwhelmingly enormous.  There are directional signs scattered throughout, but the layout is confusing and annoyingly maze-like.  At times, I felt like I was trying to navigate the Magic Kingdom, with a property map downloaded on my phone.  

The casino also has a strange layout, as it is scattered here and there and everywhere.  I really don't feel like packing an overnight bag to travel from one slot machine to another.  Not to mention that the "tightness" of the slots and video poker here were insane, even by Vegas standards.  I gambled for many hours for 3 days straight and never exceeded more than 200 credits on a single slot or VP machine.

This was also my first time at the famous Bacchanal Buffet.  The food here is great, with lots of dishes you will not find at most any other buffet.  But it was also busy, busy, busy.  Even in the Diamond line, I had to wait about 45 mins. to get in, THEN you have to wait in line at each food section while people SLOWLY take their time without any awareness of the other patrons waiting to get food.  For me, these negatives were not worth the $55 per person admission.

To sum up, I say again that Caesars LV is a beautiful and EXPANSIVE property, but the latter is a bad thing for some people, especially if you are handicapped or traveling with a handicapped family member\/partner.  There is just too much foot\/wheelchair travel within the resort, especially if you want to save your energy for traversing the Strip.  

Next time, I'll probably stay at Caesar's Paris hotel.  It is a nice property, but much smaller and boutique-like, with newly renovated rooms.

I always look forward to Vegas trips. Though I don't like to admit it, I get all excited and giddy days before! I'm not too picky when it comes to hotel accommodations. I've stayed at hotels ranging from Circus Circus to Polo Towers to The Wynn and almost every other hotel in between. But I have never experienced such terrible service as I did at Caesar Palace. 

I had booked 3 rooms for the weekend and was told the rooms will be ready by 4 pm for my friend to check in. By 4 o'clock  only 1 of the rooms was ready. No biggie though, I didn't need the room immediately. At 6:45 pm my sister arrived and tried to check in for the other 2 rooms, front desk told her house keeping was cleaning the other rooms which will take about 10 minutes, the rooms will not be in the same tower with the first one because there are no rooms available and the rooms will not be next to each other. WTHECK?! Really Caesar Palace, is it that difficult to arrange for 3 rooms to be in the same tower at least?! Anyways, 10 minutes roll by still the rooms are not available, 30 minutes later still nothing, 1 hour later still nothing... 9:30 pm and still my other 2 rooms were not available. To make matters worse, I had 8 guests waiting- not able to grab dinner and not able to get ready for the night out! Finally I arrived at 10 pm and was furious because the rooms were "supposedly" still not available. After throwing a fit and almost on the verge of throwing the front desk man into the fountain, the rooms were magically available and incidentally next to one another. To make matters worse, they only offered the rooms to be complimentary for the night and an upgrade with kings beds not 2 twins. 
In conclusion, Caesar Palace can offer bad customer service so be aware if you decide to stay here. They overbook the rooms and do not prepared to accommodate their guests when they are over capacity. 

So aside from the whole rooms ordeals, I don't think I can stay at Caesars Palace in the future again because the rooms definitely need some upgrading, the selection of food\/places to dine at are minimal, wow it's quite a trip from the parking lot to the hotel and Oh Yea, service can be a hit or miss. 

The only thing I really liked\/looked forward to whiling staying at Caesars Palace was the pool and checking out.

This is a.t.'s favorite room. And, it is an actual "room," tucked away behind Pure and the sportsbook. Cash games in the front, with a big tournament room in the rear. During slow times your choices are just 1\/3 NL or 3\/6 limit. When it's busy there's 2\/5 (no buy-in cap) and rarely 5\/10 NL. Was just here for the 12th time during the WSOP and it was packed.

Con: The rake is now $5 + $1. Some of their best staff has left for other casinos. There's no Fiji. Drink service is average at best, with waitress talent on the lower end. 

Pro: Pussycat dancers are passing thru every 15 minutes (Thu-Sat nights). Dealers have the best mix of skill + personality on the strip. 6 tournaments daily. Noise level is the lowest, since it's not exposed to the casino noise. Player competition level is not high, the games are relatively soft. You can buy in at 1\/3 NL for up to $500.

***PROS***

Atmosphere:
This hotel is situated in the perfect location - right on the middle of the strip..

We originally booked a luxury room in the Augustus tower and we were upgraded to a Octavius luxury room. I was a bit hesitant to go with the upgrade because I was set on having a view of the Bellagio fountains but the lady that checked us in reassured us it was an upgrade. We were upgraded to the 60th floor with a view of the pools. I was very please with the view.

Room was clean and everything worked perfectly.

Typical pool hours however it can vary. I think I saw a sign for the upcoming Saturday closing at 5pm - I'm assuming for a pool party.

Service:
The hotel staff were absolutely amazing whenever we actually interacted with them. Housekeeping did a perfect job - even neatly stacking my shoes off to the side of the wall.

Dining:
Probably one of the better hotels in regards to the dining selections available on property. We only ate off of the hotel on several occasions.

Check-Out:
We did online check-out vs. counter and it worked flawlessly.

***CONS***

Check-In:
When we arrived around 730pm there was a large group of people in the lobby waiting to be checked in. Of course there is a separate line for the diamond and seven-star members but I wouldn't know about that life. It took us an hour from end of line to check-in. Saving grace -  I wish I had the name of the lady that checked us in because her keyboard skills were amazing. From walk-up to check-in took us maybe 5mins.

Overall:
I definitely want to try some other resorts on the strip but as far as Total Rewards resorts this is our go-to.

Gorgeous hotel! The room itself wasn't the nicest (Palace Tower) I've ever stayed at but everything about the hotel was amazing. Great shopping, convienent location, and good casino. We didn't try the food in the hotel so I can't really comment on that but I have no complaints. The inside of the hotel was luxurious and beautiful. Definately will stay at Caesar's again the next time I'm in Vegas!

Great hotel in vegas! Not only does it have my favorite buffet inside but the staff is super friendly & they have the forum shops inside of the hotel too! Along side from that they also have many restaurants and other unique shops and bars! Come inside and take a look around of the cool greek style hotel! Reminds me of hercules!
Stayed here in June. The hotel was nice and had many tables open at all hours of the day. The rooms were nice and the hotel is in the center of the strip.
Casino could use some updates and security is a little much at the tables but it's a classic. Mixed crowd. For those looking for the 'typical' Vegas experience, including the bars and clubs.

Update to previous post.  The last night of my stay was $629.00 for a run down room w no bathroom door. I get that prices are high when conventions are running and IF this room was even close to standard I wouldnt be so pissed off but it was below steerage on a sinking ship. Why the downgrade? I went to get my car that was parked curbside in front of the hotel for 3 days and although the valet guys were nice the lady behind the desk makes a comment that "personally I think those cars are ugly and I cant get on and out of them" WTF? Add that to the insane price and it came out to be pathetic stay at best. Never again.

I have been coming here off and on for over thirty years.  i have seen the old girl as broken down casino and now an upscale casino.  

So my review is my trip here and maybe a few things in memory lane.   

The casino, itself, is a good place to gamble.  Plenty of action if you are seeking it.  I have won and lost here.  

The rooms are pretty nice, especially when you upgrade them.  I like that the bathroom and the toilet is separate room.  The toilet is actually a water closet, hahaha.  I had an upgrade and it had an amazing water jets tube, and you can actually stay in your room to relax and let the bubbles take your worries away.  The bed was super comfortable.  Tv was already.

Food is a hit or miss, so do your research.  I say do Spagos, and not Serendipity.  If you got money burning if your pockets from all the winnings.  You can hit the stores.  There is still couple of good ships in there.  A couple of years ago, it was the place to shop, but now there are better places like City Center, or the shops at  the Venetians.  it is up to you.  Still great experiences here.

Also if you have time.  You should hit up the swimming area.  Great place to hang and catch a few laps or just read a book.  It is a nice Roman inspired watering hole filled with statues.

Also i recommend you valet your car for a buck or two.  it will save you from the heat for a little while.

We went to Caesar's to see Celine Dion on our second night in LV and dined in Wolfgang Puck's restaurant. 

Our experience was excellent and Caesar's is a beautiful Casino and complex. Dining outside' the restaurant, we felt like we were outside because it's so.... Wow. That's the only word I can really think of now.

Love that you don't get harassed by salespeople everywhere you walk like you do in some other hotels.

I love this place. It has always been consistent with hospitality, service, gambling cleanliness and food. One of the best hotels on the strip! 
The pool is great and not a crazy insane party. It's normal and lots of people. People enjoying the pool and socializing. Christina was my waitress this last time I came and she was on it and amazing.  This is my 5th time here and I left thinking that I needed to definitely write a review.

Love the spa Qua here! Had many roman baths, artic room, herbal steam room, and sauna...which I tried all. Clothing is optional here.

Get a players card and get rated when you play. Become a Diamond member and receive the benefits of cutting into the front of the line for the buffet, valet, and taxi.

BEAUTIFUL casino that I've loved staying at in the past but they completely RUINED my birthday weekend there!

I booked TWO months in advance for a SUITE at Nobu that could host several of my friends for an unforgettable birthday weekend. Not just any rinky-dink room but a huge suite that I was incredibly so excited for - I brought almost 20 friends with me so you can say that I absolutely was ecstatic. 

The DAY OF my stay, Caesars told me they double-booked my suite, told me there was nothing they could do, used the excuse that it was an extra busy weekend even though I booked two months in advance and I was literally stripped of this suite because they don't know how to schedule and organize properly!

From the pictures, it looked like an amazing and beautiful room. I was sooooooo beyond angry - everyone I talked to at Caesars was less than pleasurable! Excuse after excuse, tried giving me a room that cost MORE than what I'd originally booked.

This was my BIRTHDAY weekend. Although I still had an amazing group of friends to support me and made my trip worth going for, this was an awful turn of events. Never staying here again.

Decent accommodations. You should expect more for the price, but it's certainly not bad. The room was spacious, but a bit worn. Amenities were few and far between. Apparently you need to upgrade to a suite to even see a flat screen television. Lighting was kind of awful in the room, too. Bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was much larger than I had anticipated. TV in the bathroom was a nice touch, but that just made me wonder why they couldn't spring for a decent TV in the main room.

best time of my life at ceasar's palace, this casino is by far the best looking from the inside out, their customer service is the,best and im a picky son of a gun. I played the roulette table in their pussy cat dolls section, they had strippers dancing on poles in front of the tables. The girl at the roulette table,named aileen was the,best she keeped the drinks coming I played for 2 hours and had a great time doing it. Other than that this hotel resort and casino,has many things to offer, valet parking moves fast and the I would recommend you come and spend your money here.

I am writing to make you aware of the unbelievably poor customer service I experienced during my visit to Caesars Palace Las Vegas. 

Before writing this letter I thought to myself, is it really worth the time and stress? I pick my battles wisely and try to minimize unnecessary stress but this experience is still bothering me. I have always trained my staff to provide immediate feedback, to never suffer in silence. In this case I did, but my feedback was not appropriately addressed; this was a common trend within the staff at Caesars Palace. I tried to start the process by talking to the persons who were responsible and most able to help, but as you can see it has now become necessary to come up the ranks because of their failure to act and follow-through.

Caesars Palace Las Vegas should not promise more than they can deliver. 

I visit Las Vegas multiple times throughout the year and I have never had a reason to provide feedback due to a hotels inability to provide basic customer service. There is a reason I use feedback instead of complaint, because I always give the opportunity to make things right after receiving feedback.

Treated in a shameful manner at check-in

Given the wrong room

After complaining nothing resolved

Placed in a smoking room, after making two request for a Non-Smoking room

No telephone call received to discuss concerns with a member of the management team for 72 hours. 

Medical concerns not addressed

Security taking a report and not following-up 

Rude

Condescending

Dismissive

Abrupt

Not compassionate

Not Sympathetic

Failure to follow-through

Unbelievably poor customer service

Failure to be accountable

I've always wanted to stay at Caesars so we did last weekend. It's a huge hotel complex-bigger than I imagined. We stayed in the Palace tower which had easy access to the pools, which are great. Our room was fine. Everything about a Caesars is expensive. Gambling, food, drinks, snacks, sports book, meals, etc. you can get better prices elsewhere, but I knew what I was getting in for. We checked our bags on Sunday and enjoyed the pool the rest of the day before our flight and that worked well. Don't ask for extended checkout, because you won't get one. Staff all were helpful. I don't need to go back because there are so many other fine places to stay is Las Vegas.

My sisters and I really liked this mall. There are several mid to high end stores there and decent restaurants too. It reminded me of a shopping experience I can enjoy back in Chicago.
I believe the mall stays open until midnight.

Gin & Tonic = bad. 

While the $.01 slots were fun and a good time-waster, the water they use to make their ice sucked.  No two ways about it, it's stale-freezer, hard-water ice, and it tastes like crap. So much so that our party left Ceasar's and went over to the Bellagio, and won't be coming back.
